div1.head: *a
div1.entryFree: *a-: in composition—(1) ‘privative,’ see a)n-.—(2) ‘copulative,’ originally sa, contains an idea of union, as in a(/pa=s (pa=s), a)ollhs (vei/llw).—(3) ‘prothetic,’ a simple euphonic prefix, as in a)/poina (poinh/), a)sth/r (Eng. ‘star’).
a)=: interjection expressive of pity or horror, freq. w. voc. of deilo/s, e. g. a)= deilw/, Ah! wretched pair! Il. 17.443, Il. 11.816, Od. 14.361.

a)-a=/a=tos (a)va/w): of doubtful meaning. —(1) inviolable (if a privative), nun moi o)/mosson a)a=/a=ton *stugo\s u=(/dwr, Il. 14.271; cf. *stugo\s u=(/dwr, o(/s te me/gistos | o(/rkos deino/tato/s te pe/lei maka/ressi qeoi=sin, Il. 15.37 f.—(2) baleful (if a copulative), or mad, of the suitors' contest with the bow, Od. 21.81 (echoed by Odysseus, Od. 22.5). —Signif. (2) may be assumed in *c instead of (1), representing the Styx as baleful to him who swears falsely in its name.
a)-a=gh/s, e/s (va/gnu=mi): unbreakable, Od. 11.575.†
a)/-aptos: unapproachable, invincible.
a)a/ - sxetos: lengthened form of a)sxetos.

a<*>)a<*>/w (a)va/w), aor. a<*>)/a<*>se, a)=se, 2 sing. a)=sas, mid. a)a=tai, aor. a<*>)a<*>sa/mhn, -ato, a=)/sato, pass. aor. a)a/sqhn, -hs, -h, part. -ei/s: I. act., bring to grief, Il. 8.237; esp. of the mind, delude, befool, befuddle, o(\ d' e)pei\ fre/nas a=)/asen oi)/nw|, Od. 21.297; pass., Il. 19.136, Od. 21.301 ; me/ga, Il. 16.685; pollo/n, Il. 19.113.—II. mid., commit folly, be infatuated, deceive oneself, Il. 19.95; causative, ‘beguile,’ (*=)/ath), h(\ pa/ntas a)a=tai, Il. 19.91, 129.
a)bake/w, aor. a)ba/khsan: word of doubtful meaning, be unaware, suspect nothing, Od. 4.249.†
*)/abantes: a tribe in Euboea, Il. 2.536.
*)abarbare/h: a Trojan fountainnymph, Il. 6.22.
*)/aba=s: son of the dream - reader Eurydamas, slain by Diomed, Il. 5.148.
*)/abioi: a fabulous tribe of the North, dikaio/tatoi a)nqrw/pwn, Il. 13.6.
*)/ablhros: a Trojan, Il. 6.32.
a)-blh/s, h=tos (ba/llw): unsped, i. e. ‘new,’ ‘fresh,’ of an arrow, Il. 4.117.†
a)/-blhtos (ba/llw): not hit, Il. 4.540.†
a)-blhxro/s (a prothetic, malako/s): soft, feeble, gentle, xei/r, tei/xea, qa/natos, Il. 5.337, Il. 8. 178, Od. 11.135.
a)/-bromos (bre/mw): loud - roaring, clamorous, Il. 13.41.†
a)brota/zw (a)brotei=n, a)mbrotei=n, a(martei=n): aor. subj. a)brota/comen, miss, w. gen., Il. 10.65.†
a)/-brotos (=a)/mbrotos): divine, nu\c a)bro/th, Il. 14.78.†
*)/abu=dos: Ab&ymacr;dus, a town on the southern shore of the Hellespont, Il. 2.836 .—*)abu=do/qen: from Ab&ymacr;dus, Il. 4.500 . —*)abu=do/qi: in Ab&ymacr;dus, Il. 17.584.
a)ga-: an old adv., later a)/gan, employed only as a prefix, greatly, strongly, highly.
a)ga/asqai, a)ga/asqe: see a)/gamai.
a)gagei=n, a)/gagon: see a)/gw.
a)ga/zomai: see a)/gamai.

a)gaqo/s: good.—Hence (1) of persons, ‘valiant,’ ‘brave,’ h)\ kako\s h)\ a)gaqo/s, Il. 17.632; ‘skilful,’ i=)hth=r' a)gaqw/, Il. 2.732, freq. w. acc. of specification or an adv., boh/n, pu/c.—Often ‘noble’ (cf. optimates), opp. xe/rhes, Od. 15.324.— (2) of things, ‘excellent,’ ‘useful,’ etc.; a)gaqo/n te kako/n te, ‘blessing
and curse,’ Od. 4.237 ; a)gaqoi=si gerai/rein, ‘honor with choice portions,’ Od. 14.441 ; a)gaqa\ fronei=n, ‘wish one well,’ Od. 1.43; ‘be pure-minded,’ Il. 6.162 ; ei)s a)gaqo/n or a)gaqa\ ei)pei=n, ‘speak with friendly intent;’ ei)s a)g. pei/qesqai, ‘follow good counsel.’
*)aga/qwn: son of Priam, Il. 24.249.
a)gai/omai =(a)/gamai): ‘view with indignation,’ a)gaiome/nou kaka\ e)/rga, Od. 20.16†; cf. Od. 2.67.
a)ga-kleh/s, gen. a)gaklh=os (kle/os): highly renowned.
*)agakle/hs: a Myrmidon, Il. 16.571.
a)ga-kleito/s: highly renowned, famous, epith. of men, of a Nereid, Il. 18.45, and of hecatombs.
a)ga-kluto/s =a)gakleh/s, a)gakleito/s.
a)ga/llomai: take delight or pride in (tini/); a)gallo/mena pteru/gessin, ‘on exultant wings,’ Il. 2.462; met. of ships, ‘revelling in the fair breeze’ (*dio\s ou)/rw|), Od. 5.176.

a)/galma (a)ga/llomai): anything in which one takes delight or pride, a ‘treasure,’ Il. 4.144; applied to votive offerings, Od. 3.274; a sacrificial victim, Od. 3.438; horses, Od. 4.602; personal adornments, Od. 18.300.

a)/gamai (a)/gh), fut. a)ga/ssesqai, aor. h)gasa/mhn, h)gassa/mhn (also unaugmented), and from parallel form a)ga/omai, a)ga/asqe, a)ga/asqai, ipf. h)ga/asqe. The form a)/gamai only in signif. 1:— (1) admire, wonder at, be amazed, qauma/zein ou)/t' a)ga/asqai, Od. 16.203.—(2) in bad sense, be indignant at, w. acc. Od. 2.67, w. dat. Od. 8.565; be vexed, Il. 23.639; with ko/tw|, Il. 14.111; hence envy, begrudge, with inf. Od. 5.129, esp. of envy of the gods, Od. 4.181.
*)agamemnone/h: fem. poss. adj. from *)agame/mnwn, a)/loxos, Od. 3.264.
*)agamemnoni/dhs: son of Agamemnon, Orestes, Od. 1.30.

*)agame/mnwn: Agamemnon, son of Atreus and grandson of Tantalus; his wife, Clytaemnestra, Il. 1.113 f.; his children, Orestes, Chrysothemis, Laodice, and Iphianassa, cf. Il. 2.104, Il. 9.287. King of Mycēnae, likewise ruler over ‘many islands and all Argos,’ Il. 2.108. His wealth in ships, Il. 2.576, 610-614. Epithets, di=os, krei/wn, eu)rukrei/wn, a)/nac a)/ndrw=n, poimh\n la=w=n. His stature, Il. 3.166, 178, Il. 2. 477-483; a)ristei/a=, ‘exploits,’ Il. 11.91-661; honor accorded to him, Il. 23.887; sceptre, Il. 2.104; his return from Troy, Od. 3.143 ff., 156, 193 ff., 234 f.; his death at the hands of Aegisthus and Clytaemnestra, his wife, Od. 3.248 ff., Od. 4.91, 512-537, 584, l 387-463, Od. 24.20-97.
*)agamh/dh (cf. *mh/deia): Agamēde, daughter of Augēas, granddaughter of the Sun-god, Il. 11.740.
a)/-gamos: unmarried, Il. 3.40†.
a)ga/-nnifos ([s]ni/fw): snowy, ‘snowcapped,’ epith. of Mt. Olympus. (Il.)

a)gano/s (cf. ga/numai): pleasant, gentle, kindly; e)/pea, dw=ra, basileu/s (opp. xalepo/s), Od. 2.230 ; eu)xwlai, Il. 9.499, Od. 13.357; oi(=s a)ganoi=s bele/essi, ‘with his (her) gentle shafts,’ describing a (natural) sudden, painless death dealt by Apollo upon men, by Artemis upon women, Od. 3.280.
a)gano-frosu/nh: gentle-mindedness, kindliness, Od. 11.203; cf. Od. 2.230.
a)gano/-frwn: gentle-minded, Il. 20.467†.
a)ga/omai: see a)/gamai.
a)gapa/w: welcome affectionately, Od. 23.214; ‘be content,’ Od. 21.289.
a)gap-h/nwr: loving manliness, manly.
*)agaph/nwr: *)agkai/oio pa/i+s, Il. 2.609, king of the Arcadians, a vassal of Agamemnon, to whom he brought the equipment of sixty ships.
a)gaphto/s (a)gapa/w): beloved, always with pai=s, son, which is implied in Od. 2.365.
a)ga/-rroos ([s]r(e/w): strong-flowing, *(ellh/spontos, Il. 2.845.
*)agasqe/nhs (sqe/nos): son of Augēas, king in Elis, Il. 2.624.
a)ga/-stonos (ste/nw): moaning, epith. of Amphitrite (i. e. the Sea), Od. 12.97†.
*)aga/strofos: a Trojan, Il. 11.338.
*)agau/h: a Nereid, Il. 18.42.

a)gauo/s (a)/gamai): wondrous; hence, illustrious, high-born, epith. of honor applied to rulers and nations; freq. to the suitors; to the noble pomphes, Od. 13.71; to Tith<*>nus, Od. 5.1; and thrice to Persephone.

a)ggeli/h: tidings, message, report; a)gg. patro/s, ‘news of my father,’ Od. 1.408, cf. Od. 2.30; ‘command,’ Od. 5.150, Od. 7.263 ; a)gg. e)lqo/nta, ‘on a mission,’
Il. 11.140; in Il. 3.206 gen. of cause or purpose, according to some authorities, but see a)ggeli/hs.
a)ggeli/hs: messenger; assumed as nom. masc. by Aristarchus in Il. 3.206, Il. 13.252, Il. 15.640, Il. 4.384, Il. 11.140.
a)gge/llw, fut. a)ggele/w, aor. h)/ggeila, inf. Il. 15.159: report, announce (ti\, also tina/); w. inf. ‘bid,’ Od. 16.350, Il. 8.517.
a)/ggelos: messenger; common phrase, h)=lqe/ tini, Il. 11.715; *)/ossa *dio\s a)/ggelos, Il. 2.94; also of birds, Od. 15.526.
a)/ggos, eos: pail or bowl, for milk, wine, etc., and for provisions, Od. 2.289.

a)/ge, a)/gete, imp. of a)/gw, used as interjection: quick! come! Freq. a)ll' a)/ge, a)/ge dh/, and foll. by subj. or imp. a)/ge often w. pl., e. g. pai=des e)moi/, a)/ge ktl., Il. 19.475. See also ei) d' a)/ge.

a)gei/rw, aor. h)/geira, pass. pf. a)gh/germai, aor. h)ge/rqhn, 3 pl. a)/gerqen, mid. 2 aor. a)gero/mhn, inf. a)gere/sqai (accented a)ge/resqai by ancient grammarians), part. a)gro/menos: collect, call together, assemble; pass. and aor. mid. gather together; e)s fre/na qumo\s a)ge/rqh, ‘consciousness’ (‘presence of mind,’ Il. 4.152), ‘was restored.’
a)gelai=os (a)ge/lh): of the herd, herding, bou=s, bo/es.
*)age/la=os (a)/gw, lao/s): (1) a Trojan, son of Phradmon, Il. 8.257.—(2) a Greek, Il. 11.302.—(3) a suitor, son of Damastor, *)age/lews, Od. 22.131, 247.
a)gelei/h (a)gw, lei/a): booty-bringing, ‘the forayer,’ epith. of Athena; cf. lhi=tis.
a)ge/lh (a)/gw): herd of cattle, but drove of horses, Il. 19.281 ; a)ge/lhfi, ‘with the herd,’ Il. 16.487.
a)gelhdo/n: in herds, Il. 16.160†.
a)ge/men = a)/gein.
a)/gen = e)a/ghsan, from a)/gnu=mi.
a)-ge/rastos (ge/ras): without a gift.
a)ge/rwxos: (if from e)rwh/) impetuous, mighty in combat; anciently interpreted as if from ge/ras, ‘gifted.’
a)ghge/raq) (ato); see a)gei/rw.
a)g-hnori/h: virtus, manliness, valor; said in reproach, Il. 22.457, and still more so, Il. 9.700, ‘pride.’
a)g-h/nwr (a)/ga, a)nh/r): very manly, valorous; hence, ‘bold,’ ‘proud,’ in both good and bad sense; freq. w. qu=mo/s.
*)agh/nwr: son of the Trojan Antenor and Theano, Il. 11.59.
a)-gh/raos, a)-gh/rws (gh=ras): ageless, unfading, always with a)qa/natos.
a)ghto/s (a)/gamai): wondrous, magnificent; with ei)=dos as acc. of specification, but in agreement w. ei)=dos, Il. 22.370.
a)gi=ne/w (a)/gw), inf. -e/menai, ipf. h)gi=/neon and h)gi=/neun, Il. 18.493; iter. a)gi=/neskon, lead, conduct, bring; of a bride, Il. 18.492; ‘haul’ wood, Il. 24.784.
*)agkai=os: (1) son of Lycurgus, chief of the Arcadians, Il. 2.609.—(2) a wrestler from Pleuron, vanquished by Nestor, Il. 23.635.
a)gkali/s, only e)n a)gkali/dessi: in the arms.
a)gka/s, adv.: into or in the arms, with e)/xe, e)la/zeto, etc.
a)/gkistron: fish-hook. (Od.)
a)g-kli=/nas: see a)nakli=/nw.
a)/gkos, only pl. a)/gkea: winding vales, gorges.
a)g-krema/sa=sa: see anakrema/nnu=mi.
a)gkulo-mh/ths, ew (mh=tis): crooked in counsel, epith. of *kro/nos.
a)gku/los: bending, curued, epith. of bow and of chariot.
a)gkulo/-tocos (to/con): armed with the bent bow.
a)gkulo-xei/lhs (xei=los): with crooked beak.
a)glai+/zomai (a)glao/s): glory in, fut. inf. a)glai+ei=sqai, Il. 10.331†.
*)aglai+/h: wife of Charops, and mother of Nireus, o(\s ka/llistos a)nh\r u(po\ *)/ilion h)=lqen, Il. 2.672.
a)glao/-karpos: with shining fruit; of orchard trees, Od. 7.115.

a)glao/s (root gal-): splendid, shining, bright; epith. of pellucid water, golden gifts, etc.; met. ‘illustrious,’ ‘famous,’ ui(o/s, Od. 4.188; ‘stately,’ Il. 19.385; in reproach ke/rai a)glae/, ‘brilliant with the bow,’ Il. 11.385.

a)-gnoe/w, sync. aor. iter. a)gnw/saske
(for agnoh/saske), Od. 23.95; from a)gnoie/w, only aor. ind. h)gnoi/hsen, subj. a)gnoih=|si, Od. 24.218, part. a)gnoih/sa=sa, Od. 20.15: fail to recognize.
a(gno/s: holy, pure.

a)/gnu=mi (va/gnu=mi), fut. a)/cw, aor. e)/aca, h)=ca, inf. a)=cai, pass. pr. part. a)gnumena=/wn, aor. e)a/ghn (e)a=/ghn, Il. 11.559), va/gh, va/gen (=e)a/ghsan): break, shiver, shatter; rather of crushing and destroying than of rending asunder (r(h/gnu=mi); of the ships pelted and smashed by the Laestr&ymacr;gons, Od. 10.123.
a)-gnw/s: unknown, Od. 5.79†.
a)gnw/saske: see a)gnoe/w.
a)/-gnwstos: unrecognized, unrecognizable. (Od.)
a)g-chra=/nh: see a)nachrai/nw.
a)/-gonos: unborn, Il. 3.40†.
a)gora/omai (a)gorh/), pres. a=gora/asqe, Il. 2.337, ipf. h)gora/asqe, h)goro/wnto, aor. only 3 sing. a)gorh/sato: hold assembly, Il. 4.1, harangue.

a)goreu/w (a)gorh/), fut. a)goreu/sw, aor. ind. only a)go/reusen, Il. 8.29, inf. and imp. more common: harangue, strictly with reference to form and manner of speaking; then generally, speak, say, declare; freq. with acc. e)/pea ptero/enta, a)gora=\s a)go/reuon, ‘were engaged in haranguing,’ Il. 2.788, h(\n a)goreu/w, ‘of which I speak,’ Od. 2.318; often in connection with words denoting the manner of speaking, parablh/dhn, ‘insinuatingly,’ Il. 4.6, o)neidi/zwn a)goreu/ois, ‘talk insultingly of,’ Od. 18.380.

a)gorh/ (a)gei/rw): (1) assembly of the people or army, distinguished from the boulh/ or council of the chiefs. a)gorh\n poiei=sqai, ti/qesqai, kaqi/zein, a)gorh/nde kalei=n (through the heralds), e)s d' a)gorh\n a)ge/ronto, etc.—(2) public speech, discussion.—(3) place of meeting, market, pl. Od. 8.16. As designation of time, e)pi\ do/rpon a)nh\r a)gorh=qen a)ne/sth, Od. 12.439.
a)gorh=qen: from the assembly.
a)gorh/nde: to the assembly.
a)gorh/ths: haranguer, speaker.
a)gorhtu=/s: gift of speaking, eloquence, Od. 8.168†.
a)go/s (a)/gw): leader, chief.
a)gosto/s: hand bent for seizing; e)n koni/h|si pesw\n e(/le gai=an a)gostw=|, ‘clutched the ground,’ said of the warrior's dying agony, Il. 11.425; cf. ko/nios dedragme/nos (dra/ssomai).
a)/graulos (a)gro/s, au)lh/): lying in the field (passing the night out-doors), bou=s, po/ries, poime/nes.
a)/grei, and a)grei=te, Od. 20.149, imp. from a)gre/w (=ai(re/w), used as interjection like a)/ge: quick! up! forward! Used alone or with ma=/n, dh/, nu=n, followed by imp., or inf. used as imp.
a)/grh: hunt, chase. (Od.)
a)/grios, 2 or 3 (a)gro/s): wild, as opp. to tame; met., ferocious, savage.
*)/agrios: son of Portheus in Calydon, Il. 14.117.
a)grio/ - fwnos: rude - voiced, of the Sintians of Lemnos, Od. 8.294†.
a)gro/qen, rure: from the field, country. (Od.)
a)groiw/ths: rustic, peasant; as adj., Il. 15.272.
a)gro/menos: see a)gei/rw.
a)gro/nde: to the field, country, i. e. from town.
a)gro-no/mos (ne/mw): inhabiting the fields, rural, nu/mfai, Od. 6.106†.
a)gro/s: field, country, opp. to town, e)p' a)grou= no/sfi po/lhos, Od. 16.383; e)c a)groi=o poli/nde, Od. 17.182.
a)gro/teros (poet. parallel form to a)/grios): wild; of Artemis as huntress, ‘ranging the wild,’ Il. 21.471.
a)gro/ths: rustic, Od. 16.218.
a)grw/ssw (a)/gra): catch, intensive; of the sea - gull ‘ever catching’ fish, Od. 5.53†.
a)/grwstis: field-grass, grass; identified by some with ‘dog's tooth,’ by others with ‘panic.’
a)/guia (a)/gw): road, way, street; skio/wnto de\ pa=sai a)/guiai, ‘shadowy grew all the ways,’ of the approach of night.
a)/guris (a)gei/rw): chance gathering, company, host, a)ndrw=n, neku/wn, nhw=n (when drawn up on shore), Il. 24.141.
a)gurta/zw (a)gu/rths, a)gei/rw): collect as beggar, Od. 19.284†.
a)gxe/-maxos (a)/gxi, ma/xomai): fighting hand to hand (cominus).
a)/gxi: near, hard by, tino/s. The dat., if used, generally modifies the verb of the sentence, but probably with a)/xgi in Il. 20.283. Of time, a)/gx<*> ma/l), ‘in the near future,’ Od. 19.301.
a)gxi/-alos (a(/ls): near the sea.

*)agxi/alos: (1) a Greek, slain by Hector, Il. 5.609.—(2) father of Mentes,
and ruler of the Taphians, Od. 1.180.— (3) a noble Phaeacian, Od. 8.112.
a)gxi-baqh/s (ba/qos): deep near the shore, Od. 5.413†.
a)gxi/-qeos: near to the gods (i. e. by relationship, descent), of the Phaeacians, Od. 5.35; see Od. 7.56 ff.
a)gxi-maxhth/s = a)gxe/maxos.

a)gxi/-molos (molei=n): coming near, mostly adv. acc. with e)lqei=n, e)/rxesqai, foll. by dat.; e)c a)gximo/loio, Il. 24.352, cf. e)ggu/qen. Implying time, a)gxi/molon de\ met' au)to/n, ‘close after him,’ Od. 17.336.
a)gxi/-noos (nou=s): near-, i. e. readyminded, Od. 13.332, cf. ‘presence of mind.’
*)agxi=/shs: (1) son of Capys, father of Aenēas, Il. 5.268.—(2) father of Echepōlus, from Sicyon, Il. 23.296.
*)agxi=sia/dhs: son of Anchīses, (1) Aenēas, Il. 17.754.—(2) Echepolus.
a)/gxista: see a)/gxistos.
a)gxisti=nos: close together, one upon another.
a)/gxistos (sup. of a)/gxi): nearest, most nearly, closely, only adv. neut. sing. and pl.; met. w. e)/oika and e)i/skw.
a)gxo/qi = a)/gxi.
a)gxou= = a)/gxi.
a)/gxw: choke, strangle, ipf. ‘was choking,’ Il. 3.371†.

a)/gw, fut. a)/cw, aor. h)=ca (imp. a)/cete, inf. a)ce/men, a)ce/menai), mid. h)ca/mhn (a)/cesqe, a)/conto), more common 2 aor. act. h)/gagon, subj. a)ga/gwmi, mid. h)gago/mhn (also unaugmented): I. act., lead, conduct, bring, Od. 17.218 (‘brings like to like,’ w(s is prep.), 219; bou=n, i(/ppous u(po\ cugo/n, u(f' a(/rmata, ‘put to harness’; bring or carry with one, esp. of booty and prisoners, lead captive, carry off, thus joined w. fe/rw, Il. 5.484; hence ‘transport,’ ‘convey,’ with persons or things as subj., nau=tai, nh=es; ‘remove,’ nekro/n, ko/pron; ‘guide,’ ‘control,’ Il. 11.721, Il. 21.262; esp. an army, ships, etc., Il. 2.580, 631, 557. Met. ‘bring to pass,’ ‘occasion,’ Il. 24.547, ‘spread abroad,’ kle/os, Od. 5.311. The part. a)/gwn is often added to a verb by way of amplification, Od. 1.130, Il. 2.558.—II. Mid., take with or to one what one regards as his own, Il. 3.72, Od. 6.58, prizes, captives, etc.; esp. gunai=ka, ‘lead home,’ ‘take to wife,’ said of the bridegroom, and also of those who give in marriage, or who accompany the bride, Od. 6.28.

a)gw/n (a)/gw): (1) assembly, esp. to witness games, i(/zanen (*)axilleu/s), Il. 23.258, lu=to, Il. 24.1, then contest, games, Od. 8.259.—(2) assemblage or place of assemblage, of the ships, new=n e)n a)gw=ni (the Greek camp), Il. 16.500 ; qei=os, ‘of the gods,’ Il. 18.376, but Il. 7.298 of the ‘temple-hall,’ containing the statues of the gods.—(3) place or scene of combat, arena, including the space occupied by the spectators, Il. 23.531.
a) - dahmoni/h: want of knowledge, Od. 24.244†.
a dah/mwn: unacquainted with, tino/s.
a)-da/kru=tos: tearless.
*)/adamas: a Trojan, son of Asius, Il. 13.759, 771.
a)-da/mastos (dama/zw): not to be prevailed over, i. e. ‘inexorable,’ *)ai/dhs, Il. 9.158†.
a)ddee/s: see a)deih/s.
a)ddhkw/s, a)ddh/seie: see a)de/w.
a)/ddhn: see a)/dhn.
a)-deih/s (de/os): fearless; ku/on a)ddee/s, ‘shameless hussy.’
a)delfeo/s, a)delfeio/s: brother.
a)deukh/s: odious, unpleasant; qa/natos, po/tmos, fh=mis.
a)-de/yhtos (de/yw): untanned.
a)de/w, only aor. opt. a)ddh/seie, perf. part. a)ddhko/tes, also written a=)dh- and a=(dh-: be satiated, feel loathing at; kama/tw|, u(/pnw|, ‘be overwhelmed with.’
a)/dhn, a(/dhn, a)/ddhn: to satiety, to excess; a(/dhn e)la/an kako/thtos, pole/moio, ‘until he gets enough’ of trouble, etc.
a)-dh/ritos (dh=ris): uncontested, Il. 17.42†.

a(dino/s: probably thick, esp. of things densely crowded and in motion. Hence ‘throbbing’ (kh=r), ‘swarming’ (me/lissai), ‘buzzing’ (mui<*>=ai), ‘flurried’ (mh=la), ‘sobbing’ (go/os), ‘voiceful’ (*seirh=nes). Adv. with corresponding signification a(dino/n, a(dina/, a(dinw/teron, ‘more dolefully,’ a(dinw=s a)nenei/kato, ‘fetched a deep sigh,’ Il. 19.314.
a(dinw=s: see a(dino/s.
a) - dmh/s (da/mnhmi): untamed, unbroken; parqe/nos, ‘unwedded;’ cf. da/mar. (Od.)
a)/-dmhtos: unbroken, not yet brought under the yoke.

*)/admhtos: husband of Alcestis, and
father of Eume<*>lus, Il. 2.713 f., Il. 23.289, 391, 532.
a(/don: see a(nda/nw.
a)/dos, a(/dos (see a)de/w): satiety, disgust.
*)adrh/steia: a town on the Propontis, in what was afterward Mysia, Il. 2.828.
*)adrh/sth: a handmaid of Helen, Od. 4.123.
*)adrhsti=/nh: daughter of Adrastus, *ai)gia/leia, Il. 5.412†.

*adrhstos (didra=/skw, the ‘unescapable’): (1) from Argos, fugitive to Sicyon, succeeds Polybus there as king; becomes also king in Argos, harbors Tydeus, and gives him his daughter in marriage, cf. Il. 14.121; his swift steed Areion, Il. 23.347.—(2) son of Merops, from Percōte, founder of Adrasteia, leader of Trojan allies from thence, Il. 2.380, Il. 11.328.—(3) a Trojan, slain by Menelāus, Il. 6.37, 45, 63.—(4) a Trojan slain by Patroclus, Il. 16.694.
a(droth/s (a(dro/s): maturity, vigor; a(droth=ta, questionable reading in Il., see a)ndroth/s.
a)/-duton (du/nw, ‘not to be entered’): shrine, ‘holy of holies.’
a)eqleu/w, a=/qleu/w (a)/veqlon): institute, or contend in, a gymnastic contest; e)pi/ tini, ‘in honor of’ some one; for a=/qle/w, toil, Il. 24.734.
a)e/qlion = a)/eqlon. Also pl. implements of combat, ‘weapons,’ Od. 21.4, 62, 117.
a)/eqlon, a)=qlon (a)veq.): (1) prize.— (2) prize-contest.

a)/eqlos, a)=qlos: (1) prize-contest, distinguished from war, h)\ e)n a)e/qlw| | h)e\ kai\ e)n pole/mw|, Il. 16.590.—(2) combat (in war), Il. 3.126; then ‘toil,’ ‘hardship,’ esp. of the ‘labors’ of Heracles, imposed by Eurystheus (*eu)rusqh=os a)/eqloi, Il. 8.363).
a)eqlo-fo/ros, a=/qlofo/ros: prize-winning; only of horses.
a)ei/, ai)ei/, ai)e/n: always, ever; joined with a)skele/ws, a)sfale/s, diampere/s, e)mmene/s, ma/la, nwleme/s, sunexe/s. Also ai)ei\ h)/mata pa/nta.

a)ei/dw (a)vei/dw), fut. a)ei/somai, aor. ind. a)/eise, imp. a)/eison, inf. a)ei=sai: sing—I. trans., paih/ona, kle/a a)ndrw=n, ‘lays of heroes;’ also w. acc. of the theme of minstrelsy, mh=nin, Il. 1.1; *)axaiw=n no/ston, Od. 1.326; with w(s, Od. 8.514; acc. and inf., Od. 8.516.—II. intrans., ma/l' a)ei=sai, ‘merrily’, li/ga, kalo/n (adv.); met. of the bow-string, Od. 21.411.
a)-eikei/h (a)veikh/s): disfigurement, Il. 24.19 ; a)eikei/as fai/nein, ‘exhibit unseemly behavior,’ Od. 20.308.
a)-eike/lios, 2 and 3, = a)eikh/s: ‘illfavored, Od. 6.242; adv., a)eikeli/ws: disgracefully.

a)-eikh/s (a)veik., ve/voika): unseemly, disgraceful; no/os ou)de\n a)eikh/s, ‘a likely understanding,’ ou)/ toi a)eike/s, etc.; misqo\s a)eikh/s, ‘wretched’ pay; ph/rh, ‘sorry’ wallet, a)eike/a e(/ssai, ‘thou art vilely clad.’
a)-eiki/zw (a)veikh/s), ipf. a)ei/kizen, aor. subj. a)eiki/sswsi, mid. a)eikissai/meqa, a)eiki/ssasqai, pass. a)eikisqh/menai: disfigure, maltreat, insult.

a)ei/rw, ai)/rw (a)vei/rw), aor. h)/eira and a)/eira, mid. I. a)eira/mhn, pass. a)e/rqhn (a)erqei/s, a)rqei/s), plupf. a)/wrto, cf. a)/rnumai: raise up, lift; freq. w. u(yo/se; of ‘swinging’ the lash (ma/sti=ga), of the ‘carrying’ capacity of ships (a)/xqos a)/eiran, Od. 3.312), ‘made him light,’ Il. 19.386; mid. and pass., rise up, lift oneself, of dust in the air, of the balance, Il. 8.74, of birds ‘soaring,’ and of horses flinging up their heels. The part. a)ei/ra=s is added to verbs by way of amplification, Od. 1.141. Of ‘bringing and offering,’ Il. 6.264, esp. mid. (out of one's store), 293, Od. 15.106.
a)ei=sai: see a)ei/dw.
a)-ekazo/menos (a)ve/kwn): unwillingly, reluctantly; w. polla/, ‘much against one's will.’
a)-ekh/lios (a)vek.): unwelcome, ‘woful,’ e)/rga, Il. 18.77†.
a)-e/khti (ve/khti): against the will of; freq. w. qew=n.

a)-e/kwn, a=)/kwn, -ousa (vekw/n): unwilling, reluctant; ‘unintentionally,’ Il. 16.264, bih| a)e/konta, ‘by force against my will,’ Il. 15.186 ; se\ bi/h| a)e/kontos a)phu/ra, Od. 4.646; cf. Il. 1.430.
a)/ella (a)/vhmi): gust of wind, blast, squall; of a whirlwind, Il. 16.374.
a)ello/ - pos (a)/ella, pou=s): stormfooted; of Iris, the swift messenger, cf. podh/nemos. (Il.)
a)-elph/s (ve/lpomai): unhoped for, ‘beyond hope,’ Od. 5.408†.
a)-elpte/w: be hopeless; a)velpte/ontes so/on ei)=nai, ‘despairing of his safety,’ i. e. ‘recovering him safe beyond their hopes,’ Il. 7.310†.
a=/e-na/wn, ai)e-na/wn (a)ei/, naw): everflowing, ‘never - failing,’ ‘perennial,’ u(/data, Od. 13.109†.

a)e/cw (a)ve/cw, ‘wax’), only pres. and ipf.: make to grow, increase, let grow up, ui(o/n, Od. 13.360; mid. and pass., grow, grow up; me/ga pe/nqos, ‘cherish’; e)/rgon, ‘prosper,’ Od. 14.66 ; a)e/ceto i(ero\n h)=mar, ‘was waxing,’ i. e. advancing toward the meridian, Il. 8.66, Od. 9.56.
a)-ergi=/h (ve/rgon): sloth, Od. 24.251†. The i= is a necessity of the rhythm.
a)-ergo/s: slothful, idle, lazy.
a)erqei/s, a)erqe/n: see a)ei/rw.
a)ersi/-pos (a)vei/rw, pou/s): high-stepping; epith. of horses, cf. Il. 23.501.
a=)/esa (a=)/vesa), a=)e/samen, a=)/samen, a)/esan, inf. a)e/sai, only aor.: pass the night, rest, not necessarily in sleep; nu/kta, nu/ktas. (Od.)
a)esi-frosu/nh: thoughtlessness, dat. pl. ‘thoughtlessly,’ Od. 15.470†.
a)esi/-frwn (cf. Od. 21.301 f.): light-headed, thoughtless, silly.
a)za/leos (a)/zh): dry, withered, sere.
*)azei+/dhs: son of Azeus, *)/aktwr, Il. 2.513.
a)/zh|, dat. from a(/za (a)/zomai): dry dirt, ‘rust,’ Od. 22.184†.
a) - zhxh/s, e/s: unceasing, incessant; adverbial a)zhxe/s.
a)/zomai (act. a)/zw, Hesiod): dry, grow dry, ‘season,’ Il. 4.487†.
a(/zomai, only pres. and ipf.: dread, stand in awe of; w. inf. Il. 6.267, Od. 9.478; w. mh/, ‘lest,’ Il. 14.261.

a)hdw/n (a)vei/dw, the ‘songstress,’ kat' e)coxh/n): nightingale. In the Homeric legend the daughter of Pandareus, wife of Zethus of Thebes, mother of Itylus, whom she slew by mistake, Od. 19.518† ff. See *)/itulos.
a)-hqe/ssw (a)hqh/s, h)=qos): be unaccustomed to; w. gen., Il. 10.493†.

a)/hmi (a)/vhmi), 3 du. a)/hton, inf. a)h=nai, a)h/menai, part. a)e/ntes, ipf. a)/h, a)/ei, pass. a)h/menos: blow, of wind; (le/wn) u=(o/menos kai\ a)h/menos, ‘buffeted by wind’ and rain, Od. 6.131; met. di/xa... qu=mo\s a)/hto, ‘wavered,’ Il. 21.386.
a=)h/r, h)e/ros: the lower, denser atmosphere, distinguished from ai)qh/r, ‘sky’; hence ‘vapor,’ ‘mist,’ ‘cloud,’ esp. as means of rendering invisible, Il. 3.381.
a)h/sulos = ai)/sulos, Il. 5.876†.
a)h/ths (a)/vhmi): wind, Od. 9.139; mostly pl. w. a)ne/moio, *zefu/roio, a)ne/mwn, blast, breeze.
a)/hto: see a)/hmi.

a=/-qa/natos (the a= is a necessity of the dactylic rhythm): deathless, immortal; also as subst., opp. brotoi/, qnhtoi/, a)/ndres; said of ‘imperishable’ possessions of the gods, Od. 4.79, Il. 2.447 ; a=)qa/naton kako/n (Charybdis), Od. 12.118.
a)/-qaptos (qa/ptw): unburied.
a)-qeei/ (qeo/s), adv.: without god; ou)k a)qeei\ o(/d' a)nh\r... h(/kei (i. e. ‘he is a godsend to us’), said in mockery, Od. 18.353†.
a)-qe/mistos = a)qemi/stios, Od. 9.106, cf. 112; opp. e)nai/simos, Od. 17.363.
a)qeri/zw, ipf. a)qe/rizon: disregard, despise; always w. neg.; opp. megali/zomai, Od. 23.174.
a)-qe/sfatos (qeo/s, fhmi/, ‘not to be said even by a god’): unspeakable, indescribable, immense, prodigious (of quality or quantity); gai=a, qa/lassa, o)/mbros, nu/c, and even oi)=nos, si=tos.

*)aqhnai/h, *)aqh/nh: the goddess Athena, a)gelei/h, *)alalkomenhi/s, glaukw=pis, e)rusi/ptolis, eu)plo/kamos, h)u/komos, laosso/os, lhi=tis, polu/boulos; cf. *)atrutw/nh, *tritoge/neia, esp. *palla/s. Fosters the arts, Od. 6.232, Od. 23.160, esp. domestic and feminine accomplishments, Il. 9.390, Od. 2.116; as a goddess of war, she protects cities (*)alalkomenhi/s), and is the especial patron of Odysseus.
*)aqhnai=os: Athenian, Il. 2.551, etc.
*)aqh/nh: see *)aqh=nai, *)aqhnai/h.
a)qhrh-loigo/s (a)qh/r, loigo/s): chaffdestroyer, designation of a winnowingshovel in Teiresias' prophecy to Odysseus, Od. 11.128, Od. 23.275.
a=)qleu/w (= a=)qle/w): see a)eqleu/w.
a=)qle/w (a)=qlos), only aor. part. a=)qlh/sa=s: wrestle, toil, labor.
a=)qlhth/r: fighter, Od. 4.164†, cf. Od. 4.159 f.
a)=qlos: see a)/eqlos.
a=)qlofo/ros: see a)eqlofo/ros.
*)aqo/ws, o/w: Athos, Il. 14.229†, the mt. terminating the promontory of Acte in Chalcidice, now Monte Santo.
a)qre/w, only aor. a)qrh/seie, a)qrh=sai: gaze, look, in the effort to see something, then descry; abs. and w. ei)s, Il. 10.11; also w. acc., Il. 12.391.
a(qro/os, a)qro/os, only pl.: (all) together, in crowds; freq. a(qro/a pa/nta.
a)/ - qu=mos: spiritless, despondent, Od. 10.463†.
a)qu/rma (a)qu=/rw): plaything, toy, trinket.
*)/aqws: see *)aqo/ws.

ai), ai)/: if, if only, whether; conjunction, used in conditional clauses, and in the expression of a wish; always with ke/, ke/n (never a)/n), or ga/r, and never separated from these particles by another particle (ei) de/ ke, never ai) de/ ke).—I. conditional, regularly foll. by subj., rarely by opt. (Il. 7.387, Od. 13.389). Here belongs the so-called ‘interrogative’ use, as peirh/somai ai)/ ke tu/xwmi, Il. 5.279.—II. optative, to express a wish, ‘would that,’ ai)\ ga/r, or ai)\ ga\r dh/ w. opt., generally referring to fut. time, but sometimes of an unfulfilled wish in pres. time (Il. 7.132); foll. by inf., Od. 7.311, Od. 24.376.

*ai)ai=os, only fem. *ai)ai/h: Aeaean.— (1) nh=sos, the home of Circe (see Od. 12.3 f., 9), a fabulous isle, located by the Romans at Circeii, near Terracina.— (2) the goddess Circe herself, sister of Aeētes (see Od. 10.137).
*ai)aki/dhs: descendant of Aeacus; (1) his son, Peleus, Il. 16.15.—(2) his grandson, Achilles, Il. 2.860.
*ai)ako/s: son of Zeus and Aegina, grandfather of Achilles, Il. 21.189.

*ai)/a=s: Ajax.—(1) *telamw/nios, *telamwnia/dhs, me/gas, ‘the greater,’ son of Telamon from Salamis, half - brother of Teucer; second only to Achilles in prowess, Od. 11.550 f.—(2) *)oi=lia/dhs, *)oi=lh=os taxu\s *ai)/a=s, mei/wn, ‘the lesser,’ Oileus' son, leader of Locrians, his death, Od. 4.499.—The two heroes are often coupled in dual or pl., e. g. *ai)/ante du/w, qera/pontes *)arh=os, ‘the Ajaxes.’
*ai)gai/ (cf. ai)gialo/s): a town in Achaea, seat of worship of Poseidon, Il. 8.203.
*ai)gai/wn (cf. ai)gi/s): epithet of Briareus, Il. 1.404†.
ai)gane/h: a light hunting-spear, javelin, Od. 9.156; thrown for amusement, Il. 2.774, Od. 4.626; also used in war, Il. 16.589 ff.
*ai)gei/dhs: son of Aegeus, Theseus, Il. 1.265†.
ai)/geios, ai)/geos (ai)/c): of a goat; ‘of goat's milk,’ or ‘goatskin,’ turo/s, a)sko/s, kune/h.
ai)/geiros: black poplar; as tree in the lower world, Od. 10.510.
ai)/geos = ai)/geios, a)sko/s, Od. 9.196†.
*ai)gia/leia: daughter of Adrastus, wife of Diomed, Il. 5.412†.
ai)gialo/s: beach, strand.
*ai)gialo/s (‘Coast-land’): (1) a district in N. Peloponnesus, afterward Achaea, Il. 2.575†.—(2) a town in Paphlagonia, Il. 2.855†.
ai)gi/-botos (bo/skw): fed upon by goats; as subst., goat-pasture, Od. 13.246.
*ai)gi/liy: a district, or island, under the rule of Odysseus, Il. 2.633†.
*ai)/gi=na: an island in the Saronic gulf, still bearing its ancient name, Il. 2.562†.
*ai)/gion (cf. *ai)gialo/s): a town in Achaea, afterward the capital of the Achaean league, Il. 2.574†.
ai)gi/-oxos (e)/xw): aegis-holding, epith. of Zeus.

ai)gi/s (originally emblematic of the ‘storm-cloud,’ cf. e)paigi/zw): the aegis, a terrific shield borne by Zeus, or at his command by Apollo or by Athena, to excite tempests and spread dismay among men; the handiwork of Hephaestus; adorned with a hundred golden tassels, and surmounted by the Gorgon's head and other figures of horror, Il. 5.738, Il. 2.448.

*ai)/gisqos: son of Thyestes, and cousin of Agamemnon. As paramour of Clytaemnestra, he murders Agamemnon, and after ruling seven years over Mycenae, is himself killed by Orestes, Od. 3.196, Od. 4.512 ff., Od. 11.409.
ai)/glh: radiance, gleam; of daylight, Od. 6.45; of sun and moon; of weapons, Il. 2.458.
ai)glh/eis: radiant, resplendent, epith. of Olympus.
ai)gupio/s: vulture; with o)/rni=s, Il. 7.59.
*ai)gu/ptios (in cases ending w. a long syllable, read w. synizesis, as *ai)guptjous): (1) Egyptian; as subst., Od. 4.83.—(2) Aegyptius, an old man of Ithaca, Od. 2.15.
*ai)/guptos: (1) Egypt, Od. 4.355.—(2) Homeric name of the river Nile, Od. 4.477; w. potamo/s, Od. 14.258. —*ai)/gupto/nde, d 483, Od. 14.246.
ai)dei=o: see ai)de/omai.

ai)de/omai, ai)/domai (ai)dw/s), pr. imp. ai)dei=o, ipf. ai)/deto, fut. ai)de/s(s)omai, aor. mid. h)|desa/mhn and ai)dessa/mhn, pass. h)|de/sqhn, ai)de/sqhn, 3 pl. ai)/desqen: feel shame, regard, or mercy (from moral or humane scruples, toward oneself or others, even toward inferiors); tina\, respect, have regard for, stand abashed before, Il. 1.23, Od. 3.96; w. inf., scruple, be ashamed, from modesty, or from motives of propriety, good-taste, etc., Od. 14.146, Od. 18.184 ; ai)dome/nwn, ‘selfrespecting’ (opp. feugo/ntwn), Il. 5.531.
a)i/dhlos: destructive, destroying; ‘pestilent,’ Il. 5.880, Od. 22.165.—adv. a)idh/lws, Il. 21.220.

*)ai/dhs, *aidwneu/s (root vid, god of the unseen world), gen. *)ai/da=o, *)ai/dew, *)/aidos, dat. *)/aidi, *)ai/dh|, *)aidwnh=i, acc. *)ai/dhn: Hades; e)ne/roisin a)na/sswn, *zeu\s kataxqo/nios, kratero\s pula/rths, pelw/rios, kluto/pwlos, i)/fqi=mos, stugero/s. Freq. *)/aidos do/mon ei)/sw, e)n do/mois, etc.; often only *)/aido/sde, ei)s or e)n *)/aidos (sc. do/mon, do/mw|).

ai)doi=os (ai)dw/s): (1) modest, bashful, Od. 17.578.—(2) honored, respected, of those who by their relationship, position, or circumstances have a claim to deference or merciful treatment, as the gods, kings, suppliants, mendicants, and the ‘housekeeper’ (tami/h).—As subst. neut. pl. ai)doi=a, ‘the parts of shame,’ ‘privy parts,’ Il. 13.568†.—Adv., ai)doi/ws a)pe/pempon, ‘with due honor,’ ‘fitting escort,’ Od. 19.243.
ai)/domai: see ai)de/omai.
*aidos, *)/aido/sde: see *)ai/dhs.
a)idrei/h: ignorance; a)idrei/h|si no/oio, i. e. ‘unwittingly,’ Od. 11.262.
a)/ - idris (vi/dris): ignorant, unacquainted with (tino/s), witless, Il. 3.219.

ai)dw/s, ou=s: shame (restraint), re- gard, respect, mercy (see ai)de/omai); ‘scruple,’ ai)dw= kai\ ne/mesin, Il. 13.122 (cf. Il. 15.561), ai)dw\s | kai\ de/os, Il. 15.657; ‘diffidence,’ Od. 3.14; in reproach, ai)dw/s! ‘for shame,’ Il. 16.422, Il. 5.787; w. acc. and inf., ‘it's over bold,’ Od. 3.22; equiv. to ai)doi=on, ‘that hide thy nakedness,’ Il. 2.262.
ai)ei/, ai)e/n: see a)ei/.
ai)ei-gene/ths: immortal, eternal.
ai)ei-na/wn: see a=/e-na/wn.
ai)eto/s: eagle; the ‘bird of Jove,’ and ‘most perfect’ bird of omen, Il. 24.310 f., Il. 8.247.
ai)zho/s, ai)zh/ios: vigorous; with a)nh/r, and as subst. (Od. 12.440); esp. pl., qaleroi/, a)rhi/qooi ai)zhoi/, ‘lusty,’ ‘doughty youths.’
*ai)h/ths: son of Helius and Perse, brother of Circe, holder of the golden fleece won by the Argonauts, Od. 12.70.
ai)/htos: epith. of Hephaestus, pe/lwr ai)/hton, ‘terrible;’ ‘puffing’ (if from a)/hmi), Il. 18.410†. By some thought to be the same word as a)/htos.
ai)qalo/eis, essa, en (ai)/qw): smoky, sooty; me/laqron, me/garon, Il. 2.415, Od. 22.239; ko/nis, ‘grimy’ dust (opp. polio/s), Od. 24.316, Il. 18.23.
ai)/qe: particle of wishing, ‘Would that,’ ‘Oh, that,’ more common in Homer than ei)/qe. Foll. by opt., or by w)/felon and inf.
*ai)/qh: name of a mare, ‘Sorrel’ (‘Fire-bug’), Il. 23.295.

ai)qh/r: the upper air, or sky, aether; ai)qe/ri nai/wn, of Zeus, dweller in the heavens; more exactly conceived as having ou)rano/s beyond it, Il. 2.458; separated from the lower a=/h/r by the clouds, as Hera in Il. 15.20 swings e)n ai)qe/ri kai\ nefe/lh|sin.
*ai)/qi=kes: a tribe dwelling near Mt. Pindus, Il. 2.744†.
*ai)qi/opes (ai)/qw, the ‘swarthy’), acc. h=as: Aethiopians, a pious folk, loved and visited by the gods, dwelling on the borders of Oceanus, in two divisions, east and west, Od. 1.22 ff.
ai)qo/menos: burning, blazing.

ai)/qousa: portico, corridor. We distinguish two ai)/qousai, an outer and an inner, see plate III. at end of vol
ume.—(1) the outer (ai)q. au)lh=s, Od. 21.390, n 176, Od. 22.449), on either side of the vestibule, entering the court.—(2) the inner (ai)q. dw/matos), leading from the court into the house; this one served as a sleeping-place for guests (Od. 3.399, Od. 4.297), and was roofed.
ai)/qrh (cf. ai)qh/r): clear sky, serenity.
*ai)/qrh: mother of Theseus, follows Helen as captive to Troy, Il. 3.144.
ai)qrh-gene/ths, ai)qrhgenh/s: aetherborn, Boreas.
ai)=qros: cold, frost.
ai)/quia: water-hen.
ai)/qwn: shining, tawny; of metal (Il. 4.485), and of horses, cattle, eagle, and lion.
*ai)/qwn: (1) a name assumed by Odysseus, Od. 19.183.—(2) name of a horse, Il. 8.185; see *ai)/qh.
ai)/k): see ai)/ (ke).
a=/i=kh/ (a=/i=/ssw): darting; to/cwn a=/i=ka=/s, ‘whizzing bow-shots,’ Il. 15.709†.
a)ikw=s (= a)eikw=s): ignominiously, Il. 22.336†.
ai(=ma: blood, bloodshed, carnage; of relationship, race (geneh\ kai\ ai(=ma), Il. 6.211, Il. 19.105.
ai(masih/: thorn-bush; ai(masia=\s le/gein, ‘gather hedge-brush,’ Od. 18.359 and Od. 24.224.
ai(mato/eis, essa, en: bloody, bleeding; met. h)/mata, po/lemos.
*ai)moni/dhs: son of Aemon, Laerces, Il. 17.467†.
*ai(moni/dhs: son of Haemon, Maeon, from Thebes, Il. 4.394†.
ai(mu/lios: wheedling, winning, Od. 1.56†.
ai(/mwn: skilled in, w. gen., Il. 5.496†.
*ai(/mwn: a comrade of Nestor, Il. 4.296†.
ai)n-are/ths (ai)no/s, a)reth/), only voc. ai)nare/th: woful-valorous, of Achilles' misdirection of his might from the battle - field to the nursing of his wrath, Il. 16.31†.

*ai)nei/a=s, gen. *ai)nei/a=o, *ai)nei/w: Aeneas, son of Anchises and Aphrodite, ruler of the Dardanians, by his descent from Tros, a relative of Priam (see Il. 20.230240), with whom he was at feud, Il. 2.820, Il. 13.460; held in the highest honor by the Trojans, Il. 5.467, Il. 11.58; destined to rule over the Trojan race, Il. 20.307.
ai)ne/w (ai)=nos), fut. ai)nh/sw, aor. h)/|nhsa: praise, commend, approve.
ai)ni/zomai = ai)ne/w, Il. 13.374 and Od. 8.487.
*ai)/nios: a Paeonian, slain by Achilles, Il. 21.210†.
*ai)no/qen: from Aenus (in Thrace), Il. 4.520†.
ai)no/qen (ai)no/s,=e)k tou= ai)nou=): adv. used for emphatic repetition, ai)no/qen ai)nw=s (direst of the dire), Il. 7.97†; cf. oi)o/qen oi)=os, 39.
ai)no/-moros (mo/ros): dire-fated.
ai)no-paqh/s (pa/sxw): dire-suffering, ‘poor sufferer,’ Od. 18.201†.
ai)=nos: praise, eulogy.

ai)no/s: dread, dreadful, dire; either with full force and seriousness of meaning, or colloquially and hyperbolically; ai)no/tate *kroni/dh, ‘horrid,’ Il. 1.552 (cf. Il. 8.423), ai)nw=s e)/oikas kei/nw|, ‘terribly’ like him, Od. 1.208.—Adv., ai)no/taton, ai)na/, ai)nw=s. ti/ nu/ s' e)/trefon ai)na\ tekou=sa (since I bore thee ‘to sorrow’), Il. 1.414, cf. 418, ai)nw=s kaka\ ei(/mata (‘shocking’ bad clothes), Od. 17.24.
ai)/numai, only pres., and ipf. ai)/nuto: take; met. po/qos ai)/nutai, ‘I am seized with’ longing, Od. 14.144.
ai)nw=s: see ai)no/s.
ai)/c, ai)go/s, dat. pl. ai)/gesin: goat.
a=/i=/caskon: see a=/i=/ssw.
*ai)oli/dhs: son of Aeolus, see *krhqeu/s, *si=/sufos.
*ai)oli/h, nh=sos: the Aeolian isle, residence of Aeolus, lord of winds, Od. 10.1 ff.
ai)olo-qw/rhc: with glancing cuirass.
ai)olo-mi/trhs (mi/trh): with glancing belt of mail, Il. 5.707.
ai)olo/-pwlos: with glancing (swift) steeds, Il. 3.185†, cf. Il. 19.404.

ai)o/los: quick - moving, lively; of wasps (me/son, ‘at the waist’), gad - fly (‘darting’), serpent (‘squirming’), worms (‘wriggling’); then glancing, shimmering, of lively (changeable) colors, esp. metallic, Il. 5.295, Il. 7.222.
*ai)/olos, gen. *ai)o/loo, Od. 10.36, 60: (1) son of Hippotas, and lord of winds, Od. 10.2. —(2) father of Sisyphus, Il. 6.154.
*ai)/peia: a town on the Messenian gulf, Il. 9.152, 294.
ai)peino/s, ai)ph/eis (essa), ai)po/s: see ai)pu/s.
ai)po/lion: herd of goats, herd.
ai)po/los (ai)/c, pe/lomai): goat - herd, herder.
*ai)pu/: a town subject to Nestor, Il. 2.592†.

ai)pu/s, ei=a, u/: steep, towering; of mountains, towns (here esp. the form ai)peino/s), streams with steep banks (ai)pa\ r(e/eqra, *q 369, Il. 21.9, cf. 10), a noose ‘hung high,’ Od. 11.278; met. po/nos, ‘arduous;’ o)/leqros, ‘utter,’ etc.; ai)pu/ oi( e)ssei=tai, he will find it ‘steep,’ Il. 13.317.
*ai)pu/tios: of Aepytus, progenitor of a royal line in Arcadia, Il. 2.604†.

ai(re/w, fut. -h/sw, aor. ei(=lon, e(/lon (ve/lon), iter. e(/leskon, mid. ai(reu/menoi, ai(rh/somai, ei(lo/mhn, e(lo/mhn: I. act., take, ‘grasp,’ ‘seize’ (freq. w. part. gen.), ‘capture,’ ‘overtake’ in running; of receiving prizes (Il. 23.779), embracing (Od. 11.205), putting on (‘donning’) garments (Od. 17.58), ‘taking up’ a story at some point (Od. 8.500); gai=an o)da\c e(lei=n, ‘bite the dust;’ freq. of hitting in combat, and esp. euphemistic, e(/len, he ‘slew’; met. of feelings, xo/los ai(rei= me, i(/meros, de/os, etc., so u(/pnos.—II. mid., take as one's own, to or for oneself, choose; of taking food, robbing or stripping another, taking an oath from one (tino/s, Od. 4.746, tini/, Il. 22.119); also met., a)/lkimon h)=tor, filo/thta e(le/sqai, Il. 16.282.
*)/a-i=ros (vi=ros): *)=iros *)/ai=ros, ‘Irus un-Irused,’ Od. 18.73†, cf. 6 f.
ai)/rw: see a)ei/rw.
*)/ais: see *)ai/dhs.

ai)=sa: allotted share, or portion, lot, term of life, destiny; prov. e)n karo\s ai)/sh| (cf. Att. e)n ou)deno\s me/rei); kat' ai<*>=san, ‘as much as was my due,’ ou)d' u(pe\r ai)=san, Il. 6.333; u(pe\r *dio\s ai)=san, Il. 17.321; o(mh=| peprwme/nos ai)/sh|, Il. 15.209.
*ai)/shpos: (1) son of Abarbarea and Bucolion, Il. 6.21†.—(2) name of a river emptying into the Propontis, near Cyzicus.
a)i/sqw (a)vi/w, 2), only pres. and ipf. a)/isqe: breathe out; qu=mo/n, of giving up the ghost, Il. 16.468 and Il. 20.403.
ai)/simos (ai)=sa): destined, due, suitable, right; ai)/simon h)=en, ai)/simon h)=mar, day ‘of destiny,’ ai)/sima ei)de/nai, ‘righteous thoughts;’ pers., fre/nas ai)si/mh h)=sqa, Od. 23.14.
ai)/sios (ai)=sa): auspicious, opportune, Il. 24.376†.

a=)i=/ssw (a= except u(pai=/cei, Il. 21.126), aor. h)/i=ca (a=)i=/cw, a=)i=cai, a=)i=/ca=s), a=)i/caskon, mid. aor. a=)i=/casqai, pass. h)i=/xqhn, a=/i=xqh/thn: speed, dart, spring; of persons, animals, birds flying, and of inanimate things (arrows, a beam of light, ‘fluttering’ mane of horses); of the shades of the dead ‘flitting’ to and fro; freq. the part. w. another verb of motion, bh= a=)i=/ca=sa, a=/i=/cante pete/sqhn, Il. 15.150, and conversely, h)/i=ce pe/tesqai, ‘darted away’ in flight, Il. 21.247; often of hostile movements, a)nti/os a=)i=/ca=s, fasga/nw|, ‘with his sword,’ etc.; met., of the mind, no/os a=)ne/ros, Il. 15.80 (cf. pte/ron h)e\ no/hma, Od. 7.36).
a)/-istos (vide=in): unseen; oi)/xet' a)/istos, a)/pustos, Od. 1.242; kai/ ke/ m) a)/iston e)/mbale po/ntw|, ‘to be seen no more.’
a)isto/w (a)/vistos): put out of sight, annihilate; a)istw/qhsan, vanished, Od. 10.259.
ai)su=hth/r: see ai)sumnhth/r.
*ai)su=h/ths: (1) father of Antenor, Il. 2.793.—(2) father of Alcathous, Il. 13.427.
ai)sulo/-ergos: evil - doing, v. l. for o)brimo/ergos, Il. 5.403†.
ai)/sulos: evil, neut. pl. with r(e/zein, mu=qh/sasqai.
*ai)su=/mhqen: from Aesyme, in Thrace, Il. 8.304†.
ai)sumnhth/s: princely, dat. Il. 24.347†. v. l. ai)su=hth=ri.
ai)sumnh/thr: umpire, Od. 8.258†.
*ai)/sumnos: a Greek, slain by Hector, Il. 11.303†.
ai)=sxos, eos: (1) ugliness.—(2) disgrace, reproach, outrage; ai)=sxos, lw/bh te (Od. 18.225), ai)/sxea kai\ o)nei/dea (Il. 3.342), ai)/sxe) a)kou/w (Il. 6.524), ai)/sxea po/ll' o(ro/wn (Od. 1.229).
ai)sxro/s, comp. neut. ai)/sxion, sup. ai)/sxistos: (1) ugly, Il. 2.216.—(2) disgraceful, insulting, outrageous.—Adv. ai)sxrw=s.

ai)sxu=/nw (ai)=sxos), aor. h)/|sxu=ne, perf. pass. h)|sxu=mme/nos: I. act., disfigure, then disgrace, insult; a)reth/n, ‘tarnish’ the fame of my prowess, Il. 23.571.—II.
mid., be ashamed of, or to do or say anything disgraceful.
*ai)/swn: son of Cretheus and Tyro, father of Jason, and king in Iolcus, Od. 11.259.
ai)te/w, fut. -h/sw, aor. part. -h/sa=sa: ask, demand, beg, sue for; abs., of a mendicant, Od. 18.49; freq. tina/ ti, w. inf. Il. 6.176, acc. and inf. (h)|te/omen de\ qeo\n fh=nai te/ras), Od. 3.173.
ai)tia/asqai: see ai)tia/omai.

ai)tia/omai (ai)/tios), resolved forms constantly, inf. ai)tia/asqai, opt. ai)tio/w|o, w|to, ipf. h)|tia/asqe, h)tio/w|nto: accuse; oi(=on dh/ nu qeou\s brotoi\ ai)tio/wntai, ‘how mortals do bring charges against the gods!’ Od. 1.32.
ai)ti/zw (stronger than ai)te/w): beg, importune. (Od.)
ai)/tios (ai)ti/a=): to blame, guilty; ou)/ ti/ moi ai)/tioi/ ei)sin, ‘I have no fault to find with them,’ Il. 1.153, so Od. 2.87.
ai)tio/wntai, ai)tio/w|o: see ai)tia/omai.
*ai)tw/lios, *ai)twlo/s: Aetolian.
ai)xma/zw: wield the lance; ai)xma=\s ai)xma/ssousi, Il. 4.324†.
ai)xmh/: point of lance, lance, spear.
ai)xmhth/s, ai)xmhta (Il. 5.197): spearman, warrior; freq. implying bravery, with a)ndrw=n, Il. 3.49.
ai)=ya: forthwith, at once, directly; ai)=ya d' e)/peita, ai)=ya ma/la, ai)=ya kai\ o)trale/ws. ai)=ya/ te, speedily, in general statements, Od. 19.221.
ai)yhro/s (ai)=ya): quick(ly), used with the sense of the adv.; lu=sen d' a)gorh\n ai)yhrh/n, Il. 19.276, Od. 2.257; ai)yhro\s de\ ko/ros, ‘soon’ comes, Od. 4.103.

a)i/w (1) (a)vi/w), only pres. and ipf. a)/ion: (1) hear; abs., and w. gen. or acc. —(2) mark, perceive, never inconsistently with the sense of hearing, plhgh=s a)i/ontes, the horses hear the lash as well as feel the stroke, Il. 11.532 .— ou)k a)i/eis (=a)kou/eis;); or, sometimes, ‘markest thou not?’ ‘remarkest,’ Il. 15.248, Od. 1.298.
a)i/w (2) (cf. a)/vhmi): breathe out; fi/lon a=)/ion h)=tor, ‘was (near) breathing my last,’ Il. 15.252†.
ai)w/n, w=nos (cf. aevum), m., fem. Il. 22.58: lifetime, life.
a)ka/khta: deliverer; epith. of Hermes, Il. 16.185 and Od. 24.10.
a)kala - rrei/ths (a)kalo/s): gentlyflowing; epith. of Oceanus, Il. 7.422 and Od. 19.434.
a)-ka/ma=s, antos (ka/mnw): untiring.
*)aka/ma=s: (1) son of Antenor and Theano, a leader of Dardanians, Il. 14.478. —(2) son of Eussōrus, a leader of Thracians, Il. 6.8.
a)-ka/matos = a)ka/ma=s, epith. of fire.
a)/kanqa (root ak): thistle, pl. Od. 5.328†.
*)/akastos: king of Dulichium, Od. 14.336†.
a)kaxei/ato, a)kaxei=n, a)kaxh/sw, a)kaxhme/nos: see a)kaxi/zw.

a)kaxi/zw (root ax), aor. h)/kaxe, a)kaxei=n, and a)ka/xhse, mid. a)kaxi/zomai, pf. a)ka/xhmai, 3 pl. a)khxe/datai, part. also a)khxeme/nh, ai, inf. a)kaxh=sqai, plup. 3 pl. a)kaxei/ato, aor. a)ka/xonto, -oito: distress, grieve, Od. 16.432, Il. 23.223; mid., be distressed, grieve; with causal gen. or dat., qano/nti, ‘were he dead,’ Od. 1.236 ; a)kaxhme/noi h)=tor, ‘with aching hearts’; qu=mw=|, Il. 6.486. Cf. a)/xos, a)xe/w, a)xeu/w, a)/xnumai.
a)kaxme/nos (root ak): sharpened, pointed; e)/gxos a)kaxme/non o)ce/i xalkw=| ‘tipped with sharp point of bronze,’ peleku\s a)mfote/rwqen a)k., ‘doubleedged’ axe, Od. 5.235.
a)ka/xoito: see a)kaxi/zw.
a)ke/omai, a)kei/omai, a)keio/menos, aor. h)kesa/mhn (imp. a)/kessai): heal; nh=as, ‘repair,’ Od. 14.383; met. of thirst (‘slake’), troubles (‘make good’), Il. 13.115, Od. 10.69.
a)-kerse-ko/mhs (kei/rw, ko/mh): with unshorn hair; *foi=bos, Il. 20.39†.
a)/kesma (a)ke/omai): means of healing, ‘alleviating,’ o)duna=/wn, Il. 15.394†.
*)akessa/menos: a king of Thrace, father of Periboea, Il. 21.142†.
a)kesto/s (a)ke/omai): curable; a)kestai/ toi fre/nes e)sqlw=n, ‘can be mended,’ Il. 13.115†.
a)ke/wn (cf. a)kh/n), mostly as adv. and indecl., but a)ke/ousa, a)ke/onta, a)ke/onte: in silence, still, quiet(ly).
a)-kh/destos (khde/w): uncared - for, i. e. of the dead, ‘unburied,’ Il. 6.60; adv. a)khde/stws, pitilessly.
a)-khde/w (a)khdh/s); aor. a)kh/desen: be neglectful, neglect.
a)-khdh/s, e/s (kh=dos): uncaring, unfeeling, Il. 21.123, Od. 17.319; free from care, Il. 24.526; pass neglected, esp. ‘unburied.’
a)-kh/lhtos (khle/w): not to be charmed, ‘proof against enchantment,’ no/os, Od. 10.329†.
a)kh/n: adv. silent, with i)/san, e)/san, a)kh\n e)ge/nonto siwph=|, ‘were hushed’ in silence, Od. 16.393.
a)-khra/sios = a)kh/ratos, Od. 9.205†.
a)-kh/ratos: untouched, pure.
a)-kh/rios (1) (kh/r): unharmed.
a)-kh/rios (2) (kh=r): (1) dead.—(2) spiritless, cowardly; de/os, Il. 5.812.
a)khxe/datai, a)khxe/atai, a)khxeme/nh: see a)kaxi/zw.
a)/-ki=kus (ki=kus): strengthless, feeble. (Od.)
a)-kleh/s, e/s, a)klhh/s, a)kleih/s (kle/os), acc. sing. a)klea= or a)kle/a=, nom. pl. a)klhei=s: inglorious, adv. a)klee\s au)/tws, ‘all so ingloriously,’ Il. 7.100.—Adv. a)kleiw=s.
a)/-klhros (klh=ros): portionless, Od. 11.490†.
a)kmh/ (root ak): edge, in the prov. e)pi\ curou= i(/statai a)kmh=s, Il. 10.173†.
a)kmhno/s (a)kmh/): full-grown, Il. 23.191†.
a)/kmhnos: without taste (of food or drink); only in T.
a)-kmh/s, h=tos (ka/mnw): unwearied, only pl. (Il.)
a)kmo/-qeton (a)/kmwn, ti/qhmi): anvilblock.
a)/kmwn, onos: anvil.
a)/knhstis: backbone, Od. 10.161†.
a)-koi/ths (koi/th): husband, consort, spouse.
a)/-koitis, acc. pl. a)koi/ti=s: wife, consort.
a)/kolos: morsel, pl. Od. 17.222†.
a)-komisti=/h (komi/zw), i= from the necessity of the rhythm: want of care, Od. 21.284†.
a)kontisth/s: javelin - thrower, javelin-hurling, as adj. Il. 16.328.
a)kontistu=/s: contest of the dart, Il. 23.622.
a)-ko/rhtos (kore/nnu=mi): insatiate, w. gen.
a)/kos (a)ke/omai): cure, remedy.
a)/-kosmos: disorderly, Il. 2.213†.
a)kosta/w (a)kosth/): eat barley; only aor. part., stato\s i(/ppos, a)kosth/sa=s e)pi\ fa/tnh|, ‘well fed at the grain-crib,’ Il. 6.506 and Il. 15.263.
a)koua/zomai: listen with delight, a)oidou=, ‘to the bard;’ daito\s a)koua/zesqon e)mei=o, ‘hear from me the glad call to the feast,’ Il. 4.343.
a)kouh/: hearing; meta\ patro\s a)kouh/n, ‘to hear tidings’ of father; e(/kaqen de/ te gi/gnet' a)kouh/, ‘can be heard’ afar, Il. 16.634.
a)/-kouros (kou=ros): without male heir, Od. 7.64†.

a)kou/w, ipf. h)/kouon, mostly a)/kouon, (mid. a)kou/eto, Il. 4.331), fut. a)kou/somai, aor. h)/kousa, mostly a)/kousa: hear; hence ‘listen,’ ‘give ear to,’ ‘obey’; abs., or w. acc. of thing, gen. of person, (dat. of advantage, Il. 16.516), sometimes gen. of thing; foll. by participle, gen., Il. 24.490, Od. 1.289, rarely acc. Il. 7.129; inf., Il. 6.386 ; *)atrei/dhn a)kou/ete, w(s h)=lqe (i. e. w(s *)atrei/dhs h)=lqe), Od. 3.193.
a)-kra=/antos (kraiai/nw): unfulfilled, unaccomplished.
a)kr-a=h/s, e/os (a)/kros, a)/vhmi): sharpblowing, of favorable winds. (Od.)
a)/krh (a)/kros): summit, promontory, cape; kat' a)/krhs, ‘from on high’; me/ga ku=ma, Od. 5.313 (ingens a vertice pontus); then ‘from top to bottom,’ ‘utterly’ (w)/leto, e(le/ein, Il. 15.557).
a)/krhqen: see kata/krhqen.
a)/ - krhtos (kerannu=mi): unmixed, pure.
a)kri/s, i/dos: locust, pl., Il. 21.12†.
a)/kris, ios (a)/kros): mountain - top, only pl., ‘heights.’ (Od.)
*)akrisiw/nh: daughter of Acrisius, Danaë, Il. 14.319†.
a) - krito/ - mu=qos: indiscriminate in speech; Thersites, ‘endless babbler,’ Il. 2.246 (cf. 213, 796); of dreams, ‘mazy,’ Od. 19.560.
a)/-kritos (kri=/nw): unseparated, undecided, confused, endless; tu/mbos (undistinguished, i. e. common to many dead), nei/kea, a)/xea, mu=qoi.—Adv., a)/kriton, ‘unceasingly.’
a)krito/-fullos (fu/llon): dense with leaves or foliage, Il. 2.868†.
a)kro - kelainia/w (kelaino/s): only part., with darkling surface, Il. 21.249†.
a)kro/-komos (ko/mh): with hair done up at the crown of the head, Il. 4.533†.
a)/kron, subst.: point, promontory, summit.—Adv., see a)/kros.
*)akro/news (nau=s): name of a Phaeacian, Od. 8.111.
a)kro/-polis: citadel, only in Od. In Il., separated, a)/krh po/lis.
a)kro-po/los (pe/lomai), only dat. pl.: lofty.
a)kro-po/ros (pei/rw): with piercing point, acc. pl., Od. 3.463†.

a)/kros (root ak), sup. a)kro/tatos: uttermost, topmost, highest, at the top, end, edge, or surface of (summus); po/lis a)/krh, a)/krh po/lis, ‘upper city’ (=a)kro/polis); kat' a)/krhs, see a)/krh.—Adv. a)/kron, ‘along the top,’ Il. 20.229.
*)aktai/h: a Nereid, Il. 18.41†.
a)kth/ (1): meal, corn; always with a)lfi/tou, or *dhmh/teros.
a)kth/ (2): shore, esp. rocky and jutting parts, a)porrw=ges, problh=tes.
a)-kth/mwn (kth=ma): without possession, with gen.
a)kti=/s, i=nos, only dat. pl., a)kti=sin, a)kti=/nessi: ray, beam of the sun.
*)aktori/dhs: descendant of Actor, Echecles, Il. 16.189†.
*)aktori/s: an attendant of Penelope, Od. 23.228†.
*)aktori/wn: son of Actor; there were twins, *)aktori/wne, called also *moli/one after their mother Molione, Il. 11.750.
*)/aktwr: (1) son of Azeus, Il. 2.513.— (2) father of Menoetius, Il. 11.785, Il. 16.14. —(3) son of Phorbas, brother of Augeas, and father of the *)aktori/wne.— (4) father of Echecles.
a)/kulos: edible acorn, sweet acorn, Od. 10.242†.
a)kwkh/ (root ak): point of a weapon.
a)/kwn, ontos (root ak): javelin, dart.
a=)/kwn: see a)e/kwn.
a(/la-de: seaward, into the sea; with ei)s, Od. 10.351.
a)la/lhmai: see a)la/omai.

a)lalhto/s (cf. a)lala/zw, and for the reduplication also o)lolu/zw, e)leleu=, etc.): loud, resounding yell, yelling, war-cry, of a tumultuous throng; usually a triumphant outcry, but raised by the panic-stricken victims of Achilles, Il. 21.10; in the assembly, by a majority opposed to fighting, Od. 24.463.
a)/lalke, -ei=n, -w/n: see a)le/cw.
*)alalkomenhi/s (a)lalkei=n): the Defender, an epithet of Athena, with which is connected the name of *)alalkomenai/, a city in Boeotia, Il. 4.8, Il. 5.908.
a)lalu/kthmai (cf. a)lu/w, a)lu/skw): perf. w. pres. signification, am bewildered, Il. 10.94†.

a)la/omai, imp. a)lo/w, ipf. h)lw/mhn, a)lw/mhn, aor. a)lh/qhn, pf. a)la/lhmai, a)lalh/menos: wander, rove, roam, of adventurers, freebooters, mendicants, and homeless or lost persons. The perf. is only more intensive in meaning than the present, Od. 2.370, etc.
a)lao/s: blind.
a)lao - skopi/h: only in the phrase, ou)d' a)laoskopi/hn ei)=xe, he kept no blind (i. e. heedless) watch.
a)lao/w: make blind, w. gen. o)fqalmou=. (Od.)
a)lapa/zw, ipf. a)la/paze, fut. -cw, aor. a)la/paca: empty, drain, esp. with po/lin, sack; then of ships, men, etc., ‘destroy,’ ‘slay.’
a)laste/w (a)/lastos), only ipf. h)la/steon, aor. part. a)lasth/sa=s: be unforgetting, be wroth, Il. 12.163 and Il. 15.21.
*)alastori/dhs: son of Alastor, Tros, Il. 20.463.
a)/-lastos, on (laqe/sqai): never to be forgotten, ‘ceaseless;’ a)/los, pe/nqos, a)/laston o)du=/romai, a)/laste, ‘eternal foe,’ Il. 22.261.
*)ala/stwr: (1) a Lycian, Il. 5.677.— (2) a leader of the Pylians, Il. 4.295.— (3) father of Tros.
a)lawtu=/s (a)lao/s): blinding, Od. 9.503†.
a)lge/w (a)/lgos), aor. subj. a)lgh/sete, part. a)lgh/sa=s: feel pain, suffer; met., Od. 12.27.
a)/lgion, a)lgi/sth: see a)legeino/s.

a)/lgos: pain; freq. met., and esp. pl., hardship, troubles, woe; of hunters, oi(/ te kaq' u=(/lhn | a)/lgea pa/sxousin, Od. 9.121; often of Odysseus, pa/qen a)/lgea qu=mw=|, etc.; po/ll' a)/lgea dusmene/essin, ‘vexation,’ Od. 6.184.
a)ldai/nw (root al, alo): make to grow; only aor. me/le) h)/ldane poime/ni la=w=n, ‘filled out’ his limbs. (Od.)
a)le/asqai: see a)le/omai.

a)legeino/s (a)/lgos), comp. neut. a)/lgion, sup. a)/lgistos: painful, hard, toilsome; pugmaxi/h, ku=/mata, maxlo-
su/nh, ‘fraught with trouble,’ Il. 24.30; freq. w. inf., h(mi/onos a)lgi/sth dama/sasqai, Il. 23.655.—Adv. a)/lgion, used in exclamations, tw=| d' a)/lgion, ‘so much the worse’ for him!
*)aleghnori/dhs: son of Alegenor, Promachus, Il. 14.503†.
a)legi/zw (a)le/gw), only pr. and ipf. without augment: care for, heed, tino/s. Always with neg.; abs. ou)k a)legi/zei | ou)d' o)/qetai, Il. 15.106.
a)legu=/nw (a)le/gw): care for, attend to, only w. dai=ta, dai=tas. Said comprehensively, for ‘partaking of,’ ‘enjoying’ the meal. (Od).

a)le/gw, only pres.: care, care for, be concerned, tino/s (acc. Il. 16.388); a)le/gousi kiou=sai, ‘are troubled’ as they go, Il. 9.504; usually w. neg., abs. ku/nes ou)k a)le/gousai, careless (good-for-nothing) hussies, Od. 19.154. In Od. 6.268 equiv. to a)legu/nw.
a)leei/nw: parallel form of a)le/omai, only pres. and ipf.
a)le/h (1) (a)le/omai): shunning, escaping, escape, Il. 22.301†.
a)le/h (2): warm sunshine, Od. 17.23†.
a)/leias, atos (a)le/w): flour, wheaten flour, Od. 20.108†.
a)lei/s: see ei)/lw.
*)alei/sion: a town in Elis, Il. 2.617, Il. 11.757.
a)/leison: tankard, usually costly; xru=/seon, a)/mfwton, Od. 22.9.
a)lei/ths: sinner, evil - doer, Il. 3.28, Od. 20.121.
a)/leifar, atos (a)lei/fw): ointment, fat or oil; for anointing the dead before cremation, and in Od. 3.408 for polishing marble, ‘glistening with oil.’
a)lei/fw (li/pa), aor. h)/leiya and a)l., mid. a)leiya/mhn: anoint, usually li/p' e)lai/w|, but of smearing with wax, Od. 12.200.
*)alektruw/n: father of Leïtus, Il. 17.602†.
*)ale/ktwr: father-in-law of Megapenthes, Od. 4.10†.
a)/len, a)le/n: see ei)/lw.
a)leca/menos, -asqai: see a)le/cw.
*)ale/c - andros: Alexander, Greek name of Paris, and perhaps a translation of that word. See *pa/ris.
a)lec-a/nemos: protecting against the wind, Od. 14.529†.
a)lechth/s, h=ros: averter; ma/xhs, ‘stemmer of battle,’ Il. 20.396†.
a)leci/-kakos: averting ill, Il. 10.20†.

a)le/cw (root alk), inf. a)lece/men (ai), fut. a)lech/sw, red. aor. a)/lalke, subj. a)la/lkh|si, inf. a)lalkei=n, -e/menai, -e/men, aor. opt. a)lech/seie, and subj. mid. a)lecw/mesqa: ward off, avert, ti/, tini/, and tini/ ti, hence defend one against something; mid., ward off from, defend oneself.

a)le/omai, a)leu/omai (a)le/vomai), aor. h)leu/ato, a)leu/ato, -nto, opt. a)le/aito, imp. a)/leuai, a)le/asqe, inf. a)le/asqai, part. a)leua/menos (subj. a)le/vhtai, a)levw/meqa, aor. or pres.): shun, avoid, flee from, flee; abs., and freq. ti/, rarely tina/ (qeou/s, ‘shun their wrath,’ Od. 9.274); also w. inf.
a(/letai: see a(/llomai.
a)letreu/w: grind, Od. 7.104†.
a)letri/s (a)le/w): one who grinds, gunh/, woman ‘at the mill,’ Od. 20.105†.
a)leu/etai: see a)le/omai.
a)le/w, only aor. a)/lessan: grind, Od. 20.109†.
a)lewrh/ (a)le/omai): shunning, escape, means of shunning or defending against, tino/s.
a)/lh (a)la/omai): wandering, roving, roaming.
a)-lhqei/h (a)lhqh/s): truth.
a)lhqei/s: see a)la/omai.
a)-lhqh/s (lh/qw): true; of a person, ‘honest,’ Il. 12.433, neut. sing. Od. 3.247, elsewhere only neut. pl.

*)alh/ion, pedi/on: the Aleïan plain, scene of Bellerophon's wandering, in Cilicia according to the later legend, Il. 6.201†. The name seems to involve a play upon a)la=to (in the same v.), cf. *)alu/ba=s.
a)-lh/ios (lh/ion): without corn-land, i. e. without property, cf. a)/klhros.
a=)/-lhktos, a)/llhktos (lh/gw): unceasing; adv. -ton, unceasingly.
a)lh/menai, a)lh=nai: see ei)/lw.
a)lh/mwn, onos (a)la/omai): roving, wandering, wanderer.
a(/lhtai: see a(/llomai.
a)lhteu/w (a)lh/ths): roam about. (Od.)
a)lh/ths (a)la/omai): vagabond, beggar. (Od.)
*)alqai/a=: wife of Oeneus in Calydon, mother of Meleager, Il. 9.555†.
a)/lqomai: be healed; a)/lqeto xei/r, was healing, Il. 5.417†.
a(li-a=h/s, e/os (a(/ls, a)/hmi): blowing on the sea, of favorable, off-shore winds, Od. 4.361†.
*(ali/artos: a town in Boeotia, Il. 2.503†.
a)-li/astos (lia/zomai): unswerving, hence obstinate, persistent; po/lemos, po/nos, go/os. (Il.)
a)li/gkios: like, resembling.
a(lieu/s, h=os (a(/ls): seaman, fisherman; as adj., Od. 16.349.
*(alizw=nes: a tribe of Trojan allies from Pontus.
*(ali/h: a Nereid, Il. 18.40†.
*(ali-qe/rshs: an Ithacan, the son of Mestor, and a friend of Odysseus, Od. 2.157, Od. 17.78. (Od.)
a(li - mu=rh/eis, entos (a(/ls, mu=rw): mingling with the sea, epith. of rivers.
a(/lios (1) (a(/ls): of the sea; ge/rwn, Nereus (Il. 1.556), Proteus (Od. 4.365), qeai/, and as subst. a(/liai, the Nereids, Od. 24.47.
a(/lios (2): fruitless, ineffectual, vain, in vain; adv. a(/lion.
*(/alios: (1) a Lycian, Il. 5.678.—(2) a son of Alcinous, Od. 8.119, 370.
a(lio-trefh/s, e/os (tr<*>fw): sea-nurtured, epith. of seals, Od. 4.442†.
a(lio/w (a(/lio Od. 18.2), only aor. a(li/wse, -w=sai: render fruitless, baffle, with be/los, ‘hurl in vain,’ Il. 16.737.
a(li/ - ploos (ple/w): sailing in the sea, ‘submerged,’ acc. pl., Il. 12.26†.
a(li-po/rfuros: sea-purple, purple as the sea. (Od.)

a(/lis (va/lis, cf. e)va/lhn, ei)/lw): crowded together; of persons, ‘in throngs’; bees, ‘in swarms’; corpses, ‘in heaps.’ Then in plenty, abundantly, enough; a(/lis de/ oi(, he has carried it ‘far enough’ already, Il. 9.376 ; h)= ou)x a(/lis o(/ti (w(s), is it not enough (and more than enough), etc.?

a(li/skomai (val.), pres. not in Homer, aor. h(/lw, subj. a(lw/w, opt. a(lw/|hn, a(loi/hn, inf. a(lw=nai, part. a(lou/s (a=(lo/nte, Il. 5.487): be taken, captured, of men, towns; met. qana/tw| a(lw=nai, and without qana/tw| of being ‘killed,’ ‘slain’ (cf. ai(re/w).
a)litai/nw, aor. h)/liton (Il. 9.375), a)lito/mhn, pf. part. a)lith/menos: sin against, tina/, or ti/ (Il. 24.586); qeoi=s a)lith/menos, a transgressor in the eyes of the gods, Od. 4.807.
a)lith/mwn, onos (a)litai/nw): sinning against, offending.
a)litro/s (a)litai/nw): sinner, offender; dai/mosin, ‘in the eyes of heaven;’ colloquially, ‘rogue,’ Od. 5.182.
*)alka/-qoos: son-in-law of Anchises.
*)alk - a/ndrh: wife of Polybus, in Egyptian Thebes, Od. 4.126†.
*)/alk-andros (cf. *)ale/candros): a Lycian, Il. 5.678.
a)/lkar (root alk): protection, defence, Il. 5.644 and Il. 11.823.

a)lkh/, h=s (root alk), dat. a)lki/, a)lkh=|: defence, defensive strength, valor, might; common phrases, qou/ridos a)lkh=s, a)lki\ pepoiqw/s, e)pieime/nos a)lkh/n. Joined with bi/h, me/nos, sqe/nos, h)nore/h. Personified, Il. 5.740.

*)/alkhstis (root alk, she averted death from her husband by dying for him, but this legend is not mentioned by Homer): Alcestis, daughter of Pelias, wife of Admetus of Pherae, and mother of Eumelus, Il. 2.715.
a)lki/: see a)lkh/.
*)alki - me/dwn: son of Laerces, a leader of the Myrmidons, and charioteer of Achilles after the death of Patroclus.
*)alkimi/dhs: son of Alcimus, Mentor, Od. 22.235†.
a)/lkimos (a)lkh/): efficient in defence, valiant, opp. deilo/s, Il. 13.278; freq. a)/lkimon h)=tor, also applied as epith. of weapons.
*)/alkimos: (1) father of Mentor.— (2) a Myrmidon, friend of Achilles.
*)alki/-noos: king of the Phaeacians in Scheria, a grandson of Poseidon, Od. 7.61 ff.
*)alk - i/pph: a slave of Helen at Sparta, Od. 4.124†.
*)alk - mai/wn: son of Amphiarāus and Eriph&ymacr;le, Od. 15.248†.
*)alk-ma=/wn: a Greek, the son of Thestor, Il. 12.394†.
*)alk-mh/nh: wife of Amphitryon in Thebes, mother of Heracles by Zeus, and of Iphicles by Amphitryon.
a)lkth/r, h=ros: defender against, averter.
*)alkuo/nh: a name given to Cleopatra, daughter of Idas and Marpessa, and wife of Meleager, Il. 9.562.
a)lkuw/n, o/nos: halcyon, a sea - bird with plaintive note, Il. 9.563†.

a)lla/ (a)/llos, cf. ceterum): but, nay but, but yet, yet; combined -a)ll' a)/ra, a)lla\ ga/r, a)ll) h)= (toi), a)lla/ te, a)lla\ kai\ w(=s, a)ll' ou)d) w(=s, etc.; very freq. after a negation (when a)/llos or e(/teros precedes, like ‘than,’ Il. 21.275), but also used like de/ correl. to me/n, and after concessive statements, yet, Il. 1.281; often in appeal, nay, Il. 1.32, and w. imp. or hortative subj., a)ll' i)/omen, esp. a)ll' a)/ge, a)/gete.
a)/llegen, a)lle/cai: see a)nale/gw.

a)/llh|: elsewhere, another way; of place (a)/llon a)/llh|, Od. 8.516), direction (a)/lludis a)/llh|), or manner (bou/lesqai, Il. 15.51); o(/ moi ge/ras e)/rxetai a)/llh|, goes ‘into other hands’ (than mine), Il. 1.120.
a)/llhktos: see a=)/lhktos.
a)ll-h/lwn (a)/llos, a)/llos), gen. du. a)llh/loiin, Il. 10.65: each other, one another, mutually.
a)llo/-gnwtos: known to others, i. e. foreign, Od. 2.366†.
a)llodapo/s: strange, foreign; also subst., stranger.
a)llo-eidh/s, or a)llo-i+dh/s, only neut. pl. a)llovveide/) or a)llovide/a: differentlooking, strange-looking, Od. 13.194† (cf. Od. 16.181).
a)/llo - qen: from elsewhere; ‘from abroad,’ Od. 3.318; a)/lloqen a)/llos, ‘one from one side, another from another.’
a)/llo-qi: elsewhere, ‘abroad;’ gai/hs, part. gen., ‘in the world,’ Od. 2.131, but with pa/trhs, gen. of separation, ‘far from,’ Od. 17.318.
a)llo/-qroos: speaking a strange tongue. (Od.)
a)lloi+dh/s: see a)lloeidh/s.
a(/llomai, aor. 2 and 3 pers. sing. a)=lso, a)=lto, subj. a(/lhtai, a(/letai, part. a(/lmenos: leap, spring; met. of an arrow ‘leaping’ from the string, Il. 4.125.
a)llo-pro/s-allos: changing from one to another, epith. of Ares, ‘fickle god,’ Il. 5.831 and 889.

a)/llos: other, another, (oi() a)/lloi, the rest; freq. in antithetical and reciprocal clauses, a)/llos me\n.. a)/llos de/, a)/lloqen a)/llos, etc.; very often idiomatic and untranslatable, e)/ktoqen a)/llwn | mnhsth/rwn, ‘from the others, the suitors,’ i. e. from the through of suitors, Od. 1.132. Phrases: a)/llo to/son, as much ‘more’; i)dw\n e)s plhsi/on a)/llon, with a look towards his next ‘neighbor’; e)/coxon a)/llwn, a)/llo de/ toi e)re/w (marking a transition), similarly a)/ll) (a)/llo) e)no/hse (a ‘new’ idea). In Od. 20.213, a)/lloi implies ‘strangers,’ i. e. other than the rightful owners; so ‘untrue’ (other than the true) is implied, Od. 4.348.
a)/llo-se: to another place, elsewhere, Od. 23.184 and 204.

a)/llo-te: at another time; hence ‘formerly,’ or ‘in the future’ (Il. 19.200); often in reciprocal and antithetic phrases, a)/llote a)/llw|, a)/llot' e)p) a)/llon, a)/llote me\n.. a)/llote de/ (au)=te), now.. then, now.. now.

a)llo/trios: of or belonging to another, strange; gai=a, a)llo/tria, ‘others' goods’; a)llo/trios fw=s, ‘foe - man’; gnaqmoi=si gelw/wn a)llotri/oisin, were laughing ‘with jaws as of other men’ (distorted faces), description of supernatural effects, Od. 20.347, cf. 351 ff.
a)/-llofos: see a)/lofos.
a)llo-frone/w: be abstracted, unconscious (Il. 23.698), only pres. part.
a)/lludis: to another place, always with a)/llos, or with a)/llh|, ‘now in one way, now in another,’ ‘now this way, now that.’
a)l-lu/esken, a)llu=/ousa: see a)nalu=/w.
a)/llws: otherwise; freq. implying ‘in vain’ (‘idly’), ‘besides,’ ‘for some other reason’ (Od. 17.577), ‘as it is’ (Od. 21.87), ‘better’ (Il. 5.218, Od. 8.176).
a(/lma (a(/llomai): leaping, as a contest, game, Od. 8.103 and 128.
a(/lmh (a(/ls): sea-water, brine. (Od.)
a(lmuro/s: only a(lmuro\n u(/dwr, salt water. (Od.)
a)-loge/w (a)/logos): be disregardful, fut., Il. 15.162 and 178.
a(lo/-qen: from the sea; e)c a(lo/qen, ‘from out the sea,’ Il. 21.335†.
a)loia/w (a)lwh/): thresh by treading, only ipf., gai=an xersi\n a)loi/a=, she smote the ground, Il. 9.568†.
a)loifh/ (a)lei/fw): ointment, grease, fat; rubbed into a bow of horn to render it pliant, Od. 21.179.
*)alo/ph: a town in the domain of Achilles, Il. 2.682†.
*)/alos: a town in the domain of Achilles, Il. 2.682†.
a(lo-su/dnh: child of the sea; Thetis, Il. 20.207; Amphitrīte, Od. 4.404.
a=)/-lofos, a)/llofos (lo/fos), a= before l: without plume; kune/h, Il. 10.258†. (See cut under lo/fos.)
a)/-loxos (le/xos): wife; epithets, mnhsth/, ai)doih, kudrh/, kednh/, polu/dwros.
a)lo/w, a)lo/wntai: see a)la/omai.
a(/ls (cf. sal): (1) m., salt, grain of salt, prov. ou)d' a(/la doi/hs, Od. 17.455; pl. a(/les, salt (as we say ‘salts’ in medicine), Od. 11.123, Od. 23.270.—(2) fem., the sea.
a)=lso: see a(/llomai.
a)/lsos, eos: grove (lucus), usually with an altar, and sacred to a divinity, Il. 2.506, Od. 6.321.
*)/alths: king of the Leleges, father of Laothoe, Il. 21.85.
a)=lto: see a(/llomai.
*)alu/ba=s, antos: feigned name of a place, with a play upon a)la/omai (‘Wanderley’), Od. 24.304†.
*)alu/bh: a country near Troy, productive of silver, Il. 2.857†.
a)luska/zw (stronger than a)lu/skw), only pres. and ipf.: skulk, seek to escape; abs., and with acc. of thing avoided.
a)luska/nw =a)luska/zw, ipf., Od. 22.330†.
a)lu/skw (a)leu/omai), fut. a)lu/cw, aor. h)/luca and a)/luca: shun, avoid, escape; abs., and with ti/, less freq. tina/, h)/luca e(tai/rous, ‘evaded their observation,’ Od. 12.335.
a)lu/ssw (a)lu/w): be frenizied, of dogs after tasting blood, Il. 22.70†.
a)/-lutos: not to be loosed, indissoluble.
a)lu=/w (cf. a)la/omai): wander in mind, be beside oneself, distraught, with pain, grief (Il. 24.12), or sometimes with joy (Od. 18.333); a)lu=/wn, ‘frantic with pain,’ Od. 9.398.
a)lfa/nw, only aor. h)=lfon, opt. a)/lfoi, 3 pl. a)/lfoin, Od. 20.383: yield, bring; mu=ri/on w)=non, ‘an immense price,’ Od. 15.453, cf. Il. 21.79.
*)alfeio/s: (1) a river in Arcadia and Elis (flowing past Olympia), Il. 2.592.— (2) the river-god Alphēüs, Od. 3.489.
a)lfesi/-boios (a)lfa/nw, bou=s): earning cattle, epith. of maidens, whose parents, when the daughter is married, receive presents of cattle from the bridegroom, Il. 18.593†. See e(/dna.
*)alweu/s, h=os (a)lwh/): father of Otus and Ephialtes, husband of Iphimedīa, Il. 5.386.
a)lwh/: threshing - floor (area), Il. 20.496; also orchard or vineyard, Il. 18.561. See gouno/s.
a(lw/h|, a(lw/|h, a(lw/menos: see a(li/skomai.
a)lw/menos: see a)la/omai.
a(lw/w: see a(li/skomai. a)/m, a)m: see a)na/.

a(/ma: (1) adv., at once, at the same time; a(/ma pa/ntes, a(/m' a)/mfw, Il. 7.255; freq. with te\.. kai/ (Il. 2.281), or with following de/, a(/ma mu=qos e)/hn, tete/lesto de\ e)/rgon, ‘no sooner said than done,’ Il. 19.242.—(2) prep. w. dat., at the same time with, along with, a(/m' h)eli/w| katadu/nti, a(/m) e(/pesqai, ‘attend,’ ‘accompany,’ a(/ma pnoi/h|s a)ne/moio, ‘swift as the winds,’ Od. 1.98, Il. 16.149.
*)amazo/nes: the Amazons, a warlike community of women, dwelling on the river Thermōdon in Pontus. They invaded Lycia, also Priam's realm in Phrygia, Il. 3.189, Il. 6.186.
*)ama/qeia: a Nereid, Il. 18.48†.
a)/maqos (ya/maqos): sand, Il. 5.587†.
a)maima/ketos: doubtful word, unconquerable, monstrous; epith. of the Chimaera, Il. 6.179 and Il. 16.329; of a floating mast, ‘huge,’ Od. 14.311.
a)maldu=/nw, aor. inf. a)maldu=nai, part. -u=/na=s, pass. pr. subj. a)maldu=/nhtai: crush, efface, tei=xos. (Il.)
a)mallo-deth/r, h=ros (a)/malla, de/w): binder of sheaves. Only in *s.
a)malo/s: tender, epith. of young animals.

a)/maca, a(/maca (a(/ma, a)/cwn): fourwheeled draught wagon, distinguished from the war - chariot (a(/rma), which had two wheels, Od. 9.251; also the constellation of the Great Bear (the Wain), Il. 18.487, Od. 5.273.
a)macito/s (a)/maca): wagon - road, strictly adj., sc. o(do/s, Il. 22.146†.
a)ma/rh: canal, ditch for irrigation, Il. 21.259†.

a(marta/nw, fut. a(marth/somai, aor. h(/marton and h)/mbroton: (1) miss, fail
to hit, tino/s, and abs., h)/mbrotes, ou)d' e)/tuxes, Il. 5.287; met., ‘mistake,’ ‘fail of,’ ‘lose’ (just as tuxei=n = ‘get’), Od. 7.292, Od. 9.512, Od. 21.155 ; ou)/ ti fi/lwn h(ma/rtane dw/rwn, ‘failed not to bring,’ Il. 24.68.—(2) err, do wrong, o(/te ke/n tis u(perbh/h| kai\ a(ma/rth|, Il. 9.501; au)to\s e)gw\ to/de h)/mbroton, ‘was guilty of this oversight,’ Od. 22.154.
a(marte/w: see o(marte/w.
a(marth=|, a(marth= (a(/ma, root ar): at once, together.
a(marto-eph/s, e/s (ve/pos): erring in word, rash-speaking, Il. 13.824†. Cf. a)famartoeph/s.
*)amarugkei/dhs: son of Amarynceus, Diōres, Il. 2.622, Il. 4.517.
*)amarugkeu/s, e/os: ruler of the Epeians at Buprasion in Messenia, Il. 23.630†.
a(ma-troxa/w: see troxa/w.
a(ma-troxi/h (tre/xw): running together, collision of chariots, pl., Il. 23.422†.
a)mauro/s: shadowy, darkling; ei)/dwlon a)mauro/n, Od. 4.824 and 835.
a)-maxhti/: without contest, Il. 21.437†.

a=/ma/w (cf. ‘mow,’ which orig. means to lay in heaps), ipf. h)/mwn, aor. part. a=/mh/santes, mid. a)mhsa/menos: mow, reap, Il. 18.551 ; a)p) (adv.) ou)/ata a=/mh/santes, ‘lopping off,’ Od. 21.300; mid. a)mhsa/menos, ‘collecting,’ ‘scooping up’ his curds, Od. 9.247.
a)mbai/nw, a)mba/llw: see a)nab-.
a)/m-batos (a)nabai/nw): to be ascended, scaled
a)m-blh/dhn (a)naba/llw): adv., with deep - fetched breath (= a)mbola/dhn), deeply, goo/wsa, Il. 22.476†. According to others, as prelude (a)naba/llomai), at first.
a)m-bola/dhn (a)naba/llw): adv., bubbling up, Il. 21.364†.
a)mbrosi/h (a)mbro/sios), adj. used as subst.: ambrosia; the food of the gods and of their steeds; also used as ointment, for embalming, for perfume.

a)mbro/sios (a)/mbrotos): ambrosial, divine; epith. of anything belonging to, pertaining to, or conceived as bestowed by the gods; xai=tai, Il. 1.529; ei)=dar (for their steeds), Il. 7.369, nu/c, u(/pnos.
a)/-mbrotos (broto/s): immortal, divine; qeo/s, Il. 20.358, and like a)mbro/sios (ai(=ma, teu/xea, nu/c, Od. 11.330).
a)-me/gartos (megai/rw): unenviable, dreadful; voc. as term of reproach, miserable, Od. 17.219.

a)mei/bw, fut. a)mei/yw, -omai, aor. h)mei/yato, a)mei/yato: I. act., change, exchange; tino/s ti pro/s tina (something with one for something else), Il. 6.235 ; o)li/gon go/nu gouno\s a)mei/bwn, ‘only a little changing knee for knee’ (in retreating slowly step by step), Il. 11.547; part. as subst., a)mei/bontes, ‘rafters’ of a house, Il. 23.712.—II. mid., change with each other, answer, pass; of responsive (‘amoebean’) singing, Il. 1.604; ‘alternating’ in the dance, Od. 8.379 ; qrw/skwn a)mei/betai, ‘springs alternately,’ Il. 15.684; ‘passing from house to house,’ Od. 1.375; ‘requiting’ one with gifts, Od. 24.285. In the sense of answer, very freq. the part. a)meibo/menos, ‘in reply,’ a)meibo/menos prose/eipen, h)mei/beto mu=/qw|.
a)-mei/liktos (meili/ssw): unsoftened, harsh, stern, relentless. (Il.)
a)mei/lixos = a)mei/liktos.
a)mei/nwn, on, irreg. comp. of a)gaqo/s: better. For implied meanings, see a)gaqo/s.
a)me/lgw, only pr. and ipf.: milk; pass., a)melgo/menai ga/la leuko/n, ‘yielding,’ Il. 4.434.
a)-mele/w, (me/lw), only aor. a)me/lhsa: neglect, forget; tino/s, always with negation.
a=)/menai: see a=)/w.
a)-menhno/s (me/nos): powerless, feeble, Il. 5.887; of the shades of the dead, neku/wn a)menhna\ ka/rhna, of dreams, ‘unsubstantial,’ Od. 19.562.
a)-menhno/w (a)menhno/s): make powerless, ineffective, only aor., Il. 13.562†.

a)-me/rdw (1) (me/ros), aor. h)/mersa, a)/mersa, inf. a)me/rsai, pass. pres. a)me/rdeai, aor. subj. a)merqh=|s: deprive of one's share, deprive, Od. 8.64; pass., be deprived of, forfeit, tino/s, *x 58, Od. 21.290.
a)-me/rdw (2) (ma/rmaros), only pres. and ipf.: dazzle, blind by excess of light, Il. 13.340; similarly, make lustreless, tarnish, e)/ntea ka/pnos a)me/rdei, Od. 19.18.
a)-me/trhtos (metre/w): immeasurable, Od. 19.512 and Od. 23.249.
a)-metro-eph/s (ve/pos): of unmeasured speech, Il. 2.212†.
a=/mhth/r, h=ros (a=/ma/w): reaper, pl., Il. 11.67†.
a=)/mhtos (a=)ma/w): reaping, harvest, metaph., Il. 19.223†.
a)-mhxani/h (a)mh/xanos): helplessness, despair, Od. 9.295†.

a)-mh/xanos (mhxanh/, mh=xos): (1) act., helpless, despairing, Od. 19.363.—(2) pass., of that with which one can do nothing, impossible, Il. 14.262 ; o)/neiroi, ‘inscrutable’, Od. 19.560 ; a)mh/xana e)/rga, ‘irreparable mischief,’ Il. 8.130; of persons, ‘impracticable,’ ‘unmanageable,’ Il. 10.167 ; a)mh/xano/s e)ssi piqe/sqai, ‘it is hopeless to expect you to comply,’ Il. 13.726.
*)amisw/daros: a king in Caria, father of Atymnius and Maris, Il. 16.328†.
a) - mitro - xi/twnes (mi/trh, xitw/n): without belt beneath their coat of mail (xitw/n), epith. of the Lycians, Il. 16.419†.
a)mixqalo/eis, essa: smoky, hazy; epith. of Lemnos, which is a volcanic island, Il. 24.753†.
a)/mme, a)/mmes, a)/mmi: see h(mei=s.
a)m-mi=/ca=s: see a)nami/gnu=mi.
a)-mmori/h (mo/ros): moi=ra/n t' a)mmori/hn te, all that is ‘fated and unfated,’ Od. 20.76†. Cf. a)/mmoros (2).

a)/-mmoros (mo/ros, moi=ra): (1) without share or portion, with gen., loetrw=n *)wkea/noio, said of the constellation of the Great Bear, which in Greek latitudes never sinks below the horizon, Od. 5.275, Il. 18.489.—(2) luckless, unhappy, Il. 6.408, Il. 24.773.
a)mni/on: basin for receiving the blood of sacrificial victims, Od. 3.444†. (See cut.)
*)amni=so/s: the port of Cnōsus in Crete, Od. 19.188†.
a)-moghti/ (moge/w): without trouble, Il. 11.637†.
a(mo/qen (a(mo/s, obsolete word = ei(=s, for ti\s): from somewhere; a(mo/qen ge, qea/, ei)pe/, ‘beginning at any point whatever,’ relate, Od. 1.10†.
a)moiba/s, a/dos (a)mei/bw): adj., for a change, xlai/nh, Od. 14.521†.
a)moibh/ (a)mei/bw): recompense, requital, gift in return. (Od.)
a)moibhdi/s: by turns, Il. 18.506 and Od. 18.310.
a)moibo/s (a)mei/bw): one who changes place with another, h)=lqon a)moiboi/ (as substitutes), Il. 13.793†.
a)molgo/s: doubtful word, always (e)n) nukto\s a)molgw=|, in the darkness of night, ‘at dead of night,’ as an indication of time.
*)amopa=/wn: a Trojan, son of Polypaemon, slain by Teucer, Il. 8.276†.
a(mo/s, a)mo/s = h(me/teros.
a)/moton: eagerly, vehemently; esp. with me/maa, klai/w, kexolwme/nos, tanu/onto.
a)mp-: see a)nap-.
a)mpelo/eis, essa, en (a)/mpelos): full of vines, vine - clad; of districts and towns. (Il.)
a)/mpelos, fem.: grape - vine, vine. (Od.)
a)m-pepalw/n: see a)napa/llw.
a)m-pere/s: always dia\ d' a)mpere/s, see diampere/s.
a)mp-e/xw (a)mfi/, e)/xw): surround, cover, a(/lmh a(/mpexen w)/mous, Od. 6.225†.
a)m-ph/dhse: see a)naphda/w.
a)m-pneu=sai, a)/m-pnue, a)m-pnu/nqh, a)/m-pnuto: see a)napne/w.
a)/mpuc, ukos (a)mpe/xw): head - band, worn by women, Od. 22.469. (See cut.)

a)mudi/s (a(/ma): Aeolic adv., at once. —(1) of place, together, in a mass, kaqi/zein, kiklh/skein, etc., pa/nt' a)mudi/s, m 413, Il. 12.385.—(2) of time, at once, immediately, Il. 23.217, Od. 14.305; at the same time, Od. 5.467.
*)amudw/n: a city of the Paeonians, on the river Axius, in Macedonia, Il. 2.849 and Il. 16.288.
*)amuqa=/wn: son of Cretheus and Tyro, father of Bias and Melampus, Od. 11.259†.
*)amu/klai: a city in Laconia, near the Eurotas, 20 stadia S.E. of Sparta, and the residence of Tyndareus, Il. 2.584†.

a)-mu=/mwn, onos (mwmos): blameless, excellent, both of persons and things, o(\s d' a)\n a)mu=/mwn au)to\s e)/h| kai\ a)mu=/mona ei)dh=|, Od. 19.332 (opp. a)phnh/s, 329); often to mark personal appearance or nobility of birth, and sometimes without regard to moral excellence, a)mu=/monos *ai)gi/sqoio, Od. 1.29; qeou= e)s a)mu=/mona nh=son (‘faultless’ isle, because it belonged to the god), Od. 12.261.
a)mu=/ntwr, oros (a)mu=/nw): defender, protector.
*amu=/ntwr: son of Ormenus, father of Phoenix, Il. 9.448, Il. 10.266.

a)mu=/nw, inf. a)mu=ne/men, -e/menai, aor. h)/mu=ne, a)/mu=ne, opt. a)mu=/nai, inf. a)mu=nai, imp. a)/mu=non, mid. ipf. a)mu=/neto, h)mu=/nonto, aor. opt. a)mu=nai/mhn: I. act., ward off, defend; abs., tini/, Il. 5.486; freq. tini/ ti (dat. of interest, though we say ‘from’), less often tino/s ti, Il. 4.11; also merely ti/, and tino/s, a)po/ or peri/ tinos, of the person or thing defended, Il. 13.109, Od. 2.59, Il. 17.182.—II. mid., ward off from oneself, defend oneself or what is one's own, with the same constructions as the act.; ei(=s oi)wno\s a)/ristos, a)mu=/nesqai peri\ pa/trhs, ‘to fight in defence of our country,’ Il. 12.243.
a)mu/ssw, ipf. a)/mussen, fut. a)mu/ceis: scratch, tear, sth/qea xersi/n, Il. 19.284; met., qu=mo\n a)mu/ceis, ‘shalt rend’ thy soul, Il. 1.243.
a)mf - agapa/zw, ipf. a)mfaga/pazon, mid. -o/menos: embrace lovingly, greet warmly, of entertaining guests, Il. 16.192, Od. 14.381.
a)mf-agei/romai: gather around, only aor. 2, qeai\ de/ min a)mfage/ronto, Il. 18.37†.
a)m-fadi/hn (a)mfa/dios): adv., openly, publicly.
a)m-fa/dios (a)nafai/nw): open, public, ‘regular,’ ga/mos, Od. 6.288.

a)m-fado/n and a)m-fada/ (a)nafai/nw): adv., openly, publicly; opp. krufhdo/n, Od. 14.330; bale/ein, ‘in regular battle,’ Il. 7.243 (opp. la/qrh|); a)mfada\ e)/rga ge/noito, ‘be revealed,’ ‘come to light,’ Od. 19.391.
a)mf - arabe/w: only aor., teu/xea/ t' a)mfara/bhse, clattered about him, Il. 21.408†.
a)m-fasi/h (fa/nai): speechlessness, w. obj. gen. e)pe/wn, *r 695, Od. 4.704.

a)mf-afa/w, part. a)mfafo/wn, -o/wsa, mid. inf. -a/asqai, ipf. -o/wnto: feel about, handle, esp. to test or examine something; tri\s de\ peri/steicas koi=lon lo/xon a)mfafo/wsa (Helen walks around the Trojan horse and ‘feels over’ it, while the Greeks are concealed within), Od. 4.277; of examining a necklace, xersi/n t' a)mfafo/wnto, Od. 15.462.
a)mf-epota=to: see a)mfipota/omai.
a)mf-e/pw: see a)mfie/pw.
a)mf-e/rxomai: come about, ‘sound’ or ‘rise about,’ of sound or savor ‘stealing over’ one, ‘meeting the senses,’ only aor. a)mfh/luqe, z 122, Od. 12.369. (Od.)
a)mf-e/xane: see a)mfixai/nw.
a)mf-e/xut): see a)mfixe/w.
a)mf-h/khs, a)/mfhkes (root ak): twoedged, of a sword, Od. 16.80.
a)mf-h/luqe: see a)mfe/rxomai.
a)mf-hrefh/s, e/s (e)re/fw): covered at both ends, close-covered, closed, Il. 1.45†.
a)mf-h/ristos (e)ri/zw): contested on both sides, doubtful, victory (or victor), Il. 23.382†.

a)mfi/ (cf. a)mfi/s, a)/mfw): on both sides; the distinction between a)mfi/ and peri/ (‘around’) is of course not always observed; the two words are used together, o)/xqai d' a)mfi\ peri\ me/gal) i=)/axon, ‘round about,’ Il. 21.10, but on the other hand are sometimes interchangeable, a)mfi\ de\ ku=ane/hn ka/peton, peri\ d' e(/rkos e)/lassen | kassite/rou, Il. 18.564; cf. Il. 23.561 f.—I. adv., on both sides (or ends, or above and below, Il. 6.115), about, around; here belongs the so-called use ‘in tmesi,’ and in many instances where the word seems to govern a subst., it is really adverbial,
and the case of the subst. must be explained independently, a)mf' o)beloi=sin e)/peiran (o)b. dat. instr.), a)mfi\ de\ xai=tai | w)/mois a=/i=/ssontai (w)/m. local dat.).
