In case of an apparent ambiguity of construction the presumption is in favor of adverbial interpretation in Homer.—II. prep., (1) w. gen., about, concerning; a)mfi/ tinos ma/xesqai (Il. 16.825), a)ei/dein (Od. 8.267).—(2) w. dat., (a) local, Il. 2.388, Il. 3.328 ; h)/ripe d' a)mf), au)tw=|, ‘over,’ Il. 4.493 ; th\n ktei=ne a)mf' e)moi/, ‘near,’ Od. 11.423, Il. 9.470 ; a)mfi\ puri/, ‘on,’ etc.—(b) causal, ‘for,’ a)mfi/ tini a)/lgea pa/sxein, ma/xesqai, dika/zesqai, ei)/resqai (Od. 19.95), ‘as regards’ (Il. 7.408). —(3) w. acc., local, mostly to denote motion or extension in space, a)mf' a(/la e)/lsai *)axaiou/s, Il. 1.409; a)mfi\ a)/stu e)/rdein i=(ra/, ‘around in,’ Il. 11.706 ; oi( a)mfi\ *pri/amon, ‘Priam and his followers.’
*)amfi/-alos: a Phaeacian, Od. 8.114.
a)mfi/-alos: sea-girt. (Od.)

*)amfi-a/ra=os: a seer and warrior of Argos, son of Oecles, great grandson of the seer Melampus. Through the treachery of his wife Eriph&ymacr;le, who was bribed by Polynīces with the gift of a golden necklace, he was forced to meet his death by joining the expedition of the Seven against Thebes, Od. 15.244.
a)mf-ia/xw: only part. with termination of perf., a)mfiaxui=an, as she flew screaming about, Il. 2.316†.

a)mfi-bai/nw, perf. a)mfibe/bhkas, -ke, subj. a)mfibebh/kh|, plup. a)mfibebh/kei: go (perf. stand) about or over, surround, with acc. or dat.; h)e/lios me/son ou)rano\n a)mfibebh/kei (‘had reached mid-heaven in its round,’ i. e. stood at the zenith), Il. 8.68; *trw/wn ne/fos a)mfibe/bhke | nhusi/n, Il. 16.66; a)/xos fre/nas a)mfibe/bhken, ‘has overwhelmed,’ Od. 8.541; met., protect (the figure from an animal standing over its young), a)rguro/toc), o(\s *xru=/shn a)mfibe/bhkas, Il. 1. 37, Od. 9.198.

a)mfi - ba/llw, aor. 2 part. a)mfiba- lw/n, mid. fut. a)mfibaleu=mai, aor. inf. a)mfibale/sqai: I. act., throw about, embrace; tw=| d' e)gw\ a)mfibalw\n qa/lamon de/mon (i. e. the chamber was built around the tree), Od. 23.192 ; a)mfibalo/nte a)llh/lous, Il. 23.97; kre/as, w(/s oi( xei=res e)xa/ndanon a)mfibalo/nti (as much as his hands could hold ‘in their elasp’), Od. 17.344; met., kra/teron me/nos a)mfibalo/ntes (cf. e)pie/nnu=mi), Il. 17.742.—Il. mid., throw about oneself, do\s de\ r(a/kos a)mfibale/sqai, z 178, Od. 22.103.
a)mfi/-basis: protection, sc. nekrou=, Il. 5.623†.
a)mfi/-brotos: man-protecting (reaching from head to foot, cf. Il. 6.117), a)spi/s. (Il.) (See cut.)
*)amfi - ge/neia: a town subject to Nestor, Il. 2.593†.
a)mfi-guh/eis (gui=on): strong in both arms (ambidexter), epith. of Hephaestus, usually as subst., Il. 1.607, Od. 8.300.
a)mfi/-guos (gui=on): with limb at both ends, double-pointed, e)/gxos. Cf. ou)ri/axos. (See cuts below.)
a)mfi-dai/w: kindle about, only perf. intr. (and fig.), po/lemos a)/stu a)mfide/dhe, blazes round, Il. 6.329†.
*)amfi-da/ma=s, antos: (1) from Cythēra, Il. 10.268.—(2) from Opus, Il. 23.87.
a)mfi/-dasus, seia (dasu/s): shaggy all around, thick - fringed, epith. of the Aegis, Il. 15.309†.
a)mfi-di=ne/w: twirl about; only perf. pass., xeu=ma kassite/roio a)mfidedi/nhtai, a casting of tin ‘is run around,’ Il. 23.562; of the scabbard ‘enclosing’ a sword, Od. 8.405.
a)mfi-drufh/s (dru/ptw): with both cheeks torn (from grief), Il. 2.700†.
a)mfi/-drufos (dru/ptw): torn on both sides, ‘both torn’ (from grief), pareiai/, Il. 11.393†.
a)mfi/-dumos: double, only pl., lime/nes (on both sides of the island), Od. 4.847†.
a)mfi-e/lissa (veli/ssw): curved at both ends, curving, epith. of ships. (See cut.)

a)mfi-ennu=mi (ve/nnu=mi), fut. a)mfie/sw, aor. a)mfi/es(s)a, mid. aor. a)mfie/santo, imp. a)mfie/sasqe, pres. and ipf. not in Homer: put on clothing; act., on another, Od. 5.167; with two accusatives, Od. 15.369; mid., on oneself, don, Od. 23.131.

a)mfi-e/pw, a)mf-e/pw (e(/pw), only part. a)mfie/pwn and ipf.: move round, envelop, ga/strhn tri/podos pu=r a)/mfepe, Il. 18.348; of persons, be busy about, in preparing meat, attending to sacrifices, etc., w(/s oi(/ g' a)mfi/epon ta/fon *(/ektoros, Il. 24.804; freq. the part. in connection with another verb, a)mfie/pontes, busily.
a)mf-iza/nw: settle upon, only ipf., Il. 18.25†.
a)mfi-qalh/s, e/s (qa/llw): flourishing on both sides, epith. of a child whose father and mother are still living, Il. 22.496†.
*)amfi-qe/h: wife of Autolycus, grandmother of Odysseus, Od. 19.416†.
a)mfi/-qetos (ti/qhmi): to be placed both ways, reversible, fia/lh, probably with double base and bowl, Il. 23.270, 616. Cf. a)mfiku/pellon.
a)mfi - qe/w: run about, with acc., Od. 10.413†.
*)amfi-qo/h: a Nereid, Il. 18.42†.

a)mfi - kalu/ptw, fut. a)mfikalu/yw, aor. a)mfeka/luya, subj. a)mfikalu/yh|: cover round, hide; often tini/ ti, the acc. of the thing used to cover with, kai/ oi( sa/kos a)mfeka/luyen, *q 331, Od. 8.569; met., of sleep, death, feelings, e)/rws fre/nas a)mfeka/luye, ‘engrossed my heart,’ Il. 3.442.
a)mfi-karh/s, e/s (ka/ra): double-headed; a)mfikarh= sfe/la (for the feet of two persons), v. l. for a)mfi\ ka/rh, Od. 17.231.
*)/amfi - klos: a Trojan, slain by Achilles, Il. 16.313†.
a)mfi/-komos (ko/mh): surrounded by foliage, leafy, Il. 17.677†.

a)mfi-ku/pellon, de/pas: double-cupped goblet, whose base is bowl-shaped and adapted to drink from. Cf. a)mfi/qetos. (The above is the explanation of Aristotle, Hist. An. xix., 40; but no specimens of the form described have been found amongst antique remains or representations.)
*)amfi/ - loxos: a seer of Argos, son of Amphiarāus and Eriph&ymacr;le, Od. 15.248†.
a)mfi - lu/kh (root luk, lux): with doubtful light; nu/c, i. e., neither day nor night, twi-light of dawn, Il. 7.433†.
a)mfi-mai/omai, only aor. imp. a)mfima/sasqe: seek about with the hands, hence wipe off all over, spo/ggoisi, Od. 20.152†.
*)amfi/-maxos: (1) son of Cteatus, a leader of the Eleans, Il. 13.203.—(2) son of Nomion, a leader of the Carians, Il. 2.870.
*)amfi-me/dwn: a suitor of Penelope, son of Melaneus, slain by Telemachus, Od. 22.242.
a)mfi-me/la=s, aina: black round about, only fre/nes a)mfime/lainai, ‘darkened heart,’ said with reference to the effect of passion (anger, grief, warlike impulse), Il. 1.103, Il. 17.83, 573.

a)mfi-mu=ka/omai: bellow round; only perf., da/pedon d' a(/pan a)mfime/mu=ken,
‘moans round about,’ i. e., echoes with the sound of the loom and the voice within, Od. 10.227.
a)mfi - ne/momai, only pres. and ipf.: dwell around, or dwell around in, Il. 2.521, Od. 19.132.
*)amfi-no/mh: a Nereid, Il. 18.44.
*)amfi/-nomos: a suitor of Penelope, son of Nīsus, from Dūlichium, slain by Telemachus, Od. 22.89.
a)mfi - ce/w: hew around about, only aor., Od. 23.196†.
*)/amfi=os: (1) a Trojan chief, son of Merops, Il. 2.830.—(2) son of Selagus, from Paesus, an ally of the Trojans, Il. 5.612.
a)mfi-pe/lomai: be about one, a)kouo/ntessi newta/th a)mfipe/lhtai, the newest song to ‘meet their ears,’ Od. 1.352†. Cf. a)mfie/rxomai.

a)mfi-pe/nomai, only pres. and ipf.: work about, attend (to), tend; of persons, esp. the sick or wounded, sometimes of things, Il. 19.278; ironically, to\n i)/xques a)mfepe/nonto, ‘were at work around him,’ Il. 21.203, Il. 23.184.
a)mfiperi/: see a)mfi/.
a)mfi-peri-ste/fw: see periste/fw.
a)mfi-peri-strwfa/w: see peristrwfa/w.
a)mfi - pi=/ptw: fall about, only aor. part., gunh/ po/sin a)mfipesou=sa, ‘falling upon (and embracing) the body’ of her lifeless husband, Od. 8.523†.

a)mfi/-polos (pe/lomai): female attendant, handmaid; a)mfi/polos tami/h, a)mfi/poloi gunai=kes, but regularly subst.; the noble dame of the heroic period is constantly attended by one or more of her maids when she appears in public, Od. 1.331; distinguished from dmwai/, Od. 22.483 f.
a)mfi-pone/omai, fut. a)mfiponh/somai: labor about, attend to, ti/, tina/, Il. 23.159, 681, Od. 20.307. Cf. a)mfipe/nomai.
a)mfi-pota/omai: flutter about, only ipf., a)mfepota=to te/kna, Il. 2.315†.
a)mfi/-rutos (r(e/w): sea-girt. (Od.)

a)mfi/s (cf. a)mfi/, a)/mfw): I. adv., on both sides, apart, in two ways; ‘with both hands’ at once (Il. 21.162), gai=an kai\ ou)rano\n a)mfi\s e)/xousin (Od. 1.54), ‘separately’ (Od. 22.57), a)mfi\s fra/zesqai, ‘be at variance,’ Il. 2.13.—II. prep., mostly following its case, (1) w. gen., all round, apart from, away from, Il. 2.384 ; a)mfi\s o(dou=, Il. 23.393.—(2) w. acc., about, around, a)mfi\s e(/kaston (a)mfi\ ve(kaston), Il. 11.634, Od. 6.266, Il. 14.274.

a)mf-i/sthmi, aor. 2 a)mfe/sthn, 3 pl. a)mfe/stan (for -e/sthsan), pass. ipf. a)mfi/stato, -stanto: place around, pass. and intr., stand around, Il. 18.233, Il. 24.712 ; a)/stu, ‘beleaguer,’ Il. 11.733.
a)mfi-strata/omai: besiege, only ipf., a)mfestrato/wnto, Il. 11.713†.
a)mfi-strefh/s (stre/fw): turning all ways, Il. 11.40†.
a)mfi-ti/qhmi, mid. aor. 2 a)mfe/qeto, pass. aor. part. a)mfiteqei=sa: put around; kune/h, encircling the head, Il. 10.271 ; ci/fos, ‘gird on,’ Od. 21.431.
*)amfi-tri=/th (cf. *tri/twn): Amphitrīte, goddess of the sea, personifying the element, kuanw=pis, a)ga/stonos, Od. 12.60, 97; meta\ ku=/masin *)amfitri/ths, Od. 3.91.
a)mfi-trome/w: tremble for, w. gen., Od. 4.820†.
*)amfi-tru/wn: king of Tiryns, husband of Alcmēna and reputed father of Heracles, Il. 5.392, Od. 3.266.
a)mfi/-falos (fa/los): double-ridged, double-crested, of a helmet with divided crest. (Il.)
a)mfi-fobe/w: put to flight around one, only aor. pass., Il. 16.290†.
a)mfi-foreu/s, h=os (fe/rw); for a)mforeu/s: two-handled vase or jar for wine; also used as urn for ashes of the dead, Od. 24.74. (See cuts 6 and 7.)
a)mfi-xai/nw: yawn about, only aor. 2, e)me\ kh\r a)mfe/xane, has ‘engulfed’ me, Il. 23.79†.

a)mfi-xe/omai (xe/w), ipf. a)mfexeo/mhn, aor. 2 a)mfexu/mhn, a)mfe/xuto, pass. aor. a)mfexu/qhn: pour or be diffused or shed around, embrace; pa/ros ko/nin a)mfixuqh=nai, before the dust (stirred by the feet of Ajax immediately in advance) could ‘pour (rise) round’ him (Odysseus), Il. 23.763 ; a)mfixuqei\s pate/ra, Od. 16.214, a)mfexe/onto (‘thronged around’) kai\ h)spa/zont' *)odush=a, Od. 22.498; metaph., of sounds (Il. 2.41), feelings (Od. 4.716), sleep (Il. 14.253).
a)mfixuqei/s, -h=nai: see a)mfixe/omai.
a)mfi/-xutos (xe/w): poured (spread) around, demolished, of an earthen wall, Il. 20.145†.

*)amfi=/wn: (1) son of Iasius, and king of Orchomenus in Boeotia, Od. 11.283.—(2) son of Zeus and Antiope, husband of Niobe, and brother of Zethus, with whom he built the walls of Thebes, Od. 11.262.—(3) a leader of the Epeians, Il. 13.692.

a)mfo/teros (a)/mfw): both; sing. only neut. as adv., foll. by te/.. kai/, etc., a)mfo/teron basileu/s t' a)gaqo\s kra/tero/s t) ai)xmhth/s, ‘at once both,’ etc., Il. 3.179, Il. 13.166, Od. 15.78; as subst., a)mfote/rh|si (sc. xersi/), Il. 5.416, Od. 10.264.
*)amfo/teros: a Lycian, slain by Patroclus, Il. 16.415†.
a)mfote/rw - qen: from or on both sides, at both ends.
a)mfote/rw-se: in both directions.
a)mf-oudi/s: adv. with the sense of a)mf' ou)/dei, on the ground (specifying pro\s gh=n), Od. 17.237†.
a)m-fra/ssaito: see a)nafra/zomai.
a)/mfw: both, whether of individuals or of parties, Il. 1.363, Il. 2.124; ‘the two pieces’ (defined by what follows), Od. 12.424.

a)/n (1): modal adv., indicating a condition; essentially equivalent to ke/n, and of less frequent occurrence. The use of a)/n is less exactly defined in Homer than in Attic Greek; besides the regular usages in Attic (viz. in conclusions expressed by the secondary tenses of the ind., and by the opt., or by the inf. representing these, and joined to ei) or relative words, e)a/n, o(/tan, etc., in conditional clauses that take the subjunctive), Homer employs a)/n with the subj. in independent sentences, and ke/ (rarely a)/n) with the fut. indicative. In final clauses the use of a)/n or ke/ prevails, and is not uncommon even with the opt. in conditions. On the other hand the potential opt. occurs without a)/n (ke/) oftener than in Attic. The following examples will illustrate the most important of these peculiarities of usage:—(1) a)/n w. subj. in independent sentence, ou)k a)/n toi xrai/smh| ki/qaris, ‘perchance the harp may avail thee not,’ Il. 3.54, cf. Il. 1.205.— (2) a)/n w. fut. ind., au)to
 d' a)
 pu/mato/n me ku/nes.. e)ru/ousi, e)pei/ ke<*> tis ktl., ‘me like enough last of all will dogs drag about, after I am slain,” etc., Il. 22.66.—(3) a)/n w. opt. in final clause, su\ de/ me proi+/eis.. o)/fr' a)
 e(loi/mhn dw=ra, Od. 24.334.—(4) a)/n w. opt. in condition, steu=to ga eu)xo/menos ni=kh/semen, ei)/per a)
 au)tai\ | *mou=sai a)ei/doien, Il. 2.597.
a)n- (2): negative prefix, the original form of the so-called a ‘privative,’ a still fuller form being a)na-, preserved in a)na/vednos. Cf. Lat. in-, Eng. ‘un-.’
a)/n, a)n (3): by apocope for a)na/, before n (Il. 10.298), before t (Il. 5.167), before sto/ma (Od. 5.456); and in a)\n de/ (sc. w)/rnuto), Il. 3.268, Il. 23.709, 755, 812, Od. 8.110, 115, 118.

a)na/, by apocope a)/n (a)n), before labials a)/m (a)m): up, opp. kata/.—I. adv., a)/na (with anastrophe), hortative, up! quick! Il. 18.178, Od. 18.13; up there, thereon, me/lanes d' a)na\ bo/trues h)=san, Il. 18.562; back, a)na/ t' e)/drau) o)pi/ssw, Il. 5.599, a)na\ d) i)/sxeo, ‘hold up,’ ‘refrain,’ Il. 7.110. The use with verbs ‘in tmesi’ is of course adverbial; likewise when a subst, occurs in a case that defines the adv. (thus showing the transition to a
true preposition), a)
 d' a)/ra *thle/maxos nho\s bai=ne (nho/s local or part. gen.), Od. 2.416.—II. prep., (1) w. gen., only a)na\ nho\s e)/bhn, Od. 9.177, see the remark on Od. 2.416 above.—(2) w. dat., up on, upon, Il. 1.15, Il. 15.152, a)na/ t' a)llh/lh|sin e)/xontai, hold on (close up) ‘to’ one another, Od. 24.8.—(3) w. acc., up to, up through, Il. 10.466, Od. 22.132, Il. 22.452; of motion, a)na/ generally denotes vague direction (up and down, ‘up through,’ ‘throughout’), e)nnh=mar me
 a)na\ strato
 w)/xeto kh=la qeoi=o, Il. 1.53, whereas kata/ rather indicates motion toward a definite point or end (Il. 1.483, 484); with the idea of motion less prominent, Il. 13.117, 270; of time, a)na\ nu/kta, Il. 14.80; basilh=as a)na\ sto/m' e)/xwn, ‘bandying their names up and down,’ Il. 2.250 ; a)na\ qu=mo
 fronei=n, o(rmai/nein, qambei=n, o)i/esqai, Il. 2.36, Od. 2.156, Od. 4.638; a)n' i=)qu=/n, ‘straight forward,’ Il. 21.303; following the governed word, neio
 a)n(a/), ‘up and down’ the field, Od. 13.32.
a)/na (1): see a)na/, I.
a)/na (2): see a)/nac.

a)na - bai/nw, a)mbai/nw, aor. a)ne/bhn, mid. aor. a)nebh/seto, aor. 1 part. a)nabhsa/menoi: go up, ascend (to), ou)rano/n, u(perw/ion, etc.; fa/tis a)nqrw/pous a)na bai/nei, ‘goes abroad among’ men, Od. 6.29; esp. go on board ship, embark, Il. 1.312 and often, e)s *troi/hn a)nabhme/nai, ‘embark for Troy,’ Od. 1.210; trans., aor. 1 mid., nw\ a)nabhsa/menoi, ‘taking us on board their ship,’ Od. 15.475.

a)na-ba/llw, a)mba/llw: throw up.— I. act., postpone, a)/eqlon, Od. 19.584.—II. mid., (1) ‘strike up’ a prelude, w. inf., formi/zwn a)neba/lleto kalo\n a)ei/dein, Od. 1.155, cf. Od. 17.262.—(2) postpone for oneself, e)/rgon, Il. 2.436.
a)na-be/bruxen: defective perf., bubbles up, Il. 17.54† (v. l. a)nabe/broxen).
*)ana - bhsi/-ne us: a Phaeacian, Od. 8.113†.
a)na/-blhsis (a)naba/llw): postponement. (Il.)
a)na-braxei=n, only aor. 3 sing. a)ne/braxe: of armor (clanged), Il. 19.13; of a door (‘groaned’), h)u/te tau=ros, Od. 21.48. Cf. braxei=n.
a)na-bro/xw, only aor. opt. a)nabro/ceie, and aor. 2 pass. part. a)nabroxe/n: gulp back (again), of Charybdis, her whirlpool, Od. 12.240, Od. 11.586.

a)na-gignw/skw, only aor. 2 a)ne/gnwn: know for certain, know again, recognize, Od. 1.216, Od. 4.250, Od. 19.250, Il. 13.734 ; pw=s ke/n me a)nagnoi/h to\n e)o/nta, ‘how can she know me for that one?’ (i. e. for her son), Od. 11.144.
a)nagkai/h (= a)na/gkh): necessity, constraint; dat., perforce, Il. 4.300 ; a)nagkai/hfi dame/ntes, Il. 20.143.

a)nagkai=os, h, on (a)na/gkh): constraining; mu=qos, command ‘of force,’ Od. 17.399, xreiw/, ‘dire’ need, Il. 8.57; esp. with reference to slavery, h)=mar a)nagkai=on (= dou/lion h)=mar), Il. 16.836, dmw=es a)nagkai=oi, ‘bond’ servants, Od. 24.210 ; polemistai/, warriors ‘perforce,’ Od. 24.499.

a)na/gkh: necessity, constraint; freq. a)na/gkh (e)sti/n, h)=n) foll. by inf., Il. 5.633, Il. 24.667, krate/rh d' e)pikei/set) a)na/gkh, ‘stern necessity,’ Il. 6.458; often a)na/gkh|, kai\ a)na/gkh|, ‘even against his will,’ u(p' a)na/gkhs, ‘by compulsion.’
a)na - gna/mptw, only aor. act. a)ne/gnamyan and pass. a)negna/mfqh: bend back; of undoing a prisoner's fastenings, Od. 14.348.

a)n-a/gw, fut. a)na/cw, aor. 3 a)nh/gagon: lead or bring up or back (Il. 15.29); from the coast to the interior, Od. 4.534, etc.; of ‘carrying away’ in general, esp. over the sea, gunai=k' eu)eide/) a)nh=ges | e)c a)pi/hs gai/hs, Il. 3.48, or of ‘carrying home,’ Od. 3.272; mid., put to sea (opp. kata/gesqai), Il. 1.478, Od. 19.202.
a)na-de/drome: see a)natre/xw.
a)na-de/rkomai: look up, only aor., a)ne/draken o)fqalmoi=sin, ‘opened his eyes,’ Il. 14.436†.
a)na - de/smh (a)nade/w): head - band, plekth/, Il. 22.469†. (See cut.)
a)na-de/xomai, aor. 1 a)nedeca/mhn, sync. aor. 2 a)nede/gmhn: receive, Il. 5.619; metaph., undergo, o)izu=/n, Od. 17.563.

a)na - du/omai, a)ndu/omai (du/w), aor. 2 a)ne/du=n, opt. a)nadu/h (vulg., -du/h|), inf. a)nadu=nai, mid. aor. a)nedu=/seto: (1) emerge; a(lo/s, ‘from the sea,’ Il. 1.359, li/mnhs, Od. 5.337; with acc., ku=ma qala/sshs, ‘arose to the wave,’ surface, Il. 1.496.—(2) draw back; abs., Od. 9.377, e)s o(/mi=lon, Il. 7.217; trans., po/lemon, ‘back out of,’ Il. 13.225.
a)na/-ednos (ve/dna, see a)n-, 2): without bridal gifts. Cf. e(/dna. (Il.)

a)n-aei/rw (=a)nai/rw), aor. 1 a)na/eire, inf. a)naei<*>rai: lift up, Od. 8.298; said of wrestlers who try to ‘pick each other up,’ Il. 23.724, 725, 729; of ‘carrying off’ a prize received, Il. 23.614, 778.
a)na-qhle/w (qa/llw): bloom again, fut., Il. 1.236†.
a)na/-qhma (a)nati/qhmi): only a)naqh/mata daito/s, delights, glories of the feast (song and dance). (Od.)
a)na-qrw/skw: bound up, of a stone rolling down hill, only part., Il. 13.140†.
a)n-aidei/h (a)naidh/s): shamelessness, impudence.
a)n-ai/mwn, onos (ai(=ma): bloodless, Il. 5.342†.
a)n-aimwti=/ (ai(=ma): without bloodshed.

a)nai/nomai, ipf. a)nai/neto, aor. a)nh/nato, h)nh/nato, subj. a)nh/nhtai, inf. a)nh/nasqai: deny, refuse; in both senses w. inf., Il. 18.500, 450; governs both persons and things, se\ d' a)nai/netai h)de\ sa\ dw=ra, Il. 9.679; opp. u(pode/xesqai, Il. 7.93.

a)n-aire/w, aor. 2 part. a)nelw/n, mid. fut. a)nairh/somai, aor. 2 a)neilo/mhn, a)nelo/mhn: take up; mid., for oneself, or what is one's own, Il. 13.296; ‘into one's service,’ h)= a)/r k' e)qe/lois qhteue/men, ei)/ s) a)neloi/mhn, Od. 18.357; in bad sense, kou/ra=s a)ne/lonto qu/ellai, ‘snatched away,’ Od. 20.66.
a)n - a=i=/ssw, aor. a)nh/i=ca: dart up, spring up; phgai/, Il. 22.148; w. acc. of end of motion, a(/rma, Il. 24.440. Cf. a=)i=/ssw.
a)n-ai/tios (ai)ti/a=): guiltless, innocent.
a)na-kai/w: kindle, only ipf. (Od.)
a)na - khki/w: gush up or forth, of blood and sweat. (Il.)

a)na-kli=/nw, aor. a)ne/kli=na, part. a)nakli=/na=s and a)gkli=/na=s, pass. aor. part. a)naklinqei/s, -qei=sa, -qe/ntes: make to lean back or upon; tina\ pro/s ti (Od. 18.103), to/con poti\ gai/h|, ‘bracing against the ground,’ Il. 4.113; of doors, open (opp. e)piqei=nai), Il. 8.395, Od. 22.156, Od. 11.525; pass., lean or sink back, a)naklinqei\s pe/sen u(/ptios, Od. 9.371; eu(=den a)naklinqei=sa, Od. 4.794; in rowing, Od. 13.78.
a)n-akonti/zw: shoot up or forth, of blood, Il. 5.113†.
a)na - ko/ptw: strike back, ‘shoot back,’ of door-bolts, Od. 21.47†.
a)na-kra/zw, aor. a)ne/kragon: screech out (said purposely with exaggeration), Od. 14.467†.
a)na-krema/nnu=mi, aor. part. a)gkrema/sa=sa: hang up, Od. 1.440†.
a)nakto/rios (a)na/ktwr): belonging to the master, u(/es, Od. 15.397†.
a)na-kumbalia/zw (ku/mbalon, ‘cymbal’): fell rattling over, ipf., Il. 16.379†.
a)na-le/gw, ipf. a)/llegon, aor. inf. a)lle/cai: gather up, o)ste/a. (Il.)
a)n-alkei/h (a)lkh/): want of valor; only a)nalkei/h|si dame/ntes, overcome by their cowardice. (Il.)
a)/n-alkis, idos, acc. -ida (-in, Od. 3.375): invalorous, cowardly.
a)/n-altos (root al, alere): insatiable. (Od.)
a)na-lu=/w, a)llu=/w, part. a)llu=/ousa, ipf. iter. a)llu=/esken, aor. a)ne/lu=san, mid. fut. a)nalu=/setai: unite, unravel. (Od.)
a)na - maima/w (cf. me/maa): rage through, tu=r, Il. 20.490†.

a)na-ma/ssw: wipe off, me/ga e)/rgon, o(\ sh=| kefalh=| a)nama/ceis (fig. from the custom of murderers wiping off the bloody weapon upon the head of the slain, as if to divert their guilt upon the victim himself; hence, here = ‘shalt atone for with thine own life’ (cf. Od. 22.218), Od. 19.92†.
a)na-me/nw, aor. a)ne/meina: await, Od. 19.342†.
a)na-metre/w, aor. opt. a)nametrh/saimi: remeasure (the way to), *xa/rubdin, Od. 12.428†.
a)na - mi=/gnu=mi, a)nami=/sgw, aor. part. a)mmi=/ca=s: mix up with, mix together, Od. 10.235, Il. 24.529.
a)na-mimnh/skw, aor. a)ne/mnhsas: remind, tina/ ti, Od. 3.211†.
a)na - mi/mnw (= a)name/nw): await; abs., stand fast, Il. 16.363. (Il.)
a)na - mormu=/rw, ipf. iter. a)namormu=/reske: seethe up, of Charybdis, Od. 12.238†.
a)na - ne/omai, a)nne/omai: come up again, rise, a)nnei=tai h)e/lios, Od. 10.192†.
a)na-neu/w, aor. a)ne/neusa: nod backwards (a backward inclination of the head was a sign of negation, cf. Od. 9.468, hence), deny, refuse; karh/ati, Il. 22.205; with inf., Il. 16.252.
a)/n-anta (a)/nta): up-hill, Il. 23.116.

a)/nac (va/nac), aktos, voc. a)/na (only in addressing a god, otherwise), a)/nac, dat. pl. a)na/ktesi: lord (king), master; of gods, *zeu= a)/na (Il. 3.351), u(/pne a)/nac pa/ntwn te qew=n pa/ntwn t' a)nqrw/pwn (Il. 14.233), qew=n a)e/khti a)na/ktwn (Od. 12.290); of men (esp. Agamemnon), a)/nac a)ndrw=n, and in general of any man as lord and master of his possessions, e)gw\n oi)/koio a)/nac e)/som' h(mete/roio | kai\ dmw/wn, Od. 1.397; h)= su/ g' a)/naktos | o)fqalmo\n poqe/eis, ‘miss your master's eye,’ said by the blinded Polyphemus to his ram, Od. 9.452.
a)na - chrai/nw, aor. subj. a)gchra=/nh|: dry up, Il. 21.347†.
a)n-oi/geskon: see a)noi/gnu=mi.

a)na-pa/llw, aor. 2 part. a)mpepalw=n, aor mid. a)ne/palto: I. act., brandish (drawing) back; a)mpepalw\n (‘having poised and drawn back’) proi+/ei dolixo/skion e)/gxos, Il. 3.355, etc.—II. mid. and pass., be flung up, leap up, Il. 23.692, 694, *q 85, Il. 20.424.
a)na-pau/w, aor. a)ne/pause: cause to leave off, tina/ tinos, Il. 17.550†.
a)na-pei/rw, aor. part. a)mpei/rantes: pierce with spits, spit, Il. 2.426†.
a)na-peptame/na=s see a)napeta/nnu=mi.
a)na-peta/nnu=mi, only perf. part. a)napeptame/na=s: spread back, open, of doors (opp. e)pikeklime/na=s), Il. 12.122.
a)na - phda/w, aor. a)mph/dhse: jump up, Il. 11.379†.
a)na-pi/mplhmi, fut. a)naplh/sw, aor. a)ne/plhsa: fill up; only met., po/tmon bio/toio, ‘fulfil,’ Il. 4.170, kako\n oi)=ton, Il. 8.34; kaka\ polla/, ‘endure to the end,’ Il. 15.132, Od. 5.207, 302.
a)na-ple/w, fut. inf. a)napleu/sesqai: sail up; steinwpo/n, Od. 12.234; e)s *troi/hn (over the high seas), Il. 11.22.

a)na - pne/w, aor. a)ne/pneusa, inf. a)mpneu=sai, aor. 2 imp. a)/mpnue, pass. aor. a)mpnu/nqh, mid. aor. 2 a)/mpnu=to: breathe again, take breath, revive; abs., Il. 11.327, 800, Il. 14.436; w. gen., ‘have a respite from,’ kako/thtos, Il. 11.382; po/noio, Il. 15.235.
a)n-a/poinos (a)/poina): without ransom, Il. 1.99†.
a)na-prh/qw: let stream up, only da/- kru a)naprh/sa=s, ‘with bursting tear,’ Il. 9.433, Od. 2.81. Cf. prh/qw.

a)n - a/ptw, aor. a)nh=ya, pass. perf. imp. a)nh/fqw: fasten up, attach, freq. of cables, Od. 12.162 ; e)k d' au)tou= pei/rat) a)nh/fqw, ‘let the rope-ends be tied to the mast itself,’ Od. 12.51; met., mw=mon, Od. 2.86.
a)na/-pustos (a)napeu/qomai): notorious, Od. 11.274†.
a)na-roibde/w: see a)narroibde/w.
a)n - arpa/zw, aor. a)nh/rpaca and a)nh/rpasa, part. a)narpa/ca=s: snatch up, snatch away, esp. of sudden gusts of wind, Od. 4.515.
a)na-rrh/gnu=mi (vrh/gnu=mi), only aor. a)ne/rrhca: rend or burst open, Il. 18.582, Il. 20.63; of demolishing a wall, Il. 7.461.
a)na-rripte/w (vri/ptw), a)na-rri/ptw, ipf. a)nerri/ptoun, aor. a)ne/rriya: fling up, a)/la phdw=|, of vigorous rowing; without phdw=|, Od. 10.130. (Od.)
a)na - rroibde/w, aor. a)nerroi/bdhse: swallow up (again), of Charybdis. (Od.)
a)/n-arxos: without leader.
a)na-seu/w: only aor. 2 mid. a)ne/ssuto, rushed up, Il. 11.458†.
a)na - spa/w, aor. mid. a)nespa/sato: pull back, e)/gxos e)k xroo/s, Il. 13.574†.
a)/nassa, hs (va/nac): queen, but only of goddesses, for Odysseus when he addresses Nausicaa as a)/nassa, doubts whether she is divine or mortal, Od. 6.149.

a)na/ssw (va/nac), ipf. a)/nasse, h)/nasse, fut. a)na/cw, mid. aor. inf. a)na/casqai: be king, lord, or master of, rule over, reign, said of both gods and men; tino/s or tini/ (dat. of interest), and freq. w. meta/, sometimes e)n; abs., of Nestor, tri\s ga\r dh/ min fa=sin a)na/casqai ge/ne) a)ndrw=n (ge/nea, acc. of time), Od. 3.245; pass., a)na/ssontai d' e)moi\ au)tw=|, ‘by me,’ Od. 4.177.
a)na-stado/n (i(/sthmi): adv., standing up. (Il.)
a)na-stenaxi/zw = a)nastena/xw, ipf., Il. 10.9.
a)na-stena/xw, mid. ipf. a)nestena/xonto: fetch sighs, groan; tina/ (bewail), Il. 23.211. (Il.)
a)na-stonaxi/zw: v. l. for a)nastenaxi/zw.
a)na-stre/fw, aor. opt. a)nstre/yeian: overturn, Il. 23.436; mid., wander through (versari), gai=an, Od. 13.326.
a)na - strwfa/w (frequentative of a)nastre/fw): turn over and over, Od. 21.394†.
a)nasxe/men, a)na/sxeo, a)nasxe/sqai, a)nasxo/menos, a)nasxw/n: see a)ne/xw.
a)na - te/llw, aor. a)ne/teile: cause to spring up, Il. 5.777†.
a)na-ti/qhmi, fut. a)naqh/sei: put upon, met., e)legxei/hn, ‘heap upon,’ Il. 22.100†.
a)na-tlh=nai, inf. of aor. 2 a)ne/tlhn, part. a)natla=/s: bear up, endure; fa/rmakon, ‘withstand,’ Od. 10.327. (Od.)
a)na-tre/pw: only aor. 2 mid. a)netra/peto, fell over backward. (Il.)
a)na - tre/xw, only aor. 2 a)ne/dramon and perf. a)nade/drome: run up, run back; smw/digges, ‘start up,’ Il. 23.717.
a)/n-audos (au)dh/): speechless. (Od.)

a)na - fai/nw, aor. inf. a)nafh=nai: I. act., make to shine or appear, show, exhibit; a)moibhdi\s d' a)ne/fainon, i. e. they made the torch-wood blaze up to give light, Od. 18.310 ; *)odush=a meta\ *trw/ess' a)nafh=nai, ‘reveal his presence,’ Od. 4.254.—II. mid., appear.
a)na-fanda/ and a)nafando/n: openly, publicly, ‘regularly.’
a)na-fe/rw, only aor. act. a)ne/neika, mid. a)nenei/kato: bring up; mid., fetch a deep sigh, Il. 19.314.
a)na-fra/zomai, aor. opt. a)mfra/ssaito: remark again, recognize, Od. 19.391†.
a)na - xa/zomai, aor. part. a)naxassa/menos: draw back, withdraw; esp. in battle, ‘fall back,’ Il. 5.600; with a)/y, o)pi/sw, tutqo/n, pollo/n.
a)na - xwre/w, imp. a)naxwrei/tw, fut., aor.: go back, retreat, Il. 4.305; with a)/y, Il. 3.35, etc.
a)na-yu=/xw (yu=xos), aor. pass. a)ne/yu=xqen (for -hsan): cool off, refresh, Od. 4.568, Il. 10.575.

a(nda/nw (vanda/nw, (s)vhdu/s), ipf. e(h/ndane, h(/ndane, perf. part. e(a=do/ta, aor. eu)/ade (e)/vade) and a(/de: be acceptable, please, tini/, often w. qu=mw=| added; impers., or with a thing as subj., di/xa de/ sfisin h(/ndane boulh/, Od. 3.150, toi=si de\ pa=sin e(a=do/ta mu=qon e)/eipen, Od. 18.422.
a)/n-dixa: in twain, asunder. (Il.)
a)ndr - a/gria (a)nh/r, a)/grh): spoils taken from men, spoils of arms, Il. 14.509†.
*)andr - aimoni/dhs: son of Andraemon, Tnoas, Il. 7.168†.
*)andr-ai/mwn: king of the Aetolians in Calydon, Il. 2.638, Od. 14.499.
a)ndraka/s: man by man (viritim), Od. 13.14†. (v. l. a)/ndra ka/q).)
a)ndra/-podon, dat. pl. a)ndrapo/dessi: slave, Il. 7.475†.
a)ndr-axqh/s, e/s (a)/xqos): man-burdening (heavy for a man to carry), a)ndraxqe/si xermadi/oisin, Od. 10.121†.
a)ndrei+-fo/nths (root fen): man-slaying, *)enu=a/lios. (Il.)
a)/ndressi: see a)nh/r.
a)ndro/-kmhtos (ka/mnw): wrought by men's hands, Il. 11.371†.
*)andro-ma/xh: Andromache, wife of Hector, daughter of Eëtion, king in Cilician Thebes, Il. 6.371, 395, Il. 22.460.
a)ndroth/s, h=tos: manliness, manly beauty; lipou=s' a)ndroth=ta kai\ h(/bhn, Il. 16.857, Il. 22.363; a)ndroth=ta/ te kai\ me/nos h)u/, Il. 24.6, where the first syllable is shortened. See a(droth/s.
a)ndro-fa/gos (fagei=n): man-eating, of the Cyclops, Od. 10.200†.
a)ndu/etai: see a)nadu/omai.
a)n-egei/rw, aor. a)ne/geira, inf. a)negei=rai: wake up; met., a)ne/geira d' e(tai/rous | meilixi/ois e)pe/essi, ‘roused’ them from their despair, Od. 10.172.
a)ne/gnw: see a)nagignw/skw.
a)nede/gmeqa: see a)nade/xomai.
a)ne/dramon: see a)natre/xw.
a)ne/ednos: see a)na/ednos.
a)n - ee/rgw (ve/rgw), ipf. a)ne/ergon: hold back, check. (Il.)

a)/n-eimi (ei)=mi), part. a)niw/n, ipf. a)nh/ion: go up or back, return, (of the sun) rise; para\ nho\s a)nh=ion e)s periwph/n (i. e. from the shore inland), Od. 10.146 ; e)k *troi/hs a)nio/nta, Od. 10.332; a(/m' h)eli/w| a)nio/nti, Il. 18.136.
a)n-ei/mwn, onos (ei(=ma): destitute of (bed) clothing, Od. 3.348†.

a)n-ei/romai (e)/romai), ipf. a)nei/reto: inquire, ask; tina/ or ti/, or with double
acc., o(/ m' a)nei/reai h)de\ metalla=|s, ‘what you ask me about,’ Il. 3.177, Od. 1.231.
a)neirw/twn: see a)nerwta/w.
a)n - ei=sa, defective aor., only opt. a)ne/saimi, part. a)ne/santes: set upon, Il. 13.657; ‘bring back’ to their nuptial couch, Il. 14.209. (Il.)
a)n-ekto/s, o/n (a)ne/xw): endurable, Od. 20.83; usually with ou)ke/ti, so the adv., ou)ke/t' a)nektw=s, ‘in a fashion no longer to be endured,’ Od. 9.350.
a)nelqw/n: see a)ne/rxomai.
a)nelw/n: see a)naire/w.

a)/nemos: wind; often in gen. w. synonymous words, a)ne/moio qu/ella, a)h/ths, a)utmh/, pnoiai/, and i=)\s a)ne/moio, Il. 15.383; *bore/h| a)ne/mw|, Od. 14.253. The other winds named by Homer are Eurus, Notus, and Zephyrus.
a)nemo-skeph/s, e/s (ske/pas): sheltering from the wind, Il. 16.224†.
a)nemo-trefh/s, e/s (tre/fw): wind-fed; ku=ma, ‘swollen,’ Il. 15.625 ; e)/gxos, made of a tree ‘toughened by the wind,’ Il. 11.256.
*)anemw/reia: a town in Phocis, Il. 2.521.
a)nenei/kato: see a)nafe/rw.
a)ne/palto: see a)napa/llw.
a)n-erei/pomai (e)rei/pw), aor. a)nhrei/yanto: snatch up, sweep away; esp. of the Harpies, Od. 1.241; of the rape of Ganymede, to\n kai\ a)nhrei/yanto qeoi\ *dii\ oi)noxoeu/ein, Il. 20.234.

a)n-e/rxomai, aor. 2 a)nh/luqe, part. a)nelqw/n: come (or go) up or back, return; skopih\n e)s paipalo/essan a)nelqw/n, Od. 10.97; a)/y a)naerxome/nw|, Il. 4.392; of a tree, foi/ni=kos ne/on e)/rnos a)nerxo/menon, ‘shooting up,’ Od. 6.163, 167. Cf. a)/neimi.
a)n - erwta/w: only ipf. a)neirw/twn (-hr-), questioned repeatedly, Od. 4.251†.
a)ne/saimi, a)ne/santes: see a)nei=sa.
a)/nesan, a)ne/sei: see a)ni/hmi.
a)ne/ssuto: see a)naseu/w.
a)n-e/stios (e(sti/a=): hearthless, homeless, Il. 9.63†.
a)/neu (a)n-): prep., w. gen., without; a)/neu qeou=, ‘without divine aid,’ Od. 2.372, Il. 15.213 ; a)/neu dhi+/wn, ‘clear of,’ Il. 13.556.

a)/neuqe(n): adv., away, away from, without; abs., Il. 22.300 (opp. e)ggu/qi); a)/neuqe tiqe/nai ti, Il. 22.368; as prep. w. gen., a)/neuqe qeou=, *e 185, Il. 16.89 (cf. a)/neu); oi)=os a)/neuq' a)/llwn, Il. 22.39.
a=) - ne/felos (nefe/lh), a= before n: cloudless, Od. 6.45†.

a)n-e/xw, aor. 2 a)ne/sxon (inf. a)nasxe/men) and a)na/sxeqon (inf. a)nasxeqe/ein), mid. fut. a)ne/comai (inf. a)nsxh/sesqai), aor. a)nesxo/mhn, imp. a)na/sxeo, a)/nsxeo: I. act., hold up or back (Il. 23.426), as the hands in prayer (xei=ras a)nasxw/n), or in boxing, Od. 18.89; met., eu)diki/a=s a)ne/xh|si, ‘upholds,’ Od. 19.111; intr., rise (from under water), Od. 5.320; ‘press up through,’ ai)xmh/, Il. 17.310.—II. mid., hold up oneself or something belonging to one, keep up; xei=ras a)nasxo/menoi ge/lw| e)/kqanon, Od. 18.100, and freq. a)nasxo/menos, of ‘drawing up’ to strike, Il. 3.362, Od. 14.425; of a wounded man, ou)de/ s' o)i=/w | dhro\n e)/t' a)nsxh/sesqai, Il. 5.285; met., endure, bear, tolerate; abs., te/tlaqi kai\ a)na/sxeo, Il. 1.586; w. acc., ti/ or tina/, and w. part. belonging to either subj. or obj., ei)s e)niauto\n e)gw\ para\ soi/ g' a)nexoi/mhn | h(/menos, Od. 4.595.
a)neyio/s, gen. a)neyio/o (sic), Il. 15.554: sister's son, nephew, Il. 15.422; sometimes of other relations, ‘cousin,’ Il. 10.519.
a)/new|, nom. pl.: speechless, silent, e)ge/nonto, h)=san, etc.; adv., a)/new, h(\ d' a)/new dh\n h(=sto, Od. 23.93.
a)nh/gagon: see a)na/gw.
a)nh/h|: see a)ni/hmi.
a)nh/ion: see a)/neimi.
a)n-h/kestos (a)ke/omai): incurable; xo/los, unappeasable, Il. 15.217.
a)n-hkouste/w (a)nh/koustos, a)kou/w): be disobedient, w. genitive. Cf. nhkouste/w. (Il.)
a)n-h/melktos (a)me/lgw): unmilked, Od. 9.439†.
a)n-h/noqen (cf. a)/nqos), defective perf. 2 with aor. meaning: gushed up, Il. 11.266†. See e)nh/noqe.
a)n-h/nustos (a)nu/w): unaccomplished; a)nhnu/stw| e)pi\ e)/rgw|, ‘do - nothing’ business as it is, Od. 16.111†.
a)n-h/nwr, oros (a)nh/r): unmanly, Od. 10.301 and 341.

a)nh/r, gen a)ndro/s and a=)ne/ros, dat. a)ndri/ and a=)ne/ri, acc. a)/ndra, voc. a)=ner,
pl. nom. a)/ndres, a=)ne/res, dat. a)ndra/si, a)/ndressi, acc. a)/ndras, a=)ne/ras, dual. a)/ndre, a=)ne/re: man (vir); as distinguished from gunh/, Od. 15.163; as husband, Od. 11.327; emphatically, a=)ne/res e)/ste kai\ a)/lkimon h)=tor e(/lesqe, Il. 5.529; frequently joined with a more specific noun, i=htro\s a)nh/r, *si/nties a)/ndres. The distinction between a)nh/r and a)/nqrwpos (homo) is disregarded at will, brotoi\ a)/ndres, path\r a)ndrw=n te qew=n te, etc.
a)n-h/rotos (a)ro/w): unploughed. (Od.)
a)nh/fqw: see a)na/ptw.
*)/anqeia: a town in Messēne, Il. 9.151, 293.
*)anqemi/dhs: son of Anthemion, Simoeisius, Il. 4.488†.
*)anqemi/wn: father of Simoeisius, of Troy, Il. 4.473†.
a)nqemo/eis, entos (a)/nqos): flowery; le/bhs, krhth/r, ‘adorned with flowerwork,’ Od. 3.440, Od. 24.275. Cf. cut No. 98.
a)nqerew/n, w=nos: chin; to take by the chin in token of supplication, Il. 1.501.
a)nqe/ric, ikos: (beard of) ear of grain, pl., Il. 20.227†.
a)nqe/w, aor. inf. a)nqh=sai: bloom, Od. 11.320†.
*)anqhdw/n: a town in Boeotia, on the Eu<*>īpus, Il. 2.508†.
a)nq-i/sthmi: only aor. 2 a)nte/sth and ipf. mid. a)nqi/stanto, resisted. (Il.)
a)/nqos, eos: blossom, flower; fig., h(/bhs a)/nqos, Il. 13.484.
a)nqrakih/ (a)/nqrac): heap of glowing coals, Il. 9.213†.

a)/nqrwpos: man (homo); mostly pl., as opp. to gods, a=)qana/twn te qew=n xamai\ e)rxome/nwn t' a)nqrw/pwn, Il. 5.442; mankind, pa/ntas e)p' a)nqrw/pous, ‘the world over,’ Il. 24.535; joined with a more specific word, a)/nqrwpos o(di/ths, *p 263, Od. 13.123.

a)ni<*>a/zw (a)ni<*>/h), ipf. a)ni<*>/azon: torment, annoy, weary, Il. 23.721, Od. 19.323; usually intrans., be tormented, wearied; qu=mw=| a)ni=a/zwn, agonized at heart, of the mortally wounded Eurymachus, Od. 22.87; similarly Il. 21.270, Od. 4.460; often weakened colloquially, h)dh/ moi a)ni=a/zousin e(tai=roi, ‘are worrying’ by this time, Od. 4.598; ironically, Il. 18.300.

a)ni=a/w (a)ni=/h), fut. a)ni=h/sw, pass. aor. part. a)ni=hqei/s: = a)ni=a/zw, act., tina/, Od. 2.115; abs., ‘be a torment,’ ‘nuisance,’ Od. 19.66, Od. 20.178; pass., a)ni=hqei/s, tried out, ‘tired to death’ by the long story, Od. 3.117, Il. 2.291, Od. 1.133, Od. 15.335.
a)n-i=drwti=/ (i(drw/s): without sweat, Il. 15.228†.

a)ni=/h, hs: torment, vexation; a)/neuqe po/nou kai\ a)ni/hs, Od. 7.192; of Scylla (abstr. for concr.), bane, Od. 12.233; and so of persons, daito\s a)ni=/h, Od. 17.446 (cf. 377); a)ni=/h kai\ polu\s u(/pnos, an ‘infliction,’ ‘weariness to the flesh,’ Od. 15.394, cf. Od. 20.52. Cf. a)ni=a/zw. (Od.)
a)ni=hqei/s: see a)ni=a/w.

a)n-i/hmi (i(/hmi), 2 sing. a)niei=s, opt. a)niei/hs, part. a)niei=sa, ipf. a)ni=/ei, fut. a)nh/sw (3 sing. a)ne/sei, Od. 18.265), aor. a)nh=ka, a)ne/hka, 3 pl. a)/nesan, subj. a)nh/h|, opt. a)nei/hn, part. a)ne/ntes, mid. pres. part. a)ni=e/menos: let go up, let up.—I. act., a)h/ta=s *)wkeano\s a)ni/hsin, Od. 4.568; u=(/dwr a)ni/hsi, Charybdis, Od. 12.105; let go, opp. a(lw=nai, Od. 18.265; so of ‘loosing’ bonds, ‘opening’ doors, u(/pnos, ‘forsake,’ Od. 24.440 ; o)du/nh, ‘release,’ Il. 15.24; then of ‘giving free rein’ to one, Il. 5.880; hence, incite, tina\ e)pi/ tini, Il. 5.882; abs., Il. 17.705 ; nu=n au)=te/ me qu=mo\s a)nh=ken, ‘impels,’ ‘prompts,’ followed by inf., Il. 22.252, and often.—II. mid., ko/lpon a)ni=eme/nh, letting up, i. e. ‘laying bare her’ bosom, Il. 22.80; similarly ai)=gas a)ni=eme/nous, ripping up, ‘flaying’ for themselves, Od. 2.300.
a)ni=hro/s (a)ni/h): vexatious, wearisome, Od. 17.220, 377; comp., au)tw=| a)nihre/steron e)/stai, the sorer will it be for him, Od. 2.190; cf. a)/lgion.
a)nipto/-pos, podos (a)/niptos, pou/s): with unwashed feet, pl., Il. 16.235†.
a)/-niptos (ni/ptw): unwashed, Il. 6.266†.

a)n-i/sthmi, ipf. a)ni/sth, fut. a)nasth/sousi, a)nsth/s-, aor. 1 a)ne/sthse, opt. a)nasth/seie, imp. a)/nsthson, part. a)nasth/sa=s, a)nsth/sa=sa, aor. 2 a)ne/sth, dual a)nsth/thn, 3 pl. a)ne/stan, inf. a)nsth/menai, part. a)nsta=/s, mid. pres. a)ni/stamai, a)nista/menos, ipf. a)ni/stato, fut. a)nasth/sontai, inf. a)nsth/sesqai: I. trans. (pres., ipf., fut., aor. 1, act.), make to stand or get up, Od. 7.163, 170; ge/ronta de\ xeiro\s a)ni/sth, took him by the hand and ‘made him arise,’ Il. 24.515, Od. 14.319; violently, Il. 1.191; so of ‘rousing,’ *k
32; raising the dead, Il. 24.756; instituting a migration, Od. 6.7, etc.—II. intrans. (aor. 2 and perf. act., and mid. forms), stand up, get up; e)c e(de/wn, e)c eu)nh=s, etc.; especially of rising to speak in the assembly, toi=si d' a)ne/sth, ‘to address them,’ toi=si d' a)nista/menos mete/fh, Il. 1.58; a)na/ repeated as adverb, a)\n d' *)oduseu\s polu/mhtis a)ni/stato, Il. 23.709.
a)n-i/sxw (parallel form of a)ne/xw, q. v.): only pres. part., xei=ras qeoi=sin, *q 347, Il. 15.369.
a)n-ixneu/w (i)/xnos): track back, Il. 22.192.
a)nnei=tai: see a)nane/omai.
a) - noh/mwn: unintelligent, unreflecting. (Od.)
a)n-oi/gw, a)na-oi/gw, ipf. a)ne/w|ge, a)nw=|ge, iter. a)naoi/geskon, aor. a)ne/w|ce: open; qu/ra=s, klhi=da, ‘shove back;’ a)po\ xhlou= pw=ma, ‘raise,’ Il. 16.221.
a)n-o/leqros: untouched by destruction, pl., Il. 13.761†.
a=)/nomai: see a=)/nw.
a)no/paia: doubtful word (and reading), perhaps name of a species of bird, Od. 1.320†. See o)pai=a.
a)n-orou/w, only aor. a)no/rousen, -san, part. -sa=s: spring up; e)k qro/nwn, u(/pnou, e)s di/fron, Il. 16.130; h)e/lios, ‘climbed swiftly up the sky,’ Od. 3.1.
a)-no/stimos (no/stos): not returning; a)no/stimon e)/qhkan, ‘cut off his return,’ Od. 4.182†.
a)/-nostos: without return (cf. a)no/stimos), Od. 24.528†.
a)/-nousos (nou=sos): without sickness, Od. 14.255†.
a)n - ou/tatos: unwounded, Il. 4.540†. See ou)ta/w.
a)n - outhti=/: without inflicting a wound, Il. 22.371†. See ou)ta/w.
a)nsta=/s, a)nsta=sa, a)/nsthson, a)nsth/thn, a)nsth/sesqai: see a)ni/sthmi.
a)nstre/yeian: see a)nastre/fw.
a)nsxeqe/ein, a)/nsxeo, a)nsxh/sesqai: see a)ne/xw.
a)n-sxeto/s (a)nasx-, a)ne/xw): endurable, with neg., Od. 2.63†.

a)/nta, a)/nt) (cf. a)nti/): adv. and prep., opposite, over against; a)/nta titu/skesqai, aim ‘straight forward;’ a)/nta i)dw\n h)leu/ato xa/lkeon e)/gxos, Il. 13.184; a)/nta ma/xesqai, ‘with the enemy;’ sth= d' a)/nta sxome/nh, halted and ‘faced’ him, Od. 6.141 ; qeoi=sin a)/nta e)w/|kei, ‘in visage,’ Il. 24.630 (cf. a)/nthn); as prep., w. gen., *)/hlidos a)/nta, over against, Il. 2.626 ; a)/nta pareia=/wn sxome/nh lipara\ krh/demna, ‘before’ her cheeks, Od. 1.334 ; a)/nta se/qen, Od. 4.160; and freq. in hostile sense, qeoi\ a)/nta qew=n i)/san, Il. 20.75; *dio\s a)/nta ptolemi/zein, Il. 8.428, etc.
a)nt-a/cios, on: equivalent in value, worth; w. gen., i=)htro\s ga\r a)nh\r pollw=n a)nta/cios a)/llwn, Il. 11.514. (Il.)

a)nta/w (cf. a)nti/, a)/nta), ipf. h)/nteon, fut. a)nth/sw, aor. h)/nthsa, subj. a)nth/somen: meet, encounter; of persons, w. dat., Il. 6.399, Il. 7.423; of things, w. gen., ma/xhs, dai/ths, ‘come straight to,’ Od. 3.44 ; o(/pws h)/nthsas o)pwph=s, ‘got sight of him face to face,’ Od. 4.327.
*)/anteia: wife of Proetus, Stheneboea in the tragic poets, Il. 6.160†.
a)nt-e/xw: only aor. 2 mid. imp. a)nti/sxesqe, hold before yourselves, interpose; trape/za=s i=)w=n, tables against the arrows, Od. 22.74†.

a)/nthn (a)/nta): opposite, in front, in or to the face; a)/nthn i(/stasqe (opp. feu/gein), Il. 11.590 ; a)/nthn ballome/nwn, Il. 12.152; ‘in view,’ Od. 6.221; with e)nali/gkios, ei)ke/lh, the effect of a)/nthn is largely that of emphasis, Od. 2.5, Od. 22.240; so with o(moiwqh/menai, Il. 1.187; ‘openly,’ a)gapaze/men a)/nthn, Il. 24.464.
*)anthnori/dhs: son of Antēnor, Helicāon, Il. 3.123; pl., sons of Antēnor, Il. 11.59.
*)ant-h/nwr: Antēnor, son of Aesyētes, husband of Theāno, Il. 3.262, Il. 5.69 f.
a)/nthstis (a)nta/w): meeting; only kat' a)/nthstin, at the junction of the men's and the women's apartments, opposite the entrance of the house, Od. 20.387†. (See table III. at end of volume.)

a)nti/ (cf. a)/nta), never suffers elision in Homer (a)/nt) = a)/nta, a)nti/) = a)nti/a): prep. w. gen., against (as an equivalent, not local), instead of, in return for; a)nti/ nu pollw=n | la=w=n e)sti\n a)nh\r o(/n te *zeu\s kh=ri filh/sh|, Il. 9.116, *y 650, Il. 24.254.
a)nti/), a)nti/a: see a)nti/os.
a)nti-a/neira (a)nh/r): only fem., nom. pl., matching men, of the Amazons. (Il.)

a)ntia/w, a)ntio/w (a)nti/), fut. a)ntia/sw (as if from a)ntia/zw), a)ntio/w, aor. a)n-
tia/seias, etc., part. a)ntia/sa=s, mid. ipf. a)ntia/asqe: meet, encounter, take part in, usually w. gen.; of persons, Il. 7.231, etc.; of things, ma/xhs, e(kato/mbhs, ga/mou (mid., Il. 24.62), etc.; w. dat., Il. 6.127, Il. 21.431, Od. 18.147; w. acc. (limit of motion) only in e)mo\n le/xos a)ntio/wsan, ‘visiting,’ euphemistic of the captive who shares the couch of her lord, Il. 1.31.

a)nti/-bios (bi/h): hostile, only a)ntibiois e)pe/essi, Il. 1. 304, Od. 18.415; adv., a)nti/bion, with verbs of combating, Il. 3.20, 435, Il. 11.386; also a)ntibi/hn, *a 278, Il. 5.220. (Both adverbs only in Il.)

a)nti-bole/w (ba/llw), fut. a)ntibolh/sw, aor. a)ntebo/lhse (a)ntib.): come in the way of, encounter, take part in (cf. a)ntia/w); ma/xhs, ta/fou, etc.; subject a thing, ga/mos a)ntibolh/sei e)me/qen, Od. 18.272; w. dat., of persons, Od. 7.19, Od. 10.277, Il. 16.847; seldom of things, fo/nw|, Od. 11.416; ta/fw|, Od. 24.87.

a)nti/-qeos, 3: godlike, epith. of distinction as regards rank, might, stature, beauty; applied to kings, Il. 5.663; to the companions of Odysseus, Od. 4.571; to the suitors, Od. 14.18, and (by Zeus) even to Polyphēmus, Od. 1.30; rarely of women, a)ntiqe/hn a)/loxon (Penelope), Od. 11.117.
a)nti/-quros (qu/rh): over against the door, only kat' a)nti/quron klisi/hs, in a position opposite the entrance of the hut, Od. 16.159†.
*)anti/-kleia: Anticlēa, daughter of Autolycus, wife of Laertes and mother of Odysseus, Od. 11.85, Od. 15.358.
*)/anti-klos: name of a Greek warrior in the wooden horse, Od. 4.286.

a)nti-kru=/, a)ntikru/s: opposite, straightforward, straight through; a)ntikru\ ma/xesqai, Il. 5.130, 819; w. gen., o)isto\n i)/allen | *(/ektoros a)ntikru=/, Il. 8.301; a)pofa/nai, ‘outright,’ Il. 7.362 ; a)ntikru=\ d' a)pa/race, ‘completely’ off, Il. 16.116, Il. 23.866; often joined w. foll. prep., parai/, dia/, kata/, a)na/.
*)anti/ - loxos: Antilochus, son of Nestor, Il. 4.457, Il. 13.554, Il. 16.320, Il. 13.93, Il. 15.569, *e 565, g 452, Od. 4.187.
*)anti/-maxos: a Trojan, Il. 4.123, 132, 138, Il. 12.188.
*)anti/-noos: Antinous, son of Eupeithes, Od. 1.383; prominent among the suitors of Penelope, and the most insolent of them, Od. 2.84, Od. 16.418, Od. 22.22, Od. 24.424.
a)nti/on: see a)nti/os.
*)anti - o/ph: daughter of Asōpus, mother of Amphīon and Zethus, Od. 11.260.

a)nti/os, 3 (a)nti/): opposite; freq. w. verbs of motion, and usually followed by gen., sometimes by dat., in both friendly and unfriendly sense; ou)k a)qrh=sai du/nat' a)nti/h, ‘over towards’ him, Od. 19.478 ; a)ntios h)=lqe qe/wn, came running to ‘meet’ him, Il. 6.54, Il. 1.535, Il. 2.185; dat., Il. 7.20; against, ei) mh/ tis *danaw=n nu=n *(/ektoros a)nti/os ei)=sin, Il. 7.28; so i(/stasqai, a<*>ssein, e)/gxe) a)ei=rai, etc., dat., Il. 15.584, Il. 20.422.—Adv., a)nti/on, a)nti/a, in same senses, and reg. w. gen.; o(/stis se/qen a)nti/on ei)/ph|, against, Il. 1.230 ; i(/n' a)nti/on au)to\s e)ni/sph|, ‘in my presence,’ Od. 17.529 ; di/fron a)nti/) *)aleca/ndroio qea=\ kate/qhke, Il. 3.425.
a)ntio/w: see a)ntia/w.
a)nti-pe/raios (pe/rhn): only. neut. pl. as subst., places opposite, Il. 2.635†.
a)nti/sxesqe: see a)nte/xw.
a)nti-tore/w, only aor.: bore through in front; doru\ xroo\s a)nteto/rhsen, Il. 5.337; w. acc., do/mon a)ntitorh/sa=s, ‘breaking into,’ Il. 10.267.
a)/n - titos (a)na/, ti/w): in requital, e)/rga, works ‘of retribution,’ ‘vengeance,’ Od. 17.51.
*)anti-fa/ths: (1) a Trojan, Il. 12.191. —(2) a Greek, son of Melampus, Od. 15.242. —(3) king of the Laestr&ymacr;gons (acc. -h=a), Od. 10.114.
a)nti-feri/zw: match oneself against, vie with, tini/, Il. 21.357, 488. (Il.)
a)nti - fe/romai: oppose oneself to, measure oneself with, tini/ (ti\, acc. of specification), Il. 21.482. (Il.)
*)anti/ - fonos: a son of Priam, Il. 24.250†.

*)/anti-fos: (1) a son of Priam, Il. 4.489.—(2) son of Aegyptius, Od. 2.19.— (3) a friend of Odysseus, Od. 17.68.—(4) son of Talaemenes, an ally of the Trojans, Il. 2.864.—(5) a Heraclid, son of Thessalus, a leader of Greek islanders, Il. 2.678.
a)/ntlos, ou: bilge - water, hold of a ship. (Od.)
a)ntolh/ (a)nate/llw): rising, only pl., a)ntolai\ h)eli/oio, Od. 12.4†.

a)/ntomai (parallel form of a)nta/w), only pres. and ipf.: meet, encounter; tini/, Il. 15.698, Il. 22.203; o(/qi diplo/os h)/nteto
qw/rhc, ‘met double,’ i. e. where the cuirass formed a double layer by meeting with the zw=ma and overlapping it, Il. 4.133, Il. 20.415.
a)/ntron: cave, grot. (Od.)
*)antrw/n: a town in Thessaly, Il. 2.697†.

a)/ntuc, ugos: rim.—(1) the metal rim of a shield, Il. 6.118; serving to bind together the layers of leather or metal, of which the shield was composed (see the cut).—(2) the rim of a chariot, surrounding (peri/dromos) the body (di/fros) of the car, sometimes double, Il. 5.728; it served also as a place of attachment for the reins. (See the cut.)
a)/nu=mi: see a)nu/w.
a)/nusis (a)nu/w): accomplishment; a)/nusis d' ou)k e)/ssetai au)tw=n, ‘success’ shall not be theirs, Il. 2.347, Od. 4.544.

a)nu/w, a)/nu=mi (a=)/nw), aor. h)/nuse, opt. a)nu/seie, pass. ipf. h)/nuto, mid. fut. inf. a)nu/ssesqai: bring to an end, accomplish; qow=s de/ oi( h)/nuto e)/rgon, Od. 5.243, abs. Il. 4.56, mid. Od. 16.373 ; e)pei\ dh/ se flo\c h)/nusen, had ‘consumed,’ Od. 24.71; of ‘traversing’ space (as we say, a ship ‘makes’ so many knots), o(/sson te panhmeri/h glafurh\ nhu=s | h)/nusen, d 357, Od. 15.294.
a=)/nw, ipf. h)=non: complete; o(do/n, Od. 3.496; pass. nu\c a=)/netai, ‘draws to a close,’ Il. 10.251 ; o(/ppws e)/rgon a)/noito (note the quantity), Il. 18.473.
a)/nw (a)na/): upwards, Od. 11.596 ; *le/sbos a)/nw (i. e. towards Troy, ‘north’?).. kai\ *frugi/h kaqu/perqe, Il. 24.544.

a)/nwga, perf. w. pres. meaning, imp. a)/nwxqi, -w/xqw and -wgei/tw, -wxqe and -w/xete, inf. -wge/men, plup. h)nw/gea, h)nw/gei and -ein, a)nw/gei (also forms that may be referred to a)nw/gw as pres. and ipf.), a)nw/gei, -eton, subj. a)nw/gh|, opt. a)nw/goimi, ipf. h)/nwgon, a)/nwgon, fut. a)nw/cw, aor. h)/nwca: bid, command; foll. by acc. and inf., a)/nwxqi de/ min game/esqai, Od. 2.113; very seldom w. dat. of person, de/mni) a)/nwgen u(postore/sai dmwh=|sin, Od. 20.139; freq. joined with e)po-
tru=/nw, ke/lomai, and esp. w. qu=mo/s, (two accusatives) ta/ me qu=mo\s a)nw/gei, Il. 19.102.
a)nw=|gen: see a)noi/gw.
a)nw/gw: see a)/nwga.
a)n=wqe/w, only aor. part. a)nw/santes: shove off from land, Od. 15.553†.
a)n-wisti=/ (o)i=/w): unexpectedly, Od. 4.92†.
a)n-w/istos (o)i=/w): unexpected, Il. 21.39†.
a)n - w/numos (o)/noma): nameless, Od. 8.552†.
a)/nwxqe, -qi, -qw: see a)/nwga.
a)/cantos, -asqe, -emen, -e/menai, -ete: see a)/gw.
a)ci=/nh: battle-axe of the Trojans, Il. 15.711. (See cut.)

a)/cios, 3 (a)/gw): of equal weight, value, worth, with gen.; ou)d' e(no\s a)/cioi/ ei)men *(/ektoros, Il. 8.234; le/bhs boo\s a)/cios, Il. 23.885; a)/cia a)/poina, ‘suitable,’ i. e. precious, Il. 6.46 ; a)/cion, a ‘good’ price, Od. 20.383.
*)acio/s: a river in Macedonia, Il. 21.141, Il. 2.849.
a)/-culos (cu/lon): dense, u=(/lh, Il. 11.155†.
*)/aculos: son of Teuthras, from Arisbe, in Thrace, Il. 6.12†.
a)/cwn, onos: axle, Il. 5.838, Il. 16.378. (Il.)

a)oidh/, h=s (a)ei/dw): song, minstrelsy; tw=| qeo\s peri\ dw=ken a)oidh/n, the ‘gift of song’, Od. 8.44 ; a)oidh=s u(/mnon, ‘strains of minstrelsy,’ Od. 8.429; concrete, ‘that song,’ Od. 1.351, etc. The various shades of application are not always distinct, nor is anything gained by attempting to distinguish them.
a)oidia/w, -a/ei, part. -a/ousa: sing, Od. 10.227 and Od. 5.61.
a)oi/dimos: subject of song, pl. (with bad sense from the context), Il. 6.358†.
a)olli/zw, aor. a)o/llisan, part. a)olli/ssa=sa, pass. a)olli/sqhsan, -qh/menai: bring together, assemble, Il. 6.270, 287, Il. 15.588. (Il.)
a)/or, a<*>oros (a)ei/rw), neut., but acc. pl. a=)/oras, Od. 17.222: sword, ‘hanger,’ suspended by the a)orth/r, the same as ci/fos, Od. 8.403, 406, Od. 10.294, 321. (See cut.)

a)orth/r, h=ros (a)ei/rw): baldric, belt, usually for the a)/or, and the same as telamw/n (see cut), Od. 11.609; ‘strap’ for a wallet, Od. 13.438; what the ‘suspenders’ were in Il. 11.31 is not perfectly clear.
a)osshth/r, h=ros: defender, helper.
a)/-outos: unwounded, Il. 18.536†. See ou)ta/w.
a)p-agge/llw, ipf. iter. a)pagge/lleske, and aor.: bring tidings, report; tini/ ti, Il. 9.626.
a)p-a/gxw: throttle, part., Od. 19.230†.
a)p-a/gw, fut. a)pa/cw, aor. 2 a)ph/gagon: lead or bring away; oi)/kade (tina/), au)=tis patri/da gai=an, Il. 15.706, etc.
a)p-aei/romai: only part., a)paeiro/menon po/lios, bearing away from the city, Il. 21.563†.
*)apaiso/s: a town of Mysia, Il. 2.828†. See *paiso/s.
a)p-aiti/zw: reclaim, Od. 2.78†.
a)pa/lalke, a)pala/lkoi: see a)pale/cw.
a)-pa/lamnos (pala/mh): without device, Il. 5.597†.

a)p - ale/cw, fut. inf. -ch/sein, aor. 1 opt. -ch/saimi, aor. 2 a)pa/lalke, opt. a)pala/lkoi: ward off, avert, keep from; mnhsth=ras d' a)pa/lalke, prayer of Penelope to Athena, Od. 4.766 ; tina/ tinos, *w 371, Il. 22.348; with gen. of the thing, tina\ kako/thtos, she was not going to keep (save) one of them from destruction, Od. 17.364.
a)p-a/lqomai: only fut. 3 du., e(/lke) a)palqh/sesqon, shall they be fully healed of their wounds, Il. 8.405, 419.
a)p-aloia/w, aor. a)phloi/hsen: crush utterly; o)ste/a, Il. 4.522†.

a(palo/s, 3: tender; deirh/, au)xh/n, pareiai/, of women, Il. 18.123 ; xei=res, joined w. a)/triptoi, Od. 21.151; po/des, of Ate, Il. 19.93 (cf. 94); h)=tor, ‘life,’ Il. 11.115; adv., a(palo\n gela/sai, the effect of wine, ‘snicker,’ Od. 14.465.
a(palo-trefh/s, e/s: tender-fed, ‘fattened;’ si/alos, Il. 21.363†.
a)p-ama/w, only aor. opt. a)pa=mh/seie: cut off; laimo/n, as children say, ‘cut his neck off,’ Il. 18.34† (v. l. a)potmh/ceie).
a)pambrotei=n: see a)famarta/nw.
a)p-amei/bomai: answer, reply; esp., a)pameibo/menos prose/fh (prosefw/nee), and a)pamei/beto fw/nhse/n te. In different connection, Od. 8.158.

a)p-amu=/nw, aor. a)ph/mu=na, mid. ipf. a)pamu=/neto, aor. opt. a)pamu=nai/mesqa, inf. a)pamu=/nasqai: ward off (tini/ ti). mid., from oneself, (tina/) defend oneself against; *ai)twloi=sin a)ph/mu=nen kako\n h)=mar, Il. 9.597; po/lis h(=| (whereby) k' a)pamu=nai/mesqa, Il. 15.738; xersi\ pe/poiqa | a)/ndr' a)pamu=/nesqai, Od. 16.72.
a)p-anai/nomai, only aor. a)phnh/nanto, inf. a)panh/nasqai: deny, disown, decline, Il. 7.185 and Od. 10.297.
a)p - a/neuqe(n): away, apart from (tino/s); a)pa/neuqe kiw/n, Il. 1.35; e(/zet' e)/peit) a)pa/neuqe new=n, Il. 1.48; basilh=a ma/xhs a)pa/neuqe fe/rontes, Il. 11.283; ‘forth from,’ Il. 19.374.
a(pa/nth|, a(pa/nth: on every side.
a)p-anu/w: only aor. a)ph/nusan oi)/kad' o)pi/ssw, accomplished the journey home again, Od. 7.326†.
a(/pac: once; ‘once for all,’ Od. 12.350. (Od.)
a)p-ara/ssw, only aor. a)ph/race, a)pa/race: smite off. (Il.)
a)p-are/skomai (a)re/skw), only aor. inf. a)pare/ssasqai: conciliate, Il. 19.183†.
a)p - a/rxomai: begin a sacrifice, by cutting off hair from the forehead of the victim, Od. 3.446, Od. 14.422. Cf. kata/rxesqai.

a(/-pa=s, -pa=sa, -pan (stronger than pa=s): all, pl. all (together), cuncti; a)rgu/reos a(/pa=s, ‘solid silver,’ Od. 4.616 ; tuxw\n filo/thtos a(pa=/shs, ‘nothing but kindness,’ Od. 15.158 ; kai\ ei)s e)niauto\n a(/panta, in ‘a year and a day,’ Od. 14.196.
a)/-pastos (pate/omai): without (taste of) food; e)dhtu/os h)de\ poth=tos, d 788, Od. 6.250.
a)pata/w (a)pa/th), fut. -hsw, aor. a)pa/thsa: deceive.
a)pa/th, hs: deceit; pl., Il. 15.31.
a)path/lios: deceitful; only neut. pl., a)path/lia ba/zein, ei)de/nai, Od. 14.127, 288.
a)pathlo/s = a)path/lios, Il. 1.526†.
a)p - ati=ma/w, aor. a)phti=/mhse: treat with indignity, offend deeply, Il. 13.113†.

a)p - aura/w, ipf. (usually w. aor. meaning) a)phu/rwn, -a=s, -a=, fut. a)pourh/sousi (v. l. a)pouri/ssousi), Il. 22.489, aor. part. a)pou/ra=s: wrest from, rob, deprive; tina/ ti, a)/mfw qu=mo\n a)phu/ra=, Il. 6.17; e)leu/qeron h)=mar a)pou/ra=s, Il. 16.831; sometimes w. dat. of disadvantage, *)/ektori qu=mo\n a)pou/ra=s, Il. 21.296.
a)pafi/skw, aor. 2 h)/pafe, mid. opt. a)pa/foito: delude, beguile, Od. 11.217 and Od. 23.216.
a)pe/eipe: see a)pei=pon.
a)pe/erge: see a)poe/rgw.
a)peilh/, h=s, only pl.: threats, boasting. Cf. a)peile/w.
a)peilhth/r, h=ros: boaster, pl., Il. 7.96†.

a)/p-eimi (1), fut. a)pessei=tai, a)pe/ssetai, pres. subj. a)pe/h|si, ipf. a)pe/hn, a)/pesan: be (distant) from (tino/s), be absent, wanting; to/sson a)ph=n o(/son te ge/gwne boh/sa=s, Od. 5.400; soi\ d' o(do\s ou)ke/ti dhro\n a)pe/ssetai, ‘you shall not
have to wait much longer for the journey,’ Od. 2.285.
a)/p-eimi (2), imp. a)/piqi, part. a)piw/n: go away, very often the part.; e)gw\ me\n a)/peimi, ‘am going,’ fut., Od. 17.593.

a)p - ei=pon, a)pe/eipe (a)pe/v.), subj. a)poei/pw, opt. a)poei/poi, inf. a)poeipei=n, a)peipe/men, part. a)poeipw/n: (1) speak out; ma/la ga\r kraterw=s a)pe/eipen, Il. 9.431; i(/n' u=(mi=n mu=qon a)phlege/ws a)poei/pw, Od. 1.373; a)ggeli/hn, ‘deliver,’ Il. 7.416. —(2) say no, renounce; u(po/sxeo kai\ kata/neuson, | h)\ a)po/eipe, Il. 1.515; mh=nin a)poeipw\n, Il. 19.35; pa=si mnhsth/ressin a)peipe/men, ‘warn them to desist,’ Od. 1.91. See ei)=pon.
*)apeirai/h: of Apeira, grhu+/s.— *)apei/rhqen: from Apeira; the ‘unbounded’ land (pe/ras, h)/peiros)?

a)-peire/sios and a)perei/sios, 3 (pe/ras, pei/rata): unlimited, boundless, infinite, of quantity or numbers, gai=an a)peiresi/hn, Il. 20.58; a)/nqrwpoi polloi/, a)peire/sioi, Od. 19.174; a)perei/si) a)/poina, Il. 1.13.
a)-pei/ritos = a)peire/sios, Od. 10.195†.
a)-pei/rwn, onos (pe/ras): boundless, endless; dh=mos, ‘countless,’ Il. 24.776 ; u(/pnos, Od. 7.286; desmoi/, Od. 8.340.
a)p - ek - lanqa/nomai, only aor. imp. a)peklela/qesqe: forget altogether, Od. 24.394†.
a) - pe/leqros: immeasurable; i=)/s, Il. 5.245, Od. 9.538; neut. as adv., ‘enormously far,’ Il. 11.354.
a)p-eme/w: only aor. a)pe/messen, spat out, Il. 14.437†.
a)pemnh/santo: see a)pomimnh/skw.
a)pe/neikas: see a)pofe/rw.
a)pe/plw: see a)poplw/w.
a)perei/sios: see a)peire/sios.
a)p - eru=/kw, fut. a)peru=/cw: hold off, keep off or away, Od. 9.119.
a)p-e/rxomai, aor. a)ph=lqe, perf. a)pelh/luqa: come (or go) away, depart; tino/s, b 136, Il. 24.766.
a)p - erweu/s (a)perwe/w): thwarter; mene/wn, Il. 8.361†.
a)p - erwe/w, aor. opt. a)perwh/seias: slink away; pole/mou, from fighting, Il. 16.723†.
a)/pesan: see a)/peimi.
a)pe/ssuto: see a)poseu/w.

a)-peuqh/s, e/os (peu/qomai): pass., unascertained; kai\ o)/leqron a)peuqe/a qh=ke *kroni=/wn, ‘put even his destruction beyond ken,’ Od. 3.88 (cf. 86, 87); act., without ascertaining, ‘uninformed,’ Od. 3.184.

a)p-exqai/rw, aor. 1 subj. a)pexqh/rw: hate utterly; tina/, Il. 3.415; causative, o(/s te/ moi u(/pnon a)pexqai/rei kai\ e)dwdh\n | mnwome/nw|, makes hateful to me—when I think of his loss, Od. 4.105.
a)p-exqa/nomai, aor. 2 a)ph/xqeto, inf. a)pexqe/sqai: make oneself, be, or become hated, Od. 2.202, Il. 3.454; ‘mutual’ enmity is implied in Od. 16.114.

a)p-e/xw, fut. a)fe/cw, a)posxh/sw, aor. 2 a)pe/sxon, mid. fut. a)fe/comai, aor. 2 a)pesxo/mhn, inf. a)posxe/sqai: hold from, keep from; act., tino/s ti or tina/, e(ka\s nh/swn a)pe/xein eu)erge)a nh=a, Od. 15.33; h)w\s h(/ m' *)odush=os oi)/kou a)posxh/sei, that ‘shall part’ me from Odysseus' house, Od. 19.572; also w. dat. of interest, Il. 24.19, Od. 20.263; mid., tino/s, ‘hold aloof from,’ Il. 12.248; ‘abstain,’ Od. 9.211; ‘spare,’ Od. 12.321, Od. 19.489.
a)-ph/mantos (phmai/nw): unharmed, Od. 19.282†.
a)ph/mbroton: see a)famarta/nw.

a) - ph/mwn, onos (ph=ma): without harm; pass., a)ph/mwn h)=lqe, a)ph/mona pe/mpein tina/, ‘safe and sound,’ Od. 4.487, Od. 13.39; act., of anything that tends to safety, no/stos a)ph/mwn, ‘happy’ return, Od. 4.519 ; pompoi/, ‘kindly,’ Od. 8.566 ; ou)=ros, u(/pnos, etc. The distinction of act. and pass. is rather apparent than real.
a)ph/nh, hs: wagon, for freight, and four-wheeled, Il. 24.324; with tent-like cover, Od. 6.70; usually drawn by mules. (See cut on following page.)
a)p-hnh/nanto: see a)panai/nomai.
a)p-hnh/s, e/s (opp. e)n-hh/s): unfeeling, harsh, Il. 1.340, Od. 19.329 ; qu=mo/s, Il. 15.94; no/os, Il. 16.35; mu=qos, Il. 15.202.
a)ph/racen: see a)para/ssw.
a)phu/rwn: see a)paura/w.
a)p-h/wros (a)ei/rw): hanging (high) away; o)/zoi, Od. 12.435†, cf. 436.
a)-piqe/w, only fut., and aor. a)pi/qhse: disobey; tini/, always with negative.
a)pinu/ssw (pinuto/s): lack understanding, Od. 5.342; be unconscious; kh=r, acc. of specification, Il. 15.10.
*)apisa=/wn: (1) a Greek, son of Hippasus, Il. 17.348.—(2) a Trojan, son of Phausius, Il. 11.582.
a)-piste/w (a)/pistos): disbelieve, only ipf., ou)/ pot' a)pi/steon, ‘I never despaired,’ Od. 13.339†.
a)/-pistos (pisto/s): faithless, Il. 3.106; unbelieving, Od. 14.150.
a)p-i/sxw = a)pe/xw, Od. 11.95†.
a)/ - pneustos (pne/w): breathless, Od. 5.456†.

a)po/: from (a b).—I. adv. (here belong all examples of the so-called use ‘in tmesi’), off, away; h(mi=n a)po\ loigo\n a)mu=nai, Il. 1.67; a)po\ de\ xlai=nan ba/le, Il. 2.183, etc.; a subst. in the gen. (of separation) is often added to render more specific the relation of the adv., a)p' i+)xw= xeiro\s o)mo/rgnu=, Il. 5.416; pollo/n ga\r a)po\ plunoi/ ei)si po/lhos, Od. 6.40; thus preparing the way for the strict prepositional usage.—II. prep., w. gen., from, away from, denoting origin, starting-point, separation (distance); ou) ga\r a)po\ druo/s e)ssi palaifa/tou, ou)d' a/po\ pe/trhs, ‘sprung from’ tree or rock, Od. 19.163 ; a)f' i(/ppwn a)=lto xama=ze, ‘from his car,’ Il. 16.733; so freq. a)f' i(/ppwn, a)po\ new=n ma/xesqai, where we say ‘on’; ou)k a)po\ skopou= ou)d' a)po\ do/chs | mu=qei=tai basi/leia, ‘wide of,’ i. e. she hits the mark and meets our views, Od. 11.344 ; me/nwn a)po\ h(=s a)lo/xoio, ‘away from’ his wife, Il. 2.292; so a)p' ou)/atos, a)p) o)fqalmw=n; adverbial phrase, a)po\ spoudhs, ‘in earnest,’ Il. 12.237. The ‘temporal’ meaning commonly ascribed to a)po\ in Il. 8.54 is only implied, not expressed by the preposition.
a)poai/numai: see a)pai/numai.
a)poaire/omai: see a)faire/omai.
a)po - bai/nw, fut. a)pobh/somai, aor. a)pe/bhn, a)pebh/seto: go away; e)c i(/ppwn (i(/ppwn, Il. 17.480), ‘dismount’; nho/s, ‘disembark,’ Od. 13.281.
a)po/-blhtos: to be spurned, despised, w. neg., Il. 2.361 and Il. 3.65.
a)po-bri/zw, only aor. part. a)pobri/cantes: sleep soundly, Od. 9.151 and Od. 12.7.
a)po-guio/w (gui=on), aor. subj. a)poguiw/sh|s: unnerve, Il. 6.265†.
a)po - gumno/w (gumno/s), aor. pass. part. a)pogumnwqe/nta: denude, strip, Od. 10.301†.
a)po - dai/omai (dai/w), fut. inf. a)poda/ssesqai, aor. a)poda/ssasqai: give a share of, share with; tini/ ti, and tini/ tinos, Il. 17.231, *x 118, Il. 24.595.
a)po-deirotome/w (deirh/, te/mnw), fut. -h/sw, aor. a)pedeiroto/mhsa: cut the throat of, slaughter; e)s bo/qron, i. e. over the trench, so that the blood might run into it, Od. 11.35.
a)po - de/xomai, aor. a)pede/cato: accept, Il. 1.95†.
a)po-didra=/skw, aor. 2 part. a)podra=/s: escape by stealth; e)k nho/s and nho/s, Od. 16.65 and Od. 17.516.

a)po - di/dwmi, fut. a)podw/somen, aor. a)pe/dwke, subj. a)podw=|si, opt. a)podoi=te, inf. a)podou=nai: give or deliver up, restore; kth/mata, Il. 3.285; ne/kun e)pi\ nh=as, Il. 7.84; qre/ptra tokeu=sin, ‘repay the debt’ of nurture, Il. 4.478.
a)podi/omai: see e)capodi/omai.
a)po - doxmo/w (doxmo/s), aor. part. a)podoxmw/sa=s: bend to one side, Od. 9.372†.
a)podra=/s: see a)podidra=/skw.

a)po - dru/fw, aor. a)pe/druye, subj. a)podru/ywsi, aor. pass. 3 pl. a)pe/drufqen: tear off, strip off; pro\s pe/trh|sin a)po\ xeirw=n r(i=noi\ a)pe/drufqen, Od. 5.435; i(/na mh/ min a)podru/foi e(lkusta/zwn, ‘tear him,’ i. e. abrade the skin, Il. 23.187, Il. 24.21.
a)po-du=/nw = a)podu/omai, put off, ipf., Od. 22.364†.
a)podw=|si: see a)podi/dwmi.
a)po-ei/kw (a)pov.): yield, retire from, Il. 3.406†.
a)poei=pon: see a)pei=pon.
a)po-erga/qw (a)pov.), ipf. a)poe/rgaqe (a)pee/r.): keep away from, remove from, Il. 21.599, Od. 21.221.
a)po-e/rgw (ve/rgw), ipf. a)pe/erge: keep away from, separate, Il. 8.325; ‘drive away,’ Il. 24.238.
a)po/-erse (a)po/v.), defective aor., subj. a)poe/rsh|, opt. a)poe/rseie: sweep away, wash away; mh/ min a)povve/rseie me/gas potamo/s, Il. 21.329, 283, Il. 6.348.
a)po-qauma/zw, aor. a)peqau/mase: marvel at, Od. 6.49†.
a)po/ - qestos (qe/ssasqai): scouted, despised, Od. 17.296†.
a)po-qnh/skw, perf. part. a)poteqnhw/s, plup. a)pote/qnasan: die; perf., be dead.
a)po-qrw/skw, only pres. part.: leap from; nho/s, Il. 2.702, Il. 16.748; kapno/s, ‘up,’ Od. 1.58.
a)po - qu=/mios (qu=mo/s): displeasing, nent. pl., Il. 14.261†.
a)p-oiki/zw, aor. a)pw/|kise: transfer, from an old home to a new one, Od. 12.135†.
a)/-poina, wn (poinh/): ransom, recompense, satisfaction; tino/s, ‘for one,’ Il. 1.111, etc.
a)poi/sw: see a)pofe/rw.
a)p-oi/xomai: be away, gone (from), Od. 4.109, very often the part.; ‘abandon,’ pole/mou, a)ndro/s, *l 408, Il. 19.342.
a)po-kai/numai, only ipf.: excel, Od. 8.127 and 219.
a)po-kei/rw, only aor. 1 mid. a)pekei/rato: shear away, Il. 23.141†.
a)po-khde/w, only aor. part. du. a)pokhdh/sante: proving remiss, ‘through your negligence,’ Il. 23.413†.
a)po-ki=ne/w, aor. subj. a)poki=nh/swsi, iter. a)poki=nh/saske: move from, Il. 11.636 ; tina\ qura=/wn. ‘dislodge,’ Od. 22.107.
a)po-kli=/nw, only aor. part. a)pokli=/nanta: turn off, ‘giving a different turn’ to the interpretation, Od. 19.556†.
a)po - ko/ptw, fut. inf. a)pokoye/men, aor. a)pe/koya: chop off, cut off; parh/oron, ‘cut loose’ the out-running horse (cf. Il. 8.87), Il. 16.474.
a)po-kri=/nw, only aor. pass. a)pokrinqe/nte: separated, ‘separating’ from the ranks of their comrades, Il. 5.12†.
a)po - kru/ptw, aor. a)pe/kruya, inf. a)pokru/yai: hide away, conceal, Il. 11.718, Il. 18.465, Od. 17.286.
a)pokta/men, a)pokta/menai: see a)poktei/nw.

a)po-ktei/nw, aor. 1 a)pe/kteine, usually aor. 2 a)pe/ktane, -e/ktamen, -e/ktanon, subj. a)pokta/nh|, inf. a)pokta/men, -ta/menai, aor. 2 mid. (with pass. signif.) a)pe/ktato, a)pokta/menos: kill, slay; of slaughtering animals, Od. 12.301 ; a)pe/ktato, was slain, Il. 15.437, Il. 17.472 ; a)pokta/menos, slain, Il. 4.494, Il. 13.660, Il. 23.775.

a)po-la/mpw, ipf. act. and mid.: give forth a gleam, be resplendent; trufa/leia, Il. 19.381, pe/plos, Il. 6.295; impers., w(\s ai)xmh=s a)pe/lampe, ‘such was the gleam from the spear,’ Il. 22.319; fig., xa/ris a)pela/mpeto, Od. 18.298.
a)po-lei/bw: only pres. mid. a)polei/betai, trickles off, Od. 7.107†.
a)po-le/pw, fut. inf. a)poleye/men: peel off, ‘lop off,’ ou)/ata, Il. 21.455† (v. l. a)pokoye/men).
a)pole/sketo: see a)po/llu=mi.

a)po - lh/gw, fut. a)po(l)lh/ceis, aor. subj. a)po(l)lh/ch|s, -wsi, opt. a)po(l)lh/ceian: cease from, desist, tino/s, Il. 7.263, n 151, Od. 12.224; with part., Il. 17.565, Od. 19.166; abs., w(\s a)ndrw=n geneh\ h(\ me\n fu/ei h(\ d' a)polh/gei, ‘passes away,’ Il. 6.146, Il. 13.230.
a)pollh/ceis: see a)polh/gw.

a)p-o/llu=mi, fut. a)pole/ssw, aor. a)pw/lesa, mid. a)po/llumai, a)pollu/menos, fut. inf. a)polei=sqai, aor. 2 a)pwlo/mhn, a)po/lonto, iter. a)pole/sketo, opt. 3 pl. a)poloi/ato, perf. 2 a)po/lwlen: I. act.,
lose, destroy; pate/r' e)sqlo\n a)pw/lesa, Od. 2.46; ou) ga\r *)odusseu\s oi)=os a)pw/lese no/stimon h)=mas, Od. 1.354; kei=nos a)pw/lesen *)/ilion i=(rh/n, Il. 5.648; e)kpa/glws a)po/lessan (fh=ras), Il. 1.268.—II. mid., be lost, perish; freq. as imprecation, a)po/loito, *s 107, Od. 1.47.

*)apo/llwn, *<*>)apo/llwnos: Apollo, son of Zeus and Leto, and brother of Artemis, like her bringing sudden, painless death (see a)gano/s); god of the sun and of light, *foi=bos, lukhgenh/s, of prophecy (his oracle in Pytho, Od. 8.79), Il. 1.72, Od. 8.488; but not in Homer specifically god of music and leader of the Muses, though he delights the divine assembly with the strains of his lyre, Il. 1.603; defender of the Trojans and their capital, and of other towns in the Trojan domain, Cilla, Chryse, Il. 1.37, Il. 4.507; epithets, a)kerseko/mhs, a)fh/twr, dii+=/filos, e(kathbo/los, e(/katos, e(khbo/los, e(ka/ergos, i)h/ios, la=osso/<*>s, paih/wn, xru=sa=/oros, *sminqeu/s, *foi=bos.
a)po-lou/omai (lou/w), fut. a)polou/somai: wash from (off oneself), Od. 6.219†.
a)po-lu=mai/nomai (lu=mai/nw), purify oneself of pollution, by bathing as symbolical procedure, Il. 1.313 f.
a)po - lu=manth/r, h=ros: defiler; daitw=n, ‘dinner-spoiler;’ according to others, ‘plate-licker,’ Od. 17.220 and 377.

a)po-lu/w, aor. a)pe/lu=sas, subj. a)polu=/somen, mid. fut. a)polu=so/meqa, aor. part. a)polu=sa/menos: I. act., loose from, release for ransom (Il.)<*> i(/manta qow=s a)pe/lu=se korw/nhs, Od. 21.46; ou)d' a)pe/lu=se qu/gatra kai\ ou)k a)pede/cat) a)/poina, Il. 1.95.—II. mid., loose from oneself, get released for oneself, ransom; a)polu=sa/menos (krh)demnon), Od. 5.349; (pai=das) xalkou= te xru=sou= t' a)polu=so/meqa, Il. 22.50.
a)po-mhni/w, fut. a)pomhni=/sei, aor. part. a)pomhni=/sa=s: be wrathful apart, ‘sulk in anger,’ Il. 2.772, Il. 7.230, Il. 19.62, Od. 16.378.
a)po - mimnh/skomai, aor. a)pemnh/santo: remember something in return (cf. a)podou=nai), Il. 24.428†.

a)p-o/mnu=mi and a)pomnu/w, ipf. a)pw/mnu= and a)pw/mnuen, aor. a)pw/mosa: swear not to do; according to others, swear formally (solemnly), Od. 10.345, Od. 12.303, Od. 18.58 ; o(/rkon, b 377, Od. 10.381. (Od.)

a)po-mo/rgnu=mi, ipf. a)pomo/rgnu=, mid. aor. a)pomo/rcato, part. a)pomorcame/nw: wipe off or away, mid., from oneself; spo/ggw| d' a)mfi\ pro/swpa kai\ a)/mfw xei=r) a)pomo/rgnu=, Il. 18.414; a)pomo/rzato xersi\ pareia=/s, ‘rubbed,’ Od. 18.200.
a)po-mu=qe/omai: only ipf., po/ll' a)pemu=qeo/mhn, said much to dissuade thee, Il. 9.109†.
a)po/naio, a)ponai/ato: see a)poni/nhmi.

a)po-nai/w, only aor. subj. a)pona/sswsi, and aor. mid. a)pena/sseto: remove, of residence; kou/rhn a)/y a/pona<*>sswsin, ‘send back,’ Il. 16.86; mid., *(uperhsi=/hnd' a)pena/sseto, removed, ‘withdrew,’ Od. 15.254, Il. 2.629.

a)po-ne/omai, subj. a=)pone/wntai, inf. a=)pone/esqai, ipf. a=)pone/onto (the a= is a necessity of the rhythm, and the place of these forms is at the end of the verse): return, go home; in Od. 15.308 the word applies to the real Odysseus rather than to his assumed character.
a)po/nhq), a)ponh/menos: see a)poni/nhmi.

a)p-oni/nhmi, mid. fut. a)ponh/setai, aor. 2 a)po/nhto, opt. a)po/naio, -ai/ato, part. a)ponh/menos: mid., derive benefit from, get the good of anything: (tino/s), *)axilleu\s | oi)=os th=s a)reth=s a)ponh/setai, Il. 11.763; ou)d' a)po/nhto, ‘but had no joy’ thereof, Od. 11.324, Od. 16.120, Od. 17.293.
a)poni/ptesqai, a)poni/yate: see a)poni/zw.
a)po-noste/w, only fut. inf. a)ponosth/sein: return home, return, always with a)/y, *a 60, Od. 24.471.

a)po-no/sfi(n), also written as two words, a)po\ or a)/po no/sfi: apart, aside; bh=nai, ei)=nai, kati/sxesqai, Il. 2.233; trape/sqai, Od. 5.350; as prep., with gen., apart from, far from; usually following the governed word, e)meu= a)pono/sfin, Il. 1.541; fi/lwn a)pono/sfin e(tai/rwn, Od. 12.33.
a)p-ocu=/nw (o)cu/s), aor. 1 inf. a)pocu=nai: sharpen off, make taper; e)retma/, z 269, Od. 9.326 (v. l. a)pocu=sai).

a)po-cu=/w (= a)poce/w), aor. inf. a)po-
cu=sai (v. l. a)pocu=nai), Od. 9.326, part. a)pocu=/sa=s: scrape off, smooth off; fig., gh=ras, Il. 9.446†.
a)po-paptai/nw, fut. a)popaptane/ousi: peer away for a chance to flee, ‘look to flight,’ Il. 14.101.†

a)po-pe/mpw, inf. -e/men, fut. a)pope/myw, aor. a)pe/pemya, subj. a)pope/myw, imp. a)po/pemyon: send away or off, dismiss, send away with escort; w(/s toi dw=r' a)pope/myw, Od. 17.76; a)peilh/sa=s d) a)pe/pempen, Il. 21.452; cei/nous ai)doi/ous a)popempe/men h)de\ de/xesqai, Od. 19.316.
a)pope/sh|si: see a)popi=/ptw.
a)po-pe/tomai, only aor. part. a)popta/menos, -e/nh: fly away, Il. 2.71, Od. 11.222.

a)po-pla/zw, only aor. pass. a)pepla/gxqhn, part. a)poplagxqei/s: pass., be driven from one's course, drift (away from); *troi/hqen, Od. 9.259; kata/lecon | o(/pph| a)pepla/gxqhs, Od. 8.573; th=le d' a)pepla/gxqh sa/keos do/ru, ‘rebounded,’ Il. 22.291, Il. 13.592; cf. 578.
a)po-plei/w (ple/w): sail away.
a)po-plh/ssw, aor. part. a)poplh/ca=s: strike off, Od. 10.440.
a)po-plu=/nw, ipf. iter. a)poplu=/neske: wash off, ‘wash up;’ la/iggas poti\ xe/rson, Od. 6.95†.
a)po-plw/w (ple/w), aor. 2 a)pe/plw: sail away from; gai/hs, Od. 14.339†.
a)po - pnei/w (pne/w): breathe forth, exh<*>le.
a)po - pro/: away from, far from; tin<*>/s.
a)poproe/hke: see a)poproi+/hmi.
a)poproelw/n: see a)poproaire/w.
a)po/pro-qen: from afar, far away, aloof, Od. 17.408.
a)po/pro-qi: far away, afar.
a)po-pro-i/hmi, aor. a)poproe/hke: let go forth from, let fly, send away; tina\ po/linde, Od. 14.26; i=)o/n, Od. 22.82; ci/fos xama=ze, ‘let fall,’ Od. 22.327.
a)popta/menos: see a)pope/tomai.
a)po-ptu=w: spit out, Il. 23.781; of a billow, a)poptu=/ei d' a(lo\s a)/xnhn, ‘belches forth,’ Il. 4.426.
a)p - orou/w, aor. a)po/rouse: spring away (from), ‘down’ from, Il. 5.20.
a)po-rrh/gnu=mi (vrh/gnu=mi), aor. part. a)porrh/ca=s: break off, burst off.
a)po-rri=ge/w (vri=ge/w), perf. with pres. signif. a)perri=/ga=si: shrink from with s<*>uddering, be afraid, Od. 2.52†.
a)po-rri=/ptw (vri/ptw), aor. inf. a)porri-yai, part. a)porri=/yanta: fling away; fig., mh=nin, Il. 9.517, Il. 16.282.

a)po - rrw/c, w=gos (vrh/gnu=mi): adj., abrupt, steep; a)ktai/, Od. 13.98; as subst., fragment; *stugo\s u=datos, ‘branch,’ Il. 2.755, Od. 10.514; said of wine, a)mbrosi/hs kai\ ne/ktaro/s e)stin a)porrw/c, ‘morsel,’ ‘drop,’ ‘sample,’ Od. 9.359.
a)po-seu/omai (seu/w), only aor. a)pe/ssuto, -essu/meqa, part. a)pessu/menos: rush away, hurry away, Od. 9.396 ; dw/matos, Il. 6.390.
a)po - ski/dnhmi (= a)poskeda/nnu=mi), aor. a)peske/dase, mid. pres. inf. a)poski/dnasqai: scatter, disperse, dismiss, Od. 11.385, Il. 19.309; mid., disperse, Il. 23.4.
a)po - skudmai/nw: be utterly indignant at; tini/, imp., Il. 24.65†.
a)po-spe/ndw, only part.: pour out a libation. (Od.)
a)po-stado/n and a)po-stada/ (i(/sthmi): adv., standing at a distance, Il. 15.556 and Od. 6.143, 146.
a)po - stei/xw, aor. 2 a)pe/stixe, imp. a)po/stixe: go away, depart, Il. 1.522, Od. 11.132, Od. 12.143.
a)po - sti/lbw: only part., a)posti/lbontes a)lei/fatos, glistening with oil, Od. 3.408†.

a)po-stre/fw, fut. a)postre/yeis, part. -ontas, aor. iter. a)postre/yaske, subj. a)postre/yh|sin, opt. -eien, part. a)po-
stre/ya=s: turn or twist back or about, reversing a former direction; (la=an) a)postre/yaske krataii=/s, the stone of Sisyphus, Od. 11.597 ; po/das kai\ xei=ras, i. e. so as to tie them behind the back, Od. 22.173; ‘recall,’ ‘order a retreat,’ Il. 10.355.
a)po - stufeli/zw, only aor. a)pestufe/lice, -an: smite back, knock back (from); tino/s, Il. 18.158. (Il.)

a)po - sfa/llw, only aor. subj. a)posfh/lwsi, and opt. a)posfh/leie: cause to stray from a straight course, Od. 3.320; met., mh\ (*mene/la=os) me/ga sfas a)posfh/leie po/noio, ‘disappoint’ them of, ‘make vain’ their toil, Il. 5.567.
a)posxe/sqai: see a)pe/xw.
a)po-ta/mnw (= a)pote/mnw): cut away, Il. 8.87; mid., kre/a, cut off for oneself (to eat), Il. 22.347.
a)po-thlou=: far away, Od. 9.117.

a)po-ti/qhmi, aor. 1 a)pe/qhke, mid. aor. 2 a)peqe/mhn, subj. a)poqei/omai, inf. a)poqe/sqai: put away, mid., from oneself, lay off; de/pas a)pe/qhk' e)ni\ xhlw=|, Il. 16.254; teu/xea ka=/l) a)poqe/sqai, *g 89, Il. 18.409; met., krate/rhn a)poqe/sqai e)ni=ph<*>n, Il. 5.492.

a)po-ti=/numai (ti=/nw): exact satisfaction from some one for something; tina/ tinos, cause one to pay you back for something, take vengeance for, Od. 2.73 ; pole/wn a)peti/nuto poinh/n, i. e. avenged many, Il. 16.398.
a)po-tmh/gw (= a)pote/mnw), aor. opt. a)potmh/ceie, part. a)potmh/ca=s: cut off, sever; kli=tu=s a)potmh/gousi xara/drai, ‘score,’ Il. 16.390; fig., cut off, intercept, Il. 10.364, Il. 11.468.
a)/-potmos (po/tmos): luckless, illstarred, Il. 24.388; sup. a)potmo/tatos, Od. 1.219.

a)po - tre/pw, fut. a)potre/yeis, -ousi, aor. 2 a)pe/trape, mid. aor. 2 a)petra/peto: turn away or back, divert from (tina/ tinos); mid., turn away, au)to\s d' a)pono/sfi trape/sqai, ‘avert thy face,’ Od. 5.350 ; au)=tis a)petra/peto, ‘turned back,’ Il. 10.200.
a)po - tri=/bw: only fut., sfe/la= a)potri=/yousi pleura/ (v. l. pleurai/, the converse of the same idea), ‘shall rub off,’ ‘polish off;’ cf. ‘rub down with an oaken towel,’ Od. 17.232†.
a)po/-tropos (tre/pw): live retired, Od. 14.372†.

a)po-trwpa/w (parallel form of a)potre/pw), subj. -w=men, -w=si, mid. ipf. a)petrwpw=nto: turn away from (tino/s); (ku/nes) dake/ein me\n (as far as biting was concerned) a)petrwpw=nto leo/ntwn, Il. 18.585.
a)pou/ra=s, a)pourh/sousi: see a)paura/w.
a)p-ouri/zw (ou)=ros): only fut., a)pouri/ssousin a)rou/ra=s, shall remove the boundary stones of (i. e. appropriate) his fields, Il. 22.489†.
a)po-fe/rw, fut. a)poi/seton, inf. a)poi/sein, aor. 1 a)pe/neikas: bear away, bring away or back, carry home; mu=qon, Il. 10.337; *ko/wnd' a)pe/neikas, by sea, Il. 14.255.
a)pe/fqiqen: see a)pofqi=/nw.
a)po-fqinu/qw: waste away, perish, Il. 5.643; trans., let perish, ‘sacrifice,’ qu=mo/n, Il. 16.540.

a)po - fqi=/nw, aor. mid. a)pefqi/mhn, a)pofqi/mhn, a)pe/fqito, opt. a)pofqi=/mhn, imp. a)pofqi/sqw, part. a)pofqi/menos, aor. pass. a)pefqi/qhn, 3 pl. a)pe/fqiqen: mid. and pass., perish, die, Il. 18.499 ; leugale/w| qana/tw|, Od. 15.358; lugro\n o)/leqron, Od. 15.268.

a)po-fw/lios: good-for-nothing, empty; ou)k a)pofw/lios h)=a | ou)de\ fugopto/lemos, Od. 14.212; no/on d' a)pofw/lio/s e)ssi, Od. 8.177; ou)k a)pofw/lia ei)dw/s, ‘no fool,’ Od. 5.182 ; a)pofw/lioi eu)nai/, ‘unfruitful,’ Od. 11.249.

a)po - yu=/xw, aor. pass. part. a)poyu=xqei/s: leave off breathing; dry off, cool off; ei(=len a)poyu=/xonta, ‘fainting’ (opp. e)pei\ a)/mpnu=to), Od. 24.348 ; i=(drw= a)peyu=/-
xonto xitw/nwn, | sta/nte poti\ pnoih/n, *l 621, Il. 22.2; pass., i=(drw= a)poyu=xqei/s, Il. 21.561.
a)ppe/myei: see a)pope/mpw.

a)/ - prhktos (prh/ssw): without achieving, Il. 14.221; unachieved, fruitless, endless, Il. 2.121, 376; and, in general, of that with which nothing can be successfully done, hopeless, incurable (cf. a)mh/xanos); o)du/nai, Il. 2.79; of Scylla, a)/prhkton a)ni=/hn, Od. 12.223.
a)-pria/thn (pri/amai): adv., without purchase (ransom), Il. 1.99; for nothing, Od. 14.317.
a)-proti/-mastos (ma/ssw): untouched, Il. 19.263†.
a)/-pteros (ptero/n): only th=| d' a)/pteros e)/pleto mu=qos, wingless to her was what he said, i. e. it did not escape her, she caught the idea, Od. 17.57, Od. 19.29, Od. 21.386, Od. 22.398.
a)-pth/n, h=nos (pe/tomai): unfledged, Il. 9.323†.
a)-pto-eph/s, e/s (pto/a=, ptoie/w): fearless (audacious) of speech, Il. 8.209†.
a)-pto/lemos: unwarlike. (Il.)

a(/ptw, aor. part. a(/ya=s, mid. ipf. h(/pteto, fut. a(/yetai, aor. h(/yato (a(/yato), inf. a(/yasqai, part. a(ya/menos, aor. pass. (according to some), e(a/fqh (q. v.): I. act., attach, fasten, Od. 21.408, of putting a string to a lyre.—II. mid., fasten for oneself, cling to, take hold of (tino/s); a(yame/nh bro/xon ai)pu\n a)f' u(yhloi=o mela/qrou, in order to hang herself, Od. 11.278 ; w(s d' o<*>/te ti/s te kuw\n suo\s a)gri/ou h)e\ le/ontos | a(/yhtai kato/pisqe, ‘fastens on’ to him from the rear, Il. 8.339 ; a(/yasqai gou/nwn, kefalh=s, nhw=n, etc.; brw/mhs d' ou)x a(/pteai ou)de\ poth=tos, ‘touch,’ Od. 10.379.
a) - pu/rgwtos (pu/rgos): unwalled, unfortified, Od. 11.264†.
a)/-puros (pu=r): untouched by fire, kettle or tripod, Il. 9.122 and Il. 23.267 (leuko\n e)/t' au)/tws, 268).
a) - pu/rwtos = a)/puros (i. e. brand new), fia/lh, Il. 23.270.

a)p-wqe/w, fut. a)pw/sw, inf. a)pwse/men, aor. a)pe/wse, a)pw=se, subj. a)pw/somen, mid. fut. a)pw/setai, aor. a)pw/sato, -asqai, -a/menon, oi, ous: push or thrust away (tina/ tinos, or e)k tino/s), mid., from oneself; a)pw=sen o)xh=as, ‘pushed back,’ Il. 24.446 ; *bore/hs a)pe/wse, ‘forced back,’ Od. 9.81 (cf. mid., Od. 13.276); qura=/wn a)pw/sasqai li/qon, in order to get out, Od. 9.305 ; mnhsth=ras e)k mega/roio, Od. 1.270.

a)/ra, a)/r (before consonants), r(a, r) (enclitic), always post-positive: particle denoting inference or a natural sequence of ideas, then, so then, so, naturally, as it appears, but for the most part untranslatable by word or phrase; freq. in neg. sentences, ou)d' a)/ra, ou)/t) a)/ra, and joined to rel. and causal words, o(/s t' a)/ra, o(/s r(a/ te, ou(/nek) a)/ra, o(/ti r(a, also following ei)=ta, ga/r, a)lla/, au)ta/r, etc.; further, in questions, and in the apodosis of sentences after me/n and other particles. The following examples will illustrate some of the chief usages: ou)d' a)/ra pws h)=n | e)n pa/ntess' e)/rgoisi dah/mona fw=ta gene/sqai, ‘as it seems,’ Il. 23.670 ; e)k d' e)/qore klh=ros kune/hs, o(/n a)r) h)/qelon au)toi/, ‘just the one’ they wished, Il. 7.182 ; kh/deto ga\r *danaw=n, o(/ti r(a qnh/skontas o(ra=to, ‘even because’ she saw, Il. 1.56 ; ti/s t' a)/r sfwe qew=n e)/ridi cune/hke ma/xesqai, ‘who then’? Il. 1.8 ; au)ta\r a)/ra *zeu\s dw=ke diakto/rw| *)argei+fo/nth|, ‘and then next,’ Il. 2.103 ; au)ta\r e)pei\ po/sios kai\ e)dhtu/os e)c e)/ron e(/nto, | toi=s a)/ra mu=/qwn h)=rxe *gerh/nios i(ppo/ta *ne/stwr, ‘then,’ not temporal, Il. 2.433 ; w)\s a)/ra fwnh/sa=s kat' a)/r) e(/zeto (twice in one sentence, a)/ra in the phrase kat' a)/r) e(/zeto marks the sitting down as the regular sequel of making a speech), Od. 16.213.
a)rabe/w: only in the phrase a)ra/bhse de\ teu/xe) e)p' au)tw=|, clattered as he fell, Od. 24.525, and often in the Iliad.
a)/rabos: chattering of teeth (through fear), Il. 10.375†.
*)araiqure/h: a town in Argolis, Il. 2.571†.
a)raio/s: slender, frail, Il. 5.425, Il. 18.411 ; ei)/sodos, ‘narrow,’ Od. 10.90.
a=)ra/omai: see a=)ra/w.

a)rari/skw (root ar), aor. h)=rsa (a)/rsa), aor. 2 h)/raron (a)/raron), perf. 2 a)/rhra, part. a)rhrw/s, a)rarui=a, a)rhro/s, plup. a)rh/rein, h)rh/rein, aor. pass. 3 pl. a)/rqen, mid. aor. 2 part. a)/rmenos: I. trans. (ipf., aor. 1 and 2 act.), fit on or together, join, fit with; rafters in build
ing a house, Il. 23.712; of constructing a wall, Il. 16.212; joining two horns to make a bow, Il. 4.110 ; nh=) a)/rsa=s e)reth=|sin, ‘fitting out’ with oarsmen, Od. 1.280; pass., ma=llon de\ sti/xes a)/rqen, ‘closed up,’ Il. 16.211; met. (ge/ras), a)/rsantes kata\ qu=mo/n, Il. 1.136; h)/rare qu=mo
 e)dwdh=|, Od. 5.95.—II. intrans. (mid., perf. and plup.), fit close, suit, be fitted with; of ranks of warriors, purghdo
 a)rhro/tes, Il. 15.618; jars standing in a row against the wall, Od. 2.342 ; qu/rai pukinw=s a)rarui=ai, Il. 9.475; po/lis pu/rgois a)rarui=a, ‘provided with,’ Il. 15.737 ; troxo\s a)/rmenos e)n pala/mh|sin, potter's wheel, ‘adapted’ to the hands, Il. 18.600; met., ou) fresi
 h(=|sin a)rhrw/s, Od. 10.553, (mu=qos) pa=sin e)ni\ fresi
 h)/raren (aor. 2 here intr.), Od. 4.777.
a)/raron: see a)rari/skw.
a)ra/xnion (a)ra/xnh): spider's web, pl., Od. 8.280 and Od. 16.35.
