gi/gnomai (root ga), aor. iter. gene/sketo, perf. ge/gone, 3 pl. gega/a=si, inf. gega/men, part. acc. sing. gegaw=ta, pl. -w=tas, plup. gego/nei: become, (of men) be born; the word admits of great variety in paraphrase, but never departs from its meaning of come into being; a)/nqea gi/gnetai, ‘grow’; klaggh\ ge/neto, ‘arose,’ ‘was heard’; poqh\ *danaoi)=si ge/neto, ‘filled,’ ‘they felt’; nw=i no/ston e)/dwke nhusi\ gene/sqai, i. e. the accomplishment of it, Od. 4.173 ; ou)k a)\n e)/moige | e)lpome/nw| to\ ge/noito, I may hope, but this will not ‘happen,’ Od. 3.228 ; pa/nta gigno/menos, Proteus, ‘turning into’ every shape, Od. 4.417 ; e)pi\ nhusi\ gene/sqai, ‘get’ upon the ships, and thus often implying motion, e. g. pro\ o(dou= ge/nonto, ‘progressed,’ Il. 4.382; never of course the same as ei)=nai, but the perf. is sometimes a strong equivalent of the verb of existence, toi=s oi(\ nu=n gega/a=si, who ‘live’ now, Od. 24.84, Od. 13.160, etc.

gignw/skw, fut. gnw/somai, gnw/seai, aor. e)/gnwn, subj. gnw/w, -omen, -wsi, inf. gnw/menai: come to know, (learn to)
know, the verb of insight; gignw/skwn o(/ t' a)/nalkis e)/hn qeo/s, ‘perceiving,’ Il. 5.331 ; a)mfi\ e(\ gignw/skwn e(ta/rous, ‘recognizing,’ Il. 15.241 ; o(mhliki/hn e)ke/kasto | o)/rni=qas gnw=nai, in ‘understanding’ birds, Od. 2.159.
gla/gos, to/ (ga/la): milk, Il. 2.471 and Il. 16.643.
glakto-fa/gos (fagei=n): living on milk, Il. 13.6†.
*glau/kh: a Nereid, Il. 18.39†.
glaukia/w: only part., with gleaming or glaring eyes, of a lion, Il. 20.172†.
glauko/s: gleaming (but with reference to the effect of color, grayishblue); qa/lassa (cf. ‘old ocean's gray and melancholy waste’), Il. 16.34†.
*glau=kos: Glaucus.—(1) the son of Sisyphus, and father of Bellerophon, Il. 6.154 ff.—(2) grandson of Bellerophon, and a leader of the Lycians, Il. 7.13, Il. 6.119.
glauk - w=pis, idos: gleaming - eyed (and with reference to the color, grayish-blue); epith. of the warlike goddess Athēna.
*glafu/rai: a town in Thessaly, Il. 2.712†.
glafuro/s: hollow; often of ships; of the fo/rmigc, Od. 8.257; a grotto, Il. 18.402, Od. 2.20; a harbor, Od. 12.305.
glh/nh: pupil of the eye, Od. 9.390; as term of reproach, kakh\ glh/nh, ‘doll,’ ‘girl,’ coward, Il. 8.164.
glh=nos, eos: pl., jewelry, Il. 24.192†.
*gli=/sa=s, antos: a town in Boeotia, Il. 2.504†.
glouto/s: rump, buttock, Il. 5.66, Il. 8.340. (Il.)
glukero/s (comp. glukerw/teros) = gluku/s.
gluku/qu=mos: sweet-tempered, Il. 20.467†.
gluku/s, ei=a, u/, comp. gluki/wn: sweet; ne/ktar, Il. 1.598; metaph., u(/pnos, i=(/meros, ai)w/n.
glufi/s, i/dos (glu/fw): notch of an arrow; besides the notch for the string there were others to secure a firm hold with the fingers in drawing the bow, Il. 4.122, Od. 21.419.
glw=ssa, hs: tongue, language, Il. 2.804, Il. 4.438.
gnaqmo/s: jaw, cheek; for Od. 20.347, see a)llo/trios.
gnampto/s (gna/mptw): bent, bending; of the limbs of living beings, supple, Od. 13.398; met., no/hma, ‘placable,’ Il. 24.41.
gna/mptw, aor. gna/mya: bend.
gnh/sios (gi/gnomai): genuine, legitimate.
gnu/c (go/nu): adv., with bent knee, upon the knee.
gnw=|, gnw/menai, gnw/omen: see gignw/skw.
gnw/rimos: known to one, an ‘acquaintance,’ Od. 16.9†.
gnwto/s: known; also, related by blood, Il. 3.174; brother, Il. 17.35, etc.

goa/w (go/os), inf. goh/menai, part. goo/wn, goo/wntes (gow=ntes), ipf. go/on, go/wn, iter. goa/asken, fut. goh/setai: wail, esp. in lamentation for the dead; w. acc., bewail, tina/, Il. 6.500, etc.; po/tmon, Il. 16.857.
go/mfos: wooden nail, peg, pl., Od. 5.248†.
gonh/: offspring, Il. 24.539 and Od. 4.755.
*gono/essa: a town in Achaea, near Pellēne, Il. 2.573†.
go/nos, o(: birth, origin; then offspring (son), young, Od. 4.12, Il. 6.191, Od. 12.130.

go/nu, gen. gou/natos and gouno/s, pl. gou/nata and gou=na, gen. gou/nwn, dat. gou/nasi and gou/nessi: knee; go/nu ka/mptein, phrase for sitting down to rest, e)pi\ gou/nessi kaqi/ssa=s, taking upon the ‘lap,’ Il. 9.488, Il. 5.370; freq. as typical of physical strength, ei)so/ke moi fi/la gou/nat' o)rw/rh|, so long as my ‘knees can spring,’ so long as my strength shall last; but oftenest of suddenly failing strength, swooning, death, pollw=n a)ndrw=n u(po\ gou/nat' e)/lu=sen (Helen caused the death of many men); lu/to gou/nata, Od. 4.703, ‘knees were relaxed,’ of Penelope. From the custom of embracing the knees in supplication come the phrases gou=na or gou/nwn labei)=n, a(/yasqai, u(pe\r gou/nwn or gou/nwn li/ssesqai, ‘by’ the knees, ‘by your life’; hence qew=n e)n gou/nasi kei=tai, ‘rests with’ the gods, ‘in the gift’ of the gods, Od. 1.267.
go/on: see goa/w.

go/os: wailing, lamentation; go/on d' w)i=/eto qu=mo/s, ‘his soul was engrossed
with woe,’ he was ready to burst into wailing, Od. 10.248.
goo/w: see goa/w.
*gorguqi/wn: son of Priam and Castianeira, Il. 8.302†.
*gorgw/, ou=s: the Gorgon, a monster that inspired terror by her looks, blosurw=pis, deino\n derkome/nh, Il. 11.36.
*go/rtu=s or *go/rtu=n, u=nos: Gortūna, a city in Crete, Od. 3.294 and Il. 2.646.
gou=n: sometimes written for g' ou)=n.

gouna/zomai (go/nu), fut. gouna/somai: supplicate, beseech, implore, strictly to kneel (elasping the knees of the person addressed, see under go/nu), gou/nwn gouna/zesqai, Il. 22.345, cf. 338 (u(pe\r gou/nwn).
gou/nata, gou/nasi, gou/nessi: see go/nu.
*gouneu/s: leader of two tribes of Pelasgians, Il. 2.748†.
gouno/omai (go/nu)=gouna/zomai, q. v.; foll. by fut. inf. from the sense of ‘vowing’ implied, Od. 10.521. (See cut, from ancient gem, representing Dolon and Ulysses.)
gouno/s: probably (if from go/nu) curve, slope; of hilly places, gouno\n *)aqhnai/wn, Od. 11.323 (cf. Hdt. iv. 99); a)lwh=s, a 193, Il. 18.57.
grai=a: old woman, Od. 1.438†.
*grai=a: a town in Boeotia, Il. 2.498†.
graptu/s, u/os, acc. pl. graptu=s: scrateh, Od. 24.229†.
gra/fw, aor. gra/ye: scratch, graze; o)ste/on, reached by the point of the lance, Il. 17.599 ; sh/mata e)n pi/naki, symbols graven on a tablet, Il. 6.169.
*grh/ni=kos the river Granīcus, which rises in Mount Ida, Il. 12.21†.
grhu=s, grh=us, dat. grhi/, voc. grhu= and grh=u: old woman.
gu/alon: convexity, of cuirass; gua/loisin a)rhro/ta, fitted together of convex plat<*>s, Il. 15.530. See qw/rhc. (Il.)
*gugai/h: li/mnh, the Gygaean lake, in Lydia, near Sardis, Il. 20.391. Also the nymph of this lake, Il. 2.865.

gui=on: only pl., joints, podw=n gui=a, Il. 13.512; then, limbs, members, gui=a le/luntai (see go/nu), ka/matos u(ph/luqe gui=a, gui=a e)lafra\ qei=nai, Il. 5.122; e)k de/os ei(/leto gui/wn, Od. 6.140.
guio/w, fut. guiw/sw: lame, Il. 8.402 and 416.
gumno/s: naked; to/con, taken from its case, Od. 11.607 ; o)isto/s, from the quiver, as we say ‘naked sword,’ Od. 21.417; then, usually, unarmed, Il. 21.50, Il. 22.124.

gumno/w, mid. pres. gumnou=sqai, pass. aor. (e))gumnw/qhn: strip, denude; in Hom. only mid. and pass., Od. 6.222 ; r(ake/wn e)gumnw/qh, ‘threw off,’ we should say, Od. 22.1. Usually of being ‘disarmed,’ gumnwqe/nta braxi=/ona, i. e. unprotected by the shield, Il. 12.389 ; tei=xos e)gumnw/qh, Il. 12.399.
gunaikei=os (gunh/): of women; boulai/, Od. 11.437†.
gunai - manh/s (mai/nomai): womanmad; Paris, Il. 3.39. (Il.)
gu/naios = gunaikei=os, dw=ra, Od. 11.521 and Od. 15.247.
gunh/, gunaiko/s: woman; gunh\ tami/h, de/spoina, grhu=s, a)letri/s, dmwai\ gunai=kes, etc.; wife, Il. 6.160, etc.

*gu=rai/: pe/trai, the Gyraean rocks,
near Naxos, where the lesser Ajax was shipwrecked, Od. 4.500.—Hence, adj., *gu=rai=os, *gu=rai/h pe/trh, Od. 4.507.
gu=ro/s: e)n w)/moisin, round-shouldered, Od. 19.246†.
*gurtia/dhs: son of Gyrtius, Hyrtius, Il. 14.512†.
*gurtw/nh: a town in Pelasgiōtis, on the river Penēus, Il. 2.738†.
gu=/y, du. gu=pe, pl. nom. gu=pes, dat. gu=/pessi: vulture.
gwru=to/s: bow - case, Od. 21.54†. (See cuts, No. 24, from Greek and Assyrian representations.)

div1.head: *d
div1.entryFree: da-: an inseparable prefix, with intensive meaning, cf. da/-skios.

*d*a (the root of dida/skw), aor. 2 act. de/dae, aor. 2 pass. e)da/hn, subj. daei/w, daw=men, inf. dah=nai, dah/menai, fut. dah/somai, perf. deda/hka, part. dedaw/s, dedahko/tes, mid. aor. inf. deda/asqai: (1) teach, only aor. 2 act. de/dae (tina/ ti), Od. 6.233, Od. 8.448, Od. 22.160, w. inf., Od. 20.72.—(2) learn, be instructed, the other forms; w. gen., pole/moio dah/menai, ‘become skilled in,’ Il. 21.487 ; e)meu= dah/seai, ‘from me,’ Od. 19.325; w. acc. ou) dedahko/tes a)lkh/n, Od. 2.61; deda/asqai gunai=kas, ‘find out,’ Od. 16.316.
dah/mwn, onos (root da): skilled in; w. gen., also e)/n tini.
dah=nai, dah/seai, daw=men: see *d*a.
da/htai: see dai/ Od. 24.1.
dai+/: used colloquially in questions; ti/s dai\ o(/mi=los o(/d' e)/pleto, ‘pray, what throng is this?’ Od. 1.225 (vulg. de/), Od. 24.299, Il. 10.408 (vulg. d' ai().
dai+/: see dai+/s.
daida/leos (root dal): cunningly or skilfully wrought or decorated.
daida/llw (root dal): elaborate skilfully, decorate.
dai/dalon (root dal): cunning work, piece of artistic workmanship; usually pl.
*dai/dalos (root dal): a typical name, Daedalus, a famous artist of Crete, Il. 18.592†.

dai+/zw (dai/ Od. 24.2), fut. dai+/cw, pass. perf. part. dedai+gme/nos: cleave, cut asunder; of carving, Od. 14.434, but usually of wounding, hence cut down, slay, Il. 21.147; pass. dedai+gme/non o)ce/i xalkw=|, Il. 18.236, etc.; metaph., two expressions are to be distinguished, e)dai+/zeto qu=mo/s, ‘rent’ with cares, sorrows, Il. 9.9, Od. 13.320, and w(/rmaine dai+zo/menos kata\ qu=mo\n | dixqa/dia, a ‘divided’ mind, Il. 14.20.
dai+-kta/menos: killed in battle, Il. 21.146 and 301.

daimo/nios, in Hom. only voc., daimo/nie, daimoni/h, daimo/nioi: under the influence of a dai/mwn, possessed; used in both good and bad sense, and to be translated according to the situation described in the several passages where it occurs, Il. 1.561, Il. 2.190, 200, Il. 3.399, Il. 4.31, Il. 6.407, Il. 24.194, Od. 4.774, Od. 10.472, Od. 18.15. Od. 23.174.

dai/mwn, onos. divinity, divine power; sometimes equivalent to qeo/s, but esp. of the gods in their dealings with men, Il. 3.420 ; su\n dai/moni, ‘with the help of God,’ kako\s dai/mwn, dai/monos ai)=sa kakh/, etc.; hence freq. ‘fate,’ ‘destiny,’ pa/ros toi dai/mona dw/sw, thy ‘death,’ Il. 8.166.
dai/nu(o): see dai/nu=mi.

dai/nu=mi (dai/ Od. 24.2), imp. 2 sing. dai/nu=, part. dainu/nta, ipf. dai/nu=, fut. inf. dai/sein, mid. pres. opt. dainu=to, -u=/ato, aor. part. daisa/menos: I. act., divide, distribute food, to each his portion, said of the host; dai/nu= dai=ta ge/rousin, Il. 9.70; hence, ‘give a feast, ta/fon, ga/mon, funeral, marriage-feast, Od. 3.309, Il. 19.299.—II. mid., partake of or celebrate a feast, feast (upon); abs., Il. 15.99, Il. 24.63; w. acc., dai=ta, ei)lapi/nhn, kre/a kai\ me/qu, Od. 9.162.
dai+/s (1), i/dos (dai/ Od. 24.1): torch, only pl. (The torch consisted of a number of pine splinters bound together. See cut.)
dai+/s (2): combat, only dat., e)n dai+\ lugrh=|, leugale/h|, *n 286, Il. 14.387.
dai/s, daito/s (dai/nu=mi): feast, banquet, meal; once (in a simile) of a wild animal, Il. 24.43.
dai/th = dai/s: dai/thqen, from the feast, Od. 10.216.
daitreu/w (daitro/s): distribute; esp. of carving meat; of booty, Il. 11.688.
daitro/n: portion, Il. 4.262†.
daitro/s: carver. (See cut.)
daitrosu/nh: art of carving and distributing, Od. 16.253†.
daitu/mwn, onos (daitu/s): banqueter, pl. (Od.)
daitu/s, u/os = dai/s, Il. 22.496.†
*dai/twr: a Trojan, Il. 8.275†.
dai+/ - frwn, onos: (if from dai/ Od. 24.1) fiery-hearted; in Il., of warriors; in Od., in other relations, Od. 8.373, Od. 15.356.

dai/w (1), perf. de/dha, plup. dedh/ein, mid. aor. subj. da/htai: I. trans. (act. exc. perf.), kindle, set in a blaze; dai=e/ oi( e)k koruqo/s te kai\ a)spi/dos a)ka/maton pu=r, the goddess ‘made fire blaze’ from his helmet, etc., Il. 5.5, 7, so pass., Il. 21.376.—II. intrans. (mid. and perf.), blaze, Il. 21.375, Il. 18.227, etc.; met. o)/sse, po/lemos, e)/ris, ma/xh e)noph/ te, Il. 12.35; *)/ossa, Il. 2.93; oi)mwgh/, Od. 20.353.

dai/w (2), only pres. and ipf. mid. and pass., and perf. dedai/atai: divide, mid. distribute, Od. 15.140 and Od. 17.332 ; a)lla/ moi a)mf' *)odush=i dai+/froni dai/etai h)=tor, my heart is ‘rent’ (cf. dai+/zw), Od. 1.48.
da/knw, only aor. 2 da/ke, inf. dake/ein: bite, Il. 18.585; met., fre/nas, ‘stung,’ Il. 5.493. (Il.)
da/kru, pl. da/krua, dat. da/krusi: tear.
da/kruon =da/kru. dakruo/fin, seven times.
dakru-plw/w: swim with tears; of effect of intoxication on the eyes, Od. 19.122†. (Also written as two words.)
dakruxe/wn, ousa: now written as two words, see xe/w.
dakru=/w, aor. e)da/kru=sa, pass. perf. deda/kru=mai: weep, aor. burst into tears; perf. pass., be in tears, Il. 16.7.
da=lo/s (dai/ Od. 24.1): fire-brand.
dama/zw: see da/mnhmi.
da/mar, da/martos (da/mnhmi): wife, always w. gen. of the husband. Cf. opp. parqe/nos a)/dmhs.

da/mnhmi, damna/w, ipf. (e))da/mna=, fut. dama=|, dama/a=|, damo/wsi, aor. e)da/ma(s)sa, pass. da/mnamai, 2 sing. damna=|, pass. aor. 1 e)dmh/qhn, imp. dmhqh/tw, part. dmhqei/s, also e)dama/sqhn, damna/sqh, aor. 2 e)da/mhn, da/mh, 3 pl. da/men, subj. damei/w, damh/h|s, -h/h|, -h/ete, opt. damei/h, 3 pl. -ei=en, inf. -h=nai, -h/menai, part. -ei/s, perf. dedmh/mesqa, part. dedmhme/nos, plup. dedmh/mhn, de/dmhto, de/dmhnto, dedmh/ato, mid. aor. (e))damassa/mhn, subj. dama/ssetai, etc.: tame, subdue, mid., for oneself; of taming, ‘breaking’ animals, Il. 17.77, Od. 4.637 (cf. i(ppoda/mos); subjecting as a wife, Il. 18.432, Il. 3.301 (cf. da/mar); and, generally, of ‘reducing to subjection,’ ‘overcoming,’ in war or otherwise, ‘laying low’ in battle; of things as well as of persons, to\n d' ou) be/los w)ku\ da/massen, Il. 5.106, 391; met., e)/ros qu=mo/n, Il. 14.316, etc.; pass. freq. in all the above relations.
*da/masos: a Trojan, Il. 12.183.
*damastori/dhs: son of Damastor. —(1) Tlepolemus, Il. 16.416.—(2) Agelāus, a suitor of Penelope, Od. 20.321.
damei/w, da/men, damh/h|, damh/menai, damo/wsi: see da/mnhmi.
*dana/h: Danaë, daughter of Acrisius, and mother of Perseus, Il. 14.319.
*danaoi/: the Danaäns, freq. collective designation of the Greeks before Troy.
da=no/s (dai/ Od. 24.1): dry, Od. 15.322†.
da/os, to) (dai/ Od. 24.1): firebrand, torch. (See cut.)
da/ - pedon (pe/don): ground, pavement, floor beaten down hard, esp. in houses, Od. 4.627, floor.
da/ptw, fut. da/yw, aor. e)/daya: tear, rend, devour; strictly of wild animals; fig. of the spear, and of fire, Il. 23.183. (Il.)
*dardani/dhs: son or descendant of Dardanus; Priam, Ilus.
*dardani/h: Dardania, the city founded by Dardanus, Il. 20.216†.
*darda/niai, pu/lai, the Dardanian gate of Troy, Il. 5.789, Il. 22.194, 413.

*darda/nioi, *da/rdanoi, *dardani/wnes, fem. *dardani/des: Dardanians. inhabitants of Dardania; often named in connection with the Trojans, as representatives of the allies, Il. 2.819, 839, Il. 3.456.
*da/rdanos: (1) son of Zeus, the founder of Dardania, and progenitor of the Trojans, Il. 20.215, 219, 304.—(2) son of Bias, Il. 20.460†.
*da/rhs: a priest of Hephaestus, Il. 5.9 and 27.
darqa/nw, aor. e)/draqe: sleep, Od. 20.143†.
dasa/sketo, da/sasqai: see date/omai.
da/-skios (skia/): thick-shaded, Il. 15.273 and Od. 5.470.
dasmo/s (date/omai): division, of booty, Il. 1.166†.
da/sontai, da/ssato: see date/omai.
dasu/-mallos: thick-fleeced, Od. 9.425†.
dasu/s, ei=a, u/: thick, shaggy, Od. 14.49 and 51.

date/omai (dai/ Od. 24.2), ipf. 3 pl. dateu=nto, fut. da/sontai, aor. dassa/meqa, e)da/santo, iter. dasa/sketo, perf. pass. 3 sing. de/dastai: divide with each other, divide (up); patrw/ia, moi/ra=s, lhi/da, kre/a, etc.; of simply ‘cutting asunder,’ Od. 1.112, to\n me\n *)axaiw=n i(/ppoi e)pissw/trois date/onto, Il. 20.394; xqo/na possi\ dateu=nto (h(mi/onoi), Il. 23.121; met., *trw=es kai\ *)axaioi\ | e)n me/sw| a)mfo/teroi me/nos -*)/arhos date/ontai, Il. 18.264.
*dauli/s: a town in Phocis, Il. 2.520†.
da/fnh: laurel, bay, Od. 9.183†.
da-foino/s and da-foineo/s: (blood) red, Il. 18.538; of serpent, jackal, lion, Il. 2.308, Il. 10.23, Il. 11.474.

de/: but, and; strictly neither adversative nor copulative, but used to offset statements or parts of statements; such offsetting or coördination (‘parataxis’) by means of de/, when it appears in place of the to us more familiar subordination of ideas (‘hypotaxis’), gives rise to the translation ‘while,’ ‘though,’ ‘for,’ etc. Hence de/ appears even in the apodosis of conditional or temporal sentences, oi(\ d' e)pei\ ou)=n h)/gerqen.. toi=si d) a)nista/menos mete/fh, when they were all assembled, ‘then’ arose Achilles, Il. 1.57, 137. The other extreme, of an apparently adversative force, is best seen in negative sentences where de/ is (rarely) used for a)lla/, Od. 9.145. With other particles, kai\ (‘also’) de/, (de/) te, a)/ra, au)=, dh/. de/ is placed as second (or third) word in its clause, but a vocative is not counted, Od. 3.247.
-de: inseparable enclitic suffix, appended to accusatives, denoting direction towards; e. g. oi)=ko/nde, doubled in o(/nde do/monde, with ellipsis of do/mon in *)/aido/sde.
de/at(o): defective ipf., appeared, seemed, Od. 6.242†. Cf. doa/ssato.
de/gmenos: see de/xomai.
de/daa, deda/hka: see *d*a.
dedai/atai, de/dastai: see date/omai.
dedai+gme/nos: see dai+/zw.
de/dhe, dedh/ei: see dai/ Od. 24.1.
dedi/a=si: see dei/dw.
dedi/skomai and deidi/skomai (dei/knu=mi): bid welcome or farewell (by gesture), pledge; de/pai+, deciterh=| xeiri/<*> (Od.)
dedmh/ato, dedmhme/nos: see da/mnhmi.
dedokhme/nos: see doka/w.
de/dorke: see de/rkomai.
dedragme/nos: see dra/ssomai.
de/elos = dh=los, Il. 10.466†.
dei= (de/w): ti/ de\ dei= polemize/menai *trw/essin | *)argei/ous; ‘Why should the Greeks be warring with the Trojans?’ Il. 9.337. Elsewhere xrh/ in Homer.
dei/dekto, deide/xatai: see dei/knu=mi.
deidh/mwn, onos (dei/dw): timid, pusillanimous, Il. 3.56†.
dei/dia, dei/diqi: see dei/dw.
deidisko/menos: see dedi/skomai.
deidi/ssomai (dei/dw), fut. inf. deidi/cesqai, aor. inf. deidi/casqai: trans., terrify, scare; intrans., be terrified (in a panic), only Il. 2.190. (Il.)
dei/doika: see dei/dw.

dei/dw (root dvi), fut. dei/somai, aor. e)/deisa (e)/dveisa, hence often --u), perf. dei/doika and dei/dia, dei/dimen, imp. dei/diqi, plup. e)dei/dimen, and (as if ipf.) dei/die: stand in awe of, dread, fear, trans. or intrans.; *di/a ce/nion dei/sa=s, Od. 14.389; o(/ pou/ tis nw=i ti/ei kai\ dei/dee qu=mw=|, Od. 16.306; often in the ordinary sense of fearing, w(\s e)/fat), e)/dveisen d' o( ge/rwn, Il. 1.33.
deielia/w (dei/elos): only aor. part., deielih/sa=s, having made an evening meal, Od. 17.599†.
deikana/omai (dei/knu=mi)=deidi/skomai. depa/essin, e)/pessi, *o 86, Od. 24.410.

dei/knu=mi, fut. dei/cw, aor. e)/deica, dei=ca, mid. perf. dei/degmai, plup. dei/dekto, 3 pl. deide/xato: show, point out, act. and mid.; sh=ma, te/ras, ‘give’ a sign, Od. 3.174; mid. also=deidi/skomai, q. v.; kupe/llois, depa/essi, mu=/qois, *i 671, Od. 7.72.
dei/lh: late afternoon or early evening; e)/ssetai h)\ h)w\s h)\ dei/lh h)\ me/son h)=mar, Il. 21.111†.
dei/lomai: verge towards setting; only ipf., dei/leto t' h)e/lios, ‘was westering,’ Il. 7.289†.
deilo/s (root dvi): (1) cowardly, Il. 1.293, Il. 13.278.—(2) wretched (wretch), miserable; esp. in phrase deiloi=si brotoi=sin, and a)= deile/, deilw/, deiloi/.
dei=ma (dei/dw): fear, Il. 5.682†.
dei/mato, dei/momen: see de/mw.
*dei=mos (dei/dw): Terror, a personification, Il. 4.440. (Il.)

deino/s (root dvi): dreadful, terrible; often adv., deino\n a)u=sai, deina\ i)dw/n, etc.; in good sense, deino/s t' ai)doi)=o/s te, i. e. commanding reverence, Od. 8.22; cf. Il. 3.172, where the scansion is to be noted, e(/kure dveino/s te.
dei/ous, gen.: see de/os.
deipne/w (dei)=pnon), plup. dedeipnh/kei(n): take a meal.
dei/pn - hstos (deipne/w): meal-time (afternoon), Od. 17.170†.
deipni/zw, aor. part. deipni/ssa=s: entertain at table, Od. 4.435 and Od. 11.411.
dei=pnon (cf. da/ptw): the principal meal of the day (usually early in the afternoon, cf. a)/riston, do/rpon), mealtime, repast; of food for horses, Il. 2.383.
dei/ra=s: see de/rw.
deirh/, h=s: neck, throat.
deiro-tome/w (te/mnw): cut the throat, behead.
*deis-h/nwr: a Lycian, Il. 17.217†.
de/ka: ten.
deka/kis: ten times.
de/kas, ados: a company of ten, decade.
deka/-xi=loi: ten thousand.
de/kths (de/xomai): beggar, mendicant, Od. 4.248†.
de/kto: see de/xomai.
delfi=/s, i=nos: dolphin, Il. 21.22 and Od. 12.96.

de/mas (de/mw): frame, build of body; joined with ei)=dos, fuh/, and freq. with adjectives as acc. of specification, mi=kro/s, a)/ristos, etc.—As adv., like (instar), ma/rnanto de/mas puro\s ai)qome/noio, Il. 11.596.
de/mnion: pl., bedstead, bed.
de/mw, aor. e)/deima, subj. dei/momen, pass. perf. part. dedmhme/nos, plup. (e))de/dmhto, mid. aor. (e))dei/mato: build, construct, mid. for oneself.
dendi/llw: only part., directing sidelooks, ‘with significant looks,’ ‘winks,’ Il. 9.180†.
de/ndreon: tree; dendre/w|, dendre/wn, *g 152, Od. 19.520.
dendrh/eis, essa, en: full of trees, woody.
*decame/nh (‘Cistern’): a Nereid, Il. 18.44†.
*decia/dhs: son of Dexius, Iphinous, Il. 7.15.
decih/ (fem. of decio/s): right hand, then pledge of faith.
decio/s: right-hand side, hence propitious (cf. a)ristero/s), o)/rni=s, Od. 15.160; e)pi\ decia/, decio/fin, ‘on the right,’ Il. 13.308.
decitero/s = decio/s. deciterh=fi, *w 284, Od. 15.148. Subst., deciterh/ = decih/.
de/co: see de/xomai.
deo/ntwn: see de/ Od. 24.2; better reading dide/ntwn, see di/dhmi.
de/os, gen. dei/ous (root dvi): fear, dread.
de/pas (cf. da/ptw), dat. de/pai+ and de/pai, pl. de/pa=, gen. depa/wn, dat. depa/essi and de/passi: drinking cup, beaker; a remarkable one described, Il. 11.632 ff. (See cut.)

de/rkomai, ipf. iter. derke/sketo, aor. 2 e)/drakon, perf. w. pres. signif. de/dorka: look, see, strictly of the darting glance of the eye; pu=r o)fqalmoi=si dedorkw/s, Od. 19.446; deino\n derkome/nh, ‘with dreadful glance,’ of the Gorgon, Il. 11.37; typically of life, e)meu= zw=ntos kai\ e)pi\ xqoni\ derkome/noio, while I live and ‘see the light of day,’ Il. 1.88, Od. 16.439; with obj. accusative, Il. 13.86, Il. 14.141.
derma/tinos: leathern.
de/ron: see de/rw.
de/rw, ipf. e)/deron, de/ron, aor. e)/deira: flay.
de/sma, atos (de/ Od. 24.2): only pl., bonds; of a woman's head-band, Il. 22.468. (See cut No. 8).
desmo/s (de/ Od. 24.2): any (means of) binding, fastening, fetter, imprisonment, pl., bonds; a)/neu desmoi=o me/nousin | nh=es, i. e. without mooring, Od. 13.100; of a latch-string, Od. 21.241, etc.
de/spoina (fem. of despo/ths): mistress; with gunh/ and a)/loxos, ‘lady,’ Od. 3.403, Od. 7.347.
deth/ (de/ Od. 24.2): pl., faggots; kaio/menai, Il. 11.554 and Il. 17.663.
deuh/sesqai: see deu/w.
*deukali/dhs: son of Deucalus (Deucalion), Idomeneus, Il. 12.117.
*deukali/wn: Deucalion.—(1) son of Minos, king of Crete, Il. 13.451 ff., Od. 19.180 ff.—(2) a Trojan, Il. 20.478.

deu=ro, deu/rw: hither; often w. imp., or subj. of exhortation, and sometimes in hortatory sense without a verb, a)ll' a)/ge deu=ro, ei) d) a)/ge deu=ro, etc.; also without definite reference to motion, deu=r' a)/ge peirhqh/tw, ‘come on,’ let him try, Od. 8.205, 145
deu/tatos (sup. of deu/teros): last.
deu/teros: second, next; ta\ deu/tera, ‘the second prize,’ Il. 23.538.—Adv., deu/teron, secondly, again.
deu/w (1), ipf. e)/deue, deu=e, iter. deu/eskon, pass. pr. deu/etai, ipf. deu/eto, -onto: wet, moisten; as mid., (la/ros) ptera\ deu/etai a(/lmh|, Od. 5.53.

deu/w (2) (de/vw), of act. only aor. 1 e)deu/hse, mid. deu/omai, opt. 3 pl. deuoi/ato, ipf. e)deuo/mhn, fut. deuh/somai: act. (aor. 1), lack; e)deu/hsen d' oi)h/ion a)/kron i(ke/sqai, ‘came short’ of reaching the end of the rudder, Od. 9.540; mid., be lacking or wanting in, be without or away from, inferior to (tino/s); ou)de/ ti qu=mo\s e)deu/eto daito\s e)i=/shs, Il. 1.468, etc.; also abs., deuo/menos, Il. 1.134; ma/xhs a)/ra pollo\n e)deu/eo, Il. 17.142, Il. 13.310; pa/nta deu/eai *)argei/wn, Il. 23.484.
de/xatai, de/xqai: see de/xomai.

de/xomai, 3 pl. de/xatai, fut. de/comai, aor. (e))deca/mhn, perf. de/degmai, imp. de/deco, fut. perf. dede/comai, aor. 2 e)de/gmhn, e)/dekto, de/kto, imp. de/co, inf. de/xqai, part. de/gmenos: receive, accept, await; of taking anything from a person's hands (tino/s ti or tini/ ti), de/cato/ oi( skh=ptron, Il. 2.186; so of accepting sacrifices, receiving guests hospitably, ‘entertain,’ cei/nous ai)doi/ous a)popempe/men h)de\ de/xesqai, Od. 13.316; in hostile sense, of receiving a charge of the enemy (here esp. de/xatai, de/degmai, e)de/gmhn, de/gmenos, dede/comai), to/nde dede/comai douri/, Il. 5.238; in the sense of ‘awaiting’ (here esp. aor. 2) freq. foll. by ei)so/ke, o(po/te, etc.; de/gmenos *ai)aki/dhn, o(po/te lh/ceien a)ei/dwn, ‘waiting till Achilles should leave off singing,’ Il. 9.191.—Intrans., w(/s moi de/xetai kako\n e)k kakou= ai)ei/, ‘succeeds,’ Il. 19.290.
de/yw, aor. part. deyh/sa=s: knead (to soften), Od. 12.48†.
de/vw (1) (de/vw): only aor., dh=sen, stood in need of, Il. 18.100†. (dei=, see separately.)

de/w (2), imp. 3 pl. deo/ntwn (better reading dide/ntwn), ipf. de/on, fut. inf. dh/sein, aor. e)/dhsa, dh=sa, mid. ipf. de/onto, aor. e)dh/sato, iter. dhsa/sketo, plup. de/deto, de/dento: bind, fasten; mid., for oneself, o(/pla a)na\ nh=a, ‘making fast their’ tackle, Od. 2.430; metaph., h(me/te-
ron de\ me/nos kai\ xei=ras e)/dhsen, Il. 14.73; o(/s ti/s m' a=)qana/twn peda/a=| kai\ e)/dhse keleu/qou (gen. of separation), Od. 4.380, Od. 8.352.

dh/: now, just, indeed, really, etc.; a particle marking degree of time, quality, or emphasis, mostly untranslatable by a single word; postpositive except in the initial phrases dh\ to/te, dh\ ga/r, dh\ pa/mpan, Il. 19.342; kai\ dh/ moi ge/ras au)to\s a)fairh/sesqai a)peilei=s, and ‘here now,’ Il. 1.161 ; o)ktw\ dh\ proe/hka o)istou/s, ‘full eight already,’ Il. 8.297 (so often w. numerals); appended to adverbs of time, o(/te dh/, o)ye\ dh/, to adjectives (esp. superlatives, ka/rtistoi dh/, ‘the very mightiest’), to relative and interrogative pronouns, and to other particles, w(s dh/, ironical; ei) dh/, if ‘really’; a)lla\ dh/, (ga\r) dh/ (scilicet enim); esp. in wishes or commands, mh\ dh/, ‘only’; i)/qi dh/, a)/ge dh/, etc. dh/ often coalesces with a following long vowel or diphthong (‘synizesis’), dh\ au)=te, dh\ ou(/tws (not to be written d)).
dhqa/, dh/q): long, a long time.
dhqu=/nw (dhqa/): linger, tarry.
*dhi-ko/wn: a Trojan, Il. 5.533 ff.

dh/ios (dai/ Od. 24.1): burning, blazing; pu=r, Il. 2.415; met., destroying, hostile, pl., enemies, Il. 2.544 ; dh/ion a)/ndra, Il. 6.481. To be read with synizesis in several forms, dhi/oio, dhi/w|, etc.
*dhiopi=/ths: a son of Priam, Il. 11.420†.
dhioth/s, h=tos (dh/ios): conflict, combat.
*dhi/-oxos: a Greek, Il. 15.341†.

dhio/w, dh|o/w (dh/ios), opt. 3 pl. dhio/w|en, pass. ipf. 3 pl. dhio/wnto: slay, cut down, destroy; with acc., and often also dat. instr., e)/gxei+, xalkw=|, etc.; e)/gxei+ dhio/wn peri\ *patro/kloio qano/ntos, ‘battling,’ Il. 18.195.
*dhi/-pulos: companion at arms of Sthenelus, Il. 5.325†.
*dhi/-puros: a Greek, Il. 13.576.
*dhi/-fobos: Deïphobus, son of Priam and Hecuba, a prominent warrior of the Trojans, Il. 12.94, Od. 4.276.

dhle/omai, fut. dhlh/somai, aor. (e))dhlh/santo: harm, slay, lay waste; tina\ xalkw=|, Od. 22.368; karpo/n, Il. 1.156; abs., Il. 14.102; met., mh/ tis u(perbasi/h| *dio\s o(/rkia dhlh/shtai, Il. 3.107.
dh/lhma: destruction; of winds, dhlh/mata nhw=n, ‘destroyers,’ Od. 12.286.
dhlh/mwn, onos: harming, destructive; subst., destroyer, Od. 18.85.
*dh=los: Delos, the island sacred as the birthplace of Apollo and Artemis, Od. 6.162†.
*dhmh/thr, *dhmh/teros and *dh/mhtros: Demēter (Ceres), Il. 14.326, Od. 5.125, Il. 2.696.
dhmio-ergo/s (ve/rgon): worker for the community, craftsman; of the seer, physician, joiner, bard, Od. 17.383 ff.

dh/mios, 2 (dh=mos): pertaining to the community, of the people, public; prh=cis d' h(/d) i)di/h, ou) dh/mios, Od. 3.82; dh/mia pi=/nousin, ‘the public wine’ (cf. gerou/sios oi)=nos, Il. 4.259), Il. 17.250.
dhmo - bo/ros (bibrw/skw): peopledevouring, epithet of reproach, Il. 1.231†.
dhmo-ge/rwn: elder of the people; of Trojan worthies, Il. 3.149 and Il. 11.372.
*dhmo/-dokos: Demodocus, the blind bard of the Phaeacians, Od. 8.44. (Od.)
dhmo/qen: from among the people, Od. 19.197†.
*dhmo-ko/wn: a son of Priam, Il. 4.499†.
*dhmo-le/wn: a son of Antēnor, Il. 20.395†.
*dhmo-pto/lemos: a suitor of Penelope, Od. 22.266.
dhmo/s: fat; of men, Il. 8.380, Il. 11.818.
*dhm-ou=xos: a Trojan, son of Philētor, Il. 20.457.
dh/n (dvh/n, cf. diu): long, a long time; ou)/ti ma/la dvh/n, | Il. 13.573 ; ou)d' a)/r) e)/ti dvh/n, | Od. 2.36. Note the scansion.
dhnaio/s (dvh/n): long-lived, Il. 5.407†.
dh=nos: only pl., dh/nea, counsels, arts.
dh|o/w: see dhio/w.

dhria/omai, dhri/omai (dh=ris), inf. dhria/asqai, imp. dhriaa/sqwn, ipf. dhrio/wnto, aor. dhri=/santo, aor. pass. dep. dhrinqh/thn: contend; mostly with arms, tw\ peri\ *kebrio/na=o le/onq' w(\s dhrinqh/thn, Il. 16.756; less often with words, e)kpa/glois e)pe/essin, Od. 8.76, 78, Il. 12.421.
dhro/s (dvh/n): long; xro/non, Il. 14.206, 305; usually adv., dhro/n, e)pi\ dvhro/n, Il. 9.415.
dhsa/sketo: see de/ Od. 24.2.
dh=se: see de/ Od. 24.1 and de/ Od. 24.2.
dh/w, pres. w. fut. signif., only dh/eis, dh/omen, dh/ete: shall or will find, reach, attain.
*di/a: see *zeu/s.

dia/ (cf. du/o): between, through, originally denoting severance.—I. adv. (here belong the examples of ‘tmesis’ so-called), dia\ d' e)/ptato pikro\s o)isto/s, Il. 5.99; dia/ t) e)/tresan a)/lludis a)/llos (defined by a)/lludis a)/llos), Il. 17.729 ; dia\ kth=sin date/onto, ‘between’ themselves, Il. 5.158 ; kle/os dia\ cei=noi fore/ousin, ‘abroad,’ Od. 19.333; freq. with an explanatory gen. in the same clause, thus preparing the way for the strict prepositional use, dia\ d' h(=ke sidh/rou, Od. 21.328; dia\ d) au)tou= pei=ren o)do/ntwn, Il. 16.405; with another adv., dia\ d' a)mpere/s, ‘through and through,’ Il. 11.377, etc.— II. prep., (1) w. gen., (ai)/glh) di) ai)qe/ros ou)rano
 i(=ken, Il. 2.458; dia\ nh/sou i)w/n, ‘along through,’ Od. 12.335 ; o(\ d' e)/prepe kai\ dia\ pa/ntwn, ‘among,’ ‘amid,’ Il. 12.104.—(2) w. acc., local (temporal) and causal; dia\ dw/mata poipnu=/onta, Il. 1.600; fig., mu=qon, o(
 ou)/ ken a)nh/r ge dia\ sto/ma pa/mpan a)/goito, Il. 14.91; mh/ pws kai\ dia\ nu/kta karhkomo/wntes *)axaioi\ | feu/gein o(rmh/swntai, ‘during’ the night, Il. 8.511 ; di) a)tasqali/a=s e)/paqon kako/n, ‘by reason of,’ Od. 23.67 ; kai\ nh/ess' h(gh/sat) *)axaiw=n -*)/ilion ei)/sw | h(
 dia\ mantosu/nhn, ‘through,’ ‘by means of,’ Il. 1.72.—The first syllable of dia/ is lengthened at the beginning of some verses, Il. 3.357, Il. 4.135, Il. 7.251, Il. 11.435.

dia - bai/nw, inf. diabaine/men, aor. 2 die/bhn, inf. diabh/menai, part. diaba=/s: step apart (of the position of the legs, see bai/nw); eu)= diaba=/s, ‘planting himself firmly,’ Il. 12.458; go through, cross, ta/fron, Il. 12.50; ei)s *)/hlida, Od. 4.635.
dia-gignw/skw, aor. 2 inf. diagnw=nai: recognize distinctly, distinguish. (Il.)
dia-gla/fw, aor. part. diagla/ya=sa: scoop out, Od. 4.438†.
di-a/gw, aor. 2 dih/gagon: carry across or over, Od. 20.187†.
dia - de/rkomai, aor. opt. diadra/koi: look through at, Il. 14.344†.
dia - dhle/omai, aor. diedhlh/santo: tear in pieces, Od. 14.37†.
di-a/ei: see dia/hmi.
dia-ei/domai (diav.), fut. diaei/setai: appear through, be discernable, Il. 13.277; causative, h(\n a)reth\n diaei/setai, ‘will give his prowess to be seen,’ Il. 8.535.
diaeipe/men: see diei=pon.
di - a/hmi, ipf. dia/ei (dia/h): blow through, Od. 5.478 and Od. 19.440.
dia - qeio/w (qe/eion): fumigate with sulphur, Od. 22.494†.
dia-qru/ptw, aor. pass. part. diatrufe/n: break in pieces, shiver, Il. 3.363†.
diai/nw, aor. e)di/hne: wet, moisten. (Il.)
dia-kei/rw, aor. inf. diake/rsai: cut short, frustrate, Il. 8.8†.
dia - kla/w, aor. part. diakla/ssa=s: break in twain, Il. 5.216†.
dia-kosme/w, aor. mid. diekosmh/santo, aor. pass. opt. diakosmhqei=en: dispose, marshal, put in order, mid., me/garon, Od. 22.457.
dia-krido/n (kri=/nw): decidedly; a)/ristos, Il. 12.103 and Il. 15.108.

dia-kri=/nw, fut. diakrine/ei, aor. die/kri=ne, opt. diakri=/neie, pass. aor. diekri/qhn, 3 pl. die/kriqen, opt. diakrinqei=te, inf. diakrinqh/menai, part. -qe/nte, -qe/ntas, perf. part. diakekrime/nos, mid. fut. inf. diakrine/esqai: part, separate, distinguish; (ai)po/lia) e)pei/ ke nomw=| mige/wsin, Il. 2.475; of parting combatants, maxhso/meq' ei)so/ke dai/mwn | a)/mme diakri=/nh|, Il. 7.292; ‘distinguish,’ Od. 8.195; freq. in passive.

dia/ktoros: runner, guide; epith. of Hermes as messenger of the gods and conductor of men and of the shades of the dead, Il. 24.339, Od. 24.1. (Formerly connected with dia/gw, now generally with diw/kw. The traditional derivation is not less probable because more obvious.)
dia-le/gomai: only aor. mid., ti/h moi tau=ta fi/los diele/cato qu=mo/s, thus ‘hold converse’ with me, Il. 11.407, Il. 17.97, Il. 22.122.
di-ama/w, aor. dia/mhse: cut through, Il. 3.359 and Il. 7.253.
diamelei+sti/: see melei+sti/.
dia-metre/w: measure off, Il. 3.315†.
dia - metrhto/s: measured off, laid off, Il. 3.344†.
dia-moira/omai (moi=ra): portion out, Od. 14.434†.

di - am - pere/s (pei/rw): piercing through, through and through; ‘in unbroken succession,’ Il. 7.171, Od. 22.190, Od. 14.11; of time, forever, constantly, with ai)ei/, h)/mata pa/nta, *o 70, Od. 4.209. (Sometimes dia\ d' a)mpere/s, Il. 11.377, *r 309, Od. 21.422.)

di-a/n-dixa (di/xa): between two ways, in two ways; mermhri/zein, ‘between two resolves,’ foll, by h)/, h)=, Il. 13.455; soi\ de\ dia/ndixa dw=ke, ‘a divided gift’ (i. e. only one of two gifts), Il. 9.37.
di - anu/w, aor. dih/nusen: finish, Od. 21.517†.
dia-pe/rqw, aor. 1 die/persa, aor. 2 die/praqon: utterly sack or destroy; aor. mid. diepra/qeto, w. pass. signif., Il. 15.384.
dia - pe/tomai, aor. die/ptato: fly through, fly away out, Od. 1.320.
dia - plh/ssw, aor. inf. diaplh=cai: strike asunder, cleave, split.
dia-porqe/w = diape/rqw, Il. 2.691†.
diapraqe/ein: see diape/rqw.
dia-prh/ssw: pass through or over, accomplish, finish; with part., Il. 9.326, Od. 14.197.
dia-pro/: right through, through and through, with and without gen.
dia - pru/sion: adv., reaching far and wide, Il. 17.748; piercingly, h)/u=sen, Il. 8.227.
dia - ptoie/w: startle and scatter, Od. 18.340†.
di-arpa/zw: seize and tear to pieces, Il. 16.355†.
dia-rrai/w, fut. diarrai/sw, aor. inf. diarrai=sai: utterly shatter, overthrow, destroy; fut. mid. w. pass. signif., Il. 24.355.
dia-rri=/ptw (vri=/ptw): shoot through, Od. 19.575†.
dia-seu/omai: only aor. 3 sing. die/ssuto, rushed through, hastened through; with acc. and w. gen.

dia-ski/dnhmi, 3 pl. diaski/dna=si, aor. dieske/dase, opt. diaskeda/seie: scatter, disperse; nh=a, ‘scatter in fragments,’ ‘shatter,’ Od. 7.275; fig., a)glai+/a=s, ‘scatter to the winds,’ put an end to, Od. 17.244.
dia-skopia/omai: spy out, Il. 10.388 and Il. 17.252.
dia - sxi/zw, aor. act. die/sxise, aor. pass. diesxi/sqh: cleave asunder, sever, Od. 9.71 and Il. 16.316.

dia-tmh/gw, aor. inf. diatmh=cai, aor. 2 die/tmagon, aor. 2 pass. dietma/ghn, 3 pl. die/tmagen: cut apart, cleave, separate; diatmh/ca=s, sc. *trw=as, Il. 21.3; fig., nhxo/menos me/ga lai=tma die/tmagon, h 276, Od. 5.409; freq. pass. as dep., tw/ g' w(\s bouleu/sante die/tmagen, ‘parted,’ Il. 1.531.
dia - tre/xw, aor. 2 die/dramon: run through or over, Od. 3.177 and Od. 5.100.
dia-tre/w, aor. die/tresan: flee in different directions, scatter in flight. (Il.)

dia-tri=/bw, aor. part. diatri=/ya=s: rub apart, r(i/zan xersi/, Il. 11.846; met., waste time, delay, put off; diatri=/bein *)axaiou\s ga/mon (acc. of specification), Od. 2.204 ; o(doi=o (gen. of separation, sc. e(tai/rous), Od. 2.404.
dia-tru/gios (tru/gh): bearing (strictly, ‘to be gathered’) in succession, Od. 24.342†.
diatrufe/n: see diaqru/ptw.
dia - fai/nomai: be visible through, tino/s, *q 491, Il. 10.199; glow throughout, Od. 9.379.
dia-fqei/rw, fut. diafqe/rsei, perf. die/fqoras: utterly destroy; perf., intrans., ‘thou art doomed,’ Il. 15.128.
dia-fra/zw, only aor. 2 diepe/frase: indicate distinctly, tell fully, give directions, Od. 6.47.
di-afu/ssw, aor. dih/fuse: draw off entirely, consume; tear away (by ripping), pollo\n de\ dih/fuse sarko\s o)do/nti (su=s), Od. 19.450. Cf. a)fu/ssw.
dia-xe/w: only aor. 3 pl. die/xeuan, quartered (cut in large pieces, opp. mi/stullon).
dida/skw (root da), aor. (e))di/daca, pass. perf. inf. dedida/xqai: teach, pass., learn; didasko/menos pole/moio, ‘a beginner, tiro in fighting,’ Il. 16.811.
di/dhmi (parallel form of de/ Od. 24.2), ipf. 3 sing. di/dh, imp. dide/ntwn (v. l. deo/ntwn): bind, Il. 1.105 and Od. 12.54.
diduma=/wn, onos: only dual and pl., twin - brothers, twins; with pai=de, Il. 16.672.
di/dumos (du/o): twofold; pl. subst., twins, Il. 23.641.

di/dwmi, dido/w, besides reg. forms also didoi)=s, didoi)=sqa, inf. dido/men, didou=nai, imp. di/dwqi, di/dou, ipf. (e))di/dou, 3 pl. di/dosan, di/don, fut. didw/somen, inf. didw/sein, dwse/menai, aor. 3 pl. do/san, subj. dw/h|, dw/omen, dw/wsin, inf. do/men(ai), aor. iter. do/skon: give, grant, pres. and ipf. offer, e(/dna dido/ntes, n
378; freq. w. epexegetical inf., (kune/hn) dw=ke ceinh/ion ei)=nai, Il. 10.269; of ‘giving over’ in bad sense, kusi/n, a)xe/essi, etc.; giving in marriage, Od. 4.7.
di/e: see di/w.
die/dramon: see diatre/xw.
di-ei=pon, diaei=pon (vei=pon), inf. diaeipe/men, imp. di/eipe: tell or talk over fully, Il. 10.425 and Od. 4.215.
di-ei/romai: inquire of or question fully, ti\, and tina/ ti.
di-e/k: out through, tino/s.
di-elau/nw, only aor. dih/lase: drive through, thrust through, tino/s ti.
dielqe/men: see die/rxomai.
di/emai (cf. di/w), 3 pl. di/entai, inf. di/esqai: be scared away, flee; staqmoi=o di/esqai, ‘from the fold,’ Il. 12.304 ; pedi/oio di/entai, ‘speed over the plain,’ Il. 23.475.
di-e/c-eimi (ei)=mi): go out through, Il. 6.393†.
di - ec - ere/omai: inquire thoroughly about, Il. 10.432†.
diepe/frade: see diafra/zw.
die/praqon: see diape/rqw.
die/ptato: see diape/tomai.
di-e/rgw, only ipf. die/vergon: hold apart, Il. 12.424†.
di-ere/ssw: only aor. dih/resa, paddled hard, xersi/, Od. 12.444 and Od. 14.351.
diero/s: doubtful word, living, Od. 6.201, quick, Od. 9.43.
di - e/rxomai, fut. inf. dieleu/sesqai, aor. dih=lqon: pass through, with acc. and with gen.
di-e/ssuto: see diaseu/omai.
die/tmagen: see diatmh/gw.
di-e/xw, only aor. 2 die/sxe, intrans.: reach through, penetrate through.
di/zhmai, fut. dizhso/meqa: go to seek, seek, seek to win, w. acc.; abs., e(/kastos mna=/sqw e)e/dnoisin dizh/menos, Od. 16.391.
di/-zuc, ugos (zeu/gnu=mi): pl., yoked two abreast, Il. 5.195 and Il. 10.473.
di/zw (di/s): only ipf. di/ze, was in doubt, debated, Il. 16.713†.
*di=/h: a small island near Cnossus in Crete, Od. 11.325.
dihko/sioi: two hundred.
di-hnekh/s, e/s (h)/negka): continuous, unbroken, long.—Adv., dihneke/ws, from beginning to end, at length, minutely.
dih/resa: see diere/ssw.
di/htai: see di/w.
di-ikne/omai, fut. dii/comai, aor. 2 sing. dii=/keo: go through, in narration, Il. 9.61 and Il. 19.186.
dii=-peth/s, e/os (*dio/s, pi=/ptw): fallen from Zeus, i. e. from heaven, epith. of rivers.
di-i/sthmi, only intr., aor. 2 diasth/thn, die/sthsan, part. diasta/ntes, perf. die/stamen, mid. ipf. dii/stato: stand apart, separate; met., diasth/thn e)ri/sante, Il. 1.6.
dii=/-filos: dear to Zeus; epith. of heroes, once of heralds, Il. 8.517, and once of Apollo, Il. 1.86.
dika/zw (di/kh), aor. di/kasan, imp. dika/ssate: act., of the judge, pronounce judgment, decide; mid., of the parties, seek justice, contend, Od. 11.545, Od. 12.440.
di/kaios (di/kh), -o/teros, -o/tatos: right, righteous, just.—Adv., dikai/ws.
dikas - po/los (pe/lw): dispenser of justice, judge; with a)nh/r, Od. 11.186.

di/kh: usage, custom, hence right, justice; au(/th di/kh e)sti\ brotw=n, the ‘inevitable way,’ Od. 11.218 ; mnhsth/rwn ou)x h(/de di/kh to\ pa/roiqe te/tukto, Od. 18.275; h(\ ga\r di/kh, o(ppo/te pa/trhs | h(=s a)pe/h|sin a)nh/r, Od. 19.168; di/kh| h)mei/yato, ‘in the way of justice,’ ‘with an appeal to justice,’ Il. 23.542; pl., judgments, decisions, Od. 11.570.
di-kli/s, i/dos (kli=/nw): double-folding, of doors and gates, Il. 12.455. (See cut, representing ancient Egyptian doors.)
di/ktuon: net, for fishing, Od. 22.386†.

di=neu/w and di=ne/w (di=/nh), ipf. e)di=/neuon, (e))di=/neon, iter. di=neu/eske, aor. part. di=nh/sa=s, pass. ipf. e)di=neo/mesqa, aor. di=nhqh/thn, -qh=nai, -qei/s: turn
round and round, whirl; of a quoit, h(=ke de\ di=nh/sa=s, sent it ‘whirling,’ i. e. making it whirl, Il. 23.840; of ‘twirling’ the heated stake thrust into the eye of the Cyclops, e)n o)fqalmw=| di=ne/omen, Od. 9.388; intrans. and pass., of dancers and tumblers, Il. 18.494, Od. 4.19; birds circling in the air, Il. 23.875; eyes rolling, Il. 19.680; and persons roaming about, Od. 9.153, Od. 18.63.
di=/nh: eddy, of a river, *f.
di=nh/eis, entos: eddying.
di=nwto/s (di=no/w): turned, rounded; freely applied to ornamental work, Il. 13.407, Od. 19.56.
dio-genh/s, e/os: descended from Zeus, Zeus-born, epith. of kings.
*dio/qen: from Zeus, by command of Zeus.
di-oi+steu/w, fut. inf. dioi+steu/sein, aor. dioi+/steusa: shoot an arrow through, tino/s, Od. 19.578, etc.; of shooting across an interval, i. e. from one cliff to another, Od. 12.102.
*dio-klh=s: son of Orsilochus of Pherae, Od. 3.488.
di-o/llu=mi: only perf. 2, ou)d' e)/ti ka=lw=s | oi)=kos e)mo\s dio/lwle, ‘it is no longer fair the way my house has gone to ruin, Od. 2.64.
*dio - mh/dh: a slave of Achilles, daughter of Phorbas of Lesbos, Il. 9.665†.

*dio-mh/dhs: Diomed, the son of Tydeus, and one of the most brilliant of the Homeric heroes. Book E receives its title from his exploits (*diomh/dous a)ristei/a=), but they are prominent elsewhere also. Diomed and Glaucus, Il. 6.119-236. He returned in safety to Argos, Od. 3.180 ff.
*di/on: a town in Euboea, Il. 2.538†.
*dio/nu=sos: see *diw/nu=sos.
di-opteu/w: only fut. part., diopteuswn, to spy about, Il. 10.451†.
di-opth/r, h=ros: scout, Il. 10.562†.

di=os, di=a, di=on (di=vos, *dio/s): divine, an epithet applied with great freedom and with consequent weakening of force; only fem. as applied to gods, di=a qea=/, Il. 10.290; di=) *)afrodi=/th, so di=a qea=/wn, also di=a gunaikw=n, ‘divine of women’; applied to Charybdis, Od. 12.104; to the swineherd Eumaeus (‘noble’), Od. 16.56; to one of Hector's horses, Il. 8.185; also to inanimate things, the sea, earth, lands, rivers.
*di=os: a son of Priam, Il. 24.251.

dio-trefh/s, e/os (tre/fw): nourished by Zeus, Zeus-nurtured; epith. of kings (cf. diogenh/s), and of other illustrious persons; ai)zhoi/, Il. 2.660; of the river Scamander, Il. 21.223; and of the Phaeacians as related to the gods, Od. 5.378.
di/-plac, akos (ple/kw): doubled, laid double, dhmo/s, Il. 23.243; as subst., sc. xlai=na, double mantle, Il. 3.126.
di-plo/os: double.
di/-ptuc, uxos (ptu/ssw): folded double (in two layers), kni=/sh, Il. 1.461, etc.
di/ - ptuxos = di/ptuc, lw/ph, see di/plac.
di/s (dvi/s, du/o): twice, Od. 9.491†.
dis-qanh/s, e/os: twice-dying, Od. 12.22†.
diske/w: hurl the discus, Od. 8.188†.

di/skos (dikei=n): discus, quoit, of metal or stone.—Hence di/skoura (ou)=ron), n. pl., a quoit's cast, Il. 23.431, 523. —(For the attitude in throwing the quoit, see cut, after Myron's famous statue of the Discobolus.)
di/fros: (1) chariot-box, chariot; usually war-chariot, but for travelling, Od. 3.324. (See cut No. 10).—(2) stool, low seat without back or arms.
di/xa: in two (parts), twofold; met., ‘in doubt,’ ‘at variance,’ di/xa mermhri/zein, qu=mo\n e)/xein, ba/zein, etc.
dixqa/ = di/xa.
dixqa/dios: twofold, double.
di/ya: thirst. (Il.)
diya=/w: only part., diya=/wn, thirsting, Od. 11.584†.

di/w, ipf. di/e, di/on, mid. subj. di/htai, di/wntai, opt. di/oito: act., intrans., flee,
Il. 22.251; fear, be afraid; mid., causative, scare or drive away; of the hound, ou)/ ti fu/geske knw/dalon o(/tti di/oito, that he ‘started,’ ‘chased,’ Od. 17.317; e)pei/ k' a)po\ nau=fi ma/xhn e)noph/n te di/htai, ‘repel,’ Il. 16.246.
di - wqe/w: only aor. diw=se, forced away, tore away, Il. 21.244†.

diw/kw: trans., pursue, chase, drive, intr., speed, gallop; a(/rma kai\ i(/ppous | *ou<*>/lumpo/nde di/wke, Il. 8.439; pass., nhu=s r(i/mfa diwkome/nh, ‘sped,’ Od. 13.162; mid. trans., Il. 21.602, Od. 18.8; act. intr. often.
*diw/nh: the mother of Aphrodīte, Il. 5.370.
*diw/nu=sos: Dion&ymacr;sus (Bacchus), the god of wine, Il. 6.132 ff., Il. 14.325, Od. 11.325, Od. 24.74.
*diw/rhs: (1) son of Amarynceus, a leader of the Epeians, Il. 2.622.—(2) father of Automedon, Il. 17.429.
dmhqei/s, dmhqh/tw: see da/mnhmi.
dmh=sis (da/mnhmi): taming, Il. 17.476†.
dmh/teira (da/mnhmi): subduer; nu/c, Il. 14.259†.
*dmh/twr (‘Tamer’): a name feigned by Odysseus, Il. 17.443.
dmwh/ (da/mnhmi): female slave; often by capture in war, Od. 6.307; freq. dmwai\ gunai=kes.
dmw/s, wo/s (da/mnhmi): slave; often by capture in war, Od. 4.644, Od. 16.140 ; dmw=es a)/ndres, Od. 12.230.
dnopali/zw: doubtful word, a)nh\r d' a)/ndr) e)dnopa/lizen, hustled, Il. 4.472 ; h)w=qe/n ge ta\ sa\ r(a/kea dnopali/zeis, you will bundle on your rags, Od. 14.512.
dnofero/s (dno/fos): dark, dusky.
doa/ssato, defective aor., subj. doa/ssetai: seem, appear. Cf. de/ato.
doih/: only e)n doih=|, in perplexity, Il. 9.230.
doioi/, doiai/, doia/: twofold, two.
doiw/: a pair, two.
doko/s, h( (de/xomai): beam, esp. of a roof, Od. 22.176.
do/lios (do/los): deceitful, deceiving. (Od.)
*do/lios: a slave of Penelope.
dolix - egxh/s, e/os (e)/gxos): armed with long spears, Il. 21.155†.
dolix-h/retmos (e)retmo/s): long-oared, making use of long oars; epith. of ships, and of the Phaeacian men. (Od.)
dolixo/s: long, both of space and time, do/ru, o(do/s, nou=sos, nu/c, Od. 23.243; adv., dolixo/n, Il. 10.52.
dolixo/-skios (skih/): long-shadowy, casting a long shadow, epith. of the lance.
dolo/eis, essa, en (do/los): artful; fig., de/smata, Od. 8.281.
dolo-mh/ths and dolo/mhtis, voc. dolomh=ta: crafty, wily.
*do/lopes: see *do/loy.
*dolopi=/wn: a Trojan, priest of Scamander, father of Hypsēnor, Il. 5.77†.

do/los: bait, trick, deceit; i)xqu/si, Od. 12.252; of the wooden horse, Od. 8.276 ; do/lw|, ‘by craft,’ ‘stratagem,’ opp. a)mfado/n, Od. 1.296; bi/hfi, Od. 9.406; pl., wiles, Od. 9.19, 422, Il. 3.202; do/lon (do/lous) u(fai/nein, teu/xein, a)rtu/ein, tolopeu/ein.
dolo - frone/wn, -e/ousa: devising a trick, artful-minded.
dolo-frosu/nh: wile, Il. 19.97 (pl.) and 112.
*do/loy, opos: (1) pl., the Dolopians, Il. 9.484.—(2) a. A Trojan, the son of Lampus, Il. 15.525. b. A Greek, the son of Clytius, Il. 11.302.
*do/lwn (do/los): Dolon, the spy, son of Eumēdes, Il. 10.314 ff., hence the name of the book, *dolw/neia. (See cut, No. 23).
do/monde: adv., into the house, Od. 22.479; homeward, home, Il. 24.717 ; o(/nde do/monde, to his house, to his home.

do/mos (de/mw): house, home, denoting a dwelling as a whole; usually sing. of temples, and when applied to the abodes of animals, but often pl. of dwellings of men; (*)aqhnai/hs) i(eroi=o do/moio, Il. 6.89, Il. 7.81; *)/aidos do/mos, also *)ai/da=o do/moi, (mh/lwn) pukino\n do/mon, Il. 12.301; ou)d' a)polei/pousin koi=lon do/mon (sfh=kes), Il. 12.169.
donakeu/s (do/nac): thicket of reeds, Il. 18.576†.
done/w, aor. e)do/nhsa: move to and fro, agitate, shake; of the wind driving the clouds before it, ne/fea skio/enta donh/sa=s, Il. 12.157.
do/ca (doke/w): expectation, view; ou)d' a)po\ do/chs, Il. 10.324 and Od. 11.344. See a)po/, ad fin.
doro/s (de/rw): leather bag, Od. 2.354 and 380.
dorpe/w, fut. -h/somen, ipf. 3 du. dorpei/thn: sup.
do/rpon: evening meal or meal-time, supper; pl., do/rpa, Il. 8.503.

do/ru, gen. dou/ratos and douro/s, dat. dou/rati and douri/, du. dou=re, pl. dou/rata and dou=ra, dat. dou/rasi and dou/ressi: (1) wood, beam, and of a living tree, Od. 6.167; of timber, esp. for ships, dou=ra te/mnein, ta/mnesqai, Od. 5.162, 243, Il. 3.61; e)la/ths, Il. 24.450; do/ru nh/ion, nh/ia dou=ra, dou=ra nhw=n, Il. 17.744, Od. 9.498, *b 135, Od. 5.370.—(2) shaft of a spear, spear; of ash, mei/linon, Il. 5.666.
*do/ru-klos: a natural son of Priam, Il. 11.489†.
do/sis (di/dwmi): gift, boon.
do/skon: see di/dwmi.
doth/r, h=ros: giver, pl., Il. 19.44 and Od. 8.325.
dou/leios (dou=los): slave like, servile, Od. 24.252†.
dou/lh: female slave.
dou/lios: only dou/lion h)=mar, the day of servitude.

*douli/xion (dolixo/s, ‘Long-land’): Dulichium, an island in the Ionian Sea, S. E. of Ithaca, Il. 2.625, Od. 1.246 .— *douli/xio/nde, to Dulichium, Il. 2.629 .— *doulixieu/s, an inhabitant of Dulichium, Od. 18.424.
doulixo/ - deiros (dolixo/s, deirh/): long-necked, Il. 2.460 and Il. 15.692.
doulosu/nh (dou=los): slavery, Od. 22.423†.

doupe/w (dou=pos), old form gdoupe/w: e)pi\ (adv.) d' e)gdou/phsan *)aqhnai/h te kai\ *(/hrh, thundered, Il. 11.45 (cf. e)ri/gdoupos); often dou/phsen de\ pesw/n, fell with a thud, and without pesw/n, douph=sai, Il. 13.426; dedoupo/tos *oi)dipo/da=o | e)s ta/fon, Il. 23.679. See dou=pos.

dou=pos (cf. ktu/pos): any dull, heavy sound, as the thunder at the gates of a besieged town, a)mfi\ pu/la=s o(/mados kai\ dou=pos o)rw/rei | pu/rgwn ballome/nwn, Il. 9.573; of the din of battle, compared to the echo of woodmen's axes, Il. 16.635; the roar of the sea, Od. 5.401; or of a mountain torrent, Il. 4.455. Cf. doupe/w.
doura/teos (do/ru): wooden; i(/ppos, Od. 8.493, 512.
dour - hnekh/s (do/ru, h)/negkon): a spear's throw, neut. as adv., Il. 10.357†.
douri - kleito/s and douri - kluto/s: renowned in the use of the spear.
douri-kthto/s (kta/omai): acquired by the spear, captured in battle, Il. 9.343†.
dou=ra, dou/ratos: see do/ru.
douro-do/kh (de/xomai): spear-receiver, case or stand for spears, perhaps a ring on a column in the vestibule, Od. 1.128†.
do/xmios and doxmo/s: oblique, sideways; do/xmia as adv., Il. 23.116 ; doxmw\ a=)i=/ssonte, Il. 12.148.
dra/gma (dra/ssomai): handful of grain cut by the sickle, Il. 11.69 and Il. 18.552.
dragmeu/w (dra/gma): gather handfuls of grain, as they fall from the sickle, Il. 18.555†.
drai/nw (dra=/w): wish to act or do anything, Il. 10.96†.
*draki/os: a leader of the Epeians, Il. 13.692.
dra/kwn, ontos (de/rkomai): snake, serpent.
dra/ssomai, perf. part. dedragme/nos: grasp with the hand, Il. 13.393 and Il. 16.486.
drato/s (de/rw): flayed, Il. 23.169.
dra=/w, opt. drw/oimi: work, do work as servant (drhsth/r), Od. 15.317†.
drepa/nh and dre/panon: sickle, Il. 18.551 and Od. 18.368.
dre/pw, aor. mid. part. dreya/menoi: pluck, cull, Od. 12.357†.
*drh=sos: a Trojan, Il. 6.20†.
drhsth=r, h=ros (dra=/w): workman, servant.—Fem., drh/steira, workwoman, female servant. (Od.)
drhstosu/nh (drhsth/r): work, service, Od. 15.321†.

dri=mu/s, ei=a, u/: pungent, stinging, sharp; a)na\ r(i=nas de/ oi( h)/dh | dri=mu\ me/nos prou/tuye, of the ‘peppery’ sensation in the nose caused by emotion, Od. 24.319 ; xo/los, Il. 18.322; ma/xh, Il. 15.696.
dri/os (cf. dru=s) = dru=mo/s, Od. 14.353†.
dro/mos (dramei=n): running, race, race-course.
*dru/a=s: (1) king of the Lapithae, Il. 1.263†.—(2) father of Lycurgus, Il. 6.130†.
dru/inos (dru=s): oaken, Od. 21.43†.
dru=mo/s, pl. druma/ (dru=s): oakthicket, coppice.

dru/-oxos (dru=s, e)/xw): pl., ribs of a ship or boat, Od. 19.574†. (See cut.) Later the same word designates the keelson, as holding fast the ribs, the lower ends of which are inserted into it. (See cut, where f e designates the stem; b g, keelson; i h, mast; o, o, o, ribs.)
*dru/oy: a son of Priam, Il. 20.455.
dru/ptw, aor. dru/ye, aor. mid. part. druyame/nw, aor. pass. dru/fqh: lacerate, tear; mid., reciprocal, pareia=/s, ‘each other's cheeks,’ Od. 2.153.

dru=s, uo/s (do/ru): tree, oak; prov., ou)/ pws nu=n e)/stin a)po\ druo\s ou)d' a)po\ pe/trhs o)ari/zein, Il. 22.126; ou)k a)po\ druo\s ou)d) a)po\ pe/trhs e)ssi/, Od. 19.163. From tree or rock, in both proverbs.
dru - to/mos (te/mnw): woodcutter, woodman; with a)nh/r, Il. 11.86.
drw/oimi, drw/wsi: see dra=/w.
du=: see du/w.
dua/w (du/h): plunge in misery, Od. 20.195†.
du/h: misery, misfortune. (Od.)
*du/ma=s: (1) a Phrygian, the father of Hecuba, Il. 16.718.—(2) a Phaeacian, Od. 6.22†.
du=/menai: see du/w.

du/namai, duna/mesqa, fut. dunh/somai, aor. (e))dunh/sato, pass. duna/sqh: be able, have power, avail; qeoi\ de/ te pa/nta du/nantai, Od. 10.306; a)ndro\s me/ga du=name/noio, ‘very powerful,’ Od. 11.414, Od. 1.276.
*du=name/nh: a Nereid, Il. 18.43†.
du/namis: power, strength.

du=/nw and du/w, fut. du=/sw, ipf. du=ne, iter. du/ske, aor. 1 e)/du=sa, aor. 2 e)/du=n, du=, subj. du=/w, opt. du=/h, inf. du=nai, du=/menai, part. du/nta, perf. de/du=ke, mid. du/omai, fut. du=/somai, aor. e)du=/sato, du=/seto, opt. du=sai/ato: go into or among, enter, and (apparently trans.) put on, don, xitw=na, teu=xea, qw/rhka, and with prepositions; with reference to place the verb is either abs. (h)e/lios d' a)/r) e)du=, du=/seto d) h)e/lios, set), or foll. by acc. of limit of motion, or by prepositions (ei)s, ei)/sw, e)n); freq. po/lemon, ma/xhn, o(/mi=lon, so xqo/na du=/menai, du=te qala/sshs eu)re/a ko/lpon, Il. 18.140; do/mon *)/=aidos ei)/sw, Il. 3.322; and of persons, du=/seo de\ mnhsth=ras, Od. 17.276, etc.; met., of feelings, ka/matos gui=a de/du=ken, Il. 5.811; *mele/agron e)/du= xo/los, Il. 9.553; e)n (adv.) de/ oi( h)=tor du=n' a)/xos, Il. 19.367; fut. act. and aor. 1 act. are trans., a)po\ (adv.) me\n fi/la ei(/mata du=/sw (se/), Il. 2.261 ; e)k me/n me ei(/mat' e)/du=san, ‘stripped’ me of, Od. 14.341.
du/o, du/w, indeclinable in Homer: two; proverb, su/n te du/) e)rxome/nw kai/ te pro\ o(\ tou= e)no/hsen, ‘two together going, hasteneth the knowing’ (lit. one notes before the other), Il. 10.224.
duokai/deka: twelve.
duo/wsi: see dua/w.
dus-: inseparable prefix, opp. eu)=, cf. un-rest, mis-chance.
dus-a=h/s, e/os (a)/hmi): ill-blowing; of contrary or tempestuous winds.
dus-a/m-moros: most miserable. (Il.)
dus - aristo - to/keia (ti/ktw): unhappy mother of an heroic son, Il. 18.54†.
du=/seo, du=/seto: see du=/nw.
du/s - zhlos: very jealous or suspicious, Od. 7.307†.
dus-hlegh/s, e/os: (if from a)/lgos), painful, grievous, epith. of war and of death, Il. 20.154 and Od. 22.325.
dus-hxh/s, e/os (h)xe/w): ill-sounding (horrisonus), epith. of war and of death in war. (Il.)
dus-qalph/s, e/os (qa/lpos): ill-warming, chilly, Il. 17.549.
dus - ke/lados: ill-sounding; fo/bos, attended by the cries of pursuers and pursued, Il. 16.357†.
dus-kle/hs (kle/os), acc. duskle/a: inglorious, Il. 2.115 and Il. 9.22.
du/skon: see du=/nw.
dus-mene/wn (me/nos): bearing ill-will. (Od.)
dus-menh/s, e/os: hostile, subst., enemy.
dus-mh/thr: only voc., my mother, yet no mother, Od. 23.97†.
du/s-moros: ill-fated.
*du/s - paris: hateful Paris, voc., Il. 3.39 and Il. 13.769.
dus - pe/mfelos: word of doubtful meaning, boisterous, angry sea, Il. 16.748†.
dus-ponh/s, e/os (po/nos): toilsome, Od. 5.493†.
du/sthnos: unhappy, miserable.
dus-xei/meros (xei=ma): wintry; of Dodōna, Il. 2.750 and Il. 16.234.
dus-w/numos (o)/noma): of evil name or omen, ill-named.
dus - wre/w (w)/ra=): keep wearisome watch, Il. 10.183†.
du/w, du/wn: see du=/nw.
du/w: two, see du/o.
duw/dek(a) = duokai/deka, Il. 10.488, Il. 2.637; duwde/katos = dwde/katos, Il. 1.493.
duwdeka/-boios: worth twelve oxen, Il. 23.703†.
duw - kai - eikosi/ - metros: holding twenty-two measures, Il. 23.264†.
duw-kai-eikosi/-phxus, u: twenty-two cubits long, Il. 15.678†.
dw= = dw=ma.
*dwdwnai=os: of Dodōna, epith. of Zeus, Il. 16.233.
*dwdw/nh: Dodōna, in Epīrus, site of an ancient oracle of Zeus, Od. 14.327, Il. 2.750.
dw/h|(si): see di/dwmi.

dw=ma, atos (de/mw, ‘building’): (1) house, palace, mansion, often pl., dw/mata, house as consisting of rooms.—(2) room, esp. the largest apartment or men's dining-hall (me/garon), Od. 22.494; so perhaps in pl., Il. 1.600.
dwre/omai: give, bestow, Il. 10.557†.
dwrhto/s: open to gifts, reconcilable, Il. 9.526†.
*dwri/eu/s, pl. *dwrie/es: Dorians, Od. 19.177†.
*dw/rion: a town subject to Nestor, Il. 2.594†.
*dwri/s: a Nereid, Il. 18.45†.
dw=ron (di/dwmi): gift, present.
dwth/r, h=ros: pl., givers, Od. 8.325†.
dwti=/nh = dw=ron.
*dwtw/: a Nereid, Il. 18.43†.
dw/twr, oros = dwth/r, Od. 8.335†.
dw/wsi: see di/dwmi.

div1.head: *e
div1.entryFree: e)/): a false reading for e)/a = h)=n, Od. 14.222.
e(/, enclitic, e(e/: see ou.
e)/a: see ei)mi/.
e)/a=: see e)a/w.
e)a/ghn: see a)/gnu=mi.
e(a=do/ta: see a(nda/nw.
e)a/lhn: see ei)/lw.
e(a=no/s (ve/nnu=mi): enveloping, clinging, hence soft or fine; epith. of clothing and woven fabrics; also of tin, ‘pliant,’ Il. 18.613.
e(ano/s, ei(ano/s (ve/nnu=mi): robe, garment of goddesses and women of distinction.
e)/ace: see a)/gnu=mi.
e)/a=sin: see ei)mi/.
e(/atai, e(/ato: see h(=mai.
e(a/fqh: defective aor. pass., a doubtful word, used twice, e)pi\ d' a)/spis e)a/fqh kai\ koru/s, Il. 13.543 (similarly Il. 14.419), followed.

e)a/w, ei)a/w, e)w=, ei)w=, e)a/a=|s, etc., ipf. ei)/wn, ei)/a=s, ei)/a=, e)/a=, iter. ei)/askon, e)/askes, fut. e)a=/sw, aor. ei)/a=sa, e)/a=sas, etc.: let, permit, let alone, let be, ou)k e)a=n, prevent, forbid; ei)/per ga fqone/w te kai\ ou)k ei)w= diape/rsai (note ou)k ei)w= in the condition), Il. 4.55, Il. 2.132, 832; pau/e), e)/a= de\ xo/lon, ‘give up’ thy wrath, Il. 9.260 ; i(/ppous e)/a=se, ‘left standing,’ Il. 4.226 ; to
 me
 e)/peit' ei)/a=se, him he ‘let lie,’ Il. 8.317: with inf. of the omitted act., kle/yai me
 e)a=/somen, ‘we will dismiss’ the
plan of stealth, Il. 24.71.—Some forms are often to be read with synizesis, e)a=|, e)/a=, e)w=men, e)a=/sousin.
e)a=/wn: see e)u/s.
e)/blhto: see ba/llw.
e)ggega/a=si: see e)ggi/gnomai.
e)g-gei/nomai: engender, Il. 19.26†.
e)g-gi/gnomai: only perf. e)ggega/a=sin, are in, live in or there.
e)g-guali/zw (gu/alon), fut. -cw, aor. e)ggua/lice: put into the hand, hand over, confer, ti=mh/n, ku=dos, etc.; ke/rdos, ‘suggest,’ ‘help us to,’ Od. 23.140.
e)ggua/omai : deilai\ deilw=n e)ggu/ai e)ggua/asqai, ‘worthless to receive are the pledges of the worthless,’ Od. 8.351 †; e)ggua/w, ‘give pledge.’
e)ggu/h: surety, pledge, see e)ggua/omai.
e)ggu/qen (e)ggu/s): from near, near; of time, Il. 19.409; of relationship, Od. 7.205.
e)/gguqi = e)ggu/s.
e)ggu/s: near, of time or space, with gen. or without.
e)gdou/phsan: see doupe/w.

e)gei/rw, aor. h)/geira, e)/geire, mid. part. e)geiro/menos, aor. e)/greto, imp. e)/greo, inf. (w. accent of pres.) e)/gresqai, part. e)gro/menos, perf. 3 pl. e)grhgo/rqa=si, inf. (w. irreg. accent) e)grh/gorqai, pass. aor. 3 pl. e)/gerqen: I. act., awaken, wake, arouse; tina\ e)c u(/pnou, u(pnw/ontas, Il. 5.413, Od. 5.48; *)/arha, po/lemon, po/non, me/nos, nei=kos, Il. 15.232, 594, Il. 17.554.—II. mid., awake, perf. be awake; e)/greto eu(/dwn, Od. 13.187; e)/greo, ‘wake up!’; e)grh/gorqe e(/kastos, ‘keep awake,’ every man! Il. 7.371.
e)/gkata, dat. e)/gkasi: entrails.
e)g-kata-ph/gnu=mi, aor. e)gkate/phca: thrust firmly in, ci/fos koulew=|, Od. 11.98†.

e)g-kata-ti/dhmi, aor. e)gka/tqeto, imp. e)gka/tqeo: deposit in, place in, i(/manta ko/lpw|, Il. 14.219; met., a=)/thn qu=mw=|, ‘conceive’ infatuation, Od. 23.223 ; telamw=na e(h=| e)gka/tqeto te/xnh|, ‘conceived in (by) his art,’ or perhaps better ‘included in (among the specimens of) his art,’ Od. 11.614.
e)/g-keimai, fut. e)gkei/seai: lie in, ei(/masi, Il. 22.513†.
e)gkera/sa=sa: see e)gki/rnhmi.
e)g-ke/falos (kefalh/): brain.
e)g - ki/rnhmi, aor. part. e)gkera/sa=sa: mix in, oi)=non, Il. 8.189†.
e)gkla/w: see e)nikla/w.
e)g - kli=/nw: only perf. pass. (met.), po/nos u)/mmi e)gke/klitai, rests upon you, Il. 6.78†.
e)g-kone/w: be busy, only pres. part., sto/resan le/xos e)gkone/ousai, ‘in haste,’ Il. 24.648, Od. 7.340, Od. 23.291.
e)g-kosme/w: put in order within, nhi\ teu/xea, Od. 15.218†.
e)g-kru/ptw, aor. e)ne/kruye: hide in, bury in, da=lo\n spodih=| Od. 5.488†.
e)g-ku/rw, aor. e)ne/kurse: meet, fall in with, Il. 13.145†.
e)/greo, -eto, -esqai, e)grh/gorqai: see e)gei/rw.
e)grhgoro/wn, as if from e)grhgora/w: remaining awake, Il. 10.182†.
e)grh/ssw (e)gei/rw): watch, keep watch.
e)gxei/h (e)/gxos): lance.
e)gxei/h|: see e)gxe/w.
e)/gxelus, uos: eel.
e)gxesi/ - mwros: word of doubtful meaning, mighty with the spear.
e)gxe/s-palos (pa/llw): spear-brandishing.
e)g - xe/w, aor. subj. e)gxei/h|, aor. mid. e)nexeu/sato: pour in, mid. for oneself, Od. 9.10, Od. 19.387.

e)/gxos, eos: spear, lance; used for both hurling and thrusting, and regarded as the most honorable weapon; the shaft, do/ru, was of ash, about 7 ft. long; the upper end, kaulo/s, was fitted with a bronze socket, au)lo/s, into which the point, a)kwkh/, ai)xmh/|, was inserted, Il. 16.802, being held fast by the po/rkhs; the lower end, ou)ri/axos, was furnished with a ferule or spike, saurwth/r, for sticking into the earth. The warrior usually carried two spears—for hurling, at a distance of about 12 paces, and for thrusting from above. Hector's spear was 16 ft. long, Il. 6.319. (See also su=rigc, and cut 19.)

e)gxri/mptw, e)nixri/mptw, aor. part. e)gxri/mya=s, mid. ipf. e)gxri/mptonto, pass. aor. imp. e)gxrimfqh/tw, part. e)gxrimfqei/s, e)nixrimfqe/nta: press close to, draw near; of running close to the turningpost in a race, Il. 23.334, 338; grazing the boar by a lance - point, Il. 5.662; crowding close in combat, Il. 17.413; approaching very near, Il. 13.146.

e)gw/, e)gw/n, besides the usual forms,
also gen. e)mei=o, e)meu=, e)me/o, meu, e)me/qen: I, me.
e)da/hn: see *d*a.
e(dano/s (vedano/s, h(du/s): sweet, Il. 14.172†.
e)da/sato, -ssato: see date/omai.

e)/dafos: floor, of a ship, Od. 5.249†. (See cut 32.) a, meso/dmh, mast - box; b, beams running parallel to c, e)phgkeni/des, gunwale; d, klhi=des, row-lock, thole-pin; e, skalmoi/, part of the gunwale on which the oar rests, bed of the oar; f, zuga/, thwarts (should cross the vessel); g, qrh=nus, braces for the feet; h, i)/kria, ribs; i, tro/pis, keel; k, a(rmoniai/, slabs, sustaining the floor; l, e)/dafos, floor; m, keelson, was probably not distinguished from i, keel. (See also plate No. IV., at end of vol.)
e)/ddeise, e)dei/dimen: see dei/dw.
e)de/dmhto: see de/mw.
e)/dekto: see de/xomai.
e)dhtu/s, u/os (e)/dw): food.
e)/dmenai: see e)/dw.

e(/dnon (ve/dnon), only pl. e(/dna, e)/edna: (1) bridal gifts, presented by the suitor to the father of the bride, as if to purchase her. —(2) dowry of the bride, given to her by her father, Od. 1.277.
e)dnopa/lizen: see dnopali/zw.
e(dno/w, e)edno/w (e(/dnon): aor. mid. opt. e)ednw/saito: portion off, qu/gatra, said of the father, Od. 2.53.
e(dnwth/s, e)ednwth/s: giver of dowry, the father of the bride.
e)/domai: see e)/dw, e)sqi/w.

e(/dos, eos (root e(d): (1) sitting; ou)x e(/dos e)sti/, ‘it's no time for sitting,’ Il. 11.648.—(2) sitting - place, seat, abode; a=)qana/twn e(/dos, of Olympus, Il. 5.360; so ‘site,’ ‘situation,’ *)iqa/khs e(/dos (a periphrasis for the name of the place merely), Od. 13.344.
e)/draqon: see darqa/nw.
e)/dramon: see tre/xw.

e(/drh (root e(d): seat, stool (see cut 33; also 75), Il. 19.77; pl. e(/drai, rows of seats, e. g. stone benches in the a)gora/, Od. 8.16; and elsewhere, e. g. Od. 3.7 ; ti/ein e(/drh|, honor ‘with a seat,’ i. e. show to a place of honor.
e(dria/omai (e(/drh), ipf. e(drio/wnto: sit down, take seats in council, Il. 10.198, Od. 7.98.
e)/du=n: see du=/nw.

e)/dw, inf. e)/dmenai, ipf. e)/don, iter. e)/deske, fut. e)/domai, perf. part. e)dhdw/s, pass. perf. e)dh/dotai: eat; of both men and animals; metaph., ‘consume,’ ‘devour,’ ‘gnaw;’ oi)=kon, kth/mata, Od. 1.375; a)/lloi d' h(me/teron ka/maton nh/poinon e)/dousin, ‘the fruits of our toil,’ Od. 14.417 ; qu=mo\n e)/dwn, brw/mhs d' ou)x a(/pteai, k 379, Od. 9.75.
e)dwdh/ (e)/dw): food, meat, fodder.
e)e/: see ou(=.
e)/edna, e)edno/w, e)ednwth/s: see e(/dnon, e(dno/w, e(dnwth/s.
e)eikosa/-boios (e)veik.,): worth twenty cattle, Od. 1.431 and Od. 22.57.
e)ei/kosi(n): see ei)/kosin.
e)eiko/s - oros (e)veik.): twenty-oared, Od. 9.322†.
e)eikosto/s = ei)kosto/s.
e)ei/leon: see ei)/lw.
e)eisa/menos, e)ei/sao, -ato: see (1) ei)/dw, (2) ei)=mi.
e)eisa/sqhn: see ei)=mi.
e)e/ldomai, e)e/ldwr: see e)/ldomai, e)/ldwr.
e)e/lmeqa, e)elme/nos, e)e/lsai: see ei)/lw.
e)e/lpomai: see e)/lpomai.
e)erga/qw: see e)rga/qw.
e)/erge, e)ergme/nos: see e)/rgw.
e)e/rgnu=mi: see kate/rgnu=mi.
e)erme/nos: see ei)/rw.
e)e/rsh, e)ersh/eis: see e(/rsh, e(rsh/eis.
e)/erto: see ei)/rw.
e)e/rxato: see e)/rgw.
e(e/ssato, e(/esto: see e(/nnu=mi.
e)e/ssato: see ei(=sa.

e(/zomai (root e(d), 2 sing. e(/zeai, imp. e(/zeo, e(/zeu, ipf. e(zo/mhn: sit down, take a seat; in dodging a spear, Il. 22.275; fig., of the sinking of the scale, kh=res e)pi\ xqoni\ e(ze/sqhn, Il. 8.74.
e)/h|: see ei)mi/.
e(/hke: see i(/hmi.
e)/hn: see ei)mi/.
e(h/ndane: see a(nda/nw.
e)h=os: see e)u/s.
e(/hs: see o(/s.
e(h=s: see e(o/s.
e)/hsqe, e)/h|si: see ei)mi/.
e)/q) = e)/ti.
e)/qeira, only pl. e)/qeirai: horse-hair, of the mane and tail of horses, and of the plume of a helmet.
e)qei/rw: till, a)lwh/n, Il. 21.347†.
e)qelonth/r, h=ros: volunteer, Od. 2.292†.

e)qe/lw, subj. e)qe/lwmi, ipf. e)/qelon, h)qe/leton, iter. e)qe/leskes, fut. e)qelh/sw, aor. e)qe/lhsa: will, wish, choose, with neg., be unwilling, refuse; ou)d' e)/qele prore/ein (u=(/dwr), Il. 21.366, Il. 1.112; so ou)k e)qe/lwn, polla\ ma/l' ou)k e)qe/lontos, ‘sorely against his will;’ in prohibitions w. mh/ (noli), mh/te su/, *phlei/dh e)/qel) e)rize/menai basilh=i, Il. 1.277; foll. by o)/fra, Il. 1.133.
e(/qen = ou(=.
e)qheu/meqa: see qhe/omai.
e)/qnos (ve/qnos): company, band, host; of men, e(ta/rwn, la=w=n, nekrw=n, also of ‘swarms,’ ‘flocks,’ of bees, flies, birds, etc.
e)/qoron: see qrw/skw.
e)/qreya: see tre/fw.

e)/qw (sve<*>qw), part. e)/qwn, perf. 2 ei)/wqa, e)/wqe: be accustomed, wont; kaka\ po/ll' e)/rdesken e)/qwn, ‘was in the habit of continually working mischief,’ Il. 9.540 ; ou(\s pai=des e)ridmai/nwsin e)/qontes, ‘as is their wont,’ Il. 16.260 ; u(f' h(nio/xw| ei)wqo/ti, ‘their accustomed driver, Il. 5.231.

ei): if, if only, whether; conjunction used in the expression of a wish or a condition, and in indirect questions.— I. As particle of wishing, ei) or ei) ga/r, would that, O that, is foll. by the optative.—II. Interrogatively, whether, foll. by such construction as the meaning requires, e. g., kata/lecon | ei) kai\ *la=e/rth| au)th
 o(do
 a)/ggelos e)/lqw, ‘am to go,’ Od. 16.138.—III. In conditional clauses ei) (ei) mh/), and with the subj. often (sometimes w. the opt.) ei)/ ken, rarely w. a)/n, ei) d' a)
 e)moi\ ti=mh
 *pri/amos *pria/moio/ te pai=des | ti=/nein ou)k e)qe/lwsin, Il. 3.288. Conditions of which the conclusion is vague are sometimes regarded as interrogative, e. g. a)napeptame/na=s e)/xon a=)ne/res, ei)/ tin' e(tai/rwn | e)k pole/mou feu/gonta saw/seian, they held the gates open, in case they might be able to save some fugitive, Il. 12.122; thus often ei)/ pou or ei)/ pws, ‘in the hope that,’ ‘on the chance that,’ etc. —With other particles, ei) kai/, if also (or denoting concession, though), kai\ ei) (ou)d' ei), mhd) ei)), even if, denoting opposition; ei)/ te.. ei)/ te (sive.. sive), w(s ei), w(s ei)/ te, ei) dh/, ei)/ per, ei)/ ge (q. v.); in ei) d' a)/ge (q. v.), ei) is probably an interjection.
ei(ame/nh (cf. h(=mai): low-lying pasture or water-meadow; e)n ei(ame/nh| e(/leos mega/loio, Il. 4.483 and Il. 15.631, once mentioned as the home of a poplar-tree, and once as a pasture for kine.
ei(ano/s: see e(ano/s.
ei)arino/s (ve/ar): of Spring, vernal, w(/rh, a)/nqea, noti/ai.
ei)/a=sa, ei)/askon: see e)a/w.
ei(/atai, ei(/ato: see h(=mai.
ei)/ato: see ei)mi/.
ei)/bw (cf. lei/bw), ipf. ei)=bon: shed, let fall, always with da/kruon.
ei) ga/r: see ei), I.
ei)/ ge: if, since (siquidem); usually separated as ei) e)teo/n ge, but ei)/ ge me/n, Od. 5.206; and ei)/ g' ou)=n.. ge, Il. 5.258.
ei) d' a)/ge (a)/gete): come! come on! hortatory phrase, in which ei) is probably an interjection (cf. ei)=a), at any rate not to be explained by the ellipsis of a verb.
*ei)doqe/h: Eidothea, a sea - goddess, the daughter of Proteus, Od. 4.366.
ei)/domai, ei)=don: see ei)/dw, I.

ei)=dos, eos (vid), dat. ei)/dei+: appearance, looks, esp. of the human countenance, and mostly with a suggestion of beauty; freq. as acc. of specification with adjectives, and often coupled w. me/geqos, fuh/, de/mas. Of a dog, taxu\s qe/ein e)pi\ ei)/dei+ tw=|de, a fast runner ‘with all that good looks,’ Od. 17.308.

ei)/dw (root vid): an assumed pres., answering to the tenses enumerated below, meaning (I) see, seem, and (II) know.—I. (1) see, look, aor. 2 ei)=don, i)/don, subj. i)/dw, i)/dwmi, opt. i)/doimi, imp. i)/de, inf. i)dei=n, i)de/ein, part. i)dw/n, mid. aor. 2 i)do/mhn, i)/donto, ei)/donto, subj. i)/dwmai, opt. i)/doito, imp. i)/desqe, inf. i)de/sqai.—(2) seem, appear, be like, pres. ei)/detai, part. ei)do/menos, aor. 1 2 sing. e)ei/sao, 3 sing. e)ei/sato, ei)/sato, opt. ei)/saito, part. ei)sa/menos, e)eisa/menos. The meanings need no special illustration; a difference between act. and mid. of signif. see is not to be sought. Metaph., o)/fra vi/dwmai e)ni\ fresi\n h)de\ daei/w, Il. 21.71. Denoting resemblance, ei)/sato de\ fqoggh\n ui(=i *pria/moio *poli=/th|, Il. 2.791, etc.—II. know, perf. oi)=da, oi<*>sqa (oi)=das), i)/dmen, i)/ste, i)/sa=s(<*>), subj. ei)dw=, ei)de/w, ei)/domen, ei)/dete, ei)dw=si, opt. ei)dei/hn, imp. i)/sq(i), i)/stw, inf. i)/dmenai, i)/dmen, part. ei)dw/s, ei)dui=a, i)dui=a, plup. h)/de(a), h)ei/dhs and h)/|dhsqa, h)/|dh and h/|dee(n) and h)ei/dh, 3 pl. ei)/san, fut. ei)/somai, ei)dh/sw, inf. ei)dh/sein, ei)dhse/men: The meaning know comes as the result of have seen (cf. nosco, novi); with acc. oi)=da may mean ‘be skilled in,’ and w. inf. ‘know how,’ see esp. Il. 7.237-241; special phrase, xa/rin ei)de/nai, ‘be grateful,’ ‘thankful’; another special signif., peculiar to Homer, is when the word denotes disposition or character, turn of mind; fi/la ei)do/tes a)llh/loisi, Od. 3.277; h)/pia ei)de/nai, so ai)/sima, a)/rtia, a)qemi/stia veidw/s, ‘a lawless spirit,’ Od. 9.189.
ei)/dwlon (ei)=dos): shape, phantom, Il. 5.449, Od. 4.796; esp. pl., of the shades in the nether world, brotw=n ei)/dwla kamo/ntwn, Od. 11.476.
ei)=qar: immediately.
ei)/qe: would that! Oh, that! See ai)/qe.
ei) kai/: see ei), ad fin.
ei)/ ken: see ei), also a)/n and ke/n.
ei)=ke: see (1) ei)/kw, (2) e)/oika.
ei)/kelos (veik., e)/oika): like, tini/. Cf. i)/kelos.
ei)kosa/kis: twenty times.
ei)/kosi(n), e)ei/kosi (veik., viginti): twenty.
ei)kosin-h/ritos: twenty-fold, Il. 22.349†.
ei)kosto/s, e)eikosto/s: twentieth.
e)/ikto, e)/ikton, e)i/kthn, ei)kui=a: see e)/oika.

ei)/kw (veikw), imp. ei)=ke, part. ei)/kwn, aor. ei=ca, iter. ei)/caske: yield, give way, withdraw (from anything, tino/s, before one, tini/), be inferior (to one, tini/, in some respect, ti\, sometimes tini/); ei)soro/wn xro/a ka=lo/n, o(/ph| vei/ceie ma/lista, where it, i. e. the body of Hector, would best ‘yield’ to a blow, Il. 22.321 ; ei)/ pe/r ti/s se bi/h| kai\ ka/rtei+ vei/kwn | ou)/ se ti/ei, ‘yielding’ to violent impulses, Od. 13.143 ; mhd' ei)/kete xa/rmhs | *)argei/ois, ‘fall not back from battle before the Greeks,’ Il. 4.509 ; a)ndrw=n dusmene/wn o(/ te/ moi vei/ceie po/dessin, whoever ‘was inferior’ to me in running, Od. 14.221; aor. 1 trans., ei)=cai h(ni/a i(/ppw|, ‘give him free rein,’ Il. 23.337.
ei)lapina/zw (ei)lapi/nh): feast, be at the bauquet.
ei)lapinasth/s: banqueter, guest, Il. 17.577†.
ei)lapi/nh: festal banquet.
ei)=lar (veil., ei)/lw): means of defence, protection; ku=/matos, ‘against the wave,’ Od. 5.257.
ei)la/tinos: of pine or fir wood.
*ei)lei/quia: Eilithyia, daughter of Hera, Od. 19.188; usually pl., *ei)lei/quiai, the goddesses of child-birth.
*ei)le/sion: a town in Boeotia, Il. 2.499†.
ei)le/w: see ei)/lw.
ei)lh/louqa, ei)lh/louqmen: see e)/rxomai.

ei)li/-pos (ei)/lw, pou/s), only pl. acc.
ei)li/podas, dat. ei)lipo/dessi: close-footed or trailing-footed; epith. of kine, with reference to their peculiar rolling gait.
ei(li/ssw: see e(li/ssw.
ei(=lon, ei(lo/mhn: see ai(re/w.
ei)lu/atai: see ei)lu=/w.
ei)/lu=ma (veilu=/w): wrapper, Od. 6.179†.
ei)lu=fa/zw (veil.): whirl about; flo/ga, Il. 20.492†.
ei)lufa/w = ei)lu=fa/zw, Il. 11.156†.
ei)lu=/w (veilu=/w), fut. ei)lu=/sw, pass. perf. ei)/lu=mai, 3 pl. ei)lu/atai, part. ei)lu=me/nos, plup. ei)/lu=to: wrap, envelop, cover.

ei)/lw, ei)le/w (veile/w), subj. ei)le/wsi, part. ei)leu=nta, ipf. ei)/lei, ei)/leon, e)ei/leon, aor. 3 pl. e)/lsan, inf. e)/lsai, e)e/lsai, part. e)/lsa=s, pass. pres., part. ei)lo/menoi, ipf. ei)leu=nto, aor. e)a/lh, 3 pl. a)/len, inf. a)lh=nai, a)lh/menai, part. a)lei/s, perf. e)e/lmeqa, part. e)elme/nos: I. act. and pass., crowd together, hem in, shut up or off; (O<*>on the hunter) qh=ras o(mou= ei)leu=nta, Od. 11.573; (dmwa=\s) ei)/leon e)n stei/nei, o(/qen ou)/ pws h)=en a)lu/cai, Od. 22.460; kata\ pru/mna=s te kai\ a)mf' a(/la e)/lsai *)axaiou/s, Il. 1.409; o(/n per a)/ellai | xeime/riai ei)le/wsin, ‘hold storm-bound,’ Il. 2.294; (nh=a) keraunw=| | *zeu\s e)/lsa=s e)ke/asse, ‘with a crushing blow,’ Od. 5.132; (*)/arhs) *dio\s boulh=|sin e)elme/nos, ‘held close,’ Il. 13.523.—II. mid., crowd or collect together, crouch, gather oneself for a spring; e(/stasan a)mfi\ bi/hn *diomh/deos ei)lo/menoi, Il. 5.782; oi(\ dh/ toi ei)s a)/stu a)/len, Il. 22.12; xeime/rion a)le\n u=(/dwr, ‘accumulated,’ Il. 23.420 ; th=| (a)spi/di) u(/po pa=s e)a/lh, ‘crouched,’ Il. 13.408 ; e)ni di/frw| h(=|sto a)lei/s, ‘cowering close,’ Il. 16.403 ; *)axilh=a a)lei\s me/nen, i. e. all ready to charge upon him, Il. 21.571, Od. 24.538.
ei(=ma (ve/nnu=mi): garment, of any sort; pl., ei(/mata, clothing; freq as pred. noun, par' d) a)/ra oi( fa=ro/s te xitw=na<*> te vei/mat) e)/qhkan, ‘as clothing.’ i. e. ‘to wear,’ Od. 6.214.
ei(=mai: see e(/nnu=mi.
ei(/martai, ei(/marto: see mei/romai.
ei)me/n: see ei)mi/.
ei(me/nos: see e(/nnu^mi.
ei) mh/: if not, unless, except, Od. 12.326.

ei)mi/, 2 sing. e)ssi/, ei)/s (never ei)=), 1 pl. ei/me/n, 3 pl. e)/a=si, subj. e)/w, ei)/w, 3 e)/h|si, h)=|si, 3 pl. e)/wsi, w)=si, opt. 2 e)/ois, 3 e)/oi, inf. e)/(m)men(ai), part. e)w/n, e)/ou=sa, e)o/n, ipf. e)/a, h)=a, e)/on (e)/hn), 2 e)/hsqa, h)=sqa, 3 e)/hn, h)/hn, h)=en, du. h)/sthn, pl. e)/san, iter. e)/skon, fut. e)/(s)somai, e)/(s)seai, e)/(s)setai, e)(s)so/meqa: as copula, meaning to be, forms of the pres. ind. are enclitic, with the exception of e)/a=si. But they are not enclitic in the meaning exist, be possible; so at the beginning of a sentence, and e)/sti after ou)k, kai/, ei), and w(s. *zeu= pa/ter, h)= r(a e)/t' e)/ste qeoi/, ‘ye do then still exist,’ Od. 24.352 ; ei)/ ti<*> pou e)/sti, pi/qoio/ moi, ‘if it be anywise possible,’ Od. 4.193 . ei)=nai is used in Hom. as elsewhere to form periphrastic tenses, tetlho/tes ei)me/n (=tetlh/kamen), Il. 5.873 ; blh/menos h)=n, Il. 4.211; and it is the usual verb to denote possession, ei)si/n moi pai=des, Il. 10.170; o)/fra oi( ei)/h pi/nein, ‘have (a chance) to drink,’ <*> 248; phrases, e)/ndon e)o/ntwn, ‘of her store’; o(/pws e)/stai ta/de e)/rga, ‘what turn affairs will take’; ei)/h ken kai\ tou=to, ‘this might well come to pass’; e)moi\ de/ ken a)sme/nw| ei)/h, ‘it would please me well’; kai\ e)ssome/noisi puqe/sqai, ‘for future generations,’ ‘for posterity to hear’; ei)/ pot' e)/hn ge, ‘if indeed he ever was’—as if his existence had been but a dream after all.—Ellipsis of e)sti/ is freq., of other forms rare, sc. e)/h|, Il. 14.376.

ei)=mi, 2 sing. ei)=sqa, subj. i)/hsqa, i)/h|s, i)/h|si, i<*>)/omen, i)/wsi, opt. i)/oi, i)ei/h, inf. i)/(m)men(ai), ipf. h)/ion, h)/ia, h)/ies, i)/es, h)/ien, h)=e, i)/e, h)/|omen, h)/isan, i)/san, h)/ion, fut. ei)/somai, aor. mid. (e))ei/sato: go, the pres. w. fut. signif., but sometimes w. pres. signif., esp. in comparisons, e. g. Il. 2.87. The mid. form peculiar to Homer has no peculiar meaning, *(/ektwr a)/nt' *ai)/antos e)ei/sato, went to meet Ajax, Il. 15.415.
ei)n = e)n.
ei)na<*>-etes (e)nne/a, ve/tos): adv., nine years.
ei)na/kis: nine times, Od. 14.230†.
ei)n-a/lios (a(/ls): in or of the sea, sea-. (Od.)
ei)na/-nuxes (e)nne/a, nu/c): adv., nine nights long, Il. 9.470†.
ei)na/teres (vein.): brothers' wives (Il.)
ei)/natos (e)nne/a): ninth.
ei(/neka = e(/neka.
ei)ni/ = e)n.
ei)n-o/dios (o(do/s): in the way, Il. 16.260†.
ei)nosi/gaios = e)nnosigaios.
ei)nosi/ - fullos (e)/nosis, fu/llon): leaf - shaking, with quivering foliage, epith. of wooded mountains.
ei)/caske: see ei)/kw.
ei(=o: see ou(=.
ei)oikui=ai: see e)/oika.
ei(=os = e(/ws.
ei)=pa, ei)pe/men(ai): see ei)=pon.
ei)/per, ei)/ per: if really, if; mostly in a concessive sense.

ei)=pon (root vep, cf. voco), e)/eipon, iter. ei)/pesken, subj. ei)/pwmi, ei)/ph|sqa, aor. 1 ei)=pa, 2 pl. ei)/pate: speak, say; strictly of an utterance with regard to its tenor and ethical expression rather than to the subject-matter (cf. e)/pos); hence the word may signify ‘command’ with foll. inf., ei)pei=n te gunaici
 | klhi=sai mega/roio qu/ra=s, Od. 21.235; with nearer indication of the feeling, eu)xomenos d' a)/ra ei)=pen, Od. 7.330; o)xqh/sa=s d) a)/ra ei)=pe, Il. 18.5; ei)=pe d) a)/ra klai/ousa, Il. 19.286; freq. w. obj., e)/pos, mu=qon, a)ggeli/hn, etc.; so w. acc. of person named, ou)d' h)
 *)agamemnona ei)/ph|s, ‘pronounce the name of,’ ‘name,’ Il. 1.90 ; e)/stai ma
 o(/t' a)
 au)=te fi/lhn glaukw/pida ei)/ph|, i. e. when I shall hear him call me by this name, Il. 8.373, Od. 19.334.
ei)/ pou, ei)/ pws: see ei).
ei<*>ra=/wn: see ei)/rh.
ei)/rgw: see e)/rgw.
ei)/reros (root ser, cf. servus): bondage, Od. 8.529.
ei)resi/h (e)re/ssw): rowing. (Od.)
*ei)re/tria: Eretria, in Euboea, Il. 2.537†.
ei)/rh: meeting-place (equiv. to a)gora/), pl., Il. 18.531†.
ei)/rhai: see ei)/romai.
ei)rh/nh (ei)/rhtai): peace; e)p: ei)rh/nhs, ‘in time of peace.’
ei)/rhtai: see (1) ei)/r Od. 24.1.—(2) ei)/romai.
ei)/rion: see e)/rion.
ei)ro-ko/mos (kome/w): wool-carder, Il. 3.387†.

ei)/romai, ei)/reai, subj. ei)/rwmai, -hai, -htai, -w/meqa, imp. ei)/reo, ei)re/sqw, inf. ei)/resqai, part. ei)ro/menos, ipf. ei)/reto, -onto, fut. ei)rh/somai: ask, inquire, often tina/ ti, also a)mfi/ tini, peri/ tinos, etc.; and w. acc. of thing inquired about or for, fulaka=s d' a=(\s ei)/reai, Il. 10.416, *z 239, Od. 11.542.
ei)ro - po/kos (pe/kw): woolly-fleeced, woolly, Od. 9.443 and Il. 5.137.
ei)=ros: wool, fleece, Od. 4.135 and Od. 9.426.
ei)ru/atai: see ei)ru=/w.

ei)/rw (1) (root ver, cf. verbum), assumed pres. for fut. e)re/w, -e/ei, -e/ousi, part. e)re/wn, e)re/ousa, pass. perf. ei)/rhtai, part. ei)rhme/nos, plup. ei)/rhto, fut. ei)rh/setai, aor. part. dat. sing. r(hqe/nti: say, speak, declare; strictly with regard merely to the words said; announce, herald, (*)hw/s) *zhni\ fo/ws e)re/ousa, Il. 2.49; (*(ewsfo/ros) fo/ws e)re/wn e)pi\ gai=an, Il. 23.226.

ei)/rw (2) (root ser, cf. sero), only pass. perf. part. e)erme/nos, plup. e)/erto: string, as beads; meta\ (adv.) d' h)le/ktroisin e)/erto, at intervals ‘was strung’ with beads of amber, Od. 15.460 ; o(/rmos h)le/ktroisin e)erme/nos, Od. 18.296; ge/fu=rai e)erme/nai, ‘joined’ in succession, Il. 5.89.
ei)rwta/w (ei)/romai), ipf. ei)rw/ta=: ask, tina/ ti. (Od.)

ei)s, e)s (ei)s before a consonant only in ei)sbai/nw): into.—I. adv. (the socalled ‘tmesis’), e)s d' h)=lqon, e)s d) e)re/ta=s a)gei/romen, Il. 1.142; an acc. in the same clause may specify the relation of the adv., thus preparing the way for a true prepositional use, tw\ d' ei)s a)mfote/rw *diomh/deos a(/rmata (acc. of end of motion) bh/thn, *q 115, Od. 2.152. —II. prep. w. acc., into, to, for; e)s a)llh/lous de\ i)/donto, ‘towards’ each other, into each other's faces, Il. 24.484; of purpose, ei)pei=n ei)s a)gaqo/n, ‘for’ a good end, Il. 9.102 ; ei)s a=)/thn, ‘to’ my ruin, Od. 12.372; of time, ei)s e)niauto/n, i. e. up to the end of a year, Od. 4.595; so ei)s o(/ ke, until; distributively, ai)ei\ ei)s w(/ra=s, ‘season after season’ (cf. in dies), Od. 9.135.
