Apparently w. gen., by an ellipsis, ei)s *)aida=o (sc. do/mon), e)s *pria/moio, and by analogy, ei)s *ai)gu/ptoio (sc. u=(/dwr), ei)s h(mete/rou, Od. 2.55, etc.
ei)/s: see ei)mi/.
ei(=s, mi/a, e(/n: one; tou/s moi mi/a gei/nato mh/thr, ‘one and the same.’ mother as my own, Il. 19.293; adv. phrase, e)s mi/an bouleu/ein, be ‘at one’ again in counsel, Il. 2.379.

ei(=sa (root e(d-), defective aor., imp. ei(=son, inf. e(/ssai, part. e(/sa=s, e(/sa=sa, mid. e)e/ssato: cause to sit, sit down, settle; e)s qro/non ei)=sen a)/gwn, i. e. gave her a seat, Od. 1.130 ; lo/xon, ‘lay’ an ambus
cade, Od. 4.531 ; dh=mon *sxeri/h|, ‘settled’ them in Scheria, Od. 6.8 ; e)pi\ bousi\n ei(=se/ me, ‘established’ me in charge of), Od. 20.210; mid., e)pi\ nho\s e)e/ssato/ me, ‘took me on board’ of his ship, Od. 14.295.
ei)s - agei/romai, ipf. e)sagei/reto, aor. -ato: gather together in or for; of a crew, Od. 14.248; met., ne/on d' e)sagei/reto qu=mo/n, ‘was collecting’ his powers, coming to life, Il. 15.240.
ei)s - a/gw, e)sa/gw, ipf. -h=gon, aor. 2 -a/gagon (-h/gage): lead or bring in; w. acc. of the place whither, dw/mata, do/mon, *krh/thn, ei)sh/gag' e(tai/rous, Od. 3.191.
ei)s-aqre/w, aor. opt. e)saqrh/seien: descry, Il. 3.450†.
ei)s-akou/w, aor. e)sa/kouse: give ear, Il. 8.97.
ei)s-a/llomai, aor. 1 e)sh/lato, aor. 2 e)sa=lto: leap into or at. (Il.)
ei)sa/menos: see ei)/dw, I.
ei)s-ana-bai/nw, opt. -noi, ipf. -ane/bainon, aor. 2 -ane/bhsan, inf. -bh=nai, part. -ba=sa: go up or back to, ascendto, mount.
ei)s-an-a/gw: lead away into bondage, tina\ ei)/reron, Od. 8.529†.
ei)s-an-ei=don: look up into, Il. 16.232 and Il. 24.307.
ei)s-a/n-eimi (ei)=mi): only part., climbing the sky, h)e/lios ou)rano/n, Il. 7.423†.
ei)s - a/nta, e)sa/nta: in the face, straight at, straight forward.
ei)/sato: see (1) ei)/dw, I.—(2) ei)=mi.
ei)s-af-ika=/nw = ei)safikne/omai.
ei)s - af - ikne/omai, aor. opt. -i/koito, subj. -i/khai, -i/khtai, inf. -ke/sqai: arrive at, reach.
ei)s-bai/nw, e)sbai/nw, aor. 2 opt. e)sbai/h, part. e)sba/ntes: enter, esp. go on board ship, embark.
ei)s - de/rkomai, aor. e)se/drakon: look at, discern.
ei)s-du/omai, fut. e)sdu=/seai: enter into, to take part in, a)kontistu=/n, Il. 23.622†.
ei)sei=don: see ei)sora/w.
ei)/s-eimi (ei)=mi): go into, enter; met' a=)ne/ras, ‘among the men,’ Il. 18.184; w. acc., ou)d' *)axilh=os | o)fqalmou\s ei)/seimi, ‘into his sight,’ Il. 24.463.
ei)s - elau/nw, ei)sela/w, part. -a/wn, aor. 3 pl. ei)se/lasan, part. ei)sela/santes: drive in; of a ship, run or row in.
ei)s - eru/w, aor. part. ei)seru/santes: drag into, nh=a spe/os, Od. 12.317†.
ei)s-e/rxomai, fut. e)seleu/somai, aor. 2 ei)sh=lqon, e)sh/luqon: come or go into, enter; metaph., me/nos a)/ndras ei)se/rxetai, pei/nh dh=mon, Od. 15.407.

e)i=/sh (vi=sos), only fem. forms: equal; epith. of dai/s, ‘equally divided’ feast, Il. 1.468 ; nh=es e)i=sai, ‘balanced,’ ‘symmetrical,’ Il. 1.306 ; a)spi\s pa/ntos' e)i=/sh, i. e. circular, Il. 3.347 ; i(/ppoi, exactly matched in size, Il. 2.765 ; fre/nes e)/ndon e)i=sai, a ‘well-balanced’ mind, Od. 11.337.
ei)=sqa: see ei)=mi.
ei)s-qrw/skw, aor. 2 e)/sqore: spring in. (Il.)
ei)si=e/menai: see ei)si=/hmi.
ei)s-i/zomai, subj. e)si/zhtai: place oneself in an ambuscade, Il. 13.285†.
ei)s-i=/hmi: only mid. pres. part. ei)si=e/menai, seeking to enter, Od. 22.470†.
ei)s-i/qmh (ei)=mi): way in, entrance, Od. 6.264†.
ei)s - kata - bai/nw, part. e)skatabai/nwn: go down into, o)/rxaton, Od. 24.222†.

e)i/skw, i)/skw (vev., cf. vi/kelos), i)/skousi, part. i)/skontes, ipf. h)/iskon, e)/iskon, i)/skon: make like, deem or find like, compare to, judge as to likeness or similarity; a)/llw| d' au)to
 fwti\ katakru/ptwn h)/isken, ‘made himself look like’ another man, Od. 4.247 ; e)me\ soi\ vi/skontes, i. e. taking me for thee, Il. 16.41 ; to\ me
 a)/mmes e)i/skomen o(/sson q' i(sto
 nho/s, ‘we judged it to be as large,’ Od. 9.321 ; e)i/skomen a)/cion ei)=nai | trei=s e(no\s a)nti\ pefa/sqai, ‘deem it a fair equivalent,’ Il. 13.446, Il. 21.332.
ei)s - mai/omai: only aor. (metaph.), qanw\n ma/la me e)sma/ssato qu=mo/n, ‘searched into,’ i. e. carried grief to my heart, Il. 17.564 and Il. 20.425.
ei)s-noe/w, aor. ei)seno/hsa: perceive.
ei)/s-odos: entrance, Od. 10.90†.
ei)s - oixne/w (oi)/xomai), 3 pl. -eu=si, part. -eu=san: enter. (Od.)
ei)so/ke(n), ei)s o(/ ken: until, as long as.
ei)/somai: see (1) ei)=mi.—(2) ei)/dw, II.

ei)s - ora/w, ei)soro/wsi, opt. -oro/w|te, part. -oro/wn and -w=n, aor. ei)sei=don, e)/sidon, iter. e)si/desken, fut. e)so/yomai: look upon, behold, act. and mid.; the part. is often added to verbs by way of amplification, se/bas m' e)/xei ei)soro/wnta, Od. 6.161; so the inf. epexegetically, o)cu/taton pe/letai fa/os ei)sora/asqai, Il. 14.345.
e)i=sos: see e)i=/sh.
ei)so/yomai: see ei)sora/w.
ei)s-pe/tomai, aor. ei)se/ptato: fly into, Il. 21.494†.
ei)s - fore/w, ipf. e)sfo/reon: parallel form of ei)sfe/rw.
ei)s-xe/w: only aor. mid. (metaph.), e)se/xunto kata\ pu/la=s, they poured in at the gates, Il. 12.470 and Il. 21.610.
ei)s - wpo/s (w)/y): face to face with, directly in front of, new=n, Il. 15.653†.
ei(=tai: see e(/nnu=mi.
ei)/ te: see ei).
ei)=te = ei)/hte, see ei)<*>mi/.
ei)w= = e)a/w.
ei)/wqa: see e)/qw.
ei)wn: see e)a/w.
ei)/ws = e(/ws.

e)k, before vowels e)c: out.—I. adv. (here belong the examples of ‘tmesis’ so-called), e)k d' eu)na=\s e)/balon, Il. 1.436; e)k d) e)/ssuto la=o/s, Il. 8.58; a gen. in the same clause may specify the relation of the adverb, thus forming a transition to the true prepositional use, e)k d' a)/gage klisi/hs (gen. of place whence) *bri=shi/da, Il. 1.346.—II. prep w. gen., out of, (forth) from; of distance or separation, e)k bele/wn, ‘out of range,’ Il. 11.163 ; e)k kapnou=, ‘out of,’ ‘away from’ the smoke, Od. 16.288; often where motion is rather implied than expressed, as with verbs of beginning, attaching or hanging, e)k de\ tou= a)rxo/menos, ‘beginning with that,’ Od. 23.199 ; e)k passalo/fi kre/masen fo/rmigga, Od. 8.67; th=s d' e)c a)rgu/reos telamwn h)=n, ‘attached to it,’ Il. 11.38 ; e)c e(te/rwn e(/ter' e)sti/n, ‘one set of buildings adjoining another,’ Od. 17.266; hence temporal, e)k tou=de, e)c ou(=, since; often causal, e)c a=)re/wn mhtro\s kexolwme/nos, ‘in consequence of,’ Il. 9.566; sometimes nearly equiv. to u(po/, i. e. source for agency, pa/sxein ti e)/k tinos, e)fi/lhqen e)k *dio/s, Il. 2.669; phrases, e)k qu=mou= filei=n, e)c e)/ridos ma/xesqai, etc.—e)k is accented (‘anastrophe’) when it follows its case, kau/matos e)/c, Il. 5.865, *c 472, Od. 17.518.
*(eka/bh: Hecuba, the wife of Priam, daughter of Dymas, a Phrygian king, Il. 6.293, Il. 16.718. (Il.)

e(ka/ - ergos (veka/s, ve/rgon): far- working, far-worker, epith. of Apollo, the ‘far-darter.’ Some moderns are disposed to set aside the traditional interpretation in favor of new ones, in regard to which, however, they do not agree among themselves.
e)ka/hn: see kai/w.
e(/kaqen (veka/s): from far away, afar, far.
*(ekamh/dh: daughter of Arsinous, and slave of Nestor, Il. 11.624.
e(ka/s (veka/s): adv., far, remote; freq. w. gen., far from.—Comp., e(kaste/rw, sup. e(kasta/tw.
e(ka/stoqi: in each place, ‘in each division,’ Od. 3.8†.

e(/kastos (vek.): each, each one; in sing. regularly w. pl. vb., and in app. to pl. subjects, oi(\ me\n kakkei/ontes e)/ban oi)=ko/nde ve/kastos, ‘each to his home,’ Il. 1.606; pl., less common and strictly referring to each of several parties or sets of persons, Il. 3.1; sometimes, however, equiv. to the sing., Od. 14.436.
e(ka/terqe(n) (vek.): from or on both sides.
e(kath-bele/ths, a=o = e(kathbo/los, Il. 1.75†.
e(kato/g-xeiros: hundred - handed, Il. 1.402†.
e(kato/-zugos: with a hundred benches, nhu=s, an hyperbole, Il. 20.247†.

e(kato/m-bh (bou=s): hecatomb; properly, ‘sacrifice of a hundred oxen,’ but the number is a round one, as the hecatombs mentioned always contain less than 100 head; hence for ‘sacrifice’ generally, Il. 2.321, etc.
e(kato/m - boios: worth a hundred oxen; ‘the value of a hundred oxen,’ e(kato/mboion, Il. 21.79. (Il.)
e(kato/m-pedos, e(kato/mpodos (pou/s): a hundred feet each way, Il. 23.164†.
e(kato/m - polis: hundred - citied, in round numbers (cf. Od. 19.174), epith. of Crete, Il. 2.649†.
e(kato/m - pulos: hundred-gated, epith. of Egyptian Thebes, Il. 9.383†.
e(kato/n: hundred; freq. as a round number, alone and in compounds.
e(/katos (veka/s): far-working, subst., the far-worker; epith. of Apollo; cf. e(ka/ergos, e(kathbo/los. (Il.).
e)k - bai/nw, aor. 1 part. e)kbh/santes, aor. 2 imp. e)/kbhte: go out, esp. go ashore, disembark; aor. 1 trans., ‘putting you ashore,’ Od. 24.301.

e)k-ba/llw, ipf. e)/kballe, aor. 2 e)/kbalon: throw or cast out or forth, let fall; xeiro\s e)/gxos, the spear from the hand, Il. 14.419; so of striking something from the hand of another, etc.; of felling trees, Od. 5.244; metaph., e)/pos, *s 324, Od. 4.503.
e)/k-basis: landing-place, Od. 5.410†.
e)k - blw/skw, aor. 2 e)/kmolen: go forth, Il. 11.604†.
e)kgega/men, e)kgega/thn, e)kgegaw/s: see e)kgi/gnomai.
e)k - gi/gnomai, aor. e)cege/nonto, perf. du. e)kgega/thn, inf. e)kgega/men, part. e)kgegaw=ti: spring from, perf. be descended from, tino/s.
e)/k-gonos: offspring, child.
e)k - de/rkomai: look forth from, Il. 23.477†.
e)k-de/rw, aor. part. e)kdei/ra=s: flay, Od. 10.19†.
e)k-de/xomai: receive from, tini/ ti, Il. 13.710†.
e)/k-dhlos: conspicuous, Il. 5.2†.
e)k-dia-bai/nw, aor. 2 part. e)kdiaba/ntes: pass quite over, Il. 10.198†.
e)k - di/dwmi, aor. 2 imp. e)/kdote: deliver over, Il. 3.459†.

e)k-du=/nw, e)kdu/w, ipf. e)/kdu=ne, aor. opt. e)kdu=men, part. e)kdu=/s, mid. ipf. e)cedu/onto: get out from, put off, doff; e)kdu=\s mega/roio, Od. 22.334; e)/kdu=ne xitw=na, Od. 1.437; teu/xea t' e)cedu/onto, Il. 3.114; metaph., o)/leqron, ‘escape,’ Il. 16.99.
e)kei=qi: there, Od. 17.10†.

e)kei=nos, h, o, and kei=nos: that one (ille), he, she; kei=nos me/n toi o(/d' au)to\s e)gw/, pa/ter, o<*>\n su\ metalla=|s, ‘I myself here am he,’ Od. 24.321; freq. deictic, kei=nos o(/ ge, yonder he is, Il. 3.391, Il. 5.604.—Adv., kei/nh|, there, Od. 13.111.
e)ke/kasto: see kai/numai.
e)ke/kleto: see ke/lomai.
e)ke/klito: see kli=/nw.
e)/kha: see kai/w.
e(kh-boli/h (veka/s, ba/llw): shooting far, pl., attribute of a hunter, Il. 5.54†.
e(kh-bo/los = e(kathbo/los, epithet of Apollo.

e(/khlos (vek.) and eu)/khlos: of good cheer, free from care, at ease; often negatively, ‘undisturbed,’ ‘unmolested,’ Il. 6.70, Il. 17.340; iron., e(/khlos e)rre/tw, ‘let him go to perdition at his leisure,’ Il. 9.376.
e(/khti (ve/khti): by the will or grace (of a god). (Od.)
e)k qnh/skw: only aor. e)/kqanon ge/lw|, died a-laughing, Od. 18.100†.
e)k - qrw/skw, aor. e)ce/qore, e)/kqore: spring or leap forth.
e)k-kaqai/rw: clean out, Il. 2.153†.
e(k - kai - deka/ - dwros: sixteen palms (dw=ra) long, of the horns of a wild goat, Il. 4.109†.
e)k - kale/w, aor. part. -e/sa=s, -antes: all out or forth, mid., to oneself.
e)k-kat-ei=don, part. e)kkatidw/n: look down from; *perga/mou, Il. 4.508 and Il. 7.21.
e)k - kle/ptw, aor. e)ce/kleyen: steal away, Il. 5.390†.
e)k - kuli=/w: only aor. pass. e)cekuli/sqh, rolled (headlong) down from; e)k di/frou, Il. 6.42 and Il. 23.394.

e)k-lanqa/nw, aor. 2 e)kle/laqon, mid. aor. e)kla/qeto, e)cela/qonto, subj. e)klela/qwntai, opt. -oito, inf. -e/sqai: act., causative, make to forget utterly; tina/ ti, Il. 2.600; mid., forget utterly; tino/s, also w. inf., Od. 10.557.
e)kle/eo: see klei/ Od. 24.1.
e)/k - lhsis (lh/qw): forgetting and forgiving, Od. 24.485†.
e)k - lu=/w, mid. fut. e)klu=/somai, pass. aor. e)celu/qh, Il. 5.293 (v. l. e)cesu/qh): loose from, mid., set free from, w. gen., Od. 10.286.
e)k-mei/romai: only perf., qew=n e)ce/mmore ti=mh=s, has won a high share in the honor of the gods, Od. 5.335† (v. l. qew=n e)/c).
e)/kmolen: see e)kblw/skw.
e)k-muza/w, aor. part. e)kmuzh/sa=s: suck out, Il. 4.218†.
e)k - noste/w, aor. part. e)knosth/sa=s: return from, ma/xhs (v. l. ma/xhs e)/k).

e)/k-paglos, sup. e)kpaglo/tatos: terrible, both of persons and of things; adv., e)/kpaglon, e)/kpagla, e)kpa/glws,
terribly, but often colloquially weakened, ‘exceedingly,’ e)/kpagla filei=n, Il. 3.415 (cf. ai)na/, ai)nw=s).
e)k - paifa/ssw (fa/os): only inf. (metaph.), shine forth, of brilliant performance, or perhaps of lightning swiftness, Il. 5.803†.
e)k-pa/llw: only aor. mid., e)/kpalto, spirted out, Il. 20.483†.
e)k-pata/ssw: strike out; only pass. perf. part. (metaph.), fre/nas e)kpepatagme/nos, ‘bereft of sense,’ Od. 18.327† (cf. e)kplh/ssw).
e)k - pe/mpw, aor. e)/kpemya: send out or away, mid., from oneself; conduct forth, Il. 24.681.
e)kpe/potai: see e)kpi=/nw.
e)k-pera/w, e)kpera/a|, -o/wsi, aor. e)cepe/rhse: pass through, of arrow or spear; traverse, of the sea.
e)k-pe/rqw, fut. e)kpe/rsw, aor. 1 subj. e)kpe/rswsi, aor. 2 e)cepra/qomen: utterly destroy, pillage from; poli/wn, Il. 1.125.
e)kpese/ein: see e)kpi=/ptw.
e)kpefuui=ai: see e)kfu/w.
e)k - pi=/nw, aor. 2 e)/kpion, perf. pass. e)kpe/potai: drink up, drink dry. (Od.)
e)k-pi=/ptw, aor. 2 e)/kpeson, inf. -se/ein: fall out, fall down (from).
e)k-plh/ssw, pass. aor. 2 3 pl. e)/kplhgen: strike out, regularly metaph., dismay, terrify, with and without fre/nas, Il. 18.225.
e)k-pote/omai (pe/tomai): flutter down from the sky (*dio/s), of snow-flakes, Il. 19.357†.
e)k-preph/s, e/os (pre/pw): conspicuous, distinguished, Il. 2.483†.
e)k-pro-kale/w: only aor. mid. part., e)kprokalessame/nh, having called him forth to herself, Od. 2.400†.
e)k-pro-lei/pw: only aor. 2 part. e)kprolipo/ntes, going forth and leaving, the wooden horse, Od. 8.515†.
e)k - ptu/w: only aor. e)ce/ptuse, spat forth, salt water, Od. 5.322†.
<*>e)k - punqa/nomai: only aor. 2 inf., search out, Il. 10.308 and 320.
e)kre/mw: see kre/mamai.
e)k - rh/gnu=mi, aor. e)ce/rrhca: break or burst away, foll. by part. gen., Il. 23.421; of ‘snapping’ a bowstring, Il. 15.469.
e)k-sao/w, aor. e)cesa/wsen: save (from), tina/ (tinos).
e)k - seu/w, aor. mid. e)ce/ssuto, pass. e)cesu/qh: mid., rush or hasten forth; w. gen., Il. 7.1, Od. 9.373; fig., blefa/rwn e)ce/ssuto u(/pnos, Od. 12.366.
e)k - spa/w, aor. e)ce/spase, mid. part. e)kspassame/nw: pull out, mid., something that is one's own, Il. 7.255.
e)/kta, e)/ktaqen: see ktei/nw.
e)kta/dios, 3 (tei/nw): broad; ‘with ample folds,’ xlai=na, Il. 10.134†.
e)k - ta/mnw, subj. e)kta/mnh|si, aor. e)ce/tamon, e)/ktame: cut out, hew out, fell trees, Od. 9.320; of the havoc wrought by wild boars, Il. 12.149.
e)/ktan: see ktei/nw.
e)k-tanu/w, aor. e)ceta/nussa, pass. e)cetanu/sqhn: stretch out, ‘lay low,’ Il. 17.58; mid., fall prone, Il. 7.271.

e)k-tele/w, e)ktelei/w, aor. e)cete/lessa, pass. ipf. e)ceteleu=nto, perf. e)ktete/lestai: bring to an end, finish, fulfil, consummate, achieve; o(/ moi ou)/ ti qeoi\ go/non e)cete/leion | e)c e)mou=, ‘granted me no offspring of my own,’ Il. 9.493.
e)k-ti/qhmi, aor. 2 part. e)kqei/s: put or set out, Od. 23.179†.
e)/ktoqen: outside, w. gen., ‘separate from,’ Od. 1.133; in Od. 9.239 the MSS. have e)/ntoqen. (Od.)
e)/ktoqi: outside, ‘far from,’ nhw=n, *o 391, Il. 22.439.
*(ekto/reos: of Hector, Il. 2.416.
*(ektori/dhs: son of Hector, Astyanax, Il. 6.401.
e)kto/s (e)k): outside, Il. 4.151; w. gen., outside of, Il. 23.424, and w. a)po/, ‘apart from,’ Il. 10.151.
e(/ktos: sixth.
e)/ktose: out of, w. gen., Od. 14.277†.
e)/ktosqe(n): outside, Il. 7.341; w. gen., outside of.
e)/ktupe: see ktupe/w.

*(/ektwr, oros: Hector, son of Priam and Hecuba, Il. 22.80, 405, 430, Il. 24.747; husband of Andromache, Il. 6.390, Il. 24.723; and father of Astyanax. Hector was the mainstay of Troy in the war, oi)=os ga\r e)ru=/eto *)/=ilion *(/ektwr, Il. 6.403. He was slain by Achilles in revenge for the killing of Patroclus, Il. 18.115, Il. 22.326, 331, 361.
e(kurh/ (vek.): mother-in-law.
e(kuro/s (vek.): father-in-law.

e)k-fai/nw, fut. e)kfanei=, pass. aor. e)cefaa/nqh, 3 pl. -fa/anqen, aor. 2 e)cefa/nh:
act., bring to light, Il. 19.104; mid. and pass., shine out, sparkle, Il. 19.17; appear, come to light, Od. 12.441.

e)k-fe/rw, ipf. e)ce/feron, e)/kfere, fut. 3 pl. e)coi/sousi: bear or carry out or off; of bearing away a prize, Il. 23.785; stolen property, Od. 15.470; bringing payment to maturity, Il. 21.450; and esp. of carrying forth the dead for burial, Il. 24.786; intrans., take the lead, in racing, Il. 23.376, 759.

e)k-feu/gw, aor. 2 e)ce/fugon, e)/kfuge: flce or fly from, escape from, escape; w. gen., a(lo/s, e)/nqen, y 236, Od. 12.212, or transitively w. acc., o(rmh/n, kh=ras, ga/mon, Il. 9.355, d 512, Od. 19.157; freq. of the weapon flying from the hand of him who hurls it, Il. 5.18, etc.
e)/k - fhmi, only pres. inf. mid. e)/kfasqai: speak out, utter (e)/pos), Od. 13.308 and Od. 10.246.
e)k-fqe/ggomai: only aor. e)kfqe/gcato, called out from, Il. 21.213.
e)k-fqi=/nw: only pass. plup. e)ce/fqito, had been consumed out of the ships, Od. 9.163 and Od. 12.329.
e)k-fore/w (fe/rw): carry forth from; ne/kuas oi)/kwn, Od. 22.451; mid., move forth from, nhw=n, Il. 19.360.
e)/kfuge: see e)kfeu/gw.
e)k-fu/w: only perf. part. (intrans.) e)kpefuui=ai, growing out of, kefalai\ au)xe/nos, Il. 11.40†.

e)k-xe/w, mid. aor. 1 e)kxeu/ato, aor. 2 e)ce/xuto and e)/kxuto, part. e)kxu/menos, pass. plup. e)ceke/xunto: pour out; mid., something that is one's own, o)istou/s, Od. 22.3; or intrans., stream or pour forth, u=(/datos e)kxume/noio, Il. 21.300; met., of meshes ‘hanging down,’ Od. 8.279; men or animals ‘pouring forth’ in numbers, Od. 8.515.

e(kw/n, e(kou=sa (vek.): willingly, intentionally, of one's own will; e(kw\n a)e/konti/ ge qu=mw=|, i. e. not by compulsion, and yet reluctantly, Il. 4.43 ; e(kw\n d' ou)k a)/n tis e(/loito (dw=ra qew=n), i. e. they cannot be got otherwise than from the gift of the gods, Il. 3.66.
e)la/a=n: see e)lau/nw.
e)lai/h: olive - tree; i(erh/, sacred to Athēna, Od. 13.372.
e)la=i+/neos, e)la=/i+nos: of olive-wood.
e)/la(s)sa, e)la/saske: see e)lau/nw.
*)/elasos: a Trojan, Il. 16.696.
e)la/sswn (e)laxu/s), irreg. comp. of mi=kro/s: only neut. e)/lasson, less, Il. 10.357†.
e)la/th: pine or fir; pl., ‘oars of pine,’ Il. 7.5, Od. 12.172.
e)lath/r, h=ros (e)la/w): driver, charioteer. (Il.)
*)/elatos: (1) an ally of the Trojans, Il. 6.33.—(2) a suitor of Penelope, Od. 22.267.
*)elatreu/s (‘Rower’): a Phaeacian, Od. 8.111, 129.

e)lau/nw, e)la/w, inf. e)la/a=n, ipf. e)/lwn, fut. e)lo/wsi, aor. h)/lasse, e)/lasse, iter. e)la/saske, pass. plup. h)lh/lato, e)lh/lato, 3 pl. e)lhla/dato or e)lhle/(d)ato: drive, impel, strike, mid., for oneself, Od. 4.637, Il. 10.537, etc.; freq. of ‘rowing’ a vessel, with and without nh=a, Od. 13.22, pass. Od. 13.155; so of driving horses, without obj. expressed, Il. 5.264 ; ma/sti=cen d' e)la/a=n, Od. 3.484; hence apparently often intrans., po/nton e)lau/nontes, Il. 7.6, *n 27, Od. 7.319; of ‘driving away’ cattle, horses, etc., Il. 1.154; in the sense strike the verb occurs often, esp. of ‘forging,’ Il. 12.296; of ‘drawing,’ or ‘laying out’ a fence or wall, or a swath in reaping, e(/rkos, tei=xos, ta/fron, Il. 7.450, Il. 9.349, Il. 18.564; staurou/s, Od. 14.11; xa/lkeoi toi=xoi e)lhle/dato, ‘were extended,’ Od. 7.86 ; o)/gmon, Il. 11.68; metaph., of ‘persecuting,’ Od. 5.290; being ‘racked’ with pain, Il. 16.518; ‘raising’ a din, Il. 1.575.
e)lafh-bo/los: (a)nh/r) deer-hunter, Il. 18.319†.
e)/lafos, o( and h(: stag or hind, Il. 3.24; a symbol of cowardice, Il. 1.225.
e)lafro/s, -o/teros, -o/tatos: light (moving), nimble; of the swift wind, Il. 19.416; light (of weight), Il. 12.450; met., po/lemos, Il. 22.287.—Adv., e)lafrw=s, lightly, easily, Od. 5.240.
e)/laxe: see lagxa/nw.
e)laxu/s, e)la/xeia (cf. e)la/sswn): small, Od. 9.116, Od. 10.509, v. l. la/xeia.
e)la/w: see e)lau/nw.
e)/ldomai (veld.), e)e/ldomai: desire, long for; tino/s, *c 276, Od. 5.210, etc.; also ti\, Od. 1.409, and w. inf., Il. 13.638, Od. 20.35; in pass. signif., Il. 16.494.
e)/ldwr, e)e/ldwr (e)veld.): desire, wish.
e(/le: see ai(re/w.
e)leai/rw (e)/leos), ipf. e)le/airen, iter. e)leai/reskon: pity, feel compassion; ou)k e)leai/reis a)/ndras.. misge/menai kako/thti, ‘thou dost unpityingly involve men in trouble,’ Od. 20.202.
e)legxei/h = e)/legxos. ‘Devote to shame,’ ‘cover with shame,’ Il. 22.100, Od. 14.38.
e)legxh/s, e/os: despicable; e)le/gxistos, most infamous, Il. 2.285.
e)/legxos: shame, reproach, disgrace; pl., Od. 21.333; pl. as term of reproach (abstr. for concrete), ka/k' e)le/gxea, miscreants, cowards, Il. 2.235, Il. 24.260.
e)le/gxw: dishonor, bring disgrace upon, Od. 21.424 ; tw=n mh\ su/ ge mu=qon e)le/gch|s | mhde\ po/das, ‘put not to shame their words and mission,’ i. e. by making them vain, Il. 9.522.
e(le/ein: see ai(re/w.
e)leeino/s, -o/teros, -o/tatos: pitiable, piteous; neut., and esp. pl., as adv., pitifully, Od. 8.531, Il. 22.37, Il. 2.314.
e)lee/w, fut. e)leh/sei, aor. e)le/hse: pity, have compassion or pity upon; tina/, also ti\, Il. 6.94; w. part., Il. 15.44, Il. 17.346, Od. 5.336.
e)leh/mwn: compassionate, Od. 5.191†.
e)lehtu/s, u/os = e)/leos, Od. 6.82 and Od. 17.451.
e)/lekto: see le/gw.

e)leli/zw, aor. e)le/lice, mid. aor. part. e)lelica/menos, pass. plup. e)le/likto, aor. e)leli/xqh, 3 pl. e)le/lixqen: set quivering or quaking, whirl round and round, mid. intrans.; me/gan d' e)le/licen *)/olumpon, ‘made Olympus tremble,’ Il. 1.530, Il. 8.199 ; e)leli/xqh gui=a, ‘quaked,’ Il. 22.448; of a spear brandished in the hand, seio/menon e)le/likto, Il. 13.558; of a serpent ‘coiled,’ Il. 11.39; Odysseus' ship is made to ‘spin’ by the lightning, his raft by a great wave, Od. 12.416, Od. 5.314; esp. of facing about and ‘rallying’ in the fray, oi(\ d' e)leli/xqhsan kai\ e)nanti/oi e)/stan *)axaiw=n, *z 106, Il. 17.278.

*(ele/nh: Helen, the wife of Menelāus, daughter of Zeus and Leda, Il. 3.199, 426, and sister of Castor and Pollux, Il. 3.238. Often w. the epithet *)argei/h, Il. 2.161, Od. 4.184; Il. 3.91, 121, *w 761, Od. 4.12, 219, 279. Helen returned to her home in Sparta after the war, and in the Odyssey is seen living happily with Menelāus, d, o.
*(/elenos: Helenus.—(1) a son of Priam, the best seer of the Trojans, Il. 6.76, Il. 13.576, Il. 24.249.—(2) a Greek, son of Oenopion, Il. 5.707.
e)leo/-qreptos: growing in marshes, Il. 2.776†.
e)/leos: pity, compassion, Il. 24.44†.
e)leo/s: meat - board, dresser, Il. 9.215 and Od. 14.432.
e(/leskon: see ai(re/w.
e(leto/s (e(lei=n): to be caught; a)ndro\s yu=xh\ pa/lin e)lqei=n ou)/te lei+sth\ ou)/q' e(leth/, ‘the breath of life comes not back by plundering or capture,’ Il. 9.409†.
e(leu= = e(lou=, see ai(re/w.
e)leu/qeros: free; e)leu/qeron h)=mar, ‘the day of freedom’ (= e)leuqeri/a), Il. 6.455, cf. dou/lion h)=mar; krhth/r, ‘bowl of freedom,’ celebrating its recovery, Il. 6.528.
e)lefai/romai: delude, deceive, Il. 23.388; with a play upon e)le/fa=s, Od. 19.565.
e)le/fa=s, antos: ivory, Il. 4.141, Il. 5.583, Od. 4.73, Od. 8.404; a symbol of whiteness, Od. 18.196, Od. 23.200.
*)elefh/nwr: son of Chalcōdon, leader of the Abantes, Il. 2.540, Il. 4.467.
*)elew/n: a town in Boeotia, Il. 2.500.
e)lhla/dato, e)lh/latai, e)lh/lato, e)lhle/ato, e)lhle/dato: see e)lau/nw.
e)lhlouqw/s, e)lqe/men(ai): see e)/rxomai.
*(elika=/wn: a son of Antēnor, husband of Laodice, Il. 3.123.
*(eli/kh: a town in Achaea, containing a shrine of Poseidon, Il. 2.575, Il. 8.203.
*(elikw/nios: Heliconian; a)/nac, i. e. Poseidon, Il. 20.404.
e(lik-w=pis, idos, and e(li/k-wy, wpos (ve/lic, w)/y): quick-eyed, or, according to others, with arched eye-brows, Il. 1.98, 389.

e(/lic (veli/ssw): bent around, as epith. of kine, crumple-horned; joined with ei)li/podas, *i 466, Od. 1.92, and with eu)rume/twpoi, l 289, Od. 12.355.—Subst., e(/likes gnamptai/, armlets bent into a spiral. (See cut No. 2.)

e(li/ssw (vel.), inf. e(lisse/men, aor. part. e(li/ca=s, mid. ipf. ei(li/sseto, e(li/sseto, aor. part. e(lica/menos, pass. e(lixqe/ntwn: curl, wind, turn, mid. intrans., causative, ‘making it roll,’ Il. 13.204; of a serpent ‘coiling’ himself, e)lisso/menos peri\ xeih=|, Il. 22.95; savor of a sacri
fice curling upwards, e(lissome/nh peri\ kapnw=|, Il. 11.317; of turning the goal in a race, Il. 23.309; then of persons going around, turning to and fro, facing about and ‘rallying,’ Il. 21.11, Il. 23.320, Il. 12.74.
e(lkesi/-peplos: with trailing robe, epith. of Trojan women. (Il.)
e(lke-xi/twn, wnos: with trailing tunic, Il. 13.685†.

e(lke/w (e(/lkw), ipf. e(/lkeon, fut. e(lkh/sousi, aor. h(/lkhse, aor. pass. part. e(lkhqei/sa=s: drag, drag away (as captive), Il. 22.62; of dogs pulling and tearing, Il. 17.558, Il. 22.336; of maltreating or outraging. Od. 11.580.
e(lkhqmo/s (e(lke/w): dragging away into captivity, Il. 6.465†.
e(/lkos, eos: wound, sore, Il. 19.49 ; u(/drou, ‘from the serpent,’ Il. 2.723.
e(lkusta/zw: parallel form of e(lke/w, Il. 23.187 and Il. 24.21.

e(/lkw, inf. e(lke/men(ai): draw, drag, mid., something of one's own; of drawing a bow, Il. 4.122, Od. 21.419; ‘raising’ the balance, and ‘hoisting’ sails, Il. 22.212, Od. 15.291; ‘tugged at it,’ Il. 12.398; pass., ‘trailing,’ Il. 5.665; ‘wrenched,’ Il. 23.715; mid., of drawing one's sword, tearing one's hair, etc., Il. 10.15, Il. 17.136, Od. 19.506.
e)/llabe: see lamba/nw.

*(ella/s, a/dos: Hellas, understood by the ancients to be a Thessalian city and district in Phthiōtis, under the sway of Achilles, Il. 2.684; now more correctly described as the tract between the Asōpus and the Enīpeus; coupled with Phthia, Il. 9.395; the realm of Peleus, Od. 11.496 ; kaq' *(ella/da kai\ me/son *)/argos (all Greece), see *)/argos, epithets, kalligu/naika, eu)ruxo/roio, *b 683, Il. 9.447, 478.
e)lledano/s (ei)/lw): straw band for bundles of grain, Il. 18.553†.
*(/ellhnes: the inhabitants of Hellas, Il. 2.684; see *murmido/nes and *pane/llhnes.
*(ellh/s-pontos (‘Sea of Helle’): the Hellespont, with adjacent bodies of water, Od. 24.82.
e)llisa/mhn, e)li/sseto: see li/ssomai.
e)llita/neue: see litaneu/w.
e)llo/s, e(llo/s: young deer, Od. 19.228†.
e(/loimi, e(/lon, e(lo/mhn: see ai(re/w.
e(/los, eos (ve/los): meadow - land, marsh, Il. 4.483, Od. 14.474.
*elos (ve/los, cf. Veliae): (1) in Laconia, a maritime city, named from its marshes, Il. 2.584.—(2) a town of the Pylians, Il. 2.594.
e)lo/wsi: see e)lau/nw.
*)elph/nwr (‘Hopeful’): Elpēnor, a companion of Odysseus, Od. 10.552, Od. 11.51, 57.
e)lpi/s, i/dos (velpi/s): hope; e)/ti ga\r kai\ e)lpi/dos ai)=sa, ‘share’ of hope, the ‘boon’ of hope, ‘room’ for hope, Od. 19.84.

e)/lpw (ve/lpw), usually mid. e)/lpomai, e)e/lpetai, ipf. e)/lpeto, perf. e)/olpa (ve/volpa), plup. e)w/lpei: act., make to hope, give hopes, Od. 2.91, Od. 13.380; mid., hope, expect, also ‘think,’ Il. 9.40, Il. 13.309, Il. 19.328, Od. 9.419, Od. 21.314; even in bad sense, implying fear or apprehension, Il. 15.110; w. acc. ni=/khn, Il. 13.609, Il. 15.539; tou=to, Od. 21.317; foll. by inf., fut. in the meaning hope, in other meanings by tenses referring to the past, Il. 7.199, etc., freq. qu=mw=|, kata\ qu=mo/n, e)ni\ fresi/, also qu=mo\s e)/lpetai, Il. 15.701.
e)lpwrh/ = e)lpi/s. (Od.)
e)/lsai, e)/lsa=s: see ei)/lw.

e)lu/w (velu/w), aor. pass. e)lu/sqh, part. e)lusqei/s: wind, roll up; pass., of a chariot - pole dragging in curves, ‘wiggling,’ along the ground, Il. 23.393; of Priam bent prostrate at the feet of Achilles, Il. 24.510; Odysseus curled up under the belly of the ram, Od. 9.433.
e(/lx) = e(/lke, see e(/lkw.
e)/lwn: see e)lau/nw.
e(/lwr (velei=n): prey, spoil, of wild beasts, birds, enemies; pl., *patro/kloio e(/lwra a)poti=/nein, pay the penalty ‘for taking and slaying’ (e(lei=n) Patroclus, Il. 18.93.
e(lw/rion = e(/lwr, pl., Il. 1.4†.
e)mbado/n: on foot (over the sea), Il. 15.505†.

e)m-bai/nw, ipf. e)/mbainon, aor. 2 e)/mbh, -hton, subj. e)mbh/h|, perf. part. e)mbebaw=ta, -ui=a, plup. e)mbe/basan: set foot in, step into or upon, mount, go on board; e)/mbh nhi\ *pu/londe, ‘embarked for Pylos,’ Od. 4.656 ; mh/ tis qew=n e)mbh/h|, ‘come in thy way,’ Il. 16.94; Antilochus to his horses, e)/mbhton kai\ sfw=i, ‘go in!’ Il. 23.403; perf., stand upon (see bai/nw), i(/ppoisin kai\ a(/rmasin e)mbebaw=ta, Il. 5.199; of the leaden sinker ‘mounted’ upon the horn guard of a fish-hook, Il. 24.81.

e)m-ba/llw, ipf. e)ne/balle, aor. 2 e)/m-
balon, inf. e)mbale/ein: throw or cast in; pu=r nhi/, Il. 15.598; tina\ po/ntw|, Il. 14.258; ti\ xersi/n, ‘put’ or ‘give into’ the hands, Il. 14.218, Od. 2.37, etc.; brotou= a=)ne/ros e)/mbalon eu)nh=|, ‘brought thee to the couch of a mortal,’ Il. 18.85; metaph., nei=ko/s tisi, Il. 4.444; i=(/meron qu=mw=|, ‘infuse,’ ‘inspire with,’ Il. 3.139; intrans., kw/ph|s, ‘lay to’ the oars, Od. 9.489; mid., mh=tin e)mba/lleo qu=mw=|, ‘lay to heart,’ Il. 23.313 ; fu/cin, ‘take thought of,’ Il. 10.447.
e)m-basileu/w: be king in, rule therein, Il. 2.572 and Od. 15.413.
e)mbe/basan, e)mbebaw/s, e)mbh/h|, e)/mbh: see e)mbai/nw.
e)m-bre/momai: only pres. 3 sing., the wind roars in the sail, Il. 15.627†.
e)/mbruon: new-born lamb. (i).
e)me/qen, e)mei=o, e)me/o, e)meu=: see e)gw/.
e)me/mhkon: see mhka/omai.
e)/men(ai): see ei)mi/.
e(/men(ai): see i(/hmi.
e)me/w: spew or spit out, Il. 15.11†.
e)/mi=kto: see mi=/gnu=mi.
e)/mmaqe: see manqa/nw.
e)m-mape/ws: instantly, Il. 5.836 and Od. 14.485.
e)m - memaw/s, ui=a, du. -w=te, pl. -w=tes (me/maa): eager, vehement.
e)/mmen(ai): see ei)mi/.
e)m - mene/s (me/nw): always e)mmene\s ai)ei/, continually ever.
e)/mmore: see mei/romai.
e)/m - moros (mei/romai): sharing in, ti=mh=s, pl., Od. 8.480†.

e)mo/s, h/, o/n, no voc.: my, mine; rarely with art., Il. 11.608, Od. 4.71 ; ou(mo/s (= o( e)mo/s), Il. 8.360; strengthened by gen. of au)to/s, e)mo\n au)tou= xrei=os, ‘my own,’ Od. 2.45; equiv. to obj. gen., e)mh\ a)ggeli/h, ‘about me,’ Il. 19.336.
e)m-pa/zomai, ipf. e)mpa/zeto: care for, w. gen. (acc., Od. 16.422); usually with negative.
e)/m-paios: conversant with, tino/s, Od. 20.379 (e)/mpa^ion) and Od. 21.400.
e)m - pa/ssw: sprinkle in; only ipf. (fig.) e)ne/passe, ‘was weaving in,’ Il. 3.126 and Il. 22.441.

e)/m-pedos (pe/don): firmly standing or footed, Od. 23.203, Il. 13.512; firm, immovable, unshaken, Il. 12.9, 12; so of the mind, bi/h, me/nos, fre/nes, ‘unimpaired,’ Od. 10.493 ; e)/mpedos ou)d' a)esi/frwn (*pri/amos), Il. 20.183; ‘sure,’ ‘certain,’ Od. 19.250, Od. 8.30; of time, ‘lasting,’ ‘constant,’ Il. 8.521, Od. 8.453; and metaph., h)=tor, fre/nes, *z 352, Od. 18.215.—Neut. e)/mpedon as adv., with the same meanings, sthri/cai firmly, Od. 12.434 ; me/nein, without leaving the spot, Il. 5.527 ; qe/ein, ‘constantly,’ Il. 13.141, Od. 13.86.
e)mpesei=n: see e)mpi=/ptw.

e)/mphs: wholly, nevertheless; the former meaning is denied by some scholars, and there are but very few passages to which the latter meaning is not applicable, e. g. Od. 18.354, Od. 19.37; in its common signif. of still, yet, nevertheless, e)/mphs may be placed after the concessive part. (precisely like o(/mws in Att.), and freq. at the end of the verse, though grammatically and in sense belonging to the leading verb; *trwsi\ me\n eu)kta\ ge/nhtai (e)pikrate/ousi per) e)/mphs, *c 98, Il. 9.518, etc. kai\ e)/mphs, Od. 5.205; a)ll' e)/mphs, Il. 8.33; d) e)/mphs correl. to me/n, Il. 1.562.

e)m - pi/plhmi, imp. e)mpi/plhqi, fut. inf. e)mplhse/men, aor. e)ne/plhse, imp. e)/mplhson, subj. e)niplh/sh|s, part. e)mplh/sa=s, mid. aor. e)mplh/sato, inf. e)niplh/sasqai, part. e)mplhsa/menos, aor. 2 (w. pass. signif.), e)/mplhto, -nto: fill full (ti/ tinos), mid., fill or sate oneself; fig., qu=mo\n o)duna=/wn, Od. 19.117; ui(=os e)niplhsqh=nai o)fqalmoi=sin, ‘have the satisfaction of looking on my son,’ Od. 11.452; aor. 2 mid. as pass., e)/mplhnto brotw=n a)gorai/, Od. 8.16.

e)m-pi=/ptw, aor. e)/mpese: fall into or upon; pu=r e)/mpese nhusi/n, Il. 16.113; e)n u=(/lh|, Il. 11.155; freq. in hostile sense, e)/mpes' e)pikrate/ws, ‘charge,’ Il. 16.81; metaph., xo/los, de/os e)/mpese qu=mw=|, Il. 9.436, Il. 14.207; e)/pos moi e)/mpese qu=mw=|, ‘came to my mind,’ Od. 12.266.
e)/m - pleios and e)ni/ - pleios: filled with, full. (Od.)
e)m-plh/gdhn (e)mplh/ssw): at random, Od. 20.132†.
e)/m-plhn (pe/las): hard by, w. gen., Il. 2.526†.
e)mplh/sato, e)/mplhto, -nto: see e)mpi/plhmi.
e)mplh/ssw: see e)niplh/ssw.

e)m - pne/w, e)mpnei/w, aor. e)ne/pneuse, e)/mpneuse: breathe upon, Il. 17.502; met., inspire, me/nos, qa/rsos, etc.; of an inspiring ‘suggestion,’ Od. 19.138 (e)/mpnuto, e)mpnu/nqh, v. l. a)mp., see a)napne/w.)
e)m-poie/w: only ipf. e)nepoi/eon, fitted into, Il. 7.438.
e)m-pola/w: only mid. ipf., e)mpolo/wnto, gained for themselves by trading, Od. 15.456†.
e)/m-poros: passenger, on board another's ship, Od. 2.319 and Od. 24.300.

e)m-prh/qw, e)niprh/qw, ipf. e)ne/prhqon, e)niprh/sw, fut. inf. e)mprh/sein, aor. e)ne/prhse, e)/mprhse, subj. e)niprh/swsi: (1) of wind, blow into, fill the sail, Od. 2.427. —(2) of fire, kindle; nh=as, a)/stu, nekrou/s, Il. 8.182; usually with puri/, also puro/s (part. gen.), Il. 9.242, Il. 16.82.
e)m-puri-bh/ths (pu=r, bai/nw): standing over the fire; tri/pos, Il. 23.702†.
e)m-fore/w: only mid. ipf., e)mfore/onto, were borne about in the waves, Od. 12.419 and Od. 14.309.
e)/m-fu=los: of the same tribe, Od. 15.273†.

e)m-fu/w, aor. e)ne/fu=se, perf. 3 pl. e)mpefu/a=si, part. fem. e)mpefuui<*>=a: trans. (aor. 1 act.), implant, metaph., qeo/s moi e)n fresi\n oi)/ma=s, Od. 22.348; intrans., grow in or upon, tri/xes kra=ni/w|, Il. 8.84; fig., e)mpefuui=a, ‘clinging closely,’ Il. 1.513.

e)n, e)ni/, ei)n, ei)ni/: in.—I. adv., in, therein, among them, Il. 5.740, etc.; esp. the form e)/ni, for e)/nesti, e)/neisi, pole/es d' e)/ni mu=qoi, Il. 20.248. Here belong all examples of ‘tmesis’ so-called, e)n d' e)/pese, ‘fell on’ the throng, Il. 15.624. The adv. may be defined in its relation by a dative in the same clause, thus showing an approach to the true prepositional use, e)n de/ te qu=mo\s sth/qesin a)/tromo/s e)stin, in them, viz., in their breasts, Il. 16.162.—II. prep. w. dat., in, on, among; not only of place and persons, e)n *danaoi=si, e)n a=)qana/toisi, e)ni\ stratw=|, e)n pa=sin, Od. 2.194; but also of conditions, physical and mental, e)n filo/thti, e)n pe/nqei+, e)n doih=|, Il. 9.230. Of time, w(/rh| e)n ei)arinh=|, *p 643, Od. 18.367; instead of a causal or an instrumental expression, e)n o)fqalmoi=s o(ra=n, Il. 1.587, Il. 3.306, Od. 10.385; kataktei/nesqai a)ndrw=n e)n pala/mh|sin, *e 558, Il. 24.738, etc.; often with verbs of motion, the state of rest after motion taking the place of movement into, e)n gou/nasi pi=/ptein, Il. 5.370; e)n xersi\ tiqe/nai, etc.; elliptical, e)ni\ *ki/rkhs, sc. o)/ikw|, Od. 10.282, esp. ei)n *)ai/da=o. When e)ni/ follows its case, it is written e)/ni (‘anastrophe’), Il. 9.53.

e)n-ai/simos: fateful, favorable (opp. parai/sios), Il. 2.353, Od. 2.182, 159; then proper, seemly, just (e)n ai)/sh|, kat' ai)=san, kata\ moi=ran), a)nh/r, Il. 6.521; fre/nes, Od. 18.220; dw=ma, Il. 24.425; neut. sing. as adv., e)nai/simon e)lqei=n, ‘opportunely,’ Il. 6.519; predicative, Od. 2.122, Od. 7.299.
e)n-ali/gkios: like, tini/ ti, to some one in some respect, Od. 1.371 ; a)/nthn, in countenance.
e)na/lios: see ei)na/lios.
e)n - ame/lgw: only ipf., e)na/melgen, milked therein, Od. 9.223†.
e)n - anti/ - bion: with hostile front against, Od. 14.270, Od. 17.439, Il. 20.130.

e)n-anti/os, 3: opposite, of motion and position, in friendly sense or hostile, against, Il. 6.247, Od. 23.89, Od. 10.89, Il. 5.497; of the ‘manifest’ appearance of a deity, Od. 6.329; adv., e)nanti/on, e)nanti/on w(=de ka/lesson, summon him hither ‘into my presence,’ Od. 19.544; freq. e)nanti/on e)lqei=n tino/s, go ‘to meet,’ or ‘against.’
e)/nace: see na/ssw.
e)/nara, ta: spoils (armor taken from the slain foe), booty, Il. 15.347, Il. 9.188.
e)n - argh/s, e/s: visible, manifest, Od. 4.841, Od. 7.201 ; xalepoi\ de\ qeoi\ fai/nesqai e)nargei=s, it is hazardous when the gods appear ‘in their true forms,’ Il. 20.131.
e)n-arhrw/s (root a)r), o/s: well fitted in, Od. 5.236†.

e)nari/zw (e)/nara), ipf. e)na/rize, aor. e)na/rica: strip of armor, despoil; tina/ ti, Il. 17.187, Il. 22.323, *m 195, Il. 15.343; then, usually, slay in battle, kill, Il. 5.155, Il. 16.731, Il. 1.191. (Il.)
e)n-ari/qmios: filling up the number, Od. 12.65; of account (e)n a)riqmw=|), Il. 2.202.
e)/natos, ei)/natos: ninth.
e)/n-aulos (au)lo/s): channel, river-bed (of the streams in the Trojan plain, dry in summer), water-course, Il. 16.71, Il. 21.283, 312.
e)n-dei/knu=mi: only fut. mid., e)ndei/comai, I will declare it, Il. 19.83.
e(/n-deka: eleven, round number in Il. 21.45.
e(ndeka/-phxus, u: eleven cubits long, Il. 6.319 and Il. 8.494.
e(nde/katos: eleventh; e)ndeka/th|, on the eleventh day, often as round number after mentioning ten days, Il. 24.666, Od. 2.374, Od. 4.588.

e)n-de/cios: on the right, favorable, Il. 9.236; adv. e)nde/cia, from left to right, regarded as the lucky direction in pouring wine, drawing lots, etc., Il. 1.597, Il. 7.184, Od. 17.365; cf. e)pide/cia.
e)n-de/w, aor. e)ne/dhse: bind or tie in or on, Il. 15.469, Od. 5.260; fig., ‘involve,’ ‘entangle,’ Il. 2.111, Il. 9.18.
e)n-di/hmi: only ipf., au)/tws e)ndi/esan ku/nas, merely tried to set on the dogs, Il. 18.584†.
e)/ndi=na, pl.: entrails, Il. 23.806†.
e)/n-dios (cf. *dio/s): at midday, Od. 4.450 and Il. 1.726.
e)/ndoqen: from within, within; w. gen., Il. 6.247.
e)/ndoqi: within, Il. 6.498; w. gen., Il. 18.287; opp. qu/rhfin, Od. 22.220; often = e)n fresi/, with qu=mo/s, mh=tis, no/os.
e)/ndon: within, esp. in the house, tent, etc., Il. 18.394; at home, Od. 16.355, 462, Od. 21.207, Od. 23.2; *dio\s e)/ndon, in the house of Zeus, Il. 20.13, Il. 23.200.
e)n - doupe/w, aor. e)ndou/phsa: fall with a heavy sound, ‘plump down,’ Od. 12.443 and Od. 15.479.
e)n-du=/nw and e)ndu/w, ipf. e)ne/du=ne, aor. 2 part. e)ndu=sa: put on, don, Il. 2.42, Il. 5.736, Il. 8.387.
e)ne/hka: see e)ni/hmi.
e)nei=kai: see fe/rw.

e)/n-eimi (ei)mi/), e)/nesti, e)/neimen, e)/neisi, opt. e)nei/h, ipf. e)nh=en, e)ne/hn, e)/nesan: be in or on; w. dat., Od. 10.45, or adv., Il. 24.240 ; e)/n tini, Il. 6.244; o)li/gos d' e)/ti qu=mo\s e)nh=en, ‘there was little life remaining in me,’ Il. 1.593 ; ei) xa/lkeo/n moi h)=tor e)nei/h, ‘had I a heart of bronze within me,’ Il. 2.490.
e(/neka, e(/neken, ei(/neka: on account of, for the sake of, because of, w. gen.; placed before or after its case.
e)ne/kurse: see e)gkure/w.
e)nenh/konta: ninety.
e)ne/ni=pon, e)ne/nipte: see e)ni/ptw.

e)ne/pw and e)nne/pw (root sep), imp. e)/nnepe, opt. e)ne/poimi, part. e)ne/pwn -onta, -onte, -tes, fem. -ousa, ipf. e)/nnepe, aor. e)/nispon, e)/nispes, e)/nispe, opt. -ois, -oi, subj. -w, -h|, imp. e)/nispe and e)ni/spes, inf. -ei=n, fut. e)ni/yw and e)nisph/sw: relate, reg. w. acc. of the thing which forms the theme of the narration, mu=qon, o)/neiron, a)/ndra, Od. 1.1; mu=/qoisin te/rponto pro\s a)llh/lous e)ne/pontes (sc. mu=/qous), Il. 11.643, Od. 23.301.
e)n-erei/dw, aor. e)ne/reisan: thrust into; tini/ ti, Od. 9.383†.
e)/nerqe(n), ne/rqe(n): from below, Il. 20.57 (opp. u(yo/qen); below, Il. 14.274; w. gen., Il. 8.16; after its case, Il. 11.234, 252.
e)/neroi: those below the earth (inferi), both gods and the shades of the dead, Il. 15.188, Il. 20.61.
e)ne/rteros, comp. of e)/neroi: deeper down, lower, Il. 5.898 ; e)ne/rteroi qeoi/ (= oi( e)/nerqe qeoi/), the nether gods, Il. 15.225.
e)/nesan: see e)/neimi.
e)nesth/rikto: see e)nsthri/zw.
e)n-eth/ (e)ni/hmi): clasp, a species of pero/nh, Il. 14.180†.
*)enetoi/: a tribe of the Paphlagonians, Il. 2.852†.
e)n-eu/dw: sleep in or on. (Od.)
e)n-eu/naion: sleeping-place, bed, Od. 14.51; pl., bedclothes, Od. 16.35.
e)n-hei/h (e)nhh/s): gentleness, amiability, Il. 17.670†.
e)n-hh/s, e/os: gentle, amiable, Il. 23.252, Od. 8.200.
e)/n-hmai, ipf. e)nh/meqa: sit within, Od. 4.272†.
e)nh/rato: see e)nai/rw.
e)n-h/noqe (cf. a)/nqos), defective perf. w. pres. signif.: swells there, steams there, rises there, Od. 17.270†.

e)/nqa: I. demonstr., there, thither, then; of place, usually denoting rest, Il. 1.536, Od. 3.365; less often direction, e)/nq' e)lqw/n, Il. 13.23; e)/nqa kai\ e)/nqa, ‘here and there,’ ‘to and fro,’ ‘in length and breadth,’ Il. 2.476, 462, Od. 2.213, Il. 7.156, Od. 10.517; h)\ e)/nq' h)\ e)/nqa ki/onta, ‘going or coming,’ Od. 10.574; often temporal, thereupon, e)/nqa e)/peita, Od. 10.297; e)/nq' au)=, Il. 5.1; introducing apodosis, Il. 2.308.— II. relative, where, Il. 1.610 ; e)/nq' a)/ra, Od. 22.335; e)/nqa per, Od. 13.284; e)/nqa te, n 107, Il. 2.594.
e)nqa/de: hither, thither, Il. 4.179, Od. 16.8; here, there, Il. 2.296, Od. 2.51 ; e)nqa/d' au)=qi, here on the spot, Il. 23.674, Od. 5.208.

e)/nqen: I. demonstr., thence, then, thereupon, both local and temporal, Il. 10.179, Il. 13.741 ; e)/nqen.. e(te/rwqi de/, ‘on this side.. on the other,’ Od. 12.235, 59, 211; e)/nqen e)moi\ ge/nos, o(/qen soi/, Il. 4.58. —II. relative, whence, Il. 24.597; (oi)=non) e)/nqen e)/pi=non, ‘whereof,’ Od. 4.220, Od. 19.62; correl. to e)/nqa, Od. 5.195.
e)/nqende: from here, from there, thence.
e)n-qrw/skw, aor. e)/nqore: spring in or upon, w. dat., Il. 15.623, Il. 24.79 ; la\c e)/nqoren i)sxi/w|, ‘with a kick at his hip,’ Od. 17.233.
e)n-qu=/mios: taken to heart, ‘subject of anxiety,’ Od. 13.421†.
e)ni/, e)/ni: see e)n.
e)niau/sios: yearling, Od. 16.454†.

e)niauto/s: year. Perhaps originally a less specific term than e)/tos, e)/tos h)=lqe periplome/nwn e)niautw=n, ‘as time and seasons rolled round,’ Od. 1.16 ; *dio\s e)niautoi/, Il. 2.134 (cf. Od. 14.93).
e)n -iau/w: only ipf., e)ni/aue, used to sleep there or among, Od. 9.187 and Od. 15.557.
*)enih=nes: a tribe dwelling about Dodōna, Il. 2.749†.
e)ni-kla/w, inf. e)nikla=n: break within, frustrate, Il. 8.408 and 422.
*)eni=peu/s: river-god, river in Phthiōtis, Od. 11.238†.
e)ni=ph/ (e)ni/ptw): rebuke, reprimand.
e)ni/pleios: see e)/mpleios.
e)niplhsqh=nai, -plh/swsi: see e)mpi/plhmi.
e)ni - plh/ssw, aor. subj. e)niplh/cw: intrans., dash into, rush into; ta/frw|, e(/rkei, *m 72, Od. 22.469.
e)niprh/qw: see e)mprh/qw.

e)ni/ptw, opt. e)ni/ptoi, imp. e)/nipte, aor. 2 e)ne/ni=pe and h)ni/pape: chide, rebuke, upbraid; Odysseus chides himself, to repress his wrath, kradi/hn h)ni/pape mu=/qw|: | ‘te/tlaqi dh/, kradi/h, u’ 17; usually w. specifying terms in dat., xalepoi=sin o)nei/desin, o)neidei/ois e)pe/essin, xalepw=| or kakw=| mu=/qw|, Il. 2.245, Il. 3.438, *r 141, Od. 18.326.
e)ni-ski/mptw, aor. part. e)niski/myante, aor. pass. e)niski/mfqh: lean on, hold close to, Il. 17.437; pass., stick in, Il. 17.528, Il. 16.612.
*)eni/sph: a town in Arcadia, Il. 2.606.
e)nisph/sw, e)/nispon, e)ni/spes: see e)ne/pw.
e)ni/ssw, inf. e)nisse/men, ipf. e)ni/ssomen, pass. part. e)nisso/menos: parallel form of e)ni/ptw.
e)nixrimfqe/nta: see e)gxri/mptw.
e)ni/yw: see e)ne/pw.
e)nne/a: nine.
e)nnea/ - boios: worth nine cattle, Il. 6.236†.
e)nnea-kai/-deka: nineteen, Il. 24.496†.
e)nnea/-phxus, u: nine cubits long.
e)nnea/-xi=loi: nine thousand.
e)/nneon: see ne/w.
e)nne o/rguios: nine fathoms long, Od. 11.312†.
e)nne/-wros: nine years old, the number being a round one, Il. 18.351, Od. 10.19; in Od. 19.179 perhaps meaning ‘in periods of nine years.’
e)nnh/konta: ninety, Od. 19.174†.
e)nn-h=mar: nine days long.
*)/ennomos: (1) a soothsayer, chief of the Mysians, slain by Achilles, Il. 2.858, Il. 17.218.—(2) a Trojan, slain by Odysseus, Il. 11.422.
e)nnosi/-gaios (e)/nosis, gai=a): earthshaker, epithet of Poseidon, god of the sea, as causer of earthquakes; joined with gaih/oxos, Il. 9.183.

e(/nnu=mi (ve/nnu=mi), fut. e(/ssw, aor. e(/ssa, imp. e(/sson, inf. e(/ssai, part. e(/ssa=s, mid. and pass., pres. inf. e(/nnusqai, ipf. e(/nnuto, aor. e(/(s)sato, e(e/ssato, inf. e(/sasqai, part. e(ssa/menos, perf. ei(=mai, e(/ssai, ei(=tai, part. ei(me/nos, plup. 2 sing. e(/sso, 3 e(/sto, e(/esto, du. e(/sqhn, 3 pl. ei(/ato: clothe, put on clothing, mid., on oneself, pass. (esp. perf. and plup.), be clothed in, wear; act., of clothing another, e(/ssa=s me xlai=nan te xitw=na/ te, Od. 14.396; thus regularly w. two accusatives, Il. 5.905, Od. 15.338, Od. 16.79; mid. w. acc., or acc.
and dat., xroi=\ xalko/n, Il. 19.233; also peri\ xroi+/, Il. 7.207; a)mf' w)/moisin, Il. 10.177; pass. w. acc. of thing retained, teu/xea ei(me/nos, kaka\ ei(me/nos, a)ei/kea e(/sso, ‘shockingly clothed,’ Il. 4.432, Od. 19.327, Od. 16.199; fig., h)= te/ ke la=/i+non e(/sso xitw=na, ‘hadst been clad in a coat of stone’ (stoned to death), Il. 3.57 ; fresi\n ei(me/nos a)lkh/n, Il. 20.381.
e)n-nu/xios, e)/nnuxos (Il. 11.716†): in the night time.
e)n-oino-xoe/w: pour (wine) in, part., Od. 3.472†.

e)n-oph/ (o)/y): voice, Od. 10.147, outcry; attributed to musical instruments, au)lw=n su=ri/ggwn t' e)noph/n, Il. 10.13; esp. of the cry of battle, Il. 3.2, and figuratively for battle itself, Il. 12.35; of grief, e)noph/n te go/on te, Il. 24.160.
*)eno/ph: a town in Messenia, subject to Agamemnon, Il. 9.150, 292.

e)n-o/rnu=mi, aor. e)nw=rsa, part. e)no/rsa=s, mid. aor. 2 e)nw=rto: rouse or excite in; tini\ go/on, fu/zan, *z 499, Il. 15.62; mid., arise in or among; e)nw=rto ge/lws maka/ressi qeoi=sin, *a 599, Od. 8.326.
e)n - orou/w, aor. e)no/rousa: spring upon, rush or charge upon, w. dat.; of warriors, of a lion, Il. 16.783, Il. 10.486.
e)/n-orxos: uncastrated, Il. 23.147†.
e)nosi/-xqwn = e)nnosi/gaios.
e)nski/mptw: see e)niski/mptw.
e)n-sta/zw: drop in, only perf. pass., e)ne/staktai, has been infused in thy veins, Od. 2.271†.
e)n-sthri/zw: only plup. pass., e)nesth/rikto, remained sticking fast, Il. 21.168.
e)n - stre/fw: only mid., e)nstre/fetai i)sxi/w|, turns (plays) in the hip-joint, Il. 5.306†.

e)n-tanu/w (= e)ntei/nw), aor. e)nta/nuse, mid. aor. inf. e)ntanu/sasqai: stretch tight in, regularly (act. and mid.) string a bow; neurh\n e)ntanu/sai, of stretching the string in the bow to string it, not pulling it to shoot, Od. 19.587, Od. 21.97, Od. 24.171; then bio/n, to/con, t 577, Od. 21.75, 114, 150, 403; pass., Od. 21.2. (See cut No. 34, from an antique gem.)
e)n-tau=qa: hither, Il. 9.601†.
e)n-tauqoi=: here.
e)/ntea, pl.: harness, armor, weapons; esp. the breast-plate, Il. 3.339, Il. 10.34, 75; e)/ntea a)rh/ia, ‘fighting gear,’ Il. 10.407, Od. 23.368; of table-furniture, e)/ntea daito/s, Od. 7.232.

e)n-tei/nw, only pass. perf. and plup.: stretch within; di/fros i(ma=sin e)nte/tatai, ‘is plaited’ with gold and silver straps, Il. 5.728 ; kune/h i(ma=sin e)nte/tato, ‘was lined with tightly - stretched straps,’ Il. 10.263, cf. Il. 23.335, 436.
e)/nteron: gut, oi)o/s, used for harpstring, Od. 21.408; pl., bowels.
e)ntesi/-ergos (e)/ntea, ve/rgon): working in harness, Il. 24.277†.
e)nteu=qen: thence, Od. 19.568†.

e)n-ti/qhmi, fut. e)nqh/sw, aor. inf. e)nqe/menai, mid. ipf. e)ntiqe/mesqa, aor. 2 e)/nqeto, imp. e)/nqeo, part. e)nqeme/nh: put or place in or on, mid., for oneself, or something of one's own; of putting provisions on board a ship, Od. 5.166; clothing on a bed, Il. 24.646, etc.; mid., of a mother laying her son upon the bier, Il. 21.124; metaph., mh/ moi pate/ras poq' o(moi/h| e)/nqeo ti=mh=|, ‘hold in esteem,’ Il. 4.410 ; i=(/laon e)/nqeo qu=mo/n, ‘take on,’ Il. 9.639 ; xo/lon qu=mw=|, ‘conceive,’ Il. 9.326, Od. 24.248 ; mu=qon qu=mw=|, ‘take to heart,’ Od. 1.361.
e(/nto: see i(/hmi.
e)nto/s: within; w. gen., lime/nos e)nto/s, Il. 1.432, etc.
e)/ntosqe(n) and e)/ntoqen = e)nto/s.
e)n-tre/pw: only pass. (met.), e)ntre/petai h)=tor, is moved, Il. 15.554 and Od. 1.60.
e)n-tre/xw: run in, ‘play freely in’ the armor, Il. 19.385†.
e)n-tropali/zomai (frequentative of e)ntre/pomai): only part., turning frequently about. (Il.)

e)ntu=/nw, e)ntu/w (e)/ntea), ipf. e)/ntu=non, e)/ntuon, aor. 1 imp. e)/ntu=non, part. e)ntu=/na=sa, mid. subj. 2 sing. e)ntu=/neai, aor. part. e)ntu=na/menos: harness, Il. 5.720; make ready, mid., for oneself, adorn oneself; of preparing a bed, Od. 23.289; a drink, Il. 9.203; striking up a song, m
183; mid., dai=ta, Od. 3.33; h)=lq' e)ntu=name/nh (*ki/rkh), Od. 12.18, cf. Il. 14.162.
e)n - tupa/s (tu/ptw): adv., closely wrapped in his mantle, Il. 24.163†.
*)enu=a/lios (*)enu=w/): Enyalius, epith. of Ares as god of battle, usually subst.; adj., Il. 17.211 ; *)enu=ali/w| a)ndrei+fo/nth|, ‘synizesis,’ Il. 2.651, etc.
*)enu=eu/s: king of Scyros, slain by Achilles, Il. 9.668†.
e)n - u/pnios: in sleep, only neut. as adv., Il. 2.56.
*)enu=w/: En&ymacr;o (Bellōna), battle personified, a companion of Ares, Il. 5.333, 592.
e)n-wpadi/ws: face to face, clearly, Od. 23.94†.
e)n-wph=| (w)/y): in view, openly, Il. 5.374 and Il. 21.510.
e)n-w/pia (w)/y, cf. ‘façade’): the sidewalls of the vestibule, epith. pamfano/wnta, perhaps because painted white. See plate III. A and B.
e(/c: six.
e)c-agge/llw, aor. 1 e)ch/ggeilen: bring news out, report a fact, Il. 5.390†.
e)c-agoreu/w: relate, Od. 11.234†.

e)c-a/gw, ipf. e)/cage, imp. e)/cage, aor. 2 e)ch/gage, -a/gage: lead or bring out, tina/ (tinos), also e)/k tinos; of ‘extending’ a mound (cf. e)lau/nw), Il. 7.336; of birth (bringing to light, into the world), Il. 16.188.
*)eca/dios: one of the Lapithae, Il. 1.264†.
e(ca/-etes (ve/tos): adv., six years, Od. 3.115†.
e)c - ai/numai: take out or away, w. two accusatives, Il. 5.155; ‘took out (of the chariot and placed) in the vessel,’ Od. 15.206.
e)c-ai/retos: chosen, choice, Od. 4.643, Il. 2.227.

e)c-aire/w, aor. 2 e)cei=lon and e)/celon, mid. ipf. e)caireu/mhn, aor. e)ceilo/mhn, -elo/mhn: take out or away, select, choose from, mid., for oneself; e)/nqen e)/cele pe/plous, Il. 24.229; h(\n a)/ra moi ge/ras e)/celon ui(=es *)axaiw=n, Il. 16.56; mid., fare/trhs e)cei/leto pikro\n o)isto/n, Il. 8.323; (*brishi/da) e)k *lurnhssou= e)cei/leto, here not of choosing but of taking away, Il. 2.690; cf. Il. 11.704; so of taking away one's life, qu=mo/n, Il. 15.460, Il. 19.137, Od. 11.201; fre/nas, ‘wits,’ Il. 6.234; of ‘choosing,’ Il. 9.130, 272, Od. 14.232.
e)cai/rw: see e)ca/rnumai.
e)c-ai/sios (opp. e)nai/sios): undue, unjust, unrighteous, Od. 4.670, Il. 15.577; in Od. 17.577 e)cai/sion is sometimes interpreted as an adv., ‘unduly,’ ‘excessively.’
e)/c-aitos = e)cai/retos.
e)c-ai/fnhs = e)capi/nhs, Il. 17.738 and Il. 21.14.
e)c-ake/omai, aor. opt. e)cake/saio: heal completely; ‘seek to remedy,’ Il. 9.507 ; xo/lon, ‘appease,’ Il. 4.36, Od. 3.145.
e)c - alao/w (a)lao/s), aor. e)cala/wsa: blind completely. (Od.)
e)c-alapa/zw, fut. -cw, aor. e)cala/paca: empty entirely, sack, utterly destroy; usually of cities, once of ships, Il. 13.813.
e)c - a/llomai, aor. part. e)ca/lmenos: leap out from, w. gen.; of taking the lead with a spring in racing, Il. 23.399.
e)c - ana - bai/nw: only aor. 2 part., e)canaba=sai, climbing up upon (out of the sea), Il. 24.97†.
e)c-ana-lu/w, aor. inf. -lu=sai: release from; qana/toio, Il. 16.442 and Il. 22.180.
e)c-ana-fando/n: quite openly, Od. 20.48†.
e)c-an-i/hmi, part. e)caniei=sai: let go forth, send forth, Il. 18.471†.
e)c-anu/w, aor. e)ch/nusa: accomplish, Il. 8.370; euphem., finish, despatch, kill, Il. 11.365, Il. 20.452.
e)c-apata/w, fut. inf. -h/sein, aor. e)capa/thsa: deceive utterly.
e)c-apafi/skw, aor. 2 e)ch/pafe, subj. e)capa/fw, mid. aor. 2 opt. e)capa/foito: deceive utterly, cheat, act. and mid., Il. 14.160, Il. 9.376.
e)c-api/nhs: suddenly, on a sudden.
e)c - apo - bai/nw: only aor. 2, disembarked from; nho/s, Od. 12.306†.
e)c-apo-di/omai: ma/xhs e)ca=podi/wmai, chase out of the battle, Il. 5.763. (The a= a necessity of the rhythm.)
e)c - ap - o/llu=mi, aor. mid. opt. 3 pl. -loi/ato, perf. -o/lwle: perish utterly from, w. gen., *=)ili/ou, do/mwn, ou)ranou=, Il. 6.60, *s 290, Od. 20.357.
e)c-apo-ne/omai: ma/xhs e)ca=pone/esqai, return out of the battle. (Il.) (a= a necessity of the rhythm.)

e)c-apo-ni/zw: only ipf., tou= (more
natural than tw=|) po/das e)capo/nize, out of which she used to wash feet, Od. 19.387†.
e)c-apo-ti=/nw: pay off, satisfy in full, Il. 21.412†.
e)c-a/ptw, ipf. e)ch=pton, aor. part. e)ca/ya=s: attach to, tino/s ti/, mid., hang hold of, swing from, Il. 8.20.
e)c - arpa/zw, aor. e)ca/rpaca: snatch away (from), Od. 12.100; in Il. of rescuing men from danger, Il. 3.380, Il. 20.443, Il. 21.597.
e)/c-arxos: pl., leaders of the dirge, Il. 24.721.
e)c-a/rxw, ipf. e)ch=rxe, mid. -h/rxeto: begin, lead off; molph=s, go/oio, Il. 18.606, 316; w. acc., boula=/s, ‘be the first to propose,’ ‘author of,’ Il. 2.273; mid., Od. 12.339 (see a)/rxw).
e)c-auda/w: speak out. (Il.)
e)/c-autis: again, anew.
e)c-af-aire/w, mid. aor. 2 subj. e)cafe/lhsqe: take the life from; yu=xa=/s, Od. 22.444†.
e)c - ei=don: me/g' e)/ciden o)fqalmoi=sin, looked forth with wondering eyes, Il. 20.342†.
e(cei/hs (e)/xesqai): in order, one after another, Il. 15.137, Il. 22.240.
e)/c-eimi (1) (ei)mi/): be from or of (son or descendant of), Od. 13.130.
e)/c-eimi (2) (ei)=mi), 2 sing. e)/ceisqa, inf. e)cie/nai, e)ci/menai, ipf. e)ch/|ei: go out.
e)c-ei=pon, subj. e)cei/pw, opt. -poi, fut. e)cere/w: speak out.
e)c-ei/romai, ipf. e)cei/reto: inquire of, ask for.
e)cekuli/sqh: see e)kkuli=/w.

e)c-elau/nw, e)cela/w, ipf. e)ch/laune, fut. inf. e)cela/a=n, aor. e)ch/lase, -e/lase, 3 pl. -h/lassan: drive out or away from, usually w. gen.; knock out, o)do/ntas gnaqmw=n, Od. 18.29; seemingly intrans., ‘drive,’ sc. i(/ppous, Il. 24.323 (see e)lau/nw).
e)celei=n: see e)caire/w.
e)c-e/lkw: draw out, w. gen., Od. 5.432; the thread of the woof through the warp, Il. 23.762.
e)ce/men(ai): see e)ci/hmi.
e)c - eme/w, aor. opt. -e/seie: belch out, disgorge, Od. 12.237 and 437.
e)c-enari/zw, fut. -i/cei, aor. e)cena/rica: strip of armor, despoil; tina/ and teu/xea, Il. 5.151, 155, Il. 7.146; then kill, slay, Il. 4.488, Od. 11.273, Od. 22.264.
e)c-ereei/nw: make inquiry, abs., and w. acc. of pers., or of thing, e(/kasta, ‘ask all about it,’ Od. 10.14; mid., Il. 10.81; fig., po/rous a(lo\s e)cereei/nwn, ‘questing,’ ‘exploring,’ Od. 12.259.
e)c-erei/pw, aor. 2 subj. e)ceri/ph|, part. -eripou=sa: aor. 2 intrans., fall down or over. (Il.)
e)cere/w (1): see e)cei=pon.

e)c-ere/w, e)cere/omai (2), inf. e)cere/esqai, only pres. forms of both act. and dep. (act. only in Od.): inquire of, question, ask, w. acc. of person, or of thing; ‘explore,’ Od. 4.337, Od. 17.128, cf. Od. 12.259; ‘investigate,’ Od. 1.416.
e)c-eru/w, aor. e)cei/ruse, e)ce/ruse, 3 pl. e)cei/russan: draw out or away, Od. 18.86, Od. 22.476 ; be/los w)/mou, do/ru mhrou=, Il. 5.112, 666; but di/fron r(u=mou=, ‘by the pole,’ Il. 10.505.
e)c-e/rxomai, aor. e)ch=lqon: come or go out, march forth, Il. 9.476, 576; po/lhos, ‘out of the city,’ tei/xeos, qu/raze, Od. 19.68.
e)c-erwe/w: only aor. e)cerw/hsan (i(/ppoi), have run away, ‘bolted,’ Il. 23.468†.
e)c-esi/h (e)ci/hmi): errand, embassy, Il. 24.235 and Od. 21.20.
e(c-eth/s, e/os: six years old, Il. 23.266 and 655.
e)c - e/ti: ever since, w. gen.; e)ce/ti patrw=n, ‘since the times of our fathers,’ Od. 8.245.
e)c - euri/skw, aor. opt. e)ceu/roi: find out, discover, Il. 18.322†.
e)c-hge/omai, imp. -gei/sqw: lead out, w. gen., Il. 2.806†.
e(ch/konta: sixty.
e)ch/lasa: see e)celau/nw.
e)c - h/latos (e)lau/nw): beaten out, hammered, Il. 12.295†.
e(c-h=mar: for six days (Od.)
e)c-hmoibo/s (a)mei/bw): neut. pl., for change, changes of raiment, Od. 8.249†.
e)ch/pafe: see e)capafi/skw.
e)chra/nqh: see chrai/nw.
e)ch/rato: see e)ca/rnumai.
e)chrw/hsa: see e)cerwe/w.
e(ch=s = e(cei/hs. (Od.)
e)c-i/hmi, aor. 2 inf. e)ce/men(ai): let go out, send out, Il. 11.141, Od. 11.531.
e)c-i=qu=/nw: straighten, Il. 15.410†.
e)c-ikne/omai, aor. 2 e)ciko/mhn, e)ci=/keto (i=, augment): reach, arrive at, gain (from somewhere), w. acc. of place or person, Il. 9.479, Od. 12.166, Od. 13.206.
e)ci/menai: see e)/ceim Od. 9.2.
e)c-i/sxw: hold out, protrude, Od. 12.94†.
e)coi/sw: see e)kfe/rw.
e)c-oixne/w, 3 pl. -neu=si: go forth, Il. 9.384†.
e)c-oi/xomai: only 3 sing. e)coi/xetai, is gone away, Il. 6.379, 384.
e)c-o/llu=mi, aor. 1 opt. -ole/seie: utterly destroy, Od. 19.597.
e)c - onomai/nw, aor. subj. -mh/nh|s, inf. -mh=nai: call by name, name, mention, Od. 6.66.
e)c - onoma - klh/dhn: calling out the name, by name, Il. 22.415.
e)c-o/piqe(n): in the rear, behind; w. gen., Il. 17.521. (Il.)
e)c-opi/sw: backwards, back (from), w. gen., Il. 17.357. (Il.)—Of time, hereafter, in future. (The Greeks stood with their backs to the future.)
e)c-orma/w: only aor. part. intrans., e)cormh/sa=sa, starting away (from the direction intended), Od. 12.221†.
e)c-ofe/llw: greatly augment, Od. 15.18†.

e)/c-oxos (e)/xw): prominent, preëminent above or among, w. gen., Il. 14.118, or w. dat. (in local sense), Il. 2.483, Od. 21.266.—Adv., e)/coxon and e)/coxa, preëminently, chiefly, most; ‘by preference,’ Od. 9.551 ; e)/cox' a)/ristoi, ‘far’ the best, Il. 9.638, Od. 4.629.
e)c - up - an - i/sthmi: only aor. 2 intrans., smw=dic metafre/nou, started up from (on) his back under the blows of the staff, Il. 2.267†.
e)/cw: outside, without, Il. 17.205, Od. 10.95; often of motion, forth, oi(\ d' i)/san e)/cw, Il. 24.247; freq. w. gen.
e(/cw: see e)/xw.
e(/o, e(oi=: see ou(=.
e)/oi: see ei)mi/.

e)/oika (ve/voika), 3 du. e)/ikton, part. e)oikw/s, ei)kw/s, fem. ei)kui=a, e)ikui=a, i)kui=a, pl. ei)oikui=ai, plup. e)w/|kein, du. e)i/kthn, 3 pl. e)oi/kesan, also e)/ikto, h)/ikto (an ipf. ei)=ke, Il. 18.520, is by some referred here, by others to ei)/kw): (1) be like, resemble, tini/ (ti), a)/nta, ei)s w)=pa, Od. 1.208, *w 630, Il. 3.158; ‘I seem to be singing in the presence of a god when I sing by thee’ (e)/oika = videor mihi), Od. 22.348. —(2) impers., be fitting, suitable, be- seem; abs., ou)de\ ve/voiken, Il. 1.119, and w. dat. of person, Il. 9.70, also w. acc. and inf., Il. 2.190; freq. the part. as adj., mu=qoi e)oiko/tes, Od. 3.124; e)oiko/ta mu=qh/sasqai, katale/cai, g 125, Od. 4.239.
e(oi=o: see e(o/s.
e)/ois: see ei)mi/.
e)/olpa: see e)/lpw.
e)/on: see ei)mi/.
e)/orgas: see e)/rdw.
e(orth/: festival, Od. 20.156 and Od. 21.258.
e(o/s, e(h/, e(o/n (svo/s, cf. suus), gen. e(ou=, e(oi=o, e(h=s: his, her, own; seldom w. art., Il. 23.295, Il. 10.256; strengthened by gen. of au)to/s, e(oi\ au)tou= qh=tes, his own, Od. 4.643.
e)p-aga/llomai: exult in, Il. 16.91†.
e)p - agge/llw: bring news to, announce, Od. 4.775.
e)p-agei/rw: bring together, Il. 1.126†.
e)pa/ghn: see ph/gnu=mi.
e)p - aglai=/zomai, fut. inf. e)paglaiei=sqai: glory in, Il. 18.133†.
e)p - a/gw, aor. 2 e)ph/gagon: lead or bring on, met., induce, of ‘setting on’ dogs, Od. 19.445; joined w. pei/qein, c, 392.
e)p-aei/rw, aor. 1 3 pl. e)pa/eiran, part. -aei/ra=s: lift up (on), Il. 10.80; w. gen., a(maca=/wn, ‘and placed upon,’ Il. 7.426, Il. 9.214.
e)/paqon: see pa/sxw.
e)p-aigi/zw (ai)gi/s): rush on, of winds, Il. 2.148, Od. 15.293.
e)p-aine/w, ipf. e)ph/|neon, aor. e)ph/|nhsa: give approval or assent, approve, commend; abs., also w. dat. of person, Il. 18.312; acc. of thing, mu=qon, Il. 2.335.
e)p - aino/s (ai)no/s): only fem.; the dread Persephone, consort of Hades.

e)p-a=i+=ssw, ipf. e)ph/i+=sson, aor. e)ph/i=ca, iter. -a=i+=/caske, inf. -a=i=cai, mid. e)pa=i+=/ssontai, fut. inf. -a=i+=/cesqai: dart or spring at or upon; usually in hostile sense, abs., and w. gen. or dat. of the person or thing attacked; of the wind, e)pa=i+=/ca=s, ‘darting down upon’ the sea, Il. 2.146 ; e)pa=i+=/ssonta new=n, Il. 13.687, Il. 5.263; *ki/rkh| e)pa=i=cai, Od. 10.295, 322; w. acc. of end of motion, e)pa=i=cai mo/qon i(/ppwn, Il. 7.240; mid., subjective, xei=res, ‘play’ lightly, Il. 23.628; ‘dart in’ for the prize, Il. 23.773.
e)p-aite/w, aor. opt. -th/seias: ask besides, Il. 23.593†.

e)p-ai/tios: to blame; ou)/ ti/ moi u)/mmes
e)pai/tioi, ‘I have no fault to find with you,’ Il. 1.335†.
e)p - akou/w, aor. e)pa/kousa: hearken to, hear, with the same constructions as a)kou/w, t 98, Il. 2.143.
e)p - akth/r, h=ros: hunter, i. e. o( ku/nas e)pa/gwn, Od. 19.435; a)/ndres e)pakth=res, Il. 17.135.
e)p-ala/omai, aor. pass. subj. e)palhqh=|: wander to, w. acc. of end of motion, *ku/pron, Od. 4.83; po/ll' e)palhqei/s, ‘after long wanderings,’ Od. 4.81.
e)p-alaste/w, part. -h/sa=sa: be indignant (at), Od. 1.252†.
e)p-ale/cw, fut. -h/sw: give aid to, defend, help, tini/, Il. 8.365 and Il. 11.428.
e)palhqei/s: see e)pala/omai.

e)p-alla/ssw: only aor. part., e)palla/cantes, entwining in each other, connecting (the ends of the cord of war), i. e. prolonging the contest; others interpret, ‘drawing the cord of war now this way, now that,’ Il. 13.359†.
e)pa/lmenos: see e)fa/llomai.
e)/p-alcis, ios (a)le/cw): breastwork, battlement. (Il.)
*)epa/lths: a Lycian, slain by Patroclus, Il. 16.415†.
e)pa=lto: see e)fa/llomai.
e)p-ama/omai: only aor. e)pamh/sato, heaped up for himself a bed of leaves, Od. 5.482†. See a)ma/w.
e)p-amei/bw, aor. subj. e)pamei/yomen: give in exchange to, exchange with; a)llh/lois, Il. 6.230; mid., ni=kh\ d' e)pamei/betai a)/ndras, ‘passes from one man to another,’ Il. 6.339. (Il.)
e)p - amoibadi/s (e)pamei/bw): interchangingly, ‘intertwined with each other,’ Od. 5.481†.
e)p-amu/ntwr, oros: defender, Od. 16.263†.
e)p - amu=/nw, aor. imp. e)pa/mu=non: bring aid to, come to the defence, abs., and w. dat., Il. 5.685, Il. 8.414. (Il.)
e)p-an-i/sthmi: only aor. 2 intrans., e)pane/sthsan, thereupon arose, i. e. after him, Il. 2.85†.
e)p - aoidh/ (e)paei/dw): incantation, spell, Od. 19.457†.
e)p-apeile/w, aor. e)phpei/lhsa: direct threats against, threaten, tini/ (ti).
e)p - arari/skw, aor. 1 e)ph=rse, plup. e)parh/rei: trans. (aor. 1), fit to (tini/ ti), Il. 14.167, 339; intr. (plup.), fit in, Il. 12.456.
e)p - a=rh/: imprecation, curse, pl., Il. 9.456†.
e)p-arh/gw: bring help to, succor.
e)parh/rei: see e)parari/skw.
e)p-a/rouros (a)/roura): bound to the soil (as a serf), Od. 11.489†.
e)p - arth/s, e/s (root a)r): equipped, ready. (Od.)
e)p-artu/w: fit on, Od. 8.447.

e)p - a/rxomai, aor. imp. e)parca/sqw, part. -ca/menos: ritualistic word, always w. depa/essin, make a beginning (thereto), ‘perform the dedicatory rites’ with the cups, by filling them to pour the libation, Il. 1.471, Od. 3.340.
e)p-arwgo/s (a)rh/gw): helper, Od. 11.498†.
e)p-aske/w: only perf. pass., e)ph/skhtai de/ oi( au)lh\ | toi/xw| kai\ qrigkoi=si, ‘it (the house, oi() has a court skilfully adjoined with wall and coping,’ Od. 17.266†.
e)p-assu/teros (a)sson): closer and closer, close together, Il. 4.423; in quick succession, Il. 1.383, Od. 16.366.
e)/p - aulos (au)lh/, ‘adjoining the court’): pl., cattle stalls, stables, Od. 23.358†.

e)p - auri/skw, aor. 2 subj. e)pau/rh|, inf. e)paurei=n, e)paure/men, mid. pres. e)pauri/skontai, fut. inf. -rh/sesqai, subj. aor. 2 e)pau/rhai and e)pau/rh|, 3 pl. e)pau/rwntai: I. act., acquire, obtain, Il. 18.302, Od. 17.81; fig., often of missiles, ‘reach;’ ‘touch,’ xro/a, Il. 11.573; w. gen., li/qou, ‘graze’ the stone, Il. 23.340.—II. mid., partake of, enjoy, ‘reap the fruit of,’ w. gen., Il. 13.733; freq. ironical, Il. 1.410, Il. 6.353; w. acc., bring on oneself, Od. 17.81.
e)p-afu/ssw, aor. e)ph/fuse: draw or dip (water) upon, Od. 19.388†.
e)p-egei/rw, aor. mid. e)pe/greto, part. e)pegro/menos: awaken (at some juncture), Od. 22.431; mid., wake up (at), Il. 10.124, Od. 20.57.
e)pe/dramon: see e)pitre/xw.
e)pe/hn: see e)/peim Od. 9.1.

e)pei/: temporal and causal conjunction.—I. temporal, when, after; of definite time, foll. by ind., freq. aor. (where we use plup.), Il. 1.57; but also by other tenses, Il. 1.235; of indefinite time (conditional), with the usual constructions that belong to relative
words (see a)/n, ke/n).—II. causal, since, for, foll. by ind.—With other words, e)pei\ prw=ton, prw=ta, ‘after once,’ ‘as soon as,’ e)pei\ a)/r, e)pei\ dh/ (e)peidh/), e)pei\ h)= (e)peih/), e)pei\ ou)=n, e)pei/ per, e)pei/ toi, see the several words. e)pei\ ou) is to be read with ‘synizesis,’ except in Od. 5.364, Od. 8.585 . e)pei/ stands at the beginning of some verses, as if e)ppei/.
*)epeigeu/s: a Myrmidon, the son of Agacles, slain by Hector, Il. 16.571.

e)pei/gw, ipf. e)/peigon, pass. e)pei/geto: I. act. and pass., press hard, oppress, impel, urge on; of weight, o)li/gon de/ min a)/xqos e)pei/gei, Il. 12.452; old age, xalepo\n kata\ gh=ras e)pei/gei, Il. 23.623; wind driving a ship before it, e)/peige ga\r ou)=ros a)ph/mwn, Od. 12.167; hurrying on a trade, Od. 15.445; pass. e)pei/geto ga\r bele/essin, ‘hard pressed,’ Il. 5.622 ; le/bhs e)peigo/menos puri\ pollw=|, i. e. made to boil in a hurry, Il. 21.362.—II. mid., press on, hasten; of winds driving fast, e)peigome/nwn a)ne/mwn, Il. 5.501; mh/ tis e)peige/sqw oi)=ko/nde ne/esqai, Il. 2.354; esp. freq. the part., ‘hastily,’ Il. 5.902, Od. 11.339; and w. gen., ‘eager for,’ ‘desirous of,’ o(doi=o, Od. 1.309, etc.; with acc. and inf., Od. 13.30. The mid. is also sometimes trans. (subjectively), ‘hasten on for oneself,’ ga/mon, Od. 2.97, t 142, Od. 24.132.
e)peida=/n: when, Il. 13.285†.
e)peidh/: when, after, since, the dh/ being hardly translatable, see e)pei/. Less often causal than temporal, Od. 7.152.
e)pei^h/: see e)pei/ and h)=. Always causal.
e)/p-eimi (1) (ei)mi/), opt. e)pei/h, ipf. 3 sing. e)pe/hn and e)ph=en, 3 pl. e)/pesan, fut. e)pe/ssetai: be upon, be remaining, Il. 2.259, Od. 2.344, Od. 4.756. See e)/pi, under e)pi/.

e)/p-eimi (2) (ei)=mi), e)/peisi, part. e)piw/n, ipf. e)ph/ie, e)ph/isan, e)ph=|san, mid. fut. e)piei/somai, aor. part. e)pieisame/nh: go or come upon or at; abs., or w. acc. of place or person, a)gro/n, Od. 23.359; met., pri/n min kai\ gh=ras e)/peisin, ‘shall come upon’ her, Il. 1.29; also w. dat., toi=s o)rumagdo\s e)ph/ien, ‘came to their ears,’ Il. 17.741; esp. in hostile sense, attack, w. acc. or dat., Il. 11.367, Il. 13.482.
*)epeioi/: the Epeians, a tribe in North Elis, Il. 11.732, Il. 13.686, Il. 4.537.
*)epeio/s: Epeius, son of Panopeus, the builder of the wooden horse, Il. 23.665, 838, Od. 11.523.
e)pei/per: see e)pei/ and pe/r.

e)/peita (e)pi/, ei)=ta): thereupon, then, in that case; of time or of sequence, often correl. to prw=ton, Il. 6.260; and joined with au)ti/ka, ai)=ya, w)=ka, also e)/nqa d' e)/peita, Il. 18.450; referring back to what has been stated (or implied), ‘so then,’ ‘accordingly,’ ‘after all,’ Od. 1.65, 106, Od. 3.62; after a part., Il. 14.223, Il. 11.730; freq. introducing - an apodosis emphatically, ‘in that case,’ Od. 1.84, and after temporal clauses, esp. dh\ e)/peita, Od. 8.378; to/t' e)/peita.
e)peke/kleto: see e)pike/lomai.
e)pe/kerse: see e)pikei/rw.
e)p - elau/nw, pass. plup. e)pelh/lato: forge or weld on, Il. 13.804, Il. 17.493. See e)lau/nw.
e)pe/lhse: see e)pilanqa/nw.
e)penei=kai: see e)pife/rw.
e)pe/neime: see e)pine/mw.
e)penh/neon: see e)pinhne/w.
e)p-en-h/noqe (cf. a)/nqos): defective perf. w. signif. of ipf. or pres., grew upon, Il. 2.219, Il. 10.134; of a perfume, rises upon, ‘floats around,’ qeou/s, Il. 8.365 (cf. e)nh/noqe).
e)p-en-tanu/w: only aor. part., e)pentanu/sa=s, stretching high over (a rope over the rotunda), Od. 22.467†.
e)p-entu=/nw, e)pentu/w: harness (to), Il. 8.374; mid., equip oneself to win, a)/eqla, Od. 24.89.
e)p-e/oika, plup., e)pew/|kei: be seemly, becoming; tini/, Il. 4.341; also w. acc. and inf., Il. 1.126; regularly impers., but once w. pers. subject, ‘befits,’ Il. 9.392.
e)pe/piqmen: see pei/qw.
e)pe/plhgon: see plh/ssw.
e)pe/plws: see e)piplw/w.
e)pepoi/qei: see pei/qw.
e)pepo/nqei: see pa/sxw.
e)pe/ptare: see e)piptai/rw.
e)pe/ptato: see e)pipe/tomai.
e)pe/pusto: see punqa/nomai.

e)p - erei/dw, aor. e)pe/reise: lean or bear on hard; Athēna lends force in driving the spear of Diomed, Il. 5.856; Polyphēmus throws enormous strength into his effort as he hurls the stone, Od. 9.538.
e)perrw/santo: see e)pirrw/omai.
e)p-eru/w, aor. e)pe/russe: draw to, Od. 1.441†.

e)p - e/rxomai, fut. inf. e)peleu/sesqai, aor. e)ph=lqon, e)ph/luqon, perf. e)pelh/luqa: come or go to or upon, come on; of the ‘arrival’ of times and seasons, Od. 10.175, Il. 8.488; the ‘approach’ of sleep or sickness, Od. 4.793, Od. 11.200; and often in hostile sense, ‘attack,’ esp. the part., Il. 15.406, Il. 4.334; mostly w. dat., but w. acc. in the sense ‘visit,’ ‘haunt,’ ‘traverse,’ a)/gkea, Il. 18.321; gai=an, Od. 4.268; a)grou/s, Od. 16.27; tmh/dhn, ‘struck and grazed,’ Il. 7.262.
e)pes-boli/h (e)pesbo/los): forward talk, pl., Od. 4.159†.
e)pes - bo/los (e)/pos, ba/llw, ‘wordslinging’): wordy, scurrilous, Il. 2.275†.
e)/peson: see pi=/ptw.
e)pe/spon: see e)fe/pw.
e)pe/ssetai: see e)/peim Od. 9.1.
e)pe/ssutai: see e)piseu/w.
e)pe/sth: see e)fi/sthmi.
e)pe/sxon: see e)pe/xw.
e)p-eth/sios (ve/tos): throughout all the year, Od. 7.118†.
e(/peu: see e(/pw.
e)p - eufhme/w: only aor. e)peufh/mhsan, added their favoring voices, to what the priest himself had said, in favor of granting his petition, Il. 1.22, 376.

e)p - eu/xomai, fut. 2 sing. e)peu/ceai, aor. e)peu/cato: (1) pray (at some juncture), add a prayer, Od. 10.533, Od. 14.436.—(2) boast over, exult (at), Il. 11.431, Il. 5.119.— In both senses abs., or w. dat., and w. foll. inf.
e)/pefnon: see fen-.
e)pe/fradon: see fra/zw.

e)p-e/xw, ipf. e)pei=xon, e)/pexen, aor. 2 e)pe/sxon, opt. e)pisxoi/hs, imp. e)pi/sxete, mid. aor. part. e)pisxo/menos: hold to, hold on, direct to or at, extend over; of putting the feet on a foot-stool, Il. 14.241, Od. 17.410; holding a cup to the lips, Il. 9.489, Il. 22.494, similarly 83; guiding a chariot against the enemy, Il. 17.464; and, intransitively, of assailing (cf. ‘have at him’), ti/ moi w(=d' e)pe/xeis, ‘why so hard on me?’ Od. 19.71; then of occupying, reaching in space, Il. 21.407, Il. 23.190, 238; hold in the sense of ‘check,’ intr. ‘refrain,’ Il. 21.244, Od. 21.186; met., qu=mo/n, Od. 20.266.—Mid., aor., take aim, Od. 22.15.
e)p-h/bolos: possessed of, Od. 2.319†.
e)p-hgkeni/des: uppermost streaks or planks of a ship, forming the gunwale, Od. 5.253†. (See cut No. 32, letter c).
e)ph=en: see e)/peim Od. 9.1.

e)p-hetano/s (ai)ei/): lasting forever, perennial; a)rdmoi/, plunoi/, n 247, Od. 6.86; hence ‘plentiful,’ ‘abundant,’ si=tos, ga/la, komidh/, Od. 18.360, d 89, Od. 8.233. —Neut. as adv., e)phetano/n, always, ‘abundantly,’ Od. 7.128, 99, Od. 10.427.
e)ph/ien: see e)/peim= Od. 9.2.
e)ph/luqon: see e)pe/rxomai.
e)ph/n: when, after. See e)pei/, also a)/n, ke/n.
e)ph/|neon: see e)paine/w.
e)/phca: see ph/gnu=mi.
e)p-hpu/w: appland, Il. 18.502†.
e)p-h/ratos (e)ra/w): lovely, charming, only of things and places, Od. 8.366, Od. 4.606, Il. 18.512.
e)p-h/retmos (e)retmo/s): at the oar, Od. 2.403; furnished with oars; nh=es, d 589, Od. 5.16.
e)p-hrefh/s, e/os (e)re/fw): overhanging, beetling; pe/trai, krhmnoi/, Od. 10.131, m 59, Il. 12.54.
*)eph/ritos: a name feigned by Odysseus, Od. 24.306†.
e)ph=rsa: see e)parari/skw.
e)ph=|san: see e)/peim Od. 9.2.
e)p-hth/s, e/os: discreet, humane, Od. 13.332 and Od. 18.128.
e)p-h/trimos: thick together, numerous; pi=/ptein, ‘thick and fast,’ Il. 19.226, Il. 18.211, 552.
e)p-htu/s, u/os (e)phth/s): humanity, kindliness, Od. 21.306† (v. l. e)phte/os).

e)pi/: upon, on.—I. adv., thereon, on top, thereby, besides; esp. e)/pi = e)/pesti or e)/peisi, ou)/ toi e)/pi dve/os, ‘thou hast nought to fear,’ Il. 1.515, Od. 8.563. Here belong all examples of ‘tmesis,’ e)pi\ d' ai)/geion knh= tu=ro/n, grated ‘on,’ Il. 11.639, 640; the appropriate case of a subst. may specify the relation of the adv., e)pi\ kne/fas h)/luqe gai=an, darkness came ‘on’—over the earth, Il. 24.351 .—kre/) e)/dwn kai\ e)p' a)/krhton ga/la pi=/nwn, ‘on top’ of the meat, ‘besides,’ Od. 9.297 ; pro\ me/n t' a)/ll), au)ta\r e)p) a)/lla, some before, some ‘after,’ Il. 13.799 ; e)pi\ ske/pas
h)=n a)ne/moio, ‘withal,’ Od. 5.443.—II. prep., (1) w. gen., local, of position, on, at, or direction, towards, for; and sometimes temporal; freq. e)f' i(/ppwn, e)pi\ nhw=n; e)p) a)grou=, ‘in the country,’ ‘at the farm,’ Od. 1.190 ; e)p' o)/gmou, ‘at the swath,’ Il. 18.557 ; si=gh=| e)f' u=(mei/wn, ‘by yourselves,’ Il. 7.195 ; e)pi\ paido\s e(/pesqai, ‘along with,’ Od. 1.278; direction, nh/sou e)/pi *yuri/hs, make ‘for’ the island, Od. 3.171, Il. 5.700; time, e)p' ei)rh/nhs, e)pi\ prote/rwn a)nqrw/pwn, ‘in the time of,’ Il. 2.797, Il. 5.637.—(2) w. dat., of place, time, purpose, condition; ne/mesqai e)pi\ krh/nh|, ‘at’ the spring, Od. 13.408 ; nh=a e)p' h)pei/roio e)/russan | u(you= e)pi\ yamaqoi=s, high ‘upon the sand,’ Il. 1.486 ; e)pi\ *patro/klw| te/tato u(smi=/nh, ‘over Patroclus,’ Il. 17.543; so of charge or mastery, poimai/nein e)p' o)/essi, Il. 6.25; ui(o\n e)pi\ ktea/tessi lipe/sqai, ‘in charge of,’ ‘as master of,’ Il. 5.154 ; e)pi\ i)/stori pei=ras e(le/sqai, ‘by,’ i. e. before a judge, Il. 18.501; freq. of hostile direction, h(=ke d' e)p) *)argei/oisi be/los, ‘at the Greeks,’ Il. 1.382; addition, o)/gxnh e)p' o)/gxnh|, ‘pear upon pear,’ Od. 7.120, 216; of time, e)pi\ nukti/, ‘in the night,’ Il. 8.529 ; e)p' h)/mati, ‘a day long,’ Il. 19.229; ‘day by day,’ Od. 12.105 ; e)p' h)/mati tw=|de, ‘on this day,’ Il. 13.234; cause or purpose, gaste/ras e)pi\ do/rpw| katqe/meqa, ‘for supper,’ Od. 18.44 ; e)p' a)rwgh=|, Il. 23.574; e)pi\ r(hqe/nti dikai/w|, ‘at a just remark,’ Od. 18.414; condition or price, misqw=| e)/pi r(htw=|, Il. 21.445, *k 304, Il. 9.602.—(3) w. acc., local, direction to or at (hostile), or extension, over; of purpose, for; and of time in extension, for, up to; e(/zesqai e)p' e)retma/, ‘take seats at the oars,’ Od. 12.171 ; e)pi\ e)/rga tre/pesqai, ‘to work,’ Il. 3.422 ; o)/rnusqai e)pi/ tina, ‘against,’ Il. 5.590 ; e)p' e)nne/a kei=to pe/leqra, ‘extending over,’ Od. 11.577 ; pa/ntas e)p' a)nqrw/pous e)ke/kasto, ‘the world over,’ Il. 24.535; so e)pi\ gai=an, e)pi\ po/nton; purpose, a)nasth=nai e)pi\ do/rpon, Il. 12.439; time, pannu/xion eu(dei=n kai\ e)p' h)w= kai\ me/son h)=mar, Od. 7.288; so e)pi\ xro/non, ‘for a time;’ e)pi\ dvhro/n, ‘for long.’
e)p-ia/llw: send upon; only aor. 1, e)pi=/hlen ta/de e)/rga, ‘brought to pass,’ Od. 22.49†.
e)pia/lmenos: see e)fa/llomai.
e)pianda/nw: see e)fanda/nw.
e)p-ia/xw, aor. 2 e)pi=/axon: shout (at), shout (in battle), Il. 7.403, Il. 5.860. (Il.)
e)pi/-baqron (paid by an e)piba/ths): fare, passage-money, Od. 15.449†.

e)pi-bai/nw, fut. inf. e)pibhse/men, aor. 1 e)pe/bhsa, subj. e)pibh/sete, imp. e)pi/bhson, aor. 2 e)pe/bhn, subj. du. e)pibh=ton, 1 pl. e)pibei/omen, mid. fut. e)pibh/somai, aor. e)pebh/seto: set foot on, mount, go on board; w. gen. gai/hs, i(/ppwn, nhw=n, eu)nh=s, Od. 10.334; purh=s, Il. 4.99; fig., a)naidei/hs e)pibh=nai, ‘tread the path of insolence,’ Od. 22.424, Od. 23.52; w. acc. *pieri/hn, *c 226, Od. 5.50.—Aor. 1 and fut. act., causative, tina\ i(/ppwn, make one mount the car, Il. 8.129 ; purh=s, of bringing men to their death, Il. 9.546 ; pa/trhs, bringing one home, Od. 7.223; and fig., e)uklei/hs, saofrosu/nhs, *q 285, Od. 23.13.

e)pi-ba/llw, ipf. e)pe/balle, mid. pres. part. e)piballo/menos: throw or cast on; of plying the whip, ‘laying it on’ the horses, Od. 6.320; intrans., (nhu=s) *fea=\s e)pe/balle, ‘touched at,’ Od. 15.297; mid., ‘lay hand on,’ ‘aim for,’ e)na/rwn, Il. 6.68.
e)pibh/menai: see e)pibai/nw.
e)pi-bh/twr, oros: mounter, ‘mounted warrior,’ i(/ppwn, Od. 18.263; designating a boar, suw=n e)pibh/twr, l 131, Od. 23.278.
e)pi-blh/s, h=tos (e)piba/llw): bar, of gate or door, Il. 24.453†. (See cut No. 56, and the adjacent representation of Egyptian doors; see also No. 29.)
e)pi-boa/w, mid. fut. e)pibw/somai: call upon, for help, as witnesses, qeou/s, a 378, Il. 10.463 (v. l. e)pidwso/meqa).
e)pi-bouko/los: herdsman (over cattle), cattle-herd. (Od.)
e)pi-bre/mw: set roaring, Il. 17.739†.
e)pi - bri=/qw, aor. e)pe/bri=sa: weigh down upon, make heavy (with fruit), Od. 24.344; fall heavily (upon), Il. 7.91, Il. 12.286, fig., po/lemos, Il. 7.343.
e)pibwso/meqa: see e)piboa/w.
e)pi-bw/twr, oros: mh/lwn, shepherd, Od. 13.222. Cf. e)pibouko/los.
e)pi - gi/gnomai: draw on, approach, Il. 6.148†.
e)pi - gignw/skw, aor. subj. e)pignw/h|, -gnw/wsi: mark, recognize, Od. 18.30, Od. 24.217.
e)pi-gna/mptw, aor. e)pe/gnamya: bend over; do/ru, Il. 21.178; met., bend, ‘change,’ ‘bow’ the will, Il. 2.14, Il. 9.514, Il. 1.569.
e)pignw/h|: see e)pigignw/skw.
e)pi-gouni/s, i/dos (go/nu, ‘above the knee’): thigh; mega/lhn e)pigouni/da qei=to, ‘grow a stout thigh,’ Od. 17.225. (Od.)
e)pi - gra/bdhn (e)pigra/fw): adv., ba/le, struck scratching, i. e. ‘grazed,’ Il. 21.166†.
e)pi-gra/fw, aor. e)pe/graya: scratch on; ‘graze,’ xro/a, Il. 13.533; ‘mark,’ klh=ron, Il. 7.187.
*)epi/dauros: Epidaurus, in Argolis, Il. 2.561†.
e)pide/drome: see e)pitre/xw.

e)pi-deuh/s, e/s (e)pideu/omai): in need of, lacking, inferior to; daito/s, Il. 9.225; w. two genitives (and illustrating both meanings at once), bi/hs e)pideue/es ei)me\n *)odush=os, Od. 21.253.—Adv., e)pideue\s e)/xein di/khs, ‘fail of,’ Il. 19.180.

e)pi-deu/omai (de/omai), ipf. e)pedeu/eto: lack, need, be inferior to, w. gen. of thing or of person, Il. 2.229, Il. 18.77; both together, ou) me\n ga/r ti ma/xhs e)pedeu/et' *)axaiw=n (cf. Od. 21.253, under e)pideuh/s), Il. 24.385.
e)pi-dhmeu/w (dh=mos): stay at home (in town, and not in the country), Od. 16.28†.
e)pi-dh/mios: at home, Od. 1.194, Il. 24.262 ; po/lemos, ‘civil strife,’ Il. 9.64.

e)pi-di/dwmi, aor. e)pe/dwke, inf. e)pidou=nai, mid. fut. e)pidwso/meqa, aor. 2 subj. e)pidw/meqa: give besides or with, Il. 23.559; as dowry, Il. 9.147; mid., take (to oneself) as witness, Il. 22.254; ‘honor with gifts’(?), Il. 10.463 (v. l. e)pibwso/meqa).

e)pi-di=ne/w (di=/nh), aor. part. e)pidi=nh/sa=s, pass. -nhqe/nte: set whirling, whirl, Il. 3.378, Od. 9.538; pass., wheel, circle (of birds), Od. 2.151; mid., metaph., revolve in mind, ponder, Od. 20.218.
e)pi-difria/s, a/dos (di/fros): rim of a chariot-box, Il. 10.475†. (See cut No. 10, under a)/ntuc.)
e)pi-di/frios (di/fros): in the chariot, neut. pl., predicatively, Od. 15.51 and 75.
e)pidramei=n, e)pidrame/thn: see e)pitre/xw.
e)pidw/meqa: see e)pidi/dwmi.
e)pi-ei/kelos (vei/kelos): like to; qeoi=s, a=/qana/toisin, *a 265, Il. 9.485.
e)pi-eikh/s, e/s (ve/voika): suitable, becoming, Od. 9.382; (tu/mbon) e)pieike/a toi=on, ‘only just of suitable size,’ Il. 23.246; often w(s e)pieike/s (sc. e)stin).

e)pi-eikto/s, 3 (vei/kw): yielding, always w. neg., me/nos ou)k e)pieikto/n, ‘unyielding,’ ‘steadfast,’ Od. 19.493, Il. 5.892 ; sqe/nos, ‘invincible,’ Il. 16.549 ; e)/rga, ‘unendurable,’ i. e. to which one must not yield, Od. 8.307.
e)pieime/nos: see e)pie/nnu=mi.
e)piei/somai: see e)/peim Od. 9.2.
e)pi-e/lpomai (ve/lpw): have hope of, Il. 1.545, Od. 21.126.

e)pi-e/nnu=mi (ve/nnu=mi), aor. 1 pl. e)pie/ssamen, pass. perf. part. e)pieime/nos: put on over; xlai=nan, Od. 20.143; pass., metaph., e)pieime/nos a)lkh/n, a)naidei/hn, clothed in might, etc., Il. 7.164, Il. 1.149.
e)pi=/hle: see e)pia/llw.
e)pih/ndane: see e)fanda/nw.
e)pi/hra: see h)=ra.
e)pi-qarsu=/nw: encourage, Il. 4.183†.
e)piqei=te: see e)piti/qhmi.
e)pi/-qhma (ti/qhmi): lid of a chest, pl., Il. 24.228†.
e)piqre/ca=s: see e)pitre/xw.
e)pi-qrw/skw: spring upon; nho/s, Il. 8.515; ‘jump upon’ (in contempt), Il. 4.177 ; to/sson e)piqrw/skousi, spring so far, Il. 5.772.
e)p-i=qu=/w (i=)qu/s), aor. part. e)pi=qu=/santes: charge straight at or on, Il. 18.175, Od. 16.297.
e)pi-i/stwr, oros (root vid): conscious of, accomplice in, Od. 21.26†.
e)pi/kar: see ka/r.
e)pi - ka/rsios, 3 (ka/r, ka/ra): headforemost, headlong, Od. 9.70†.
*)epika/sth (kai/numai, the ‘Notorious’): the mother of Oedipus, in the tragic poets Jocasta, Od. 11.271†.
e)pi/-keimai, fut. e)pikei/setai: lie on or to, i. e. ‘be closed’ (of doors), Od. 6.19; met., a)na/gkh, ‘press upon’ (as we say ‘be under’ the necessity), Il. 6.458.
e)pi-kei/rw, aor. e)pe/kerse: mow down; fa/laggas, Il. 16.394†.
e)pi - ke/llw, aor. e)pe/kelsa: beach a ship, nh=a, Od. 9.138; intr., nhu=s, run in on the beach, Od. 13.114, Od. 9.148 (cf. 149).
e)pi - kertome/w: mock at, deride; part., ‘jestingly,’ Il. 24.649.
e)pi-keu/qw, fut. -sw, aor. subj. e)pikeu/sh|s: conceal, always w. neg., Od. 14.467, Od. 4.744, Il. 5.816.
e)pi - ki/dnamai: only pres. 3 sing., diffuses itself over, Il. 2.850, Il. 7.451, 458.
e)pi - ki/rnhmi, aor. inf. e)pikrh=sai: mix in, add wine to water, Od. 7.164†.
e)pi - klei/w (kle/os): bestow praise upon, applaud, Od. 1.351†.
*)epiklh=s: a Lycian, slain by Ajax, Il. 12.379†.
