e)pi/ - klhsis (kale/w): given name (‘surname’); only acc., adverbially or predicatively, mostly with kalei=n, *)/arkton q), h(\n kai\ a(/macan e)pi/klhsin kale/ousin, ‘which they call also by the name of the wain,’ Od. 5.273, Il. 7.138, Il. 22.506 ; *sperxeiw=|, au)ta\r e)pi/klhsin *bw/rw|, ‘but by repute to B.,’ Il. 16.177.
e)pi - kli=/nw: only pass. perf. part., e)pikeklime/nai sani/des, closed doors, Il. 12.121†.
e)pi/-klopos (kle/ptw): thievish, cunning, sly rogue; mu=/qwn, to/cwn, ‘filcher’ (combined skill and rascality), Il. 22.281, Od. 21.397.
e)pi-klu/w: hear, Il. 23.652, Od. 5.150.
e)pi-klw/qw, aor. e)pe/klwsa, mid. e)peklwsa/mhn: spin to, of the Fates spinning the threads of destiny; hence allot to, grant, w. acc., or foll. by inf. (Od. and Il. 24.525.)
e)pi - ko/ptw: only fut. part., e)piko/ywn, to fell by a blow, Od. 3.443†.
e)pi-koure/w: only fut. part., e)pikourh/sonta, to give aid, Il. 5.614†.
e)pi/-kouros: helper in battle, Il. 5.478, fem., Il. 21.431; pl., allies of the Trojans.
e)pi - krai/nw, e)pikraiai/nw, aor. opt. e)pikrh/neie, imp. e)pikrh/hnon: bring to fulfilment, fulfil, accomplish. (Il.)
e)pi-krate/w: have power over, rule over; ‘have the upper hand,’ Il. 14.98.
e)pi-krate/ws (kra/tos): mightily, victoriously. (Il.)
e)pikrh/hnon, e)pikrh/neie: see e)pikrai/nw.
e)pikrh=sai: see e)piki/rnhmi.
e)p-i/krion: yard of a ship, Od. 5.254 and 318.
e)pi-la/mpw, aor. e)pe/lamye: shine in, Il. 17.650†.
e)pi-lanqa/nw, e)pilh/qw, aor. e)pe/lhse, mid. ipf. e)pelh/qeto, fut. e)pilh/somai: act., make to forget, w. gen., Od. 20.85; mid., forget.
e)pi-lei/bw: pour wine over, as a libation, Od. 3.341.
e)pi-leu/ssw: see ahead, Il. 3.12†.
e)pilh/qw: see e)pilanqa/nw.
e)pi-lhke/w: beat time to a dance, Od. 8.379†.
e)pi-li/gdhn: blh=to w)=mon, received a stroke grazing the shoulder, Il. 17.599†.
e)p-illi/zw: wink to, Od. 18.11†.
e)pi - lwbeu/w (lw/bh): mock at, Od. 2.323†.
e)pi - mai/nomai, aor. e)pemh/nato: be mad for, madly desirous, w. inf., Il. 6.160†.

e)pi-mai/omai, imp. e)pimai/eo, ipf. e)pemai/eto, fut. e)pima/ssetai, aor. e)pema/ssato, part. e)pimassa/menos: (1) feel over, feel for, touch up; of the blind Polyphēmus feeling over the backs of his sheep, hoping to catch Odysseus, o)i/wn e)pemai/eto nw=ta, Od. 9.441; Odysseus feeling for the right place to stab the sleeping Polyphēmus, xei/r) (dat.) e)pimassa/menos, Od. 9.302; the surgeon probing a wound, e(/lkos d' i=)hth\r e)pima/ssetai, Il. 4.190; of touching one with the magic wand, r(a/bdw|, Il. 13.429; horses with the whip, Il. 5.748.—(2) make for, strive for; tino/s, Od. 12.220, e 344, Il. 10.401.
e)pi-ma/rturos: witness to a matter, only of gods, Il. 7.76, Od. 1.273.
e)pimassa/menos: see e)pimai/omai.

e)pi/ - mastos (e)pimai/omai): of one
who has been handled, hence ‘filthy,’ a)lh/ths, Od. 20.377†.
e)pi-meida/w: only aor. part., e)pimeidh/sa=s, smiling at or upon, Il. 4.356; in bad sense, Il. 10.400.
e)pi - me/mfomai: find fault with, blame for, w. dat. of person, Od. 16.97; gen. (causal) of the thing, Il. 1.65, 93, Il. 2.225.
e)pi - me/nw, aor. imp. e)pi/meinon, inf. e)pimei=nai: stay, wait, tarry.
e)pi - mh=nis: wrath thereat, Il. 5.178†. The reading of Aristarchus.
e)pi - mhni/w: only ipf., was at feud with, Il. 13.460†.
e)pi - mimnh/skomai, aor. mid. opt., e)pimnhsai/meqa, pass. part. e)pimnhsqei/s: call to mind, remember.
e)pi-mi/mnw: wait upon, superintend; e)/rgw|, Od. 14.66 and Od. 15.372.
e)pi-mi=/c: indiscriminately.
e)pi - mi/sgomai: mingle with, hence come in contact with, have to do with, engage in battle (with the enemy), Il. 5.505.
e)pimnhsai/meqa: see e)pimimnh/skomai.
e)pi-mu=/zw (mu=/zw, ‘say mu=’), aor. e)pe/mu=can: mutter, murmur at. (Il.)
e)pi - ne/mw, aor. e)pe/neime: distribute (to).
e)pi - neu/w, aor. e)pe/neusa: nod with the helmet (of the plume), Il. 22.314; nod assent (opp. a)naneu/w), ka/rhti, Il. 15.75.
e)pi - nefri/dios (nefro/s): over the kidneys, Il. 21.204†.
e)pi - ne/w, aor. e)pe/nhse: spin to, i. e. allot as destiny (cf. e)piklw/qw), Il. 20.128 and Il. 24.210.
e)pi/ - cu=nos (cu=no/s = koino/s): common, i. e. where several persons have rights, Il. 12.422†.
e)pi-orke/w, fut. -h/sw: swear falsely; pro\s dai/monos, in the name of a divinity, Il. 19.188†.
e)pi/ - orkos: falsely sworn, false, Il. 19.264; as subst., e)pi/orkon, false oath, Il. 3.279; vain oath, Il. 10.332.
e)pi - o/ssomai: look after, look out for (to hinder, if possible), w. acc., Il. 17.381†.
e)pi/oura: see ou)=ron.
e)pi/ - ouros (ou)=ros): guardian or watch over; *krh/th|, ‘ruler over’ Crete, Il. 13.450 ; u(w=n, ‘chief swine - herd,’ Od. 13.405, Od. 15.39.
e)pio/yomai: see e)fora/w.
e)pi - pei/qomai, ipf. e)pepei/qeto, fut. e)pipei/somai: allow oneself to be prevailed upon, Od. 2.103, Od. 10.406; hence, obey, tini/.
e)pi-pe/lomai: only syncopated part., e)piplo/menon ve/tos, on-coming, on-rolling year, Od. 7.261 and Od. 14.287.
e)pi-pe/tomai, aor. e)pe/ptato, inf. e)pipte/sqai: fly toward or in, Il. 13.821; of an arrow, Il. 4.126.
e)pi-pi/lnamai: come nigh, Od. 6.44†.
e)pi - ple/w, e)piplei/w: sail over, w. acc.
e)pi-plh/ssw, fut. inf. -h/cein: lay on blows, Il. 10.500; metaph., take to task, rebuke, Il. 12.211, Il. 23.580.
e)piplo/menon: see e)pipe/lomai.
e)piplw/w, aor. 2 2 sing. e)pe/plws, aor. 1 part. e)piplw/sa=s:=e)piple/w, Od. 3.15, *z 291, Il. 3.47.
e)pi - pne/w, e)pipnei/w, aor. subj. e)pipneu/swsi: breathe or blow upon, Il. 5.698 ; nhi/, Od. 4.357.
e)pi - poimh/n, e/nos: pl., fem., shepherdesses over, Od. 12.131†. Cf. e)pibouko/los, e)pibw/twr.
e)pi - pre/pw: only 3 sing., is to be seen, manifest in, Od. 24.252†.
e)piproe/men: see e)piproi+/hmi.
e)pi-pro-ia/llw: only aor. e)piproi+/hle, set before them (sfwi/n), Il. 11.628†.

e)pi-pro-i/hmi, aor. e)piproe/hka, inf. e)piproe/men: let go forth to or at; of sending a man to the war, Il. 18.58, 439; discharging an arrow at one, <*> 94; intrans. (sc. nh=a), make for; nh/soisin, Od. 15.299.
e)pi - ptai/rw, aor. e)pe/ptare: sneeze at; tini\ e)pe/essin (at one's words, a lucky omen; pa=si, means that the omen applied to all she had said), Od. 17.545†.
e)pipte/sqai: see e)pipe/tomai.

e)pi - rre/zw (vre/zw): only ipf. iter.,
epirre/zeskon, were wont to do sacrifice, Od. 17.211†.
e)pi-rre/pw (vre/pw): sink toward, of the balance; o)/leqros h(mi=n, ‘settles down upon us,’ Il. 14.99.
e)pi-rre/w (sre/w): flow upon, Il. 2.754; met., stream on, Il. 11.724. (Il.)
e)pi-rrh/ssw: only ipf. iter. e)pirrh/sseskon, drove to, pushed home, Il. 24.454, 456. (Il.)
e)pi - rri=/ptw (vri=/ptw), aor. e)pe/rri=yan: fling upon or at, Od. 5.310†.
e)pi/-rroqos (cf. e)pita/rroqos): helper. (Il.)
e)pi-rrw/omai: see r(w/omai, ipf. e)perrw/onto, plied their toil at the milis, Od. 20.107; aor. e)perrw/santo, flowed down; xai=tai, Il. 1.529.

e)pi-seu/w, e)pisseu/w, aor. 1 e)pe/sseue, part. e)pisseu/a=s, mid. ipf. e)pesseu/onto, perf. w. pres. signif. e)pe/ssumai, part. e)pessu/menos, plup. e)pe/ssuto, e)pessu/meqa: I. act., set upon, incite or send against; kh=to/s tini, e 421, Od. 14.399; met., kaka/, o)nei/rata, Od. 18.256, t 129, Od. 20.87.— II. mid., rush on or at, hasten on, speed to, w. dat. of person, esp. in hostile sense; w. gen. of thing aimed at, tei/xeos, *m 388, Il. 16.511, cf. Od. 22.310; acc., de/mnia, Od. 6.20; also foll. by inf.; met., qu=mo\s e)pe/ssutai, ‘is so moved,’ Il. 1.173.
e)pi/ - skopos (skope/w): look-out, watch, spy against, in hostile sense w. dat., *trw/essi, nh/essi, Il. 10.38, 342; otherwise w. gen., Od. 8.163; guardian, Il. 22.255, Il. 24.729.
e)pi - sku/nion: skin over the brows (supercilium), knitted in frowning, Il. 17.136†.
e)pi-smugerw=s: miserably, sadly, Od. 3.195, Od. 4.672. (Od.)
e)pi/ - spastos (spa/w): drawn on himself, Od. 18.73. (Od.)
e)pispei=n: see e)fe/pw.
e)pi - spe/rxw: urge on, Od. 22.451, Il. 23.430; intr., drive fast, of storms, Od. 5.304.
e)pispe/sqai, e)pispw/n: see e)fe/pw.
e)pissei/w, e)pisseu/w: see e)pisei/w, e)piseu/w.
e)pi/sswtron: tire of a wheel. (Il.)
e)pi-stado/n (i(/sthmi): adv., stepping up to; standing, i. e. on the spot, Od. 16.453.

e)pi/stamai, ipf. e)pi/stato, fut. e)pisth/sontai: know how, understand, w. inf., Il. 2.611; often the part. in the sense of skilled in, w. gen., Od. 21.406, abs., Il. 18.599; w. dat., Il. 15.282; of ‘knowing’ a fact, Od. 4.730.
e)pistame/nws (e)pi/stamai): skilfully.
e)pi - sta/ths: one who stands by or over; so\s e)pista/ths, ‘thy petitioner,’ meaning a beggar, Od. 17.455†.
e)pi - stena/xomai: groan besides, Il. 4.154†.
e)pi-stefh/s, e/s (ste/fw): brimful.
e)pi-ste/fomai (ste/fw), aor. e)peste/yanto: fill to the brim for oneself.
e)pisth/mwn: knowing, sagacious, Od. 16.374†.
e)pi/stion: dock-yard or boat-house, a place for keeping ships, Od. 6.365†.
e)pi-stonaxe/w: only aor., e)pestona/xhse, the billows roared as they closed upon her, Il. 24.79†.
e)pi - stre/fw, aor. part. e)pistre/ya=s: turn towards, sc. mi/n, Il. 3.370†.
e)pi - strofa/dhn: turning in every direction, on every side.
e)pi/ - strofos (e)pistre/fomai): conversant with (a)nqrw/pwn), through wanderings, Od. 1.177†.
*)epi/strofos: (1) son of Iphitus, leader of the Phocians, Il. 2.517.—(2) leader of the Halizonians, Il. 2.856.—(3) son of Evēnus, slain by Achilles at the sack of Lyrnessus, Il. 2.692.
*)epi/stwr: a Trojan, slain by Patroclus, Il. 16.695†.
e)pi-sfu/rion (sfuro/n): anything at the ankle, pl., ankle - clasps fastening the greaves, or perhaps, ankle-guards, Il. 3.331. (Il.) (See cut on next page.)
e)pi-sxerw/ (sxero/s): adv., in a row, close together, Il. 23.125. (Il.)
e)pi - sxesi/h (e)pe/xw): mu=/qou poih/sasqai e)pisxesi/hn, give a direction to one's statements, Od. 21.71†.
e)pi/-sxesis (e)pe/xw): restraint, foll. by inf., Od. 17.451†.
e)pi-ta/rroqos (cf. e)pi/rroqos): helper. (Il. and Od. 24.182.)
e)pi - te/rpomai: take pleasure in, Od. 14.228†.
e)pite/traptai, e)pitetra/fatai: see e)pitre/pw.
e)pi-thde/s: sufficiently, as are needed, Il. 1.142, Od. 15.28.

e)pi-ti/qhmi, fut. e)piqh/sw, aor. e)pe/qhka, imp. e)pi/qes, opt. e)piqei/h, 2 pl. -qei=te: put or place to or upon, add, Il. 7.364; of putting food on the table, Od. 1.140; a veil on the head, Od. 5.314; the cover on a quiver, Od. 9.314; a stone against a doorway, Od. 9.243; and regularly of ‘closing’ doors (cf. ‘pull the door to’), Il. 14.169, Od. 22.157, cf. Il. 5.751, Il. 8.395, Od. 11.525; metaph., qwh/n, ‘impose’ a penalty, Od. 2.192 ; mu=/qw| te/los, ‘give fulfilment,’ Il. 19.107.
e)pi - ti=mh/twr: avenger, protector, Od. 9.270†.
e)pi - tlh=nai, imp. e)pitlh/tw: be patient (at), Il. 23.591 ; mu=/qoisin, ‘hearken patiently to,’ Il. 19.220.
e)pi-tolma/w, imp. e)pitolma=/tw, aor. e)peto/lmhse: hold out, endure, abs., Od. 17.238, w. inf., Od. 1.353.
e)pi/-tonos (tei/nw): back-stay of a mast, Od. 12.423†. (See cut, representing a Phoenician war-ship.)
e)pi-toca/zomai: bend the bow upon, shoot at; tini/, Il. 3.79†.
e)pi - trape/w: commit, intrust to, Il. 10.421†.

e)pi - tre/pw, aor. 1 e)pe/treya, aor. 2 e)pe/trapon, imp. 2 pl. e)pitra/feq), mid. aor. 2 e)petrapo/mhn, pass. perf. e)pite/trammai, 3 pl. e)pitetra/fatai: act., turn or give over to, commit, intrust, pass., Il. 2.25, Il. 5.750; of ‘leaving’ the victory to another, Il. 21.473; intr., ‘give up,’ ‘give in to,’ gh/rai+, Il. 10.79; mid. (met.), be inclined, qu=mo/s, Od. 9.12.

e)pi-tre/xw, aor. 1 part. e)piqre/cantos, aor. 2 e)pe/dramon, perf. e)pide/droma: run up, run upon, often in hostile sense, Od. 14.30; of horses putting forth their??peed, ‘ran on,’ Il. 23.418, 447; the chariot rolling close on (behind) the horses, Il. 23.504; a spear impinging upon a shield, Il. 13.409 ; leukh\ d' e)pide/dromen ai)/glh, runs over all, Od. 6.45 ; a)xlu/s, Od. 20.357.
e)pi - troxa/dhn: glibly, fluently, Il. 3.213, Od. 18.26.
e)pi - fe/rw, fut. e)poi/sei, aor. 1 inf. e)penei=kai: bear upon, only in unfavorable sense, xei=ra, xei=ras, lay hands upon, Il. 1.89, Od. 16.438; ‘touch,’ Il. 19.261.
e)pi - fqone/w: begrudge, refuse, deny, Od. 11.149†.
e)pi - fle/gw: burn, consume; u=(/lhn, nekro/n, *b 455, Il. 23.52. (Il.)

e)pi-fra/zomai, aor. 1 2 sing. e)pefra/sw, 3 e)pefra/sato, subj. e)pifra/sset), opt. e)pifrassai/meqa, 3 pl. -ai/ato, pass. aor. e)pefra/sqhs: consider, mark, devise, Od. 15.444; joined w. noei=n (Odysseus weeps), *)alki/noos de/ min oi)=os e)pefra/sat' h)d) e)no/hsen, ‘remarked’ and noted the fact, Od. 8.94, 533, Il. 5.665; oi(=on dh\ to\n mu=qon e)pefra/sqhs a)goreu=sai, ‘didst take it into thy head’ to say, Od. 5.183.
e)pi-frone/ousa: part., sagaciously, Od. 19.385†.
e)pi-frosu/nh: thoughtfulness, sagacity; pl. a)nele/sqai, assume discretion, Od. 19.22. (Od.)
e)pi-xeire/w (xei/r): put hand to, apply oneself to; dei/pnw|, si/tw|, Od. 24.386 and 395.
e)pixeu=ai: see e)pixe/w.

e)pi-xe/w, aor. 1 e)pe/xeue, inf. e)pixeu=ai, mid. aor. 1 e)pexeu/ato, aor. 2 e)pe/xunto: pour upon, heap up, mid. (aor. 1), for oneself; not of liquids only, but of earth, leaves, etc.; pollh\n d' e)pexeu/ato u=(/lhn, for wattling, Od. 5.257 ; xu/sin fu/llwn, for a bed, Od. 5.487; mid., aor. 2, intr. (metaph.) toi\ d' e)pe/xunto, poured in, Il. 15.654, Il. 16.295.
e)pi-xqo/nios (xqw/n): upon the earth, earthly, epith. of men, mortals, as opp. to gods; subst., dwellers upon earth, Il. 24.220, Od. 17.115.
e)pi-xra/w, aor. 2 e)pe/xraon: assail; tini/, Il. 16.352, 356; fig., of the suitors ‘besetting’ Penelope with their wooing, Od. 2.50.
e)pi-xri=/w, aor. part. e)pixri=/sa=sa: besmear, anoint, mid., oneself, Od. 18.179. (Od.)
e)pi-yau/w: touch upon; met., prapi/dessin, ‘have perception,’ Od. 8.547†.
e)pi - wgai/, pl.; places of shelter against wind and wave, roadstead, Od. 5.404†.
e)piw/n: see e)/peim Od. 9.2.
e)/ple: see pe/lw.
e)/pleo, e)/pleu, e)/pleto: see pe/lomai.
e)/plhnto: see pela/zw.
e)poi/sei: see e)pife/rw.

e)p-oi/xomai, ipf. e)pw/|xeto: go up to, go against, w. acc. of person or of thing; e)poixo/menon sti/xas a)ndrw=n, i. e. to marshall them, Il. 15.279, Il. 16.155 ; ou)rh=as me\n prw=ton e)pw/|xeto, ‘attacked,’ Il. 1.50 ; e)pw/|xeto kh=la qeoi=o, ‘sped’ to their mark, Il. 1.383 ; e)poixome/nh po/sin eu(=ren, had ‘gone abroad’ to find a husband, Od. 6.282 ; e)/rgon e)poi/xesqai, do/rpon, Od. 1.358, Od. 13.34; i(sto\n e)poixome/nh, ‘plying’ the loom, i. e. going up and down before it, Il. 1.31.
e(/pomai: see e(/pw.
e)p-o/mnu=mi, e)pomnu/w, ipf. e)pw/mnuon, aor. e)pw/mosa: take oath, swear upon some matter, Od. 15.437 ; e)pi/orkon, ‘swear a vain oath,’ Il. 10.332.
e)p-omfa/lios (o)mfalo/s): ba/len sa/kos e)pomfa/lion, on the boss, Il. 7.267†.
e)p-opi/zomai (o)/pis): stand in awe of, reverence, Od. 5.146†.
e)p - opta/w: broil over a fire, Od. 12.363†.
e)p - opteu/w, ipf. iter. e)popteu/eske: oversee, superintend, Od. 16.140†.
e)p-ore/gw: only mid. aor. part., e)poreca/menos, reaching out after, lunging at, Il. 5.335†.

e)p - o/rnu=mi, e)pornu/w, ipf. e)pw/rnue, aor. 1 e)pw=rsa, mid. aor. 2 e)pw=rto: act., rouse against, arouse, send upon, mid., rise against; a)/grei ma=/n oi( e)/porson *)aqhnai/hn, Il. 5.765; (*zeu/s) o(/s moi e)pw=rse me/nos, Il. 20.93; th=| tis qeo\s u(/pnon e)pw=rsen, Od. 22.429; mid. (the river Scamander), e)pw=rt' *)axilh=i kukw/menos, Il. 21.324.
e)p-orou/w, aor. e)po/rousa: rush upon, hasten to; tini/, usually in hostile sense, but not always, Il. 5.793; w. acc., a(/rma, Il. 17.481; met., u(/pnos, ‘came swiftly upon,’ Od. 23.343.

e)/pos (root vep., cf. vox), pl. e)/pea: word, words, rather with reference to the feeling and ethical intent of the speaker than to form or subject-matter (r(h=ma, mu=qos); kako/n, e)sqlo/n, mei/lixon, a(/lion, u(perfi/alon e)/pos, Il. 24.767, Il. 1.108, Od. 15.374, *s 324, Od. 4.503; pl., e)/pesin kai\ xersi\n a)rh/cein, Il. 1.77; dw/roisi/n t' a)ganoi=sin e)/pessi/ te meilixi/oisin, Il. 9.113; so of the bard, e)/pe) i=(mero/enta, r 519, Od. 8.91; phrases, poi=o/n se ve/pos fu/gen e(/rkos o)do/ntwn, e)/pos t' e)/fat) e)/k t) o)no/mazen, eu)xo/menos e)/pos hu)/da=, e)/pea ptero/enta proshu/da=. e)/pos, e)/pea are best literally translated; if paraphrased, ‘command,’ ‘threat,’ are admissible, not ‘tale,’ ‘message,’ or the like.

e)p-otru=/nw, aor. e)pw/tru=na: urge on, move, prompt, impel, tina/, and w. inf., rarely tini/ (most of the apparent instances of the dat. depend on some other word), Il. 15.258, Od. 10.531; joined with keleu/w, a)/nwga, *b 422, Il. 10.130; often qu=mo\s e)potru=/nei, Il. 6.439; in bad sense, ‘stirred me up,’ Od. 8.185; of things, po/lemo/n tini, a)ggeli/a=s poli/essi, x 152, Od. 24.335; mid., e)potru=nw/meqa pomph/n, ‘be quick with our escort,’ Od. 8.31 (cf. act., 30).
e)p-oura/nios (ou)rano/s): in heaven, heavenly, epithet of the gods (opp. e)pixqo/nios).

e)p-oxe/omai, fut. -h/setai: be carried
upon, ride upon, i(/ppois (in the sense of chariot), Il. 17.449. (Il.)
e)po/yomai: see e)fora/w.
e)/praqon: see pe/rqw.
e(pta/: seven.
e(pta-e/ths (ve/tos): only neut., e(pta/etes, seven years. (Od.)
e(pta-po/dhs (pou/s): seven feet long, Il. 15.729†.
*(epta/poros: a river in Mysia, flowing from Mt. Ida, Il. 12.20.
e(pta/ - pulos (pu/lh): seven - gated, epith. of Boeotian Thebes, Il. 4.406.
e)/ptaron: see ptai/rw.
e)/ptato: see pe/tomai.
e(/ptaxa: in seven parts, Od. 14.434†.

e)/pw, ipf. e(/pon, mid. e(/pomai, imp. e(/peo, e(/peu, ipf. ei(po/mhn, e(po/mhn, fut. e(/yomai, aor. e(spo/mhn, imp. spei=o, e(spe/sqw, part. e(spo/menos: move about, be busy. — I. act., a)mf' *)odush=a *trw=es e(/pon, ‘moved around Odysseus,’ Il. 11.43 ; a)/lloi d' e)pi\ e)/rgon e(/poien, ‘be busy with their work,’ Od. 14.195; trans., perikalle/a teu/xe) e(/ponta, ‘occupied with,’ Il. 6.321 ; ou) me
 dh\ to/de mei=zon e(/pei kako/n, a greater evil that ‘approaches,’ Od. 12.209 (v. l. e)/pi).—II. mid., once like act., a)mfi\ d' a)/r) au)to
 *trw=es e(/ponq), ‘moved around him,’ Il. 11.474 (cf. 483); usually go along with, accompany, follow, ke/kleto qera/pontas a(/ma spe/sqai e(oi= au)tw=|, Od. 4.38; soi\ d' a)/loxon spe/sqai, Od. 22.324; tou/tou g) e(spome/noio, ‘if he should go too,’ Il. 10.246 ; e(/peo prote/rw, ‘come along in,’ Il. 18.387 ; w(\s ei)pw
 h(gei=q), h(\ d' e(/speto, followed, Od. 1.125; also w. adverbs, meta/, su/n, e)pi/, Il. 23.133, k 436, Il. 4.63 (met.); often of things, o(/ssa e)/oike fi/lhs e)pi\ paido\s e(/pesqai, ‘go along with,’ i. e. be given as dowry, Od. 1.278 ; oi(/h e)mh\ du/namis kai\ xei=res e(/pontai, ‘answer to’ my strength, Od. 20.237 ; gou/nata, Il. 4.314; in hostile sense only in Il., Il. 11.154, 165, etc.
e)p - w/numos (o)/noma): by a name given for some reason (‘surname,’ cf. e)pi/klhsis), Il. 9.562 ; o)/noma e)pw/numon, of a significant name, Od. 7.54, Od. 19.409.
e)pw=rto: see e)po/rnu=mi.
e)p - w/xato, plup. pass. 3 pl. from e)pe/xw: were shut, Il. 12.340†.
e)/ra-ze: upon the ground, with pi=/ptw and xe/w, x 20, Il. 12.156.
e)/ramai, e)ra/omai, ipf. 2 pl. e)ra/asqe, aor. h)rasa/mhn, e)ra/(s)sato: be (aor. become) enamoured of, in love with; fig., pole/mou, fu=lopi/dos, *i 64, Il. 16.208.
e)ranno/s (e)/ramai): lovely, charming, epith. of places, Il. 9.531, Od. 7.18.
e)/ranos: picnic, Od. 1.226. (Od.)
e)ra/ssato: see e)/ramai.
e)rateino/s (e)rato/s): lovely, charming; epith. of places and of things; twice of persons, Od. 4.13 and (in a litotes, much like poqeino/s) Od. 9.230.
e)rato/s (e)/ramai): lovely, neut. pl., Il. 3.64†.

e)rga/zomai (ve/rgon), ipf. ei)rga/zeto, e)rga/zonto: work, do, perform; ke/leuse de verga/zesqai, bade his bellows be at work, Il. 18.469 ; e)/rga e)rga/zesqai, Od. 20.72; e)nai/sima, ‘do what is right,’ Od. 17.321 ; xru=so\n ei)rg<*>zeto, wrought, Od. 3.435.

e)/rgon (ve/rgon): work, deed, act, thing; me/ga e)/rgon, usually in bad sense (facinus), Od. 3.261, but not always, Il. 10.282; collectively, and pl., e)/rgon e)poi/xesqai, e)pi\ e)/rga tre/pesqai, nu=n e)/pleto ve/rgon a(/pa=sin, ‘something for all to do,’ Il. 12.271; with specifying adj., polemh/ia, qala/ssia e)/rga, e)/rga ga/moio, *b 614, Il. 5.429; esp. of husbandry, ou)/te bow=n o)/ut' a)ndrw=n fai/neto ve/rga (boumque hominumque labores), Od. 10.98, and simply e)/rga, fields, *)iqa/khs eu)deie/lou e)/rg' a)fi/konto, c 343, Il. 2.751; of the results of labor (krhth/r) e)/rgon *(hfai/stoio, Od. 4.617; (pe/ploi) e)/rga gunaikw=n, Il. 6.289; also in the sense of ‘accomplishments,’ Od. 8.245, etc.; o(/pws e)/stai ta/de ve/rga, these ‘matters,’ ‘affairs.’

e)/rgw, e)e/rgw, ei)/rgw, e)/rgnu=mi (ve/rg.), ipf. e)/erge, e)e/rgnu=, aor. 3 pl. e)/rcan, pass. perf. e)/ergmai, 3 pl. e)e/rxatai, plup. 3 pl. e)/rxato, e)e/rxato, aor. part. acc. e)rxqe/nta: shut off by barrier or enclosure, e)nto\s e)e/rgein, shut in, Il. 2.617, etc.; of simply ‘enclosing,’ diakekrime/nai de\ e(/kastai | e)/rxato, the young animals were severally ‘penned,’ Od. 9.221, Od. 14.73 ; e)rxqe/nt' e)n potamw=|, ‘shut up,’ Il. 21.282; also of ‘crowding,’ ‘pressing closely,’ Il. 16.395; mostly w. specifying adv. (as
e)nto/s above), zugo\n a)mfi\s e)e/rgei (bo/e), ‘holds apart,’ Il. 13.706; so e)kto/s, Od. 12.219; kata/, Od. 10.238; the gen. may follow even the simple verb, w(s o(/te mh/thr | paido\s e)e/rgh| mui=an, ‘keeps a fly away from her child,’ Il. 4.131 ; e)ergme/nai, Il. 5.89; better reading e)erme/nai.

e)/rdw (root verg.), ipf. iter. e)/rdeskes, fut. e)/rcw, aor. e)/rca, perf. e)/orga, plup. e)w/rgein: do, esp. do sacrifice, sacrifice; e(kato/mba=s, Il. 1.315, Od. 7.202; i=(ra\ qeoi=s, Il. 11.207; w. two accusatives, or w. dat., o(/ me pro/teros ka/k' e)/orgen, Il. 3.351; polla\ ka/k) a)nqrw/poisin e)w/rgei, Od. 14.289, Il. 14.261; e)/rcon o(/pws e)qe/leis, ‘do as thou wilt,’ Od. 13.145; defiantly, e)/rd)˙ a)ta\r ou)/ toi pa/ntes e)paine/omen, ‘go on and do!’ Il. 4.29.
e)rebenno/s (*)/erebos): black (ater), gloomy; nu/c, a=/hr, ne/fea, Il. 5.659, 864, Il. 22.309. (Il.)
e)re/binqos: chick-pea, Il. 13.589.
*)/erebos, gen. *)ere/beus, *)ere/besfi: Erebus, the realm of nether darkness, Il. 8.368, Il. 16.327, Od. 10.528, Od. 12.81 .—*)/erebo/sde, to Erebus, Od. 20.356.
e)reei/nw, ipf. e)re/eine, mid. e)reei/neto: ask, abs., Il. 3.191, Od. 7.31 ; tina/ (ti), Il. 6.176, Od. 1.220 ; a)mfi/ tini, Od. 24.262; mid., with mu=/qw|, Od. 17.305.
e)reqi/zw = e)re/qw, *a 32, Il. 24.560.
e)re/qw (cf. e)/ris): irritate, provoke, Il. 1.519, Il. 3.414 ; o)du/nai, meledw=nai, ‘disquiet,’ ‘worry,’ Od. 4.813, Od. 19.517.

e)rei/dw, pass. perf. e)rh/reismai, 3 pl. e)rhre/datai, plup. 3 sing. h)rh/reisto, 3 pl. e)rhre/dato, aor. e)rei/sqh, mid. aor. e)rei/sato, part. e)reisa/menos: I. act., lean one thing against another, usually with some notion of weight or violence, support, press or force down; do/ru pro\s tei=xos e)rei/sa=s, Il. 22.112; qro/non pro\s ki=/ona, Od. 8.66; a)spi\s a)spi/d' e)/reide, ‘bore hard on,’ Il. 13.131 ; e)rei/dontes bele/essin, ‘pressing him hard,’ Il. 16.108; pass., e)pi\ meli/hs e)reisqei/s, ‘supported,’ ‘supporting himself,’ ‘leaning’ upon the lance, Il. 22.225 ; qro/noi peri\ toi=xon e)rhre/dato, ‘set firmly,’ Od. 7.95 ; la=e e)rhre/datai, ‘planted,’ Il. 23.329 ; u(/ptios ou)/dei e)rei/sqh, ‘forced heavily to the ground,’ Il. 7.145 ; ou)/dei+ de/ sfin | xai=tai e)rhre/datai, their manes ‘rest upon’ the ground), Il. 23.284 ; dia\ qw/rhkos h)rh/reisto, ‘forced through,’ Il. 3.358.—II. mid., lean or support oneself firmly; e)rei/sato xeiri\ gai/hs, ‘upon the ground with his hand,’ Il. 5.309 ; e)reisa/menos, ‘planting himself firmly,’ Il. 12.457; of wrestlers, Il. 23.735.
e)rei/kw, aor. 2 h)/rike, pass. pres. part. e)reiko/menos: act. (aor. 2), intr., broke, Il. 17.295; pass., e)reiko/menos peri\ douri/, transfixed, Il. 13.441. (Il.)
e)/reio: see e)/romai.
e)rei/omen: see e)re/w.

e)rei/pw, ipf. e)/reipe, aor. 2 h)/ripe, e)/ripe, subj. e)ri/ph|si, part. -w/n, -ou=sa, pass. plup. e)re/ripto: act. (exc. aor. 2), throw down, overthrow; tei=xos, e)pa/lceis, *m 258, Il. 15.356, 361; pass., Il. 14.15; intr., aor. 2, fall down, tumble, Il. 5.47, 75, Od. 22.296; e)/sth gnu\c e)ripw/n, held himself up, ‘sinking on his knee,’ Il. 5.309.
*)eremboi/: a fabulous people, Od. 4.84†.
e)remno/s = e)rebenno/s. e)remnh\ gai=a =*)/erebos, Od. 24.106.
e)/reca: see r(e/zw.
e)re/omai: see e)re/w.
e)re/ptomai, only part. e)repto/menoi: bite off, crop, usually of animals, Il. 2.776, Il. 21.204, Od. 19.553; of men ‘plucking’ and eating of the lotus, Od. 9.97.
e)re/ripto: see e)rei/pw.
e)re/ssw: row, Il. 9.361, Od. 9.490.
e)re/ths: pl., rowers, oarsmen, Il. 1.142.
*)eretmeu/s (‘Oarman’): a Phaeacian, Od. 8.112.
e)retmo/n: oar. (Od. and Il. 1.435.) (The cut, from an antique vase, represents a different way of working the oars from that of the Homeric age; see cut No 120.)

e)reu/gomai, aor. 2 h)/ruge: belch, belch forth, intr., Od. 9.374; trans., Il. 16.162; of the sea, partly with reference to sound, bellow, Il. 17.265, Il. 5.403, 438; and aor. 2 of animals, Il. 20.403, 404, 406.
*)ereuqali/wn: a noble Arcadian, slain by Nestor in a war of the Pylians with the Arcadians, Il. 7.136.
e)reu/qw, aor. inf. e)reu=sai: redden, dye with blood, Il. 11.394, Il. 18.329. (Il.)
e)reuna/w: track, trace, scent out or seek, Od. 22.180.
e)re/fw, aor. e)/reya: roof over, Il. 24.450, Od. 23.193; specific for generic, ‘built,’ Il. 1.39.
*)erexqeu/s: Erechtheus, a national hero of the Athenians, Il. 2.547, Od. 7.81.
e)re/xqw (cf. e)rei/kw): rack; metaph., qu=mo/n, Od. 5.83; pass., of a ship, be buffetted about, a)ne/moisi, Il. 23.317.
e)re/w = e)rw=, see ei)/r Od. 24.1.
e)re/w, part. e)re/wn, subj. e)rei/omen, opt. e)re/oimen, mid. e)re/omai, ipf. e)re/onto, subj. e)re/wmai, inf. e)re/esqai: ask, tina/, and abs.; e)/k (adv.) t' e)re/onto, ‘made inquiry,’ Il. 9.671.
e)rh=mos (Att. e)/rhmos): deserted, desolate, Il. 5.140.
e)rhre/datai: see e)rei/dw.

e)rhtu+/w (e)ru/w), aor. iter. e)rhtu=/saske, opt. e)rhtu=/seie, pass. aor. 3 pl. e)rh/tu=qen: hold back, restrain, control; fa/laggas, la=o/n, *l 567, Il. 18.503; pass. Il. 2.99, 211; met., qu=mo/n, Il. 1.192, pass., Il. 9.635; mid. as dep., Il. 15.723, elsewhere subjective and not easily distinguished from the pass., Il. 9.462.
e)ri-: intensive prefix, like a)ri-.
e)ri-au/xhn, enos: with high-arching neck, epith. of steeds, Il. 11.159, Il. 10.305. (Il.)
e)ri - breme/ths, ew (bre/mw): loudthundering, Il. 13.624†.
e)ri-bw=lac, akos, and e)ri/bwlos: with large clods, i. e. with rich soil, fertile, epith. of lands. (Il. and Od. 13.235, Od. 5.34.)

e)ri/ - gdoupos and e)ri/doupos (gdou=pos): loud - thundering, resounding; epith. of Zeus, also of the seashore, the feet of horses, and the portico of a palace, Il. 5.672, Il. 20.50, Il. 11.152, Il. 24.323.

e)ridai/nw (e)/ris), mid. aor. 1 inf. e)ri=dh/sasqai: contend, dispute, strive, vie with; tini/, a)nti/a tino/s, Od. 1.79; e(/neka, peri/ tinos, b 206, Od. 18.403; abs., possi/n, ‘in running,’ Il. 23.792; fig., of winds, Il. 16.765.
e)ridmai/nw (e)/ris): irritate, stir up, Il. 16.260†.
e)ri/doupos: see e)ri/gdoupos.
e)ri/zw, ipf. iter. e)ri/zeskon, aor. subj. e)ri/swsin, opt. e)ri/seie, -an, mid. aor. subj. e)ri/ssetai: = e)ridai/nw, q 225, Il. 5.172.
e)ri/ - hros (root a)r), pl. e)ri/hres: trusty, faithful; epith. of e(tai=roi (sing., Il. 4.266), Il. 3.47, Od. 9.100; of a)oido/s, a 346, Od. 8.62, 471.
e)ri - qhlh/s, e/s (qa/llw): blooming, luxuriant, Il. 5.90. (Il.)
e)/ri=qos: pl., reapers, Il. 18.550, 560.
e)ri-ku=dh/s, e/s (ku=dos): glorious, famous; epith. of gods, also of things, dw=ra qew=n, h(/bh, dai/s, Il. 3.65, *l 225, Od. 3.66.
e)ri/-mu=kos (mu=ka/omai): loud-bellowing, epith. of cattle, Od. 15.235.
e)ri=neo/s: wild fig-tree, Od. 12.103; in the Iliad a particular tree near the sources of the Scamander, Il. 6.433.
e)ri=no/n = e)ri=neo/s, the reading of Aristarchus in Od. 5.281†.
*)eri=nu/s, u/os, acc. pl., *)eri=nu=s, -u/as: the Erinnys, pl., the Erinnyes (Furiae), goddesses who fulfil curses and avenge crimes, Il. 9.571. (See cut.)
e)/rion, ei)/rion: wool, Od. 4.124, Il. 12.434, pl., Il. 3.388, etc.
e)ri-ou/nhs and e)riou/nios (o)ni/nhmi): helpful, the Helper, epith. of Hermes; subst., Il. 24.440.

e)/ris, acc. e)/rida and e)/rin: strife, contention, rivalry, Il. 1.8, Il. 7.210 ; e)/rida profe/rousai, ‘putting forth rivalry,’ ‘vying with one another’ in speed, Od. 6.92 ; e)/rida/ tini profe/resqai a)e/qlwn, ‘challenge one to a contest for prizes,’ Od. 8.210 ; e)c e)/ridos, ‘in rivalry,’ Il. 8.111, Od. 4.343.—Personified, *)/eris, Discord, Il. 11.73 . *)/eri=s, Il. 4.440.
e)ri - sqenh/s, e/os (sqe/nos): most mighty, all - powerful, epith. of Zeus, Il. 19.355, Od. 8.289.
e)/risma (e)ri/zw): matter or cause of strife, Il. 4.38†.
e)ri - sta/fulos (stafulh/): largeclustered, oi)=nos, Od. 9.111, 358.
e)ri/ - ti=mos (ti=mh/): highly - prized, precious, Il. 2.447. (Il.)
e)/rifos: kid, pl., Od. 9.220.
*)erifu=/lh: Eriph&ymacr;le, the wife of Amphiarāus, Od. 11.326†.
*)erixqo/nios: son of Dardanus, and father of Tros, Il. 20.219, 230.
*)eriw=pis: wife of Oïleus, Il. 13.697.
e(rkei=os (e(/rkos): of the enclosure, of the court (au)lh/), epith. of Zeus as household god, having his altar in the court, Od. 22.355†. (See plate III., at end of volume.)

e(/rkos, eos (ve/rgw): hedge, wall, then the enclosure itself, i. e. the court, Il. 24.306, pl., Od. 8.57, etc.; bulwark, defence against, a)ko/ntwn, bele/wn, *d 137, Il. 5.316; said of persons, e(/rkos pole/moio, e(/rkos *)axaiw=n, *a 284, Il. 3.229 (cf. pu/rgos); e(/rkos o)do/ntwn (the ‘fence of the teeth’), used in connections where we should always say ‘lips.’

e(/rma (1) (ei)/r Od. 24.2, root ser): only pl., e(/rmata, pendants, ear - rings, probably strings of beads. (See cuts, the one on the left an Athenian tetradrachm, that on the right a Sicilian decadrachm.)

e(/rma (2), atos: prop; pl., of the supports placed under ships when drawn up on shore, Il. 1.486; met., of persons, e(/rma po/lhos, ‘prop and stay,’ ‘pillar’ of the state, Il. 16.549; of an arrow, melaine/wn e(/rm) o)duna=/wn, ‘bearer of black pains,’ by some referred to e(/rma 1, Il. 4.117.
*(/ermaios: of Hermes, lo/fos, a hill in the island of Ithaca, a spur of Mt. Neion, Od. 16.471†.

*(ermh=s, *(ermei/a=s, gen. *(ermai/a=o and *(ermei/w, dat. *(ermh=| and *(erme/a=|, acc. *(ermh=n and *(ermei/a=n, voc. *(ermei/a=: Hermes (Mercurius), son of Zeus and Maia, Od. 14.435; messenger of the gods, guide of mortals (of Priam, Il. 24.457), and conductor of the shades of the dead; his winged sandals and magic wand, Od. 5.44 ff. Epithets, a)ka/khta, e)riou/nios, e)u/skopos, sw=kos, xru=so/rrapis, dia/ktoros, *)argei+fo/nths.
*(ermio/nh: Hermione.—(1) the daughter of Menelāus and Helen, Od. 4.14.—(2) name of a city in Argolis, Il. 2.560.
e)rmi=/s, i=nos (e(/rm Od. 1.2): pl., bed-posts, Od. 8.278 and Od. 23.198.
*(/ermos: a river in Phrygia and Mysia, Il. 20.392.
e)/rnos, eos: shoot, scion, young tree, Il. 17.53 ; e)/rnei+ vi=sos, of young persons, Il. 18.56, Od. 14.175, cf. Od. 6.163.
e)/rcw: see e)/rdw.
e)/romai, assumed pres. for aor. subj. e)rw/meqa, opt. e)/roito, imp. e)rei=o, inf. e)re/sqai: ask, Od. 1.135, Od. 3.243.
e)/ros: see e)/rws.
e(rpeto/n (e(/rpw): creeping thing; o(/ss' e)pi\ gai=an e(rpeta\ gi/gnontai, i. e. all the ‘creatures that move’ upon the earth, Od. 4.418†. Cf. the 2d example under e(/rpw.
e(rpu/zw: parallel form of e(/rpw. e(rpu/zwn, ‘dragging himself,’ the effect of grief or of old age, Il. 23.225, Od. 13.220, Od. 1.193.

e(/rpw (cf. serpo), ipf. ei(=rpon, e(/rpe: creep, crawl; r(i=noi/, a prodigy, Od. 12.395; specific for generic, o(/ssa te gai=an e)/pi pnei/ei te kai\ e(/rpei, ‘breathes and crawls,’ i. e. lives and moves, Il. 17.448, Od. 18.131 ; h(/menos h)\ e(/rpwn, an alliterative saying, ‘sitting or stirring,’ intended to suit any possible attitude or condition, Od. 17.158.
e)rra/datai: see r(ai/nw.
e)/rri=ga: see r(i=ge/w.

e)/rrw (ve/rrw): go with pain or difficulty, Od. 4.367; of the lame Hephaestus, Il. 18.421; esp. imp. as imprecation, e)/rre, e)/rrete, begone! Il. 8.164, Od. 10.72, 75, Il. 24.239; e)rre/tw, ‘off with him!’ Od. 5.139; ‘let him go to Perdition!’ Il. 9.377; similarly the part., e)nqa/de ve/rrwn, ‘coming hither, to my ruin,’ Il. 8.239, Il. 9.364.
e(/rsh, e)e/rsh (e)ve/rsh): pl., dewdrops, Il. 11.53 (in a prodigy); of newborn lambs, Od. 9.222.
e(rsh/eis, essa, e)ersh/eis (ve/rsh): dewy, fresh, Il. 14.348, Il. 24.419, 757.
e)ru/gmhlos (e)rugei=n): bellowing, Il. 18.580†.
e)rugw/n: see e)reu/gomai.
e)ruqai/nomai (e)ruqro/s): only ipf., was reddened, Il. 10.484, Il. 21.21. (Il.)
*)eruqi=noi: a place in Paphlagonia, Il. 2.855.
*)eru/qrai: Erythrae, in Boeotia, Il. 2.499.
e)ruqro/s: red, ruddy; oi)=nos, ne/ktar, xalko/s, Od. 9.163, *t 38, Il. 9.365.
e)ru=kake/ein, e)ru=/kakon: see e)ru=/kw.
e)ru=kana/w, e)ru=ka/nw: parallel forms of e)ru=/kw, a 199, Od. 10.429 (v. l. e)ru=/kake).

e)ru=/kw, ipf. e)/ru=ke, fut. e)ru=/cw, aor. 1 e)/ru=ca, aor. 2 h)ru=/kake, e)ru=/kake: hold back, restrain, detain, tina/ tinos, and abs.; kai/ ke/n min trei=s mh=nas a)po/proqen oi)=kos e)ru=/koi, ‘keep him at a distance,’ Od. 17.408; met., me/nos, Il. 8.178; qu=mo/n, Il. 11.105; e(/teros de/ me qu=mo\s e)/ru=ken, Od. 9.302; mid., tarry, Il. 23.443, Od. 17.17; like act., Il. 12.285.
*)eru/la=os: a Trojan, slain by Patroclus, Il. 16.411†.
e)/ruma (e)ru/omai): a protection; xroo/s, Il. 4.137†.
*)eru/manqos: Erymanthus, a mountain in Arcadia, Od. 6.103†.
*)eru/ma=s: (1) a Trojan, slain by Idomeneus, Il. 16.435.—(2) a Lycian, slain by Patroclus, Il. 16.415.

e)ru/omai, ei)ru/omai (ver.), ipf. e)ru=/eto, fut. 3 sing. e)ru/ssetai, 3 pl. ei)ru/ssontai, aor. 2 sing. ei)ru/sao, 3 sing. ei)ru/sato, e)ru/ssato, e)ru=/sato, opt. ei)ru/ssaito, e)ru/saito, 2 pl. ei)ru/ssaisqe, inf. ei)ru/ssasqai, also from ei)/rumai, e)/rumai, 3 pl. ei)ru/atai, inf. e)/rusqai, ei)/rusqai, ipf. 2 sing. e)/ru=so, 3 sing. e)/ru=to, ei)/ru=to, 3 pl. ei)/runto, ei)ru/ato: shield, protect, preserve; o(/sson t' h)e\ du/w h)e\ trei=s a)/ndras e)/rusqai, enough leaves to ‘cover’ two or three men, Od. 5.484; (boulh/) h(/ ti/s ken e)ru/ssetai h)de\ saw/sei | *)argei/ous kai\ nh=as, Il. 10.44; e)/pos ei)ru/ssasqai, ‘observe’ the command, Il. 1.22 ; ou) su/ ge boula=\s | ei)ru/sao *kroni/wnos, Il. 21.230; fresi\n ei)ru/ssaito, ‘keep’ the secret, Od. 16.459 ; pa\r nhi/ te me/nein kai\ nh=a ve/rusqai, ‘watch’ the ship, Od. 10.444; so ‘watch for,’ ‘lie in wait for,’ Od. 16.463, Od. 23.82; from the sense of protecting comes that of ‘warding off,’ ‘defending against,’ h(/ d) (a)spi/s) ou)k e)/gxos e)/ru=to, Il. 5.538, Il. 4.186, Il. 2.859; xo/lon, ‘keep down,’ Il. 24.584.
e)rus - a/rmates (e)ru/w, a(/rma), pl.: chariot-drawing, steeds, Il. 15.354. (Il.)
e)rusi/-ptolis (e)ru/w): city-rescuing, city - protecting, epith. of Athēna, Il. 6.305†.

e)ru/w (veru/w), fut. e)ru/ousi, aor. ei)/ru(s)se, e)/ruse, mid. ei)ruo/mesqa, inf. e)ru/esqai (or fut.), fut. 2 sing. e)ru/sseai, inf. e)ru/ssesqai and e)ru/esqai, aor. ei)rusa/mhn, -u/(s)sato, perf. 3 pl. ei)ru/atai, part. ei)ru=me/nai, plup. ei)/ruto, 3 pl. ei)/runto and ei)ru/ato: draw, drag, mid., draw for oneself or to oneself, rescue, esp. the fallen in battle, ne/kun, nekro/n; act., of drawing an arrow from the wound, Il. 5.110; a mantle down over the head, Od. 8.85; drawing the bow, Il. 15.464; ships into the sea, Il. 1.141; pulling flesh off the bones, Od. 14.134; battlements from a wall, Il. 12.258; pass., Il. 4.248, Il. 14.75, Od. 6.265; mid., of drawing one's sword or dagger, Il. 3.271; one's ships into the sea, Il. 14.79; drawing off meat from the spits (to eat it yourself), Il. 1.466, and other subjective actions; draw to oneself, rescue, Il. 5.456, Il. 17.161, Il. 14.422, Il. 18.152.
e)/rxatai, e)/rxato: see e)/rgw.
e)rxata/w (ve/rgw): only ipf. pass., e)rxato/wnto, were penned up, Od. 14.15†.
e)rxqei/s: see e)/rgw.

e)/rxomai, fut. e)leu/somai, aor. h)=lqon and h)/luqon, perf. ei)lh/louqa, ei)lh/louqmen, part. ei)lhlouqw/s and e)lhluqw/s, plup. ei)lhlou/qei: come, go; the word needs no special illustration, as there is nothing peculiar in its numerous applications. The part. e)lqw/n is often employed for amplification, ou) du/namai.. ma/xesqai | e)lqw\n dusmene/essin, ‘to go and fight,’ Il. 16.521.
e)/rw|: see e)/rws.
e)rw|dio/s: heron, Il. 10.274†.

e)rwe/w (e)rwh/), fut. e)rwh/sei, aor. h)rw/hsa: (1) flow, Il. 1.303, Od. 16.441.—(2) recede, fall away; (ne/fos) ou)/ pot' e)rwei=, Od. 12.75; mhde/ t) e)rw/ei, ‘rest not,’ Il. 2.179 ; ai(\ d) (the horses) h)rw/hsan <*>pi/ssw, ‘fell back,’ Il. 23.433; w. gen., pole/moio, xa/rmhs, *n 776, Il. 14.101; once trans., tw=| ke kai\ e)ssu/meno/n per e)rwh/sait' a)po\ nhw=n, ‘drive him away,’ Il. 13.57.

e)rwh/ (cf. r(e/w, r(w/omai): (1) rush,
sweep, force in motion, Il. 3.62 ; o(/son t' e)pi\ douro\s e)rwh\ | gi/gnetai, a spear's ‘throw,’ Il. 15.358, Il. 23.529.—(2) cessation; pole/mou, *p 302, Il. 17.761.
e)/rws, e)/ros, dat. e)/rw|, acc. e)/ron: love; qea=s, gunaiko/s, ‘for’ a goddess, a woman, Il. 14.315; fig., of things, go/ou, Il. 24.227; often po/sios kai\ e)dhtu/os, ‘appetite,’ see i(/hmi.
e)rwta/w: see ei)rwta/w.
e)s-: for words compounded with e)s, see under ei)s-.
e)sa=lto: see ei)sa/llomai.
e)/sbh: see sbe/nnu=mi.
e)sdu=/seai: see ei)sdu=/nw.
e)se/drakon: see ei)sde/rkomai.
e)seleu/somai: see ei)se/rxomai.
e)sema/ssato: see ei)smai/omai.
e)se/xunto: see ei)sxe/w.
e)sh/lato: see ei)sa/llomai.
e(/sqhn: see e(/nnu=mi.
e)sqh/s, h=tos (vesq.): clothing, clothes, Od. 1.165, Od. 6.74; ‘bedding,’ Od. 23.290. (Od.)

e)sqi/w, e)/sqw, inf. e)sqe/menai, ipf. h)/sqion, h)=sqe, aor. e)/fagon, inf. fage/men, fage/ein, for fut. and perf., see e)/dw: eat, said of both men and animals; fig., ‘consume,’ ‘devour,’ Od. 2.75 ; pu=r, Il. 23.182; pass., oi)=kos, Od. 4.318.
e)sqlo/s: a poetic synonym of a)gaqo/s, q. v.; examples are numerous in every application of the meaning good, opp. kako/s, a)/llote me/n te kakw=| o(/ ge ku=/retai, a)/llote d' e)sqlw=|, Il. 24.530.
e)/sqos, e/os (ve/sqos): garment, Il. 24.94†.
e)/sqw: see e)sqi/w.
e)sidei=n: see ei)sei=don.
e)si=e/menai: see ei)si/hmi.
e)/skon: see ei)mi/.
e)so/yomai: see ei)sora/w.
e(spe/rios (ve/speros): in the evening, Il. 21.560, Od. 9.336; of the West, Od. 8.29.
e(/speros (ve/sp., cf. vesper): of or at evening; a)sth/r, ‘evening star,’ Il. 22.318; usually subst., evening, Od. 1.422 f.; pl., e(/spera, the evening hours, Od. 17.191.
e)/spete, defective imp.: relate, only in the formula e)/spete nu=n moi *mou=sai, Il. 2.484, Il. 11.218, *c 508, Il. 16.112.
e(spo/mhn: see e(/pw.
e(/ssa, e(/ssai, e(ssa/menos: see e(/nnu=mi.
e)ssei=tai, e)ssi/: see ei)mi/.
e)sseu/onto: see seu/w.
e)/sso: see ei)mi/.
e(/sso: see e(/nnu=mi.
e)/ssumai, e)ssu/menos: see seu/w.
e)ssume/nws (seu/w): hastily.
e(sta/men(ai), e(/stamen, e)/stan, e(/stasan, e)/stasan, e(stew/s, -aw/s, e(/sthka, e(sth/kein: see i(/sthmi.
e(/stwr, oros: bolt at the end of the pole of a chariot, yoke - pin, Il. 24.272†. (See cut; cf. also No. 46.)
e)/sx) = e)/ske in Od. 2.346, see ei)mi/.—For e)/sxe, see e)/xw.

e)sxa/rh, gen. and dat. e)sxaro/fin: hearth, fire - place; puro/s, of watchfires, Il. 10.418. (According to some, ‘portable’ hearths are to be understood in certain passages, e. g., Od. 5.59, Od. 6.305, Od. 20.123. Portable fire-basins were doubtless common in the time of Homer as now in the Orient. See cut No. 83; cf. also the Pompeian warming-pan and water-warmer represented in the adjoining cut.)
e)sxatih/ (e)/sxatos): border, edge, remotest part; lime/nos, nh/sou, Od. 2.391, Od. 5.238; *fqi=/hs, pole/moio, *i 484, Il. 11.524; without gen., e)sxatih=|, at the remotest estate, Od. 14.104.

e)/sxatos (e)c): furthest, remotest, extremest, last, only of place; of the Aethiopians, e)/sxatoi a)ndrw=n, Od. 1.23, cf. 24; e)/sxatoi a)/llwn, ‘outside of the others,’ Il. 10.434; neut. pl. as adv., e)/sxata, at the outside, at the ends, Il. 8.225, Il. 11.8.
e)sxato/wn, -o/wsa, defective part.: at the border, at the end; dhi/wn e)sxato/wn, ‘a straggler,’ Il. 10.206; of ‘frontier’ towns, Il. 2.508, 616.
e)/sxeqon, e)/sxon, e)/sxeto: see e)/xw.
e)/sw: see ei)/sw.
e(tai/rh, e(ta/rh: companion, attendant, Il. 4.441; usually fig., Il. 9.2, Od. 17.271.
e(tairi/zw, e(tari/zw; aor. inf. e(tairi/ssai, mid. aor. opt. e(tari/ssaito: act., be companion to, attend, Il. 24.335; mid., causative, take as one's companion, Il. 13.456. (Il.)
e(tai=ros, e(/taros: companion, comrade; fig., of a wind, e)sqlo\s e(tai=ros, Od. 11.7, cf. e(tai/rh; as adj., w. a)nh/r, la=oi/, *r 466, Il. 13.710.
e)teqh/pea: see qap-.
*)eteoklh/eios: of Eteocles (the son of Oedipus, king of Thebes); bi/h *)eteoklhei/h, periphrasis for the name of the man (see bi/h), Il. 4.386.
*)eteo/krhtes (e)teo/s, *krh/s): true (primitive) Cretans, Od. 19.176†.

e)teo/s: true, real; neikei=n po/ll' e)tea/ te kai\ ou)xi/, ‘reproaches true and untrue,’ Il. 20.255; elsewhere only e)teo/n, the truth or truly; ei) dh/ r() e)teo/n ge kai\ a)treke/ws a)goreu/eis, Il. 15.53, and freq. ei) e)teo/n ge (sc. e)sti/), Il. 14.125, Od. 3.122.

e(ter-alkh/s, e/s (e(/teros, a)lkh/): ni=/kh, lending strength to the other party, i. e. to the party previously inferior, Il. 7.26, Il. 8.171, Il. 16.362; in more general sense, decisive, Od. 22.236 ; dh=mos, able to change the fortune of the fight, Il. 15.738.
e(ter-h/meros (h(me/rh): on alternate days, pl., Il. 11.303†.

e(/teros: the other or one of two (alter); pl., e(/teroi, one or the other party, Il. 20.210 ; e(/tera a(/rmata, chariot ‘of the other party,’ Il. 4.306; freq. e(/teros me\n.. e(/teros de/, also w. article, or replaced in one member by a)/llos, Il. 14.272, Il. 21.164, Il. 9.913; e(te/rh| xeiri, or simply e(te/rh| or e(te/rhfi, Il. 16.734; with reference to more than two, like a)/llos, Il. 21.437, h 124, Od. 17.266.
e)te/rseto: see tersai/nw.
e(te/rwqen: from or on the other side.
e(te/rwqi: on the other side, elsewhere.
e(te/rws: otherwise, Od. 1.234†.
e(te/rwse: in the other direction, Il. 4.492, Od. 19.470; to one side, Il. 8.306, 308; in another direction, away, Il. 23.231, Od. 16.179.
e)te/talto: see te/llw.
e)teteu/xato: see teu/xw.
e)/tetmon, defective aor., 3 sing. e)/tetme, te/tme, subj. 2 sing. te/tmh|s: find, reach, Il. 6.374, Od. 15.15; fig., o(\n gh=ras e)/tetmen, Od. 1.218.
e)te/tukto: see teu/xw.
*)etewneu/s: son of Boethous, a companion - at - arms of Menelāus, Od. 4.22. (Od.)
*)etewno/s: a town in Boeotia, Il. 2.497†.
e)/ths (ve/ths), pl. e)/tai: friends, retainers, distinguished from near relatives, Od. 4.3, Il. 6.239, Il. 9.464.
e)th/tumos (cf. e)/tumos, e)teo/s): true, truthful, real; a)/ggelos, no/stos, mu=qos, Il. 22.438, g 241, Od. 23.62; freq. neut. as adv., e)th/tumon, actually, really, Il. 1.558, Il. 18.128.

e)/ti: still, yet.—I. temporal, pa/lai h)d' e)/ti kai\ nu=n, still to this day, Il. 9.105; often w. neg., ou)d' a)/r) e)/ti dvh\n | h)=n, he lived ‘not much longer,’ ‘not long thereafter,’ Il. 6.139; and idiomatically, ou) ga\r e)/ti *troi/hn ai(rh/somen, we shall not take Troy ‘any more,’ i. e. we can no longer hope to take the city, Il. 2.141. —II. denoting addition, a)/llos, e(/teros e)/ti, yet another, Il. 7.364, Od. 14.325 ; e)/ti ma=llon, ma=llon e)/ti, Od. 1.322.
e)/tlhn: see tlh=nai.
e(toima/zw, aor. imp. e(toimasa/tw, -a/sate, mid. aor. e(toima/santo: make ready, prepare, Il. 1.118, Od. 13.184.
e(toi=mos: ready, at hand; mh=tis, ‘feasible,’ Il. 9.425; ‘actual,’ ‘actually,’ Il. 14.53, Od. 8.384 ; po/tmos, ‘certain,’ Il. 18.96.
e)/toron: see tore/w.
e)/tos, eos (ve/tos, cf. vetus): year. See e)niauto/s.
e)/trapon: see tre/pw.
e)tra/fhn, e)/trafon: see tre/fw.
e)/tumos, pl. e)/tuma, and e)/tumon = e)th/tumos, e)th/tumon, Od. 19.203, 567, Od. 23.26.
e)/twsios (vet.): fruitless, vain; e)/gxos, be/lea, dw=ra, a)/xqos, Il. 3.368, *w 283, Il. 18.104.

eu)=, e)u/ (neut. of e)u/s): well, answering in meaning as adv. to the adjectives a)gaqo/s and ka=lo/s; hence ‘rightly,’ ‘finely,’ ‘carefully,’ etc., esp. ‘happily,’ ‘prosperously,’ eu)= zw/ein, eu)= oi)/kad' i(ke/sqai, Od. 17.423, Il. 1.19, Od. 3.188, 190; eu)= e)/rdein tina/, i. e. a)gaqa\ e)/rdein, Il. 5.650; used to strengthen other words, eu)=
ma/la, eu)= pa/ntes, ‘quite all,’ Od. 10.452, Od. 18.260.
eu(=: see ou(=.
eu) - agge/lion: reward for good tidings, Od. 14.152, 166.
eu)/ade: see a(nda/nw.
*eu)aimoni/dhs: son of Euaemon, Eurypylus, Il. 5.76, Il. 7.167. (Il.)
*eu)ai/mwn: son of Ormenus, and father of Eurypylus, Il. 2.736, Il. 5.79.
eu) - anqh/s, e/s (a)/nqos): luxuriant, abundant, Od. 11.320†.
*eu)a/nqhs: the father of Maron, Od. 9.197†.
*eu)/boia: Euboea, the island separated from Boeotia by the Eurīpus, named by Homer as the home of the Abantes, Il. 2.536, Od. 3.174, Od. 7.321.
eu)/-botos (bo/skw): with fine cattle, Od. 15.406†.
eu)=gma, atos (eu)/xomai): boast, pl., Od. 22.249†.
eu)/-gnamptos, e)u/g. (gna/mptw): gracefully bent, Od. 18.294†.
eu)-dei/elos: (if from dei/lh) westering, sunny; (if from de/elos, dh=los) clearly or far seen; epith. of islands, esp. Ithaca, Od. 2.167. (Od.)
eu)-diki/h (di/kh): fair justice, pl., Od. 19.111†.
eu)/-dmhtos, e)u/d. (de/mw): well-built.
eu(/dw, ipf. eu(=don, iter. eu(/deske: sleep, lie down to sleep, Od. 2.397; fig., of death, Il. 14.482; of the wind, Il. 5.524.
*eu)/dwros: son of Hermes and Polymēle, a leader of the Myrmidons, Il. 16.186, 179.
eu) - eidh/s, e/s (vei=dos): beautiful, Il. 3.48†.
eu) - ergesi/h (ve/rgon): well - doing, kindness, Od. 22.235, 374†.
eu)-ergh/s, e/s: well-made, well-wrought; pl., eu)erge/a, good deeds, benefactions, Od. 22.319.
eu)-ergo/s: doing right, good, Od. 11.434. (Od.)
eu)/-zugos, e)u/z. (zugo/n): well - yoked, of a ship, i. e. ‘well - beamed,’ or according to others, ‘well - benched,’ Od. 13.116, Od. 17.288.
e)u/-zwnos, oio, ous (zw/nh): beautifully girdled, the girdle giving a graceful appearance to the garment, Il. 6.467, Il. 1.429. (Il.) (See cut No. 44.)
eu)-hgenh/s, e/s (= eu)genh/s): well or nobly born, Il. 11.427. (Il.)
eu)-hgesi/h (h(ge/omai): good government, Od. 19.114† (v. l. eu)ergesi/hs).
eu) - h/khs, es (a)kh/): well <*> pointed, sharp, Il. 22.319†.
*eu)hni=/nh: daughter of Evēnus, Marpessa, Il. 9.557†.
*eu)hnori/dhs: son of Evēnor, Leiocritus, Od. 2.242. (Od.)
*eu)hno/s: (1) son of Selepius, Il. 2.693. —(2) father of Marpessa,
eu)-h/nwr, oros (a)nh/r): manly or ‘inspiring manliness,’ xalko/s, oi)=nos, n 19, Od. 4.622. (Od.)
eu) - h/rhs, es (root a)r): well - fitted, handy, of oars, Od. 11.121. (Od.)
e)u/-qric, trixos: well - maned, ‘with flowing mane,’ Il. 23.13.
e)u/-qronos: well-throned, ‘with beautiful throne,’ *hw/s, Il. 8.565. (Od.)
eu)qu/s: see i=)qu/s.
eu)/ - qu=mos: well - disposed, kindly, Od. 14.63†.
*eu)/ippos: a Lycian, slain by Patroclus, Il. 16.417†.
eu)-kamph/s, e/s (ka/mptw): well-bent, curved, sickle, key, Od. 21.6. (Od.)
eu) - ke/atos (kea/zw): easily cleft or split, fissile, Od. 5.60†.
eu)/khlos (ve/khlos, e)vk.) = e(/khlos, *a 554, Od. 3.263.
eu)-kleh/s, e/s, eu)kleih/s (kle/os), acc. pl. eu)klei=as: glorious, renowned, Il. 10.281, Od. 21.331.—Adv., eu)klew=s, eu)kleiw=s, gloriously, Il. 22.110.
e)u-klei/h: good reputation, fame, Il. 8.285, Od. 14.402.
e)u-klh/i=s, i=dos (klhi/w): close - shutting, Il. 24.318†.
e)u-knh/mi=s, i=dos: well-greaved, epith. of *)axaioi/, and in the Od. also of e(tai=roi. (See cut under a)mfi/brotos.)
eu) - ko/smws: well arranged or disposed, Od. 21.123†.
e)u-kti/menos, u)/ktitos (kti/zw): wellbuilt, well-appointed, well-tilled, Il. 2.501, Il. 21.77, Od. 9.130, Od. 24.336.
eu)kto/s (eu)/xomai): prayed - for, wished - for; neut. pl., ‘occasion for triumph,’ Il. 14.98†.
eu)/ - kuklos: well-rounded, well-rimmed (Il.), well-wheeled, Od. 6.58.
eu) - lei/mwn: with fair meadows, abounding in meadows, Od. 4.607†.
eu)lh/ (cf. vei/lw): worm, maggot. (Il.)
eu)/lhra, pl.: reins, Il. 23.481.
*eu)/maios: Eumaeus, the faithful swine-herd of Odysseus, Od. 14.17 -190, Od. 22.267; son of Ctesius, king of the island of Syria; the story of his life, Od. 15.400 ff.
eu) - mene/ths = eu)menh/s, Od. 6.185 (opp. dusmenh/s, 184).
*eu)mh/dhs: father of Dolon, a Trojan herald, Il. 10.314, 412.
eu)/ - mhlos: abounding in sheep, Od. 15.406†.
*eu)/mhlos: Eumēlus, son of Admētus and Alcestis, Il. 23.288. (Il.)
e)u-mmeli/hs, gen. i/w (meli/h): good at the ashen lance, good at the spear, epith. of Priam and others. (Il. and Od. 3.400.)

eu)na/zw and eu)na/w (eu)nh/), fut. eu)na/sw, aor. eu)/nhse, mid. pres. inf. eu)na/zesqai, pass. aor. inf. eu)nhqh=nai: put in a place to lie, place in ambush, Od. 4.408, 440; mid. and pass., lie down to sleep or rest, Il. 3.441, Od. 20.1; fig., of winds, Od. 5.384.
eu)naieta/wn, -a/wsa: see naieta/w.
eu)naio/menos: see nai/w.

eu)nh/, gen. eu)nh=fi: (1) place to lie, bed, couch; said of an army, Il. 10.408; of the ‘lair’ of wild animals, Il. 11.115; esp. typical of love and marriage, filo/thti kai\ eu)nh=|, ou)k a)pofw/lioi eu)nai\ | a=)qana/twn, Od. 11.249.—(2) pl., eu)nai/, mooring-stones, which served as anchors, having cables (prumnh/sia) attached to them, and being cast into the water or upon the shore, Il. 1.436, 476.
eu)nh=qen: from his couch, Od. 20.124†.
*eu)/nhos: son of Jason, and king of Lemnos, Il. 7.468. (Il.)
eu)/-nnhtos (ne/w): well-woven, Il. 18.596.
eu)nh=fi(n): see eu)nh/.
eu)=nis, ios: reft, bereft, Il. 22.44, Od. 9.524.
eu)-nomi/h (no/mos): good order, obedience to laws, Od. 17.487†.
e)u/.-cestos and e)u/coos (ce/w), gen. eu)/cou: well-scraped, well-planed, polished; in act. sense, ske/parnon e)u/coon, Od. 5.237.
eu)/-ormos: affording good moorage or anchorage, Il. 21.23. (Od.)
eu) - pate/reia: daughter of a noble father, epith. of Helen and Tyro, Il. 6.292, Od. 11.235.
*eu)pei/qhs: father of the suitor Antinous, slain by Laertes, Od. 24.523.
eu)/-peplos: with beautiful mantle, beautifully robed, Il. 5.424, Od. 6.49.
eu)-phgh/s and e)u/phktos (ph/gnu=mi): well or firmly joined, well built, Od. 21.334 †, *b 661, Od. 23.41.
e)u/-pleios: well filled, Od. 17.467†.
e)u-plekh/s and e)u/-plektos (ple/kw): well plaited.
eu)-ploi/h (ple/w): prosperous voyage, Il. 9.362†.
e)u-ploka/mi=s, i=dos, and e)u-plo/kamos (plo/kamos): with beautiful tresses, fair-tressed, epithet of goddesses and of women, Od. 5.125, Od. 2.119. (See cut.)
e)u-plunh/s, e/s (plu=/nw): well-washed. (Od.)
eu)-poi/htos: well-made, well-wrought.
eu)/-prhstos (prh/qw): well or strongly burning or blowing, Il. 18.471†.
eu)/ - prumnos (prumnh/): of ships, with well - built or decorated sterns, Il. 4.248†.
eu)/-purgos: well towered or walled, Il. 7.71†.
eu)/ - pwlos (pw=los): abounding in horses, with fine horses, epith. of Ilium, Il. 5.551, Od. 2.18.
eu)ra/c (eu)=ros): on one side, sidewise, Il. 11.251, Il. 15.541.
e)u-rrafh/s, e/s (r(a/ptw): well-sewed, Od. 2.354, 380.
e)u-rreh/s, gen. e)urrei=os, e)u-rrei/ths, a=o: fair-flowing, epith. of rivers.

eu(ri/skw, aor. 2 eu(=ron, mid. pres. imp. eu(/reo, aor. ind. eu(/reto: find, find
out, discover, mid., for oneself; of ‘thinking up’ a name for a child, Od. 19.403; ‘bringing (trouble) on oneself,’ Od. 21.304.
e)u/-rroos = e)urreh/s, e)urrei/ths.
*eu)=ros: Eurus, the south-east wind, stormy, Il. 2.145, Il. 16.765; but warm enough to melt the snow, Od. 19.206.
eu)=ros, eos (eu)ru/s): breadth, width, Od. 11.312†.
eu)ru-a/guia: wide - streeted, epith. of cities.
*eu)rua/dhs: a suitor of Penelope, slain by Telemachus, Od. 22.267†.
*eu)ru/alos: Euryalus.—(1) an Argive, son of Mecisteus, Il. 6.20, Il. 23.677.— (2) a Phaeacian, Od. 8.115, 396.
*eu)ruba/ths: Eurybates.—(1) a herald of Agamemnon, Il. 1.320.—(2) a herald of Odysseus, Il. 2.184, Od. 19.247.
*eu)ruda/ma=s: Eurydamas.—(1) a Trojan, the father of Abas and Polyīdus, Il. 5.149.—(2) a suitor of Penelope, slain by Odysseus, Od. 22.283.
*eu)rudi/kh: Eurydice, the wife of Nestor, Od. 3.452.
*eu)ru/kleia: Euryclēa, the nurse of Odysseus, and faithful housekeeper in his palace, Od. 19.357, Od. 2.361.
eu)ru-krei/wn: wide-ruling, epith. of Poseidon and of Agamemnon, Il. 11.751, Il. 1.102.
*eu)ru/loxos: a cousin and companion of Odysseus, Od. 10.232, Od. 11.23, Od. 12.195 339. (Od.)
*eu)ru/maxos: son of Polybus, a suitor of Penelope, slain by Odysseus, Od. 1.399, Od. 22.82. (Od.)
*eu)rume/dousa: an attendant of queen Arēte, Od. 7.8†.
*eu)rume/dwn: Eurymedon.—(1) son of Ptolemaeus, and charioteer of Agamemnon, Il. 4.228.—(2) a servant of Nestor, Il. 8.114, Il. 11.620.—(3) king of the Giants, father of Periboea, Od. 7.58.
eu)ru-me/twpos: broad-browed.
*eu)rumi/dhs: son of Eurymus, Telemus, a seer among the Cyclōpes, Od. 9.509†.
*eu)runo/mh: Eurynome.—(1) an Oceanid, Il. 18.398†.—(2) stewardess of Penelope, Od. 17.495, Od. 19.97.
*eu)ru/nomos: an Ithacan, the son of Aegyptius, Od. 2.22. (Od.)
eu)ru=/nw (eu)ru/s), aor. 1 eu)/ru=na: widen, enlarge, Od. 8.260†.
eu)ru-o/deia (o(do/s): wide - wayed, i. e. ‘wide-wandered,’ epith. of the earth as field of human travel, always xqono\s eu)ruodei/hs.
eu)ru/-opa, nom., acc., and voc.: (if from o)/y) wide (far) thundering; (if from w)/y) wide (far) seeing, Il. 5.265, Il. 16.241, Il. 1.498.
eu)ru/-poros (po/ros): wide-traversed, epith. of the sea (cf. eu)ruo/deia), always qala/sshs eu)rupo/roio. (Od.)
eu)ru-pulh/s, es (pu/lh): wide - gated, eu)rupule\s *)/aidos dw=.

*eu)ru/pulos: Eurypylus.—(1) son of Euaemon, from Thessaly, Il. 2.736, Il. 5.76, Il. 6.36, Il. 11.580, 809.—(2) son of Poseidon and Astypalaea, from the island of Cos, Il. 2.677.—(3) son of Telephus, slain by Neoptolemus, Od. 11.520.
eu)ru-re/eqros and eu)rure/wn; broadflowing, Il. 21.141 †, Il. 2.849. (Il.)
eu)ru/s, ei=a, u/, gen. -e/os, -ei/hs, acc. eu)re/a and eu)ru/n: broad, wide; comp., eu)ru/teros, *g 194, Il. 23.427; adv., eu)ru\ r(e/ein, Il. 5.545.
eu)ru - sqenh/s, e/s (sqe/nos): widely powerful, with far - reaching might, epith. of Poseidon, Od. 13.140. (Il.)

*eu)rusqeu/s: Eurystheus, son of Sthenelus, and king of Mycēnae; by a trick of Hera upon Zeus, Eurystheus was born to power over Heracles, and imposed upon him the celebrated labors, Il. 19.103 ff., 123 ff., Od. 8.363, Od. 11.620.
*eu)ruti/dhs: son of Eurytus, Iphitus, guest - friend of Odysseus, Od. 21.14, 37. (Od.)
*eu)ruti/wn: a Centaur, Od. 21.295†.

*eu)/rutos (eu)=, e)ru/w, ‘Drawer of the Bow’): Eurytus.—(1) son of Actor (or of Poseidon) and Molione, brother of Cteatus (see *)aktori/wn), with his brother an ally of Augēas against Nestor and the Pylians, Il. 2.621, Il. 11.709 ff.—(2) son of Melaneus and Stratonice, king of Oechalia, father of Iole and Iphitus. A celebrated archer, he challenged Apollo to a contest, and was slain by the god, Od. 8.204 ff. Odysseus received the bow of Eurytus from his son Iphitus, Od. 21.32 ff.
eu)ru-fuh/s, e/s (fu/w): wide-growing, i. e. with its rows of kernels far apart, epith. of barley, Od. 4.604†.

eu)ru/-xoros: (if from xoro/s) with broad dancing-places or lawns; (if from
xw=ros) spacious; epith. of lands and cities.
eu)rw/eis, essa (eu)rw/s): mouldy, dank, epith. of Hades.

e)u/s, e)u/, and h)u/s, h)u/, gen. e(h=os, acc. e)u/n, h)u/n, pl. gen. e(a=/wn: synonym of a)gaqo/s and kalo/s, the neut. forms of the sing. mostly adverbial, see eu)=. e)u\s pai=s, ui(o/s, qerapw/n, *bi/a=s, paido\s e(h=os, esp. in Il.; also me/nos h)u/, ‘noble ardor,’ Od. 2.271, etc.; h)u/s te me/gas te, Il. 2.653.— gen. pl. e(a=/wn, of good things, blessings, Il. 24.528 ; qeoi\ dwth=res e(a=/wn, Od. 8.325.
eu(=sa: see eu(/w.
e)u/ - skarqmos (skai/rw): lightly bounding, Il. 13.31†.
e)u/-skopos: (1) well - aiming, epith. of Artemis, the huntress, Od. 11.198.—(2) sharp-seeing, of Hermes, Il. 24.24, etc.
e)u/-sselmos (se/lma): with good deck, well - decked, of ships, Il. 2.170, Od. 2.390. (The Homeric ships were decked only at bow and stern.)
*)eu/sswros: a Thracian, the father of Acamas, Il. 6.8†.
e)u-ste/fanos (stefa/nh): with beautiful head-band, epith. of goddesses and women, Il. 21.511, Od. 18.193, Od. 2.120; fig., of Thebes, with noble wall, Il. 19.99.
e)u/-streptos, e)ustrefh/s, e)u/strofos (stre/fw): well-twisted.

eu)=te: (1) when, at the time when, foll by the same constructions as other relative words (see a)/n, ke/n). eu)=te is always employed ‘asyndetically,’ i. e. without a connecting particle, and is freq. followed by a demonstrative temporal word in the apodosis, e)/nqa, th=mos dh/, kai\ to/te dh/, e)/peita, etc.; eu)=t' a)sth\r u(pere/sxe faa/ntatos.. th=mos dh\ nh/sw| prosepi/lnato pontopo/ros nhu=s, Od. 13.93; the clause introduced by eu)=te may, however, follow its apodosis, tlh= d' *)ai/dhs.. w)ku\n o)isto/n.. eu)=te/ min wu(to\s a)nh\r.. o)du/nh|sin e)/dwken, Il. 5.396.—(2) as, even as, introducing a simile, Il. 3.10, Il. 19.386 (where some write hu)=te, for h)u/te).
eu)-tei/xeos, metapl. acc. sing. eu)tei/xea: well-walled, well-fortified, Il. 1.129, Il. 16.57.
e)u/ - tmhtos (te/mnw): well - cut, of straps, Il. 23.684. (Il.)
e)u-trefh/s, e/s (tre/fw): well - nourished, fat, Od. 9.425. (Od.)
*eu)/trhsis: a village in Boeotia, Il. 2.502.
e)u/-trhtos (titra/w): well-pierced, Il. 14.182†.
e)u/trixas: see eu)/qric.
e)u/-troxos (troxo/s): well-wheeled, Il. 8.438.
eu)/-tuktos (teu/xw): well-wrought, Il. 3.336, Od. 4.123.
eu)-fhme/w (eu)/fhmos): observe a holy silence, i. e. avoid ill-omened words by not speaking at all, Il. 9.171†.
*eu)/fhmos: son of Troezēnus, and leader of the Ciconians, Il. 2.846†.
*eu)fh/ths: ruler over Ephyra in Elis, Il. 15.532†.
*eu)/forbos: Euphorbus, a Trojan, the son of Panthous; after wounding Patroclus, he is slain by Menelāus, Il. 16.806, Il. 17.59.
e)u - frade/ws (fra/zomai): thoughtfully, wisely, Od. 19.352†.
eu) - frai/nw (frh/n), fut. eu)frane/w, aor. eu)/frhna: cheer, gladden, mid., take one's pleasure, Od. 2.311.
e)u-frone/wn: well meaning and well judging, with good and wise intent, always e)ufrone/wn a)gorh/sato kai\ mete/eipen.
e)u-frosu/nh: mirth, gladness.
e)u/ - frwn: glad, cheerful; in act. sense, oi)=nos, Il. 3.246.
e)u - fuh/s, e/s (fu/w): well - grown, shapely, Il. 21.243, Il. 4.147. (Il.)
eu)/ - xalkos: of fine bronze, well mounted with bronze, Il. 20.322.

eu)xeta/omai (eu)/xomai), opt. eu)xetow/|mhn: pray or offer obeisance, tini/, boast; eu)xeto/wnto qew=n *dii\ *ne/stori/ t a)ndrw=n, Il. 11.761, Od. 8.467; u(pe/rbion, au)/tws eu)xeta/asqai, Il. 17.19, Il. 20.348; ti/nes e)/mmenai eu)xeto/wntai, Od. 1.172 (see eu)/xomai).
eu)xh/: prayer, vow, pl., Od. 10.526†.
*eu)xh/nwr: son of Polyīdus, Il. 13.663.

eu)/xomai, imp. eu)/xeo and eu)/xou, ipf. eu)xo/mhn, aor. eu)ca/mhn: (1) pray, vow; then solemnly declare and wish; eu)/xeto pa/nt' a)podou=nai, ‘asseverated,’ Il. 18.499 ; eu)ca/meno/s ti e)/pos e)re/w.. ei)/q' w(\s h(bw/oimi, Od. 14.463, 468, Il. 14.484; usually, however, of praying to the gods.—(2) avow, avouch oneself, boast; h(mei=s toi pate/rwn me/g' a)mei/nones eu)xo/meq) ei)=nai,
Il. 4.405; usually of just pride, but not always, Il. 13.447.
eu)=xos (eu)/xomai, boast): glory, esp. of war and victory, freq. dido/nai eu)=xo/s tini, eu)=xos a)re/sqai, Il. 5.285, i 317, Il. 7.203.
eu)-xroh/s, e/s (xrw/s): bright-colored, Od. 14.24†.
eu)xwlh/ (eu)/xomai): (1) prayer, vow, Od. 13.357, Il. 1.65.—(2) boast, exultation, shout of triumph, Il. 4.450, Il. 8.229, Il. 2.160; ‘my pride,’ Il. 22.433.
eu(/w, aor. eu(=sa: singe, bristles of swine, Il. 9.468, Od. 2.300; the eyelids of Polyphēmus, Od. 9.379.
eu) - w/dhs, es (o)/zw, o)/dwda): sweetsmelling, fragrant.
eu) - w=pis, idos (w)/y): fair - faced. (Od.)
e)/fagon: see fagei=n.
e)f - a/llomai, aor. 2 e)pa=lto, part. e)pa/lmenos and e)pia/lmenos: leap or spring upon or at; i(/ppwn, Il. 7.15; and freq. in hostile sense, tini/, Il. 13.643; in friendly sense, abs., Od. 24.320.
e)/f-alos (a(/ls): situated on the sea, epith. of maritime cities, Il. 2.538, 584. (Il.)
e)/fan: see fhmi/.
e)f-anda/nw, e)pianda/nw (vanda/nw): be pleasing or acceptable to, please.
e)fa/nh: see fai/nw.
e)f-a/ptw, pass. perf. e)fh=ptai, plup. e)fh=pto, mid. aor. subj. e)fa/yeai: act., attach to, pass. (metaph.), be hung over, hang over, impend; tini/, *b 15, Il. 6.241; mid., touch, Od. 5.348.
e)f - armo/zw, aor. opt. e)farmo/sseie: intr., fit, suit, Il. 19.385†.
e)f-e/zomai, ipf. e)fe/zeto: sit upon or by, Il. 21.506, Od. 17.334.
e)fe/hka, e)fei/hn: see e)fi/hmi.

e)f-ei=sa, defective aor., inf. e)fe/ssai, mid. aor. imp. e)/fessai, part. e)fessa/menos, fut. inf. e)fe/ssesqai: cause to sit upon or by, set, mid., for oneself; of putting on board ship, Od. 13.274; mid., w. gen. (nho/s), Od. 15.277 ; tini/ ti, *i 455, Od. 16.443.
e)f-e/lkw, drag to or after, pass., Il. 23.696; mid. (met.), draw to oneself, attract, Od. 16.294.
e)f-e/nnu=mi: see e)pie/nnu=mi.

e)f-e/pw, ipf. e)/fepe, iter. e)fe/peskon, fut. e)fe/yeis, aor. e)pe/spon, opt. e)pi/spoi, inf. e)pispei=n, mid. aor. inf. e)pispe/sqai, part. -o/menos: I. act., follow up, pursue, and seemingly causative, *patro/klw| e)/fepe kraterw/nuxas i(/ppous, ‘urge on against,’ Il. 16.724 ; w(\s tou\s *)atrei/dhs e)/fepe, ‘followed up,’ ‘pursued,’ Il. 11.177; (kunhge/tai) korufa=\s o)re/wn e)fe/pontes, ‘pushing to,’ Od. 9.121 ; u(smi=/nhs sto/ma, ‘move over,’ Il. 20.359, Il. 11.496; freq. met., qa/naton kai\ po/tmon e)pispei=n, ‘meet’ one's fate; so oi)=ton, o)le/qrion or ai)/simon h)=mar, Od. 3.134, *t 294, Il. 21.100.—II. mid., follow close; tini/, Il. 13.495; posi/n, ‘in running,’ Il. 14.521; met., e)pispo/menoi me/nei sfw=|, qeou= o)mfh=|, c 262, Od. 3.215.
e)fe/ssai, e)/fessai, e)fe/ssesqai, e)fessa/menos: see e)fei<*>=sa.

e)f - e/stios (e(sti/a=): at or to the hearth, at one's own hearth or home, Od. 3.234, Od. 23.55 ; e)fe/stioi o(/ssoi e)/a=sin, i. e. all the native Trojans, Il. 2.125; (e)me/) e)fe/stion h)/gage dai/mwn, ‘to her hearth,’ Od. 7.248.
e)f-etmh/ (e)fi/hmi): command, behest, mostly in pl. (Il. and Od. 4.353).
e)f - euri/skw, aor. e)feu/romen, opt. e)feu/roi: come upon and find, surprise, freq. w. part.
e)f-eyia/omai: mock, make sport of, tini/. (Od.)
e)/f-hmai: sit upon or at. (Od.)
e)f-hme/rios: the day through, Od. 4.223 ; e)fhme/ria fronei=n, thoughts ‘but for the day,’ i. e. no thought for the morrow, Od. 21.85.
e)f-hmosu/nh (e)fi/hmi) = e)fe/tmh.
e)/fhsqa: see fhmi/.
e)/fqhn: see fqa/nw.
e)fqi/aq): see fqi/w.
*)efia/lths: Ephialtes, the giant, son of Alōeus, and brother of Otus, Il. 5.385, Od. 11.308.
e)f-iza/nw: sit upon or at; dei/pnw|, Il. 10.578; met., u(/pnos e)pi\ blefa/roisin, Il. 10.26.
e)f-i/zw, ipf. iter. e)fi/zeske: sit upon. (Od.)

e)f - i/hmi, part. e)fi=ei/s, ipf. e)fi^/ei, fut. e)fh/seis, aor. e)fh=ka, e)fe/hka, subj. e)fei/w, opt. e)fei/hn, imp. e)/fes, mid. pres. part. e)fi=e/menos: let go at or upon.—I. act., of ‘sending’ one person to another, Il. 24.117; ‘letting fly’ missiles at anything, be/lea/ tini, *a 51, Il. 21.170; ‘laying (violent hands) upon’ one, Il. 1.567, Od. 1.254; met., of ‘inciting’ a person to some action, w. inf., xaleph=nai, a)ei=sai, *s
108, Od. 14.464; also of ‘bringing’ or ‘imposing’ troubles, etc., upon one, po/tmon, a)/eqlon, kh/dea/ tini, Il. 4.396, t 576, Il. 1.445.—II. mid., enjoin upon, command; tini/ (ti), Il. 23.82, Il. 24.300, Od. 13.7.
e)f - ikne/omai: only aor. e)fi/konto (a)llh/lwn), fell upon each other, Il. 13.613†.
e)fi/lhqen: see file/w.

e)f-i/sthmi, perf. 3 pl. e)fe/sta=si, inf. e)festa/men(ai), part. gen. e)festao/tos, plup. e)festh/kei, 3 pl. e)fe/stasan, aor. 2 e)pe/sth, mid. ipf. e)fi/stato: perf. and mid., stand upon, by, or at, aor. 2, come up to, draw near, w. dat., or a prep. and its case, Il. 6.373, Il. 23.201, Il. 10.124, Il. 11.644; in hostile sense, ‘set upon,’ Il. 15.703; fig., *kh=res e)festa=sin qana/toio, Il. 12.326.
e)f-o/lkaion (e(/lkw): rudder, Od. 14.350†.
e)f-omarte/w: follow close upon. (Il.)
e)f - opli/zw, fut. -opli/ssousi, aor. e)fo/pli(s)sa, mid. aor. subj. e)fopliso/mesqa: equip, get ready, mid., for oneself, nh=a, a)/macan, dai=ta, do/rpa, Od. 2.295, Od. 6.37, *q 503, Il. 9.66.

e)f - ora/w, fut. e)po/yomai, e)pio/yomai, aor. e)pei=don: look upon, behold, watch over; (*zeu/s) a)nqrw/pous e)fora=| kai\ ti=/nutai o(/s ken a(ma/rth|, Od. 13.214; also ‘go to see’ (visere), Od. 7.324, Od. 23.19, and ‘look up’ (in order to choose), here the form e)pio/yomai, *i 167, Od. 2.294; fig., ‘live to see,’ kaka/, Il. 22.61.

e)f - orma/w, aor. e)fw/rmhsa, pass. e)fwrmh/qhn: act., set a-going against, arouse against; po/lemo/n tini, a)ne/mous, *g 165, Od. 7.272; mid. and pass., rush upon, be impelled, be eager; e)ni\ di/frw| | e)/gxei e)forma=sqai, Il. 17.465; w. acc., o)rni=/qwn petehnw=n ai)eto\s ai)/qwn | e)/qnos e)forma=tai, Il. 15.691, Il. 20.461; ei)/ oi( qu=mo\s e)forma=tai game/esqai, Od. 1.275.
e)f-ormh/: way to speed to (from the interior to the o(do\s e)s lau/rhn), Od. 22.130†.
e)f-ubri/zw: only part., insultingly, Il. 9.368†.
e)/f-udros (u(/dwr): wet, rainy, Od. 14.458†.
e)f-u/perqe(n): above.
*)efu/rh: Ephyra.—(1) the ancient name of Corinth, Il. 6.152, 210.—(2) a Pelasgic city in Northern Elis, the residence of Augēas, Il. 2.659, Il. 15.531, Il. 11.739, Od. 1.259, Od. 2.328.
*)/efuroi: the inhabitants of Crannon in Thessaly, which formerly bore the name of Ephyra, Il. 13.301.
e)/xadon: see xanda/nw.
e)/xean, e)/xee: see xe/w.
e)xe/-qu=mos: restraining passion; ouk e)xe/qu=mos, incontinent, Od. 8.320†.
*)exeklh=s: a Myrmidon, the son of Actor, Il. 16.189.
*)/exeklos: (1) a son of Agēnor, slain by Achilles, Il. 20.474†.—(2) a Trojan, slain by Patroclus, Il. 16.694†.
*)exe/mmwn: a son of Priam, slain by Diomed, Il. 5.160†.
*)exe/nhos: an aged Phaeacian, Od. 11.342.
e)xe-peukh/s, e/s (cf. pikro/s): having a sharp point, sharp, o)isto/s. (Il.)
*)exe/pwlos: (1) a descendant of Anchīses, dwelling in Sicyon, Il. 23.296. —(2) a Trojan, the son of Thalysius, slain by Antilochus, Il. 4.458.
e)/xeskon: see e)/xw.
*)/exetos: a barbarous king in Epīrus, Od. 21.308. (Od.)
e)/xeua, e)xeua/mhn: see xe/w.
e)xe/-frwn: thoughtful, prudent. (Od.)
*)exe/frwn: a son of Nestor, Od. 3.413.
e)/xh|sqa: see e)/xw.
e)xqai/rw (e)/xqos), aor. h)/xqhra: hate, opp filei=n, Od. 4.692.
e)/xqistos (sup. of e)xqro/s): most hateful, most odious. (Il.)
e)xqo-dope/w: only aor. inf. e)xqodoph=sai, to enter into hostilities against, tini/, Il. 1.518†.
e)/xqomai, inf. e)/xqesqai, ipf. h)/xqeto: be hated, odious. (Od.)
e)/xqos, eos: hate, enmity, wrath.
e)xqro/s: hateful, odious.
*)exi=nai: nh=soi, name of a group of islands in the Ionian Sea, near Dulichium, Il. 2.625.
*)exi/os: (1) the father of Mecisteus, Il. 8.333.—(2) a Lycian, slain by Patroclus, Il. 16.416.—(3) a Lycian, slain by Polītes, Il. 15.339.

e)/xma (e)/xw), pl. e)/xmata: props, supports, bearers; nhw=n, pu/rgwn, *c 410, Il. 12.260; of the earth under a mass of rock, pe/trhs, Il. 13.139; also of the mud or rubbish from a canal, holding back the flow of water, Il. 21.259.

e)/xw, subj. 2 sing. e)/xh|sqa, ipf. ei)=xon, e)/xon, iter. e)/xeskon, fut. e(/cw, sxh/sw, aor. e)/sxon, inf. sxe/men, mid. fut. e(/cetai, sxh/sesqe, aor. e)sxo/mhn, imp. sxe/o, par
allel forms of aor. act. e)/sxeqon, sxeqe/ein: hold, have.—I. act. (and pass.) —(1) trans., hold, in the hands, Il. 1.14; or in any way or direction, hence ‘wear,’ Il. 13.163, Il. 23.136, Il. 16.763, Od. 19.225; ‘hold up,’ ‘support,’ Od. 1.53; ‘hold back,’ ‘stop,’ Il. 4.302, Il. 12.456; and similarly of holding something to a course, ‘guide,’ ‘steer,’ a ship, horses, Od. 9.279, Il. 13.326; met., of holding watch, holding under one's protection, I 1, Il. 24.730; also have, keep, esp. ‘have to wife,’ Od. 4.569; as one's abode, ‘inhabit,’ Il. 5.890; under one's authority, Od. 2.22; and w. inf., ‘be able,’ Il. 16.110, Od. 12.433. Pass., Il. 7.102.—(2) intrans., hold still, or in some position, e(/cw, w(s li/qos, Od. 19.494; also of motion, direction, e)/gxos e)/sxe di) w)/mou, simply giving verbal force to the prep. dia/, Il. 13.520; freq. w. an adv., r(i/zai e(ka\s ei)=xon, were ‘far reaching,’ Od. 12.435 ; eu)= e)/xei, ‘it is well,’ Od. 24.245; answering to the trans. use w. nh=a, i(/ppous, but without object, ‘steer,’ ‘drive,’ Od. 3.182, Il. 23.401; and similarly where no object can be thought of, e)pi\ d' au)tw=| pa/ntes e)/xwmen, ‘have at him,’ Od. 22.75.—II. <*>id., hold something for oneself, or of one's own, hold fast, hold still, cease from, hold on to something (tino/s); a)/nta pareia=/wn sxome/nh lipara\ krh/demna, ‘before her cheeks,’ Od. 1.334, Il. 20.262 ; e)/xeo kraterw=s, Il. 16.501; tw=| prosfu=\s e)xo/mhn w(s nukteri/s, Od. 12.433; e)/sxeto fwnh/, ‘stuck,’ ‘stopped,’ Il. 17.696, Il. 21.345; w. gen., Il. 2.98; metaph., ‘depend on,’ se/o e(/cetai, Il. 9.102, z 197, Od. 11.346.
e(yia/omai: make merry, Od. 17.530 ; molph=| kai\ fo/rmiggi, Od. 21.429.
e)w=, e)w=|: see e)a/w.
e)/wqa: see e)/qw.
e)w/|kei: see e)/oika.
e)w/lpei: see e)/lpw.
e(/wmen: unintelligible word in Il. 19.402†. (According to most of the ancient grammarians it is equiv. to a)/dhn e)/xwmen, plhrwqw=men, koresqw=men.)
e)w/n: see ei)mi/.
e)w|noxo/ei: see oi)noxoe/w.
e)w/rgei: see e)/rdw.

e(/ws, ei(/ws, ei(=os: (1) as long as, until; foll. by the usual constructions with rel. words (see a)/n, ke/n). A clause introduced by e(/ws often denotes purpose, Od. 4.800, Od. 9.376.—(2) like te/ws, for a while, usually with me/n, Od. 2.148, etc. —e(/ws, to be read with ‘synizesis,’ except Od. 2.78.
e)/wsi: see ei)mi/.
e)w=si: see e)a/w.
*(ews-fo/ros: morning star (Lucifer), Il. 23.226†.

div1.head: *z
div1.entryFree: za- (dia/): intensive prefix, like da-.
za=h/s, e/s (a)/hmi), acc. za=h=n: strongly blowing, tempestuous.
za/ - qeos, 3: most divine, sacred, of localities favored by the gods. (Il.)
za/-kotos (ko/tos): surly, morose, Il. 3.220†.

*za/kunqos: Zacynthus (now Zante), an island in the realm of Odysseus, south of Same, Od. 1.246, Il. 2.634. A short syllable is not necessarily lengthened by position before the initial Z of this word, Od. 9.124, Od. 1.246; cf. *ze/leia.
za-trefh/s, e/s (tre/fw): highly fed, fat, sleek.
za - flegh/s, e/s (fle/gw): strongly burning, met., full of fire, Il. 21.465†.
za-xrhh/s (xra/w): raging, impetuous. (Il.)
za/w: see zw/w.
zeiai/: a coarse kind of barley, spelt, Od. 4.41, 604.
*ze/leia: a town at the foot of Mt. Ida. A short syllable is not necessarily lengthened by position before the initial Z of this word, Il. 2.824; cf. *za/kunqos. (Il.)
ze/ssen: see ze/w.
zeu/glh: yoke-cushion, between neck and yoke. (Il.) (See cut No. 72, also 45, letter d.)

zeu/gnu=mi, zeugnu/w, inf. zeugnu/men (zeugnu=men, Il. 16.145), aor. e)/zeuca, zeu=ce, pass. perf. part. e)zeugme/nai: yoke, yoke up, yoke together, mid., for oneself; i(/ppous, bo/as, also w. u(p' o)/xesfin, u(p) a)ph/nh|, etc., Il. 20.495, Il. 23.130, Od. 6.73, Od. 15.46, Od. 3.492; abs., Il. 24.281.
zeu=gos, eos: pl., a pair, yoke of draught animals, Il. 18.543†.

*zeu=s (*dieu/s, root div), gen. *dio/s, dat. *dii/, acc. *di/a, voc. *zeu=, also gen. *zhno/s, dat. *zhni/, acc. *zh=n(a): Zeus (Diespiter, Juppiter; cf. *zeu= pa/ter, Il. 3.320), the son of Cronos and the father of gods and men, god of the lightning, the clouds and weather, of time itself, hence u(yi/zugos, ai)qe/ri nai/wn, *dio\s o)/mbros, *dio\s e(niautoi/, eu)ru/opa, e)ri/gdoupos po/sis *(/hrhs, ai)gi/oxos, u(yibreme/ths, nefelhgere/ta, kelainefh/s, sterophgere/ta, teryike/raunos, a)sterophth/s, a)rgike/raunos, e)ribreme/ths. Zeus is the sender of portents, and the shaper of destiny, panomfai=os, *dio\s ta/lanta, etc.; he is the protector of kings, of suppliants, of house and court, and he presides over the fulfilment of oaths, diotrefei=s, diogenei=s basilh=es, *zeu\s cei/nios, i(keth/sios, e(rkei=os. The original meaning of the root of the word is the brightness of the sky, afterwards personified; cf. di=os, Lat. sub divo.
zefuri/h: the western breeze, Od. 7.119†. (The first syllable long in the verse.)

ze/furos (zo/fos): the west wind, rough and violent, Od. 5.295, Od. 12.289, 408; and the swiftest of the winds, Il. 19.415; bringing snow and rain, Od. 19.202, Od. 14.458; only in fable-land soft and balmy, Od. 7.119, Od. 4.567; personified, Il. 16.150, Il. 23.200.
ze/w, ipf. ze/e, aor. ze/sse: boil, seethe; le/bhs zei=, the kettle boils, Il. 21.362.
*zh=qos: Zethus, son of Zeus and Antiope, brother of Amphīon, with whom he founded Thebes, Od. 11.262; the husband of Aëdon, and father of Itylus, Od. 19.523.
zhlh/mwn (zh=los): jealous, grudging, Od. 5.118†.
*zh/n, *zhno/s: see *zeu/s.
zhte/w: seek, Il. 14.258†.
zo/fos (cf. kne/fas, gno/fos, dno/fos): (1) gloom, darkness, esp. of the nether world, and for the realm of shadows itself, Il. 15.191.—(2) evening, the Occident, the West, Od. 9.26, Od. 12.81.
zugo/-desmon: yoke-band, a cord or strap for fastening the yoke to the pole, Il. 24.270. (See cut under zugo/n, b; and cut No. 42.)

zugo/n (zeu/gnu=mi), gen. zugo/fin: (1) yoke or cross-bar by means of which beasts of draught were attached to whatever was to be drawn. (See adjacent cut, combined from several antique representations.) a, o)mfalo/s; b, cugo/desmon; c, kri/kos; d, zeu=glai; e, straps to fasten the zeu=glai; f, le/padna; g and h, oi)/hkes, points of attachment for the collars, and rings through which the reins pass; i, zugo/n; k, projections to hold, e. g., the reins of the parh/oros i(/ppos. (Cf. also the Assyrian yoke on the chariot on board a ship, represented in the adjoining cut.)—(2) cross-bar of a lyre (see fo/rmigc), to which the strings were attached, Il. 9.187.—(3) pl., zuga/, rowers' benches, thwarts of a ship (see cut No. 32, under e)/dafos).
zw-a/gria, pl. (zwo/s, a)gre/w): reward for saving life, Il. 18.407, Od. 8.462.
zwgre/w (1) (zwo/s, a)gre/w): take alive, i. e. grant quarter and not slay, Il. 10.378†.
zwgre/w (2) (zwh/, e)gei/rw): revive, reanimate; qu=mo/n, Il. 5.698†.
zwh/ (za/w): means of life, substance, Od. 14.208, Od. 16.429. (Od.)

zw=ma (zw/nnu=mi): (1) apron of leather or of felt, extending from the flank to the upper part of the thigh, and serving to protect the part of the body left exposed between the cuirass and the greaves (see cut under *)axilleu/s also cut No. 12, the figure of Aenēas). —(2) broad girdle around the waist of boxers, like that of the tumbler in the adjoining cut, Il. 23.683.
zw/nh: girdle of a woman (see cut No. 48, also Nos. 44 and 61); then for waist, Il. 2.479, Il. 11.234.

zw/nnu=mi, aor. part. zw/santes, mid. pres. subj. zw/nnu=ntai, ipf. zw/nuto, iter. zwnnu/sketo, aor. zw/sato, imp. zw=sai, part. zwsame/nw: act., gird another, Od. 18.76, mid.; gird oneself, gird on, w. acc. or dat. of the belt used, Il. 5.857, Il. 10.78; abs., Il. 11.15, Od. 18.30.
zwo/s, zw/s, acc. zw/n: alive, living, Il. 5.887, Il. 16.445.
zwro/s, comp. zwro/teros: lively, fiery, of wine; zwro/teron ke/raie, i. e. mix it stronger, pour in less water, Il. 9.203†.

zwsth/r, h=ros (zw/nnu=mi): (1) warrior's body-girdle, of leather strengthened with metal plates, which covered the lower part of the qw/rhc, and the upper part of the mi/trh and of the zw=ma (see cuts Nos. 3 and 79). (Il.) —(2) girdle worn over the tunic, Od. 14.72. (See cut No. 73.)
zw=stron = cw/nh, Od. 6.38†.

zw/w, inf. zw/ein, zwe/menai, part. zw/ontos and zw=ntos, ipf. e)/zwon: live; freq. joined with o(ra=n fa/os h)eli/oio, Od. 4.833; with e)/stin, Od. 24.263; r(ei=a zw/ontes, of the gods and their untroubled existence.

div1.head: *h
div1.entryFree: h)/, h)e/: or, than, whether.—(1) disjunctive, or, and in correlation, either.. or, o(/ppws ke mnhsth=ras.. ktei/nh|s h)e\ do/lw| h)\ a)mfado/n, Od. 1.296.—(2) comparative, than.—(3) interrogative, (a) rarely in a single indirect question, whether, Il. 8.111, Od. 13.415 (v. l. ei)).—(b) freq. in double questions, direct or indirect (whether).. or (Att. po/teron.. h)/), the accentuation of the second particle according to the ancient grammarians being h)= (h)=e). The first member is introduced either by h)/ (h)e/), or by some other particle, or stands without any particle; qeo/s nu/ tis h)= broto/s e)ssi; Od. 6.149. ou)de/ ti oi)=da, zw/ei o(/ g' h)= te/qnhke, Od. 11.464. *tu=dei/dhn d) ou)k a)\n gnoi/hs pote/roisi metei/h, | h)e\ meta\ *trw/essin o(mi=le/oi h)= met' *)axaioi=s, Il. 5.86. With ei) in first clause, Od. 16.33.
h)=: see (1) ei)mi/.—(2) h)mi/.

h)=: in truth, surely, verily.—(1) particle of asseveration, always standing at the beginning of its clause except in the phrase e)pei\ h)= (sometimes written e)peih/). Freq. in combination with other particles, h)= dh/, h)= ma/la (dh/), h)= qh/n, h)= te, h)= toi (q. v.), and esp. h)= mh/n (me/n), which may be retained even in indirect quotation, kai/ moi o)/mosson | h)= me/n moi.. a)rh/cein (representing in the direct form, h)= me/n soi a)rh/cw, ‘I sol
emnly declare that I will defend thee’), Il. 1.77, Il. 14.275.—(2) the same particle may introduce a direct question, esp. a specific question following a general one, always, however, with the expression of some feeling; ti/pt' au)=t).. ei)lh/louqas; h)= i(/na u(/brin i)/dh| *)agame/mnonos, ‘is it that thou may'st behold, etc.?’ Il. 1.203, Il. 3.400, Il. 20.17 ; *zeu= pa/ter, h)= r(a/ tis e)/sti brotw=n, ktl., ‘pray, lives there a man, etc.?’ Il. 7.446.
h(/: see o(/s.
h(/: regarded by some as an adv. in the phrase h(\ qe/mis e)sti/n, as is right. See o(/s.
h(=|: where (whither), as; dat. fem. of the rel. pron., used as adv., Il. 12.389, Il. 15.46, Il. 9.310.
h)=a: see ei)mi/.
h)=|a: see h)/ia.

h)baio/s (Att. baio/s): little, slight, usually w. neg., ou)d' oi( e)/ni fre/nes, ou)d) h)baiai/, ‘not the least,’ Il. 14.141, Od. 21.288, Od. 18.355.—Adv., h)baio/n, a little, Od. 9.462, elsewhere w. neg.
h(ba/w, opt. h(bw/oimi, h(bw=|mi, part. h(bw=n, h(bw/onta, etc., aor. h(/bhsa: be (aor. arrive) at one's prime, have youthful vigor; fig., of a vine, ‘luxuriant,’ Od. 5.69.
h(/bh: youth; h(/bhs me/tron, ‘youthful prime,’ Il. 11.225, Od. 11.317; youthful strength or vigor, Il. 16.857, Od. 8.181.
*(/hbh: Hebe, daughter of Zeus and Hera, spouse of Heracles, Od. 11.603. In the Iliad she always appears as a goddess performing some manual service for other divinities, Il. 4.2, Il. 5.722, 905.
h(bw=|mi, h(bw/oimi: see h(ba/w.
h)ga/asqe: see a)/gamai.
h)/gagon, h)gago/mhn: see a)/gw.
h)ga/qeos: highly divine, sacred, of localities, Il. 6.133, Od. 4.702. Cf. za/qeos.
h)/geira: see (1) a)gei/rw.—(2) e)gei/rw.
h)ga/ssato: see a)/gamai.

h(gemoneu/w (h(gemw/n), fut. -eu/sw: be leader, lead the way (w. dat.), command an army (w. gen.), (Il.); toi=si ge/rwn o(do\n h(gemo/neuen, Od. 24.225; u(/dati r(o/on, Il. 21.258; e(te/rhs (stixo/s), Il. 16.179 (dat. Il. 2.816).
h(gemw/n, o/nos: guide, leader, commander. (Il. and Od. 10.505, Od. 15.310.)

h(ge/omai (a)/gw), fut. -h/somai, aor. -hsa/mhn: go before, lead the way, guide, lead; opp. e(/pomai, Od. 1.125; pro/sqen h(gei=sqai, Il. 24.696; o(do/n, Od. 10.263; w. acc. of the place led to, a)/stea, Od. 15.82; met., w. gen., o)rxhqmoi=o, Od. 23.134; w. gen. of persons commanded, Il. 2.567, 620, 851.
h)gere/qomai (a)gei/rw): assemble.
h)/gerqen: see a)gei/rw.
h(ghla/zw: parallel form of h(ge/omai, w. acc., Od. 17.217 ; mo/ron, Od. 11.618. (Od.)
h(gh/twr, oros (h(ge/omai): leader, chief; freq. h(gh/tores h)de\ me/dontes, w. a)/ndres, Il. 16.495.
h)gora/asqe, h)goro/wnto: see a)gora/omai.

h)de/: and; combined, h)de\.. kai\.. h)de/, t' h)de/, te\.. h)de/, te\.. h)de\ kai/, Il. 15.663, Il. 2.206, Od. 1.12, Il. 5.822; h)de\ kai/, ‘and also,’ Il. 1.334, etc.; freq. correl. to h)me/n, also to me/n.
h)/|dea, h)/|dh: see ei)/dw (II.).
h)/dh: already, now (ia m); h)/dh pote\ h)/luqe, ‘once before,’ Il. 3.205 ; e)pi\ nh=a kateleu/somai h)/dh, ‘at once,’ Od. 1.303; freq. h)/dh nu=n, Il. 1.456, Il. 15.110 Il. 16.844.
h(/domai (h(du/s): only aor. h(/sato, was delighted, Od. 9.353†.

h(=dos, eos: joy, enjoyment; daito/s, Il. 1.576, Od. 18.404; h(me/wn e)/ssetai h(=dos, ‘joy of us,’ i. e. from us, Il. 11.318; ‘profit,’ ‘advantage,’ Il. 18.80, Od. 24.95. Always w. neg. expressed or implied.
h(du-eph/s (ve/pos): sweet - speaking, Il. 1.248†.
h(du/-potos (pi=/nw): sweet to drink. (Od.)
h(du/s, ei=a, u/ (svhdu/s) sup. h(/distos: sweet, pleasant; adv., h(du/, knw/ssein, gela=n, d 809, Il. 2.270.
h)e/ (h)=e): see h)/.
h)=e: see ei)mi/.
h)ei/dein, h)ei/dh, h)ei/dhs: see ei)/dw (II.)
