kapu/w: only aor., a)po\ (adv.) de\ yu=xh\n e)ka/pussen, breathed forth (in a swoon), Il. 22.467†.
ka/r: see kata/.
ka/r (ka/rh): only e)pi\ ka/r, headlong, Il. 16.392†.
*ka/r, pl. *ka=res: the Carians, inhabitants of Caria in Asia Minor, Il. 2.867. (Il.)
karo/s, defect. gen.: doubtful word, only ti/w se/ min e)n karo\s ai)/sh|, ‘the value of a straw,’ ‘not a whit,’ Il. 9.378.
*kardamu/lh: a town in Messēne, under the sway of Agamemnon, Il. 9.150†.

kardi/h, kradi/h: heart, as an organ
of the body, Il. 10.94, Il. 13.282, 442; then as seat of life, courage, emotion, reason, Il. 1.225, Il. 9.646, Il. 10.244, Od. 4.548, 260.

ka/rh (Att. ka/ra=), gen. ka/rhtos, karh/atos, kra=to/s, kra=/atos, dat. similarly, acc. ka/rh, kra=ta, pl. karh/ata, kra=ta, kra=/ata, dat. kra=si/, kra=/tesfi: head, of men or animals; also of a poppy, mountain-peaks, the head of a harbor, Il. 8.306, Il. 20.5, Od. 9.140. For krh=qen, see kata/krhqen.
karh-komo/wntes: long-haired; epith. of the Achaeans, who cut their hair only in mourning or on taking a vow, Il. 23.146, 151, while slaves and Orientals habitually shaved their heads.
ka/rhnon (ka/rh): only pl., heads, also summits (o)re/wn), and of towers, battlements, Il. 2.117.
*ka/rhsos: a river rising in Mt. Ida, Il. 12.20†.
karkai/rw: quake, ipf., Il. 20.157†.
karpa/limos (cf. kraipno/s): swift. —Adv., karpali/mws, swiftly, speedily, quickly.
karpo/s (1): fruit of tree, field, or vine, Il. 3.246.
karpo/s (2): wrist, always e)pi\ karpw=|, and with xei/r, Il. 5.458, s 258, Il. 18.594.
karre/zousa: see katarre/zw.
kartero/-qu=mos: strong-hearted. (Il.)
kartero/s: see kratero/s.
ka/rtistos: strongest, mightiest; neut., fuge/ein ka/rtiston a)p' au)th=s (sc. e)sti/), best, i. e. ‘the better part of valor,’ Od. 12.120.
ka/rtos: see kra/tos.
kartu=)nw: only aor. mid., e)kartu=/nanto fa/laggas, strengthened their ranks. (Il.)
*ka/rustos: a town at the southern extremity of Euboea, Il. 2.539†.
karfale/os: dry; of sound (cf. au)=on), Il. 13.409. (Il. and Od. 5.369.)
ka/rfw, fut. ka/ryw, aor. ka/rye: parch, shrivel up, Od. 13.398 and 430.
karxale/os: rough with thirst (di/yh|), of the throat, dry, Il. 21.541†.
karxar-o/dous, o/dontos: sharp-toothed, epith. of dogs. (Il.)
kasi-gnh/th (ka/sis, gi/gnomai): sister (of the same mother).
kasi/-gnhtos (ka/sis, gi/gnomai): brother; of a cousin, Il. 15.545, Il. 16.456.
*ka/sos: an island near Cos, Il. 2.676†.
*kassa/ndrh: Cassandra, daughter of Priam, the prophetess, carried to Greece as captive by Agamemnon, and slain by Clytaemnestra, Il. 13.366, Il. 24.699, Od. 11.422.
kassi/teros: tin; used to ornament weapons and chariots.
*kastia/neira: the mother of Gorgythion, Il. 8.305†.
kastornu=sa: see katastore/nnu=mi.

*ka/stwr: Castor.—(1) son of Zeus and Leda, brother of Polydeuces and Helen, famed for horsemanship (i(ppo/damos), as participant in the hunt of the Calydonian boar, and in the Argonautic expedition, Il. 3.237, Od. 11.299 ff.— (2) son of Hylacus, Od. 14.204.
ka/sxeqe: see kate/xw.

kata/, before g sometimes ka/g, before d ka/d, before p and f ka/p, before r ka/r (and by some written in combination with its case, e. g. kaggo/nu, kaddu/namin): down.—I. adv., down, utterly (here belong all examples of ‘tmesis’ so-called); kata\ da/kru xe/ousa, fig., kata\ d' o(/rkia pa/thsan, ‘under foot,’ Il. 4.157 ; kata\ d' a(/rmata a)/cw, break ‘to pieces;’ kata\ tau=ron e)dhdw/s, having devoured, stronger than ‘eaten,’ through the force of kata/, Il. 17.542; *phlh=a/ g' o)i=/omai h)\ kata\ pa/mpan | teqna/men, to be dead and gone, cf. kataqnh/skw, Il. 19.334; the appropriate case of a subst. may specify the relation of the adv., kata\ de\ no/tios r(e/en i(drw\s | w)/mwn kai\ kefalh=s (local gen.), Il. 11.811.—II. prep., (a) w. gen., down, down from, down over, kat' ou)ranou= ei)lh/louqen, Od. 7.199; kat) o)fqalmou= ke/xut) a)xlu=/s, Il. 5.696; a)mbrosi/hn kai\ ne/ktar e)ruqro\n | sta/ce kata\ r(i=nw=n, ‘down through,’ ‘in through,’ Il. 19.39 ; kat' a)/krhs, ‘from top to bottom,’ ‘utterly.’—(b) w. acc., down, down through, down into, kata\ tei=xos e)/bhsan, Il. 13.737; of motion not so vaguely as a)na/, ‘up and down,’ but usually rather with reference to some definite end or purpose, doiw\ de\ kubisthth=re kat' au)tou\s.. e)di=/neuon kata\ me/ssous, ‘among them.. down the centre,’ Od. 4.18 ; nai/ein kata\ po/lin, in particular places throughout the city, Il. 2.130; so, kata\ gai=an, kata\ po/nton, and simply local, kata\ sth=qos, in the breast, met., kata\ qu=mo/n, ‘in the heart;’ transferred from the physical or local sense to other relations, distributive, according
to, by, kata\ fu=la, kata\ sti/xas, so kata\ sfe/as, ‘by themselves;’ fitness, kata\ qu=mo/n, according to one's wish; kata\ ko/smon, kat' ai)=san, kromu/oio lopo\n ka/ta, ‘after the semblance’ of an onion-skin, Od. 19.233; purpose, kata\ prh=cin, ‘on business’; kata\ dai=ta, ‘for a banquet,’ Il. 1.424.

kata - bai/nw, aor. 2 kate/bhn, 3 pl. -e/bhsan, kate/ban, subj. -bei/omen, imp. kata/bhqi, inf. -bh=nai, -bh/menai, mid. aor. katebh/seto, imp. katabh/seo, subj. katabh/setai: step down, descend, tino/s, ‘from,’ ou)rano/qen, Od. 6.281; ei)/s ti, e)pi/ ti, and sometimes w. acc. of end of motion without prep., katebh/seto qa/lamon, Od. 2.337; then apparently trans., kli=/maka, e)fo/lkaion, ‘down - stairs,’ ‘down the rudder,’ Od. 1.330, Od. 14.350 ; u(perw/ia, as acc. of the place from which (as if the verb meant to leave), Od. 18.206, Od. 23.85.

kata - ba/llw, ipf. kate/balle, aor. sync. ka/bbale (ka/mbale): cast or throw down, Il. 15.357, Od. 6.172; then merely ‘put down,’ ‘let fall,’ Il. 9.206, Il. 5.343, Il. 8.249; (kuw/n) ou)/ata ka/bbalen, ‘dropped’ his ears, Od. 17.302†.

kat - a/gw, aor. kath/gage, inf. katace/men, mid. ipf. kath/geto, kata/gonto, aor. -hgago/mesqa: lead or bring down, bring to some definite place, i(/ppous e)pi\ nh=as, Il. 5.26; tina\ *krh/thnde, ‘drove’ to Crete, Od. 19.186; mid., of sailing, bring to land or port, put in (opp. a)na/gesqai), Od. 3.10, 178, Od. 10.140.
kata-da/ptw, aor. kate/dayan: tear, devour; met., h)=tor katada/ptetai, Od. 16.92.
kata-darqa/nw, aor. kate/draqon, du. sync. kaddraqe/thn: fall asleep, sleep, Od. 23.18. (Od.)
kata-de/rkomai: look down upon, Od. 11.16†.
kata-deu/w: drench, wet, Il. 9.490†.
kata-de/w, ipf. kate/dei, aor. kate/dhse: bind down, bind fast, confine.
kata-dhmo-bore/w (dhmobo/ros): devour or consume in common, aor., Il. 18.301†.
katadra/qw: see katadarqa/nw.
kataeime/nos, kataei/nusan: see katae/nnu=mi.
kataei/sato: see ka/teimi.
kata-e/nnu=mi (ve/nnu=mi), ipf. kataei/nusan, pass. perf. part. kataeime/nos: clothe, cover, Il. 23.135; fig., u=(/lh|, n 351, Od. 19.431.
kat-azai/nw, aor. iter. katazh/naske: make dry, dry up, Od. 11.587†.
kata - qa/ptw, aor. inf. kataqa/yai: inter, bury. (Il.)
kataqei/omai, -qei/omen: see katati/qhmi.
kata-qe/lgw, aor. kate/qelce: subdue by charming, charm, enchant, Od. 10.213†.

kata-qnh/skw, aor. 2 sync. ka/tqane, perf. katateqnh/ka=si, opt. -teqnai/h, part. -teqnhw=tos, etc., fem. -teqnhui/hs: go down to death, die, perf., be dead and gone; yu=xai\ neku/wn katateqnhw/twn, shades of the ‘departed dead,’ Od. 11.37.
kata-qnhto/s: mortal.
kata-qu=/mios (qu=mo/s): in or upon the mind or heart, Il. 10.383, Il. 17.201, Il. 22.392.
katai-bato/s: to be descended, passable, Od. 13.110†.
kat-aiki/zw, pass. perf. kath/|kistai: disfigure, soil, Od. 16.290 and Od. 19.9.
kat-aisxu=/nw: disgrace, dishonor.
kata-i+/sxw: see kati/sxw.
katai=tuc, ugos, leather helmet or skull-cap, Il. 10.258†. (See cut No. 115.)
kata-kai/rios (kairo/s): mortal, with te/los (like te/los qana/toio), Il. 11.439†.
kata-kai/w, inf. -kaie/men, aor. 1 kate/kha, subj. -kh/omen, inf. sync. kakkh=ai (-kei=ai): burn up, consume.
kata/ - keimai, 3 pl. katakei/atai, ipf. kate/keito: lie down, lie, remain in any settled condition; met., rest, Il. 24.523; as pass. of katati/qhmi, be set down, Il. 24.527.
kata-kei/rw: shear down, hence waste, consume. (Od.)
kata - kei/w, subj. katakei/omen, part. sync. kakkei/ontes: lie down; as desiderative, part. w. e)/ban, went to lie down, to sleep, Il. 1.606, Od. 1.424.
katakh=ai, -khe/men, -kh/omen: see katakai/w.
kata - kla/w, ipf. kate/klwn: break down, break off; pass., fig., katekla/sqh fi/lon h)=tor, my heart broke, ‘gave way,’ Od. 4.481.
kata-kli=/nw, aor. part. -kli=/na=s: lean or lay down; do/ru e)pi\ gai/h|, Od. 10.165†.
*kataklw=qes: see *klw=qes.
kata - koima/w, only aor. pass. katekoimh/qhn: pass., lie down to sleep, sleep, lie. (Il.)
katakoirane/w: see koirane/w.
kata - kosme/w, mid. aor. subj. katakosmh/shsqe: put in order, Od. 22.440; ‘fitted,’ Il. 4.118.
kata/ - krhqen (ka/rh): from top to bottom, utterly.
kata/krhs =kata/krhqen, see a)/krh.
kata - kru/ptw, fut. inf. -u/yein, aor. part. katakru/ya=s: hide, conceal; au)to/n, ‘himself,’ Od. 4.427; ‘make no concealment,’ Od. 7.205.

kata - ktei/nw, fut. kataktenei)=, 3 pl. -ktane/ousi, aor. 1 opt. kataktei/neie, aor. 2 kate/ktanon, imp. kata/ktane, ka/ktane, also kate/ktan, inf. -kta/men(ai), part. -kta=/s, pass. aor. 3 pl. kate/ktaqen, mid. fut. kataktane/esqe, aor. part. katakta/menos: kill, slay; mid. w. pass. signif., Il. 14.481, Od. 16.106.
kata - ku/ptw, aor. kate/kuye: bend down the head, bow down. (Il.)
kata-le/gw (1), fut. -le/cw, aor. kate/leca. enumerate, recount, Od. 19.497, Od. 16.235; then narrate, relate, with eu)=, a)treke/ws, e)n moi/rh|, *i 115, Il. 19.186.
kata-le/gw (2) (root lex), mid. fut. katale/cetai, aor. katele/cato, imp. kata/lecai, aor. 2 kate/lekto, inf. katale/xqai, part. katale/gmenos: mid., lay oneself down, lie down to sleep or rest, lie.
kata-lei/bw: only pass. part. trickling down, Il. 18.109†.

kata-lei/pw, kallei/pw, aor. 2 ka/llipon (ka/llif), *z 223, Il. 10.338), inf. -e/ein: leave behind, leave in the lurch, abandon, Il. 21.414, Il. 22.383, Il. 24.383; ‘give over,’ e(/lwr gene/sqai, Il. 17.151, g 271, Od. 5.344.
kata-lh/qomai: forget entirely.
kata=lofa/deia (lo/fos): adv., ‘down over the neck’; fe/rwn, carrying the animal crosswise over his back (the feet being tied together and held under the chin of the bearer), Od. 10.169†.
kata-lu=/w, aor. kate/lu=se, subj. -lu=/somen: loose (unharness), Od. 4.28; fig., undo, ‘destroy,’ Il. 2.117, Il. 9.24.
kata-ma/rptw, aor. subj. katama/ryh|: overtake.
kat - ama/w: only aor. mid. katamh/sato, had heaped upon himself, Il. 24.165†.
kat-amu/ssw: only aor. mid., katamu/cato xei=ra, has scratched her hand, Il. 5.425†.

kata-neu/w, part. kata-neu/wn (Od. 9.490), fut. -neu/somai, aor. kate/neusa, part. sync. kanneu/sa=s: nod down (forward), nod to, to give a sign, regularly of assent (opp. a)naneu/w); kefalh=| or kra=ti/, Il. 1.527; joined with u(pe/sxeto, u(pe/sthn, Il. 2.112, n 133, Il. 4.267; grant (tini/ ti), ni=kh/n, ku=dos, also w. inf., Il. 10.393, Od. 4.6.
kat-a=/nomai (a=)/nw): pass., be used up, wasted. (Od.)
ka/t-anta (kata/nths): adv., downhill, Il. 23.116†.
kata/nthstin: see a)/nthstis.
katantikru/: see a)ntikru/.
kata/ - pauma (pau/w): rest from, alleviation; tino/s, Il. 17.38†.

kata - pau/w, fut. -sw, aor. kate/pausa, subj. -pau/somen: put an end to, quell; of persons and w. gen. of separation, silence, stop in anything (a)ghnori/hs, a)frosuna=/wn), Il. 22.457, Od. 24.457; ironically of killing, Il. 16.618.
kata - pe/ssw, aor. subj. katape/yh|: digest, fig., xo/lon (as we say ‘swallow’ one's anger), Il. 1.81†.
katape/fnwn: see kate/pefnon.
kata - ph/gnu=mi, aor. kate/phca, mid. aor. sync. kate/phkto: stick fast, plant, mid. intrans., Il. 11.378.
kata - pi=/ptw, aor. sync. ka/ppeson: fall down; fig., parai\ posi\ ka/ppese qu=mo/s, i. e. their courage utterly forsook them, Il. 15.280.
kata - ple/w: sail down, put in (to shore from the high sea), ipf., Od. 9.142†.
kata-plh/ssw: only aor. pass., kateplh/gh, was struck with dismay (h)=tor, acc. of specification), Il. 3.31†.
kata-prhnh/s, e/s: ‘down-turned forward,’ only w. xei/r, the flat of the hand.
kata - pth/ssw, aor. 1 part. katapth/ca=s, aor. 2 kate/pthn, 3 du. katapth/thn: crouch down, cower with fear, Il. 8.136.
kata-ptw/ssw =katapth/ssw. (Il.)
kata-pu=/qomai (pu=/qw): become rotten, rot away, Il. 23.328†.
kat - a=ra/omai: utter imprecations, invoke upon (tini/ ti); followed by inf. denoting the substance of the prayer, Il. 9.454.
kata=-ri=ghlo/s (vri=gos): horrible, Od. 14.226†.
kata-rre/zw, katare/zw, part. karre/zousa, aor. kate/rece: stroke, caress.
kata-rre/w, part. neut. katarre/on: flow down.
kat-a/rxomai: only ipf., in ritualistic sense, xe/rniba/ t' ou)loxu/ta=s te, began the sacred hand-washing and sprinkling of barley meal, Od. 3.445†.
kata-sbe/nnu=mi, aor. kate/sbese: extinguish, quench, Il. 21.381†.
kata-seu/omai: only aor. 2, kate/ssuto, rushed down, Il. 21.382†.
kata - skia/w: overshadow, ipf., Od. 12.436†.
kata-store/nnu=mi and katasto/rnu=mi, part. sync. ka=stornu=sa, aor. katesto/resa: spread down, spread out upon, Od. 17.32; then of ‘covering over,’ Il. 24.798.
kata-stuge/w: only aor., kate/stuge, was horror-struck, Il. 17.694†.
katasxeqei=n: see kate/xw.
kata - th/kw, aor. kate/thce: melt down, melt; pass. intrans.; fig., ‘pine away,’ katath/komai h)=tor (acc. of specification), Od. 19.136.

kata - ti/qhmi, fut. -qh/sw, aor. kate/qhka, pl. ka/tqemen, ka/tqesan, imp. ka/tqete, subj. kataqei/omen, inf. -qei=nai, katqe/men, part. du. kataqe/nte, mid. aor. 2 katqe/meqa, katqe/sqhn, subj. kataqei/omai, part. katqe/menoi: put or lay down, put away, mid., for oneself; of setting one ashore or at any other place of destination, Od. 16.230, Il. 16.683; spreading a bed, Od. 19.317; proposing as a prize in a contest, Il. 23.267; laying the dead on the bier, Od. 24.190, 44; depositing things for safe keeping, etc.
kata - tru=/xw: wear or waste away, exhaust, consume.
katau=qi, katauto/qi: see au)=qi and au)to/qi.
kata - fe/rw: only fut., katoi/setai, will bring me down to the grave, Il. 22.425†.

kata - fqi/w, fut. -fqi=/sei, mid. aor. kate/fqito, inf. katafqi/sqai, part. -fqi/menos: destroy, mid., perish, pass away, die; neku/essi katafqime/noisin (kata/ because they have passed down to Hades, cf. kataqnh/skw), Od. 11.491.
kata-fle/gw, fut. -cw: burn up, consume; puri/, Il. 22.512†.
kata-fu=lado/n (fu=lon): in tribes, in clans, Il. 2.668†.

kata-xe/w, aor. kate/xeua, inf. kataxeu=ai, mid. aor. 3 pl. kate/xunto: pour down, shower down, shed over (tini/ ti); not of fluids only, but variously, of letting fall a garment, Il. 5.734; throwing down wands, Il. 6.134; levelling a wall, Il. 7.461; and often metaph., xa/rin, plou=ton, o)nei/dea, Od. 2.12, *b 670, Od. 14.38; mid., o(/pla ei)s a)/ntlon, ‘fell in a heap,’ Od. 12.411.
kata-xqo/nios: subterranean, nether, *zeu/s (= Hades), Il. 9.457†.
kate/aca: see kata/gnu=mi.
kate/dei: see katade/w.
kat-e/dw, fut. kate/dontai: eat up, devour; fig., oi)=kon, qu=mo/n, b 237, Il. 6.202.
kat-ei/bw (= katalei/bw): let flow down, shed; mid., flow apace, trickle down, fig., ai)w/n, ‘ebb away,’ Od. 5.152.

ka/t-eimi (ei)=mi), ka/teisi, inf. kati/men, ipf. kath/ie, mid. aor. kataei/sato: go or come down, in some definite direction, as back home, into port, etc.; fig., of a river, ‘flow down,’ Il. 11.492; a ship, Od. 16.472; a spear, Il. 11.358.
kate/ktaqen: see kataktei/nw.
katenai/rw, mid. aor. katenh/rato: slay, Od. 11.519†.
kat - enanti/on: down against, go to meet; tini/, Il. 21.567†.
kat - e/nwpa: in the face of, turned toward, Il. 15.320†.
katepa/lmenos: see katefa/llomai.
kate/palto: see e)kkatapa/llw.
kat-e/pefnon, subj. katape/fnh|, part. (w. irreg. accent) katape/fnwn: kill, slay.
kat - erei/pw, aor. kath/ripen, perf. katerh/ripen: aor. and perf., intr., fall down, be prostrated, fig., ‘fall away,’ ‘come to nought,’ Il. 5.92. (Il.)
kat-erhtu/w: hold back, restrain.
kat - eru=ka/nw and kateru=/kw: hold back, hinder, detain, pass., Od. 1.197.
kat-eru/w, aor. katei/ruse, pass. perf. katei/rustai, kateiru/sqai: draw down, launch a vessel.

kat-e/rxomai, fut. kateleu/somai, aor. kath/luqon, inf. katelqe/men: come or go down, come in some definite direction, as from country to town, home, from high sea to harbor, etc.; pe/trh, ‘descending,’ Od. 9.484.
kate/ssuto: see kataseu/omai.
kat-euna/zw and kateuna/w, aor. opt. kateunh/saimi, aor. pass. 3 pl. kateu/nasqen, part. kateunhqe/nta: put to bed, lull to sleep, pass., lie down, sleep.
kat - ef - a/llomai: only aor. part., katepa/lmenos, springing down to the attack, Il. 11.94†.

kat - e/xw, fut. kaqe/cei, aor. 2 kate/sxon, pass. kate/xontai, ipf. katei/xeto, -e/xonto, mid. aor. kate/sxeto, part. katasxome/nh, aor. 2, parallel forms, kate/sxeqon, sync. ka=/sxeqe: I. act., hold down, Od. 24.242; hold fast, keep back, Il. 11.702, Od. 15.200; occupy, ‘fill,’ Il. 16.79; fig., of the earth holding down (within its depths) the buried dead, pri\n kai/ tina gai=a kaqe/cei, *p 629, Il. 3.243; of the heavens held (obscured) by night, the moon by clouds, Od. 13.269, Od. 9.145.—II. mid., hold down upon or cover oneself or a part of oneself, Il. 3.419, Od. 19.361; stop, tarry, Od. 3.284.
kat - hpia/w (h)/pios): alleviate, assuage, pass., Il. 5.417†.
kat - hrefh/s, e/s (e)re/fw): covered over, vaulted, overhanging.
kath/ripe: see katerei/pw.
kat-hfei/h (kathfh/s): humiliation, shame. (Il.)
kat - hfe/w, aor. kath/fhsan, part. -fh/sa=s: be humiliated, confounded, Od. 16.342, Il. 22.293.
kat-hfh/s, e/s: humiliated, disgraced, Od. 24.432†.
kat-hfw/n, o/nos = kathfei/h, abstract for concrete, disgraces, Il. 24.253†.
ka/tqane: see kataqnh/skw.
katqa/yai: see kataqa/ptw.
katqe/men, ka/tqemen, ka/tqete, ka/tqesan: see katati/qhmi.
kati/men: see katie/nai.
kat-i/sxw and katai+/sxw, inf. katisxe/men(ai), pass. katai+/sxetai: hold down, occupy, Od. 9.122; hold back, Il. 23.321; hold to a course, steer, nh=a, Od. 11.456; mid., keep for oneself, Il. 2.233.
kat-oi/setai: see katafe/rw.
kat-o/pisqe(n): in the rear, behind; w. gen., Od. 12.148; of time, in the future, afterwards.
ka/tw (kata/): down, downward, Il. 17.136 and Od. 23.91.
kat-wma/dios (w)=mos): (down) from (over) the shoulder, of the discus so hurled, Il. 23.431†. (See cut No. 30.)
kat - wmado/n (w)=mos): (down) from (over) the shoulder, of the whip as used by the driver, or ‘down on the shoulders’ of the horses. (Il.)
kat - w=ruc, uxos (o)ru/ssw): dug in, buried or firmly set in the earth. (Od.)
*kau/kwnes: the Cauconians.—(1) in Paphlagonia, Il. 10.429. — (2) in Elis, Od. 3.366.
kaulo/s: spear-shaft, part next the point, Il. 16.115; also sword-hilt, Il. 16.338.
kau=ma, atos (kai/w): burning heat, Il. 5.865†.
kau/steira (kai/w), fem. adj.: hot, raging, ma/xh. (Il.)
*kau+/strios: the Caÿster, a river in Ionia, emptying into the sea near Ephesus, Il. 2.461.
kau)to/s = kai\ au)to/s.
kaf-: only perf. part., kekafho/ta, gasping out, qu=mo/n, Il. 5.698 and Od. 5.468.

ke/, ke/n: enclitic modal adv. indicating a condition; essentially equivalent to a)/n, but of more frequent occurrence, esp. in affirmative sentences, and sometimes found in combination with a)/n, Il. 11.187, Il. 13.127, Il. 24.437, Od. 5.361, z 259, Od. 9.334. Homer uses ke/n, like a)/n, with the fut. indic. and w. the subj. in independent sentences, kai/ ke/ tis w(=d' e)re/ei, ‘thus many a one will be like to say,’ Il. 4.176 ; e)gw\ de/ k' a)/gw *bri=shi+/da, ‘just as certainly will I,’ etc., Il. 1.184. With inf., Il. 22.110. See a)/n.
*kea/dhs: son of Ceas, Troezenius, Il. 2.847.
kea/zw, aor. (e))ke/asse, ke/ase, opt. kea/saimi, inf. kea/ssai, pass. perf. part. kekeasme/na, aor. kea/sqh: split, cleave; of lightning, shiver, Od. 5.132, Od. 7.250.
ke/atai: see kei=mai.
*kebrio/nhs: a son of Priam, charioteer of Hector, slain by Patroclus, Il. 8.318, Il. 16.738.
keda/nnu=mi (parallel form of skeda/nnu=mi, employed for metrical convenience), aor. e)ke/dasse, pass. aor. 3 pl. e)ke/dasqen, kedasqei/s: disperse, scatter; gefu=/ra=s, ‘burst the dikes,’ Il. 5.88.
kedno/s (root kad, kh/dw), sup. kedno/tatos: careful, true, good, excellent; a poetic synonym of a)gaqo/s, e)sqlo/s, used mostly of persons; kedna\ vidui=a, ‘careful-minded,’ Od. 1.428.
kedrino/s: of cedar, Il. 24.192†.
ke/dros: cedar, of the tree and of the wood, Od. 5.60†.
keia/menos, kei/antes: see kai/w.
kei/atai, kei/ato: see kei=mai.
kei=qen (kei=nos): thence, then, Il. 15.234.
kei=qi: there.

kei=mai, kei=sai, kei=tai, 3 pl. kei=ntai, ke/atai, kei/atai, subj. kh=tai, imp. kei=so, kei/sqw, inf. kei=sqai, part. kei/menos, ipf. (e))kei/mhn, 3 pl. ke/ato, kei/ato, iter. 3 sing. ke/sketo, fut. kei/somai: lie, be placed or situated, of both persons and things, and often virtually a pass. to ti/qhmi, as kei=tai a)/eqla, prizes ‘are offered,’ Il. 23.273; freq. where we say ‘stand,’ di/fros, qrh=nus, Od. 17.331, 410; fig., pe/nqos e)pi\ fresi\ kei=tai, Od. 24.423; tau=ta qew=n e)n gou/nasi kei=tai, ‘rest’ in their disposal; see go/nu.
keimh/lion (kei=mai): treasure, heirloom; of ‘landed property,’ Od. 2.75.
kei=nos, kei/nh, kei=no: see e)kei=nos.
keino/s: see keno/s.

kei/rw, fut. inf. kere/ein, aor. 1 e)/kersa, ke/rse, mid. part. keiro/menos, ipf. kei/ronto, aor. inf. kei/rasqai: shear, shear off, cut down; ko/mhn, dou=ra, te/nonte, Il. 23.146, *w 450, Il. 10.546; then ‘consume,’ ‘waste,’ kth/mata, bi/oton, Od. 2.312, 143; fig., ma/xhs e)pi\ (adv.) mh/dea kei/rei, ‘cuts short,’ Il. 15.467; mid., cut off one's own hair (as an offering to the dead), Il. 23.46, Od. 4.198.
kei=se (kei=nos): thither, there; ‘thus far,’ Il. 23.461.
kei/w, ke/w (1), inf. keie/men, part. kei/wn, ke/wn, a future with desiderative force: wish to sleep; freq. the part. w. verb of motion, ba\n kei/ontes, o)/rso ke/wn, Od. 7.342.
kei/w (2), stem form of kea/zw: split, part., Od. 14.425†.
kekadh/sei, -dhso/meqa: see kh/dw.
keka/donto, kekadw/n: see xa/zomai.
ke/kasmai: see kai/numai.
kekafhw/s: see kaf-.
ke/kleto: see ke/lomai.
ke/klhga: see kla/zw.
keklh/ato: see kale/w.
keklh/sh|: see kale/w.
keklo/menos: see ke/lomai.
ke/kluqi, ke/klute: see klu/w.
ke/kmhkas, kekmhw/s: see ka/mnw.
kekopw/s: see ko/ptw.
keko/rhmai, kekorho/te: see kore/nnu=mi.
kekoruqme/nos: see koru/ssw.
kekothw/s: see kote/w.
kekra=/antai, kekra=/anto: see kera/nnu=mi.
kekru/falos: net to confine the hair, Il. 22.469†. (See cut No. 41.)
keku/qwsi: see keu/qw.
keladeino/s: sounding, ringing, clanging, echoing; *ze/furos, Il. 23.208; elsewhere, keladeinh/, epithet of Artemis as huntress (leader of the pack), as subst., Il. 21.511.
kelade/w: sound applause, shout in applause, aor. (Il.)
ke/lados: clang, echo, clamor, of the hunt or the combat, and otherwise, Od. 18.402.
kela/dwn, ontos: part., sounding, Il. 21.16†.
*kela/dwn: a stream in Elis, Il. 7.133†.
kelai-nefh/s, e/s (kelaino/s, ne/fos): as epith. of Zeus, god of the dark clouds, subst., Od. 13.147; of blood, dark.
kelaino/s: dark, black; of the skin, blood, night, wave, storm, the earth, Il. 16.384.
kelaru/zw: gurgle, of flowing water; of blood, Il. 11.813.

ke/leuqos, pl. ke/leuqoi, oftener ke/leuqa: path, way; a)ne/mwn lauyhra\ ke/leuqa, keleu/qous, Od. 5.383; u(gra/, i)xquo/enta ke/leuqa, of the paths of air and of the sea; of a journey, Od. 10.539 ; ke/leuqon prh/ssein, tiqe/nai, qe/sqai, gefu=rou=n, of making a way over a ditch, Il. 15.357 ; nukto/s te kai\ h)/matos ke/leuqoi, ‘outgoings of night and day,’ Od. 10.86; met., qew=n a)po/eike keleu/qou, ‘cease from walking heavenly ways,’ Il. 3.406.
keleutia/w (frequentative of keleu/w), part. -tio/wn: urge or cheer on, ‘animate,’ Il. 12.265. (Il.)

keleu/w (root kel), ipf. (e))ke/leuon, fut. inf. keleuse/menai: urge, ma/sti=gi, Il. 23.642; then command, bid, request, tini/ ti, or w. inf., Od. 16.136, Il. 2.50; freq. w. acc. and inf.; w. two accusatives in the formula o)/fr' ei)/pw ta/ me qu=mo\s e)ni\ sth/qessi keleu/ei, Il. 7.68.
ke/lhs, htos (root kel, cf. celer): racer, courser, w. i(/ppos, race-horse, Od. 5.371†.
kelhti/zw (ke/lhs): ride race-horses, i(/ppoisi, of professional fancy riding, Il. 15.679†.
ke/llw, aor. e)/kelsa: beach a ship (nh=a); also intr., kelsa=/sh|si de\ nhusi/, the ships ‘having run on the beach,’ we, etc., Od. 9.149.

ke/lomai (root kel), ke/leai, fut. kelh/setai, aor. 2 redupl. (e))ke/kleto, part. keklo/menos: command, urge on, exhort, call to (tini/ or tina/, *z 66, Il. 18.391); fig., the wax was softened, e)pei\ ke/leto mega/lh vi\s | h)eli/ou, Od. 12.175.
ke/lsai: see ke/llw.
kema/s, a/dos: a two-year old deer, Il. 10.361†.
ke/n: see ke/.
kene-auxh/s, e/s (au)xe/w): emptily or idly boasting, Il. 8.230†.
keneo/s: see keno/s.
kenew/n, w=nos (keneo/s): the empty space of the body, part between the hips and ribs, waist, small of the back, Od. 22.295; acc. of specification, Il. 5.284; elsewhere w. e)s.
keno/s, keneo/s, keino/s: empty; met., vain, idle, eu)/gmata, Od. 22.249.
ke/nsai: see kente/w.
*ke/ntauros: a Centaur, e. g. Eurytion, Od. 21.295. In Homer the Centaurs were a wild Thessalian tribe, Il. 1.268.
kente/w, aor. inf. ke/nsai: goaded on; i(/ppon, Il. 23.337†.
kentr-hnekh/s, e/s: goaded on. (Il.)
ke/ntron (kente/w): goad. (Il.)
ke/ntwr, oros: goader; ke/ntores i(/ppwn, epith. of Cadmaeans and Trojans. (Il.)
ke/ontai: see kei=mai.
kera/asqe: see kera/nnu=mi.
kerai+/zw (cf. kei/rw), inf. kerai+ze/men: lay waste, destroy; also kill, Il. 2.861.
kerai/w, kera/w: see kera/nnu=mi.
kerameu/s, h=os: potter, Il. 18.601†.

ke/ramos: anything of earthen ware, pot or jar, such as are sometimes found half buried in the earth (see cut), Il. 3.469; in Il. 5.387, xalke/w| e)n kera/mw|, serving as a dungeon (cf. the pit into which Joseph was thrown by his brethren).

kera/nnu=mi, kera/w, kerai/w (cf. also kirna/w and ki/rnhmi), aor. ke/rasse, part. fein. kera/sa=sa, mid. pres. subj. ke/rwntai, imp. kera/asqe, kera=sqe, ipf. kero/wn- to, kerw=nto, aor. kera/ssato, pass. perf. kekra=/antai, plup. -anto: mix, prepare by mixing, mid., for oneself, have mixed; esp. of tempering wine with water, also of preparing water for a bath, Od. 10.362; of alloy, or similar work in metal, xru=sw=| d' e)pi\ xei/lea kekra=/antai, ‘plated’ with gold, Od. 4.132.
kerao-co/os (ke/ras, ce/w): horn-polishing, worker in horn, te/ktwn, Il. 4.110†.
kerao/s: horned.

ke/ras, ke/raos, dat. ke/rai (ke/ra|), pl. ke/ra= (but shortened before a vowel), kera/wn, dat. ke/rasi, kera/essi: horn; bows were made of horn, Il. 4.109 ff., Od. 21.395; hence said for ‘bow,’ Il. 11.385; a sheath of horn was used to encase a fishing-line, to prevent the hook from being bitten off, Il. 24.81; with a play upon the word krai/nw, Od. 19.566.
kerauno/s: thunderbolt, lightning.
kera/w: see kera/nnu=mi.
kerdale/os (ke/rdos): profitable, advantageous; hence cunning, sly, Od. 6.148, Od. 8.548, Od. 13.291.
kerdaleo/-frwn: with mind bent on gain, greedy - minded, Il. 1.149; craftyminded, Il. 4.339.
kerdi/wn, ke/rdion: more profitable, more advantageous, ‘better,’ Od. 18.166.— Sup. ke/rdistos, the slyest, Il. 6.153†.

ke/rdos, eos: gain, profit; shrewd counsel, esp. pl., Il. 23.515 ; ke/rdea e)pi/stasqai, ei)de/nai, to be ‘versed in cunning arts,’ Il. 23.322 ; nwma=n e)ni\ fresi/, ‘devise clever counsels,’ Od. 18.216; in bad sense, Od. 2.88, Od. 23.217.
kerdosu/nh: craft; only dat. as adv., cunningly, craftily.
kerki/s, i/dos: rod (in later times ‘comb’), by a blow from which the threads of the woof were driven home into the warp, and the web made firm and close, Od. 5.62. (See cut No. 59.)
ke/rsa=s: see kei/rw.
ker-tome/w (ke/rtomos), ipf. (e)kerto/meon: taunt, tease, Il. 16.261.
kertomi/h: taunt, only pl.
kerto/mios (cf. kei/rw): taunting, cutting, e)/pta, Il. 4.6; also as subst., kerto/mia (=kertomi/ai), Il. 1.539, Od. 9.474.
kerw=ntai, kero/wnto: see kera/nnu=mi.
ke/sketo: see kei=mai.
kesto/s (kente/w): of needle-work, embroidered (girdle of Aphrodite), Il. 14.214†.
keuqa/nw = keu/qw, Il. 3.453†.
keuqmo/s: lair, pl., Il. 13.28†.
keuqmw/n, w=nos: hiding-place, cranny, Od. 13.367; of the sties of swine, Od. 10.283.
keu=qos, eos,=keuqmo/s, keuqmw/n, only pl., u(po\ keu/qesi gai/hs, ‘in the depths of the earth beneath,’ of Hades, Il. 22.482, Od. 24.204.

keu/qw, fut. -sw, aor. 2 ku/qe, subj. redupl. keku/qw, perf. ke/keuqa: hold concealed, hide, cover; esp. of death, ku/qe gai=a, Od. 3.16; pass., *)aidi\ keu/qwmai, Il. 23.244; met., no/w|, e)ni\ fresi/n, etc.; with two accusatives, Od. 3.187, Od. 23.273.

kefalh/, kefalh=fi: head; typical of life, Il. 4.162, Od. 2.237, Il. 17.242; several expressions have no equivalent in Eng., fi/lh, h)qei/h kefalh/ (carum caput), terms of endearment; as the source of voice, Il. 11.462, Il. 16.76.
*kefallh=nes: the Cephallenians, collective designation of the subjects of Odysseus on islands and mainland, Il. 2.631, Od. 14.100, Od. 20.187, Od. 24.355, 378, 429.
ke/xanda: see xanda/nw.
kexarhse/men, kexarh/setai, kexarhw/s, kexaroi/ato, kexa/ronto: see xai/ow.
kexhnw/s: see xai/nw.
kexarisme/nos: see xari/zomai.
kexo/lwmai: see xolo/w.
kexrhme/nos: see xra/omai.
ke/xumai: see xe/w.
ke/w: see kei/w.
kh=ai, kh/ai, kha/menos: see kai/w.
kh/deios, kh/deos (kh=dos): of any object of solicitude, dear; esp. of those who claim burial service, Il. 19.294 and Il. 23.160.
khdemw/n, o/nos: one solicitous, near friend, mourner, only pl. (Il.)
kh/distos, a sup. to kh/deios: dearest.
kh=dos, eos: care, trouble, esp. for deceased friends, mourning, Il. 4.270; pl. kh/dea, sorrows.

kh/dw, ipf. iter. kh/deskon, fut. part. khdh/sontes, mid. ipf. iter. khde/sketo, fut. kekadhso/meqa: trouble, distress, Il. 5.404, Il. 21.369, Il. 24.240, 542, Od. 9.402; pass. and mid., be concerned, care for, tino/s, Il. 7.204, *a 196, Od. 14.146.
kh=en: see kai/w.
khki/w (ki/w): gush forth, Od. 5.455†.
kh/leos, kh/leios (kai/w): blazing; pu=r, Il. 15.744.
khlhqmo/s (khle/w): charm; khlhqmw=| d' e)/sxonto, they were spell - bound, Od. 11.334 and Od. 13.2.
kh=lon: pl., shafts, missiles of the gods; of snow, Il. 12.280. (Il.)
kh/c: (sea-)gull, Od. 9.479†.
kh/omen: see kai/w.
kh=pos: garden.

*kh=r, *khro/s (kei/rw): the angel of death, any form of death personified, hence kh=res qana/toio, fates of death, muri/ai, Il. 12.326, c 207, Il. 2.302. Immediately upon the birth, the Moira or Aisa was determined for the life, and the kh=r for the death (cf. Il. 9.411, where the choice of a twofold destiny is offered to Achilles; the passage also shows that the *kh=r impels to destruction, cf. khressifo/rhtos). When the time of death for the special favorites of Zeus approaches, he weighs the fortunes of combatants, e. g. Patroclus and Sarpēdon, Achilles and Hector. (See cut, representing Hermes discharging this function.) Freq. joined w. qa/natos, Od. 2.283; fo<*>nos, d 273, Od. 2.165; hence w. adj. me/laina, Il. 21.66; like qa/natos, Il. 16.687; often = death, Il. 11.360, 362, *e 652, Il. 9.411; symbol of hate, Il. 1.228.

kh=r, kh=ros: heart, Il. 16.481; then in wider signification, as the seat of understanding, will, and emotion, thus answering approximately to Eng. ‘heart’; hence (e)n)fresi/n, e)ni\ sth/qessin, e)n qu=mw=|, Il. 6.523, ‘within me’; (peri\) kh=ri, ‘at heart exceedingly,’ ‘most heartily,’ Od. 5.36 ; khro/qi ma=llon, ‘still more in
heart,’ Od. 17.458; also used periphrastically like me/nos, bi/h, etc., Il. 2.851, cf. Il. 1.395.
khressi-fo/rhtos: borne on by their fates to death, Il. 8.527†.
*kh/rinqos: a town in Euboea, N. E. from Chalcis, Il. 2.538†.
khro/qi: see kh=r.
khro/s: wax. (Od.)

kh=ruc, ukos: herald. The heralds convoked the popular assembly, kept order at trials, bore as sign of their office a staff (see cut, from an archaic relief, No. 114), which they handed over to him who had the right to speak. They served also as messengers of the chiefs and as their assistants in sacrifice. Epithets, qei=oi, *dio\s a)/ggeloi, *dii\ fi/loi. kh/ruki *)hputi/dh|, Il. 17.324.
khru=/ssw: proclaim as herald, summon, order, po/lemo/nde, a)gorh/nde. ‘In the office of herald,’ Il. 17.325.
kh=tai: see kei=mai.
*kh/teioi: a Mysian tribe, followers of Eurypylus, Od. 11.521†.
kh=tos, eos: sea-monster, e. g. sharks and seals, Il. 20.147, Od. 4.446.
khtw/eis, essa (kh=tos): full of ravines, epith. of Lacedaemon, Il. 2.581, Od. 4.1.
*khfi=si/s, i/dos: li/mnh, name of a lake in Boeotia, later Copāis, Il. 5.709†.
*khfi=so/s: a river in Phocis.
khw/dhs: sweet-smelling, fragrant, Il. 6.483†.
khw/eis = khw/dhs.
ki/dnamai (ki/dnhmi = skeda/nnu=mi): *)hw/s, be diffused.
ki/qaris: cithara, lyre; for kiqaristu/s, Il. 13.731.
kiqaristu=/s cithara-playing. (See cut.)
kiklh/skw (kale/w): call by name, call, summon, mid., to oneself, Il. 9.569, Il. 10.300.
*ki/kones: the Ciconians, a Thracian tribe, Il. 2.846, Od. 9.39 ff.
ki=kus: force, Od. 11.393†.
*ki/likes: the Cilicians, a tribe of Greater Phrygia, dwelling under two leaders, in Hypoplacian Thebe and in Lyrnessus, Il. 6.397, 415.
*ki/lla: Cilla, a town in the Troad, Il. 1.38, 452.
*kimme/rioi: the Cimmerians, a fabulous people dwelling at the entrance of Hades, Od. 11.14†.
ki=ne/w (ki/w), aor. ki=/nhsa, pass. ki=nh/qh, 3 pl. e)ki=/nhqen: move, set in motion, disturb, stir, pass. intr., move, Il. 1.47.
ki=/numai, part. ki=nu/menos = ki=ne/omai, move on, march.
*kinu/rhs: a ruler in Cyprus, Il. 11.20†.
kinuro/s: whimpering, wailing, Il. 17.5†.
*ki/rkh: Circe, the enchantress, daughter of Helius, sister of Aeētes, dwelling in the isle of Aeaea, Od. 10.230 ff.
ki/rkos: a hawk or falcon that flies in circles, i=)/rhc, Od. 13.87; *)apo/llwnos a)/ggelos, Od. 15.526.
kirna/w, ki/rnhmi (parallel form of kera/nnu=mi), part. kirna=/s, ipf. e)ki/rna=: mix.
*kisshi/s: daughter of Cisses, Theāno, Il. 6.299†.
*kissh=s: a ruler in Thrace, the father of Theāno, Il. 11.223†.
kissu/bion: cup or bowl, originally of ivy-wood, for drinking or for mixing, Od. 9.346, Od. 14.78, Od. 16.52. (Od.)
ki/sth: box, chest, Od. 6.76†.

kixa=/nw, ki/xhmi, kixa=/nomai, fut. kixh/-
somai, pres. subj. kixei/w, inf. kixh=nai, kixh/menai, ipf. 2 sing. ki/xeis, -en, -h/thn, aor. kixh/sato, aor. 2 e)/kixe, ki/xon: overtake, come upon, find, freq. w. part., Il. 1.26, Il. 2.18.
ki/xlh: thrush, pl., Od. 22.468†.

ki/w, opt. ki/oi, kioi/thn, k<*>te, part. kiw/n, -ou=sa, ipf. e)/kion, ki/on: go, go away, usually of persons, rarely of things, Il. 6.422, Od. 15.149, Od. 16.177; the part. kiw/n is often employed for amplification, Od. 10.156, Od. 24.491.
ki=/wn, onos: pillar, very often of those that support the beams of a house. (See plate III. at end of vol., F and G.)
klaggh/ (kla/zw): scream, properly of birds, Od. 11.605; of animals, as the squealing of pigs, Od. 14.412; and of the loud cry of warriors, Il. 2.100; the sharp twang of a bowstring, Il. 1.49.
klagghdo/n: adv., with cries, Il. 2.463†.

kla/zw, aor. e)/klagca, perf. part., w. pres. signif., keklhgw/s, pl. keklh/gontes: scream, properly of birds, Il. 16.429; then of animals, Od. 14.30; applied also to warriors and to men under other circumstances, Il. 5.591, Od. 12.256, Il. 2.222; to things, as arrows, the wind, etc., Il. 1.46, Il. 17.88, Od. 12.408. The verb may be translated according to the context in the several passages, but its original and proper application shows its force. Cf. klaggh/.

klai/w, ipf. klai=on, iter. klai/eske, fut. klau/somai, aor. klau=se: weep, cry; freq. of lamenting the dead (either as natural or as formal ceremonial utterance), hence used transitively, Il. 19.300, Od. 1.263.
klau=se: see klai/w.
kla/w, aor. kla/se, pass. e)kla/sqh: break, break off, pass. intrans., Il. 11.584.
klehdw/n, o/nos, and klhhdw/n (kle/os): rumor, tidings, Od. 4.317; then of something heard as favorable omen, Od. 2.35, Od. 18.117, Od. 20.120.
kleito/s (kle/os): celebrated, famous, epith. of persons and of things; esp. e)pi/kouroi, e(kato/mbh, *g 451, Il. 1.447. (Il. and Od. 6.54.)
*klei=tos: (1) a Greek, the son of Mantius, Od. 15.249.—(2) a Trojan, the son of Pisēnor, companion of Polydamas, slain by Teucer, Il. 15.445.
klei/w, kle/w (1) (root klu, klu/w), pass. kle/omai, ipf. 2 sing. (e)/)kleo: celebrate, make famous; pass., Il. 24.202, Od. 13.299.
klei/w (2): see klhi=/w.
*kleo/boulos: a Trojan, slain by the lesser Ajax, Il. 16.330†.
*kleopa/trh: the wife of Meleāger, identical w. *)alkuo/nh, Il. 9.556†.

kle/os (root klu, klu/w), pl. kle/a= (shortened before a vowel): rumor, tidings, glory; so/n, e)mo\n kle/os, ‘news of thee,’ ‘of me,’ Od. 13.415 ; kle/os pro\s *trw/wn, ‘an honor to thee before the Trojans,’ Il. 22.415 ; a)ndrw=n kle/a=, glorious deeds (laudes), Il. 9.189.
kle/pths: thief, Il. 3.11†.
kleptosu/nh: thieving, trickery, Od. 19.396†.
kle/ptw, aor. e)/kleya: steal; then deceive, no/on tino/s, Il. 14.217; mh\ kle/pte no/w|, ‘do not hide things in thy heart,’ Il. 1.132.
*klewnai/: a town in Argolis, Il. 2.570†.
klh/dhn (kale/w): by name, Il. 9.11†.
klhhdw/n: see klehdw/n.
klh/qrh: alder, Od. 5.64 and 239.

klhi=/s, i=dos (Att. klei/s): (1) bolt, bar (see cuts Nos. 29 and 35, both from Egyptian originals); cut No. 56, in four compartments, shows above the open, below the closed door: on the left as seen from within; on the right from without. c, g, f, mark the place of the key - hole, through which the thong (i(ma=/s, Od. 1.442) ran, and the key was passed by which the bolt was first lifted (as is seen at g), a)ne/koyen, and then pushed back, a)pw=san. The adjoining cut (No. 68), from a Greek sepulchral monument, as well as No. 29, presupposes double bolts, and above on the right we see the key as it is applied, and below on the other half of the door the loosened thong. These bolts of double doors are also called e)piblh/s, o)xh=es. krupth=|, with hidden, concealed bolt.—(2) key, better described as hook, Il. 12.456. (See cut No. 56, f, g.)—(3) collar - bone.— (4) curved tongue of a buckle, Od. 18.294. (See cut No. 97.)—(5) pl., thole-pins, rowlocks, e)pi\ klhi=si, to which the oars were made fast by a thong, and round which they played, see cuts Nos. 120 and 32; for later, different arrangements, see cuts Nos. 38, 60, and the
Assyrian war - ship, cut No. 37. e)pi\ klhi=si, translate, at the oars.
klhi+sto/s: that may be closed, Od. 2.344†.
klhi=/w (Att. klei/w), aor. (e))klh/i=se, inf. klhi=sai: shut; o)xh=as, ‘draw forward’ the bolts closing the door, by means of the thong. (See cut No. 56.)

klh=ros: (1) lot, a stone or potsherd, on which each man scratched his mark, Il. 7.175. The lots were then shaken in a helmet, and he whose lot first sprang forth was thereby selected for the matter in hand.—(2) paternal estate, Od. 14.64.
klhto/s (kale/w): called, chosen, invited, Il. 9.165, Od. 17.386.
kli=mac, akos (kli=/nw): stair-way, ladder. (Od.)
klinth/r, h=ros: couch, sofa. (See cut.)

kli=/nw, aor. e)/kli=na, kli=nan, pass. aor. (e))kli/nqh, e)kli/qh, perf. 3 pl. kekli/atai, keklime/nos, plup. ke/klito, mid. aor. part. kli=na/menos: I. act., make to slope or incline, lean one thing against another, tini/ ti, or pro/s ti, *l 593, Od. 22.121; of turning away the eyes, Il. 3.427; turning the tide of battle (ma/xhn, inclinare pugnam), Il. 14.510, and esp. put to flight, Il. 5.37, Od. 9.59.—II. pass., bend oneself, sink or lie down; e)kli/nqh kai\ a)leu/ato??ra, e(te/rws' e)kli/nqh ka/rh, kli/nqh kekmhw/s, Il. 3.360, *n 543, Il. 23.232; be supported, lean against, tini/, *l 371, Od. 6.307, mid., Od. 17.340.

klisi/h (kli=/nw), dat. klisi/hfi: hut or lodge of shepherds, Il. 18.589, Od. 14.45, Od. 15.301, Od. 16.1; barrack (not exactly ‘tent’) of warriors, Il. 11.448 ff; often in pl.; also couch or easy-chair, Od. 4.123, Od. 19.55. (See cut No. 73.)
klisi/hqen: from the hut, from the barrack.
klisi/hnde: to the hut, to the barrack.
kli/sion (kli=/nw): an adjoining building for servants, etc., Od. 24.208†.
klismo/s (kli=/nw): reclining chair, easy-chair, Od. 1.145. (Cf. adjoining cut, or Nos. 105, 106.
kli=tu=/s, pl. acc. kli=tu=s: slope, hillside.

klone/w, klone/ei, pass. klone/ontai, ipf. klone/onto: put to rout, drive in confusion, pass., be driven or rush
wildly about; fig., of wind, driving clouds or flame, Il. 23.213, Il. 20.492; pass., Il. 4.302, Il. 21.528. (Il.)
*kloni/os: leader of the Boeotiaus, slain by Agēnor, Il. 2.495, Il. 15.340.
klo/nos: tumult; e)gxeia=/wn, ‘press of spears,’ Il. 5.167. (Il.)
klo/pios: deceitful, Od. 13.295†.
klotopeu/w: doubtful word, be wasting words or making fine speeches, Il. 19.149†.
klu/dwn, wnos (klu/zw): surge, billow, Od. 12.421†.
klu/zw, ipf. iter. klu/zeskon: of waves, plash, dash, Il. 23.61; aor. pass., ‘was dashed high,’ ‘rose in foam,’ Il. 11.392, Od. 9.484, 541.
klu=qi: see klu/w.
*klume/nh: (1) a Nereid, Il. 18.47.—(2) an attendant of Helen, Il. 3.144.—(3) daughter of Minyas or Iphis, mother of Iphiclus, Od. 11.326.
*klu/menos: king of the Minyans in Orchomenus, father of Eurydice, mortally wounded at Thebes, Od. 3.452.

*klutaimnh/strh: daughter of Tyndareus, sister of Helen, and wife of Agamemnon. She was slain at the same time that her paramour Aegisthus was killed by Orestes, Il. 1.113, Od. 3.266, 310, Od. 11.439. (See cut No. 33.)
*kluti/dhs: son of Clytius.—(1) Dolops.—(2) Piraeus.
*klu/tios: (1) a son of Laomedon, brother of Priam, and father of Calētor, Il. 15.419, 427, *g 147, Il. 20.238.—(2) father of Piraeus in Ithaca, Od. 16.327.— (3) a Greek, the father of Dolops.
kluto/ - ergos (ve/rgon): maker of famous works, Od. 8.345.
*klutomh/dhs: son of Enops of Aetolia, beaten by Nestor in a boxingmatch, Il. 23.634†.
*kluto/nhos: son of Alcinous, Od. 8.119, 123.
kluto/ - pwlos: with famous steeds, epithet of Hades, Il. 5.654 ff. Probably said with reference to the rape of Proserpine. (Il.)
kluto/s, 2 and 3 (klu/w): illustrious, glorious, epith. of gods and men; then of things, famous, fine, a)/lsos, mh=la, e)/rga, etc.; o)/noma, Od. 9.364, cf. Od. 19.183.
kluto - te/xnhs: famous in art, renowned artificer, epithet of Hephaestus.
kluto/-tocos: with glorious bow, illustrious archer, epith. of Apollo.

klu/w, ipf., w. aor. signif., e)/kluon, klu/on, e)/klue, aor. 2 imp. klu=qi, klu=te, redupl. ke/kluqi, ke/klute: hear, esp. hear willingly, hearken to prayer or entreaty; hence very often the imp., klu=qi/ meu, a)rguro/toce, ke/klute/ meu mu=/qwn, *a 37, Od. 10.189; also implying obedience, tou= ma/la me\n klu/on h)d' e)pi/qonto, *h 379, Od. 3.477; w. participle, e)/kluon au)dh/santos, Il. 10.47; freq. w. acc. of thing heard.
*klw=qes: the ‘Spinsters,’ i. e. the Fates, Od. 7.197†.
klwmako/eis, essa: rock - terraced, rocky, Il. 2.729†.
kna/w, ipf. (or aor.) knh=: grate (cheese), Il. 11.639†.
kne/fas (cf. gno/fos, dno/fos): darkness, dusk, of the first part of the night.
knh=: see kna/w.
knh/mh: the part of the leg between knee and ankle, shin.

knhmi=/s, i=dos (knh/mh): greave. The greaves were metal plates, lined with some soft material, bent around the shin-bone under the knee, and fastened by clasps at the ankle (see cut No. 36), thus only in the Iliad. In the Odyssey, Od. 24.229, the word signifies leather leggins.
knhmo/s: only pl., mountain - valleys (saltus).
knh=stis, dat. knh/sti= (kna/w): grater, or knife for grating, Il. 11.640†.

kni=/sh: the steam or savor of burnt offerings, originally fat, esp. that of the caul or diaphragm, in which the thighs of the victim were wrapped. It was then laid upon the fire and burned, together with pieces of flesh piled upon it, Il. 1.460.
kni=sh/eis, en: redolent of savory viands, Od. 10.10†.
knuzhqmo/s (knu/zw): whimpering, of dogs, Od. 16.163†.
knuzo/w, fut. -w/sw, aor. knu/zwse: render dim or lustreless, Od. 13.401 and 433.
knw/dalon: wild animal, Od. 17.317†.
*knwso/s: Cnosus, the principal city in Crete, Il. 2.646, Il. 18.591, Od. 19.178.
knw/ssw: slumber, Od. 4.809†.
koi=los (cf. cavus): hollow; often of places between mountains, o(do/s, *lakedai/mwn, Il. 23.419, Od. 4.1; limh/n, ‘deepembosomed,’ i. e. extending far into the land, Od. 10.92.

koima/w (cf. kei=mai), aor. (e))koi/mhsa, mid. ipf. koima=to, koimw=nto, aor. (e))koimh/sato, pass. aor. (e))koimh/qhn: act., put to bed or to rest, Od. 3.397, Od. 4.336; lull to sleep, tina\ u(/pnw|, Od. 12.372; fig. of winds, Od. 12.281; mid. and pass., lie down to sleep or to rest (esp. w. reference to the comfort or discomfort of the resting-place), sleep; fig. of the sleep of death, Il. 11.241.
koirane/w (koi/ranos): belord or ruler, rule, a)na/, kata/, dia/ tinas, whether in war or peace; of the suitors of Penelope, ‘playing the lord,’ ‘lording it,’ Od. 13.377.
koi/ranos (cf. ku=ros): lord, ruler, master, Od. 18.106.
*koi/ranos: (1) a Lycian, slain by Odysseus, Il. 5.677.—(2) from Lyctus in Crete, charioteer of Meriones, slain by Hector, Il. 17.611, 614.
koi/th (kei=mai): bed, Od. 19.341†.
koi=tos: night's rest, sleep, then resting-place, Od. 22.470.
koleo/n, kouleo/n: sheath or scabbard of a sword, made of metal, and decorated with ivory, Il. 11.30 ff., Il. 3.272.
kollh/eis (kolla/w): custa\ nau/maxa kollh/enta, ship - spears united with rings, Il. 15.389†.
kollhto/s (kolla/w): joined, wellcompacted or ‘shod,’ with bands or otherwise, di/fros, sani/des, Il. 19.395, *i 593, Od. 23.194.
ko/lloy, opos: peg of a lyre, round which the string was fastened, Od. 21.407†.
koloio/s: jack-daw. (Il.)
ko/los: docked, pointless, Il. 16.117†.
kolosurto/s: noisy rout, of the hunt, Il. 12.147 and Il. 13.472.
kolou/w (ko/los): cut short, curtail, only fig., Il. 20.370, Od. 8.211, Od. 10.340.
ko/lpos: bosom, also of the fold of the garment about neck and breast, Il. 9.570; fig. of the sea, qala/sshs, a(lo/s.
kolw|a/w (kolw|o/s), ipf. e(kolw/|a=: bawl, Il. 2.212†.
kolw/nh: hill. (Il.)
kolw|o/s: noisy wrangling, racket, Il. 1.575†.

koma/w (ko/mh): only part., wearing long hair; ka/rh komo/wntes *)axaioi/, ‘long-haired Achaeans;’ *)abantes o)/piqen komo/wntes, i. e. shorn in front, Il. 2.542 ; e)qei/rh|si, ‘with long manes,’ Il. 8.42.
kome/w, kome/ousi, ipf. e)ko/mei, komei/thn, iter. kome/eske: take care of, tend, by affording food, bed, clothing, bath, Od. 11.250; of animals, Od. 17.310, 319.
ko/mh: hair of the head, with reference to comeliness, pl., locks, Od. 6.231; then foliage, Od. 23.195.
komidh/: care, attendance, bestowed on persons, horses, garden, Od. 24.245, 247.

komi/zw (kome/w), fut. komiw=, aor. ko/missa, (e))ko/mise, mid. aor. (e))komi/ssato, komi/santo: I. act. (1) wait upon, attend, care for, esp. entertain as guest, Od. 10.73, Od. 17.113, cf. 111; of feeling (tina/ tini), Od. 20.69; pass., Od. 8.451.—(2) take or bring away to be cared for, fetch, convey, Il. 2.183, Il. 3.378, Il. 11.738, Il. 13.196, Il. 23.699, Od. 13.68.—II. mid., take to one's care, entertain hospitably, take or convey home or to oneself, Il. 5.359, Il. 8.284, Od. 14.316, Il. 1.594, Od. 6.268; of carrying off a spear in one's body, Il. 22.286.
kompe/w: clash, Il. 12.151†.
ko/mpos: clashing; ‘stamping’ of feet, Od. 8.380; ‘gnashing’ of the tusks of a wild boar, Il. 11.417, Il. 12.149.
konabe/w, aor. kona/bhsa: resound, ring, of echoing and of metallic objects, ph/lhc, nh=es, dw=ma. (Il. and Od. 17.542.)
konabi/zw = konabe/w. (Il.)
ko/nabos: din, Od. 10.122†.
koni=/h: dust, sand, ashes, Od. 11.600, Il. 23.502, Od. 7.153.
ko/nis, ios, dat. ko/ni==koni/h.
koni=/salos: dust - cloud, dust - whirl. (Il.)

koni=/w, fut. koni=/sousi, aor. e)ko/ni=sa, pass. perf. part. kekoni=me/nos, plup. keko/ni=to: make dust or make dusty, cover with dust; pass., Il. 22.405, Il. 21.541; intr., koni=/ontes pedi/oio, ‘scampering’ over the plain in a cloud of dust.
konto/s: punting-pole, pole, Od. 9.487†.
*kopreu/s: the father of Periphētes, herald of Eurystheus, Il. 15.639†.
kopre/w: only fut. part. koprh/sontes, for manuring the fields, Od. 17.299†.
ko/pros: dung, manure, Il. 24.164; then ‘farm-yard,’ ‘cow-yard,’ Il. 18.575.
ko/ptw, aor. ko/ye, perf. part. kekopw/s, mid. aor. ko/yato: knock, smite, hammer, Il. 18.379, Od. 8.274, mid., oneself or a part of oneself, Il. 22.33.
*ko/rakos pe/trh: Raven's Rock, in Ithaca, Od. 13.408†.

kore/nnu=mi, fut. kore/w, aor. e)ko/resa, pass. perf. keko/rhmai, part., act. w. pass. signif., kekorhw/s, aor. pass. (e))kore/sqhn,
aor. mid. (e))kore/(s)sato: sate, satisfy, tina/ tini, Il. 8.379; mid., satisfy oneself, tino/s; met., have enough of, be tired of, w. gen. or participle, Od. 20.59.
kore/w, aor. imp. korh/sate: sweep, sweep out, Od. 20.149†.
ko/rh: see kou/rh.
korqu/omai (ko/rus): rise to a head, tower up, Il. 9.7†.
*ko/rinqos: Corinth, Il. 2.570; anciently named Ephyra.—*korinqo/qi, at Corinth, Il. 13.664.
kormo/s (kei/rw): log, trunk of a tree, Od. 23.196†.
ko/ros: satiety, surfeit, tino/s.
ko/roh (ka/rh): temple. (Il.)
koruq-a=/i=+c (a=)i/ssw): helmet-shaking, with waving plume, Il. 22.132†.
koruq-ai/olos: with glancing helm; epith., esp. of Hector and Ares. (Il.)
ko/rumbos, pl. ko/rumba (cf. ko/rus, ka/rh): pl., the heads, bow-ends of a vessel, cf. a)/flasta, Il. 9.241†. (See cut No. 38.)
koru/nh: battle - mace, club of iron. (Il.)
korunh/ths: club-brandisher. (Il.)

ko/rus (cf. ka/rh), acc. ko/ruqa and ko/run: helmet; epithets, briarh/, daidale/h, i(ppoda/seia, i(ppo/komos, lampome/nh, lamprh/, panai/qh, tetra/falos, faeinh/, xalkh/reos, xalkopa/rh|os. (See cuts under these adjectives.)

koru/ssw, mid. aor. part. korussa/menos, pass. perf. part. kekoruqme/nos: arm the head with the helmet; then, in general, arm, equip, mid., arm oneself; of weapons, kekoruqme/na xalkw=|, with head of bronze, bronze-shod, Il. 3.18, Il. 16.802; met., po/lemon, ku=ma (cf. korqu/omai), Il. 21.306, Il. 4.424.
korusth/s, du. korusta=/: helmeted, hence armed, equipped for battle. (Il.)
korufh/ (cf. ko/rus, ka/rh): crest, summit. (Il. and Od. 9.121.)
korufo/w, mid. korufou=tai: mid., rise with towering crest; ku=ma (cf. korqu/omai), Il. 4.426†.
*korw/neia: Coronēa, a city in Boeotia, south of lake Copāis, Il. 2.503†.

korw/nh: anything crooked or curved. —(1) the ring on a door, Od. 1.441. (See cuts Nos. 68 and 56.)—(2) the curved end of the bow over which the loop of the bow-string was brought. (See cut No. 34.)—(3) sea-crow cormorant,, 66.
korwni/s, i/dos (korw/nh): curved, epith. of ships; always nhusi\ (or nh/essi) korwni/sin. (See cuts Nos. 38, 87, 88.)
*ko/rwnos: son of Caeneus, father of Leonteus, king of the Lapithae, Il. 2.746†.
kosme/w (ko/smos), aor. e)ko/smhsa, pass. aor. 3 pl. ko/smhqen, mid. aor. part. kosmhsa/menos: arrange, order, esp. marshall troops, mid., one's own men, Il. 2.806; of preparing a meal, Od. 7.13.
kosmhto/s: well laid out, Od. 7.127†.
kosmh/twr, oros: marshaller, in Il. always kosmh/tore la=w=n, of the Atrīdae and the Dioscūri; sing., Od. 18.152.

ko/smos: order, arrangement, then ornaments (of women), trappings (of horses); of building or construction, i(/ppou (the wooden), Od. 8.492; freq. ko/smw|, and (eu)=) kata\ ko/smon, both literally and figuratively, ‘duly,’ ‘becomingly,’ Od. 8.489; also ou) kata\ ko/smon, Od. 20.181.
kote/w, kote/omai, perf. part. kekothw/s, mid. aor. kote/ssato: be angry with, tini/, also w. causal gen., Il. 4.168.
koth/eis: wrathful, Il. 5.191†.
ko/tos: grudge, rancor, wrath.
kotu/lh: little cup, hip-joint, Il. 5.306.
kotulhdw/n, o/nos, dat. pl. kotulhdono/fin: pl., suckers at the ends of the tentaculae of a polypus, Od. 5.433†.
kotul-h/rutos (a)ru/w): that may be caught in cups, streaming, Il. 23.34†.
kouleo/n: see koleo/n.
kou/rh: young girl, daughter; also of young married women, Il. 6.247.
kou/rhtes (kou=ros), pl.: youths, usually princes.
*kourh=tes: the Curētes, a tribe in Aetolia, afterward expelled by the Aetolians; their siege of Calydon, Il. 9.529-599.

kouri/dios: doubtful word, regular, wedded, epith. of a)/loxos, po/sis, le/xos, as opposed to irregular connections; dw=ma, house of the husband, or princely house, Od. 19.580; as subst. (=po/sis), Od. 15.22.
kouri/zw: only part., when a young man, Od. 22.185†.
kouri/c: adv., by the hair, Od. 22.188†.

kou=ros: youth, boy, esp. of noble rank, so when applied to the attendants at sacrifices and banquets, as
these were regularly the sons of princely houses, Il. 1.470, Od. 1.148; also implying vigorous youth, ability to bear arms, Il. 17.726; son, Od. 19.523.
kouro/teros: younger; as subst., Il. 4.316.
kouro-tro/fos: nourisher of youths, Od. 9.27†.
kou=fos: light, agile; adv., kou=fa, quickly, Il. 13.158 ; koufo/teron, with lighter heart, Od. 8.201.
*ko/wn: son of Antēnor, slain by Agamemnon, Il. 11.248 -260, Il. 19.53.
*ko/wnde: see *kw=s.
kra=/ata, kra=/ati, kra=/atos: see ka/rh.
kradai/nw = krada/w, only mid. part., quivering. (Il.)
krada/w, part. krada/wn: brandish.

krai/nw, kraiai/nw, krai/nousi, ipf. e)krai/aine, aor. imp. krh/hnon, krh=non, inf. krhh=nai, krh=nai, mid. fut. inf. krane/esqai (for kekra=/antai, -nto, see kera/nnu=mi): accomplish, fulfil, bring to pass; fut. mid. as pass., Il. 9.626; ‘bear sway,’ Od. 8.391.
kraipno/s, comp. kraipno/teros: rapid, quick; fig., hasty, no/os, Il. 23.590.— Adv., kraipnw=s, also kraipna/, Il. 5.223.
*krana/h: name of an island, Il. 3.445.
kranao/s: rocky, epith. of Ithaca.
krane/esqai: see krai/nw.
kra/neia: cornel-tree, Il. 16.767, Od. 10.242.
kra=ni/on (kra=non): upper part of the skull, Il. 8.84†.
*kra/paqos (later *ka/rpaqos): an island near Rhodes, Il. 2.676.
kra=ta, kra=ti/: see ka/rh.
kratai-gu/alos: with strong breastplates, Il. 19.361†. (See cut No. 55.)
krataii=/s: overpowering force, ‘weight’ we should say, i. e. the force of gravitation, in the stone of Sisyphus, Od. 11.597.—Personified, *krataii=/s, Crataeis, the mother of Scylla, Od. 12.124.
krataio/s: powerful, mighty; *moi=ra, qh/r (lion), Il. 11.119.
kratai/-pedos (pe/don): with strong (hard) footing or surface, Od. 23.46†.
kratero/s, kartero/s, kraterh=fi: strong, powerful, mighty, of persons and things, and sometimes in bad sense, mu=qos, ‘stern,’ Il. 1.25.—Adv., kraterw=s.
kratero/-frwn: stout-hearted, dauntless.
krater-w=nuc (o)/nuc): strong-hoofed, strong-clawed.
kra=/tesfi: see ka/rh.

krateutai/: explained by Aristarchus as head-stones, on which the spits were rested in roasting meat; cf. our ‘fire - dogs,’ ‘andirons.’ Possibly the shape was like the horns (ke/ras) on the altar in cut No. 95. Il. 9.214†.
krate/w (kra/tos): be superior in might, have power, rule over, tino/s, sometimes tisi/n (among), Od. 11.485, Od. 16.265 ; krate/wn, ‘with might.’
kra/tos, ka/rtos, eos: superior strength, might, power, then mastery, victory, Od. 1.359, Od. 21.280.
kra=to/s: see ka/rh.
kratu/s = kratero/s, epith. of Hermes.
kre/as, atos, pl. kre/a and kre/ata, gen. krew=n and kreiw=n, dat. kre/asin: flesh, meat, pl., pieces of dressed meat; kre/a, Od. 9.347.
krei=on (kre/as): meat-tray, dresser, Il. 9.206†.
krei/sswn, on: stronger, superior in strength or might, better; w. inf., Od. 21.345.
*kreiontia/dhs: son of Creon, Lycomēdes, Il. 19.240†.

krei/wn, ousa, properly part.: ruling, ruler; eu)ru\ krei/wn, ‘ruling far and wide,’ title esp. of Agamemnon, as generalissimo of the Greek forces; also of Zeus and Poseidon; more freely applied, Od. 4.22.
*krei/wn: Creon.—(1) a king of Thebes, the father of Megara, Od. 11.269. —(2) father of Lycomēdes.
krema/nnu=mi, kre/mamai, fut. kremo/w, aor. kre/mase, mid. ipf. (e))kre/mw: hang, hang up, mid. intrans., Il. 15.18.
krew=n: see kre/as.
krh/guos: good, useful, helpful, Il. 1.106†.
krh/demnon (ka/rh, de/w): head-band; in women's attire, a short veil, as seen in the cut, Od. 1.334; also of the ‘battlements’ of cities, Od. 13.388; ‘lid’ of a wine-jar, Od. 3.392. (See cut No. 64.)
krhh=nai: see krai/nw.
krh=qen: see kata/krhqen.
*krhqeu/s: Cretheus, of Iolcus, the husband of Tyro, Od. 11.237, 258.
*krh/qwn: son of Diocles, slain by Aenēas, Il. 5.542, 549.
krhmno/s (kre/mamai): steep, over hanging bank, often of the gullied banks of the Scamander, Il. 21.26, 175.
krhnai=os (krh/nh): of the fount, nu/mfai, fountain-nymphs, Od. 17.240†.
krh/nh: fount, spring; krh/nhnde, to the spring, Od. 20.154. (Cf. cut No. 61.)
*krh/s, pl. *krh=tes: the Cretans, inhabitants of Crete.
*krh/th, also pl. *krh=tai: Crete; epithets, e(kato/mpolis, eu)rei=a, Od. 19.172, 175.— *krh/thnde, to Crete, Od. 19.186 ; *krh/thqen, from Crete, Il. 3.233.

krhth/r, h=ros (kera/nnu=mi): mixingbowl, wassail-bowl, in which wine and water were mingled, to be distributed in cups; two parts of wine to three of water was a common mixture; krhth=ra mi/sgesqai, sth/sasqai, ‘set up,’ place at hand. The wassail-bowl was usually placed near the hearth, and often on a tripod (esp. when several krhth=res were in use at the banquet); the contents were poured into the cups (de/paa) by means of a filler (pro/xoos, pitcher), Od. 3.339. Cut No. 8 shows (1) the a)mfiforeu/s, from which the wine was poured into the upper, smaller mixing-bowl, on which the pro/xoos stands. The second mixing-bowl served to contain the water, and then the contents of both bowls may be imagined as mixed in the largest bowl, which stands upon the tripod, and from which the diluted wine was distributed. (Cf. cut No. 26.)
kri= = kriqh/.
kri/zw, aor. 2 kri/ke: creak, said of the yoke under a strain, Il. 16.470.
kriqh/, only pl. kriqai/: barley, barleycorn.
kri/ke: see kri/zw.
kri/kos (ki/rkos): yoke-ring, Il. 24.272†. (See adjoining cut, from the antique; still clearer are cuts Nos. 42, 45.)

kri=/nw, imp. kri=ne, pass. perf. part. kekrime/nos, aor. krinqe/ntes, mid. aor. e)kri=/nato, subj. kri=/nwntai, inf. kri=/nasqai, part. kri=na/menos: I. act., separate, karpo/n te kai\ a)/xna=s, Il. 5.501; hence of arranging troops, Il. 2.446; then select, Il. 6.188; freq. the pass., Il. 13.129, Od. 13.182; decide (cernere), nei=kos, qe/mistas, Od. 18.264, Il. 16.387; ou)=ros kekri- me/nos, a ‘decided’ wind, Il. 14.19.—II. mid., select or choose for oneself; Od. 4.408, Od. 8.36; get a contest decided, ‘measure oneself’ in battle, kri=/nesqai *)/arhi (decernere proelio), Il. 2.385; abs. Od. 24.507, cf. Od. 16.269; of ‘interpreting’ dreams, Il. 5.150.
krio/s: ram. (Od.)
*kri=sa: a town in Phocis, near Delphi, termed zaqe/h, Il. 2.520.
krito/s (kri=/nw): chosen, Il. 7.434 and Od. 8.258.
kroai/nw (krou/w): gallop. (Il.)
*kroi=smos: a Trojan, slain by Meges, Il. 15.523†.
kroko/-peplos: with saffron-colored mantle, saffron - robed; epith. of Eos. (Il.)
kro/kos: saffron, Il. 14.348†.
*kroku/leia: an island or a village belonging to Ithaca, Il. 2.633†.
kro/muon: onion.
*kroni/dhs: son of Cronus, Zeus, often used alone without *zeu/s, Il. 4.5.
*kroni=/wn = *kroni/dhs.
*kro/nos: Cronus (Saturnus), the father of Zeus, Poseidon, Hades, Hera, Demēter, and Hestia; overthrown with the Titans, Il. 8.415, 479, 383, Il. 5.721.
kro/ssai (cf. ko/rsh, ka/rh): pu/rgwn, walls or breasting of the towers, between foundations and battlements, Il. 12.258, 444.
krotali/zw (kro/talon): rattle; o)/xea krota/lizon, ‘drew the rattling chariots,’ Il. 11.160†.
kro/tafos (cf. ko/rsh, ka/rh): temples of the head, Il. 4.502, Il. 20.397; usually pl.
krote/w (kro/tos) = krotali/zw, Il. 15.453†.
*krounoi/: ‘Springs,’ a place in Elis, Od. 15.295†.
krouno/s: source, spring. (Il.)
kru/bda, kru/bdhn: secretly.
kruero/s (kru/os): chilling, dread.
kruo/eis = kruero/s. (Il.)
krupto/s: concealed, secret, Il. 14.168†.

kru/ptw, ipf. iter. kru/ptaske, fut. kru/yw, aor. e)/kruya, pass. aor. kru/fqh, perf. part. kekrumme/nos: hide, conceal, sometimes implying protection, tina\ sa/kei+, kefala=\s koru/qessi, cf. kalu/ptw; pass., kru/fqh u(p a)spi/di, ‘hid himself,’ Il. 13.405; met., ‘keep secret,’ e)/pos tini/, Od. 11.443.
kru/stallos: clear ice, ice, Od. 14.477 and Il. 22.152.
krufhdo/n: secretly, Od. 14.330 and Od. 19.299.
*krw=mna: a locality in Paphlagonia, Il. 2.855†.
kta/men(ai): see ktei/nw.
kta/omai, aor. 2 sing. e)kth/sw, perf. inf. e)kth=sqai: acquire, perf. possess, Il. 9.402; of acquiring for another than oneself, Od. 20.265.
kte/ar, dat. pl. ktea/tessi: pl., possessions, property.
kteati/zw, aor. ktea/tissa=kta/omai.
*kte/atos: son of Actor and Molione, Il. 2.621.

ktei/nw, ipf. ktei=non, iter. ktei/neske, fut. ktene/ei, part. ktane/onta, aor. e)/kteina, ktei=ne, aor. 2 e)/ktanon, kta/non, also e)/kta, e)/ktamen, e)/ktan, subj. kte/wmen, inf. kta/menai, pass. pres. inf. kteinesqai, aor. 3 pl. e)/ktaqen, aor. 2 mid., w. pass. signif., kta/sqai, kta/menos: kill, slay, esp. in battle; rarely of animals, Il. 15.587, Od. 12.379, Od. 19.543; pass., Il. 5.465; aor. mid. as pass., Il. 15.558.
kte/ras = kte/ar, Il. 10.216 and Il. 24.235.
kte/rea, pl.: possessions burned in honor of the dead upon the funeralpyre, hence funeral honors, obsequies (extremi honores), always with kterei+/zein.

kteri/zw+, kterei+/zw, inf. kterei+ze/men, fut. kteriw=, aor. opt. kteri/seie, inf. kterei+/cai: bury with solemn honors; a)e/qlois, ‘celebrate one's funeral with games,’ Il. 23.646 ; e)pi\ (adv.) ktere/a kterei+/cai, ‘bestow funeral honors upon’ one, Od. 1.291, Il. 24.38.
kth=ma (kta/omai): possession, property, sing., Od. 15.19; elsewhere pl., in the Iliad mostly of treasures, Il. 7.350, Il. 9.382.
*kth/sios: the father of Eumaeus, Od. 15.414†.
*kth/sippos: son of Polytherses, from Same, one of the suitors of Penelope, slain by Philoetius, Od. 20.288, Od. 22.279, 285.
kth=sis, ios (kta/omai): property.
kthto/s: that may be acquired, I 407†.
kti/deos (i)kti/s): of weasel-skin; kune/h, Il. 10.335 and 458.
kti/zw, aor. e)/ktisa, kti/sse: settle, found, a city or land.
kti/los: ram, Il. 3.196 and Il. 13.492.
*ktime/nh: daughter of Laertes, sister of Odysseus, settled in marriage in Same, Od. 15.363.
ktupe/w, aor. e)/ktupe: crash, thunder; of falling trees, the bolts of Zeus.
ktu/pos: any loud noise such as a crash, thunder; of the stamping of the feet of men, or the hoofs of horses, the tumult of battle, and the bolts of Zeus, Od. 16.6, Il. 10.532, Il. 12.338.
ku/amos: bean, pl., Il. 13.589†.

ku=a/neos (ku/anos): of steel, Il. 18.564, then steel-blue, dark blue, dark; of the brows of Zeus, Il. 1.528; the hair of Hector, Il. 22.402; a serpent, Il. 11.26; earth or sand, Od. 12.243; and esp. nefe/lh, ne/fos, even in metaphor, Il. 16.66, Il. 4.282.
ku=ano/-peza: with steel-blue feet, tra/peza, Il. 11.629†.
kuano/-prw|ros and kuano-prw/|reios (prw/|ra=): dark - prowed, dark - bowed, epith. of ships.
ku/anos: probably blue steel, Il. 11.24, 35, and Od. 7.87.
ku=ano-xai/ths and ku=ano-xai=ta: the dark-haired, epith. of Poseidon, also as subst.; dark-maned, i(/ppos, Il. 20.224.
kuan-w=pis, idos: dark-eyed, Od. 12.60†.
kuberna/w, aor. inf. kubernh=sai: steer, nh=a, Od. 3.283†.
kubernh/ths, ew, and kubernhth/r, h=ros: helmsman, pilot. (Od.)
kubista/w (ku/bh, head, found only in glossaries), ipf. kubi/stwn: turn somersaults, tumble, Il. 16.745, 749; of fishes, Il. 21.354.
kubisthth/r, h=ros: tumbler; diver, Il. 16.750.

ku=da/limos (ku=dos): glorious, noble,
epith. of persons, and of kh=r, as typical of the person.
ku=da/nw: glorify, exalt; intrans., exult, Il. 20.42.
ku=di-a/neira: man-ennobling, a)gorh/, ma/xh. (Il.)
ku=dia/w, part. ku=dio/wn: triumph, be proud. (Il.)
ku=/distos: most glorious.
kudoime/w, aor. kudoi/mhsan: rush tumultuously, spread confusion; trans., throw into confusion, Il. 15.136.
kudoimo/s: uproar, confusion, din or mêlée of battle; personified, Il. 5.593, Il. 18.535.
ku=dos, eos: glory, majesty, might; of persons, in address, me/ga ku=dos *)axaiw=n, ‘pride of the Greeks,’ Nestor and Odysseus, Il. 10.87, Od. 9.673.
kudro/s: glorious, illustrious, always kudrh\ para/koitis.
*ku/dwnes: the Cydonians, a tribe in the northwest of Crete, Od. 3.292, Od. 19.176.
kue/w: conceive, carry in the womb; of a mare with mule foal, Il. 23.266.
ku/qe: see keu/qw.
*kuqe/reia: Cytherēa, epithet of Aphrodite, from the island of Cythēra.

*ku/qhra, pl.: Cythēra, an island off the coast of Laconia, S.W. of the promontory of Malēa, where the worship of Aphrodite had been introduced by an early Phoenician colony, Od. 9.81, Il. 15.432. —*kuqhro/qen, from Cythēra, Il. 15.538. —Adj. *kuqh/rios, of Cythēra, Il. 10.268, Il. 15.431.

kuka/w, part. kuko/wnti, ipf. e)ku/ka=, aor. ku/khse, pass. kukh/qhn: stir up, stir in, mix up; met., only pass., be stirred up, ‘panic-stricken,’ Il. 20.489; of waves and the sea, foam up, be in commotion, Il. 21.235, Od. 12.238.
kukew/n, acc. kukew=: a mixed drink, compounded of barley meal, grated cheese, and wine, Il. 11.624; Circe adds also honey, Od. 10.290, 234.
kukle/w: wheel away, carry forth, of corpses, Il. 7.332†.

ku/klos, pl. ku/kloi and ku/kla: ring, circle; do/lios, employed by hunters for capturing game, Od. 4.792 ; i(ero/s, the solemn circle of a tribunal, etc., Il. 18.504; wheel, Il. 23.340, pl., ta\ ku/kla, *e 722, Il. 18.375; of the rings on the outside of a shield, or the layers which, lying one above the other and gradually diminishing in size toward the boss, made up the whole disc, Il. 11.33, Il. 20.280.
kuklo/se: in a circle, Il. 4.212 and Il. 17.392.
kuklo-terh/s, e/s (tei/rw): circular, Od. 17.209; stretch or draw ‘into a circle,’ Il. 4.124.

*ku/klwy, pl. *ku/klwpes: Cyclops, pl., the Cyclōpes; sing., Polyphēmus, whose single eye was blinded by Odysseus, Od. 9.428. The Cyclōpes are in Homer a lawless race of giants, dwelling without towns, social ties, or religion, Od. 9.166.
ku/knos: swan.

kuli/ndw, part. neut. kuli/ndon, pass. ipf. (e))kuli/ndeto, aor. kuli/sqh: roll; *bore/hs ku=ma, Od. 5.296; fig., ph=ma/ tini, Il. 17.688; pass., be rolled, roll, of a stone, Od. 11.598; of persons in violent demonstrations of grief, Il. 22.414, Od. 4.541; met., Il. 11.347, Od. 8.81.
*kullh/nh: Cyllēne, a mountain-chain in northern Arcadia, Il. 2.603.
*kullh/nios: Cyllenian.—(1) epith. of Hermes, from his birthplace, Mt. Cyllēne in Arcadia, Od. 24.24.—(2) an inhabitant of the town Cyllēne in Elis, Il. 15.518.
kullo-podi=/wn, voc. -po/di=on (kullo/s, pou/s): crook-footed, epith. of Hephaestus. (Il.)
ku=ma (ku/w): wave, billow; kata\ ku=ma, ‘with the current,’ Od. 2.429.
ku=mai/nw: only part., po/nton ku=mai/nonta, billowy deep. (Od.)
ku/mbaxos: head foremost, Il. 5.586; as subst., crown or top of a helmet, the part in which the plume is fixed, Il. 15.536. (See cuts Nos. 16 and 17.)
ku/mindis: night-hawk, called in the older language xalki/s, Il. 14.291.
*ku=mo-do/kh and *kumoqo/h: Nereids, Il. 18.39, 41†.
kuna/-muia: dog-fly, an abusive epithet applied by Ares to Athēna, Il. 21.394.

kune/h: properly ‘dog - skin,’ a soldier's cap, generally of leather, taurei/h, Il. 10.257; ktide/h, Il. 10.335; also mounted with metal, xalkh/rhs, xalkopa/rh|os, and pa/gxalkos, helmet, Od. 18.378; the kune/h ai)gei/h was a goat - skin cap for country wear (like that of the oarsmen in cut No. 38), Od. 24.231 ; *)/aidos, the cap of Hades, rendered the wearer invisible, Il. 5.845.
ku/neos: dog - like, i. e. shameless, Il. 9.373†.

kune/w, ipf. ku/neon, ku/nei, aor. e)/kusa, ku/(s)se, inf. ku/ssai: kiss; ku/sse de/ min kefalh/n te kai\ a)/mfw fa=ea ka=la\ | xei=ra/s t' a)mfote/ra=s (this shows the range of the word), Od. 16.15, cf. Od. 17.39 ; a)/rouran, his native soil, Od. 13.354.
kun-hge/ths (ku/wn, h(ge/omai): literally leader of dogs, i. e. hunter, pl., Od. 9.120†.
kuno-raisth/s (r(ai/w): literally dogbreaker (cf. ‘house-breaker’), i. e. flea, pl., Od. 17.300†.
*ku=nos: a harbor-town of Locris, Il. 2.531†.
ku/nteros, comp., sup. ku/ntatos: more (most) dog like, i. e. shameless, impudent, audacious, Il. 10.503.
kun - w/phs, voc. kunw=pa, and kunw=pis, idos: literally dog-faced, i. e. impudent, shameless.
*kuparissh/eis: a town in Elis, Il. 2.593†.
kupari/ssinos: of cypress wood, Od. 17.340†.
kupa/rissos: cypress, evergreen, Od. 5.64†.
ku/peiron: fragrant marsh - grass, perhaps ‘galingal,’ used as food for horses, Od. 4.603.
ku/pellon: drinking - cup, goblet, Il. 24.305, cf. 285, Il. 9.670.
*ku/pris: Cypris, epith. of Aphrodīte, from the island of Cyprus, Il. 5.330.
*ku/pros: the island of Cyprus, Od. 4.83 .—*kupronde, to Cyprus, Il. 11.21.
ku/ptw, aor. opt. ku/yei(e), part. ku/ya=s: bend the head, bow down. (Il. and Od. 11.585.)

kure/w, ku=/rw, ipf. ku=re, aor. inf. kurh=sai, part. ku/rsa=s, mid. pres. ku=/retai: chance upon, encounter, ipf. try to hit, aim, Il. 23.281; w. e)pi/ or dat. merely, Il. 24.530; of colliding in the race, Il. 23.428. Cf. tugxa/nw.
ku/rma (kure/w): what one chances upon, hence prey, booty; usually with e(/lwr, Il. 5.488.
ku/rsa=s: see kure/w.
kurto/s: curved, rounded, arched. (Il.)
kurto/w: make curved; ku=ma kurtwqe/n, ‘arched,’ Od. 11.244†.
ku/stis: bladder. (Il.)
*ku/twros: a town in Paphlagonia, Il. 2.853.
ku=fo/s (ku/ptw): bowed, bent, Od. 2.16†.
*ku/fos: a town in Perrhaebia in Thessaly, Il. 2.748†.
ku/w: see kue/w and kune/w.

ku/wn, kuno/s, acc. ku/na, voc. ku/on, pl. dat. ku/nessi: dog, bitch; ku/nes qhreutai/, trapezh=es, ‘hunting’ and ‘lapdogs,’ *)ai/da=o, i. e. Cerberus, Il. 8.368, Od. 11.623; ‘sea-dog,’ perhaps seal, Od. 12.96; dog of Orīon, Sirius, Il. 22.29; as symbol of shamelessness, applied to women and others, Il. 13.623 ; lusshth/r, ‘raging hound,’ Il. 8.299.
kw=as, pl. kw/ea, dat. kw/esin: fleece, serving for seat or bedding, Od. 16.47, Il. 9.661, Od. 3.38.
kw/deia: poppy-head, Il. 14.499†.
kwku=to/s (kwku/w): wailing. As proper name *kwku=to/s, Coc&ymacr;tus, river of the nether world, Od. 10.514.
kw/lhy, hpos: bend or hollow of the knee, Il. 23.726†.
kw=ma (koima/w): deep sleep.
*kw=pai: a town on lake Copāis in Boeotia, Il. 2.502†.
kw/ph: handle of sword or oar, hilt, oar; of a key, Od. 21.7. (See cut No. 68.)
kwph/eis: hilted.
kw/rukos: leather knapsack or wallet. (Od.)
*kw=s: the island of Cos, Il. 2.677 .— *ko/wnde, to Cos, Il. 15.28.
kwfo/s (ko/ptw): blunted, Il. 11.390; ‘dull - sounding,’ of a wave before it breaks, Il. 14.16 ; kwfh\ gai=a, dull, ‘senseless’ dust, of a dead body, Il. 24.54.

div1.head: *l
div1.entryFree: la=as, la=os, dat. la=i, acc. la=an, du. la=e, pl. gen. la=/wn, dat. la=/essi: stone.
*la/as: a town in Laconia, Il. 2.585†.
labr - ago/rhs (la/bros): reckless talker, Il. 23.479†.
labreu/omai: talk rashly, Il. 23.474 and 478.
la/bros, sup. labro/tatos: rapid, rushing.

lagxa/nw, aor. e)/laxon, la/xen, redupl. subj. lela/xhte, perf. le/logxen: obtain by lot or by destiny, obtain, receive; abs., Il. 7.171; reversing the usual relation, *kh\r la/xe geino/menon, ‘won me to her power at my birth,’ Il. 23.79; w. part. gen., Il. 24.76, Od. 5.311; causative, ‘put in possession of,’ ‘honor with,’ qano/nta puro/s, only with redupl. aor., *h 80, etc.; intrans., ‘fall by lot,’ Od. 9.160.
lagwo/s (Att. lagw/s): hare.
*lae/rkhs: (1) son of Aemon, father of Alcimedon, a Myrmidon, Il. 16.197.— (2) a goldsmith in Pylos, Od. 3.425.
*la=e/rths: Laertes, son of Arcīsius, and father of Odysseus, king in Ithaca, Od. 1.430, Od. 24.206, 270, Od. 4.111, 555, x 185, Od. 24.219 ff.
*la=ertia/dhs: son of Laertes, Odysseus.

la/zomai (=lamba/nw), opt. 3 pl. lazoi/ato, ipf. (e))la/zeto: take; gai=an o)da/c, ‘bite the dust,’ Il. 2.418 ; mu=qon pa/lin, ‘caught back again’ the words (of joy which were on his lips), Od. 13.254.
laqi-khdh/s, e/s (kh=dos): causing to forget care, ‘banishing care,’ Il. 22.83†.
la=/i+gc, iggos: pebble. (Od.)
lai=lay, apos: tempest of wind and rain, hurricane.
laimo/s: throat, gullet. (Il.)

laish/ion: light shield or target; laish/ia ptero/enta, perhaps so called on account of the ‘fluttering’ apron of untanned leather (la/sios) hanging from the shield. (See adjoining cut and esp. No. 79.)
*laistru=go/nios: Laestrygonian, Od. 10.82, Od. 23.318.
*laistru=gw/n, pl. *laistru=go/nes: Laestr&ymacr;gon, the Laestr&ymacr;gons, a tribe of savage giants, Od. 10.106, 119, 199.
lai=tma: the great gulf or abyss of the sea, usually w. a(lo/s or qala/sshs. (Od. and Il. 19.267.)
lai=fos, eos: shabby, tattered garment, Od. 13.399 and Od. 20.206.
laiyhro/s: nimble, swift; adv., laiyhra\ e)nw/ma=, ‘plied nimbly,’ Il. 15.269.
la/ke: see la/skw.
lakti/zw: kick with the heel, of the mortally wounded, struggling convulsively, Od. 18.99 and Od. 22.88.

lamba/nw, only aor. 2 act. and mid., e)/llab(e), e)lla/bet(o), inf. redupl. lelabe/sqai: take, receive, mid., take hold of; freq. w. part. gen.; sometimes of ‘seizing,’ ‘taking captive,’ Od. 11.4, Il. 11.114; in friendly sense, ‘take in,’ Od. 7.255; met., of feelings, xo/los, pe/nqos, tro/mos, etc.
*la/mos: the king of the Laestr&ymacr;gons, Od. 10.81†.
lampeta/w = la/mpw.
*lampeti/dhs: son of Lampus, Dolops, Il. 15.526†.
*lampeti/h: a nymph, daughter of Helius, Od. 12.132, 375.
*la/mpos: (1) son of Laomedon, father of the Trojan Dolops, Il. 3.147, Il. 15.526.—(2) name of one of the steeds of Eos, Od. 23.246.—(3) one of Hector's horses, Il. 8.185.
lampro/s, sup. lampro/tatos: bright, brilliant, shining. (Il. and Od. 19.234.)
lampth/r, h=ros: fire - pan, lightstand, cresset, to hold blazing pine splinters for illuminating, Od. 18.307, Od. 19.63. (See cuts, after bronze originals from Pompeii.)
la/mpw, ipf. e)/lamp(e), la/mf): shine, gleam, be radiant or brilliant.

lanqa/nw, lh/qw, ipf. (e))la/nqanon, e)/lhqon, lh=qen, iter. lh/qeske, fut. lh/sw, aor. 2 e)/laqon, la/qon, subj. redupl. le- la/qh|, mid. lh/qomai, ipf. lanqano/mhn, aor. 2 la/qeto, redupl. lela/qonto, opt. 3 pl. laqoi/ato, imp. redupl. lelaqe/sqw, perf. le/lastai, part. lelasme/nos: I. act., escape the notice of, tina/, the obj. of the Greek verb usually appearing as the subj. in Eng., ou)de/ se lh/qw, ‘nor dost thou ever fail to mark me,’ Il. 1.561, Od. 17.305; the thing that one does when somebody else fails to mark him is regularly expressed by the part., a)/llon pou/ tina ma=llon *)axaiw=n xalkoxitw/nwn | lh/qw marna/menos, se\ de\ vidmenai au)to\n o)i=/w, ‘another perchance is likely enough to overlook my prowess, but you know it right well,’ Il. 13.272. The learner cannot afford to be careless about the above meaning and construction. Sometimes w. o(/ti or o(/pws, o(/te, Il. 17.626. The redupl. aor. is causative, make to forget; tina/ tinos, Il. 15.60.—II. mid., forget; tino/s, *d 127, Od. 3.224.
la/c: adv., with the heel, with podi/, Il. 10.158 and Od. 15.45.
*lao/-gonos: (1) a Trojan, the son of Onētor, slain by Meriones, Il. 16.604. —(2) a Trojan, the son of Bias, slain by Achilles, Il. 20.460.
*la=o/damas: (1) son of Antēnor, slain by Ajax, Il. 15.516.—(2) a Phaeacian, son of Alcinous, Od. 8.119, 132, h 170, Od. 8.117, 141.
*la=oda/meia: daughter of Bellerophon, and mother of Sarpēdon, Il. 6.198.
*la=odi/kh: Laodice.—(1) a daughter of Agamemnon, Il. 9.145, 287.—(2) a daughter of Priam, wife of Helicāon, Il. 3.124, Il. 6.252.
*la=o/dokos: (1) a son of Antēnor, Il. 4.87.—(2) a comrade of Antilochus, Il. 17.699.
*laoqo/h: daughter of Altes, mother of Lycāon, Il. 21.85, Il. 22.48.
*la=omedontia/dhs: son or descendant of Laomedon.—(1) Priam, Il. 3.250.—(2) Lampus, Il. 15.527.

*la=ome/dwn: Laomedon, son of Ilus and father of Priam. He had promised his daughter Hesione to Heracles, on condition of her being delivered from the sea-monster sent by Poseidon to ravage the Troad, but proving false to his agreement was slain by Heracles, Il. 5.638 ff., 269, Il. 6.23, Il. 20.237, Il. 21.443.

la=o/s, pl. la=oi/: people, host, esp.
army; sometimes crew, crews, Od. 14.248; oftener the pl. than the sing., Il. 4.199, Il. 5.573.
la=o-sso/os (seu/w): driving the people on (to combat), rousing the people; epith. of Ares, Eris, Athēne (Apollo, Amphiarāus), Il. 13.128, Od. 22.210.
la=o - fo/ros: o(do/s, public way, Il. 15.682†.
lapa/rh: the soft part of the body between hips and ribs, flank, loins. (Il.)
*lapi/qai: the Lapithae, a warlike tribe dwelling by Mts. Olympus and Pelion in Thessaly, Il. 12.128, 181, Od. 21.297.
la/ptw, fut. part. la/yontes: lap up with the tongue, Il. 16.161†.
*la=/ri=sa: a town in Asia Minor, near Cyme, Il. 2.841, Il. 17.301.
la/ros: a sea bird, cormorant, with o)/rni=s, Od. 5.51†.
la=ro/s, sup. la=rw/tatos: rich, fine, well-relished, Il. 17.572.
la/sios: hairy, shaggy, epith. of sth=qos, also kh=r, as sign of manly strength and spirit; of sheep, wolly, Od. 9.433.

la/skw, aor. 2 la/ke, perf. part. w. pres. signif. lelhkw/s, lelakui=a: give voice, of animals, Scylla (as dog), a falcon, Il. 22.141; of things, sound, xalko/s, a)spi/s, o)ste/a. (Il. and Od. 12.85.)
laukani/h: throat, gullet. (Il.)
lau/rh: lane, side - passage between the house (of Odysseus) and the outer wall of the court, Od. 22.128, 137. (See plate III., o, n.)
lafu/ssw: gulp down, swallow. (Il.)
la/xe: see lagxa/nw.
la/xeia: with good soil for digging, fertile, nh=sos, Od. 9.116 and Od. 10.509.
la/xnh: woolly hair, down, Il. 10.134; sparse hair or beard, Il. 2.219, Od. 11.320.
laxnh/eis: hairy, shaggy. (Il.)
la/xnos = la/xnh, wool, Od. 9.445†.
la/w, part. la/wn, ipf. la/e: doubtful word, ‘bury the teeth in,’ of a dog strangling a fawn, Od. 19.229 f.

le/bhs, htos: kettle, caldron, for warming water or for boiling food over fire, Il. 21.362; in the Odyssey usually, basin, wash-basin, held under the hands or feet while water was poured from a pitcher over them, Od. 19.386; called a)nqemo/eis, from the decoration, Od. 3.440.

le/gw, ipf. e)/leg), le/ge, le/gomen, fut. part. le/contes, aor. e)/lecen, imp. le/con, mid. pres. subj. legw/meqa, ipf. le/gonto, fut. le/comai, aor. le/cato, aor. 2 e)le/gmhn, e)/lekto, le/kto, imp. le/co, le/ceo, pass. aor. e)le/xqhn. The above forms are common to two distinct roots leg, gather, and lex, lay. —I. root leg, gather, collect, Il. 23.239, Il. 10.755, Od. 18.359, Od. 24.72, 224; count, Od. 4.452; pass., Il. 3.188; then enumerate, recount, tell, relate, Il. 2.222, Od. 5.5, Od. 11.374; mid., collect for oneself, count oneself in, select, Il. 8.507, 547, Od. 9.335, Il. 2.125; le/kto a)riqmo/n, counted over the number (for himself), Od. 4.451; also talk over (with one another), mhke/ti tau=ta legw/meqa, Od. 3.240.—II. root lex, act. aor. 1, lay, put to bed or to rest, Il. 24.635; met., Il. 14.252; mid., fut. and aor. 1 and 2, lay oneself down, lie down to sleep, lie, Od. 4.413, 453, Il. 4.131, *q 519, Il. 9.67.
leiai/nw (lei=os), fut. leiane/w, aor. 3 pl. lei/hnan, part. leih/na=s: make smooth, smooth, level off, Od. 8.260.

lei/bw, ipf. lei=be, aor. inf. lei=yai: pour (in drops), shed, da/krua often; also esp., pour a libation, (oi)=non) tini/, or drink-offering; abs., Il. 24.285. (See cut No. 77 on next page; cf. also Nos. 21 and 95.)
leimw/n, w=nos: meadow, mead; leimwno/qen, from the meadow, Il. 24.451.
lei=os (lēvis): smooth, even, level; petra=/wn, ‘free from rocks,’ Od. 5.443.

lei/pw, ipf. lei=p(e), fut. lei/yw, aor. 2 e)/lipon, li/pon, perf. le/loipen, mid. ipf. lei/pet(o), aor. 2 lipo/mhn, pass. perf. le/leiptai, plup. lelei/mmhn, fut. perf. lelei/yetai, aor. 3 pl. li/pen: leave, forsake; e)/lipon i=)oi/ a)/nakta, arrows ‘failed’ him, Od. 22.119, cf. Od. 14.213; pass. and aor. mid., be left, remain, survive, Il. 12.14; w. gen., be left behind one, as in running,
Il. 23.523, 529; leleimme/nos oi)w=n, ‘remaining behind’ the other sheep, Od. 9.448 ; li/pen a(/rmat' a)na/ktwn, ‘had been forsaken by’ their masters, Il. 16.507.
leirio/eis, essa (lei/rion): lily - like, lily-white, Il. 13.830 ; o)/y, ‘delicate,’ Il. 3.152. (Il.)
*leiw/dhs: son of Oenops, a suitor of Penelope and the soothsayer of the suitors; he shares their fate, Od. 21.144, Od. 22.310.
*leiw/kritos: (1) son of Arisbas, slain by Aenēas, Il. 17.344.—(2) son of Euēnor, a suitor of Penelope, slain by Telemachus, Od. 2.242, Od. 22.294.
lei/ousi: see le/wn.
lei+sto/s: see lhi+sto/s.
le/kto: see le/gw.
*lekto/n: a promontory on the Trojan coast, opposite Lesbos, Il. 14.284.
le/ktron (root lex): bed, freq. the pl.; le/ktronde, Od. 8.292.
lelabe/sqai, lela/bh|si: see lamba/nw.
lela/qh|, lela/qonto: see lanqa/nw.
lelakui=a: see la/skw.
le/lasmai: see lanqa/nw.
lela/xhte, lela/xwsi: see lagxa/nw.
*le/leges: a piratical tribe on the south and west coast of Asia Minor, Il. 10.429, Il. 21.86.
lelhkw/s: see la/skw.
leli/hmai: only part., lelihme/nos, as adj., eager, desirous; w. o)/fra, *d 465, Il. 5.690. Cf. lilai/omai. (Il.)
le/logxa: see lagxa/nw.
le/ceo, le/co: see le/gw.
*leonteu/s: a Lapith, the son of Corōnus, a suitor of Helen, Il. 2.745, Il. 23.841.
le/padnon, pl. le/padna: breast-collar, a strap passing around the breast of the horses, and made fast to the yoke, Il. 5.730. (See g in cut No. 78 below, also cut No. 45, f.)
leptale/os (lepto/s): fine, delicate, Il. 18.571†.
lepto/s (le/pw), sup. lepto/tatos: peeled, husked, Il. 20.497; then thin, fine, narrow, delicate.
