para-nhe/w, intens. ipf. parenh/neen: heap up, Od. 1.147 and Od. 16.51.
para - nh/xomai, fut. paranh/comai: swim along near the shore, Od. 5.417†.
pa/r - anta (a)/nta): sideways, Il. 23.116†.
par-apafi/skw, aor. 2 parh/pafen: deceive, cheat, beguile, w. inf., Il. 14.360†.
para-pei/qw, paraipei/qw, aor. 1 pare/peise, aor. 2 redup. subj. paraipepi/qh|si, part. -qou=sa, sync. parpepiqw/n: win over by persuasion, gain over, coax, wheedle, Il. 7.120; w. inf., Od. 22.213.
para-pe/mpw, aor. pare/pemye: send past, guide past, Od. 12.72†.

para-pla/zw, aor. pare/plagce, part. fem. parapla/gca=sa, pass. aor. parepla/gxqh: cause to drift past, drive by or away from, Od. 9.81, Od. 19.187; pass., swerve away from the mark, Il. 15.464; met., confuse, perplex, Od. 20.346.
para-plh/c, h=gos (plh/ssw): beaten on the side by waves, hence shelving, sloping; h)io/nes, Od. 5.418, 440.
para - plw/w, aor. 2 pare/plw: sail by, Od. 12.69†.
para-pne/w, aor. subj. parapneu/sh|: blow out by the side, breathe off, escape, Od. 10.24†.
para-rrhto/s (r(hqh=nai): to be prevailed upon, placable; neut. pl. as subst., words of persuasion, Il. 13.726.
para - stado/n: adv., standing by, going up to. (Od.)
para - sfa/llw, aor. 1 pare<*>sfhlen: cause to glance away; o)isto/n, Il. 8.311†.
para-sxe/men: see pare/xw.
para - tektai/nomai, aor. opt. paratekthnai/mhn: alter in building, make over, Il. 14.54 ; e)/pos, invent, ‘fix up a story,’ Od. 14.131.

para-ti/qhmi, partiqei=, fut. paraqh/somen, aor. pare/qhka, 3 pl. pa/rqesan, subj. paraqei/w, opt. paraqei=en, imp. para/qes, mid. aor. 2 opt. paraqei/mhn, part. parqe/menoi: place or set by or before one, esp. food and drink; then in general, afford, give; du/namin, cei/nia/ tini, Il. 11.779; mid., set before oneself, have set before one; fig., put up as a stake, wager, risk, stake; kefala=/s, yu=xa=/s, b 237, Od. 3.74.
para-tre/pw, aor. part. para<*>re/ya=s. turn aside. (Il.)
para-tre/xw, aor. 2 pare/dramon, pa radrame/thn, opt. paradra/moi<*> run by, outrun, overtake, Il. 23.636.
para-tre/w, aor. pare/tressan spring to one side, shy, Il. 5.295†.
para-trope/w (=paratrepw) met., mislead, Od. 4.465†.
para-trwpa/w (tre/pw): fig., change in purpose, move, propitiate. qeou\s qu/essi, Il. 9.500†.
para - tugxa/nw: chance to be at hand, Il. 11.74†.
par-auda/w, imp. parau/da=, aor. part. paraudh/sa=s: try to win over by address, persuade, urge; qa/nato/n tini, ‘speak consolingly of,’ ‘extenuate,’ Od. 11.488. (Od.)
par - auto/qi: in that very place, Il. 12.302†.
para - feu/gw, aor. inf. parfuge/ein: flee past, slip by, Od. 12.99†.

para/-fhmi, mid. aor. inf. parfa/sqai, part. parfa/menos, paraifa/menos: ad-
vise, Il. 1.577; mid., mislead, delude, appease, Il. 24.771.
para - fqa/nw, aor. 2 opt. parafqai/hsi, part. parafqa=/s, mid. parafqa/menos: overtake, pass by. (Il.)
parbebaw/s: see parabai/nw.
pardale/h: leopard - skin, Il. 3.17 and Il. 10.29.
pa/rdalis: see po/rdalis.
par - e/zomai, imp. pare/zeo, part. -o/menos, ipf. pare/zeto: sit by, take a seat near or by, tini/.
pareiai/, pl.: cheeks; of eagles, Od. 2.153.
parei/qh: see pari/hmi.

pa/r-eimi (1) (ei)mi/), pa/resti, pa/reste, pare/a=si, opt. parei/h, inf. parei=nai, pare/mmenai, part. parew/n, ipf. parh=sqa, parh=n, pa/resan, fut. pare/ssomai, -e/ssetai, pa/restai: be present, at hand, ready, e. g., to help one (tini/); also ‘stay with’ one, and of things, ma/xh|, e)n dai/th|si, Il. 10.217; w. a thing as subject, ei)/ moi du/nami/s ge parei/h, ‘were at my command,’ Od. 2.62 ; pareo/ntwn, ‘of her store,’ Od. 1.140.
pa/r-eimi (2) (ei)=mi), part. pariw/n, pariou=si: go or pass by.
par-ei=pon, def. aor. 2, subj. parei/ph|, part. pa=reipw/n, -ou=sa: persuade, win over.

par-e/k, pare/c: along past, close by, Od. 5.439, Il. 11.486; met., ei)pei=n, a)goreu/ein, away from the point, evasively; ‘different from this,’ Od. 14.168; as prep., w. gen., outside of; w. acc., beyond, away from, along beyond, Od. 12.276 ; pare\k no/on, ‘contrary to reason,’ ‘foolishly,’ Il. 20.133, Il. 10.391 ; pare\c *)axilh=a, ‘without the knowledge of Achilles,’ Il. 24.434.
pareke/sketo: see para/keimai.
par-ek-pro-feu/gw, aor. subj. -fu/gh|sin: fig., elude the grasp, Il. 23.314†.
par-e/lkw, imp. pare/lkete, mid. ipf. pare/lketo: draw along, fig., prolong, put off, Od. 21.111; mid., draw aside to oneself, get hold of, Od. 18.282.
pare/mmenai: see pa/reim Od. 9.1.
parenh/neen: see paranhe/w.
pare/c: see pare/k.
par - ec - elau/nw, -ela/w, inf. parecela/a=n, aor. subj. parecela/sh|sqa: drive or row past (nh=a), and intrans., Od. 12.109.
par - ec - e/rxomai, aor. inf. parecelqei=n, part. -ou=sa: come or go (out) by, slip by, Od. 10.573; fig., elude, Od. 5.104, 138.
pare/plw: see paraplw/w.
par-e/rxomai, fut. pareleu/seai, aor. parh=lqe, inf. parelqe/men: come or go by, pass by, outstrip, Od. 8.230; fig., evade, overreach, Il. 1.132.
pa/resan: see pa/reim Od. 9.1.
par-euna/zomai: lie beside, Od. 22.37†.

par - e/xw, fut. pare/cw, aor. 2 pare/sxon, pare/sxeqon, subj. para/sxh|, inf. parasxei=n, parasxe/men: hold or hand to, hold ready, Il. 18.556; supply, furnish, provide, dw=ra, si=ton, a)rethn; also with a thing as subject, qa/lassa de\ pa=re/xei (i. e. par(s)e/xei) i)xqu=s, Od. 19.113; w. inf., Od. 4.89.
parhe/rqh: see paraei/rw.
parh/ion (pareia=/): cheek, jaw; cheekpiece of a bridle, Il. 4.142.
parh/lase: see parelau/nw.
pa/r-hmai, part. parh/menos: sit down at or near, remain or dwell near, Od. 13.407; implying annoyance, Il. 9.311.
par-hori/h: gear of the parh/oros or extra horse, his head - gear, bridle and reins (represented in plate I. as hanging from the zugo/n), Il. 8.87, Il. 16.152.

par-h/oros (a)ei/rw): hanging or floating beside; stretched out, sprawling, Il. 7.156; met., flighty, foolish, Il. 23.603; esp. parh/oros (i(/ppos), a third or extra horse, harnessed by the side of the pair drawing the chariot, but not attached to the yoke, and serving to take the place of either of the others in case of need, Il. 16.471, 474. (Plate I. represents the parh/oros in the background as he is led to his place. See also the adj. cut, the first horse.)
parh/pafe: see parapafi/skw.
parqe/menos: see parati/qhmi.
parqenikh/ =parqe/nos.
parqe/nios: adj., virgin, zw/nh, Od. 11.245; as subst., virgin's child, born out of wedlock, Il. 16.180.
*parqe/nios: a river in Paphlagonia, Il. 2.854†.
parqen - opi=/phs, voc. -i<*>=pa (o)pipteu/w): ogler of girls, Il. 11.385†.
parqe/nos: virgin, maiden.
pa/rqesan: see parati/qhmi.
par-iau/w <*> sleep by, Il. 9.336†.
par-i/zw, ipf. pari=zen: sit down by, Od. 4.311†.
par-i/hmi: let go by the side, only aor. pass., parei/qh, hung down, Il. 23.868†.

*pa/ris: Paris, son of Priam, who by the help of Aphrodīte carried off Helen from Sparta and thus brought on the war with Troy, Il. 24.28 ff. The name Paris is supposed to mean ‘Fighter’ (rendered in the Greek *)ale/candros), and he is represented by Homer as not without warlike prowess, though naturally uxorious and averse to fighting, Il. 3.39 ff, Il. 6.350.

par-i/sthmi, aor. 2 pare/sthn, subj. du. parsth/eton, opt. parstai/h, part. parsta=/s, perf. pare/sthke, inf. paresta/menai, plup. 3 pl. pare/stasan, mid. pres. pari/stamai, imp. pari/staso, ipf. pari/stato, fut. inf. parasth/sesqai: only intrans. forms in Homer (aor. 2 and mid.), come and stand by or near (esp. the part. parasta=/s), come up to, draw near, (perf.) stand by or near; the approach may be with either friendly or hostile intent, and the subj. may be a thing (lit. or fig.), nh=es, qa/natos, moi=ra, Il. 7.467, *p 853, Od. 24.28.
parkate/lekto: see parakatale/gomai.
parme/mblwke: see parablw/skw.
parme/nw: see parame/nw.
*parnhso/s: Parnassus, the doublepeaked mountain in Phocis, north of the ravine in which lies Delphi, Od. 19.394, Od. 21.220, Od. 24.332.
pa/roiq(en): in front, Il. 20.437; heretofore, beforehand, Il. 23.20 ; to\ pa/roiqen, Od. 1.322; w. gen., ‘in the presence of,’ ‘before,’ Il. 1.360, Il. 15.154.
paroi/teros: one in front, pl., Il. 23.459, 480.
par - oi/xomai, ipf. parw/|xeto, perf. parw/|xhke: pass by, Il. 4.272, Il. 10.252.
pa/ros: before, formerly; *tu=dei/da=o pa/ros, ‘in advance of,’ Il. 8.254; correl., ou) pa/ros.. pri/n ge, Il. 5.218; freq. w. to/, and foll. by pe/r, ge/.
parpepiqw/n: see parapei/qw.
*parrasi/h: a town in Arcadia, Il. 2.608†.
parstai/hn, parsta=/s, parsth/eton: see pari/sthmi.
partiqei=: see parati/qhmi.
parfa/menos, parfa/sqai: see para/fhmi.
pa/r-fasis (para/fhmi): persuasion, allurement, Il. 14.317†.
parfuge/ein: see parafeu/gw.
parw/|xhka: see paroixomai.

pa=s, pa=sa, pa=n, pl. gen. fem. pa=se/wn, pa=sa=/wn, dat. pa/ntessi: sing., every (one), Il. 16.265, Od. 13.313; pl., all, e)nne/a pa/ntes, nine ‘in all,’ Il. 7.161, Od. 8.258; whole, entire, Il. 2.809, Od. 17.549; all sorts, all kinds, in pl., Il. 1.5, etc.—Neut. pl. as adv., pa/nta, in all respects, in the Iliad mostly in comparisons, but in the Odyssey only so in Od. 24.446; all over, Od. 16.21, Od. 17.480.
*pa=siqe/h: the name of one of the Graces, Il. 14.276.
pa=si-me/lousa: ‘world - renowned,’ Od. 12.70. Better written in two words, see me/lw.
pa/ssalos, gen. passalo/fin: wooden nail or pin, peg, used to hang things upon, as the harp, Il. 24.268, Od. 1.440, Od. 8.67, 105.
pa/ssasqai: see pateo/mai.
pa/ssw, ipf. e)/passe, pa/sse: strew, sprinkle; fig., of weaving, e)n (adv.) de\ qro/na poiki/l' e)/passen, ‘worked in,’ Il. 22.441.
pa/sswn: see paxu/s.
passudi/h: see pansudi/h.

pa/sxw, fut. pei/somai, aor. 2 e)/paqon, pa/qon, inf. paqe/ein, perf. pe/ponqa, 2 pl. pe/posqe, part. fem. pepaqui<*>=a, plup. e)pepo/nqei: the verb of passivity, meaning to be affected in any way, in Homer regularly in a bad sense, suffer, kako/n, kaka/, ph/mata, a)/lgea qu=mw=|, so kakw=s, ‘be maltreated,’ Od. 16.275 ; mh/ ti pa/qw, ‘lest anything should happen to me’ (euphem. for mh\ qa/nw); ti/ paqw/n, ‘by what mischance’; ou)lh\n o(/ tti pa/qoi, ‘how he came by it,’ Od. 19.464 ; ti/ pa/qw; ‘what am I to do?’ Il. 11.404, Od. 5.465; the same in participle, Il. 11.313; cf. Od. 24.106.

pa/tagos: any loud sound of things
striking together, crash of falling trees, chattering of teeth, dashing of waves, din of combat, Il. 16.769, Il. 13.283, Il. 21.9, 387.
pata/ssw: beat; kradi/h, qu=mo/s, *n 282, Il. 7.216, cf. Il. 23.370.
pate/omai, aor. (e))pa(s)sa/mhn, plup. pepa/smhn: taste, eat, partake of, enjoy, usually tino/s, acc. spla/gxna, a)kth/n, *a 464, Il. 21.76.
pate/w: tread; fig., kata\ (adv.) d' o(/rkia pa/thsan, ‘trampled under foot,’ Il. 4.157†.
path/r, gen. patro/s and pate/ros, pl. gen. pate/rwn and patrw=n: father; pl. pate/res, forefathers, Il. 4.405, Od. 8.245.
pa/tos: treading, step, Od. 9.119; meaning ‘the society’ of men, Il. 6.602; trodden way, path, Il. 20.137.
pa/trh (path/r): native country, native land, home, Il. 13.354.
patro-kasi/gnhtos: father's brother, uncle. (Od. and Il. 21.469.)

*pa/troklos, also gen. *patroklh=os, acc. -klh=a, voc. *patro/kleis: Patroclus, son of Menoetius of Opus, the bosom friend of Achilles. He had fled as a youth to Peleus on account of an involuntary homicide, Il. 1.765 ff. Wearing Achilles' armor at the head of the Myrmidons, he repulsed the Trojans from the ships, but was slain by Hector, and his death was the means of bringing Achilles again into the battlefield, *p. The funeral games in honor of Patroclus, *y.
patro - foneu/s, h=os: murderer of a father. (Od.)
patro-fo/nos: murderer of a father, parricide, Il. 9.461†.
patrw/ios: from one's father, paternal, hereditary; neut. pl. as subst., patrimony, Od. 16.388, Od. 22.61.
pau=ros, comp. pauro/teros: little, feeble; pl., few, opp. polloi/, Il. 9.333.
pauswlh/: cessation, rest, Il. 2.386†.

pau/w, inf. paue/menai, ipf. iter. pau/eskon, fut. part. pau/sousa, aor. e)/pausa, pau=se, mid. pau/omai, ipf. iter. paue/sketo, aor. e)pau/sato, perf. pe/paumai, plup. e)pe/pauto: cause to cease or leave off, stop (tina/ tinos), mid., cease, stop, leave off, rest from (tino/s), also w. part., Il. 11.506; inf., Il. 11.442.
*paflagw/n, pl. *paflago/nes: Paphlagonian, inhabitant of the district south of the Euxine, and bounded by the rivers Halys and Parthenius, and by Phrygia, Il. 2.851, Il. 5.577, Il. 13.656, 661.
pafla/zw: only part., bubbling, foaming, Il. 13.798†.
*pa/fos: Paphos, a city in Cyprus, Od. 8.363†.
pa/xetos =paxu/s. (Od.)
pa/xistos: see paxu/s.
pa/xnh (ph/gnu=mi): hoar frost, Od. 14.476†
paxno/w: congeal, only pass. (fig.) paxnou=tai, ‘is chilled with dread,’ Il. 17.112†.
pa/xos, eos: thickness, Od. 9.324†.

paxu/s, ei<*>=a, u/ (ph/gnu=mi), comp. pa/sswn, sup. pa/xistos: thick, stout, as of a thick jet of blood, Od. 22.18; or to indicate strength or fulness, so with xei/r. Usually of men, but of Athēna, Penelope, Il. 21.403, Od. 21.6.

peda/w (pe/dh), peda/a|, ipf. iter. peda/askon, aor. (e))pe/dhse, inf. pedh=sai: fetter, bind fast, Od. 23.17, Od. 13.168; often fig., constrain, detain, entangle; qeou= kata\ (adv.) moi=ra pe/dhsen, Od. 11.292; a)po\ patri/dos ai)/hs, Od. 23.353; w. inf., Il. 22.5, Od. 3.269, Od. 18.155.
pe/dh (pou/s): fetter, pl., Il. 13.36†.
pe/di=lon: sandal, only pl.; the gods wear golden sandals that bear them over land and sea, Il. 24.340.
pedi/on (pe/don): plain; the freq. gen. pedi/oio with verbs of motion is local, on, over, or through the plain.
pedi/onde: to the plain, earthward (opp. ou)rano/qen), Il. 8.21.
pedo/qen: from the ground; fig., ‘to thy very heart,’ Od. 13.295†.
pe/donde: to the ground, earthward.
pe/za (pou/s): a metallic end-piece or cap (shoe) at the end of a chariot-pole, Il. 24.272†. (See cut No. 42.)
pezo/s: on foot, pl. foot-forces, opp. i(pph=es or i)/ppoi, *q 59, Od. 17.436; on land, opp. e)n nhi/, *w 438, Od. 11.58.

pei/qw, ipf. e)/peiqon, pei=qe, fut. inf. peise/men, aor. inf. pei=sai, aor. 2 red. pe/piqon, fut. pepiqh/sw, mid. opt. 3 pl. peiqoi/ato, ipf. (e))pei/qeto, fut. pei/somai, aor. 2 (e))piqo/mhn, red. opt. pepi/qoito, perf. pe/poiqa, subj. pepoi/qw, plup. pepoi/qei, 1 pl. e)pe/piqmen: I. act., make to believe, convince, persuade, prevai<*>
upon, tina/, fre/nas tino/s or tini/, and w. inf.; the persuasion may be for better or for worse, ‘talk over,’ Il. 1.132; ‘mollify,’ Il. 1.100.—II. (1) mid., allow oneself to be prevailed upon, obey, mind; mu=/qw|, tini\ mu=/qois, Il. 23.157; tera/essi, Il. 4.408; a(/ tin' ou) pei/sesqai o)i=/w, ‘wherein methinks many a one will not comply,’ Il. 1.289.—(2) perf., pe/poiqa and plup., put trust in, depend upon; tini/, a)lki/, etc., Od. 10.335, Od. 16.98.
pei/kete: see pe/kw.
peina/w, inf. peinh/menai, part. peina=/wn: be hungry, hunger after; tino/s, Od. 20.137.
pei/nh: hunger, famine, Od. 15.407†.
peira/zw (peira/w): make trial of, test; tino/s, Od. 16.319.
*peirai+/dhs: son of Piraeus, Ptolemaeus, Il. 4.228†.
*pei/raios: Piraeus, a comrade of Telemachus, son of Clytius, Od. 15.544, Od. 17.55.
peirai/nw, aor. part. peirh/na=s, pass. perf. 3 sing. pepei/rantai: (1) bring to an end, accomplish, pass., Od. 12.37.—(2) bind to, Od. 22.175, 192.

pei=rar, atos: (1) pl. pei/rata, ends, limits; gai/hs kai\ po/ntoio, Il. 8.478; te/xnhs, ‘tools,’ ‘implements,’ which bring to completion, Od. 3.433; ‘chief points’ in each matter, Il. 23.350; sing., decision, Il. 18.501, cf. Od. 23.248.—(2) cord, rope; fig., o)le/qrou pei/rata, ‘snares’ or ‘cords’ of destruction, cf. Psalm xviii. 6, 2 Sam. xxii. 6; o)izu/os, ‘net’ of woe, Od. 5.289; so pole/moio, ni=/khs, Il. 13.358.

peira/w (pei=ra), inf. peira=n, fut. peirh/sw, mid. 2 sing. peira=|, peira=tai, ipf. (e))peirw/mhn, fut. peirh/somai, aor. (e))peirhsa/mhn, perf. pepei/rhmai: make trial of, test, put to proof (tino/s), try, attempt, abs. and w. inf., also w. ei), w(s, or o(/pws, mid., the same subjectively; in hostile sense, attack, Il. 12.301, Od. 6.134; rarely w. acc., Il. 18.601, Od. 4.119, Od. 24.238.
peirhti/zw (peira/w): make trial of, test, sound; tino/s, Od. 15.304; ‘measure one's strength’ in contest, Il. 7.235; w. acc., Il. 12.47.

*peiri/qoos: Pirithous, son of Ixīon (or Zeus) and Dia, king of the Lapithae, a friend of Theseus; at his wedding with Hippodamīa arose the quarrel between the Centaurs and the Lapithae, Il. 12.129, 182, Od. 21.298, *c 318, Il. 1.263.
pei/rins, acc. pei/rinqa: wagon-box or body, perhaps of wicker-work, Od. 15.131.
*pei/roos: son of Imbrasus, a chief of the Thracians, slain by Thoas, Il. 4.520, 525.

pei/rw, ipf. e)/peiron, pei<*>=re, pass. perf. part. peparme/nos, plup. pe/parto: pierce through, pierce, transfix, Il. 16.405; of piercing meat with spits (kre/a o)beloi=sin), and pass., h(/loisi peparme/nos, ‘studded,’ Il. 1.246; fig., o)du/nh|si, Il. 5.399; also fig., ke/leuqon, ku=/mata, ‘cleave’ one's way, ‘plow’ the waves, Od. 2.434, Od. 8.183.
pei=sa (pei/qw): obedience, ‘subjection,’ Od. 20.23†.

*pei/sandros: Pisander.—(1) a Trojan, son of Antimachus, slain by Agamemnon, Il. 11.122, 143.—(2) a Trojan, slain by Menelāus, Il. 13.601 -619.—(3) a Greek, son of Maemalus, a chief of the Myrmidons, Il. 16.193.—(4) a suitor of Penelope, son of Polyctor, slain by Philoetius, Od. 18.299, Od. 22.268.
*peishnori/dhs: son of Pisēnor, Ops, Od. 1.429, Od. 2.347, Od. 20.148.
*peish/nwr: (1) father of Clitus, Il. 15.445.—(2) father of Ops.—(3) a herald in Ithaca, Od. 2.38.
*peisi/stratos: Pisistratus, the youngest son of Nestor, Telemachus's companion on his journey to Pherae and Sparta, Od. 3.36, Od. 4.155, Od. 15.46, 48, 131, 166.
pei=sma, atos: rope, cable, esp. the stern - cable or hawser used to make the ship fast to land, Od. 6.269, Od. 10.96, Od. 13.77; also a cord plaited of willow withes, Od. 10.167. (Od.)
pei/somai: see (1) pa/sxw.—(2) pei/qw.
pe/kw, pei/kw, imp. pei/kete, mid. aor. part. pecame/nh: comb or card wool; mid., comb one's own hair, Il. 14.176.
pe/lagos, eos: the open, high sea; pl., a(lo\s e)n pela/gessin, ‘in the briny deep,’ Od. 5.335.
*pela/gwn: (1) a chief of the Pylians, Il. 4.295.—(2) an attendant of Sarpēdon, Il. 5.695.

pela/zw (pe/las), aor. (e))pe/la(s)sa, imp. du. pela/sseton, mid. aor. 1 opt. 3 pl. pelasai/ato, aor. 2 e)plh/mhn, plh=to, e)/plhnto, plh=nto, pass. perf. peplhme/nos, aor. 3 pl. pe/lasqen: bring near, make to approach (tini/ tina or ti\);
mid. (aor. 2) and pass., draw near, approach, (tini/); of bringing the mast down into the mast - crutch, Il. 1.434; fig., tina\ o)du/nh|si, Il. 5.766; aor. mid., causative, bring near, Il. 17.341.
pe/las: near, hard by; w. gen., Od. 15.257. (Od.)
*pelasgiko/s: Pelasgic, epithet of Zeus in Dodōna, Il. 16.233; see also *)/argos.

*pelasgo/s, pl. *pelasgoi/: Pelasgian, the Pelasgians, the early population of Greece, first mentioned in the region about Dodōna; then in Thessaly, Il. 2.840; Boeotia, Attica, and the Peloponnēsus, Il. 17.288; Homer mentions other Pelasgians from Cyme, on the side of the Trojans, Il. 10.429; and still others in Crete, Od. 19.177.
pe/leqron: plethron, a measure of surface 100 ft. square, about 1/4 of an acre.
pe/leia: wild dove, wild pigeon.
peleia/s, a/dos:=pe/leia, only pl. (Il.)
peleka/w, aor. pele/kkhsen: hew, shape with an axe, Od. 5.244†.
pe/lekkos: axe-helve, Il. 13.612†.

pe/lekus, eos, pl. dat. pele/kessi: axe or hatchet, for felling trees, Il. 23.114, Il. 17.520; double-edged, Od. 5.234, see h(mipe/lekka. A sacrificial instrument in Od. 3.449. In the contest with the bow of Odysseus the ‘axes’ were either axheads without the handles, arranged in line, or iron blocks resembling axes, made for the purpose of target-shooting, Od. 19.573.

pelemi/zw, aor. inf. pelemi/cai, pass. ipf. pelemi/zeto, aor. pelemi/xqh: shake, brandish, make to quiver or quake; sa/kos, u=(/lhn, to/con, Od. 21.125; pass., quake, quiver, Il. 8.443; esp. and often in aor., be forced back, Il. 4.535.
pele/skeo, pe/leu: see pe/lw.

*peli/hs: Pelias, son of Poseidon and Tyro, king of Iolcus, drove his brother Neleus into exile, and forced Jason, the son of his other brother Aeson, into the Argonautic expedition, Od. 11.254. Pelias was the father of Alcestis, Il. 2.715.
pe/lla: milk - pail, milk - bowl, Il. 16.642†.
*pellh/nh: a town in Achaea, Il. 2.574†.
*pe/loy: Pelops, son of Tantalus, father of Atreus and Thyestes, gained with his wife Hippodamīa, the daughter of Oenomaus, the throne of Elis, Il. 2.104 ff.

pe/lw, pe/lei, ipf. pe/len, aor. e)/ple, and pe/lomai, imp. pe/leu, ipf. pe/lonto, iter. 2 sing. pele/skeo, aor. e)/pleo, e)/pleu, e)/pleto: a poetic synonym of ei)=nai, gi/gnesqai, perhaps originally containing some idea of motion (versari), but in Homer simply to be, Il. 3.3, Il. 12.271, Od. 13.60, Il. 5.729; the aor. has pres. signif. (like e)/fu in Attic), ei) dh/ r() e)qe/leis kai/ toi fi/lon e)/pleto qu=mw=|, ‘and it pleases thee,’ Il. 14.337, Od. 13.145, etc.
pe/lwr: monster; the Cyclops, Od. 9.428; Scylla, Od. 12.87; Hephaestus, Il. 18.410.
pelw/rios: monstrous, huge; Ares, Polyphēmus, Hector, etc.; also of things, e)/gxos, la=as, qau=ma, Od. 9.190.
pe/lwron =pe/lwr, also pl.
pe/lwros =pelw/rios.
pempa/zomai (pe/nte), aor. subj. pempa/ssetai: reckon up on the five fingers, Od. 4.412†.
pemptai=os: on the fifth day, pl., Od. 14.257†.
pe/mptos: fifth.

pe/mpw, fut. pe/myw, aor. e)/pemya, pe/myen: send, dismiss, send or convey home, escort; the last meaning constitutes a characteristic difference between the Greek verb and the Eng. ‘send,’ Il. 1.390, Od. 11.626; freq. of the Phaeacians in Od.
pemp-w/bolon (pe/nte, o)belo/s): fivetined fork, used at sacrificial burnings, Il. 1.463. (Cf. cut No. 95, combined from several ancient representations.)
penqero/s: father-in-law, Od. 8.582 and Il. 6.170.
pe/nqos, eos: mourning, grief.
peni/h: poverty, Od. 14.157†.
penixro/s: poor, needy, Od. 3.348†.
pe/nomai, ipf. (e))pe/nonto: labor, be at work or busy upon (peri/ ti), prepare (ti\), Od. 4.624, Od. 14.251.
penta-e/thros (ve/tos): five years old.
penta-eth/s (ve/tos): only neut. as adv., pentaete/s, five years long, Od. 3.115†.
pe/ntaxa: in five divisions, Il. 12.87†.
pe/nte: five.
penth/konta: fifty.
penthkonto/ - guos: of fifty acres, Il. 9.579†.
penthko/sioi: five hundred, Od. 3.7†.
pepaqui=a: see pa/sxw.
pepa/lagmai: see pala/ssw.
pepa/lasqe, pepala/sqai: see pala/ssw.
peparme/nos: see pei/rw.
pepa/smhn: see pate/omai.
peperhme/nos: see pera/w.
pe/phge: see ph/gnu=mi.
pepiqei=n, pe/piqmen, pepiqh/sw: see pei/qw.
pe/plhgon, peplhgw/s: see plh/ssw.
peplhme/nos: see pela/zw.

pe/plos: robe, used as a cover for a chariot, Il. 5.194; for chairs, Od. 7.96; for funeral-urns, Il. 24.796; and esp. of a woman's over-garment, Il. 5.315, Il. 6.90, Od. 18.292. (See adjoining cut, and No. 2.)
pepnu=me/nos: see pne/w.
pe/poiqa: see pei/qw.
pe/ponqa, pe/posqe: see pa/sxw.
pepoth/atai: see pota/omai.
peprwme/nos, pe/prwto: see por-.
pe/ptamai: see peta/nnu=mi.
peptew=ta: see pi=/ptw.
pepthw/s: see pth/ssw.
pepu/qoito, pe/pusmai: see punqa/nomai.

pe/pwn, onos, voc. pe/pon (pe/ssw): cooked by the sun, ripe, mellow; in Homer only fig., (1) as term of endearment, dear, pet, Il. 6.35, Il. 17.120, Od. 9.447.—(2) in bad sense, coward, weakling, Il. 2.235, Il. 13.120.

pe/r: enclitic particle, giving emphasis or prominence to an idea, usually to what immediately precedes it, very, at least, even, just, etc. e)pei/ m' e)/teke/s ge minunqa/dio/n per e)o/nta, ‘for a very short life,’ Il. 1.352, 416, Il. 3.201; here belongs the use with participles denoting opposition (concession), so kai/per, where pe/r itself of course does not mean ‘although,’ but the logical relation of the part. is emphasized, ou)/ ti dunh/seai a)xnu/meno/s per | xraismei=n, ‘however distressed,’ ‘distressed tho’ you be,’ i. e. though very distressed, Il. 1.241 . pe/r is freq. appended to other particles, conditional, temporal, etc., and to all relative words, w(s e)/setai/ per (w(/sper), ‘just as,’ Od. 19.312 ; e)/nqa per, ei)/ per, ‘that is if’; e)pei/ per, see o(/sper.
pera/a=n: see pera/w.
*peraiboi/: the Perrhaebians, a Pelasgian tribe about Dodōna and the river Titaresius, Il. 2.749†.
peraio/w: only aor. pass. part., peraiwqe/ntes, crossing over, Od. 24.437†.
pera/th: farthest border, horizon, implying the west side, Od. 23.243†.

pera/w (1) (pe/ras, ‘end’), 3 pl. pero/wsi, inf. pera/a=n, part. perw=nta, ipf. pe/raon, iter. pera/aske, fut. inf. perhse/menai, aor. e)pe/rhsa, pe/rhse, inf. perh=sai: go from one end to the other, pass through, penetrate, traverse; ti\, dia/ tinos, also e)pi\ po/nton, etc., Il. 2.613, Od. 4.709.
pera/w (2) (pe/rhn, pipra=/skw), inf. pera/a=n, aor. e)pe/rassa, pe/rasan, pass. perf. peperhme/nos: export for sale, sell; e)s *lh=mnon, kat' a)lloqro/ous a)nqrw/pous, *f 40, Od. 15.453.
*pe/rgamos: Pergamus, the citadel of Ilium, Il. 4.508, Il. 5.446, Il. 6.512, Il. 7.21.
*pergasi/dhs: son of Pergasus, Deïcoön, Il. 5.535†.
perhse/menai: see pera/ Od. 24.1.

pe/rqw, fut. inf. pe/rsein, aor. e)/persa, pe/rse, aor. 2 e)/praqon, pass. pres. part. perqome/nh, ipf. pe/rqeto, mid. (w. pass. signif.), fut. pe/rsetai, aor. 2 inf. pe/rqai: sack, plunder, lay waste, regularly of cities, a)/stea, po/lin, Il. 2.660; pass., Il. 16.708, Il. 24.729.

peri/: around, see a)mfi/.—I. adv. (including the so - called ‘tmesis’).— (1) around, all round; peri\ ga/r r(a/ e( xalko\s e)/leyen | fu/lla te kai\ floio/n, i. e. the leaves and bark that encircled it, Il. 1.236; so of throwing a cloak about one, standing around in crowds, being enveloped by the shades of night, Il. 3.384, Il. 10.201.—(2) over and above others, in an extraordinary degree, very; peri/ toi me/nos, ‘thou hast exceeding strength’, Od. 12.279 ; peri\ me\n qei/ein taxu/n, Il. 16.186; to\n peri\ *mou=sa fi/lhse, ‘above others,’ ‘extraordinarily,’ Od. 8.63.—A subst. in the appropriate case may specify the relation of the adv., peri\ de\ zw/nhn ba/let' i)cui= (dat. of place), Od. 5.231 ; h)= se peri\ *zeu\s a)nqrw/pwn h)/xqhre (partitive gen.), Od. 19.363, in the phrase peri\ kh=ri, peri\ qu=mw=|, peri/ is adv., and the dat. local.—II. prep., (1) w. gen., rare of place, peri\ tro/pios bebaw/s, i. e. bestriding it, Od. 5.130, 68; <*>sually met., about, for, in behalf of, of the obj. of contention or the thing defended, ma/xesqai peri\ nho/s, a)mu=/nesqai peri\ nhw=n, *p 1, Il. 12.142; then with verbs of saying, inquiring, about, concerning, of (de), mnh/sasqai peri\ pomph=s, Od. 7.191; rarely causal, peri\ e)/ridos ma/rnasqai, Il. 7.301; denoting superiority, above, peri\ pa/ntwn e)/mmenai a)/llwn, Il. 1.287; so with adjectives, peri\ pa/ntwn kratero/s, o)izuro/s.—(2) w. dat., local, around, on, as of something transfixed on a spit or a weapon, peri\ douri\ peparme/nh, Il. 21.577; so of clothing on the person, peri\ xroi+\ ei(/mata e)/xein, xalko\s peri\ sth/qessi, kni=/sh e(lissome/nh peri\ kapnw=|, curling ‘around in’ the smoke, Il. 1.317; then sometimes w. verbs of contending, like the gen., about, for, Od. 2.245, Od. 17.471, Il. 16.568, and w. a verb of fearing, Il. 10.240. Often the dat. is to be explained independently, peri/ being adverbial, see above (I).— (3) w. acc., local implying motion, sth=sai (ti\) peri\ bwmo/n, fula/ssein peri\ mh=la, and esp. of sounds, fumes floating around, coming over the senses, stealing over one, peri\ de/ sfeas h)/luq) i)wh/, *ku/klwpa peri\ fre/nas h)/luqen oi)=nos, ‘went to his head,’ we should say, Od. 17.261, Od. 9.362; met., of that in which one is interested, ponei=n peri/ ti, ‘about,’ ‘over,’ ‘with,’ Il. 24.444, Od. 4.624.
pe/ri: (1)=peri/esti, *k 244, Od. 12.279. —(2) thus written by ‘anastrophe’ for peri/, when the prep. follows its case.
peri-a/gnu=mi (va/gnu=mi): only pass., and fig., (o)/y) peria/gnutai, breaks around, spreads around, Il. 16.78†.

peri - bai/nw, aor. 2 peri/bh, -hsan, inf. peribh=nai, part. -ba=/s: go around (as to bestride) or in front of a fallen man, to protect the body, as animals stand over and protect their young, tino/s, Il. 5.21, also tini/, Il. 17.80, 313.
peri - ba/llw, aor. 2 perie/balon: throw about or around; pei=sma/ tinos, Od. 22.466; met., excel, surpass, Il. 23.276, Od. 15.17; mid., of putting on armor, Od. 23.148.
*peri/boia: Periboea.—(1) daughter of Acessamenus, mother of Pelagon, Il. 21.142.—(2) daughter of Eurymedon, mother of Nausithous by Poseidon, Od. 7.57.
peri-glagh/s, e/s (gla/gos): filled with milk, Il. 16.642†.
peri - gna/mptw: double a cape, in nautical sense, part., Od. 9.80†.
peri - dei/dw, aor. peri/dveisa, part. peridvei/sa=s, perf. peridei/dia: fear for, be afraid for; tino/s, also tini/, and w. mh/, Il. 17.240, 242, Il. 15.123.
peri-de/cios: ambidextrous, skilful in both hands, or very skilful, expert, Il. 21.163†.
peri-di/dwmi, only mid. fut., and aor. subj. 1 du. peridw/meqon: mid., stake, wager, w. gen. of the thing risked, Il. 23.485 ; e)me/qen peridw/somai au)th=s, ‘will stake my life,’ Od. 23.78.
peri-di=ne/w: only pass. aor. du., peridi=nhqh/thn, ran round and round, Il. 22.165†.
peri/dramon: see peritre/xw.
peri/-dromos: running round, round, circular; kolw/nh, au)lh/, that can be run around, hence ‘detached,’ ‘alone,’ Il. 2.812, Od. 14.7.
peri-dru/ptw: only pass. aor., peridru/fqh, had the skin all torn off from his elbows, Il. 23.395†.
peri - du/w: only aor. 1 peri/du=se, stripped off, Il. 11.100†.
peridw/meqon: see peridi/dwmi.
peri/-eimi (ei)mi/): be superior, excel one in something; tino/s ti, s 248, Od. 19.326.
peri - e/xw, mid. aor. 2 perisxo/mhn, imp. peri/sxeo: mid., surround to protect, w. gen., Il. 1.393; acc., Od. 9.199.
perih/|dh: see peri/oida.
*perih/rhs: the father of Borus, Il. 16.177†.
peri - hxe/w: only aor., perih/xhsen, rang all over, Il. 7.267†.
perii/dmenai: see peri/oida.
peri-i/sthmi, aor. 2 peri/sthsan, subj. peristh/wsi, opt. peristai<*>=en, pass. ipf. perii/stato, aor. perista/qh: only intrans. forms, station oneself about, rise and stand around, w. acc.
peri - kallh/s, e/s: very beautiful, often of things, rarely of persons, Il. 5.389, Il. 16.85, Od. 11.281.

peri/-keimai, ipf. peri/keito: lie or be placed (pass. of periti/qhmi) around, as a covering, Od. 21.54; in embrace, Il. 19.4; fig., remain over; ou)de/ ti/ moi peri/keitai, ‘I have won nothing by it,’ Il. 9.321.
peri/-khlos: very dry, well seasoned, Od. 5.240 and Od. 18.309.
*periklu/menos: son of Neleus and Pero, Od. 11.286†.
peri - kluto/s: highly renowned or famous.
peri-ktei/nw: kill round about, pass., Il. 4.538 and Il. 12.245.
peri-kti/ones (kti/zw), pl.: dwellers around, neighbors.
peri-kti/tai =perikti/ones, Od. 11.288.
peri - maima/w: only part. perimaimw/wsa, feeling or groping about for, w. acc., Od. 12.95†.
peri/ - metros: beyond measure, exceedingly large. (Od.)
*perimh/dhs: (1) a companion of Odysseus, Od. 11.23, Od. 12.195.—(2) father of Schedius, Il. 15.515.
peri-mh/ketos =perimh/khs.
peri-mh/khs (mh=kos), neut. peri/mhkes: very long, very tall or high.
peri - mhxana/omai, 3 pl. -no/wntai, ipf. -no/wnto: cunningly devise; tini/, ‘against one,’ Od. 14.340 and Od. 7.200.
*pe/rimos: a Trojan, son of Meges, slain by Patroclus, Il. 16.695†.
peri-naieta/w, 3 pl. -a/ousi: of persons, dwell about, Od. 2.66; of places, be inhabited, lie round about, Od. 4.177.
peri-naie/ths: neighbor, pl., Il. 24.488†.
peri/-cestos: polished on every side, Od. 12.79†.
peri/-oida (voi=da), peri/oide, inf. perii/dmenai, plup. perih/|dh: know or be skilled above others, understand or know better; tino/s tini or ti\, and with inf., Il. 13.728, Od. 3.244, Il. 10.247.
peri-pe/lomai (pe/lw), aor. part. periplo/menos: be or go around, surround, Il. 18.220; revolve (e)niautoi/).
peri - peukh/s, e/s: very sharp, Il. 11.845†.
peri-ple/kw, pass. aor. periple/xqhn: pass., embrace; tini/, Od. 14.313 and Od. 23.33.
peri - plhqh/s, e/s: very full, populous, Od. 15.405†.
periplo/menos: see peripe/lomai.
peri-pro/: around and before, Il. 11.180 and Il. 16.699.
peri-pro-xe/w: only pass. aor. part., periproxuqei/s, pouring in a flood over, Il. 14.316†.
peri - rre/w (sre/w), ipf. peri/rree: stream around, w. acc., Od. 9.388†.
peri - rrhdh/s, e/s: tumbling across; trape/zh|, Od. 22.84†.
peri/-rrutos (sre/w): flowed around, sea-girt, Od. 19.173†.
peri - sai/nw, perissai/nw: wag the tail about one, fawn upon; tina/ (ou)rh=|sin), ‘with their tails,’ i. e. wagging them, Od. 10.215. (Od.)
peri-sei/w, perissei/w: only pass., be tossed about, float in the air, Il. 19.382 and Il. 22.315.
peri - sqene/w (sqe/nos): only part., exulting in his might, Od. 22.368†.
peri/-skeptos: (if from ske/ptomai) conspicuous from every side, or (if from ske/pw) covered, shut in on all sides. (Od.)
perissai/nw, perissei/w: see perisai/nw, perisei/w.
peri - stado/n: standing around, drawing near from every side, Il. 13.551†.
perista/qh: see perii/sthmi.
peri-stei/xw, aor. peri/steicas: walk around, Od. 4.277†.
peri-ste/llw, aor. part. peristei/la=s: enwrap, as in funeral clothes, Od. 24.293†.
peri-stenaxi/zomai: moan, ring, or echo around; possi/n, ‘with the tread of feet,’ Od. 23.146, Od. 10.10.
peri-ste/nw (steno/s): make narrow or close all round, only pass., ‘be stuffed full,’ Il. 16.163†.
peri-ste/fw: set closely around, surround, Od. 5.303; pass., fig., his words are not ‘crowned’ with grace, Od. 8.175.
peri/sthsan: see perii/sthmi.
peri-stre/fw, aor. part. peristre/ya=s: whirl around.
peri/sxeo: see perie/xw.
peri-ta/mnomai (ta/mnw, te/mnw): cut off for oneself, intercept, of driving away cattle as booty. (Od.)
peri-te/llomai: roll around, revolve, recur.
peri - ti/qhmi, aor. opt. periqei=en: place around; fig., du/nami/n tini, ‘bestow,’ ‘invest with,’ Od. 3.205†.
peri - tre/fw: make thick around; pass., of milk, curdle, Il. 5.903; of ice, congeal, ‘form around,’ Od. 14.477.
peri - tre/xw, aor. peri/dramon: run up from every side, Il. 11.676†.
peri - trome/omai: quiver (around) with fear, Od. 18.77†.
peri - trope/w: only part., intrans., revolving, Il. 2.295; turning often about, Od. 9.465.
peri/-troxos: round, Il. 23.455†.
peri - fai/nomai: only part., visible from every side, Il. 13.179; as subst., a conspicuous (place), Od. 5.476.
*peri=/fa=s: (1) an Aetolian, son of Ochesius, slain by Ares, Il. 5.842, 847.— (2) a Trojan herald, the son of Epytus, Il. 17.323.
*perifh/ths: (1) a Mysian, slain by Teucer, Il. 14.515.—(2) a Greek from Mycēnae, the son of Copreus, slain by Hector, Il. 15.638.
peri - frade/ws: circumspectly, carefully.
peri-fra/zomai: consider on all sides or carefully, Od. 1.76†.
peri/ - frwn, on: very thoughtful or prudent.
peri-fu/w, aor. 2 inf. perifu=nai, part. perifu=/s: aor. 2, grow around, embrace, tini/. (Od.)
peri-xe/w, aor. 1 perixeu=a (peri/xeua), mid. aor. 1 subj. perixeu/etai: pour or shed around or over, mid. for oneself, Od. 6.232, Od. 23.159; fig., xa/rin tini/, Od. 23.162.
peri-wph/ (root o)p): look-out place.
peri - w/sios (periou/sios, peri/eimi): beyond measure, exceeding great; neut. as adv., periw/sion, exceedingly, too greatly.
perkno/s: dappled, as specific name of a kind of eagle, Il. 24.316†.
*perkw/sios: of Percōte.
*perkw/th: a town in the Troad, Il. 11.229, Il. 15.548, Il. 2.835.
pe/rnhmi (parallel form of pera/ Od. 24.2), part. perna=/s, ipf. iter. pe/rnaske, pass. pres. part. perna/mena: sell. (Il.)
perona/w (pero/nh), aor. pero/nhse, mid. ipf. perona=to, aor. peronh/sato: pierce, transfix; mid., fasten with a buckle about one, Il. 10.133, Il. 14.180. (Il.)
pero/nh (pei/rw): brooch-pin, buckle, clasp, Il. 5.425, Od. 18.293. (See the cut, which though of modern form is from an ancient original.)
pero/wsi: see pera/ Od. 24.1.
pe/rsa: see pe/rqw.
*perseu/s: Perseus.—(1) the son of Zeus and Danaë, daughter of king Acrisius of Argos, Il. 14.320.—(2) a son of Nestor, Od. 3.414, 444.
*persefo/neia: Persephone (Proserpina), daughter of Zeus and Demēter, wife of Hades and queen of the nether world, often termed e)painh/ in Homer, Il. 9.457, Od. 10.494, 509, Od. 11.213, 217.
*pe/rsh: daughter of Oceanus, wife of Helius, mother of Aeētes and Circe, Od. 10.139†.
*pershia/dhs: descendant of Perseus, Sthenelus, Il. 19.116†.
pese/ein, pese/esqai: see pi=/ptw.
pesso/s: only pl., draughts, checkers, the game played with them, the nature of which is unknown. (The following cut represents an Egyptian game o<*> this character.)

pe/ssw, inf. pesse/men: make mellow, ripen, Od. 7.119; fig., digest, then met., xu/lon, ‘brood over,’ ‘coddle,’ Il. 4.513, Il. 9.565 ; kh/dea, ‘swallow,’ Il. 24.617, 639; ge/ra=, ‘enjoy,’ Il. 2.237 ; be/los, ‘chew on,’ ‘nurse’ the wound, Il. 8.513.
pesw/n: see pi=/ptw.
pe/talon: leaf, mostly pl.

peta/nnu=mi, aor. pe/ta(s)sa, pass. perf. pe/ptamai, part. peptame/nos, plup. pe/ptato, aor. peta/sqhn: spread out, spread wide; as of sails, the arms (in supplication, or as a sign of joy), Il. 1.480, Il. 14.495, Od. 24.397; of doors, open wide, often in perf. pass., fig., ai)/qrh, au)gh/, qu=mo/n, Od. 6.45, *r 371, Od. 18.160.
petehno/s (pe/tomai): flying, winged, fledged, Od. 16.218; as subst., petehna/, flying things, birds.
*petew/n: a village in Boeotia, Il. 2.500†.
*petew/s, w=o: son of Orneus, father of Menestheus, Il. 4.338, Il. 12.355.

pe/tomai, aor. e)/ptato, subj. pth=tai, part. ptame/nh: fly, of birds and insects; then often fig., of gods and men running, horses, missiles, snow and hail, Il. 5.99, Il. 15.170; the oars ‘fly’ from the hands of the rowers as they drop them, Od. 12.203; at death the life ‘flies’ from the body, Il. 23.880, Il. 16.469.
petrai=os: of a rock, inhabiting a rock, Od. 12.231†.
pe/trh: rock, cliff, reef, Il. 13.137, Od. 3.293, Od. 10.4; symbol of firmness, of hardheartedness, Il. 15.618, Il. 16.35.
petrh/eis, essa, en: rocky.
pe/tros: piece of rock, stone. (Il.)
peu/qomai: see punqa/nomai.
peuka/limos: prudent, sagacious, fre/nes. (Il.)
peukedano/s: destructive, Il. 10.8†.
peu/kh: pine, fir. (Il.)
peu/somai: see punqa/nomai.
pe/fantai: see (1) fai/nw.—(2) fen-.
pefa/sqai: see fen-.
pefasme/nos: see fai/nw.
pefh/somai: see (1) fai/nw.—(2) fen-.
pefide/sqai, pefidh/somai: see fei/domai.
pe/fnon: see fen-.
pe/fradon, pefrade/ein: see fra/zw.
pe/fri=ka: see fri/ssw.
pefu/a=si: see fu/w.
pefugme/nos, pefuzo/tes: see feu/gw.
pefulagme/nos: see fula/ssw.
pefuui=a: see fu/w.
pe/furmai: see fu=/rw.
ph=| or ph=: interrogative adv., whither? in what way? how?
ph/| or ph/: enclitic adv., anywhere, somewhere, in any way.
phgesi/-mallos (ph/gnu=mi): thickfleeced, Il. 3.197†.
phgh/: only pl., sources.

ph/gnu=mi (cf. pango, pax), fut. ph/ceis, aor. e)/phca, ph=ce, perf. pe/phge, plup. (e))peph/gei, pass. aor. e)pa/ghn, pa/gh, 3 pl. pa/gen, aor. 1 3 pl. ph=xqen: fix, both in the sense make stiff or compact, and plant firmly; of fixing or sticking a spear e)/n tini, an oar upon a mound (e)pi\ tu/mbw|), impaling a head (a)na\ skolo/pessi), Il. 4.460, Od. 11.77, Il. 18.177; hence build, nh=as, Il. 2.664; mid., for oneself, Od. 5.163; fig., ‘fix’ the eyes upon the ground, Il. 3.217; pass., and perf. act., stiffen, stick fast, stick in, Il. 22.453, Il. 13.442.
phgo/s (ph/gnu=mi): stout, thick, tough, Il. 9.124 ; ku=ma, big wave, Od. 5.388.
phguli/s, i/dos (ph/gnu=mi): frosty, icecold, Od. 14.476†.
*ph/daion: a place in Troy, Il. 13.172†.
*ph/daios: son of Antēnor and Theāno, slain by Meges, Il. 5.69†.

phda/lion (phdo/n): steering-oar or rudder, Od. 3.281, Od. 5.255. (Strictly, the word probably denotes the handle or
bar connecting the two rudders, and serving to move them. See cuts Nos. 87, 88, and cf. Nos. 37, 38, 60. The adjoining cuts represent the rudders of Egyptian ships; in the first cut both rudders are depicted as on one side of the vessel.)
*ph/dasos: (1) a town of the Leleges in the Troad, on the Satnioeis, destroyed by Achilles, Il. 6.35, Il. 20.92, Il. 21.87. —(2) a town in the realm of Agamemnon, Il. 9.152, 294.
*ph/dasos: (1) a Trojan, the son of Bucolion, slain by Euryalus, Il. 6.21.— (2) name of a horse of Achilles, Il. 16.152, 467.
phda/w, ipf. e)ph/da=, aor. e)ph/dhsa: jump, bound, leap. (Il.)
phdo/n: oar-blade. (Od.)
phkto/s (ph/gnu=mi): compact, firm.
ph=lai, ph=le: see pa/llw.
*phlegw/n: son of the river - god Axius, and father of Asteropaeus, Il. 21.141, 152, 159.
*phlei/dhs and *phlhi+a/dhs: son of Peleus, Achilles.
*phlei/wn =*phlei/dhs.—*phlei/wna/de, to Peleus' son, Il. 24.338†.

*phleu/s: Peleus, son of Aeacus, fled from his native island Aegīna to Phthia, and married Antigone, daughter of Eurytion, king of the Myrmidons. His daughter by this marriage, Polydōra is mentioned, Il. 16.175 ff. He afterwards married the Nereid Thetis, who became the mother of Achilles, Il. 9.147, 252, 289, Il. 18.87, *w 61, Il. 21.188.
*phlh/ios: of Peleus, Il. 18.60.
*phlhia/dhs: see *phlei/dhs.
ph/lhc, hkos: helmet. (Il.)
*phlia/s, a/dos: Pelian, i. e. from Mt. Pelion, epithet of the ashen spear (meli/h), a gift of the Centaur Chiron to Peleus, Il. 20.277, Il. 16.143. (Il.)
*ph/lion: Pelion, a mountain in Thessaly, Il. 2.757, Il. 16.144, Od. 11.316.
ph=ma, atos (pa/sxw): suffering, woe, harm; common periphrasis, ph=ma kakoi=o, also du/hs ph=ma, Od. 14.338; of persons, bane, nuisance, Od. 17.446.
phmai/nw, fut. phmane/ei, inf. -e/ein, aor. 1 opt. phmh/neian, pass. aor. phma/nqh, inf. -h=nai: harm, hurt; u(pe\r o(/rkia, ‘work mischief’ by violating the oaths, Il. 3.299; pass., Od. 8.563.
*phneio/s: Penēus, a river in Thessaly, flowing through the vale of Tempe into the Thermaic gulf, Il. 2.752, 757.
*phne/lews: a leader of the Boeotians, Il. 2.494, Il. 14.496, 487, 489, *p 340, Il. 17.597.
*phnelo/peia: Penelope, the daughter of Icarius, and wife of Odysseus, Od. 1.329, etc.
phni/on: thread of the woof, passed from one side to the other, in and out through the upright threads of the warp, before which the weaver stood, Il. 23.762†.
pho/s: brother-in-law.
*phrei/h: a region in Thessaly, Il. 2.766†.
ph/rh: knapsack, beggar's wallet. (Od.)
phro/s: lame, mutilated; blind in Il. 2.599†.
*phrw/: Pero, daughter of Neleus and Chloris, sister of Nestor, and wife of Bias, Od. 11.287†.

ph=xus, eos: elbow, then fore - arm, arm, Il. 21.166, Od. 17.38. Also centre-piece of a bow, joining the arms (horns) of the weapon, being the part grasped by the left hand in shooting, Il. 11.375, Od. 21.419. (For the manner of holding, see cuts Nos. 104, Heracles; 127, Paris; 63, 89, 90, Assyrians.)
pi=ar (pi=var, pi<*>/wn): fat, Il. 1.550; fig., fatness, of land, Od. 9.135.
pi=dac, akos: spring, fount, Il. 16.825†.
pi=dheis, essa, en: rich in springs, Il. 11.183†.
*pi=du=/ths: a Trojan from Percōte, slain by Odysseus, Il. 6.30†.
pi/e, pie/ein: see pi=/nw.
pie/zw, ipf. e)pi/ezon, pi/eze, pass. aor. part. piesqei/s: squeeze, press, pinch; fig., e)n desmoi=s, ‘load with fetters,’ Od. 12.164; pass., Od. 8.336.
pi=/eira: see pi=/wn.
*pi=eri/h: Pieria, a region in Macedonia, on the borders of Thessaly, by the sea, near Mt. Olympus, Il. 14.226, 250.
piqe/sqai: see pei/qw.
piqe/w, assumed pres. for the foll. forms, fut. piqh/seis, aor. part. piqh/sa=s (for pepiqh/sw see pei/qw): obey, Od. 21.369; rely on, part.
pi/qos: large earthen jar, for wine or oil, Od. 23.305, Od. 2.340. (Sometimes half buried in the earth, as seen in cut No. 64.)
pikro/-gamos: having a bitter marriage; pl., of the suitors of Penelope, ironically meaning that they would not live to be married at all. (Od.)
pikro/s: sharp; o)isto/s, be/lemna, Il. 22.206; then of taste and smell, bitter, pungent, Il. 11.846, Od. 4.406; and met., of feelings, ‘bitter,’ ‘hateful,’ Od. 17.448.
pi/lnamai (parallel form to pela/zw), pi/lnatai, ipf. pi/lnato: draw near, near, approach, Il. 19.93, Il. 23.368.
pi=los: felt, Il. 10.265†.
pimpla/nw =pi/mplhmi, only mid., pimpla/netai, is filled, with wrath, Il. 9.679†.

pi/mplhmi, 3 pl. pimpla=si, aor. plh=se, opt. plh/seian, part. plh/sa=sa, mid. ipf. pi/mplanto, aor. opt. 3 pl. plhsai/ato, aor. 2 plh=to, -nto, pass. aor. 3 pl. plh=sqen: make full, fill, tina/ (ti\) tinos, less often tini/, Il. 16.374; mid. (aor. 1), fill for oneself, de/pas oi)/noio, Il. 9.224; fig., qu=mo/n, satisfy, Od. 17.603; pass. and aor. 2 mid., be filled, get full, fill up, Il. 1.104, Od. 8.57.
pi/nac, akos: board, ship's timbers, planks, Od. 12.67; tablet, Il. 6.169; wooden plate or trencher for meat, Od. 1.141.
pinu/ssw (pinuto/s, pne/w), ipf. e)pi/nusse: make shrewd, ‘sharpen the wits,’ Il. 14.249†.
pinuth/: prudence, understanding.
pinuto/s (pinu/ssw, pne/w): prudent, discreet. (Od.)

pi=/nw, inf. pi=ne/menai, ipf. iter. pi=/neske, fut. part. pi=o/menos, aor. 2 e)/pion, pi/on, subj. 2 sing. pi/h|sqa, opt. pi/oimi, imp. pi/e, inf. piei=n, pie/ein, pi<*>e/men, part. piw/n, -ou=sa, pass. pres. pi=/netai, ipf. pi=/neto: drink; krhth=ras, ku/pella, drain, quaff, Il. 8.232, Il. 4.346; also w. dat. of the cup, Od. 14.112; freq. w. part. gen. of the drink.
pi=/omai: see pi=/nw.
pi=o/tatos: see pi=/wn.

pi=/ptw (root pet, for pipe/tw), ipf. e)/pi=pton, pi=pte, fut. pese/ontai, inf. pese/esqai, aor. 2 pe/son, inf. pese/ein, perf. part. peptew=ta: fall; fig., e)k qu=mou= tini/, out of one's favor, Il. 23.595; freq. of falling in battle, and from the pass. sense of being killed, w. u(po/ (‘at the hands of’) tinos, also u(po/ tini, *z 453, Il. 17.428; in hostile sense, fali upon, e)n nhusi/, Il. 11.311; upon each other (su/n, adv.), Il. 7.256; fig. (e)n, adv.), Il. 21.385; of the wind ‘falling,’ ‘abating,’ ‘subsiding,’ Od. 14.475, Od. 17.202.
pi=sos, eos (pi=/nw): meadow, dell.
pi/ssa: pitch.
pisto/s, sup. pisto/tatos: trusty, faithful; w. inf., Il. 16.147; neut. pl. as subst., pista\ gunaici/n, ‘faith,’ ‘confidence,’ in, Od. 11.456.
pisto/w, mid. aor. (e))pistw/santo, pass. aor. subj. du. pistwqh=ton, inf. -h=nai: mid., bind oneself or each other mutually by oath, pledges, Il. 6.283; pass., be pledged, trust, Od. 21.218.
pi/sunos (pei/qw): trusting in, relying upon, tini/.
pi/sures (Aeolic for te/ssares): four.
*pitqeu/s: son of Pelops, king in Troezen, father of Aethra, Il. 3.144†.
pitna/w and pi/tnhmi (parallel forms to peta/nnu=mi), part. pitna=/s, ipf. pi/tna=, pass. ipf. pi/tnanto: spread out, extend; mid., ‘float,’ flutter,’ Il. 22.402.
*pitu/eia: a town in Mysia, Il. 2.829†.
pitu/s, u/os: pine or fir.

pi=fau/skw, pi=fau/skomai (pi-fa/vskw, fa/os): make to shine, make manifest, make known; in the physical sense, flo/ga, kh=la, *f 333, Il. 12.280; then met., e)/pos, e)/pea, fw=ta, *k 202, Od. 15.518.
pi=/wn, onos, fem. pi=/eira, sup. pi=o/tatos: fat, fertile, rich, Il. 9.577, Il. 5.512.
*plagktai/ (pla/zw): pe/trai, the Planctae, or Clashing Rocks, against which everything that approached was dashed to pieces, Od. 12.61, Od. 23.327.
plagkto/s (pla/zw): crazy, or, according to others, vagabond, Od. 21.363†.
plagktosu/nh: roving, roaming, Od. 15.343†.
pla/gxqh: see pla/zw.

pla/zw (cf. plh/ssw), aor. pla/gce, mid. fut. pla/gcomai, pass. aor. pla/gxqh, part. plagxqei/s: I. act., strike, Il. 21.269; esp., strike or drive back, cause to drift; r(o/on, tina\ a)po\ patri/dos, Il. 17.751, a 75, Od. 24.307; met., of the mind, ‘make to wander,’ ‘confuse,’ Od. 2.396.— II. mid. and pass., be driven, drift, wander; ‘be struck away,’ ‘rebound,’ Il. 11.351.
*pla/kos: a mountain above the city of Thebe, in Mysia, Il. 6.396, 425, Il. 22.479.
plana/omai, plano/wntai: rove, Il. 23.321†.
*pla/taia: Plataea, a town in Boeotia, Il. 2.504†.
plata/nistos: plane-tree, not unlike our maple, Il. 2.307.
platu/s, ei=a, u/: broad, wide; ai)po/lia ai)gw=n, ‘wide - roaming,’ because goats do not keep close together in the herd as sheep do in the flock, Il. 2.274, Od. 14.101, 103.
ple/es: see plei/wn.
plei=os, ple/os, comp. pleio/teros: full.
plei=stos (sup. of polu/s): most, a great many.—Adv., plei=ston, most, especially.
plei/w: see ple/w.
plei/wn, plei=on, and ple/wn, ple/on (comp. of polu/s), pl. nom. ple/ones (Hdt. pleu=nes), Od. 18.247, plei/ous, ple/es, dat. plei/osin, pleo/nessin, acc. ple/as: more, greater, the greater part.
plekto/s (ple/kw): braided, twisted.
ple/kw, aor. e)/plece, mid. aor. part. pleca/menos: plait, twist.
pleurh/: only pl., side, ribs, flank.
pleuro/n =pleurh/, pl., Il. 4.468†.
*pleurw/n: Pleuron, a town in Aetolia, Il. 2.639, Il. 13.217, Il. 14.116 .—*pleurw/nios: inhabitant of Pleuron, Il. 23.635.
ple/w, plei/w (ple/vw), inf. plei/ein, part. ple/wn (Od. 1.183), plei/ontes, ipf. e)/pleon, ple/en, fut. pleu/sesqe: sail; as if trans., u(gra\ ke/leuqa, Od. 3.71.
ple/wn, ple/on: see plei/wn.
plhgh/ (plh/ssw): blow, stroke, from a stick, a whip, a thong, Il. 15.17, Od. 4.244 ; *dio/s, the lightning-stroke, Il. 14.414.
plh=q) =plh=to, see pi/mplhmi.
plh=qos, eos (plh/qw): multitude, mass of men. (Il.)
plhqu=/s, u/os=plh=qos, esp. of the masses, the commons, as opp. to the chiefs, Il. 2.143, 278.
plh/qw, ipf. plh=qe: be or become full, w. gen.; said of rivers ‘swelling,’ the full moon, Il. 16.389, Il. 18.484.
*plhia/des: the Pleiads, the ‘Seven Sisters’ in the constellation Taurus, Od. 5.272, Od. 12.62.
plhkti/zomai (plh/ssw): contend with, inf., Il. 21.499†.
plh/mnh (plh/qw): hub or nave of a wheel. (Il.)
plhmuri/s, i/dos: rise of the sea, swell, flood, Od. 9.486†.
plh/n: except, w. gen., Od. 8.207†.
plh=nto: see (1) pi/mplhmi.—(2) pela/zw.
plh=ca: see plh/ssw.
plh/c-ippos: lasher of horses. (Il.)
plhsi/os (pe/las): near, neighboring to, tino/s, sometimes tini/, Od. 2.149; as subst., neighbor, Il. 2.271, Od. 10.35.—Adv., plhsi/on, near, hard by.
plhs-i/stios (i(sti/on): filling the sail, Od. 11.7 and Od. 12.149.

plh/ssw, aor. plh=ca, aor. 2 redup. (e))pe/plhgon, inf. peplhge/men, perf. pe/plhga, part. -gw/s, -gui=a, mid. aor. part. plhca/menos, aor. 2 peplh/geto, -onto, pass. aor. plh/gh, plhgei/s: strike, smite; mid., subjectively, Il. 16.125 ; xoro\n posi/n, in dancing, Od. 8.264; of the bolt struck (shot) by the key, Od. 21.50; freq. of wounding, Il. 11.240, Il. 16.332; metaph., e)k ga/r me plh/ssousi, ‘distract,’ Od. 18.231, Il. 13.394.
plh=to: see (1) pi/mplhmi.—(2) pela/zw.
pli/ssomai: only ipf., strode out, Od. 6.318†.
plo/kamos (ple/kw): lock of hair, pl., Il. 14.176†.
plo/os (ple/w): voyage, Od. 3.169†.
plou=tos (ple/os, plh/qw): wealth, riches.
ploxmo/s =plo/kamos, pl., Il. 17.52†.
pluno/s (plu=/nw): washing - pit, pl., tanks or basins in the earth, lined with stone.
plu=/nw, part. plu=nou/sh|, ipf. iter. plu=/neskon, fut. part. plune/ousa, aor. 3 pl. plu=nan, part. -a=sa: wash, clean, cleanse.
plwto/s: floating, Od. 10.3†.
plw/w (plw/vw, parallel form to ple/w), ipf. plw=on: swim, float.
pneu/mwn, onos: lung. (Il.)

pne/w, pnei/w (pne/vw), pne/ei, pnei/ei, aor. subj. pneu/sh|, mid. perf. 2 sing. pe/pnu=sai, inf. pepnu=sqai, part. pepnu=me/nos, plup. 2 sing. pe/pnu=so: (1) breathe, sometimes synonymous with live, Il. 17.447, Od. 18.131; of the wind and air, odors, Od. 4.446; fig., me/nea pnei/ontes, ‘breathing might’; e)n (adv.) de\ qeo\s pneu/sh| me/nos a)mfote/ro<*>n, ‘inspire,’ Il. 19.159.—(2) the perf. mid. comes to mean, be prudent, discreet, Il. 24.377, Od. 10.495; esp. freq. the part. pepnu=me/nos, sensible.
pnoih/ (pne/w): breathing, breath; freq. of the air, winds, esp. the pl., pnoiai\ ligurai/, blasts, Il. 5.526; of fire, Il. 21.355.
*podalei/rios: Podalirius, son of Asclepius, and brother of Machāon, Il. 2.732, Il. 11.833.
poda/ - niptron (ni/ptw): water for washing the feet, Od. 19.343 and 504.
*poda/rgh: name of a Harpy, the dam of Achilles' horses, Il. 16.150, Il. 19.400.
*po/dargos: name of a horse of Hector, and of one of Menelāus, Il. 8.185, Il. 23.295.
pod-a/rkhs (a)rke/w): strong of foot, swift-footed. (Il.)
*poda/rkhs: son of Iphiclus, brother of Protesilāus, chief of the contingent from Phylace and Pyrasus, Il. 2.704, Il. 13.693.
pod-hnekh/s, e/s (h)nekh/s, fe/rw): extending to the feet. (Il.)
pod - h/nemos (a)/nemos): wind - swift, epith. of Iris. (Il.)
*podh=s: son of Eëtion, slain by Menelāus, Il. 17.575, 590.
pod-w/keia: swiftness of foot, pl., Il. 2.792†.
pod-w/khs, es (w)ku/s): swift of foot, fleet-footed.
poqe/eske: see poqe/w.
po/qen: interrog. adv., whence? Of origin and parentage, ti/s po/qen ei)=s a)ndrw=n; *f 150, Od. 1.170.
poqe/n: enclitic indef. adv., from somewhere, Od. 24.149; freq. w. ei).
poqe/w, inf. poqh/menai, part. poqe/wn, -ousa, ipf. po/qeon, po/qei, iter. poqe/eske, aor. po/qesan, inf. poqe/sai: miss one that is absent, yearn for, desire, Od. 2.375, Od. 11.196.
poqh/: missing, yearning for, desire, lack, Od. 10.505.
po/qi: interrog. adv., where? (Od.)
poqi/: enclitic indef. adv., somewhere, anywhere; somehow; so esp. w. ai)/ ke, ‘if in any case,’ ‘if at all,’ etc., Od. 1.379, Od. 2.144.
po/qos =poqh/, so\s po/qos, ‘yearning for thee,’ Od. 11.202.
*poia/ntios: ui(o/s, son of Poeas, Philoctētes, Od. 3.190†.

poie/w, imp. poi/ei, ipf. (e))poi/ei, poi/eon, aor. (e))poi/hsa, fut. inf. poihse/men, mid. pres. poiei=tai, ipf. poieu/mhn, fut. poih/somai, aor. poih/sato, pass. perf. pepoi/htai: I. act., make, i. e. construct, build, dw=ma/ tini, sa/kos tau/rwn, *a 608, Il. 7.222; as an artist, Il. 18.490; then met., make, cause, do, of actions and results, poih=sai/ tina basilh=a, la=ou\s li/qous, ‘change to stones,’ Il. 24.611; w. prep., no/hma e)ni\ fresi/, ‘cause,’ ‘put’ in one's thoughts, Il. 13.55; and w. inf., se\ i(ke/sqai e)s oi)=kon, Od. 23.258.—II. mid., make (construct) for oneself; oi)ki/a, sxedi/hn, *m 168, Od. 5.251; less literally, a)gorh/n, ‘bring about,’ Od. 8.2 ; kle/os au)th=|, ‘procure,’ ‘win,’ Od. 2.126 ; r(h/trhn, of binding oneself by an agreement, Od. 14.393; w. two accusatives, tina/ a)/loxon, ‘make her his’ wife, Il. 3.409.
poi/h: grass.
poih/eis, essa, en: grassy.
poihto/s: (well) made or built, with and without eu)=.
poiki/llw (poiki/los): only ipf., poi/kille, wrought with skill, Il. 18.590†.
poi/kilma, atos (poiki/llw): any variegated work, broidery, Il. 6.294 and Od. 15.107. (The cut represents a woman embroidering.)
poikilo-mh/ths (mh=tis): with versatile mind, fertile in device, inventive, cunning.

poiki/los: variegated, motley, spotted, as the leopard or a fawn, Il. 10.30, Od. 19.228; also of stuffs embroidered in various colors, and of metal or wood artistically wrought, Il. 5.735, Od. 18.293, Il. 22.441, Il. 4.226, Il. 10.501.
poimai/nw, ipf. iter. poimai/neske, mid. ipf. poimai/nonto: act., tend as a shepherd, Il. 6.25, Od. 9.188; mid. or pass., be tended, pasture, feed.
poimh/n, e/nos (pw=u): shepherd; fig., la=w=n, ‘shepherd of the people,’ said of rulers.
poi/mnh: flock, pl., Od. 9.122†.
poimnh/ios: of the flock; staqmo/s, ‘sheep-fold,’ Il. 2.470†.

poinh/ (cf. poena): price paid for purification or expiation, satisfaction, penalty, w. gen. of the person whose death is atoned for by the quittance, Il. 9.633; also w. gen. of a thing, price, Il. 3.290, Il. 5.266, Il. 17.217.
poi=os: interrog. adj. pron., of what sort? (qualis). Freq. rather exclamatory than interrogative, as in the phrase, poi=o/n se ve/pos fu/gen e(/rkos o)do/ntwn; ‘what a speech!’
poipnu=/w (redup. from pne/w), part. poipnu=/wn, ipf. poi/pnuon, aor. part. poipnu=/sa=s: puff, pant, ‘bestir oneself,’ ‘make haste,’ Il. 8.219, Od. 20.149.
po/kos (pe/kw): shorn wool, fleece, Il. 12.451†.
pole/es: see polu/s.
polemh/ios: of or pertaining to war or battle, warlike.
polemisth/s, ptolemisth/s: warrior. (Il. and Od. 24.499.)
po/lemos, pto/lemos: fighting, war, battle.—p(t)o/lemo/nde, into the fight, to the war.
poleu/w: move or live in, inf., Od. 22.223†.
pole/wn: see polu/s.
po/lhas, po/lhes: see po/lis.
poli/zw (po/lis), aor. poli/ssamen, pass. plup. pepo/listo: found a city, build, Il. 7.453 and Il. 20.217.
polih/ths =poli=/ths, pl., Il. 2.806†.
po/linde: to the city.
polio - kro/tafos: with hoary temples, gray with age, Il. 8.518†.
polio/s: gray, hoary; of hair, iron, the sea, Il. 9.366, Il. 1.350.

po/lis, pto/lis, ios, po/lhos, dat. po/lhi, pl. po/lhes, po/lies, gen. poli/wn, dat. poli/essi, acc. po/lias, po/lhas: city, the whole district and community; hence with the name in apposition (not gen.); or as a part, a)/krh po/lis, ‘acropolis,’ ‘citadel;’ see a)/stu.
poli=/ths: citizen, only pl.
*poli=/ths: (1) a son of Priam, Il. 2.791, Il. 13.533, Il. 15.339, Il. 24.250.—(2) a companion of Odysseus, Od. 10.224.
polla/ki(s): many times, often.
pollo/s, pollo/n: see polu/s.
*poluaimoni/dhs: son of Polyaemon, Amopāon, Il. 8.276†.
polu/-ainos (ai)ne/w): much - praised, illustrious, epith. of Odysseus.
polu-a=/i=c, i=kos (a=)i=/ssw): much-darting or rushing, impetuous; ka/matos, weariness ‘caused by impetuosity in fighting,’ Il. 5.811.
polu - anqh/s, e/s (a)/nqos): much or luxuriantly blooming, Od. 14.353†.
polu - a=/rhtos (a)ra=/omai): muchprayed-to, much-desired, Od. 6.280 and Od. 19.404.
polu/-arni, dat., cf. polu/rrhn: rich in lambs or flocks, Il. 2.106†.
polu-benqh/s, e/s (be/nqos): very deep; limh/n, Il. 1.432. Elsewhere of the sea, and in Od.

*po/lubos: Polybus.—(1) a son of Antēnor, Il. 11.59.—(2) an Egyptian, Od. 4.126.—(3) an Ithacan, the father of Eurymachus, Od. 15.519.—(4) a suitor of Penelope, Od. 22.243, 284.—(5) a Phaeacian, Od. 8.373.
polu - bo/teira, poulubo/teira (bo/skw): much- or all-nourishing, epith. of the earth, *)axaii/s, Il. 11.770.
polu/-boulos (boulh/): full of counsel, exceeding wise, epith. of Athēna.
polu-bou/ths (bou=s): rich in cattle, Il. 9.154 and 296.
polu-ghqh/s, e/s (ghqe/w): much-rejoicing, ‘ever gay,’ epith. of the Horae, conceived as never ceasing from the choral dance, Il. 21.450†.
polu-dai/dalos: highly or cunningly wrought, of works of art; of men, artistic, skilful, Il. 23.743.

polu/-dakrus and poluda/kruos: of
many tears, tearful, deplorable, epith. of war, battle, etc., Il. 17.192.
polu - da/kru=tos: much wept or lamented, tearful, go/os, *w 620, Od. 19.213.
*polu/damna: wife of the Egyptian Thon, Od. 4.228†.
polu - deira/s, a/dos (deirh/): manyridged, epith. of Mt. Olympus. (Il.)
polu-de/ndreos (de/ndron): with many trees, full of trees. (Od.)
polu/-desmos: much or firmly bound together, Od. 5.33 and 338.
*poludeu/khs: Polydeuces (Pollux), son of Zeus and Leda, twin brother of Castor, Il. 3.237, Od. 11.300.
polu - di/yios (di/ya): very thirsty, dry, epith. of Argos, Il. 4.171†.
*poludw/rh: daughter of Peleus, wife of Spercheius, and mother of Menestheus, Il. 16.175†.
polu/-dwros (dw=ron): richly dowered.
*polu/dwros: (1) the youngest son of Priam by Laothoe, slain by Achilles, Il. 20.407, 419, *f 91, Il. 22.46.—(2) a Greek, Il. 23.637.
*polu/eidos: see *polu/i=dos.
polu/ - zugos (zugo/n): with many rowers' benches, Il. 2.293†.
polu-hgerh/s, e/s (a)gei/rw): numerously assembled, reading of Aristarchus in Il. 11.564†.
polu-h/ratos (e)/ramai): greatly loved or desired, lovely. (Od.)
polu-hxh/s, e/s: many - toned, nightingale, Od. 19.521; echoing, resounding, Il. 4.422.
polu-qarsh/s, e/s (qa/rsos): bold, intrepid.
*poluqersei+/dhs: son of Polytherses, Ctesippus, Od. 22.287†.
*polu/i=dos: (1) son of Eurydamas, slain by Diomed, Il. 5.148.—(2) a seer in Corinth, father of Euchēnor, Il. 13.663, 666.
polu - i+drei/h: much knowledge, shrewdness, Od. 2.346 and Od. 23.77.
polu/-idris (vi/dris): very knowing, shrewd, subtle, Od. 15.459 and Od. 23.82.
polu/-ippos: rich in horses, Il. 13.171†.
polu-kagkh/s, e/s (ka/gkanos): very dry, parching, Il. 11.642†.
polu/-karpos (karpo/s): fruitful, Od. 7.122 and Od. 24.221.
*poluka/sth: the youngest daughter of Nestor, Od. 3.464†.
polu-kerdei/h: great craft, Od. 24.167†.
polu - kerdh/s, e/s (ke/rdos): very crafty, cunning, Od. 13.255†.
polu/ - kestos (kente/w): much or richly embroidered, Il. 3.371†.
polu-khdh/s, e/s (kh=dos): full of sorrows, woful, Od. 9.37 and Od. 23.351.
polu-klhi/s, i=dos (klhi/s): with many thole-pins, many-oared.
polu/ - klhros: of large estate, wealthy, Od. 14.211†.
polu/ - klhtos (kale/w): called together in large numbers, i. e. from many a land, Il. 4.438 and Il. 10.420.
polu/ - klustos (klu/zw): much or loudly surging. (Od.)
polu/ - kmhtos (ka/mnw): wrought with much labor, well wrought, firmly built.
polu/-knhmos (knh/mh): with many glens or ravines, Il. 2.497†.
polu-koirani/h (koi/ranos): rule or sovereignty of many, Il. 2.204†.
polu - kth/mwn: with much possessions, Il. 5.613†.
*poluktori/dhs: son of Polyctor, Pisander, Od. 18.299†.
*polu/ktwr: Polyctor.—(1) a fabled name, Il. 24.397.—(2) name of an ancient hero in Ithaca, Od. 17.207.—(3) the father of Pisander.
polu - lh/i+os (lh/i+on): rich in harvests, Il. 5.613†.
polu/-llistos (li/ssomai): object of many prayers, Od. 5.445†.
*polumh/lh: daughter of Phylas, mother of Eudōrus, Il. 16.180†.
polu/-mhlos: rich in sheep or flocks. (Il.)
*polu/mhlos: a Lycian, son of Argeas, slain by Patroclus, Il. 16.417†.
polu/-mhtis: of many devices, crafty, shrewd, epith. of Odysseus; of Hephaestus, Il. 21.355.
polu - mhxani/h: manifold cunning, Od. 23.321†.
polu - mh/xanos: much contriving, full of device; ever ready, epith. of Odysseus.
polu - mnh/sth (mna/omai): much wooed. (Od.)
polu/-mu=qos: of many words, fluent, Il. 3.214 and Od. 2.200.
*polunei/khs: Polynīces, son of Oedipus, king of Thebes, and brother of Eteocles, mover of the expedition of the Seven against Thebes, Il. 4.377†.
*polu/nhos: a Phaeacian, the father of Amphialus, Od. 8.114†.
*polu/ceinos: son of Agasthenes, a chief of the Epeians, Il. 2.623†.
polu - pai/palos (paipa/lh, ‘fine meal’): very artful, sly, Od. 15.419†.
polu-pa=/mwn, onos (pe/pamai): much possessing, exceeding wealthy, Il. 4.433†.
polu - penqh/s, e/s: much - mourning, deeply mournful, Il. 9.563, Od. 23.15.
*poluphmoni/dhs: son of Polypēmon (‘Great Possessor’ or ‘Sufferer’), a feigned name, Od. 24.305†.
polu-pi=dac, akos: rich in springs. (Il.)
polu/-pikros: neut. pl. as adv., very bitterly, Od. 16.255†.
polu/ - plagktos (pla/zw): muchwandering, far-roving; a)/nemos, driving far from the course, baffling, Il. 11.308.
*polupoi/ths: a Lapith, the son of Pirithous, Il. 2.740, Il. 6.29, Il. 12.129, 182, Il. 23.836, 844.
polu/-ptuxos (ptu/ssw): with many folds, many-furrowed. (Il.)
polu/-pu=ros: abounding in wheat.
polu/-rrhn and polu/rrhnos (vrhn, va/rna): rich in sheep, Il. 9.154 and 296.

polu/s, pollh/, polu/, peculiar forms, pollo/s, pollo/n, poulu/s (also fem.), poulu/, gen. pole/os (Od. 20.25), acc. poulu/n, pl. nom. pole/es, polei=s, gen. pole/wn (Il. 16.655), polla=/wn, polle/wn, dat. pole/si, pole/essi, acc. pole/as, for comp. and sup. see plei/wn, plei=stos: much, many, with numerous applications that call for more specific words in Eng., as ‘long,’ of time, ‘wide,’ ‘broad,’ of space, ‘loud,’ ‘heavy,’ of a noise or of rain, etc. polloi/ (Att. oi( polloi/), the many, the most, the greater part, Il. 2.483, and w. part. gen., polloi\ *trw/wn, etc. Freq. as subst., polloi/, polla/, ‘many men,’ ‘many things,’ but predicative in Od. 2.58, Od. 17.537; often with other adjectives, pole/es te kai\ e)sqloi/, polla\ kai\ e)sqla/, ‘many fine things,’ Od. 2.312. —Neut. as adv., polu/, pollo/n, polla/, much, far, by far, very; polla\ h)ra=to, prayed ‘earnestly,’ ‘fervently,’ Il. 1.35; w. comp. and sup., polu\ ma=llon, pollo\n a)mei/nwn, a)/ristos, so polu\ pri/n, pollo\n e)pelqw/n, Il. 20.180.
polu/-skarqmos (skai/rw): much or far - springing, bounding, agile, epith. of the Amazon Myrīne, Il. 2.814†.
polu - sperh/s, e/s (spei/rw): widestrewn, wide-spread, over the earth.
polu - sta/fulos (stafulh/): with many clusters, rich in grapes, Il. 2.507 and 537.
polu/-stonos: much-sighing, mournful, Od. 19.118; grievous, Il. 15.451.
polu/-tla=s (tlh=nai): much-suffering or enduring, epith. of Odysseus.
polu-tlh/mwn = polu/tla=s.
polu/ - tlhtos: having endured or suffered much, Od. 11.38†.
polu-trh/rwn, wnos: abounding in doves, Il. 2.502 and 582.
polu/ - trhtos: pierced with many holes, porous. (Od.)
polu/ - tropos (tre/pw): of many shifts, versatile, epith. of Odysseus, Od. 1.1 and Od. 10.330.
polu - fa/rmakos: skilled in drugs, Il. 16.28, Od. 10.276.
*polufei/dhs: son of Mantius, grandson of Melampus, Od. 15.249 and 252.
*polu/fhmos: Polyphēmus.—(1) son of Poseidon and the nymph Thoō¨sa, one of the Cyclōpes, a man-eater, Od. 1.70, Od. 9.371 ff.—(2) one of the Lapithae, Il. 1.264.
polu/ - floisbos (floi=sbos): loudroaring, always polufloi/sboio qala/sshs.
*polufh/ths: chief of the Trojan allies from Ascania, Il. 13.791†.
*polufo/nths: son of Autophonus, slain by Tydeus before Thebes, Il. 4.395†.
polu/-forbos (forbh/): much-nourishing, bountiful. (Il.)
polu/ frwn, onos: very sagacious.
polu/-xru=sos: rich in gold.
polu-wpo/s (o)ph/): with many holes, meshy, Od. 22.386†.
pompeu/s, h=os: = pompo/s, only pl.; pomph=es nhw=n, Od. 4.362.
pompeu/w (pompeu/s): be escort, conduct, escort, Od. 13.422†.
pomph/ (pe/mpw): sending away, dismissal, escort.
pompo/s (pe/mpw): conductor, escort; fem., Od. 4.826.

pone/omai (po/nos), part. poneu/menos,
ipf. (e))ponei=to, pone/onto, fut. ponhso/meqa, aor. ponh/sato, plup. pepo/nhto: be engaged in toil, toil, labor, be busy, peri/ ti, kata\ dw=ma, u(smi=/nhn, and abs., Od. 17.258; trans., work upon, make with care, Il. 18.380, Od. 9.310.

po/nos: labor, toil, esp. of the toil of battle, Il. 6.77; frequently implying suffering, grievousness, ‘a grievous thing,’ Il. 2.291; hence joined with o)izu/s, kh/dea, a)ni=/h, Il. 13.2, *f 525, Od. 7.192.
*ponteu/s: a Phaeacian, Od. 8.113†.
ponto/qen: from the sea, Il. 14.395†.
po/ntonde: into the sea, Od. 9.495 and Od. 10.48.
*ponto/noos: a herald of Alcinous, Od. 7.182, Od. 8.65, Od. 13.50, 53.
ponto - poreu/w and pontopore/w: traverse the sea. (Od.)
ponto-po/ros: ‘sea-faring,’ sea-traversing.
po/ntos, gen. ponto/fin: the deep sea, deep; w. specific adj., *qrhi/kios, *)ika/rios; po/ntos a(lo/s, the ‘briny deep’ (cf. a(lo\s e)n pela/gessin), Il. 21.59.
po/poi (cf. papai/): interjection, always w)= po/poi, alas! alack! well-a-day! Il. 2.272. Usually of grief or displeasure, except in the passage cited.

por-, aor. e)/poron, po/ron, part. porw/n, pass. perf. pe/prwtai, peprwme/nos: bring to pass, give, grant, of things, both good and evil (tini/ ti), and of circumstances and events, w. acc. and inf., Il. 9.513; pass. perf. pe/prwtai, it is decreed by fate, ordained, destined, Il. 18.329; mostly the part. peprwme/nos, *o 209, Il. 3.309.
po/rdalis, ios, also pa/rdalis: panther, leopard.
*porqeu/s: king of Calydon, father of Oeneus, Il. 14.115†.
porqe/w (pe/rqw), ipf. (e))po/rqeon, fut. porqh/sw: lay waste, devastate.
porqmeu/s, h=os (po/ros): ferryman, pl., Od. 20.187†.
porqmo/s (po/ros): strait, sound, Od. 4.67 and Od. 15.29.
po/ris: see po/rtis.
po/rkhs: an iron ring, around the shaft of a spear to hold the head firm, Il. 6.320 and Il. 8.495. (See cut No. 4.)
po/ros (cf. pei/rw): passage - way, ford; po/roi a(lo/s, ‘paths of the sea,’ Od. 12.259.
po/rph (pei/rw): buckle, brooch, Il. 18.401†. (See cut No. 97.)
porsu=)nw, porsai/nw (root por), ipf. po/rsu=ne, fut. part. porsane/ousa (v. l. porsun.): make ready, prepare, tend; le/xos kai\ eu)nh/n, euphemistic for sharing the bed.
po/rtac, akos = po/rtis, Il. 17.4†.
po/rtis and po/ris, ios: calf or heifer.

porfu/reos: purple; fa=ros, ta/phtes, ai(=ma, Il. 8.221, *i 200, Il. 17.361; of the sea, with reference to its dark - gleaming, changeable hues, likewise of a swollen river, Il. 1.482, Il. 21.326; also of the rainbow, a cloud, Il. 17.547, 551. Met., qa/natos, probably with reference to the optical sensations of dissolution, Il. 5.83.
porfu=/rw (fu=/rw): boil or surge up, of waves, Il. 14.16; met., of mental disquiet, be troubled, brood, Od. 4.427, etc.
po/se: interrog. adv., whether?

*poseida=/wn: Poseidon (Neptūnus), son of Cronus and Rhea, brother of Zeus, Hades, etc., and husband of Amphitrīte. As god of the sea, the element assigned to him by lot (Il. 15.189), he sends winds and storms, moves the waters with his trident, and causes earthquakes, e)nosi/xqwn, e)nnosi/gaios, gaih/oxos. To him, as to Hades, black bulls were sacrificed, Od. 3.6; cf. the epithet ku=anoxai/ths. Poseidon is the enemy of the Trojans in consequence of the faithlessness of Laomedon, Il. 21.443 ff.; and of Odysseus, because of the blinding of Polyphēmus, his son, Od. 1.20. His dwelling is in the depths of the sea near Aegae, Il. 13.21, Od. 5.381; but he attends the assembly of the gods on Olympus, Il. 8.440, Il. 15.161.
*posidh/ios: sacred to Poseidon, Il. 2.506; as subst., *posidh/ion, temple of Poseidon, Od. 6.266.
po/sis (1), ios (pi=/nw): drink.
po/sis (2), ios (cf. despo/ths, potens): husband, spouse.
poss - h=mar: how many days? Il. 24.657†.
po/stos: the ‘how - manyeth?’ po/ston dh\ e)/tos e)sti/n, o(/te, ‘how many years is it, since, etc.?’ Od. 24.288†.
potamo/nde: into or to the river.
potamo/s: river; freq. personified as river-god, Il. 5.544, Il. 14.245.

pota/omai and pote/omai (frequentative of pe/tomai), potw=ntai, pote/ontai, perf. pepo/thtai, 3 pl. pepoth/atai: flit.
fly; said of the souls of the departed, Od. 11.222.
po/te: interrog. adv., when? at what time?
pote/: enclitic indef. adv., at some time, once, some day.
pote/omai: see pota/omai.
po/teros: which (of two)? Pl., which party?
poth/ (pe/tomai): flying, flight, Od. 5.337†.
poth/s, h=tos: drink.
pothto/s (pota/omai): flying; subst. pothta/, birds, Od. 12.62†.
poti/: see pro/s. Compounds beginning with poti- must be looked for under pros-.
potide/gmenos: see prosde/xomai.
potike/klitai: see proskli=/nw.
potipepthui=a: see prospth/ssw.
potifwnh/eis: see prosfwnh/eis.
po/tmos (pet, pi=/ptw): that which befalls one, fate, death, always in bad sense in Homer, a)eike/a po/tmon e)fie/nai tini/, po/tmon a)naplh=sai, qa/naton kai\ po/tmon e)pispei=n, *d 396, Il. 11.263.

po/tnia, voc. po/tna (cf. po/sis 2, de/spoina): mistress, queen, qhrw=n, Artemis, Il. 21.470; freq. as honorable title or epith. of goddesses and women, po/tna qea=/, ‘mighty’ goddess (cf. ‘our Lady’), po/tnia mh/thr, ‘revered,’ ‘honored,’ Od. 18.5.
poto/s (pi=/nw): drink.
pou=: interrog. adv., where? whither?
pou/: enclitic indef. adv., somewhere, anywhere; methinks, doubtless, perhaps.
poulubo/teira: see polubo/teira.
*pouluda/ma=s: Polydamas, a Trojan, son of Panthoüs, Il. 14.449, 453, Il. 15.339, 518, 521, *p 535, Il. 18.249.
poulu/pos, podos: polypus, cuttlefish, Od. 5.432.
poulu/s, poulu/: see polu/s.

pou/s, podo/s, pl. dat. possi/, po/dessi, du. podoi=in: foot; said also of the ‘talons’ of birds, Od. 15.526; designating swiftness of foot, in the race, Il. 13.325; fig., of the base of a mountain, Il. 20.59; technically, nho/s, sheet, a rope fastened to the lower corners of a sail to control it (see plate IV.), Od. 5.260, Od. 10.32.
*pra/ktios: a river in the Troad, north of Ab&ymacr;dus, Il. 2.835†.
*pra/mneios: oi)=nos, Pramnian wine, of dark color and fiery quality.
prapi/des = fre/nes, diaphragm, midriff, Il. 11.579; then for heart, mind, thoughts, Il. 22.43, Il. 18.380, Od. 7.92.
prasih/: garden-bed, Od. 24.247 and Od. 7.127.
pre/pw, ipf. e)/prepe: be conspicuous or distinguished, Il. 12.104, Od. 8.172, Od. 18.2.
pre/sba: see pre/sbus.
presbh/ion (pre/sbus): gift of honor, Il. 8.289†.
presbu-genh/s: first-born, Il. 11.249†.

pre/sbus, in Hom. only fem. pre/sba, comp. presbu/teros, sup. presbu/tatos: aged, venerable, honored, comp. older, sup. oldest; *(/hrh pre/sba qea=/, not with reference to age (although of course it never made any difference how old a goddess was), Il. 5.721; cf. Od. 4.59.

prh/qw, aor. e)/prhsa, prh=se, inf. prh=sai: a verb combining the notions, blow, stream, burn; e)/prhsen d' a)/nemos me/son i(sti/on, ‘swelled,’ ‘filled,’ Od. 2.427; with e)n, Il. 1.481; (ai<*>=ma) a)na\ sto/ma kai\ kata\ r(i=nas | prh=se xanw/n, ‘spirted,’ Il. 16.350 ; puri/ and puro/s, Il. 7.429, 432, Il. 2.415.
prhnh/s, e/s (pro/, cf. pronus): forward, on the face, head-foremost, Il. 6.43, Il. 16.310; opp. u(/ptios, Il. 24.11.

prh=cis, ios (prh/ssw): accomplishment, result; ou)/ tis prh=cis e)gi/gneto mu=rome/noisin, ‘they gained nothing’ by weeping, Od. 10.202, 568; business, enterprise, Od. 3.82 ; kata\ prh=cin, ‘on business,’ Od. 3.72.

prh/ssw (pe/rhn), ipf. iter. prh/sseskon, fut. prh/cw, aor. e)/prhca: fare, pass over, a(/la, Od. 9.491; complete a journey, ke/leuqon, o(doi=o (part. gen.), Il. 14.282, Il. 24.264, Od. 3.476; then in general, do, accomplish, e)/rgon, ou)/ ti, Od. 19.324, *w 550, Il. 1.562.
pri/ato, defective aor.: bought, purchased. (Od.)
*priami/dhs: son of Priam. (Il.)

*pri/amos: Priam, son of Laomedon, and king of Troy. He was already an aged man at the time of the war, and took no part in the fighting, Il. 24.487. Homer says that Priam was the father of fifty sons, of whom his wife Hecuba bore him nineteen. Besides Hector, Paris, Helenus, and Cas
sandra, the following children are named: Echemmon, Chromius, Lycāon, Polītes, Gorgythion, Democoön, Deīphobus, Isus, Antiphus, Laodice.

pri=/n (pro/): (1) adv., before, formerly, first; pri/n min kai\ gh=ras e)/peisin, ‘sooner’ shall old age come upon her, Il. 1.29, Il. 24.551, Od. 3.117; freq. to\ pri/n, polu\ pri/n, Od. 2.167.—(2) conj., before, with some peculiarities of construction which may be learned from the grammars; the inf. is used more freely with pri/n in Homer than in other authors. Freq. doubled in correlation, pri\n.. pri/n, *q 452, Il. 1.97; so pa/ros.. pri/n, pro/sqen.. pri/n, pri/n g' o(/te, pri/n g) h)/ (priusquam), Il. 5.288. Without verb, pri\n w(/rh, ‘before it is time,’ Od. 15.394.
pristo/s (pri/w): sawn, ivory, Od. 18.196 and Od. 19.564.

pro/: before, forward, forth.—I. adv., (ku=/mata) pro\ me/n t' a)/ll), au)ta\r e)p) a)/lla, some ‘before,’ others after, Il. 13.799, cf. 800; pro\ ga\r h(=ke, sent ‘forth,’ Il. 1.195 ; *=)ilio/qi pro/, ou)rano/qi pro/, ‘before Ilium,’ ‘athwart the sky’ (at Ilium, in the sky, ‘in front’), Il. 3.3; of time, h)w=qi pro/, in the morning ‘early’; pro/ t' e)o/nta, ‘things past’; pro/ oi( ei)/pomen, ‘beforehand,’ Il. 1.70, Od. 1.37; a subst. in the gen. may specify the relation of the adv., pro\ d' a)r) ou)rh=es ki/on au)tw=n (gen. of comparison), Il. 23.115.—II. prep. w. gen., (1) of space, pro\ pula=/wn, pro\ a)/naktos, before the gates, in the presence of the master, Il. 24.734 ; pro\ o(dou=, well forward on the way, Il. 4.382.—(2) of time, Od. 15.524, Il. 10.224.—(3) fig., in behalf of, for; ma/xesqai, o)le/sqai pro\ po/lhos (pro patria mori), Il. 22.110; causal, pro\ fo/boio, for, Il. 17.667.
pro-alh/s, e/s (a(/llomai): springing forward, sloping, Il. 21.262†.

pro-bai/nw, part. probiba=/s, probibw=nti, -a, perf. probe/bhka, plup. probebh/kei: go forward, advance, and fig., surpass, tino/s, Il. 6.125; a)/stra probe/bhke, are ‘verging low,’ ‘forward’ toward their setting, Il. 10.252.

pro-ba/llw, aor. 2 iter. proba/leske, part. probalo/ntes, mid. aor. 2 proba/lonto, opt. probaloi/mhn: act., throw forth, ‘tossed it over,’ of the winds playing ball with Odysseus's raft, Od. 5.331; met., e)/rida, ‘begin’ strife, Il. 11.529; mid., cast down before, subjectively, Il. 1.458; met., excel, tino/s, Il. 19.218.
pro/-basis (probai/nw): live - stock, as opp. to keimh/lia (kei<*>mai), Od. 2.75†. Cf. the foll.
pro/ - baton (probai/nw): only pl., cattle, droves or flocks, Il. 14.124 and Il. 23.550.
probiba=/s, probibw=n: see probai/nw.
pro-blh/s, h=tos (proba/llw): projecting.
pro - blw/skw, inf. problwske/men, aor. 2 pro/molon, imp. pro/mole, part. -w/n, -ou=sa: come or go forward or forth.
pro-boa/w, part. probow=nte: shout loudly (above the rest), Il. 12.277†.
pro/ - bolos (proba/llw): jutting rock, Od. 12.251†.
pro-gene/steros: born before, older, comp. of progenh/s.
pro - gi/gnomai, aor. 2 proge/nonto: get on, advance, Il. 18.525†.
pro/-gonos: pl., earlier-born lambs, ‘spring lambs,’ ‘firstlings,’ Od. 9.221†.
pro - daei/s (root da): aor. part., learning beforehand, Od. 4.396†.
pro - dokh/ (prode/xomai): lurkingplace, ambush, pl., Il. 4.107†.
pro/-domos: vestibule, a portico before the house, supported by pillars (see plate III. D D, at end of volume), Il. 9.473, Od. 4.302, cf. Od. 8.57.
pro - ee/rgw (ve/rgw): hinder (by standing before), w. inf., ipf., Il. 11.569†.
proe/hka: see proi+/hmi.
pro - ei=don, subj. proi+/dwsin, part. proi+dw/n, mid. subj. proi+/dwntai: look forward, catch sight of in front, mid., Od. 13.155.
proe/men: see proi+/hmi.
pro - ere/ssw, aor. proe/ressa: row forward.
pro - eru/w, aor. proe/russen, subj. proeru/ssw: draw forward, launch.
pro/es: see proi+/hmi.
pro-e/xw, prou)/xw, prou)/xousin, part. prou)/xwn, ipf. pro/exe; mid. ipf. prou)/xonto: be ahead, Il. 23.325, 453; jut forward, Od. 12.11, Od. 13.544; mid., hold or have before oneself, Od. 3.8.
pro-h/khs, es (a)kh/): sharp in front, with sharp blades, Od. 12.205†.
pro-qe/lumnos (qe/lumnon): with the root, roots and all, Il. 10.15, Il. 9.541; overlapping, of the layers of ox-hide forming a shield, Il. 13.130.
proqe/ousi: see proti/qhmi.
pro - qe/w, ipf. iter. proqe/eske, subj. proqe/h|si: run before, outstrip.
*proqoh/nwr: son of Areïlycus, a chief of the Boeotians, Il. 2.495, Il. 14.450, 471.
*pro/qoos: son of Tenthrēdon, a leader of the Magnesians, Il. 2.756, 758.
proqorw/n: see proqrw/skw.
*proqo/wn: a Trojan, slain by Teucer, Il. 14.515†.
pro - qrw/skw, aor. part. proqorw/n: spring forward. (Il.)
pro-qu=mi=/h (pro/qu=mos): zeal, courage, pl., Il. 2.588†. The i= is due to the necessities of the rhythm.
pro/-quron (qu/rh): front gateway, Od. 1.103, Od. 3.493; front doorway (see plate III. t), Od. 8.304, Od. 18.10; porch at the entrance of the court, with pillars (see plate III. A).
pro - i+a/llw, ipf. proi+/allen: send forth.
pro-ia/ptw, fut. proi+a/yei, aor. proi+/ayen: hurl (forth), *)/ai+di, *)ai+dwnh=i, *a 3, Il. 5.190. The pro- is merely for emphasis. (Il.)

pro - i+/hmi, proi+/hsi, 3 pl. proi+ei=si, imp. proi+/ei, part. proi+ei=sa, ipf. proi+/ein, -eis, -ei (-hn, -hs, -h), aor. proe/hka, proh=ke, 3 pl. pro/esan, imp. pro/es, -e/tw, inf. proe/men: let go forth, send forth, tina/, w. inf. of purpose, Il. 10.125, Od. 10.25; so of missiles, water, ‘pour,’ etc., Il. 8.297, Il. 2.752; ‘let drop,’ ‘let fall,’ Od. 5.316, Od. 19.468; fig., fh/mhn, e)/pos, Od. 20.105, Od. 14.466; ku=do/s tini, ‘bestow,’ Il. 16.241.
pro - i+/kths: beggar, mendicant. (Od.)
proi+/c, proiko/s: gift, present; proiko/s, ‘for nothing,’ i. e. without compensation, Od. 13.15.
pro-i+/sthmi: only aor. 1 part., prosth/sa=s, having put forward (in the front), w. inf., Il. 4.156†.
*proi=tos: Proetus, king of Tiryns, son of Abas, and husband of Anteia, Il. 6.157 ff.
pro-kaq-i/zw: alight after flying forward, settle down, part., Il. 2.463†.
pro - kale/omai, aor. prokale/ssato, imp. proka/lessai, subj. prokale/ssetai: challenge; xa/rmh|, maxe/sasqai, *h 218, Il. 3.432.
pro-kali/zomai = prokale/omai.
pro/-keimai: lie before, only part.
pro/ - klutos (klu/w): heard of old, ancient and celebrated; e)/pea, Il. 20.204†.
*pro/kris: daughter of Erechtheus, king of Athens, Od. 11.321†.
pro/-krossos (kro/ssai): in rows, in tiers, pl., Il. 14.35†.
pro - kuli/ndomai: roll forward, Il. 14.18†.
pro - le/gw: only pass. perf. part., prolelegme/noi, chosen, picked, Il. 13.689†.
pro-lei/pw, aor. part. prolipw/n, inf. prolipei=n, perf. prole/loipen: leave behind, met., forsake, Od. 2.279.
pro-maxi/zw (pro/maxos): be a champion, fight in the front rank, *trwsi/ (among the Trojans), tini/ (with some one), Il. 3.16 and Il. 20.376.
pro - ma/xomai: fight before one, Il. 11.217 and Il. 17.358.
pro/ - maxos: champion, foremost fighter.
*pro/maxos: son of Alegēnor, a Boeotian chief, Il. 14.476, 482, 503.
pro-mi=/gnu=mi: only pass. aor. 2 inf., promigh=nai, to have intercourse with (tini/) before one, Il. 9.452†.
pro - mnhsti=noi: one before (after) another, successively, opp. a(/ma pa/ntes, Od. 21.230 and Od. 11.233.
promolw/n: see problw/skw.
pro/mos (pro/): foremost (man), foremost fighter.
pr<*>oe/w, aor. prono/hsan, inf. pronoh=sai: think or devise beforehand, suspect, Od. 5.264, Il. 18.526.
*pro/noos: a Trojan, slain by Patroclus, Il. 16.399†.
pro/c, proko/s (cf. perkno/s): deer, roe, Od. 17.295†.
pro-paroiqe(n): before, formerly, of space and of time; w. gen. of place, before, along; h)io/nos propa/roiqe, Il. 2.92.
pro/-pa=s, -a=sa, -an: all (day) long, all (the ships) together, Od. 9.161.
pro-pe/mpw, aor. prou)/pemya: send before or forth.
prope/fantai: see profai/nw.
pro - pi=/ptw, aor. part. propesw/n: fall forward, ‘lay to,’ in rowing, Od. 9.490 and Od. 12.194.
pro - podi/zw: only part., striding forward, Il. 13.158 and 806.
pro - prhnh/s, e/s: leaning forward, bent (forward), Il. 3.218, Od. 22.98.
