fula/ssw, inf. fulasse/menai, fut. -cw, aor. fu/lacen, pass. and mid. perf. part. pefulagme/nos: I. act., watch, keep watch, abs., nu/kta, ‘all night,’ Od. 5.466, Od. 22.195; trans., watch over, guard, Il. 10.417; pass., Il. 10.309; watch for, Il. 2.251, Od. 4.670; fig., ‘treasure up,’ ‘keep’ faith, Il. 16.30, Il. 3.280.—II. mid., watch for oneself, Il. 10.188 ; pefulagme/nos ei)=nai, ‘be on thy guard,’ Il. 23.343.
*fu=lei/dhs: son of Phyleus, Meges, Il. 5.72, Il. 15.519, 528, Il. 16.313.

*fu=leu/s: son of Augēas of Elis, banished by his father, because when appointed arbiter in the dispute between Augēas and Heracles he decided in favor of the latter, Il. 2.628, Il. 10.110, 175, *o 530, Il. 23.637.
fuli/h: wild olive-tree, Od. 5.477†.
fu/llon: leaf; fu/llwn geneh/, Il. 6.146.
*fu=lome/dousa: wife of Arithoüs, Il. 7.10†.

fu=lon (fu/w): race, people, in the widest sense, qew=n, Il. 5.441; usually pl., tribes, host, etc., gunaikw=n, a)oidw=n, g 282, Od. 8.481; of animals, a)/gria fu=la, Il. 19.30. In narrow sense, tribe, class, clan, family, Il. 2.362.
fu=/lopis, idos, acc. -in, -ida, Od. 11.314; combat, din of battle; usual epith., ai)nh/, also a)rgale/h, krate/rh, Od. 16.268; pole/moio, Il. 13.635.
*fu=lw/: name of a maid of Helen, Od. 4.125 and 133.
fu/chlis: cowardly, Il. 17.143†.
fu/cimos: neut., fu/cimon, chance of escape, Od. 5.359†.
fu/cis (feu/gw): flight. (Il.)
fu=/rw, aor. e)/fursa, subj. fu/rsw, pass. perf. part. pefurme/nos: wet, moisten.
fu=sa, pl. fu=sai: bellows. (*s)
fu=sa/w, part. fu=sw=ntes, ipf. e)fu=/swn: blow, Il. 18.470 and Il. 23.218.
fu=sia/w: only part., fusio/wntes, panting, Il. 4.227 and Il. 16.506.
fu=si/ - zoos (fu/w, zwh/): producing life, life-giving, ai)=a. (Il. and Od. 11.301.)
fu/sis, ios (fu/w): natural characteristic, quality, property, Od. 10.303†.
fu=tali/h (futo/n): plantation; vineyard or orchard, Il. 6.195. (Il.)
futeu/w, ipf. fu/teuen, aor. e)fu/teusan, subj. futeu/sw, inf. -eu=sai: plant; fig., devise, plan, Od. 2.165, Od. 4.668, Il. 15.134.
futo/n (fu/w): plant, tree; collective, ‘plants,’ Od. 24.227, 242.

fu/w, ipf. fu/en, fut. fu=/sei, aor. 1 e)/fu=se, aor. 2 e)/fu=n, fu=, part. fu/ntes, perf. pe/fu=ka, 3 pl. -asi (not -a=si), pefu/a=si, subj. pefu=/kh|, part. pefui=a, pefuw=tas, pefu=ko/tas, plup. pefu=/kei, mid. fu/ontai, ipf. fu/onto: I. trans., pres. (exc. once), fut., and aor. 1 act., make to grow, produce; fu/lla, tri/xas, *a 235, Od. 10.393. — II. intrans., mid., perf., and aor. 2 act., grow; phrases, o)da\c e)n xei/lesi fu/ntes, ‘biting their lips’; e)n d' a)/ra oi( fu= xeiri/, ‘grasped,’ ‘pressed’ his hand; the pres. act. is once used intransitively, Il. 6.149.
*fwkei=s: the Phocians, inhabitants of Phocis, Il. 2.517, 525, *o 516, Il. 17.307.
fw/kh: seal. (Od.)

fwne/w (fwnh/), aor. (e))fw/nhse, part. fwnh/sa=s: raise the voice, speak aloud, speak, see fwnh/. Often joined to another verb of saying, either as participle, or as parallel tense, Il. 1.201, Od. 4.370.
fwnh/: voice, properly with reference to its quality, whereby one individual may be distinguished from an other. Transferred to animals, suw=n, bow=n, Od. 10.239, m 396, Od. 19.521.
fwriamo/s: chest, coffer, box, pl., Il. 24.228 and Od. 15.104.
fw=s: see fa/os.
fw/s, fwto/s: man, wight; like a)nh/r, but not so much a mark of distinction; freq. in apposition to a name, Il. 4.194 . a)llo/trios fw/s, ‘somebody else.’

div1.head: *x
div1.entryFree: xa/de, xade/ein: see xanda/nw.

xa/zomai, subj. xazw/me(s)q(a), imp. xa/zeo, ipf. (e))xa/zet(o), -ont(o), fut. xa/ssontai, aor. xa/ssat(o), inf. -asqai, part. -a/menos, aor. red. part. kekadw/n, mid. keka/donto: give way, fall back, retire before some one, a)/y, o)pi/sw, and w. u(po/, Il. 4.497; fra/zeo kai\ xa/zeo, ‘bethink and shrink,” Il. 5.440; then with gen., give over, rest from, ma/xhs, douro/s, *o 426, Il. 11.539. Here belongs the causative kekadw/n, depriving, Il. 11.334, Od. 21.153, 170, unless this form should be referred to kh/dw.

xai/nw or xa/skw (root xa, cf. hisco), aor. 2 opt. xa/noi, part. xanw/n, perf. part. kexhno/ta: gape, yawn; ‘may the earth engulf me,’ Il. 4.182, etc.; perf. part., ‘with open mouth,’ aor., pro\s ku=ma xanw/n, ‘opening my mouth’ to the wave, i. e. swallowing the water, Od. 12.350.

xai/rw (cf. gratus), ipf. xai=ron, e)/xaire, xai=re, iter. xai/resken, fut. inf. xairh/sein, aor. e)xa/rh, -hmen, -hsan, xa/rh, opt. xarei/h, part. xare/ntes, perf. part. kexarho/ta, also red. fut. inf. kexarhse/men, mid. fut. kexarh/setai, aor. 2 kexa/ronto, opt. -oito, 3 pl. -oi/ato, aor. 1 xh/rato: be glad, be joyful, rejoice; (e)n) qu=mw=|, no/w|, fresi/ and fre/na, also xai/rei moi h)=tor, kh=r, Il. 23. 647, Od. 4.260; w. dat. of the thing rejoiced at, ni=/kh|, o)/rni=qi, fh/mh|, Il. 10.277, Od. 2.35; freq. w. part. and dat., tw=| xai=ron nosth/santi, ‘at his return,’ Od. 19.463; also w. part. agreeing with the subj., Il. 3.76 ; ou) xairh/seis, ‘thou wilt be sorry,’ ‘rue it,’ Il. 20.363, Od. 2.249 ; xai=re, hail or farewell, Od. 1.123, Od. 13.59.
xai/th: flowing hair; of horses, mane, sing. and pl.
xa/laza: hail. (Il.)

xalepai/nw (xalepo/s), ipf. xale/paine, aor. subj. xaleph/nh|, inf. -h=nai: be hard, severe, rage, of wind and storm, Il. 14.399; freq. of persons, be vexed, angry, tini/, Od. 16.114, *c 256, Il. 20.133.

xalepo/s, comp. xalepw/teros: hard, difficult, dangerous, a)/eqlos; limh/n, ‘hard to approach,’ Od. 11.622, Od. 19.189; personal const. w. inf., xaleph/ toi e)gw\ me/nos a)ntife/resqai, Il. 21.482; xalepoi\ qeoi\ e)nargei=s fai/nesqai, ‘it is dangerous when gods appear, etc.’, Il. 20.131; oftener the impers. const. Of things, harsh, grievous, severe; gh=ras, mo/xqos, o)nei/dh, e)/pea, Il. 23.489; of persons, stern, angry, tini/, Od. 17.388.
xale/ptw (xalepo/s): be hard upon; tina/, Od. 4.423†.
xalepw=s: with difficulty. (Il.)
xali=no/s: bit (of a bridle), Il. 19.393†.
xali-frone/w (xali/frwn): only part. as adj., thoughtless, indiscreet, Od. 23.13†.
xali - frosu/nh: thoughtlessness, Od. 16.310†.
xali/-frwn, on (xala/w): slack-minded, thoughtless, Od. 4.371 and Od. 19.530.
xalkeo - qw/rhc, hkos: with breastplate of bronze; bronze - cuirassed, Il. 4.448 and Il. 8.62.
xa/lkeos and xa/lkeios: of copper or bronze, brazen; fig., o)/y, h)=tor, u(/pnos (of death), Il. 11.241.
xalkeo/ - fwnos: with brazen voice, epith. of Stentor, Il. 5.785†.
xalkeu/s, h=os: coppersmith, worker in bronze; with a)nh/r, i 391, Il. 4.187; of a worker in metals, goldsmith, Od. 9.391, Od. 3.432.
xalkeu/w: only ipf., xa/lkeuon, 1 wrought, Il. 18.400†.
xalkew/n, w=nos: forge, Od. 8.273†.
xalkh/ios: of a smith; do/mos, smithy. (Od.)
xalk - h/rhs, es (a)rari/skw): fitted with bronze, bronze - mounted, brazenshod.
xalki/s, i/dos = ku/mindis, Il. 14.291†.
*xalki/s: Chalcis.—(1) a town in Euboea on the Eurīpus, Il. 2.537.—(2) in Aetolia, at the mouth of the Evēnus, Od. 15.295.
xalko-barh/s, e/s: heavy with bronze, of ponderous bronze. — Fem., xalkoba/reia, *l 96, Od. 22.259.
xalko - glw/xi=n, i=nos: with bronze point, Il. 22.225†.
xalko-knh/mi=s, i=dos: with greaves of bronze, Il. 7.41†.
xalko - korusth/s (koru/ssw): in bronze armor, brazen-clad. (Il.)
xalko - pa/rh|os: with cheeks (sidepieces) of bronze, helmet. (Il. and Od. 24.523.)
xalko/-pos, -poun, gen. -podos: with hoofs of bronze, brazen - hoofed, Il. 8.41 and Il. 13.23.

xalko/s: copper or bronze (an alloy of copper and tin; brass, which is made of copper and zinc, was unknown to the ancients), Od. 1.184. The word stands often for things made of bronze, knife, axe, weapons and armor in general. Epithets, ai)=qoy, nw=roy, a)teirh/s, and others appropriate to the things severally designated.
xalko/-tupos (tu/ptw): inflicted with brazen weapons, Il. 19.25†.
xalko-xi/twn, wnos: brazen-clad.
*xalkwdontia/dhs: son of Chalcōdon, king of the Abantes in Euboea, Elephēnor, Il. 2.541†.
*xa/lkwn: a Myrmidon, the father of Bathycles, Il. 16.595†.
xama/dis (xamai/): to the ground.
xama=ze (xamai/): to the ground, down; to or into the earth, Il. 8.134, Od. 21.136.
xamai/ (loc. form xama, cf. humi): on the ground, to the ground.
xamai - eunh/s (eu)nh/): pl., making their beds on the ground, Il. 16.235†.
xamai-euna/s, a/dos = the foregoing, su/es, ‘grovelling,’ Od. 10.243 and Od. 14.15.

xanda/nw (root xad, cf. pre-hendo), ipf. e)xa/ndanon, xa/ndane, fut. xei/setai, aor. 2 e)/xade, xa/de, inf. -e/ein, perf. part. kexando/ta, plup. kexa/ndei: hold, contain, of the capacity of vessels, etc., Il. 23.742 . r 344, Od. 4.96; fig., of capacity of shouting, o(/son kefalh/ xa/de fwto/s, as loud as a man's ‘head holds,’ as loud as human voice is capable of shouting, Il. 11.462; fig., also Il. 4.24, Il. 8.461.
xando/n (xai/nw): lit., ‘with open mouth,’ greedily, Od. 21.294†.
xa/noi: see xai/nw.
xara/drh (xara/ssw): gully, ravine, mountain torrent, Il. 4.454 and Il. 16.390.
xarei/h, xa/rh: see xai/rw.
xari/eis, essa, en (xa/ris), comp. xarie/steros, sup. xarie/statos: full of grace, graceful, charming, winsome; neut. pl. as subst., ‘winning gifts,’ Od. 8.167.

xari/zomai (xa/ris), aor. opt. xari/saito, inf. -asqai, pass. perf. part. kexarisme/nos, plup. kexa/risto: show favor, gratify, tini/, very often the part., Il. 4.71, Od. 10.43 ; tini\ yeude/si, ‘court favor by lies,’ Od. 14.387; w. acc., ‘bestow graciously’ or ‘abundantly,’ Il. 11.134; also with partitive gen., esp. pareo/ntwn, ‘giving freely of her store,’ Od. 1.140; perf. and plup. as pass., be dear or pleasing; kexarisme/nos h)=lqen, was welcome, Od. 2.54 ; kexarisme/na qei=nai, like xari/sasqai, Il. 24.661.

xa/ris, itos (xai/rw, cf. gratia): quality of pleasing, grace, charm, charms, pl., Od. 6.237; then favor, thanks, gratitude; fe/rein tini, ‘confer,’ Il. 5.211 ; a)re/sqai, ‘earn’; dou=nai, i)/dmenai, ‘thank,’ ‘be grateful,’ Il. 14.235.—Acc. as adv., xa/rin, for the sake of, tino/s, i. e. to please him, Il. 15.744.
*xa/ris: the foregoing personified, as wife of Hephaestus, Il. 18.382.—Pl., *xa/rites, the Graces, handmaids of Aphrodīte, Il. 5.338, Il. 14.267, Il. 17.51, Od. 6.18, Od. 18.194.
xa/rma, atos (xai/rw): concr., a thing of joy, Il. 14.325; esp., gi/gnesqai/ tini, be a source of malignant joy,’ Il. 3.51, Il. 6.82.
xa/rmh (cf. xai/rw): joy of battle, desire for the fray, eagerness for combat.
xar-opo/s: with glaring eyes, Od. 11.611†.
*xa/ropos: king of Syme, father of Nireus, Il. 2.672†.
*xa/roy: son of Hippasus, brother of Socus, Il. 11.426†.
*xa/rubdis: Charybdis, the whirlpool opposite Scylla, Od. 12.104, 113, 235, Od. 23.327.
xa/skw: see xai/nw.
xate/w (cf. xa/skw): have need of, desire, beg, demand.
xati/zw = xate/w.
xeih/ (xa/skw): hole, Il. 22.93 and 95.
xei=los, eos: lip; for phrases, see fu/w, gela/w, prov., Il. 22.495; in general, rim, border, Il. 12.52; cf. Od. 4.132, Od. 15.116.
xei=ma, atos: winter, cold. (Od.)
xeima/ - rroos (sre/w), xeima/rrous, xei/marros: flooded with winter snow, winter-flowing.
xeime/rios (xei=ma): wintry; u(/dwr, ‘snow-water,’ Il. 23.420.
xeimw/n, w=nos: storm, tempest, rain, rainy weather.

xei/r, xeiro/s, besides the usual forms also dat. xeri/, pl. dat. xei/ressi and xei/resi (Il. 20.468): hand, as flat hand or fist, Od. 12.174; including the arm, Il. 6.81, Od. 1.238; often the pl., esp. fig. as typical of strength, violence, etc., joined with me/nos, bi/h, du/namis, Il. 6.502, Il. 12.135, Od. 20.237; xersi/n te posi/n te kai\ sqe/nei, Il. 20.360; xei=ra e)pife/rein tini/, xei=ras e)fie/nai, i)a/llein, xersi\n a)rh/gein, xei=ra u(pere/xein tini/, in defence, Il. 4.249; (ei)s) xei=ras i(ke/sqai, ‘fall into the power,’ Il. 10.448.
xeiri/s, i=dos: pl., probably loose or false sleeves, bound over the hands instead of gloves, Od. 24.230†.
xeiro/teros = xei/rwn, Il. 20.436 and Il. 15.513.
xei/rwn, onos (comp. to xe/rhs): inferior, worse.
*xei/rwn: Chiron, the centaur, skilled in the arts of healing and prophecy, the instructor of Asclepius and Achilles, dikaio/tatos *kentau/rwn, Il. 11.832, Il. 4.219, *p 143, Il. 19.390.
xei/somai: see xanda/nw.
xeli=dw/n, onos: swallow, Od. 21.411 and Od. 22.240.
xe/rados, eos: gravel, pebbles, Il. 21.319†.
xe/reion: see xerei/wn.
xereio/teros = xerei/wn. (Il.)
xerei/wn, on (xe/rhs): inferior, worse; ta\ xerei/ona, ‘the worse’ part, Il. 1.576 ; ou)/ ti xe/reion, ‘'t is not ill,’ Od. 17.176.

xe/rhs (xei/r, i. e. under one's hand), dat. xe/rhi, acc. xe/rha, pl. xe/rhes, neut. xe/reia: low, humble, weak, mean, poor, the positive to xei/rwn, xerei/wn, xeiro/teros, xereio/teros. With gen. it has the force of a comp., Il. 4.400, Od. 14.176.
xerma/dion: stone, of a size suitable to be thrown by hand.
xernh=tis: living by hand labor, a woman who spins for daily hire, Il. 12.433†.
xe/r-nibon (xei/r, ni/ptw): wash-basin, Il. 24.304†.
xer-ni/ptomai: only aor., xerni/yanto, washed their hands, Il. 1.449†.
xe/r-niy, ibos: water for washing the hands. (Od.)
*xersida/ma=s: a son of Priam, Il. 11.423†.
xe/rsonde: to or on the dry land, Il. 21.238†.
xe/rsos: dry land, shore.
xeu=ai, xeu=an, xeu=e: see xe/w.
xeu=ma, atos (xe/w): that which is poured, casting, Il. 23.561†.

xe/w (xe/vw, root xu), ipf. xe/on, xe/e(n), aor. 1 (Att.) e)/xeen, e)/xean, also e)/xeua, xeu=a, subj. xeu/w, xeu/omen, mid. pres. inf. xei=sqai, ipf. xeo/mhn, aor. 1 (e))xeu/ato, aor. 2 e)/xuto, part. xume/nh, pass. perf. 3 pl. ke/xuntai, plup. ke/xuto, aor. opt. xuqei/h: I. act., pour, shed, not of liquids only, but freq. of dry things, leaves strewn, let fall, earth heaped up, etc., xuth\n e)pi\ gai=an e)/xeuan, so tu/mbon, sh=ma, a 291, Il. 23.256; still more naturally said of mist, cloud, darkness, Il. 17.270, Il. 20.321; then fig., u(/pnon, ka/llos, fwnh/n, Od. 7.286, y 156, Od. 19.521.—II. pass. and aor. 2 mid., be poured, shed, or strewn, pour, flow, with the same freedom of application as act., a)h/r, xiw/n, ko/pros, Od. 9.330; of persons pouring forth in numbers, pressing around one, Il. 16.267, Od. 10.415 ; a)mf' au)tw=| xume/nh, i. e. embracing him, Il. 19.284; so once aor. 1, Il. 7.63.—III. mid., aor. 1, but not aor. 2, pour for oneself, or in any way subjectively, Od. 10.518 ; xeu/ato ka\k kefalh=s, on ‘his’ head, Il. 18.24 ; be/lea xe/onto, ‘their’ missiles, Il. 8.159 ; a)mfi/ ui(o\n e)xeu/ato ph/xee, ‘threw her’ arms about him, Il. 5.314.
xhlo/s (xai/nw): chest, coffer.
xh(mei=s = kai\ h(mei=s, Il. 2.238.
xh/n, xhno/s: goose.
xhramo/s (xai/nw): hole or crevice in a rock, Il. 21.495†.
xh/rato: see xai/rw.
xhreu/w (xh/rh): be deprived of, without; a)ndrw=n, Od. 9.124†.
xh/rh: bereaved, widowed; w. gen., Il. 6.408.
xhro/w (xh=ros, xh/rh), aor. xh/rwsas: bereave, make desolate. (Il.)
xhrwsth/s: pl., surviving relatives, heirs of one who dies childless, Il. 5.158†.
xh=tos, eos (xate/w): lack. (Il.)
xqamalo/s (xamai/), comp. -w/teros, sup. -w/tatos: low-lying, low.
xqizo/s (xqe/s): of yesterday, yesterday, usually as adv., Il. 1.424.—Neut. as adv., xqizo/n, xqiza/. xqiza/ te kai\ prw/iza, phrase meaning ‘but a day or two since,’ Il. 2.303.
xqw/n, xqono/s: earth, ground; land, region, Od. 13.352.
xi=/lioi, xi=/lia: a thousand. (Il.)
xi/maira: she-goat, Il. 6.181†.
*xi/maira: the Chimaera, a monster sent as a plague upon Lydia, but slain by Bellerophon, described Il. 6.179-182. (The cut is from an Etruscan bronze figure of large size in the museum at Florence.)
*xi/os: Chios, island on the Ionian coast of Asia Minor, Od. 3.170, 172.

xitw/n, w=nos: tunic. The xitw/n was like a shirt, but without sleeves, woollen, and white. It was worn by both men and women, next the body, and confined by a girdle, Od. 14.72. (See the cut, representing Achilles—clothed in the xi/tw/n—taking leave of Peleus. Cf. also No. 55). There were also long tunics, see e(lkexi/twn. Of soldiers, coat-of-mail, cuirass, Il. 2.416, Il. 11.100 (cf. cuts Nos. 12, 17, 79, 86). la=/inos, ‘tunic of stone,’ fig., of death by stoning, Il. 3.57.
xiw/n, o/nos: snow.

xlai=na: cloak, mantle, consisting of a piece of coarse, shaggy woollen cloth, worn double or single, diplh=, di/plac, a(ploi=/s, and freq. of a purple color, Il. 22.493, Od. 14.460, 478, 480, 488, 500, 504, 516, 520, 529. It also served as a blanket in sleeping, Od. 20.4, 95, g 349, Od. 4.50.
xlou/nhs: doubtful word, epith. of the wild - boar, according to the ancients, making its bed in the grass (e)n xlo/h| eu)nh\n e)/xwn), Il. 9.539†.
xlwrhi=/s (xlwro/s): pale green, olive green, epith. of the nightingale as dwelling in the fresh foliage, Od. 19.518†.
*xlw=ris: Chloris, daughter of Amphīon, king in Orchomenus, the wife of Neleus, and mother of Nestor, Chromius, Periclymenus, and Pero, Od. 11.281†.
xlwro/s (xlo/h): greenish yellow or yellowish green, as honey; de/os, pale fear, Il. 7.479, Od. 11.43, Il. 15.4; then fresh, verdant, Od. 9.379, 320.
xno/os (kna/w, ko/nis): foam; a(lo/s, Od. 6.226†.
xo/anos (xe/w): melting - pit, pl., Il. 18.470†.
xoh/ (xe/w): libation, drink-offering, esp. in sacrifices for the dead, Od. 10.518 and Od. 11.26.
xoi=nic, ikos: measure (for grain) = a soldier's daily ration, about one quart; a(/ptesqai xoi/niko/s tinos, ‘to eat of one's bread,’ Od. 19.28†.
xoi/reos: of a pig, of swine; kre/a, pork, Od. 14.81†.
xoi=ros: young pig, porker, Od. 14.73†.
xola/s, a/dos: pl., bowels, intestines, Il. 4.526 and Il. 21.181.
xo/los (cf. fel): gall, Il. 16.203; then, wrath, of animals, rage, Il. 22.94.

xolo/w, fut. inf. xolwse/men, aor. e)xo/lwsa, mid. xolou=mai, xolw/somai, kexolw/somai, aor. (e))xolwsa/mhn, pass. perf. kexo/lwtai, inf. -w=sqai, part. -wme/nos,
plup. kexo/lwso, -wto, 3 pl. -w/ato, aor. e)xolw/qhn: act., enrage, anger; mid. and pass., be wroth, angry, incensed, qu=mw=|, e)ni\ fresi/, khro/qi, fre/na, h)=tor, and tini/, ‘at’ or ‘with’ one; w. causal gen., also e)k, ei(/neka, etc. Il. 9.523, Il. 13.203, Il. 17.710.
xolwto/s: angry, wrathful.
xordh/: string of gut, Od. 21.407†.
xoroi-tupi/h (xoro/s, tu/ptw): choral dance, pl., Il. 24.261†.
xoro/s: dancing-place, Il. 18.590, Od. 12.318; then dance, Il. 16.180.
xo/rtos (cf. hortus): enclosure, Il. 11.774 and Il. 24.640.

xraisme/w (xrh/simos), aor. 2 e)/xraisme, xrai=sme, subj. xrai/smh|(si), -wsi, inf. -ei=n, fut. xraismh/sw, inf. -se/men, aor. 1 xrai/smhse, inf. -h=sai: be useful to one in something (tini/ ti), Il. 7.144; hence avail, help, ward off something, abs., and w. acc. (ti\), Il. 1.566, 589. Always with negative.

xra/omai, part. xrew/menos, perf. part. kexrhme/nos, plup. ke/xrhto: have use or need of; ‘according to his need,’ Il. 23.834 ; kexrhme/nos, ‘desiring,’ Il. 19.262; as adj., ‘needy,’ Od. 17.347; plup., fresi\ ga\r ke/xrht' a)gaqh=|sin, ‘had,’ Od. 3.266.
xrau/w, aor. subj. xrau/sh|: scratch, graze, wound slightly, Il. 5.138†.
xra/w (1) (xra/vw, cf. xrau/w), ipf. (or aor. 2) e)/xrae, e)xra/ete: fall foul of, assail, handle roughly, tini/, e 396, Od. 10.64; w. acc., and inf. of purpose, Il. 21.369, Od. 21.69.
xra/w, xrei/w (2), part. xrei/wn, mid. fut. part. xrhso/menos: act., deliver an oracle, Od. 8.79; mid., have an oracle delivered to oneself, consult the oracle, Od. 8.81, Od. 11.165, Od. 10.492.
xrei=os: see xre/os.
xrei/wn: see xra/ Od. 24.2.
xreiw/: see xrew/.
xrei/ws: v. l. for xrei=os, see xre/os.
xremeti/zw: neigh, whinny, Il. 12.51†.

xre/os, xrei=os (xra/omai): (1) want, need, then affair, business, Od. 1.409, Od. 2.45 ; *teiresi/a=o kata\ xre/os, for want of T., i. e. to consult him, Od. 11.479.—(2) what one must pay, debt, o)fei/lein tini/, o)fe/lletai/ moi, Il. 11.688, 686.

xrew/, xrew/, Il. 11.606, xreiw/ (xrh/): want, need, necessity; xreioi= a)nagkai/h|, Il. 8.57; e)sti\, gi/gnetai (cf. opus est), w. gen. of thing and acc. of person, also freq. ikei, i(ka=/nei, i(ka=/netai, Od. 6.136; xre/w without e)sti/ or i(ka=/nei, like xrh/, ti/pte de/ se xrew/; Od. 1.225.
xrew/menos: see xra/omai.

xrh/ (act. of xra/omai): impers., there is need, w. acc. of person and gen. of thing, Od. 1.124; then, one must, ought, should, w. acc. and inf. (either or both), ou(de/ ti/ se xrh/, ‘it behooves thee not,’ Od. 19.500, etc.
xrhi+/zw (xra/omai): need, tino/s.
xrh=ma, atos (xra/omai): what one has use or need of, pl., possessions, property. (Od.)
xri/mptw: only pass. aor. part., xrimfqei/s, pe/las, approaching very near, Od. 10.516†.
xri=/w, ipf. xri=on, aor. e)/xri=sa, xri=se, mid. fut. xri=/somai: smear with oil, anoint; mid., oneself, or something of one's own, i)ou\s farma/kw|, Od. 1.262.
xroih/ (cf. xrw/s): skin or surface of the body, Il. 14.164†.
xro/mados: grinding sound, Il. 23.688†.
*xro/mios: Chromius.—(1) a son of Priam, Il. 5.160.—(2) a son of Neleus, Od. 11.286, Il. 4.295.—(3) a Lycian, Il. 5.677.—(4) a Trojan, Il. 8.275.—(5) a chief of the Mysians, Il. 17.218, 494, 534.
*xro/mis = *xro/mios (5), Il. 2.858.
xro/nios: after a long time, Od. 17.112†.
xro/nos: time.
xroo/s+, xroi+/, xro/a: see xrw/s.
xru=s-a/mpuc, ukos: with frontlet of gold. (Il.)
xru=s-a=/oros (a)/or): with sword of gold, epith. of Apollo, Il. 5.509 and Il. 15.256.

xru=/seos, xru=)seios: of gold, golden, adorned with gold, Od. 4.14 (see cut No. 2). Of color, e)/qeirai, ne/fea, *q 42, Il. 13.523. The word is esp. applied to things worn or used by the gods. xru=se/h, xru=se/w|, etc., pronounced with synizesis.
*xru=/sh: Chryse, a port in the Troad, with a temple of Apollo, Il. 1.37, 100, 390, 431, 451.
*xru=shi/s: daughter of Chryses, Chrysēïs, Il. 1.111, 143, 182, 310, 369, 439. Her proper name was Astynome.
xru=s - hla/katos (h)lakath/): with golden arrow, Artemis, Od. 4.122.
xru=s-h/nios (h(ni/a): with golden reins or bridle, Il. 6.205 and Od. 8.285.
*xru=/shs: Chryses, priest of Apollo at Chryse, Il. 1.11, 370, 442, 450.
*xru=so/qemis: Chrysothemis, daughter of Agamemnon and Clytaemnestra, Il. 9.145 and 287.
xru=so/-qronos: golden-throned.
xru=so-pe/di=los: golden-sandalled.
xru=so/-pteros: with wings of gold, Il. 8.398 and Il. 11.185.
xruso/-rrapis: with wand of gold, Hermes.
xru=so/s: gold; collectively for utensils of gold, Od. 15.207.
xru=so - xo/os (xe/w): goldsmith, Od. 3.425†.

xrw/s, xrwto/s and xroo/s, dat. xroi+/, acc. xrw=ta and xro/a: properly surface, esp. of the body, skin, body with reference to the skin; then color, complexion, tre/petai, ‘changes,’ of turning pale with fear, Il. 13.279, Od. 21.412.
xume/nh, xu/nto: see xe/w.
xu/sis (xe/w): pouring, heap. (Od.)
xutlo/w, mid. aor. opt. xutlw/saito: mid., bathe and anoint oneself, Od. 6.80†.
xuto/s (xe/w): poured, heaped up.
xwleu/w: be lame, limp. (Il.)
xwlo/s: lame, halt.

xw/omai (xe/w), imp. xw/eo, ipf. xw/eto, aor. (e))xw/sato, subj. xw/setai, part. -a/menos: be agitated, troubled, angered; kh=r, (kata\) qu=mo/n, fresi/n, and w. dat. of the person, Il. 1.80, Il. 9.555; causal gen. of thing or person, Il. 1.429.
xwre/w (xw=ros), fut. xwrh/sousi, aor. (e))xw/rhsa: properly, make space or room; give place, make way, withdraw; tini/, ‘before’ one, Il. 13.324 ; tino/s, ‘from’ something, Il. 12.406.
xw/rh: space, place; pl., regions, countries, Od. 8.573.
xwri/s: separately, apart, by oneself.
xw=ros: a space, place; more concrete than xw/rh. Spot, region, Od. 14.2.

div1.head: *y
div1.entryFree: ya/maqos: sand, sands; to designate the strand, or the sand - hills of the shore, Od. 4.426; as simile for a countless multitude, Il. 2.800.
ya/mmos: sand, Od. 12.243†.
ya/r, yh/r, pl. gen. yarw=n, acc. yh=ras: starling, or meadow lark, Il. 17.755 and Il. 16.583.
yau/w (ya/vw), ipf. yau=on, aor. e)/yausa: touch lightly, graze; tinos, Il. 23.519, 806.
yedno/s (ya/w): rubbed off, thin, sparse, Il. 2.219†.
yeud-a/ggelos: reporting lies, false messenger, Il. 15.159†.
yeudh/s, e/s: false; as subst., liar, Il. 4.235†.
yeu=dos, eos: falsehood, lie; of fiction, Od. 19.203.
yeu/domai, imp. yeu/deo, fut. yeu/somai, aor. part. yeusa/menos: speak falsely, lie, deceive; yeu/somai h)= e)/tumon e)re/w, ‘shall (do) I deceive myself, or?’ Il. 10.534.
yeuste/w, fut. yeusth/seis: be a liar, ‘deceive oneself,’ Il. 19.107†.
yeu/sths: liar, deceiver, pl., Il. 24.261†.
yhlafa/w, part. -fo/wn: feel about, grope, Od. 9.416†.
yh=ras: see ya/r.
yhfi/s, i=dos: pebble, pl., Il. 21.260†.
yia/s, a/dos: drop, pl., Il. 16.459†.
yi=lo/s (ya/w): worn smooth and bare; nh=a, ‘dismantled,’ without sides, Od. 12.421.
yolo/eis, essa, en (yo/los, ‘smoke’): smouldering, sulphurous, Od. 23.330 and Od. 24.539.
*yuri/h: Psyria, a small island between Lesbos and Chios, Od. 3.171†.

yu=xh/ (yu=/xw): properly, breath of life, life, soul, spirit; to\n e)/lipe yu=xh/, of one falling in a faint, Il. 5.696; of life itself, yu=xh=s o)/leqros, Il. 22.325; peri\ yu=xh=s ma/xesqai, Od. 22.245; of animals, Od. 14.426 ; yu=xa=\s o)le/santes, Il. 13.763. Also of the disembodied spirits, souls of the departed in the nether world, yu=xh\ kai\ ei)/dwlon, Il. 23.104, cf. Od. 24.14; opp. to the body or the man himself, Il. 1.3.
For the supposed condition of the souls in Hades, see Od. 11.153, 232 ff., 476.
yu=xos, eos (yu=/xw): cold, coolness, Od. 10.555†.
yu=xro/s: cold.
yu=/xw, aor. 1 yu=/ca=sa: blow, breathe, Il. 20.440†.
ywmo/s (ya/w): morsel, gobbet, pl., Od. 9.374†.

div1.head: *w
div1.entryFree: w)=: O, interjection used w. voc.; placed between adj. and subst., Od. 4.206. With synizesis, Od. 17.375.
w)/: Oh! interjection expressive of feeling, w)/ moi, w)/ po/poi, etc.
*)wgugi/h: Ogygia, a fabulous island, the residence of Calypso, Od. 1.85, Od. 6.172, Od. 7.244, 254, Od. 12. 448, Od. 23.333.

w(=de (adv. from o(/de): so, thus, in this way, referring either to what follows or to what precedes, Il. 1.181, Il. 7.34; correl. to w(s, *g 300, Il. 6.477; like au)/tws, w(=de qe/eis a)ki/xhta diw/kwn, ‘just as you do,’ i. e. in vain, Il. 17.75, Il. 20.12; just, as you see, Od. 1.182, Od. 2.28 (according to Aristarchus w(=de never means hither in Homer); to such a degree, Il. 12.346.
w)/|dee: see oi)de/w.
w)di=/nw: writhe with pain, be in pain, travail, Il. 11.269.
w)di/s, i=nos: pl., pains of labor, travail, Il. 11.271†.
w)du/sao, w)du/sato: see o)du/ssomai.

w)qe/w, w)qei=, ipf. w)/qei, iter. w)/qeske, aor. w)=sa, e)/wse (Il. 16.410), iter. w)/saske, mid. aor. w)sa/mhn: thrust, push, shove; mid., thrust oneself, i. e. ‘press forward,’ Il. 16.592; force, drive, from or for oneself, Il. 5.691, Il. 8.295; w. gen., tei/xeos, ‘from’ the wall, Il. 12.420.
w)i=/eto, w)i/sqhn: see o)i=/w.
w)=k(a) (adv. from w)ku/s): quickly.
*)wkale/h: a village in Boeotia near Haliartus, Il. 2.501†.

*)wkeano/s: Oceanus, distinguished from the sea. (qa/lassa, po/ntos, a(/ls) as a mighty stream (potamo/s, Il. 18.607, Il. 20.7; do/os *)wkeanoi<*>=o, Il. 16.151; cf. Milton's ‘ocean stream’) encircling the whole Earth, Il. 18.607. The constellations (excepting the Great Bear, which in Greek latitudes does not dip below the horizon) are conceived as sinking below Oceanus and emerging from it on the other side of the Earth, as they set and rise. Beyond Ocean is the entrance to the nether world, and Elysium is on its hither bank, Od. 10.508, Od. 4.568. (In the cut, which represents a design of the shield of Achilles, the outer rim [5] indicates the stream of Ocean.)—Personified, *)wkeano/s, husband of Tethys, father of all streams and fountains, and indeed, of all the gods, Od. 4.568, Od. 10.139, Il. 14.311, 201.
w)/kistos: see w)ku/s.
w)/|kteira: see oi)ktei/rw.
w)ku/alos: swift-sailing.
*)wku/alos: a Phaeacian, Od. 8.111†.
w)ku/-moros, sup. -rw/tatos: quicklydying, doomed to a speedy death, swiftfated, Il. 18.95, Il. 1.417 ; i=)oi/, swift-slaying, Od. 22.75.
w)ku-pe/ths (pe/tomai): swift-flying, Il. 13.24 and Il. 8.42.
w)ku/-poros: swift-sailing, fast-going.
w)ku/-pos, podos: swift-footed, horses.
w)ku/-pteros (ptero/n): swift-winged, Il. 13.62†.
w)ku/-roos: swift-flowing, Il. 5.598 and Il. 7.133.

w)ku/s, w)kei=a and w)ke/a, w)ku/ (cf. ocior), sup. w)/kistos, w)ku/tatos (Od. 8.331): swift, fleet, often po/das w)ku/s, ‘swift-footed.’ Of things, be/los, o)isto/s, o)/leqros, Il. 22.325. Predicatively as adv., Od. 12.374, Il. 23.880.—Sup. neut. pl. as adv., w)/kista, Od. 22.77, 133.
*)wleni/h pe/trh: Olenian rock, a peak of Mt. Scollis, on the borders of Elis, Il. 2.617, Il. 11.757.
*)/wlenos: a town in Aetolia, on Mt. Aracynthus, Il. 2.639†.
w)lesi/-karpos: losing their fruit, of the willow which drops its fruit before ripening, Od. 10.510†.
(w)=lc), acc. w)=lka (ve/lkw): furrow, Il. 13.707 and Od. 18.375.
w)m-hsth/s (w)mo/s, e)/dw): eating raw flesh, of animals; hence, cruel, savage, of men, Il. 24.207.
w)mo-ge/rwn (w)mo/s, cf. cruda senectus): fresh, vigorous old man, Il. 23.791†.

w)mo - qete/w, aor. w)moqe/thsan, mid. ipf. w)moqetei=to: place (as offering to the gods) raw pieces of flesh upon the mhri/a wrapped in the caul, consecrate flesh, Il. 1.461; mid., have flesh consecrated, Od. 14.427.
w)=mos: shoulder.

w)mo/s: raw, uncooked. opp. o)ptale/os, Od. 12.396; prov., w)mo\n bebrw/qein tina/, ‘eat alive,’ of intense hate, Il. 4.35 ; w)ma/, adverbial, devour ‘raw,’ Il. 23.21; fig., ‘premature’ old age, Od. 15.357.
w)mo-fa/gos: eating raw flesh. (Il.)
w)/|mwca: see oi)mw/zw.
w)/nato: see o)/nomai.
w)nh/mhn, w)/nhsa: see o)ni/nhmi.
w)nhto/s (w)ne/omai): bought, ‘slavemother,’ Od. 14.202†.
w)=nos (vw=nos, cf. venum): purchase-money; e)pei/gete w(=non o(dai/wn, ‘hurry forward the delivery of the goods given in exchange for your freight,’ i. e. the return freight, Od. 15.445.
w)nosa/mhn: see o)/nomai.
w)|noxo/ei: see oi)noxoe/w.
w)=|ce: see oi)/gnu=mi.
w)/ressin: see o)/ar.
w)/reto: see o)/rnu=mi.

w(/rh: season, esp. the spring, Il. 2.468, Od. 9.51; and in pl., seasons of the year, Od. 10.469, Od. 2.107 ; *dio\s w(=rai, Od. 24.394; then the fitting, right time (like kairo/s), do/rpoio, u(/pnou, ga/mou, Od. 15.126; with inf., eu(/dein, Od. 11.373; pri\n w(/rh (‘before 't is time’), e)n w(/rh|, ei)s w(/ra=s, Od. 9.135.—Personified, *(=wrai, the Hours (Horae), door - keepers of Olympus and goddesses of the seasons, Il. 5.749 ff., Il. 8.393, 433.
*)wrei/quia: a Nereid, Il. 18.48†.
w(/rios (w(/rh): w(/ria pa/nta, all things in their season, Od. 9.131†.
w)/ristos = o( a)/ristos.

*)wri=/wn: Orīon, the mighty hunter, beloved of Eos, Od. 5.121. Slain by Artemis, he continues to follow the chase in the nether world, Od. 11.572, 310, Il. 18.486. He appears even in Homer as a constellation, Il. 18.488, Od. 5.274.
w)/rore: see o)/rnu=mi.
*)=wros: a Greek, slain by Hector, Il. 11.303†.
w)=rse, w)=rto, w)rw/rei: see o)/rnu=mi.

w(s (2) (yws): I. adv., as, how; answering to tw/s, w(/s (w(=s), ou(/tw, to/sson, Od. 14.44; ‘so surely as,’ Il. 8.541; often w(s o(/te, w(s ei), and used with single words as well as with clauses. Exclamatory, how! Od. 16.364, Od. 24.194. — II. conj., (1) temporal, as, when, always of a fact, with ind., Il. 23.871. — (2) explanatory (like o(/ti), that, Od. 3.346; and causal, because (=o(/ti ou(/tws), Il. 4.157, Od. 2.233, Od. 17.243.—(3) final, that, in order that.— (4) idiomatically used in the expression of a wish, like utinam, Il. 18.107, Il. 3.428.
w(/s (1): by anastrophe for w( Od. 18.2, when it follows its subst. In such cases the preceding short syllable is usuaily lengthened, o)/rni=qes yw/s (end of verse).
w(/s (2) (w(=s after ou)d) and kai/): thus, <*>, in this way; often kai\ w(=s, ‘even thus’ (ou)d' w(=s, ‘not even thus’), i. e. nevertheless (not).
w(sei/ (w(s ei)): as if, as though, never separated by an intervening word, Od. 9.314; w. part., Il. 5.374; also without a verb, as, like, Od. 7.36.
w(/sper (w(/s per): just as, even as; often separated by an intervening <*>ord, w(s e)/setai/ per, Il. 1.211.

w(/ste (w(/s te): as, just as, with or without verb. Only twice used to ex
press result as in Attic, so that, Il. 9.42, Od. 17.21.
w)teilh/: wound.
*)=wtos: Otus.—(1) a giant, son of Poseidon and Iphimedīa, Od. 11.308, Il. 5.385. —(2) of Cyllēne, a chief of the Epeians, Il. 15.518.
w)tw/eis, essa, en (ou)=s): with ears or handles, Il. 23.264 and 513.
wu(to/s: = o( au)to/s, Il. 5.396†.
w)/fellon, w)/feles: see o)fei/lw.
w)xra/w: only aor. part., w)xrh/santa, having become pale, Od. 11.529.
w)=xros: paleness, pallor, Il. 3.35†.
w)=y: only acc., ei)s w)=pa, in the face (‘in the eye’), full in the face, i)de/sqai, Od. 22.405; in face, in person, e)/oiken, Il. 3.158.
